Simpson on the box cover and the game was retitled accordingly.

title: Talking Football
mechanisms: MemoryPoint to Point MovementRock-Paper-ScissorsSecret Unit Deployment
description:
Re-released in 1977 as Talking ABC Monday Night Football.

Talking Football is one of those gimmicky games from the early 1970s that could go under a mechanic called record-driven. The players use a set of 13 custom records to drive the action; 10 for offense/defense play selection, and 3 for special plays (penalties, field goals, etc.).

The offensive player secretly chooses a play disc and inserts it into the record player sportcaster. The opposing player rotates the record in the player, looking at the back of the disc to select their defense. Once the defensive selection is in view from the defense's side, that player pushes down to start the recording. The sportscaster gives a yardage/penalty result for the play (the records were multi-groved and would play differently based on which 'defense' was chosen.

title: Talking Baseball
description: More record driven fare from Mattel, in the vein of their Talking Football game.

title: Samsonite Baseball Game
description: Another game offering from the luggage company, Samsonite. In this work, a custom card deck drives the baseball action between the two players. Runners advance and score as per standard baseball rules.

title: Nickelodeon Double Dare
types: Action / Dexterity Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description: Double Dare is a game show game for kids.  Answer questions in a series of rounds.  If you do not know the answer you can dare the other team.  If they do not know the answer then that team in turn can double dare and if once again the answer is not obtained then they can take a physical challenge, which consist of different stunts or obstacle courses.  The game ends with an elaborate obstacle course in which both teams compete for the best time.

title: Spellstones
description:
Spellstones combines the strategy of a card-based spellcasting duel with the hand-eye coordination of a real-time action game. The result is a fast-paced puzzle game requiring quick thinking and even quicker fingers! Players manipulate sixteen stone tiles to form the patterns (Runes) needed to cast spells at their opponents. Will your Fireball best your opponent's Heat Shield? It all depends on who can build his Runes the fastest.

Consists of a rulebook, 32 stone tiles (cut from a stone-like flooring material and hand-painted; this game was most definitely a basement production by the designer), and two complete sets of spell cards (DTP quality). Rated for ages 10-adult. Each set supports 2 players, so you can add more sets for multi-player battles. The game comes with 22 spell cards for each player for use in a 2-player game, and 16 more for each player that are designed for multi-player use only.

title: SiegeStones Charge!
description:
A sequel game to SiegeStones is available from the publisher as a free download from the Siegestones website.  It uses the same components as that game, but focuses on capturing pieces rather than controlling area.  Towers (which can be built during play) are used to launch stones, which are moved to attack other pieces.  Stones support allied stones, adding defensive strategies.  Winner is the one who destroys the opponents' towers.

Wasn't sure which mechanics boxes to check.  Players take turns deploying and moving pieces, which are used both to attack and defend.

title: Baby Boomer
description:
DTP effort from 1989, can be played solo.  Baby has a gun at the end of the hallway.  Try to get Mom, Dad, or Officer Bill down the hallway before baby (actions determined by die rolls) bumps them off.  I think this is an attempt at black humor, but it's kind of disturbing, and pretty random.

From the back of the rules:

OH NO!
   Too late you realize your toddler has found your fully loaded Krup 9000, 16 shot, Near Silenced, Semi Auto pistol.
   Sitting at the end of the hall baby is playing with a lethal weapon.

Baby is about to have a lot of fun.
   The dog was the first victim.

Will you be next?

BABY BOOMER is a solo or group board game that keeps everybody on their toes as they race down the hall to disarm the toddler.  Six sided dice, and Diapers not included.

title: Damon Hill Motorsport Board Game
description: Players race around the monopoly style track around the edge of the board collecting sponsorship money and car bits.  This also qualifies them on the grid.  When all players have their cars on the grid players race around the track in the center of the board.  Race stewards and hazards may send you to the pits.  Team managers mark of the laps on a score card provided.  Simple game with nice cartoon style artwork.

title: Charado
description:
Charado is a game of forming shapes from play dough, and having your partner(s) try to guess what shape you were trying to form.  Fundamentally similar to Clay Mania and Clay to Win and clearly inspired by Charades and Pictionary.

Teams try to work their pawn across a grid of colored squares, with each color of square representing one of four categories of 'subject' (Creatures  Things, Actions, People  Gadgets, and Grab Bag) that one teammate must sculpt for the others' guesswork and amusement.

title: Who on Earth?
description:
Who on Earth? is a party game wherein, in each round,  players are each secretly assigned one 'partner' (person to describe) and, after all players answer 3 questions of the form If your partner was a (garden tool), what would they be?, all players attempt to guess which players were describing which players.

Players score points for correct guessing of who was describing who, and then in a bonus round, the round's lowest scorer turns over a card from a second set of cards with questions of the form If you use the category of (species of animal) which player would best be described by (sloth)?.  All players answer secretly what they believe the card-flipper's answer would be, and for each match, both the matching player and the card-flipping low-scorer earns bonus points.

Essentially a non-competitive party game, as all the players must play completely honestly for the game to work.

title: Cross of Zion
description:
This is a wargame supplement to the Gundam RPG but it can be played as a game on its own right.

Published by Tsukuda Hobbies

HG087R5600

title: Final Yamato
description:
This is a wargame on the movie and series Final Yamato.

Basically this game has several scenarios which walk you through the Final Yamato series.

Published by Bandai if wargame series.

title: Tiger I
description:
Tiger I is a Japanese wargame published by Tsukuda hobbies which is a game on the tactical tank combat in the western front.

This game has several scenarios which sees Allied vs. German tank to tank battles in the Ardennes to the end of the war in Germany.

title: Panther
description:
This is Japanese tactical tank combat wargame in the Eastern Front published by Tsukuda Hobbies.

Using the same system as Tiger I this game has several scenarios all of tank warfare in the Eastern front from 1941-1945 German vs. Soviet.

title: Admiral Graf Spee
description:
This is a Japanese naval wargame published by Tsukuda Hobbies based on the hunt for the Graf Spee during World War 2 and has several scenarios.

This game uses the game system based on Avalon Hill's Bismark and is double blind.

title: Arion
types: Comic Book / Strip Fantasy Negotiation Wargame
description:
Multi-players wargame based on Japanese comics and animation Arion.
The game represent conflict between Gods of Olympus and son of a God, Arion.

The game map is covering ancient greek.
Each counter is represent a character or a military units.

Players control a God or hero (called character) in story.
Player order vary by random order card per turn. Each turn, players manage movement, combat and miscellaneous actions for fellow characters.

The game include six scenarios for one to ten players.
Winner is determined various victory condition per scenario and character. Especially, the five player game use random victory condition card and it can change during in the game. For example, eliminate certain person, capture certain person or couquer certain area, etc.

title: Ark Royal
description: This is a naval combat game set during world war 2 in the Atlantic. Published by Tsukuda hobbies it includes several scenarios which show the entire Atlantic Campaign vs. the U-boats during World War 2.

title: Gundam 0080 Cyclops Attack
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese robotech animation Mobile suit Gundam  Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket.　New Gundam game with emphasis on command.

Players control small size force with 1 to 9 Mobile suit(robotech name in this universe).

At the beginning of each turn, players assign a command to each platoon. The game include thirteen commands. For exmaple, reorganization, suppress fire, support fire, advance or combined movement. 
Then, determine the initiative, and then alternately activating their units. During activation, the unit can benefit from assigned command.

The game contains five scenarios based on the story, the basically purpose of the scenarios is the destruction of enemy forces. However, the main issue of this game is the campaign game. In the campaign game, players manage their own force by appoint the pilot and purchase the mobile suit. The battle resolve as normal game. Between in the battle, growing the abilities of the pilot by combat experience, do the repair and replacement of the Mobile suit.

As a small drawback, fighters and tanks, are not included in this game.

title: Third Great War
description:
This is a Japanese wargame set during the NATO vs. Warsaw pact dust up that is World war three.

5wg-25

title: Zero Fighter
types: Aviation / Flight Wargame World War II
description:
This is an air combat wargame set during World War 2 that is set in the Pacific Theatre and features Japanese vs. Allied fighters.

This is published by Bandai games and is part of their IF wargame  series.

title: Tank Battles
description:
This is a tactical Japanese tank wargame set during the eastern front battles of World War 2 during 1944-1945. Unlike Pacific Fleet, Hobby Japan has not included a supplemental English text for rules. Too bad.

Several scenarios.

title: Tank Battles 2
description: Sequel to Hobby Japan's Tank Battles game.

title: Matilda
description:
This is a tank tactical wargame set in North Africa from 41-43 during world war 2.

Numerous scenarios.

Published by Tsukuda Hobbies.

title: Patton
description:
This is a Japanese tank tactical wargame set during Korean War, the Arab-Israeli wars and Vietnam War of the 50s to 70s.

Published by Tsukuda Hobbies, this wargame features several scenarios.

title: Round Vernian VIFAM
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description: This is a science fiction wargame published by Tsukuda Hobbies and is set in the world of the anime show Vifam.

title: Nausicaa
description:
Nausicaa is a game of hack and slash melee combat in the world of Nausicaa published by Tsukuda hobbies.

Very famous in Japan and the game itself is rarely seen.

title: Battle of the Bulge
description:
This is an epoch published Japanese wargame on the Battle of the Bulge.
This game is nicknamed Epoch Bulge and has been republished three times:
Command Magazine Japan #23 in 1998,
Extra issue #16 of Command Magazine Japan in 2000 and
Japan Wargame Classics #4 in 2014.

title: Enemy Below
description:
This is a Japanese wargame of submarine warfare in the Atlantic during World War 2.

Published by Tsukuda hobbies.

1 rulebook, 2 data sheets, 2 hexmaps, 2 log pads,
4 countersheets (yes, this have 4 sheets), 2 playaids, 2 dice

1 hex = 93m, 1 inning = 1 minute

This game uses call-marker system that Tsukuda first invented in Task-force series.
Escort ship cannot see submarin.  And submarine cannot see escort because they go undersea.
But, this game doesn't use double-blind.  Instead, this use call-marker.

title: Manöver
description: Old Swedish wargame published in 1941. Unsure if the credited publisher is correct, or merely the printer. Players take turns moving Foot-soldiers and Cavalry trying to capture land from the opponent while keeping an unbroken front. Asymmetric map w/colorful and somewhat iconic Swedish place names -- mill creek, grand farm, red/blue depot etc.

title: Tak-Tik: Flotta kontra flyg
description: A Swedish Battleships clone, but giving one player an airforce instead of an opposing fleet. Printed in 1942.

title: Hot Spots
mechanisms: Card DraftingDice RollingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
From the instructions: The object of the game is to keep your political conflict going while every other player has ended his conflict. There is only one winner. This person wins because his political conflict is still in existence, and the money, planes, and soldiers that go with is will boom his economy. When the conflict ends, the soldiers, planes, and most of the money usually end also. Whoever ends his conflict loses the game.

Role and move game where players try to escalate political conflict by landing on the right squares and collecting cards granted by landing on the correct squares.

title: Daytonopoly
description: You start out the game as a visitor to our fair community.  By acquiring various properties such as local hotels, restaurants, retail stores, radio stations, TV stations and other well-known businesses in the areas- and developing them into skyscrapers- you become a resident entrepreneur. The last entrepreneur to avoid bankruptcy, or the one with the most property, wins! It's just a different version of monopoly.

title: Knok
description:
Knok, the upside down card game where low is the way to go.

Two decks, each with 54 cards; twelve 10's, six 0's and four each of 1's to 9's. For each hand, players are dealt four cards which are placed, face down, on the table in front of the player. The player may look at face of only two of their cards. On their turn, players my take the top card from the discard pile or the draw pile. The player may exchange the drawn card with any of their four face down cards. The unwanted card is placed, face up, in the discard pile. The goal is to collect the lowest set of four cards at the table. If the player believes he/she has the lowest total, they say knok; play ends at this point and all players' cards are revealed. If the knoking player owns the lowest total, they receive 0 points and all other players receive the point total from their four cards. If any other player ties or is lower than the knoking player, the knoking player receives all of the points of his and the other players cards, the non-knoking players receive 0 points.

Nine hands are played to complete a game.

title: Jenga Casino
description:
Party favorite Jenga with Casino theme. Take the blocks from the tower and bet on the outcome.

Contains black and red blocks, numbered as on a roulette table. Betting with money-chips follows roulette rules.

title: Fire
types: Party Game Religious Trivia Word Game
description:
The object of this game is to be in possession of the greatest amount of Heavenly Gain when the word FIRE is shouted. As the player improves his position, he may trans-mint his Earthly Barter, Wood, Hay and Stubble, which burns up completely when FIRE is announced, into Heavenly Gain, Gold, Silver and Precious Stones, which is imperishable.

(quoted from the introduction to the rules)

Players dig through a pile of alphabet tiles to spell out short answers to Bible-related questions, e.g. an acceptable answer to A person who turned into a Pillar of Salt would be MRS. LOT. If you get an Upon the Foundation card, you have to spell out a word of some specific meaning and significance in connection with the Foundation provided for our Salvation, e.g. BLOOD, DEATH, or CROSS.

title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Gundam history
description:
This is a Japanese wargame published by Tsukuda Hobbies on the wars in the Gundam universe starting from the original gundam to ZZ Gundam.

Various scenarios pitting mech to mech combat.

This is based off the Mobile Suit Z Gundam anime series and is part of the Mobile Suit Gundam familly of games.

title: Throw Up
types: Action / Dexterity Dice Humor Party Game Word Game
description:
According to the publisher, It's loud, it's ludicrous, it's brilliant. THROW UP is the appallingly funny NEW game for two or more. Get your wits in gear or suffer the consequences

THROW UP is usually played as a drinking game (rule 1: Ensure that you have a ready supply of liquid refreshments). The game begins as a rhythmic word game. Players tap the table and clap in rhythm. The first player calls out a word and the player to his/her left shouts out a word that begins with the final letter of the first word (e.g., word 1 = cat, word 2 = ten, word 3 = naked...). Players who cannot think of a word, break the rhythm, or who make a mistake must roll a pewter die (it is in the form of a drunk; it reminds me of the pigs in Pass the Pigs) to determine a penalty.

The position of the die determines the penalty:
? A choker: take a large swallow.
? A sticky ear (bottle up): you and the player to your left take a large swallow.
? A sticky ear (fish up): you and the player to your right take a large swallow.
? A gutter: choose one of the other players to take a large swallow.
? A dribbler: propose a toast; everyone takes a drink.
? A tumble: Off the table, finish your glass.

The game includes:
? 1 Pewter drunk figure
? 1 pen
? 1 forfeit pad
? 1 forfeit summary card
? 1 carry pouch
? 1 set of rules

title: Fan-Play Ice Hockey
description: The game is mathematically designed for perfect results in scoring and individual team performance. The relative strength of opposing teams having already been established. For thrilling ice hockey competition, form a league with friends. Each player chooses and coaches his own teams.

title: Topping the Charts
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to sell a million records and be awarded a gold record. To accomplish this your band will have to play the nightclub circuit to earn money for the recording studio fee. When you succeed in cutting an album, you take your bad on the promotional tour to build sales. During this time you will also have to make a music video.

Game includes game board, gold record token, 10 red discs, 6 playing pieces, 1 6-sided die, game board, score pad, play money, stack of Turn of Events cards, and instructions

title: Gallipoli
description:
Gallipoli  
by Paper Wars Games 1979

The Dardanelles Campaign, 1915

The land game is a battalion-level simulation of the landings at Cape Helles, Anzac Cove, and Suvla Bay. The naval game recreates the assault by British and French battleships on the Dardanelles forts.

It comes with:

BOX 
3 MAPS (2 land  1 naval)
Land Rules/Naval Rules (30 pages)
504 Counters (UNPUNCHED)
Charts and tables card
Allied/Turkish damage record sheet

title: Totopoli
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingBetting/WageringModular BoardRoll / Spin and MoveStock Holding
description:
This Italian version of the original Totopoly, was first published in Italy in the '70s and after a restyling it came back in 1996. It shares a very close build up and look with its ancestor, but it also bears some custom traits which give it an Italian taste.
First off, the horses's names are unmistakably Italian: Nearco, Niccol Dell'Arca, Orsenigo, Astolfina...
I wouldn't put my hand across a flame saying that they're all real names, but undoubtedly some of them are.
The gameboard is double sided (in the '70s version instead you had to change the board simply folding a flap page over it) with the training course on one side and the racing track on the other.
The game is played in two distinct phases: training and race.
During the training phase all the players bid to get the fastest horses, usually the black or red ones, and occupations which can give them more money to bet before the race.
Then starts the training. Every horse, starting from no.1 to no.12, gets out from its stables (San Siro at Milan or Capannelle at Rome) and rolling two dice it runs one full lap, before re-entering its own stable.
During this lap the players collect Advantage colored chits (to be used as bonus during the race) or Disadvantage white chits (to be spent during the race as penalties), and pay various taxes for the maintenance, health and fitness of their horses.
To be said, a good training isn't enough to grant you have a winner, because the subsequent race phase bears a great share of randomness.
Totopoli is not only a racing game, but a betting one also, so this is perfectly normal.
Luck and tactics here join together while you're searching for the best lane in every situation, but along the track some dangers are lurking to slow or either exit your horse from the race.
You can win the game as being the winner at the race, or you can win through your money.
And you can play dirty to ease the way for the horse you bet on.
The box includes a double sided board, 12 plastic horses, 78 cards, Advantage and Disadvantage chits, bet bills and two dice.

title: Max Backtalk
description: Max Backtalk is an electronic memory/reaction game that uses the player's own voices. To begin, each player sits by a colored button and speaks a word into the microphone. The game starts by Max flashing a player's light and repeating that player's word. The player scores a point by quickly pressing his or her button. If your reaction time is too slow you lose a point. Max then calls another player's word and so on. Be careful - Max can also bluff by calling one player's word and lighting another player's light. Any player that reacts would then lose a point. The longer you play, the faster the words are spoken and the lenses light. The player with the most points at the end is the winner. An elimination version, and a simple memory game (ala Simon) can also be played.

title: King of Tarts
description:
Pucker up and play by drawing and discarding sequential sets of cards to win tokens. Can you be the first to collect 6 identical Sour Power Tokens and win?
52 card deck and 80 sour power tokens.

title: Candy Counter
description: Grab as many candy coated number cards as you can match from your hand. Or add up the candy numbers on the table and buy the treats using a combination of your cards and your Candy Counter coins.

title: Tiger Island
description:
You and three friends are trapped on a tiny island. Also on the island is a 30 foot tall tiger armed with a giant club. You spin the tiger, and suddenly he locks onto one of your locations. You have to fling a marble into the tiger's mouth before he bops you on the head with the giant club.

Obviously a toy/dexterity game, but with a cool giant tiger.

title: Volé
description:
You take the tricks you won and build them into sets. If you build enough sets to make your bid, you score big. Otherwise you go in the hole.
A Combination of Rummy and Euchre.
A special deck of 48 cards, scorepad, and rules.

title: Pokari
types: Bluffing Card Game Memory Word Game
description:
Play 25 different games with this special deck and the Pokari die. Games includes variations of Poker, Gin Rummy, Solitare, and games unique to Pokari!

Includes special Pokari deck of 70 cards, Pokari row die, and instructions

title: Mississippi Marbles
description:
Mississippi Marbles -- The dice game that lets you keep on rollin'.

Variant of the Ten Thousand dice game family with a delta riverboat theme. Game consists of six dice, one score pad, dice shaker, velvet pouch, and dice tray.

Requires 700 to open, then player can take the score and pass the dice, or press his/her luck and keep rolling. Winner is the first person to reach 11,000 points.

title: WOW! The Pillow Fight Game for Girls
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Party Game
description:
Back in the mid-1960s, Milton Bradley published a pair of wonderfully sexist games: WOW! (for girls) and POW! The Cannon Game for Boys. The games are essentially the same: dexterity games that consist of sending a small projectile over a barrier with the intent of knocking over the opponent's pieces.

The theme of WOW! is a pajama party. the playing pieces are girls engaging in a pillow fight and a house mother. The game board is divided into two sections by a cardboard barrier. Each side has a plastic bed with a small pillow. The bed acts as a catapult to send the pillow over the barrier. As described in the directions, WOW! is a safe, fast-action game...

title: POW! The Cannon Game for Boys
description:
Back in the mid-1960s, Milton Bradley published a pair of wonderfully sexist games: POW! (for boys) and WOW! The Pillow Fight Game for Girls. The games are essentially the same: dexterity games that consist of sending a small projectile over a barrier with the intent of knocking over the opponent's pieces.

POW! is a soldier game in which boys try to 'shoot' the opponent's Army with Cannons that gently toss harmless cannon balls. The game board is divided into two sections by a cardboard barrier. Each side has a plastic cannon with a cannon ball (marble). The cannon shoots the marble over the barrier to knock down the opponent's soldiers. As described in the directions, POW! is a safe, fast-action soldier game...

title: Chart Moves
description:
Another roll and move game with spinners, dice, trivia, luck cards, etc...

Experience the deals and ordeals as you first play as a hustler then as a musician hopefully steering your tracks to the coveted 'No. 1'

title: Endeavor Eleven
description:
The object of the game is to win the most money by the end of the game.  Players decide in advance how many rounds (turns around the board) they wish to play.

Players win money by playing different games of chance which are decided by the spaces on the board.  Players roll the dice on their turn, move, then decide if they want to play the game on the space where they landed.  There are eleven different games of chance.  Some are played against The house (the board), and some are played against other players.

Playing a game always costs money to play.  There is a flat fee to play the game, and some of the games allow you to bet more money to increase the payout.

The Games:

1)  Best of Five - Roll five dice to get two, three, four, five of a kind, a full house or a run.  You may roll five dice up to three times

2)  Bonus 21 - Played with another player.  Roll one die up to five times to get as close to 21 as you can without going over. Whoever comes closest wins all the money bet.

3)  Double Trouble - bet that you will or won't roll doubles with two dice.

4)  Pair-a-dice Derby - You may buy or win horses which you can race against other players.  There is a horse track in the center of the board.

5)  Three + Three - Try to rolls two threes with two dice in as few rolls as possible.

6)  Diamond Jim - Try to beat the total of two 6 sided dice with one 8 sided die.

7)  Unlucky One - Keep rolling the die and earning the number you roll, unless you roll a one, in which case you lose everything.

8)  Lottery Dice - Everyone chooses a number, then a die is rolled.  Whoever guessed the number wins the lottery.

9)  Even Odds - Win double your bet if you correctly guess that two dice will be odd or even.

10) Challenge - Played against another player.  Whoever rolls highest wins the bet.

11) Impossible 36 - Try to roll 36 by rolling two dice three times.  Huge payout if you succeed.

There is an open house space that lets you play the game of your choice.

The game ends when the last player completes the last circuit of the board.

title: Nephi's Courage
description: Nephi's Courage is a deck of cards with which you can play Gadianton Robber (Old Maid), Seek and Ye Shall Find (Go Fish), and Ponder (traditional pair matching game) with characters from the Book of Mormon.  Another Latter-Day Saint themed game for Family Home Evening or any family game time.

title: Pin High
description:
Simple Australian card game based on a 9 or 18 hole round of golf. There is no course (and no board), though players try to match the par scores for various well known courses (Augusta, Muirfield, Pebble Beach, Royal Melbourne, Royal Sydney and St Andrews).

Cards depict distances and various clubs including drivers, irons, putters, pitching wedges, Lost Ball various Traps, and few nice ones like Holed Approach, Holed Putt.

title: Call 'em All!
description:
From the box:

Call 'em' All is the furiously fast and frantic think it and shout it game.

In Call 'em All players are given a category and in 60 seconds they have to think of as many items to do with that category as they can and shout them all out.

This may sound easy, but, wouldn't you just know it, there's a catch!  Shout as loud as you can, as quickly as you can, as many items as you can but the only ones which will score you points are the ones that appear on the card.

Call 'em All contains 130 categories as diverse as 'Types of Fruit', 'Parts of a Car' and 'Things Found in a Chemist'.  It's a non-stop riot of laughter which will amuse you, your family and friends for hours.

Get your brain in gear, get your mouth in gear because Call 'em All is here.

Contents: 130 game cards, 2 sets of number cards, 1 scorepad, 1 pencil, 1 60 second timer, 2 counters, rules of the game.

Each player in turn takes a card from the deck, which will list a category and ten items in that category.  They lay out ten cards numbered 1 to 10 to match the items, and place a counter on the item they think the other players are least likely to guess.

All the other players then have 60 seconds to shout out as many items as they can in the category, hoping to match the ten on the card.  The player reading the category card turns over the number cards as the matching items are called.

At the end of the round, all the guessing players each score one point for each of the items they have collectively guessed, plus three bonus points if they guess the item with the counter on.  The reading player scores one point for each item that was not guessed, again plus three bonus points if the counter-marked item was not guessed.

The next player then takes the next category card, and the previous card reader re-joins the guessers.  In this way the game is co-operative, but the teams are constantly changing and each player will have their own individual score by the game end.

Play continues for as many rounds as the players decide, although for fairness everyone should have the same number of turns as the card reader.

Suitable for ages 10+.

title: Last Crusade
description: A simulation of the 25 September 1396 Battle of Nicopolis in which the last major Crusader army tried to drive the Ottomans out of Europe. one 22x17 inch game map in two sections, 200 nice-looking mount and cut counters.

title: Longbow
description: A simulation of the two major battles early in the Hundred Years War-Crecy and Poitiers. From Berg's introduction: The era, and these two battles, saw a change from the supremacy of heavy, armored cavalry to that of an infantry led by the defensive fire power of the longbow coordinated with the offensive capabilities of Men- at-arms, either mounted or dismounted. One 22x17 map in two parts, one 11x17 map, 200 cut and mount counters. 145 yds/hex, 300 men/combat unit.

title: Line of Fire
description: Covers two Napoleonic Era battles far away from France. Maipo was the 1818 battle that led to independence for Chile. Lundy's Lane was the bloodiest battle of the War of 1812. Two 22x17 inch maps and 255 counters that have to be mounted and cut.

title: Last Raid
description: Simulates the 955 Battle of Lechfeld (near Augsburg, Germany) which pitted Western-style heavy cavalry against Eastern-style hit and run mounted archers. For two centuries, the deadly mounted Magyar archers had been raiding west, out of the Hungarian plains, devastating German duchies and reaching into the south of France. Hearing another raid was on the way, King Otto gathered an army of heavy, armored cavalry and marched to meet them. Uses the Simon Says game system which is similar to Kingdom for a Horse. 11x33 inch map, 200 counters that have to be mounted and cut.

title: Voyage to the Stars
description:
Each player pilots a starship through the 12 constellations. While traveling through space, various dangers such as exploding stars and the Dreaded Black Hole will be encountered

Nuclear fuel chips provide the energy your starship needs to continue its journey. During the voyage, you may claim legal rights to any of the 36 stars in the Zodiac. Other players landing on your stars must surrender to you valuable fuel. Only then can they escape the gravitational pull of your stars

title: Galloping Golf
description:
Galloping Golf is a dice driven game in which players compete at par 4 holes by rolling five dice with various outcomes. Each player scores between 2-9 per hole (no hole-in-one). Scores are tallied on scoring sheets and the lowest score wins.

A collectible feature of this game are the Bakelite/Catalin dice that are included. The game may have had several reincarnations, including being produced for Wilson Sporting Goods and for a company called Arl-Hi.

from the gameboard explanation

To anyone not experienced in golf, this game will prove very interesting and instructive. Anyone who does not play golf can quickly learn the Golf Game by reading the accompanying rules. Every member of the family will find this game delightfully instructive as well as a fascinating pastime.

The experienced golfer will be subject to many of the same interesting and thrilling situations which are found on the links.

This Golf Course is modeled after the famous Championship Golf Course, designed by the late Seth J Raynor. It is located in Fairyland, atop Lookout Mountain, Tennessee-Georgia, near Chattanooga, Tenn. The Location of greens, tees, hazards and the par figures shown are identical with the Fairyland Course.

title: Trafalgar
description:
A legendary early self-produced, and accordingly rare, board wargame portraying the Battle of Trafalgar on a ship-to-ship scale. Game turns represented 10 minutes of real time. Features Basic Game rules, Optional rules, and Optional Tournament Game rules.

Reportedly only 450 copies were produced.

title: Fu Rin Ka Zan
description:
This is a Japanese wargames published by Bandai on the 
Climatic battle of 4th Kawanakajima between Shingen Takeda and Kenshin Uesugi.
It was well accepted by reviewers.
Basically, it was a variety of Napoleon at Waterloo with supply consumption and hidden movement.

title: Chicanery
types: Bluffing Party Game Trivia Word Game
description: Another variant in the Dictionary family of games, of which Balderdash is the widest-known member.  Chicanery consists of a deck of 51 cards, each with 5 obscure words and their definitions.  The players form two teams, and each team starts with one card; one word at a time is used, starting with the top word on the card.  Each player on a team makes up a definition for the chosen word, and the fake definitions, along with the real one, are given to the other team, whose players try to guess which is the real one.

title: Not So Scary Things
description:
Its the fun, acting-silly, hooray-youre-so-brave game that kids love to play again and again!  Created by doctors and a child psychologist to help every child develop confidence, creativity, and self-esteem.

Children earn Bravery Badges on the exciting journey to Mount Courage.  By using imagination and creative play, players meet and master that Not So Scary Things (Thunder  Lightning, Monsters, Darkness, Spiders, Bullies  Meanies, and Snakes).  Every child can win!  Ages 4 - 8

title: Jonah the Overboard Adventure Game!
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Pirates
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
From the box:  Join Jonah in his misadventures as he tries to abandon his assignment to deliver a message of mercy to the people of Nineveh.  He sets sail with The Pirates Who Don't Do Anything, meets Khalil the worm, survives stormy waters, learns the true meaning of go fish, walks the plank, gets swallowed bu an enormous fish, and ultimately is given a second chance by being burped up on shore.

Spin the spinner and follow Jonah's path to Nineveh while collecting reminders of Jonah's encounters.  But be careful of possible setbacks along the way!  Inspired by Jonah-A VeggieTales Movie(TM), children will play this hilarious fast-paced game time after time.

Ages 3 and up

title: The Donkey and the Carrot
description: A game for 2 to 4 players Ages 4 and up. The object of the game is for each player to make a track from one corner square on the board, joining up with one of the paths leading into the stable and to move his donkey along this path. The player whose donkey enters the stable first being the winner.

title: Ambition
description:
Ambition is a trick taking standard deck playing card game. It was invented by Indie designer Mike Church whose stated goal was to create a trick game where the role of chance (hand-luck) was as small as possible.

The usual object is to avoid taking the most points in a round and, secondarily, to score as many as possible up to that. (That is, if the 120 points split 42-34-25-19, it's best to be the '34' and worst to be the '42'.) Bonuses, known as Nil and Slam, are given respectively for taking no points or for taking 75+. Thus, almost any hand dealt has some strategy: few terrible hands exist.

Ambition is as much a game of players, and the interactions of their varying strategic objectives, as of cards.

For improvement's sake, the inventor has updated the game several times since its first publication in November 2003. The most recent rules were published in July 2012.

title: The Bicycle Game
description: The Bicycle Game was one of several board games published in the 1890s about that exciting new sport, bicycling. The board depicts an oval shaped racetrack divided into spaces. The object of the game is to win the race.

title: Fan-Tel
description: This vintage fan that tells your fortune game includes 48 fan-blade shaped fortune telling sticks packaged in a cardboard tube.

title: The Elsie Game
description: This vintage game involves rolling dice and moving tokens that represent cows along a set of winding paths. It is based on Elsie the Cow, which is a well known old mascot of the Borden Dairy Company. The goal of the game is to get the cows into the barn, which is located in the center of the board.

title: Indiana Jones: Der Weg nach Timbuktu
description:
Indiana Jones starts a journey to Timbuktu to obtain the Golden Mask of an Egyptian pharaoh, which has been stolen 3000 years ago and was recently discovered by a friend. Indy's friend has hidden the mask by the 100 year old Tuareg, before he was carried of by greedy foreigners.

Indy's friend was also able to wire a message about the location of the mask before he vanished. But it seems the secret was given away by someone because there are other man behind the treasure claiming to be Indiana Jones! But only the true Indiana Jones will stand the trials and adventures and get the Golden Mask from the wise Tuareg.

title: Cinema
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description: Cinema is a trivia game where the question cards contain pictures from scenes, titles and things used in a particular film. Do you know the answer?

title: Dictionwary
description: A player reads aloud the first and last words on the pages of an opened dictionary.  The other players think of words which fall between those keywords to spell and give their meaning.  Points are awarded for the number of letters, the meaning of the word, and bonus letters. Dictionwary is a game for word lovers.

title: Peg Baseball
description: Peg Baseball is a vintage game for players Ages 8 and up. Players take turns rolling the dice and then moving their pegs to the bases and on towards home plate. The game consists a pair of dice, two sets of six pegs, a shaker, and a rules pamphlet. The game was originally released in 1915, and published fairly continuously until the early 1960s.

title: Little Orphan Annie
description: The Little Orphan Annie Game  is vintage game based on the famous comic strip character. It includes a circular patterned board, four dice and two shakers, and little cardboard pieces with wooden bases that represent the characters from the strip. The first player to reach the center of the board is the winner.

title: Uranium Rush
description: Uranium Rush was an educator approved game from the 1950s. Players begin with $15,000 and prospect for uranium in an area determined by a spinner (mountain, hills, or desert). Claims can be purchased for $1000 each and may be auctioned off or tested for uranium. This involves an electric Geiger counter that produces a buzzing sound if uranium is discovered. The claim is then sold to the federal government for $50,000. Players alternate turns until all claims have been staked and the person with the most money is declared the winner.

title: Shiloh
description:
Paraphrased from the rulebook:

This is the second edition of this game, the first was a limited run of approximately 75 copies in December 1971 in the 12th issue of Battleflag magazine.

238 counters (Third Millennia Edition)

title: McDonaldland Match-Up Game
types: Action / Dexterity Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This game, based on McDonalds restaurant characters, is actually 3 games-in-one. In the first game, 5 cards depicting shadows of the characters are placed in the center of the table. The regular cards are then dealt out evenly among the players. On your turn, you turn over your top card so that all players may see it. The first player to slap the matching shadow card wins the character card. The winner is the first player to collect one each of all 5 McDonaldland characters. In the second game, players try to match cards in their hands to the top card on the center stack by using colors or numbers (shadow cards are wild). The third game is played solitaire. You draw a card and try to match it to the face up card on the table. If you can, you play it on top; if you can't, you start a new pile. If the top card of a pile matches another pile card, the 2 piles may be merged. You win if you have 2 piles or less after you've gone through the deck.

title: Chicken Limbo
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Party Game
description:
From the back of the box:
 Line up with your friends as you listen to the singing chicken clucking a song. Then bend down low-under the chicken legs you go. Backward, forward, silly walks, too. Six positions in all to do. But don't touch the chicken. If you do, you're out! The last player left is the winner!

Kids try to limbo under the legs of the chicken.

title: Minister i klister
description: You are the Prime Minister (oddly there is four parties (purple, yellow, red and green) all with their respective Prime Minister!) and try to control your ministers so you can stay in power. But some of the ministers leak stories to the press, but who is doing it? Ministers that become too involved in sleazy affairs will be sacked and given new roles as county governors (of which there was 25 in Sweden at this time, correctly reflected in the map of the game). The player (Prime Mister / party) with the fewest county governors when all 25 has been appointed, wins the game.

title: Le Maître du Rayon
types: Comic Book / Strip Deduction Fantasy Science Fiction
description:
Based on the Belgian comic Blake et Mortimer. In this game you try to prevent the evil Olrik from obtaining a deadly device which can destroy the world.

A player gains points by saving cities. Each turn a player plays a card. First he/she follows the instructions of the card played. Then the player moves his/her pawn as many spaces as indicated on the card. When a player finds a deadly device, he or she looks secretly at the name of the city written on the device.
If the city isn't threatened by Olrik, the player puts back the device. Otherwise the player places the deadly device in front of him/her. 
The the player takes an Olrik Execution Card and threaten a city and rotates the spinner. If the number is lower than the number of the city, it stays there and players can save the city. If not, the city is destroyed.
If all cities are destroyed and/or saved the game ends. The player with the most points wins the game.

title: Tintin et Milou vers la lune
description: Based on the famous comic by Herg in this game you follow Tintin and his friends on their journey to the moon.

title: Byråkrat
description: Racing game with bluffing mechanics, where you dont win if you win the race. Instead you aim to move as little as possible and try to be the last person remaining on the game board.

title: Babes in Toyland
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Puzzle
description: This game was inspired by the Disney musical, Babes in Toyland. Players move around the board collecting jigsaw pieces of toy soldiers. The first player to complete his or her own toy soldier from these pieces is the winner.

title: King Zor: The Dinosaur Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Prehistoric
description:
From Erik Arneson at About.com:

Produced by Ideal in 1962, this game is based on the toy of the same name. It came with four cavemen to represent the players (green, yellow, red, blue), 16 dinosaurs (four each in the same colors), a variety of dinosaur eggs, two decks of cards, a spinner, and the game board. The board was illustrated with about two dozen dinosaurs, plus various geological features.

title: Full Metal Conquête
description:
Published in Backstab magazine n43 (March/May 2003 - FC Publications [Asmode / Halloween Concept]) as an homage to the original and very rare game Full Metal Planète.

10 years after the mineral gold rush from the Full Metal Planète game, the spacecrafts are returning to the mother planet only to reach it after a nuclear war that devastated the Earth. Instead of joining forces, the 2 groups continue their rivalry in trying to save the remaining survivor who are hidden in bunkers.

Full Metal Conqute allows 2 players to try to save survivors on a devastated Earth.

There is no change in the rules. Water was replaced by radioactivity, but everything works the same with different names.

Map is 13 x 30 hexes.

All the game (i.e. rules, counters, map) is on the central poster of the magazine. Counter must be glued on cardboard and cut.

The game is produced in French.

title: Gambler
description:
From the game's website:

Gambler was invented by Charlie Towlson and friends in 1987 and has attracted a huge cult following amongst those who play it. This has lead to annual tournaments, most notably the UK Championships which grows in attendance every year.

The object of the game is to gamble your way around the world on a set course of Reno - London - Monte Carlo - Tokyo - Sun City - Las Vegas. The game is won when a player completes the course and finally wins a bet in Las Vegas. This means that the climax to every game is always a winning bet; failure to win that bet means the game continues.

Gambler made its serious debut at the London International Toy Fair in 1998 and was voted in the Top Ten New Games.

title: Walt Disney Donald Duck Game (Treasure Hunt)
types: Children's Game Dice Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Donald Duck game is an exciting treasure hunt. The game is simple, so are the rules.
Dice are throw and players move around the board clockwise. When picture squares are landed on they look across to the Treasure Hunt Sheet and match there picture  - players must comply with instructions. Winner is first person to reach the center.

title: TaleSpin: Flying Aces & Air Show
types: Aviation / Flight Card Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
This is actually two separate decks of 20 cards each, used to play (minor) variations of a couple of children's card games with a light TaleSpin theme.

Air Show, played with the cards depicting characters from the show, is a Memory-type game.  The cards are dealt, face down, in a 4-by-5 rectangle.  Players take turns flipping two cards face up; if they match, the player keeps the pair and goes again, otherwise the cards are flipped face down and the turn passes to the next player.  One minor rule that I don't remember from the original Memory game is that, once a pair is removed, the holes that are thus formed are immediately filled by shifting cards to the right.

Flying Aces, played with the cards depicting the airplanes, is a variant of War.  Each player is given a stack of cards; everyone places their top card face up in the center of the table, and if exactly one player plays a Sea Duck, they win all the cards; otherwise, it's a tie, and everyone goes again.

title: Europa på boks
description:
Europa p boks
A trivia game based on what you know about Europe. You are sent on a mission. The first one to fulfill their mission is the winner.
To do so you have to use every bit of knowledge you have about Europe, its geography, languages, cultures and flags.

There is also the possibility to challenge an opponent and steal cards.....if you know or remember the answers on that specific card.

The game contain 330 cards, 2300 questions, 50 mission cards, 2 dices, 1 notepad.

title: Naval Battle in the Sea of Japan
description:
Naval wargame for battles in Russo Japanese war 1904-1905. The game title means Battle of Tsushima in Japanese, but game covering five major battles in the war.

Players control either Japanese or Russian fleet.
In Each turn, each player conduct one movement phase and two fire combat phase. Fire combat is using classical odds ratio combat result table and two dice.
Based on the historical result of Tushima, Japanese Navy has various advantage.

Victory condition is vary by scenarios.

title: Final Twilight Customizable Card Game
description:
In the near future, on the western coast city of New Metropolis, an evil that has lain dormant for centuries is about to be awakened to the 21st century. Forces of darkness and magic strive to unleash a horror upon the Earth unlike any mankind can remember. The only forces capable of stopping it are rendered impotent by an age-old fear and hatred. Will humanity set aside their differences and stand as one against the darkness? Or will this be humanity's Final Twilight?

Final Twilight is a modern fantasy themed card game for two players.
Players each select a Major Character featured in the game's storyline and build a deck around that character; supporting characters, special action and spells, weapons and items, all ripped from the pages of the story come to life on the game board. 
Using Location cards to build a small portion of the great city of New Metropolis, players move between sites and backdrops of the story, dueling other characters including fantastic creatures, horrors of the shadows, and helpful, though innocent, bystanders. 
Magic is scarce and unusual in the world of Final Twilight. While hiring goons and allies from our normal world can be easy, summoning the vast forces of nature takes its toll; fantastic characters, spells, and magical abilities all require a small piece of the mage. To cast these spells players spend a portion of their life total, potentially granting them greater power but opening them up to easier defeat. Winning is balancing the quest for power against the will to survive!

Final Twilight is customizable and non-collectable, with each release featuring pre-constructed decks and expansion packs containing just the right cards for a character or an assortment of universal cards suitable for any character.

Revised Edition

April 2013 The Revised edition officially released! Title available through print-on-demands services DriveThruCards.com and TheGameCrafter.com

title: Jack & Jane In An Aeroplane
description: The game box contains only the game board and 1 bone die (according to the instructions, counters were not supplied as the players were expected to provide their Aeroplanes with lead, paper figures or counters). Printed in Bavaria by the British games manufacturer Spears before WWI, it's one of the many clones of the older The Game of Goose. The mechanic is fair simple, with the players alternating rolling the die and advancing their counters, ending by chance on some bonus or malus spaces and resolving the special effects before passing the turn to the next player. The game ends as the winning player reaches the winning post (50).

title: Lost in Space
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
The game consists of a 16x16 full color board and various pieces. In this game of luck, players must travel over the wild and hazardous LOST IN SPACE unknown planet. The spinner tells them in what direction they must move each turn. They may be forced to move off the path or even into the monster pit which will send them back to start...
Winner is the player who lands on his finish circle first.

title: Squaredance
description: This games has nothing to do with Squaredance. It is an abstract tactical game. Pieces move and kick each other off the board in squares.

title: Tolle Tomaten
description:
Every player owns 12 counters. Place these counters on the board. The player with the largest area gets the most points.
No. 49 Spielbox edition.

title: Bauboom in Babylon
description:
Build the City of Babylon. When the game is over every building with the same roof color is removed. For those who are left you will earn points.
Spielbox edition No.31

title: Rodeo Rama
description:
Ever dream of saddling up and being a Pro Rodeo Cowboy?

Now you can bring the rodeo home with the Rodeo Rama board game. Players have their choice of competing in one of six exciting rodeo events.

 Saddle Bronc Riding
 Bull Riding
 Bareback Riding
 Barrel Racing
 Steer Wrestling
 Calf Roping

Feel the adrenaline rushing excitement as you try to ride your way to victory at one of four rodeo locations on the game board. Draw event cards at each rodeo to determine your fate. Will you make the eight second ride or get bucked off as soon as you leave the gate? Better hope for a good draw!

But remember, as a Rodeo Rama cowboy, your winnings and a meager monthly salary are your only sources of income. You must make the best of each rodeo because to win the game you must have earned at least $30,000 and purchased a truck, horse, trailer, and saddle!

Do you have what it takes to compete and survive in one of the toughest sports in the world? Play Rodeo Rama and find out!

title: Legends of Wrestling
description:
LEGENDS OF WRESTLING is a card and dice game that features playing cards for 24 professional wrestling legends! The playing cards have a drawing of the wrestler on the front and game information on the back. For example, the back of the card features the wrestler's favorite moves (such as Jimmy Snuka's SUPERFLY LEAP finisher) and other realistic characteristics specifically catered to each wrestling legend! LEGENDS features a fast-action game system that allows matches to take place in real time. You can play alone or with friends.

The LEGENDS OF WRESTLING Box Set includes 24 wrestler playing cards, dice, playing charts, instruction book, and game handbook. You'll be the promoter and booker for your own wrestling federation featuring the greatest roster in history! Each expansion game adds another 12 cards to the game!

title: The Gender Gap (2nd Edition)
description:
From the box:

Gender Gap 2 is a game that tests both adult men and adult women on their ability to predict how other players really think about present day issues and situations. The questions are designed to be both topical and likely controversial, with the hope that it will create exciting discussion among the players regarding moral, ethical, relationship, parental and lifestyle topics. Gender Gap 2 deals with situations that are top of mind but sometimes never discussed.

Brief description:

Players take it in turn to act as a reader, reading aloud a statement relating to gender roles (i.e. European men are more secure in their masculinity than North American men). The reader than picks a rating from 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree) and everyone else secretly tries to guess the readers choice.

The choice and all guesses are revealed simultaneously. Correct guessers roll the dice to move forward, everyone else moves back a number of spaces equal to the difference between the guess and the actual answer.

title: TiJa
description: Players try to get their own pawns into the center of the gameboard. Every player owns 9 pawns. One player is Ti the other Ja.

title: Kastellan
description: Every player tries to get the most influence in the different areas. There are 8 areas with different values.

title: Paulus 6th Army
description: This is a wargame on the siege of Stalingrad during World War 2.

title: Quadrato
description:
36 counters are placed on the 36 spaces of the board. There are positive ones and negative ones. Try to get the positive ones and avoid the negative ones. 
Graphics: I. Vohwinkel

title: Toxic Crusaders Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Environmental Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Players battle Good Guy and Bad Guy cards for the right to clean up Tromaville.

Mini-cards are dealt in a 'Memory' fashion. Numbered cards are flipped over, with the winner attempting to make matches from the memory board. The player with the most matches wins the game.

Box Contents: 18 Good Guy  Bad Guy cards, 36 Toxic Clean-Up Time mini cards, 1 card tray, 1 spinner, and instructions.

title: Monster Tank
description:
Part of their sports and adventure series, this is a simple tactical game on modern tank battles.

Published by Ad Technos in Japanese.

title: Top
description:
Collect cards and make combinations. 
You also have pawns. The first player who is able to place all his pawns on the board wins the game. The board shows 10 spaces. Number 2 to 7 and 4 card colors. 
Graphics: Franz Vohwinkel

title: Quatrix
description:
Every player owns 9 pawns. The goal is to get them to the opposite side first. How far you can move depends on how many pawns are in the row 90 degrees of the pawn that you want to move. 
Graphics: Franz Vohwinkel

title: Tabalati
description:
Every player tries to get a connection of his 2 pawns. The pawns are on the opposite side on the gameboard. Every player also ones counters with numbers on them. Like if you use the 0 counter you do nothing, play the 2 counter bring two tokens into the gameplay.
Graphics: Franz Vohwinkel

title: Dominanz
description:
Dominoes are placed on the gameboard. On your turn remove one of them. One of the numbers tells you how far to go, the other number in which row you are allowed to move.

Graphics: Christof Tisch

title: Sechs: Ex
description: Goal is to earn the most points. Points are counted for areas contolled. Roll 2 dice. Use them to determine on which space on the gameboard you are allowed to place a piece.

title: Strandläufer
description: Try to get as many pawns as possible to the finish line. Play cards to move your pieces.

title: Lonely Heart
description: Counters are placed on board. Play cards to get those counters. Also the cards may have a value after you played them. Depends on the order they are played.

title: Rangeln
description: Goal of the game is to place pieces on the board to earn the most points. First pieces are placed on the board. Second they are moved.

title: Versuch dein Glück
description: Place stones and win whenever you earned 40 points.

title: Quadringentesimus Quadratum
description:
Every player owns 17 pawns. Try to get the most influence on most spaces. The board looks like the ancient Rome or something like that. The story is about Caesar and how the game got its name.
Graphics: Christof Tisch/Dennis Braun

title: Barnen i Bullerbyn
description: Abstract strategy game based on the story of the same name by Astrid Lindgren.

title: Akropolis
description: Akropolis is a three-dimensional abstract strategy game for 2 players. As in the ancient world, columns and temples will be built. Each player tries to make use of the hard work of his opponent for himself. The aim of the game is to get several columns together in a particular arrangement or to build a temple.

title: Civilization Eastern Expansion Map
types: Ancient Civilization Economic Expansion for Base-game Negotiation
description:
Published in Spanish Alea Magazine issue 21, includes an Eastern map (Mesopotamia) to add to the basic game.

It includes:

     4 new cultures: Persia, Sumer, Samita and Indus
     5 new cards

title: Karl-Alfreds Skattsökarspel
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Game based on Popeye the sailor. In this game Popeye is searching for a treasure, but Brutus will do anything in his power to stop him.

Players use a spinner to move along paths of connected spaces, aiming to reach treasure islands in order to collect correspondingly coloured chests. A player who has collected a chest of every colour may head for their home space, but landing on a Brutus space means the loss of a chest, and rolling the exact number of spaces is required to return home as well as when collecting the chests.

title: Élan
description:
[From the manual]

Elan is designed for Wargames representing Divisional and Corps sized combat on the European continent from 1805 to 1815 in 25mm or 15mm. It provides gamers with a system focused on the tactical employment of units from Brigade down to company level.

Elan aims to capture the feel of combat during the period, and will satisfy players who approach their games with an appreciation for the actual tactics used by the Generals of the period. Use of combined arms, effective command and keeping a reserve up your sleeve are the keys to success.

The rules are also perfect for tournament games allowing for objectives, quick results and good reflection of a player's ability as opposed to just sheer luck.

For play purposes a Tactical Turn represents about 20 minutes, and with the Grand Tactical aspects included, a Turn represents about 1 hour. All measurements are in millimeters representing 1 meter per millimeter. The rules are written with measurements for 25mm scale figures, but 15mm is equally suitable by modifying distances.

Includes reference charts.

title: Regulations of the Year XXII
description:
[From the manual]

This Standard Rulebook may be used with all games in the series 'Les Batailles dans L'Age L'Empereur Napoleon Premier'. This is the fourth edition; the Regulations of the Year XXII. Basic concepts of play are detailed herein. Events particular to a certain battle are covered in the Special Rulebook accompanying each game.

- Warning: These rules are more suitable for advanced players.

- Suitable for Solitaire Play: Much more so than in previous editions.

- Extensively Illustrated Examples of Play are included.

- Compatible with all previously published La Bataille titles (in order of their appearance):

Expands:

    La Bataille de la Moscowa
    La Bataille d'Auerstædt
    La Bataille de Preussisch-Eylau
    La Bataille d'Espagnol: Talavera
    La Bataille d'Austerlitz
    La Bataille de Deutsch-Wagram
    La Bataille d'Albuera: Espagnol
    La Bataille de Ligny
    La Bataille des Quatre Bras
    La Bataille de Mont Saint Jean
    La Bataille de Wavre
    La Bataille de Corunna-Espagnol
    La Bataille de Lützen
    La Bataille d'Orthez

title: The Nuclear Energy Game
mechanisms: Card DraftingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Own, Operate, or Meltdown Your Own Plant.

The Nuclear Energy game is one of several to come out in the wake of the incident at Three Mile Island. Players attempt to acquire operating licenses for nuclear power plants, which serve as a source of income. Similarly, they try to avoid meltdowns or other mishaps at those same plants. Licensed sites serve as a source of income from other players who land on them as well as producing contract fees in their own right. After a pre-determined amount of time (the designer suggests 90 minutes), players tally assets and the person with the highest total wins.

There are humorous touches in both the instructions and on the game board, ranging from the disclaimer that any small errors were incorporated intentionally in order to confuse the foreign intelligence community, to a sign pointing away from the power plant marked fallout shelter and another pointing straight down marked China. The back page gives a line-item account of the actual events at Three Mile Island leading to the release of radioactive gas.

title: Rick's Reef
description:
From Publisher-
You and your crew have been invited to participate in a three day competition to photograph as many Caribbean fish and wildlife as possible. But you are not the only team! Rick has also invited some of the best divers to compete against you so you will need to efficiently use all of your resources including your crew if divers and their equipment to confuse and delay the other competitors.

Ricks Reef, a collectible card game designed by divers for divers. There are 12 different types of divers, 7 kinds of equipment available to them and over 65 different types of fish and coral you can discover. And just to make it interesting there are 9 types of problems you can create for your opponent to throw his divers off balance.

title: Autolino
description: The goblins are going on vacation. Can you help them collect everything they need for the trip? Players take turns using a spinner to move their goblin around the board, but they must stop at certain points to wait for other players to arrive and help them acquire the necessary provisions. First goblin to the car wins.

title: IQ Squared
types: Math Number Puzzle Trivia Word Game
description:
Move round the board and answer bronze, silver or gold IQ questions for 1, 2 or 3 points. Collect points to move to another circuit on the board, and then to the center. A bit like trivial pursuit but with IQ questions.

It has the makings of a great game, but lacks something which keeps your attention. Have rarely played it to the finish.

title: Monopoly: Powerpuff Girls
types: Children's Game Economic Movies / TV / Radio theme Negotiation
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingDice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description: Another version of the classic board game Monopoly. This time you are taken to the city of Townsville to hang out with Buttercup, Blossom, Bubbles, Professor Utonium, The Mayor, and Mrs. Keane. The basic game rules are the same. What is different... well the look of the board and pieces reflect the Cartoon Network hit show, the Powerpuff Girls. Townsville dollars replace Monopoly money. Forces of evil and hotline cards replace chance and community chest cards. Townsville properties replace the usual deeds. In place of railroads there are Townsville landmarks. You can also use 3 villain characters with the special Powerpuff Girls optional rules.

title: Anno Domini: Sachsen
description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly, so this aint no game for the nerds/geeks of this world, even they might think so, because its full of surprises and pure fun. Highly recommended, because Anno Domini is a blast to play, is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Unfortunately there is no English edition in existence, but this game could be a good way, to improve your already existing German skills or a very good reason, to learn German language in the first place.

The set Sachsen contains historical events which are related to Sachsen. This relationship is not necessary obvious. Like all Anno Domini the Sachsen edition can be played as standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

Part of the Anno Domini series

title: Hachimitsu
description: A Player talks to nine girls living in an old-fashioned apartment called Hachimitsu-So, in a effort to collect positive feeling cards. By taking a girl out using those cards, you receive points. The more cards you collect, the more points you get. Whoever gets the most points achieves the right to live in Hachimitsu-So.

title: Police Chase
mechanisms: Card DraftingPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: Police Chase Game is a Milton Bradley game for ages 6 and up. Join the race for the rooftop robber! A bandit has stolen the priceless jewel and hidden it in one of the buildings downtown. He jumps from rooftop to rooftop to avoid the Police. You are a police officer on his trail. Your job is to travel through the city to gather the evidence and get a warrant. You must also recover the stolen jewel. Along the way you may meet one of your partners who can help you find what you need. Once you've collected the evidence, a warrant and the jewel, you can capture the robber and bring him to justice.

title: Bibi Blocksberg und das Geheimnis der blauen Eulen!
description:
This game was released at the same time of the movie Bibi Blocksberg und das Geheimnis der blauen Eulen! (translated as Bibi Blocksberg and the Secret of the Blue Owls!) in Germany. The movie (with the title character Bibi, who is a young witch) is based on a decades-old, long-running radio play and animated series but was also inspired by the success of the Harry Potter movies.

It's a roll and move game for juniors with four quests to complete. Roll and move effect is mitigated in a number of ways - players can re-roll once in each turn and they can collect helping cards when arriving on specific spaces or rolling a pentagram. The four quests are as follows:
- Library: find the book that opens a secret door to the secret passage. For this, find the same-colored book as the spaces you arrive on.
- Maze: to find your way through the maze, move the 5 moving pentagon tiles showing parts of the maze. These can be moved (turned or moved to different spaces) when rolling a pentagram or when arriving on a pentagon space. Cards might also help.
- Suspended bridge: each step (space) has some hidden traps that are revealed when stepping on them, easily causing players fall into the abyss. Some of them can be avoided with knowledge (knowing which blue owl has which number on its bottom), others with planning and luck (e.g. tiles where you fall into the abyss if you arrived there with specified die rolls), others with discarding a card. If a player falls into the abyss they have to climb back to the bridge and try again. The task gets easier once tiles are revealed and players know what to expect.
- The Five Owls: owls have to be placed on the five numbered spaces in order (the owl with number 1 to space 1 and so on). If a player fails they go back to the entrance of the owls hall. The numbers on the bottom of the owls can be looked at during game (with cards or when rolling a pentagram) but whenever they are checked (secretly, by the active player) they are placed back to another space so their location keeps changing and players must watch their movement closely during the course of the game.
The first player to correctly place the fifth owl to its corresponding place on the last space of the path wins.

title: Trivial Pursuit: Pocket Player Set – TP's People
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description:
(From the box:) Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Sets let you play a great new way - anywhere, without a board!  With the new Pocket Player Spinner/Scorers, just spin to select a question category and slide to keep track of your score.  The first player or team to score correct answers in all six categories wins.  Here's a fast-playing game that goes right to the heart of Trivial Pursuit.  Those famous, fascinating questions!
1,440 all-new questions about famous - and infamous - personalities.

title: Trivial Pursuit Junior Fourth Edition
description:
(from the box:) From bats and cats to spiders and space... from Little Miss Muffet to the Liberty Bell... here are questions specially written for children age 8 and up.  And this fourth edition has twice as many questions as earlier games.
As always, Trivial Pursuit Junior has the same game play and all the fun and challenge of the adult edition, with questions in these kid-friendly categories:
Every Day
Fun
Science
Stories  Songs
Nature
Games

title: Trivial Pursuit: Baby Boomer Master Game
description:
This is a Master Game, complete with board, die, moving pieces and scoring wedges.  The cards are the same as in the popular Baby Boomer Edition Subsidiary Card Set.  The board is the same as from the original 1981 Trivial Pursuit. In some printings, the background color of the board is the same garnet shade as the box. In others it is blue, identical to the original board.

The categories are:
Television
Stage  Screen
Nightly News
Publishing
Lives  Times
R.P.M.

title: Trivial Pursuit: Edicion Olimpica [Spanish]
description:
This is a master game, complete with board.  The instructions and questions are entirely in Spanish and cover the 1992 Olympics in Barcelona.
Categories are:
Futbol y Baloncesto
Paises y Lugares Olimpicos
Otros Deportes Olimpicos
Deportes Olimpicos Basicos
Vips y Personajes
Historia y Noticias del Deporte

title: Insider
description:
One of Gerhard Kodys' better games, the game concerns moving in the right social circles and this gaining the best seats at a restaurant.

From the game rules description:

The Game of Appearance and Reality

The 400, the glitterati, the beautiful people and the VIPs. Who wouldnt want to be part of their world of luxury, glamour and glitz

However, we cant all belong to it. The road to the top leads through the best tables at the INSIDER! The super-luxury-IN-temple in the center of the city. The restaurant.

Those seen there may rightfully count themselves among High Society. But in order to reach your goal must you keep your adversaries at bay. By use of Scandals, Rumors, Contacts and many other actions you are trying to climb the social ladder while trying to put a spike in the wheel of your opponents. Lucky for you that having a Bodyguard handy just might save you from just about everything.

And don't despair. Those who are IN today may be Total OUT tomorrow!

title: Fencing
description: A very unusual card game of Fencing. The exact moves performed in the real sport are included, and work realistically. Predates En Garde by some decades!

title: My Little Pony: Dream Castle
description:
From the Game's Instructions:
Ready for a high-flying hot-air balloon adventure?  Pick a pony -- Sunny Daze, Pinkie Pie, Sparkleworks or Rainbow Dash.  Then spin the spinner to move your pony pawn from cloud to cloud above Ponyville.  Play special cards to move ahead, or to switch places with another pony.  First one to 'touch down' at Celebration Castle wins the game!

It's a slightly different take on classics like Candyland and Chutes-and-Ladders ... incorporating both a spinner and drawn cards.

Note to Admins: This is different than the other My Little Pony games listed on BGG so far ...

title: R.A.G.
description:
Welcome to the world of publishing: As a publisher of the Weekly Rag, thousands of readers look to you for news and gossip. Your tabloid is seeking to have the best stories in the business. Deal the cards and write some headlines!

Self-published game consisting of 96 word cards, a few blank cards and a couple of quick-reference cards. Each word card has 4 different words on it along with either a positive sign ( + ) or a negative sign ( - ). Words are articles, nouns, verbs, adjectives or adverbs. Different symbols correspond to the different parts of speech.

Everyone is dealt 10 cards face down (your personal pile) and players then draw 3 of those cards to form a hand. Remaining cards form a draw pile. On your turn, you may start a headline with a noun or article card, add a card to your headline (following normal sentence structure), add a card to someone else's headline (if you have a headline of your own started) or pass (and draw a card from the draw pile). If you use a card from your hand, you draw a card from your personal pile. Headlines must start with a noun or article and must contain at least 2 nouns and 1 verb. The headline is completed and set aside when the second noun is placed.

The round continues until a player runs out of cards from both their personal pile and their hand. Each player then scores their completed headlines. Incomplete headlines do not score any points. Subtract the number of negative cards from the number of positive cards in the headline. If the result is positive, this is your score. If the result is negative, take the absolute value as your score (e.g. you get 4 points for a score of -4).

The first player to reach a score of 10 wins the game. However, The primary purpose of RAG is to be entertaining. Many of the headlines will be funny. Some of them will be VERY funny! Enjoy the game and laugh a lot. Laughing is good for you!

title: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game – Forbidden Forest Expansion Pack
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Exploration Fantasy Miniatures
mechanisms: Area MovementCo-operative PlayDice RollingModular BoardRole Playing
description:
This is the 2nd expansion for Dungeons  Dragons by Hasbro.

Objective: the adventurers have to enter the haunted woods to fight evil and find the mad druid Elwick and defeat him...

The new rules include the addition of wandering monsters and the trample ability.

Expands:

    Dungeons and Dragons the Fantasy Adventure Board Game

title: Draculix
description:
A neat dice race with a simple version for younger players.

Ooooh, it's scary in Count Dracula's castle! Bravely, the little vampire rolls the dice again: A garlic, two bats. And so he makes his way closer to the treasure chamber!

title: Zahlenzwerge
description: A learning game about the first numbers. Whoever lands on a treasure space by using luck, imagination and the right numbers receives a prize. Who will have the most prizes at the end of the game?

title: Mango Tango
description:
A swinging card game.

The mangoes have rhythm! The best mango-tango dancers are chosen to dance in the big competition. Different categories must be filled. The game is about the best dancing schools, dance troupes and formation dancers. Which player will have the most competitors in the finals?
