title: Mogel-Monster
description:
The amusing monster race!

The monsters of Castle Wobblestone are holding a race. They agree not to use their unnatural powers and capabilities, but none of the monsters actually hold themselves to this agreement. There's so much cheating going on, the entire Castle starts to wobble. But woe to a monster who gets caught! Then he must jump into one of the holes that lead back to the start. Which monster will cheat the best and make it to the goal first?

title: Papa Klapper
description:
The baby rattlesnake race.

Papa Rattler is going out exploring. His six children follow! Daddy speeds ahead, and his babies want to catch up to him. But Papa often moves forward faster than the little ones. Then the name of the game is quickly slither onwards and try to catch up! The baby rattler who reaches papa first is the winner. With fun wooden 3D snakes!

title: Auf heißer Spur
description:
This game is being promoted in some interesting ways. The chocolate company Ferrero has produced 250 000 Auf heier Spur mini-games, sold with Kinder Friends Chocolates. These mini-games are a reduced version with simpler mechanisms of the full game, with cardboard dice to build (see picture). Also, the German TV Channel Super RTL uses Auf heier Spur in a weekly game program for kids, called SpieleGalaxie. The kids must find the guilty thief on the TV screen.

The goal of the game is to follow the clues (shown on 3 dice: starting location, color of dropped diamond, and clothing detail) to find the right thief. Every player tried to find the right thief at the same time, following a circle of cards with suspects. There are also special cards (subway, etc.)

title: Fische füttern
description:
A light-hearted wooden set collection game for the younger set.

Four colourful fish wait happily in their aquarium tank to be fed. To get lots of food for their own fish, the players carefully shake the food can and arrange the coloured food pieces according to the right cards. A light-hearted set collection game for the very young, who can learn fine motor skills as well as colours. Wooden playing pieces!

title: Flecken Monster
description:
Get rid of your spots!

A communication game. Oh dear, how will one get rid of these monster spots again? The action cards show the players how. With fun, Grips (a German game where colored wooden discs are placed onto spaces) and creativity a great time is guaranteed.

title: Cockatoo Contest
description:
Parrot fun that demands memory and dexterity.

Four parrots want to land safely on the ever-higher-growing palm trees. The players pay close attention to which parrot sits where. Because whoever remembers the varying colors well collects the tastiest fruits. Exciting gaming fun that requires a good memory and good dexterity.

title: Rutschpartie mit Winnie the Pooh
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
A fun 3D ladder game.

Winnie and his friends have discovered huge footprints. They bravely follow the trail and a fun and exciting race begins. Especially high gaming enjoyment is guaranteed by the large game board, set up like a roof. Even little children can follow the trail with the help of the colored die and let their playing figure slide over the large game board.

title: Sprich genau, hör genau
description:
Practice language in a game - an organization game.

This game develops your child's language skills. It is perfect to prepare a child, through play, for reading and writing. Included are speech and language games with rhyming words and similar-sounding words. Only he who listens carefully and speaks clearly will find the right word. Three game versions provide age-appropriate play possibilities and individual learning fun.

title: Volcano
description:
Ash Sunday's Volcano describes itself as A board game odyssey to the May 18th eruption of Mount St. Helens. A short history of the 1980 eruption is provided.

The game itself is a race from Toutle to Cougar and to the Crater Observation Point, then back again. Pyroclastic flows, mud flows, road blocks, and bureaucracies all serve to deter the players along their route.

Players may choose to remove the Big Eruption! card from the deck that eliminates its drawer.

title: Wangaratta
description:
Wangaratta is a game about selling and transporting goods. You are a shipowner and the goal of the game is to ship as much you can, for best price and also to buy one ship in each if the three different weight classes.

To win the game you must have three different ships, have sold merchandise in both London and New York. And of course have the most money.

title: The Wishbone Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Based on the PBS television series about the little dog with a big imagination.

The object of the game is simple: race around the board to collect your hero's favorite things.  Along the way, you'll leap into literature, sniff out adventure, dig for clues, scratch out a game-winning strategy, and search for food (dogs can't live on books alone).  The Wishbone Game is a great introduction to the classic works of literature introduced by the world's most classic dog.  It's designed for parents and children to play together, and it's more fun than chewing on an old sneaker.

title: East Front
description:
This is a Japanese tactical level game on the battles of the Eastern Front during World War 2.
Platoon level game of tactical battles on the Eastern front similar to Panzerblitz.

640 counters. 4 8.5 x 22 inches modular geomorphic maps plus one 11 x 17 inches Berlin residential area map. 
Twelve scenarios from January 1943 to May 1945 from the Ukrainian steppes to Hungary and to the streets of Berlin.

All tank types of the German and Russian armies are there from PZ III to Konistiger and from T-34/76 to Stalin II with less common types. There are even tanks never produced such as the E-100 and Maus in several variants. Beautiful counter art.

title: Operation MI
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on the battle of Midway.

Published by Tsukuda Hobbies.

title: DAK the Desert
description:
DAK the Desert is campaign level wargame for North Africa in World War 2. This game published in the self-published edition (old) Game Journal volume 51.

Players control either Axis or Allied army in North Africa. Players manage unit organize, supply, movement and combat. Each combat unit represent battalion, regiment or brigade and they can operate individually, but they are organize into division for more efficient activation.

Each turn is a repeat of the unlimited number operation impulse. However, the each impulse must spend a supply point, and each combat is require extra supply point per involve formations. Reinforcements and supplies must purchase by transport  points.

Winner determined by control of Benghazi, Tobruk and Alexandria. If either player controlled all three places at end of the turn, he can achieve sudden death victory. Alternatively, at the end of the game, the winner determined by the control situation.

title: Moskva
description:
This is a French wargame on Operation Barbarossa 1941.

Re-implements:

    MOCKBA

title: Macross Dogfight
description:
Complexity level 3 on Tsukada's 1-6 scale (1=easiest)

The game of Space Dog Fight in Macross

This is a Japanese science fiction wargame based on the popular Japanese anime Macross.

This is a tactical game of mech vs. mech combat in outer space with rules for Valkyrie transformations, unit facing, 3-D movement and inertia.

title: Road Trip
description:
Road trip is an unusual counting game in which the only choice is how many dice to roll.  Each player has stones of one color, which are arranged in a line of alternating colors.  If playing with two players, each player has two colors.  Whoever's color is first in line decides how many dice to roll (one to five), rolls the dice and counts down the line.  If the stone matches the first stone in line, it is captured.  If not, the two stones switch position.  The winner is the first person to capture six stones.

Road Trip was first published as a Cheapass ad in the 1999 program book for ShoreCon, a gaming convention in Cherry Hill, New Jersey.

title: Gettysburg: High Tide of the Confederacy
description:
Gettysburg - High Tide of the Confederacy is a brigade-level simulation of the American Civil War battle of Gettysburg, fought from July 1 to July 3, 1863, between Union and Confederate forces.

The game is suitable for two to eight players.  With two players, one takes on the role of General Robert E. Lee, commander of the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia, while the other player assumes the role of General George C. Meade, commander of the Union Army of the Potomac.  With more players, each assumes command of one or more corps.  According to the publisher, the game is most enjoyable with between four and six players.

While not overly simple, the game is not complex, and experienced gamers will have little difficulty with the mechanics of play.  There are six scenarios, including a campaign scenario that simulates all three days of the battle.  The publisher suggests that the four-turn Assault on the Round Tops scenario be played first in order to become familiar with the game turn sequence and the line-of-sight rules.  Depending on the scenario selected, playing time is between 2 and 18 hours.

title: Hero's Realms
description:
This is a Japanese tactical fantasy game published by Tsukuda hobbies.

This reminds me of Melee where the players play pre generated characters and fight them with each other or monsters ala arena style combat.

title: Sealab 2020
types: Abstract Strategy Movies / TV / Radio theme Nautical Science Fiction
description:
From the inside box lid:  This undersea TV drama comes to life with this exciting strategy game.  Each player controls his team of divers as they leave the Sea Lab to explore the ocean depths. The first player to bring his research team back to the lab with samples from the search, wins the game.

Each player has a team of 3 figures that start in the middle of the board.  In the 4 corners of the board are undersea treasures to obtain (for each player).  Movement is done in a Chinese Checkers fashion until one player retrieves them all and returns home.

title: Unity
description:
The object of the game is to win the game by playing all of your cards, where the final cards you play are two or more righteous cards or a single Unity card.

There are three categories of cards in the game: righteous, evil, and festival.

Unity is a Biblically based strategy card game where righteous cards are played in unity to enter into righteousness with other players and to defeat evil attacks.  There are also festival cards that allow all of the players to celebrate each Biblical festival described in the book of Leviticus, chapter 23.

The game is a rather complicated one, but once learned it is a pretty engaging game, despite the simplistic sound of the basic objectives.  The righteous, evil, and festival cards each have various categories and point values, along with special instructions for playing them.

The rules that come with the game are very basic, but there are some expanded explanations on the game maker's website at:

http://www.unitygame.com/

Along with options to play online via a Java game.

title: If You Had To Choose ...?
description:
If You Had To Choose...? A FANTASY GAME ABOUT PRIORITIES TM

If you had to choose... would you rather (A) be breathtakingly beautiful but have to go to prison for five years, or (B) always be plain looking but never go to jail?

If you had to choose... would you rather be stuck in a one room cabin for two weeks during a severe snow storm with (A) George Bush, or (B) Michael Jackson?

If you had to choose... would you rather (A) always be extremely rich but never meet the person of your dreams, or (B) never make more than minimum wage your whole life but find true love?

If you had to choose... would you rather (A) be famous but die at 58, or (B) always be anonymous but live until 98?

If You Had To Choose...? A FANTASY GAME ABOUT PRIORITIES TM is a party game for ages 16 and up that really makes you think but in a fun way. As the millennium unfolds it is evident that people are searching for more depth and meaning in their lives. If You Had To Choose...? is a soul searching game that helps people discover what's really important to them and to others by asking thought provoking questions about their priorities and values in life having to do with love, money, relationships, spirituality, etc. But it does this in a fun and humorous way using fantasy which allows people to enter into totally imaginary situations. People want to escape their everyday lives and If You Had To Choose...? lets them.

Players will predict (by betting with chips) how others will answer and then attempt to persuade them to change their minds in intense discussions. Players, through answering, predicting, persuading and discussing will have eye-opening revelations about themselves and others and also have a great time in the process.

CONTENTS: Instructions, 660 questions, 330 cards, 20 marker cards, 200 chips, 1 sand timer

For 2 to 10 players ages 16 and up.

title: Talengarde
mechanisms: Dice RollingHex-and-CounterModular BoardRole PlayingRoll / Spin and MoveVariable Player Powers
description:
From the back of the box:

Twoelk the hunter looked at Alyta and then at the portal at the far side of the vast hall. She, too, knew it was their one chance of getting home again.  The fog that rolled out of the portal had left stones in the fortress slick with dew, so the two of them approached it with caution.  According to what the avatar at the oracle had said, Urrick would be here, and he would be unbeatable without the aid of a spell caster.  That is why, as a sinister form began to take shape within the eldritch mists of the portal, Twoelks trepidation grew.  He slowly drew the magic arrow from his quiver, and glanced sideways at the amazon.  Alytas eyes were fixed on the portal and the terror within.  They could now discern the immense stature of the Rakshasa as it stepped through the vapors.  It was Urrick.

As the tiger-mans pale eyes narrowed on the two adventurers, he sneered.  He would enjoy eviscerating these foolish humans, and dining upon their entrails.  But before he could pounce upon his victims, an unseen force left him suspended in mid-leap.  It seemed the Twoelk and Alyta were equally stunned.  Now, my friends!  Strike now!  It was the voice of Brannig, whom they believed had been killed in the ruins south of the oracle.  Twoelk stammered, stymied.  You cant keep a good mage down, Brannig replied to their unvoiced question.  But magic will only keep Urrick immobile a few seconds more.  Now be quick!

Welcome to Talengarde, A world of fantasy and adventure, heroes and quests, magic and chance.  This game features a customizable playing area, numerous beings, and dozens of secret objectives and plot twists ensuring hours of fascination and thousands of game scenarios.  And, unlike many role-playing games, Talengarde does not require a game master. It includes everything you need to start your adventures.

Box contains:
6  Map Boards
36  Map Building Pieces
6  Colored Dice
6  Colored Pawns
396  Game Cards Featuring Original Artwork
200  Game Markers
1  Instruction Booklet

title: Penguin Pat's Fishy Business
description:
Penguin Pat waddles around his track to in front of the next player and randomly announces your action - take a fish, take 2 fish, steal a fish or return a fish.

When you match all 4 fish tails to your board, you win.

title: Noah's Quest
types: Card Game Collectible Components Dice Religious
description: A CCG that based off of Bible story Noah's Ark. You battle (animals) with a combination of cards and dice.

title: Bohn Hansa: Die Städtemehrheiten
types: Economic Expansion for Base-game Medieval Travel
description:
This simple expansion for Bohn Hansa contains 75 markers for use during the game. Players are rewarded for traveling a variety of roads as well as working to gain a bonus for having the most city majorities. (The name of the expansion translates to The City Majorities.

Die Stdtemehrheiten is part of the Bohnanza family of games.

Expands:

    Bean Trader

title: Think: Mega Memo
description:
Improve your memory!
This game is from the THINK product line of Ravensburger and is about how to improve the abilities of your memory.

It includes a memory game, with 128 cards (56 printed both sides) and 3 different memory concepts, described in the rulebook. Additionally there is an illustrated training-book, which provides detailed information about how to improve your memory in everyday life.

title: Trojan Wars
types: Ancient Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame
description:
[From the manual]

Warfare in the Age of the Chariot - A Module for Ancient Empires

The Late Bronze Age:
This module covers the campaigns of the Aegean peoples and their opponents of the late bronze age from the rise of the Hittite and Mycenaean Empires in the mid 14th Century BC to the collapse of the East Mediterranean civilizations into the dark ages of the Sea Peoples at the end of the 13th Century. This period coincides with the last surge of Imperial Egypt as the premiere military power of the region.

The module is called The Trojan Wars because Trojans participated in many of the memorable military actions. The age of bronze was symbolized by the supremacy of the battle chariot as the arbitrator of the fate of empires.

Contents:

- Over forty pages of rules for chariot warfare and scenarios for Megiddo and Kadesh.

- Easy to use charts and tables listing over one hundred different troop types, including historical leader ratings.

- Background and history of the wars and times, with the latest historical and archaeological interpretations.

The empires of the chariot. The heroes of Troy. Will Homer sing of your exploits on the battlefield?

Expands:

    Ancient Empires: A Simulation of the Wars of Antiquity

title: Alexander
types: Ancient Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame
description:
From the manual:

A Module for Ancient Empires: A Simulation of the Wars of Antiquity.

Alexander the Great stirs the imagination of almost all of us. He is without doubt, one of the greatest conquerors of all time. His victories fused two great cultures and provides the wargaming historian with many imponderables and possibilities.

In Alexander the Great, the Wars of Philip and Alexander, we provide for you the great armies of this period so that you, the historical wargamer, can recreate the various armies and battles of this great period in military history. The armies of Philip at Chaeronea and the Greeks he fought; the invasion army of Alexander as he crossed the Hellespont and the army of the 'Great King' Darius III; the new army of Alexander that he took into India, as well as the armies of Porus and even Cangdragnupta, are all detailed here for you to study and recreate.

Within the framework of this module and 'Ancient Empires', now you can become Alexander at the head of his Companions at Issus or Gaugamela. As Porus, now you can attempt to end the conquests of the invincible Macedonian conqueror! All of the great campaigns of Alexander are listed here within the covers of this module for you to study, analyze and recreate.

This module is the fourth released for use with 'Ancient Empires'.

Expands:

    Ancient Empires: A Simulation of the Wars of Antiquity

title: De Vlucht van de Uiver
description:
From the box:
A tense game for 3 to 6 players where tactics, daring and entrepreneurship determine the result.
Go on a flight from Schiphol (main airport of Amsterdam, NL) to Melbourne (AU) experiencing all events that come and go with such a trip.
This game is published to commemorate the flight of the historical Uiver in 1984 in a single limited edition.

title: Modern Battles: Four Contemporary Conflicts
description:
The Modern Battles Quadrigame consists of four completely separate games, each with its own 17 x 22, three-color map, unit counters and Exclusive Rules.  The Standard Rules are common to all four games.

Game scale is one mile per hex and 12 hours per game turn.  Unit sizes range from battalion to Brigade.  Design is a simple IGO-UGO sequence of play utilizing rigid Zones of Control and a differential based CRT.  Artillery units can participate in combat from non-adjacent hexes in attack and defense.

The games included in this quad are:


    Chinese Farm - covers the combat between the Israeli and Egyptian force around the Suez Canal, during the latter half of the Yom Kippur War, October 15 to 21, 1973.



    Wurzburg - (Hypothetical) A vital communications center, dominating the route of Soviet invasion into West Germany, which would be the site of a clash between Soviet Mechanized Rifle Divisions and the American Third Mechanized Infantry Division.



    Golan - On October 5, 1973, the Syrians launched an offensive with the objective of driving the Israelis off the Golan Heights.  They came close to success, but were eventually hammered back to the outskirts of Damascus.



    Mukden - (Hypothetical) Mukden is a great industrial center which lies at the edge of the vast Manchurian plain.  It would be a vital objective in a Soviet invasion, and would be hotly contested as the first threatened Chinese city.


A follow up set of four new games was later published as Modern Battles II: Four Contemporary Conflicts.

title: Modern Battles II: Four Contemporary Conflicts
Power CARDZ Collectable Card Game
types: Card Game Collectible Components Fantasy Fighting Science Fiction
description:
Sub-titled: The Definitive Super-Powered Collectible Card Game

With additional 'credits' to: Tim Parsons; Stephen Stegelin; Chris Riley; Dan Harbison; EDITOR-Chester Jacques; PUBLISHER-Gary Reed; PLAYTESTERS-Todd Wartman as well as the many others previously listed; and SKYVERSE.
The LIST of 'artists' is as follows: Gary Barker, Leann Buckley, Andy Dimmitt, Jerry Foley, Gene Gonzales, Brad Gorby, Mark Hester, Don Hillsman, Quinton Hoover, Raff Ienco, Jake Jacobsen, Greg Land, Chris Leidenfrost, David Mack, Deon Nuckols, Sean Parsons, Willie Peppers, Steven Redinger, David Rowe, Kevin Sharpe, Brent Trammell, and Wayne Wong, as well some of the others already mentioned in the credits.

EACH Power CARDZ Starter Deck consists of 50-CARDs of 2-types: either Characters Cards OR Enhancement Cards and these have this denoted upon them, as well as a set of Rules for playing this. There is also a Power Scorecard sheet printed within this rules sheet, that needs to be enlarged and copied prior to gameplay. The Characters are also divided into HERO and VILLAIN Cards for simplicity's sake. Basically, you have 25-points for each Character, or object, and once these are exhausted, then that particular card is K.O.'d!

There was a means of obtaining a supplemental Power Scorecard, plus six Power Stones of various colors, as well as a checklist of the entire initial release-300 cards. These have a decidedly comic book look and feel in the components and gameplay, while being geared towards a generic approach for this so as not to impinge upon anyone's IP rights.

The game was really released twice with very different rules and many changes to the formatting of the cards.  The second release was based on input from Martin A. Stever.

title: Defence of the Sea Lane
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on naval battles during a hypothetical 3rd World War.
Published as one of the SS(Small size war Simulation) series in 1989.
Designed by Chikanori Nomata.

title: Emperor Napoleon
description:
Emperor Napoleon is strategic level Japanese wargame on Napoleon's campaigns .

First published as one of the SS(Small size war Simulation) series in 1989.
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #119 in 2014.

title: War in Vietnam
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on the Tet Offensive during the Vietnam war.

One side plays the U.S. and the other plays the North Vietnamese.

Published as one of the SS(Small size war Simulation) series in 1989.

Designed by Daisuke Sato.

title: Von Vietinghoff's 10th Army
description:
The Game: Von Vietinghoff's 10th Army consists of 1386 pieces , two 59 x 84 cm maps , a 10.5 x 29.5 cm map(printed in Japanese) and 14 pages of rules (in Japanese). Turn length is eight hours and units are platoons or companies. Player numbers are one or two and playing time is from three hours. Players play tactical battles in Salerno 1943. Circumference of Salerno in southern Italy is printed in maps.

Solitaire Suitability: Medium (on a scale of Low-Medium-High)

title: Wehrmacht: First Defeat
description:
The Game: Wehrmacht: First Defeat consists of 240 pieces , a 59 x 84 cm map (printed in Japanese) and 8 pages of rules (in Japanese). Turn length is eight days and units are divisions , corps and armies. Player numbers are one or two and playing time is about eight hours. Players play Operation Typhoon in East Front 1941. The map area covers Leningrad-Moskva-Kursk. Players can try many historical options. For example, German player can bring panzer divisions from Army Group North to Army Group Center with risks.

Solitaire Suitability:High(on a scale of Low-Medium-High)

title: Campaign for Guadalcanal
description:
Campaign for Guadalcanal contains 96 counters, a 36 x 51 cm map (printed in Japanese) and 6 pages of rules (also in Japanese).

Turn length is a month and units are a ship or a squadron. For one or two players, playing time is two hours. 
Players play battles in South Pacific 1942 (centered on the Solomon Islands).

Solitaire Suitability: High (on a scale of Low-Medium-High).

title: The Game of HotSeat
description: Players are dealt five cards.  The first player rolls the die to determine which player is on the HotSeat.  They must then truthfully answer a question asked by the player who rolled the die.  They may use a Pass card to get out of answering, or a Rebound card to force the the asking player to answer the question.  The first player to use all of their cards wins.

title: Lernabenteuer Tiere unserer Welt
description:
A description of the game from Spielbox:

In Tiere unserer Welt (Animals of our World), children learn 30 different animals, where they live and which group they belong to. Much more information is provided by Zoo director Animalfriend in the accompanying booklet - that is, that whales aren't fish, they're mammals, what a mammal is, and where they live.

title: Lernabenteuer Papier & Co., Was gehört wohin?
description:
A description of the game from Spielbox:

Papier  Co., Was gehort wohin? (Paper  Co., What goes where?) deals with our garbage and how it is separated. Through play, children learn what goes into which barrel, what makes up our garbage, and what happens to it after it is thrown away.

title: Wieso? Weshalb? Warum? Mein Indianerspiel
description:
A description of the game from Spielenet:

Discover - Question - Understand. A knowledge game.

When did Indians smoke the peace pipe? What's a tomahawk? This tile-laying game is fun and explains to children that life as a Native Indian was like. By placing the tiles correctly, the overall picture emerges. In the process, not only points but also information is collected. Two variants are also included.

title: Over the Edge Football
description:
Over the Edge Football is a tabletop game.  Remember playing paper football in school?  Well, now you have an electronic triangular unit that simulates the football.

You still push it back and forth over the table, but the unit keeps score, times the quarters, and even has voice and stadium sounds.

When you turn the unit on, lights will let you know who has possession of the 'ball'.  To score a touchdown, the unit has sensors underneath that will register when it goes over (but does not fall off) the edge of the table.  Each side has four downs to score a point before a turnover occurs.  It also has a special setting for field goal attempts.

title: Tabletop Football
description:
This game has taken the old recess and study hall pass time of paper football and turned it into an officially licensed product of the NFL. And they did a great job with it.

The game comes with flat cardboard triangles for the footballs. What is cool is that each one has the name and logo of an actual NFL team. And yes, they made expansion packs so you could collect them all. It also comes with a very cool item, a field goal that you put together and stand up for when you attempt an extra point.

The game is played by two opponents stationed at opposite ends of a tabletop surface. The person who goes first flicks or slides the football toward the other end of the table. If it is touched by the opponent a field goal attempt is allowed for the flicker. Otherwise, a touchdown is made when part of the football rests over the edge of the table but doesn't fall off. Then an extra point can be attempted if a score is made. If a score is not made, the other person attempts to score, and so on until a winner is declared.

The game was first introduced in 1994.  The inaugural events which introduced the game were sponsored jointly by the NFL and Ocean Spray.

Tournaments were established around the country at thousands of Universities, with a grand prize package at stake for a team of four to attend the Superbowl with all expenses paid.

title: Sports Dynasty
description:
In this mechanically simple game, each player is the owner of four sports teams (baseball, American football, hockey, and basketball).

Each player starts with money, and cards representing (generic) superstars in the four sports. As players move around the board, they pay payrolls, collect gate receipts, and can get new superstars from the bank, through auction, or by acquiring them from other players.

Certain board spaces (or a roll of doubles) trigger a championship round in the currently-active sports season. Championships are resolved by each player rolling as many dice as they have superstars in the currently-active sport (which of course also moves the game into the next season). The championship victor gets a 2-D plastic trophy, and a monetary bonus.

The winner is the first to win 3 championships in any one sport, or 2 championships in each of  2 sports.

title: Battle for the Falklands
description: Axis & Allies-style treatment of the 1982 war between Britain and Argentina for control of the Falklands Islands.

title: The Successors
types: Ancient Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame
description:
[From the manual]

A module for Ancient Empires.

You have won a great victory.
Yes, one more such victory and Phrrhus is no more.

Soon after the death of Alexander in 323 B.C., his kingdoms became divided. The Successors represent the armies and leaders born out of this turbulent period. Inside this module for 'Ancient Empires' you will find all the details to re-fight the great battles of Pyrrhus, the Ptolemys, and Seleucid dynasties, and much more.

Ancient Empires has quickly become the standard by which all other rule systems for miniatures are measured. Combining ease of play with careful attention to historical detail, the discerning gamer is able to accurately recreate the wars of antiquity.

CONTENTS:

- Over sixty pages of rules and scenarios, spanning the later Successor armies.

- Easy to use charts and tables listing over one hundred different troop types, including historical leader ratings.

- Background and history of the wars and times.

- The first Ancient Empires update.

Expands:

    Ancient Empires: A Simulation of the Wars of Antiquity

title: Criminalita
types: Bluffing Card Game Mafia Memory Party Game Political
description:
This is a Mafia/Werewolf variant with a number of twists that change the game dynamics. Players are dealt a number of cards per round that affect powers, enhance capabilities etc.
Further twist lies in the fact that players lynched or murdered still take part due to ability to re-enter game. This increases player retention after multiple game sessions. 
So far it's published only in Greek but there are plans for a German version.

title: Nobunaga: A Dangerous Time
description:
This is a Japanese wargame of the campaigns of Oda Nobunaga in Central Honshu.

A very well regarded game, it is considered one of the best if not the best games that Mr. Tetsuya Nakamura has ever designed.

title: Locke the Superman
types: Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Negotiation Science Fiction
description:
This is a Japanese card game set in the anime universe of Locke the Superman.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Locke_the_Superman

Published by Epoch.

title: Hydramatik
description: Tile laying game with 49 hexagons showing different body parts of dragons. If a player lays a tile and finishes a hydra, he scores points according to the number of tiles in the hydra. Extra points are awarded for player specific hydras (2 backs, 3 ends, ring and head, ring and claw).

title: Spellarama
types: Card Game Educational Memory Party Game Word Game
description:
Cool letter card game you can print-off for free...Works with sound cards + charts...The card game uses sounding, hearing, seeing, memorizing, hands-on and creative thinking...

Discover the POWER OF PLAY

title: Principality
description:
A CCG where Angelic hosts battle out demons. Players play as team of angels  gold team and blue team. The first player to capture 3 of the 5 Deceiver cards win.

Each Deceiver cards has four sides and each side has a number, representing the Deceivers strength. Each archangel card has a single number, representing its own strength. Players must play sets of archangel cards next to each side of a Deceiver to equal or better the strength number printed on that side. When a player has played sufficient archangels to equal the strength number on the one side of a Deceiver, that side is covered. The first player to have all 4 sides, of a Deceiver covered has successfully bound the Deceiver and takes the card.

Each Deceiver card also has a few dice pictured on the center of the card, two red ones and a white one. During the end of the turn, a die is rolled. If you roll one of the numbers one the red ones, you must pick up a Minion card and immediately follow the instructions on that card. If the white is rolled, you most discard you highest vauled card that is currently in play. There are also good special cards that can be played as well during the game.

title: The Battle of Trafalgar 1805
description: The Battle of Trafalgar 1805 board game celebrates the 200th anniversary of the famous encounter between the combined fleets of Napoleonic France and her ally, Spain, against the British fleet commanded by Admiral Horatio Nelson on the 21st of October 1805. The game contains miniature ships of the line to give the realistic appearance of two fleets of Men 'O' War engaging in battle.

title: Camping, Hiking & Outdoor Trivia
description:
Contains thousands of questions on camping, hiking, national and state parks, forest, memorials and trails, RVing, first aid, wilderness survival, campgrounds, fishing, mountain biking, Boy and Girl Scouts, camping food, camping gear, campfire songs, stories, wildlife conservation and much more. 
The object of the game is to answer the questions correctly and acquire a colored token in each of the 5 categories.

title: Bugs Bunny Game
description:
From the box:
Boppin Bugs Bunny takes Speed and Skill to make your Bugs Bunny run up the Hill

title: 64 Milestones: The Game of Life
description: The game is played with on a large illustrated board divided up into 64 squares or Milestones with period illustrations, these represent some of the 64 Milestones of Life, the player starts when born and passes through the various phases of life, Babyhood, Schooldays, Varsity, etc. and after marriage ultimately retires at 64. The first player to reach square 64 is the winner. The game and board are separate with the playing pieces contained in a small box.

title: Huckleberry Hound Western Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Huckleberry Hound roll and move game

title: Tweedledum and Tweedledee
description: A 'ticklish' game of Tweedledum and Tweedledee, the aim is to rebuild your figure of either character on its pedestal using the two wooden sticks known as lifters to pick up each section of the body.

title: Secret Square
description:
From the publisher:

The Game of Great Questions! Kids love to ask questions, and Secret Square encourages great questions. One player secretly hides a chip under a square, then the other players ask questions to remove squares . . . until the only square left is the secret square. Simple enough for a 4 year-old, challenging enough for parents and older children. Great developmental game for young childrenit enhances deductive reasoning, set-building, and sequencing skills. 1997 Parents Choice Toy Approval Award Winner.

title: Step On It
description:
From the publisher:

What a kick! Can you step on the footprint and act out the picture? This game combines the challenge of charades with the development of memory and word-association skills. Heres how you play: pick a picture card, put it under a giant footprint andyou guessed it!step on it. Then act out the picture and get the other players to guess what you are. Then go again. As the path grows, youll be hopping from footprint to footprint and acting out all kinds of things. Its so much fun, Mom and Dad might want to play, too! Comes with 50 picture cards, 20 colorful vinyl footprints and easy-to-follow instructions for beginners and more advanced little players.

title: You Must Be Joking
description:
From the back of the box:

You Must Be Joking is the sensational game that plays on words and contains thousands of witty and pun filled cards designed to confuse and amuse you. Clues are read aloud and players try to spot their double meanings which will lead them to the correct answer. The results are always hilarious.

title: Frankenstein's Children
description:
FRANKENSTEIN'S CHILDREN is the second in Human Head Studios' GOTHICA line of tactical, horror-themed board games. In it, Vincent Frankenstein and Marion Shelly are brilliant scientists who become bitter rivals when their love turns sour. Within the confines of the infernal estate, the scientists wield weapons of strange science and control unholy abominations. The ex-lovers and their henchmen seek to overthrow each other and claim the throne of the mad doctor.

Outside, the denizens of the surrounding village, hearing news of the workings of the Frankenstein brood, have taken up torch and tool and surrounded the grounds. Fearing what is happening within its chambers, the villagers will struggle to destroy the progeny of Frankenstein and bring the very walls of the castle down!

The game includes:
20 Floor Tiles
34 Character Tokens
34 Action Cards
8 six-sided dice
6 doors
42 Black plastic stands
32 Counters
3 Dice Screens with Wheels and Quick Reference Charts
32-page Rulebook

title: For the Masses
description:
For the Masses is a complete fantasy mass-combat wargame system, designed for use with 15mm miniatures, although any line of miniatures from 6mm up can be used for play. But it is also much more: The flexibility of the system allows players to use any fantasy setting and armies to play out famous fantastical scenarios and ancient epic battles.

Several sample army lists are included in the book but the real strength of For the Masses is the unit creation system. This system encourages players to be creative, use their imagination and have fun, which is the way wargaming should be.

title: How to be a Complete Bitch
description: A simple roll, move and pick up card game.  On picking up a card the other players decide what answer they believe you will give, if they are correct you move back, if they are wrong you move on.

title: Fauna
types: Abstract Strategy Animals Bluffing Card Game Print & Play
description:
Fauna was originally inspired by the traditional Chinese Animal Game.
It is played on an 18 x 14 board. Both players have a set of 8 hierarchically ordered animal pieces (elephant, polar bear, tiger, lion, wolf, dog, cat, mouse) and 2 humans (woman and man).
Bigger animals win against smaller animals, with two exceptions: The mouse beats the elephant, and the dog beats the polar bear.
Humans are the weakest pieces; they lose against any animal.
To win, you have to either cross the board with one of your humans, or eliminate one of the opponent's humans.
Play is card-driven. For each piece (animal or human) there are 9 cards with values 1,2,2,3,3,3,4,4,5. There's also an identical set of joker cards, which can be used for any of the pieces.
Players choose their cards from a hand of 7, one per turn, to move the corresponding piece.

There's a page dedicated to Fauna

http://www.terra.es/personal2/u.roth/fa-00.htm

where, among other things, you can find the rules in English, German and Catalan, all graphics (board, pieces cards) for download and do-it-yourself instructions.

title: Invasion
description: Strategy game of Attack and Defence by Land Sea and Air. The is a second edition of the game by author Dennis Weatley. The game as with most of this period comes with a small box containing the playing pieces and a separate board.

title: Brain Chain
description:
Brain Chain is a trivia game with a twist.  2-3 teams compete to answer questions- when correct, the team places a link of its color (red, green or blue) on the corresponding space of the large 10X10 grid that makes up the playing board.  To win, a team must get six links in a row- horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

The twist is that all teams move the same yellow marker around the edges of the board through the use of movement cards and brain pills (bonus cards gotten by answering questions correctly).  A team can ONLY attempt to answer a trivia question on a square that is in the same row or column as the yellow marker.  However, the yellow marker itself can be used to complete a row of six for the win!

The four corner spaces that have special powers: remove an opponent's token, place a free token, move any token, or attempt to answer a question on any square.

The trivia categories are: Business, Entertainment, Geography, History, Sports, Science, Potluck, and Oddball (you must figure out what trait 3 of the 4 items listed share in common).

It's Trivial Pursuit with a Go-Moku win mechanic and a dash of Pueblo added in.

Available at www.brainchaingames.com

title: Tops and Tails
description:
From the box:

Rules for Several Players:

Shuffle the cards well, and deal them out equally, face downwards. If any player finds he has a complete matching picture in his hand he can lay it down immediately, face upwards. Matching halves bear the same number.
The player on the right of the dealer begins by laying one card down, face upwards. If the next player has the card to match it, he puts it down and takes the complete picture, counting it as a set in his favor. If he has not got the matching card he can put down any other card to make whatever funny combination he likes. However, only a top can be laid to a tail, or vice versa, as two tops or two tails cannot be put together. If a player has not the type of card required, he loses his turn to the next player. The winner is the player with most complete sets at the end of the game.

Rules for One Player:

Shuffle the cards well and lay them out face downwards in pairs, in such a way that the design on the backs of each pair forms a complete picture. Then turn the cards face upwards one by one. The resulting comical combinations will give a lot of amusement. If any of the pairs of cards you have laid out forms a matching pair (a set), place them on one side, face upwards, then shuffle the remaining cards and repeat the process until all the matching pairs have been found.
You can take as long as an hour to play this game, and will always get different combinations.

title: Stlts
description:
Stlts is a new strategic board game, played on a 12x12 checkerboard with cork-centered pieces into which pins are placed. You can play Stlts  online at www.stlts.com, playing with other players or playing the computer. The object of the game is to take all the opponent's pieces.

Players take turns.  White begins.

On each turn a player may either 
- insert a pin of either color in one of their pieces,
- move one of their pieces.

A piece may move to any square that can be reached by a sequence of one-square horizontal and vertical moves where the maximum number of vertical moves is the number of white pins in the piece and the maximum number of horizontal moves the number of black pins. (A piece with no pins cannot move)

A piece may not move through a square occupied by another piece of either color. To take an opponent's piece a player moves to that square and removes it.

title: Colorforms Silly Faces Game
description:
From the publisher:

Be the first to build a complete silly face! Spin the spinner to see what silly feature you can add to your face. Wacky eyes, funny noses, goofy mouths, and silly ears! An easy-to-learn game that encourages gallons of giggles. Simple rules, large formats, fun graphics, sturdy components. For 2-4 players

title: Wikinder
description: Together with his father Leo, 12-year old Federico Colovini has developed the children's game Wikinder (Vikids). As the captains of Viking boats, the players sail from island to island and load barrels - either from the island or from an opponent's boat that happens to be moored there. The goal is to be the first player to bring a certain number of barrels back to his home island. On a player's turn, he rolls three coloured dice. They decide how many islands further his boat may sail - but it's different than what many players are used to. If the player's own colour is rolled, then his movement is reduced by one. If he has barrels on board, then none of those colours may be rolled either. The more colourful the load, the greater the chance of not moving very far and losing the load instead. An innovative idea.

title: Kecke Frösche
description:
The bold frogs are engaging in their antics: along the shore, on the pond, and underwater. The croakers are cheeky and the players help them have their fun. The stork can interrupt the fun only for a short time.

Part of the Goldsieber à la Carte line of games.

title: Willis wilde Wühlerei
description: It is fall. The acorns have fallen from the trees and lie across the forest floor. That's always the time when Willi the wild boar and his friends set off on a wild chase for the coveted acorns. Who will succeed this year to put the proper 'spin' on things and bring the most acorns home to his meadow?

title: Social Circles
description:
A get-to-know you game, a catalyst, an outstanding mixer and a great ice breaker for your next event. Great for family gatherings, neighborhood get-togethers, bible study, and Sunday school social events.

Over 1000 witty questions prompt players to talk about interests, occupations, hobbies, education, and more... in an enjoyable, light heartened setting. Guess how players will answer questions such as:

How many know someone that is always late for church?
How many love to ride roller coasters?
How many have read the entire Bible?
How many have earned an athletic letter in high school?

You win by collecting the most social circle rings while learning fun things about each other.

Includes game board, 224 question cards, eight colored pawns, 75 social circles, and original instructions

title: GiOstraKon
description:
A PDF print-and-play game set in the world of Ostrakon.
In this new daVinci game you play the role of a philosopher trying to reach the Merry-go-round of Wisdom. 
To move, the other players must give you their vote!

The game materials are:
- a board
- a white/black arrow board
- 12 philosophers 
- 12 ostrakons
- 12 tokens
- 12 team cards
- rules (in Italian)

you can download the game from www.arima.it

title: The Ungame: Christian Version
description:
This is a Christian version to the original Ungame.  This set has cards that are specifically oriented to the self-expression of faith and beliefs centered around Christianity.  There are two decks in the game and in this set there are over 140 topics that are covered.

The first deck contains lighthearted topics that are great for casual get-togethers.  The second deck contains more serious topics and should be used after a group has become familiar with sharing through the first deck.

The game is played by simply each person taking turns drawing a card and answering a question.  The person reads the card aloud and then answers it in two or three sentences.  There are no comments aloud at that time.  There are specific Question-Comment cards that allows a person to ask a question of somebody in the group, any question, or make a comment on any subject.

The game's aim is to spend quality time together, improve listening, promote fairness, and experience freedom expressing ones self.

title: Picco Giraffo
description:
Picco Giraffo is a simple tile placement game for children age 3 and up.
The game components consist of 40 nicely drawn card tiles which show body parts of giraffes in different colors: head, neck, body, legs and hooves. Each player receives 5 tiles. Players alternately play their tiles building a giraffe according to certain rules. While a giraffe must always contain exactly one head, a body and hooves tile there is no limit to the amount of neck and leg pieces. The objective of the game is to get rid of your tiles as fast as possible.

title: Profit$ of the Airwaves
description:
From the Manual (with spelling intact);
     Hallelujah breetheren! Heeere, is your opportunity to aid in the salvation of sowels, and to pockit some cold, hard cash.  Ahhlll, at the same time!  In this four player game, you wa-ill play thuh pahrt of a Tee Vee Evangelist and attempt to accumulate a vast, personal fortune (and, oh yes, spa-red the good word too!) by reaching out to people's hearts and pocket books over the airwaves.

This game comes with a small booklet containing the rules, the cover of which has the board printed on the inside, counters necessary and a small die.
     The players take the roles of TV Evangelists, in a humorous way, to get to the last space on the board while getting the most money.
     It has fairly simple gameplay.  A player rolls the die to move.  If the space the player lands on has a ? the player then chooses which of a number of choices for that space he gets. Or, if the space doesn't have a ? he rolls on the chart for that space and takes the effect corresponding to that roll.  Once a player gets to the last space Your Final REWARD!! on an exact roll (if a roll would move you beyond that, you go back a space) the player with the largest bank account ,counted in billions, wins.

title: Wreck The Nation: The Game of Political Misbehavior
description: Wreck The Nation: The Game of Political Misbehavior injects political satire into a classic board game format. Players race to spend billions of dollars in play money while following real Bush policies. They become Politicians beholden to special interests, receiving one trillion dollars in taxpayer money. Players throw the dice and travel around the board, following instructions on Revenue, Expenditure and Homeland Security cards. Players Gouge the Government, acquire media monopolies, Declare War, Poll the Public, and engage in multifarious pursuits, until somebody spends his or her last taxpayer dollar to win the game and Wreck The Nation. Players register on-line and enter a code printed at the bottom of each card to get the facts (or fun) behind a card.

title: Spheres Tarot
description:
Spheres Tarot uses a modified tarot deck. Each player deals out a ten-card spread. The cards, and their positions in the spread, have special abilities. These are activated by using the cards in certain combinations (called rituals) with each other. 
  The object of the game is to take control of the cards in your opponent's layout. No cards change hands; instead, they are pivoted 180 degrees to face the current controller. Many rituals deal with the capture and recovery of the cards, but others change their position or alter the content of the layout.

title: Desert Shield: A Gulf Strike Expansion Module
types: Expansion for Base-game Modern Warfare Wargame
description:
This is an expansion to Gulf Strike, also by Victory Games.  It was published in 1990, and updates Gulf Strike 2nd Edition with new scenarios, rules, and counters covering the 1st Gulf War. It comes with a 12 page Rule and Scenario booklet (with Saddam Hussain pictured on the cover!) and a countersheet with 260 new counters.

Ownership of Gulf Strike 2nd Edition is required to play the Desert Shield scenarios, as the rules, maps and counters from Gulf Strike 2nd Edition are utilised in the Desert Shield scenarios.

title: Grant Takes Command
types: American Civil War Expansion for Base-game Wargame
description:
Grant Takes Command contains two scenarios and 140 counters.

The first scenario, After the North Anna, covers Grant's overland campaign following the battles of Wilderness and Spottsylvania Courthouse. It  requires Lee Takes Command to play. 
The second scenario, The Battle Above the Clouds, covers Grant's campaign to break the siege of Chattanooga. It requires Autumn of Glory to play.

title: Ki-Yo
description: Teams of two players, each using a pointed rod, must cooperate to lift a flat-ended rod from the table and place it on a delicately balanced set of platforms without dropping the rod, knocking other rods off, or upsetting the balance of the platforms.

title: War of the Star Slavers
types: Economic Pirates Science Fiction Transportation Wargame
mechanisms: Dice RollingHex-and-CounterPick-up and DeliverSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
The third Meta-Galactic War ended with the realization by the belligerent empires that over 70% of their fleets had been destroyed. The decimation of their fleets also forced the contraction of their outer boundaries. Fearing that hostilities would be resumed before they could rebuild their fleets, the empires mutually agreed to bar all warships heavier than a cruiser from these liberated or abandoned (depending on your viewpoint) areas. Spontaneously the deserters, criminals, and other opportunists rose to fill this void. By preying on commercial ships and providing availability to now unobtainable or illegal items, they amassed great fortunes and others died in poverty or on the gallows.

War of the Star Slavers is a simulation of these violent times. As an empire player you must protect your commerce and prevent unrest among your populace so that you can rebuild your fleets. You must also protect yourself against the other empire as it is in his interest to see your economy fall apart as much as it is to defeat you on the field of battle.

The Slaver players must amass a fortune and retire before they are apprehended. The Slaver must pay for fuel, his crew, repairs on his ship, etc.

In other words every turn costs him money, but he can obtain large amounts of money by dealing in contraband or illegal acts. The greater the chance he takes the greater his return will be.

You can make any deals you like with whomever you choose. Anything you can get away with is valid. No act is too vile, no deal too dishonest.

title: Family Cricket
description:
The game is ideally played by two players each of whom is the captain of a team. 
Captain throws die to determine who bats first.

The fielding captain shuffles the bowling card deck and places it face down on the table. The fielding captain sets his field by placing one man in the shaded area for the wicketkeeper, one man in the shaded area of board for the bowler and his remaining men in nine different selected positions on the field. (The fielding captain may reset his field at any time between bowls)
The batting captain places one batsman at the wicket. Each time the batting team loses a wicket, the captain of the team surrenders one of his remaining ten counters (representing his batsmen) to the opposition captain. When the last of these ten counters has been lost the innings is closed.

Play begins with the fielding captain turning over the top card of the bowling deck. This action represents one bowl. The card tells where the bowler has aimed.
Hitting the ball: batter spins both spinners and then throws two dice to determine how he hits the ball.

title: Race
description: Simple take that card game simulating a car race in which the players are competing to complete 1,000km. Similar to Mille Bornes.

title: Golf Tiddlywinks
description:
Simple Tiddlywinks variant in a small (15cm) square box with a fold-up hard board (4 x the size of the box) featuring 16 holes.

The box says it's based on an original table-top board game from the 1920s.

Landing in a lake or bunker sends you back to the start. Landing on another player's token sends them back 3 spaces.


                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


From back of packaging:

Golf Tiddlywinks

A Game of Fun  Dexterity

Golf Tiddlywinks is a challenging game of skill based on an original table-top board game from the 1920s. It was designed as a celebration of golf, the 'Royal and Ancient' game that was hugely popular with affluent 'bright young things' whose world is reflected in novels by Evelyn Waugh, Nancy Mitford and P.G. Wodehouse

Play begins once each player has selected a colour counter and the order of play has been decided. Each player takes it in turn to place his counter on the starting point and flip it once towards Flag 1. When it is his turn again, the player flips his counter towards the first 'hole' from wherever it is on the board after his previous attempt. To complete the 'hole', a player's countermust come to rest on the white circle of a flag, but is not necessary for it to cover the whole of the space. When a player's counter touches the white circle and completes a 'hole' it can be flipped agian towards the next flag. The winner is the first player to reach Flag 16, the final 'hole' of the Golf Tiddlywinks course.

A counter that comes to rest on an opponent's counter must go back three 'holes'. Counters that land in a bunker or lake are returned to the start, from where the player must try to reach the Flag that was his goal before he encountered the hazard. Counters that leave the board entirely are returned to the start, from where, after missing a turn, the player must try to reach the Flag that was previously his goal.

For up to 4 players aged 3 years and over
Not suitable for children under 36 months due to small parts.

Original game courtest of Richad Ballam antique games archive

title: Club Golf
description:
Standard rules for 2, 3 or 4 players. Features rules for hooks, caddie's advice, hit pin, awkward lie, in the trees, out of bounds (or in the water), bunkered, mis-hit, dog-legs, greens.

Other forms of play possible: Stableford (Stroke Play), Match Play.

Components:
18 Hole Cards
36 Chance Cards
56 Club Cards
1 20-sided die
Scorepad

Part of the Gibsons sports range, which included Formula Motor Racing, Armchair Cricket, Turf Horse Racing, and Fireside Football.

title: SpellCaster
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemPoint to Point MovementVariable Phase OrderVariable Player Powers
description: SpellCaster is a contest of wills between two or more magic users. The winner will be the magic user who employs his or her skills to the most advantage.

title: Xtreme Fantasy Wrestling
description:
Welcome to Xtreme Fantasy Wrestling, where you control all the action. You make the cards, you set the matches, it's all up to you. Choose from 32 wrestlers to create your stable, or create your own wrestler and try to capture the XFW world title belt.

Each wrestler has his own abilities, bio, and moves list with finishing moves. Start with your light moves to stun your opponent then pound him with a heavy move. Throw him into the ropes and catch him with a clothesline on the way back. Shoot him into the turnbuckle then set him up for a superplex. Can't beat him the old fashioned way? See if he gets up after a stiff chair shot to the head! Just remember the referee may be watching!

title: Schatzsuche: Das Erbe des Seewolfs
description:
From Spielbox:

Schatzsuche: Das Erbe des Seewolfs (Treasure Hunt: The Inheritance of the Sea Wolf) is an exciting treasure hunt for children invented by Klaus Zoch. A brave little wolf is on the search for booty. Gold coins and jewelry get added to Wolfi's as well as his young helpers' possessions when they manage to accumulate as many pairs of identical island- and treasure-cards as possible. But the Devil is in the details: Two of the beautifully-illustrated cards, although they may appear identical at first glance, are actually different upon closer inspection. Guessing wrong impacts Wolfi's treasure hunt: the goods have to be returned. The winner at the end of the adventure is the person who has managed to accumulate the most treasure. An extra dose of excitement is afforded by the little pirates that challenge each other to guessing contests.

title: Railroad Big Party
description:
Aoste-Gare-de-lEst, December 31

While waking up (at about 8pm), Lulu and Dd decide to go to the party in the village hall of Saint-Andre-le-Gaz. They intend to get there before Nono and Kiki, who also go out only at 8pm because they were playing Playstation all the afternoon

The 4 characters go through the countryside, at feet or by train, trying to get to the village hall but on the way long, they may meet pals. Those never fail to invite our guys to drink a glass of beer, or to smoke weed. They never refuse an invitation (theyre no beasts).

Nevertheless, each one will be careful not to arrive too drunk at the festival in order to have a chance of getting chicks It would also be better to bring flowers but as all the florists are closed down at this time, it will be necessary to find some on the road.

title: Little Round Top
description:
Issued with The Wargamer Magazine #20.

Confederate attack by Hood on end of Union line at Gettysburg, 2nd July 1863.

Attractive map (with extra-large hexes) features Plum Run, Devil's Den, Big Round Top and Little Round Top.

Three historical scenarios (each with non-historical alternatives):

Devil's Den
Little Round Top
Hood's Assault

title: The Troll Family Game
types: Children's Game Fantasy Maze Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Children's game based on and containing the toy troll characters.  A simple dice rolling race to the finish.

This is has a double sided gameboard.The first side has the game THE GREAT TROLL NUT AND BERRY RACE GAME the other side has THE TROLL GATHERING GAME

THE GREAT TROLL NUT AND BERRY RACE GAME

Object of the game :Is to be the first troll to reach your cave having found all the right nuts and berries on the way.

THE TROLL GATHERING GAME

Object of the game : Is to be the first troll to reach the party island having gatheered four friends on the way

CONTENTS

4 Original DAM TROLLS
1 Double sided playing board
56 Playing cards
1 Dice
Instructions

title: Stack 'Em Up
description: A children's game played around a circular game board with plastic cones in four different colors.  The object is to move around the board according to the dice roll and capture all the other players' cones by landing on them and stacking them up.

title: Piss Artist
types: Action / Dexterity Deduction Mature / Adult Party Game
description:
A team game in the Pictionary line.  The rather rude drinking and drawing game Contains pencils, board, pads, pieces and 500 drawing suggestions A great adult party game Be careful you don't end up in rehab and have to miss a turn Suitable for 2 or more adult teams.

Manufacturer's Description:
As you move around the bottle, and land on one of the 6 different categories, they are Catchphrase, Entertainment, Object, Action, Dirty Draws and bite your tongue. Apart from Bite your Tongue, your sketching skills are put to the test, when you have to draw what is on the card and your teammates have to guess what it is before time runs out! To assist your teammates, the power of mime is allowed.

As you go around the board you may land on Team Drink and you and your teammates have to drink some of their favorite beverage or to make it a little more interesting down a shot! Beware you could be sent to Rehab not only does your team miss a go but alcohol is not to be consumed whilst in 'Rehab'.

The first team to make it to the Start/Finish space and correctly guesses the card, which the other team gets to choose, WINS!

title: Satan!
description:
The game comes with a flaming dice pin, which the players wear. When two players meet (recognizing the pin), the game begins when one of them declares Satan! Then both players roll three six-sided dice on the nearest convenient surface. Any die that doesn't come up 6 is rerolled. The first player to have all three dice showing sixes (6-6-6) and declare Satan! is the winner. If other players hear the initial call, they can declare Satan! and join the game. 
The game was sold as a joke at GenCon 2003, but turned into a minor hit. Prospective buyers weren't told the rules unless they bought the game, but at $5, it drew in many curious gamers.

title: Sigma Playing Cards
description:
Sigma is a new deck of playing cards. There are 52 total cards in the deck with 15 distinct types of cards. Each card has a geometric shape on it consisting of 6 squares that are either black or white. Shojiro Doi, the designer, is an amateur 7-dan Japanese Go player.

Three games have been create by the designer:

Escape (2 players) - A Cat and Mouse game where one player takes Black and the other White and they take turns adding cards (tile-placing style) to the current board. The Black player's goal is to enclose the White player, while the White player's goal is to remain free.

Six (2-4 players) - Each player starts with a quadrant of territory on a board and takes turns playing cards on to the board. Special rules reward players for making a quadrant into a single color or forming lines on the board. First player to play all of his/her cards wins.

Nine (2-6 players) - Sigma style poker where players bluff and bet that they can best match a pattern selected for each hand.

title: Melvin The Looney Gooney Bird Game
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Electronic
description: This is a children's dexterity game that features Melvin, an electronic plastic bird with a big open beak atop a long flexible neck. To begin, place Melvin on the floor in an open area. Each player takes a colored stick that matches the color of 5 worms. The 20 rubber worms are placed on the floor 5-10 feet away. Melvin is then turned on and he begins jumping, turning, and flapping his wings causing his neck and head to wobble around. The players then rush to pick up a worm using only their stick and then drop it into his mouth. The first player to feed him all 5 of his or her worms is the winner.

title: Memory Step by Step
description: This is a standard memory game with the added twist of having to make matches in a certain sequence. Each player takes a board that depicts two picture sequences, each telling a story. On your turn, you flip over a card so that all players may see it. If it matches the first picture for either story on your board, place it over the picture and then try to match the second etc. The first player to complete both story sequences on his or her board wins.

title: Memory Match & Move
description: Memory Match  Move combines the standard memory Game with the standard track game. To begin, the cards are shuffled and placed on the squares in the center of the board. Each space on the board track shows a picture (or color) matching 1 of the cards. There are also 4 color spaces in the corners where the players start, placing their color pawns on the matching color space. On your turn, you flip over a card so that all players can see it. If it matches the picture on the space in front of your pawn, you advance to that space and go again. If it doesn't match, your turn ends. The first player to go around the board and return to his or her starting color space wins.

title: Amazon.com Book-ology
description: Put out by Amazon.com, it is simple book trivia game.  You travel round the board, and get asked questions based on the space where you land.  There are five clues per question.  The first person gets 1 clue and a chance to answer.  If they don't the second player gets another clue and a chance as well, going around until someone gets the correct answer.  Since the reader does not participate in this process, the game is much better with more than 2 players.

title: Battles of the First Empire: Marengo
description: A Battalion-Squadron level simulation of Napoleon's hard fought victory at Marengo, 1800.

title: Purdueopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos ό (alone or single) + polein ῖ (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The Purdue University version of the classic game.

title: Battle for Paradise
types: Fantasy Modern Warfare Print & Play Territory Building Wargame
description:
Battle for Paradise is two games in one. The first is a strategic board game for two players. The goal is to capture and hold cities on a contested island paradise. Points are scored each turn for every city held. The winner is the first player to reach 100 points.

The second game uses the Budget Battlefield* tabletop gaming system from Microtactix Games. Battle for Paradise supplies statistics for all units in the boardgame, and stand-ups for all of the vehicles (use the stand-ups supplied with Budget Battlefield for Infantry). Why settle a battle with a die roll when you can play it out!

title: Memory Spin & Match
description: This memory game uses a plastic case covered with doors. A picture wheel is inserted into the case and is spun with a lever. On your turn, you open two of the doors and show the pictures revealed to all the players. If the two pictures match, you open two more doors and so on. If the pictures don't match, you close all the doors and pass the case to the next player. The first player that opens all the doors on a single turn wins.

title: Twelve Teepees Memory
description: In this game, players try to hide all 5 of their Indians under teepees. The Indian pawns are placed in the center of the board and surrounded by the teepees. On your turn, you look under 1, 2 or 3 teepees depending on the number you spun on a spinner. If a teepee is empty, you place one of your pawns beneath it. If a teepee is covering another player's Indian, you exchange it for one of yours and return the opponent's pawn to the middle of the board. The first player to cover all 5 of his or her Indians is the winner.

title: Fliegenfänger
description:
The gameboard represents a gully grid. A game about horse droppings and flies.

The circular game board is divided into six sectors of different color. Each sector has 15 empty fields (cobble stones). Every player selects one sector as his home turf. The aim of the game is to fill all fields of a single sector with tokens (flies) but keep your own sector clear. Players roll dice and move special tokens (horse droppings) to attract the flies into the sector of their opponents. The player whose home sector holds the fewest fly tokens at the end wins the game.

Flycatcher is a derivative of the game Circus Roncalli which was published by Schmidt in 1986.

Edition Spielbox No. 61

title: May I? Memory Game
description: In this memory game, you must ask permission from the other players to advance across the board. Each player takes 2 picture cards from the deck and places them face down on the table. The pictures on the cards (skateboard, hot dog etc.) show the spaces on the board owned by that player. On your turn, you begin advancing your pawn one space at a time along the track. You must get permission to enter a space owned by another player by saying May I and the name of the player that owns the space. If you do not ask permission, the owner says Stop!, reveals the picture card and turns it face down again. You say nothing on an unowned space. You may continue moving as long as you don't make a mistake, so as more and more cards are revealed, players can travel further and further along the track during a turn. The first player to reach the finish space wins. For a more challenging game, players may draw 3, 4 or 5 cards.

title: San Francisco: The Tour Game
description:
Roll and land on 31 different attractions in San Francisco
using our personal Trolley Car on a main board. See all the 31 attractions and be the first to return to the airport to win. Cards help and hurt your progress as you move on the board. Score cards for each player spell out I enjoyed everybody's favorite city as you uncover each attraction.

title: Ben-Hur Chariot Race Game
description: Racing game where the players bet on which chariot will be the first to make 4 laps on the Ben-Hur-the-movie-like-race-track.

title: World Cup Ski-ing '98
description: A single or multi-player simulation of Downhill ski-ing. Ratings for 40 male skiers from the 97/98 season and 27 ATG male skiers are included, and there are 22 course section cards to recreate any of the 31 courses rated in the game, of which only 7 or 8 of these cards are used for any one course.

title: Dinobones
description:
From the box:
The bones have been uncovered. Time to build the dinosaur. Race around board collecting bones to build the dinosaur puzzle. Every time you place a bone you receive a score equal to the total number of bones played. Hang on to your bones for a higher score, but in doing so you risk losing them to another player who is hot on your heels.

1 to 4 players represented by a dinosaur pawn. There are 14 bones spaces with matching bones and scoring markers from 1 to 14.

When it is your turn you roll a die and move in the direction your pawn is facing. Depending on the space you land you can take a different action.
- Find bone can pick up a bone on the space, At the beginning of the turn, can play a bone for the next number score marker. You do not have to play a bone you have, can keep for future play.
- Bonus space  can play a bone for the next number marked and pick up a bonus marker worth 5 points.
- Lose bone  replace on map in the matching space
- Go to any bone change direction 
- If you land on another players marker you may take one of his bones he has not played into the puzzle.

When all bones have been played sum all scoring and bonus markers for high score.

title: The Spanish Civil War
description:
A small wargame that covers the Spanish Civil War, 1936-1939.  It comes with an 8 page rulebook, map and counters.  It includes 7 different scenarios to reflect different combination of foreign intervention.

Revised as

     Viva España

title: Lamm Bada
types: Animals Card Game Children's Game Memory
description:
The box includes a 90-card deck and instructions for 3 different children games:
- Lammbada: A speed game (2-5 players, Ages 6 and up)
- Maeaehmory: A memory game (2-4 players, Ages 7 and up)
- Volle Wolle (Full Wool): (3-6 players, Ages 5 and up)

title: Hakodate 1869
description: A wargame on a battle of the Japanese civil war between those factions who wanted to keep Japan closed vs. the Meiji reformers.

title: Atlantis
description:
A game from the Pelikan bookcase series.

The game includes two map boards (beginning and advanced) and also includes a plastic divider.

The divider is similar to those used in navigation except this one is fixed and cannot be adjusted. The player places one of the points of the divider in the start hole. The divider is then rotated until a hole matching the radius of the divider is found. There are multiple hole at this radius. One of the holes is chosen and the other point of the divider is rotated until another hole is found and chosen. This continues alternating points of the divider until the goal is reached.

An interesting solo game that seems more like a puzzle. Re-playability is somewhat limited as there are only two different boards.

The game could be extended to multiple players by keeping track of the number of times that the divider points are placed in new holes. The player with the fewest number wins.

title: Battle of the Coral Sea
description: Japanese wargame on the Battle of the Coral Sea. Published by Tsukuda hobbies.

title: Malay Campaign
description:
Japanese wargame on the Malay Campaign 1942.
Two games of Malay Campaignand Capture of Singapore are contained. Both game have different rules.

title: Bingo Romano
description:
A Pelikan bookcase game from their Buchkassette series.

This is the basic bingo game played at many locations. Includes the Gioco Romano variant where only motives are called not the numbers.

title: Sun Tzu
description: Sun Zi, Japanese multi players game of Chinese Chunjiu Zhanguo era. Published by Epoch.

title: Cubical
description:
Cubical is a fast-paced die rolling racing game with a twist.

The goal of the game is to be the first to move three dice from one side of the board to the opposite overcoming walls and obstacles along the way.

Edition Spielbox No. 62

title: Seven Seas: The Game of Trade
mechanisms: Dice RollingPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and MoveTrading
description:
Players roll dice and move their ships from port to port around the world, buying and selling goods specific to each port. (Ex. Players can buy beef in Buenos Aires.)
