The mapboard is a map of the entire world and its oceans, with a square grid overlaying the oceans.  Most major ports are depicted.  Some have goods to be bought there, while others are simply destinations for goods.

Game comes with: gameboard, cargo manifests, play money,
pegs, ships, and dice.

Excellent educational game to learn geography.

title: Ombagi
description:
A 2-player abstract strategy game where the aim is to get your 12 pieces to the opposite side. They start and must finish in 4 stacks with a 'number 3' on top, a 'number 2' in the middle and a 'number 1' on the bottom (numbers are embossed on the pieces). The numbers determine the steps each piece must move and also indicate the highest level they may climb to and move at on top of other pieces.
Also comes with 4 other variants.
Chunky wooden pieces and a gold-printed imitation-leather board add a touch of class to this Frankh/Edition Perlhuhn production.

title: Blank Expression
description:
Ages 12 and up


     of PLAYERS: 2-4 players or teams


OBJECT OF THE GAME:
Players accumulate points by filling in the missing word or words in quotes or by identifying the famous people the quotes are by or about.

EQUIPMENT:
The game includes a card holder, 64 two-sided game cards, two card screens, seven scoring pegs, and a minute timer.

TYPES of QUOTES:
There are three types of quotes in the game--
1) quotes in which one or more words have been replaced by [BLANK];
2) quotes about a person to be identified, which have the nouns or pronouns referring to that person underlined;
3) quotes by a person who must be identified

RULES OF PLAY:
Each game card has three categories of quotes. (EX. History, Author, Movers and Shakers) A player (or team) slides down game screen to reveal one quote in one category. All players can hear and see the quote. The current player can make a guess as to the answer, scoring points if correct, and losing points if incorrect.  The player can also pass.  If the player passes or is incorrect, play passes on clockwise to the next player.

OTHER NOTES:
The gamebox says that this stand-alone game is a sequel to 'Quote, Unquote', chosen 'Best New Trivia Game' by GAMES magazine, 1994.

title: Dolly and Daniel Whale Game
description:
Package description:
Dolly  Daniel, the two frisky little whales, usually play with the Eskimos on the icebergs of the Arctic Ocean. However, once every year, they travel to the Antarctic to visit their friends, the penguins. As they move along, they meet some friendly spouting whales, who help them. They also encounter some polar bears, who delay them, and 'the' angry angler who sends them back. 
The girl players are Dolly whales and the boys are Danny whales. 
The object of the game is to be the first whale to reach the Antarctic.

title: Legion
description:
Wargame Rules for Ancient Battles on the Grand Tactical Scale

Players write down their moves and then move simultaneously.

title: Luise und die wilden Ziegen
description:
Louise and the Wild Goats (Luise und die wilden Ziegen) is a tactical die-rolling game.

The goal of the game is to drive your goats from the pasture into the barn making effective use of guard dog Louise. The way and number of spaces Louise moves on the board depends on the die roll. If you roll a 2, for example, Louise may jump over one or two goats Halma style. If Louise ends up on a space occupied by a goat, the goat moves one space straight on. The 12 barn spaces are worth victory points from 1 to 3. The game ends when the barn is fully filled with goats. The player with the most victory points wins the game.

Edition Spielbox No. 63

title: Party Scrabble
description: PARTY SCRABBLE The classic word game has a contemporary new theme with a timing feature! Score points by placing words on the playing board. But this is not ordinary Scrabble. Play in teams with special dice. Once the timer starts, it's time to scramble! The faster you play, the more your score. Delay and your team is penalized. The team with the highest score wins! For two or more teams. Ages 10 and over.

title: Kreuzweise
description:
From a translation of the rules:

Kreuzweise was designed to play at home or when away. It is compact and the optimized material chosen for the high quality playing cards is thin, flexible and easy to clean. Where ever you play Kreuzweise, enjoy!

Basically, it's a tile-laying puzzle game where points are scored based upon the number of matching edges.

title: The Antique Auction Game
description:
Players take the roles of antique dealers bidding for items at auction.  At the start of the game each player secretly selects eight items, represented by nicely illustrated cards, of the sixteen different antiques available (the deck includes three of each type) recording these on a score pad.  Each item is likely to have a different value, representing the resale value for each player.  The object therefore is to purchase as many of the selected items as possible for less than the resale price.

Players take it in turns to auction the cards.  The progress of each auction is unusual in being determined by die rolls. The auctioneer rolls a die to establish the reserve. The next player in rotation can either roll again, the value shown being added to the reserve price or drop out.  This continues until only one player remains in the bidding. The cost of the item is then the sum of all the die rolls!

Items other than the eight may be purchased but  at the game end they will represent a loss there is no resale value) and at any point a player may offer an item or items for sale at a price to be negotiated.
The game continues until one player has accumulated his or her
portfolio of eight items, the game ends immediately and all players calculate their profits.

The largest profit wins.

title: Permission
description: 'The New Property Development Board Game': in contrast to Monopoly presumably. Play comprises two stages.  In stage one players travel around a a perimeter track, 'the inner ring road' on the roll of two dice, collect income on one corner and pay taxes on another.  Each space represents a parking space.  These give either an option to purchase either property  or pick up a card and follow the instructions on it. The object is to collect a complete site made up of ten back-land plots together with a drainage easement.  When a player has achieved this, movement moves to the outer (ring road?) track that is meant to represent the process of obtaining Planning Approval for the development. This is achieved by firstly collecting cards giving recommendations for approval from three separate local authority departments and then being the first to land on the town hall space: yes, on the roll of the dice and, yes, doubles mean another go!

title: Front Line
description:
Front line by Bandai
This is a man to man level tactical combat in WW2.
Some gamers ranks this game high, especially when the details of weapon is concerned.
Another feature is there are self adhesive terrain stickers are included.
They stick to the mapboard (hard board) and are easily pealed off so they  are re-usable.
This game has companion game called Shin-ei-tai, which means the Guards or SS.

title: Strategy & Tactics
description:
This is a Japanese hypothetical setting game,  based on a WW2 level   weapon system.
This game is intended to be an introductory game for newcomers.

title: Panzer Korps
description:
This game portrays the three battles of:
El Alamein, Dunkirk and 3rd Kharkov.

Simple I-go, You-go system makes this a complete beer  pretzel package.

System and El Alamein designed by Yukihiro Kuroda.
Dunkirk designed by Masaharu Nakano.
Kharkov designed by Hiroyuki Okuyama.

COMPONENTS (Epoch edition)

     1 rulebook
     4 map board (1 for El Alamein, 1 for Dunkerque, 2 for Khar'kov) 
     1 counter sheets
     1 counter tray
     2 six side dice




COMPONENTS (Japan Wargame Classics edition)

     4 rulebooks (4 pages each)
     4 map sheets
     1 counter sheet
     1 primer guidebook (32 pages)






Operation Compass only included in Japan Wargame Classics edition.

title: Spots
description:
Spots is a card game in which two or more players will make change from a pool of cards.  Scoring is handicapped based on the difference between the total of a player's starting cards and the lowest total of the opponent's starting cards.

Players put one card from their hand into the pool, taking cards with a total value equal to or greater into their score pile.  The player with the lowest score after all cards have been played wins.

Spots was designed to be a card-based version of Pennywise.  It was first published in the Origins 2000 preregistration book.

title: Moscow Blitzkrieg
description:
This is a Japanese game on Operation Barbarossa.

This game won the 1st prize in the design competition presented by Sho-Kikaku.

title: Japanese Task Force
description:
Operational level wargame for carrier warfare in WW2 Pacific theater. It covers from raid on Pearl Harbor to Battle of the Eastern Solomons, also include two fictional battles.

Players will control either carrier task force of Imperial Japanese Navy or United States Navy. Players manage fleet organization, fleet movement, search for the enemy and aircraft operations. Search system use the dummy counter and the information chit.

Winner determined by victory point based on damage given to opponent ships. Also earn VP from achieve or prevent certain strategic objective.

Scenario
1. Attack on Pearl Harbor (Dec 7, 1941) Solo
2. Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse (Dec 10, 1941) Solo
3. Battle of the Java Sea (Feb 27, 1942) Solo
4. Carrier vs. Carrier (Fictional)
5. Battle of the Coral Sea (May 7-8, 1942)
6. Battle of Midway (Jun 4, 1942)
7.　Battle of the Eastern Solomons (Aug 24-25, 1942)
8. General Fleet vs. Pacific Fleet (Fictional)
9. Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands　(Oct 25-27, 1942) 2nd and 3rd Ed. only
10. Campaign of Solomons (1942) 2nd Ed. only
11. Indian Ocean raid (Apr 5-9, 1942) Command Magazine Japanese #15 and 3rd Ed.
12. Assault on Solomons (1942) Command Magazine Japanese #15

title: Cuban Revolution
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
The Cuban Revolution depicts the critical area and time in the Guerrilla war fought between the colonial government of Fulgencio Batista and the Guerrillas led by charismatic individuals like Fidel Castro and Ernesto Che Guevara. Beginning in February, 1958 Castro began the first Guerrilla offensive by coming out of the Sierra Maesta Mountains and attacking the Bastiano troops in the plains. The Bastiano army counterattacked driving the Guerrillas back into the mountains beginning in June 1958. When the Bastiano army attempted to destroy the guerrillas, the Bastiano army was all but destroyed itself. With all the newly acquired weapons, the guerrillas launched a final offensive that ended in the only major battle of the war at the town of Santa Clara. The defeat of the Bastiano western forces caused the rest of the army to begin deserting. When Batista fled in January 1959, the guerrillas triumphantly declared the island was finally free. The improbable victory of the Guerrillas resulted in the only communist country in the Western Hemisphere.

The Cuban Revolution uses area movement and a simple and easy-to-learn combat system. Learning the game takes minutes and about 1-2 hours of playing time at most.

title: Deguello at Dawn
description:
In the early morning hours of March 6, 1836, after a thirteen-day siege, the besieging Mexican army surrounding San Antonio, Texas, launched a surprise attack upon the presidio of the Alamo, which was defended by U.S., Texan and Tejano volunteer militia units. The cheering Mexican soldiers, along with the accompanying bugle call of the Deguello, soon betrayed the surprise attack. Within an hour and a half, the entire garrison of 182 to 225 volunteers had been put to the sword, and General Santa Anna had won his victory at the cost of some 311 of his brave officers and soldiers. Even more, he created an American myth that began with the Deguello at Dawn

Dennis Bishop uses area movement, facing, ranged fire and melee combat to recreate this famous event in American History. Leaders play a big role in the game and rules for Col. James Bowie to determine if he's healthy and able to take part in the battle.

A unique twist on casualties is also used as the game has a large map (17 x 22) and uses over 400 double sided unit counters (some that are 1 x ) as well as about 8-10 pages of rules and various game player aids.

Deguello at Dawn was a nominee in the Charles S. Roberts awards for Best DTP-Produced Boardgame (Charles S. Roberts Awards) for 2005.

title: The Battle of Tanga 1914
description: The Battle of Tanga was the first major movement by Britain during World War 1 against the German East Africa colony. A diverse mix of colonial troops from India took part in the landings. Plagued with numerous problems, the British pressed on against the outnumbered German Schutztruppe and their Askari soldiers.

title: Rattle Battle
description: The object of the game is to catch marbles through holes in a vertical maze as the marbles fall from top to bottom.

title: Space Race Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Science Fiction Space Exploration
description:
Space Race is a simple card game designed for two players, though more can play with additional card sets (as there is no player interaction whatsoever).

The object of the game is to complete a round trip through the Solar System by drawing ten planet cards in their proper order. (The order will be unfamiliar, though, as it goes Earth - Saturn - Jupiter - Mars - Uranus - Neptune - Venus - Mercury - Earth). Each card features well executed art done in a style similar to golden age science fiction pulp magazines.

The game consists of two identical decks with cards numbered 1-10. These cards represent round trips the the Solar System, starting with Take Off (Card 1) and ending with Landing On Earth (Card 10). Players take a deck and shuffle it, then place it before them. The first player draws a card. If it is Take Off (Card 1), they place it in front of them and draw the next card. If the next card is a planet but not Card 2, they discard it in a discard pile next to their original pile and draw again, until they draw a card that says Next player goes. The next player takes a turn, and draws until they get a Next player goes card. Chance cards such as lost on the moon, Sputnik, and Danger--Comets can affect a player's turn.

Players may draw from either pile, so there is a memory element, as you must remember which pile your next planetary target was in.

All cards must be discarded in the pile next to the pile from which they were drawn.

The goal is to collect all 10 cards, in sequence.

Rules list a variant for three or more players through using multiple copies of the game.

title: Medabots Trading Card Game
types: Card Game Collectible Components Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: The Medabots Trading Card Game, based on the children's television cartoon of the same name, allows two players to compete by placing Medabots on a Battle Sheet and fighting it out.  Whenever a Medabot is destroyed, players pay a cost in Hit Points. The player who causes his opponent to lose all his HP is the winner.

title: Rainbow Fish and the Big Blue Whale Game
Mickey Bingo
types: Animals Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description: This is a children's bingo game with a Mickey Mouse Theme. Each player receives a bingo card with a 5x5 grid of Disney characters with different colored backdrops. A spinner is used to call spaces. The outer circle of the spinner shows the various characters while the inner circle shows colors (5 per character). For example: If the spinner arrow points to the color blue and Donald Duck's face, Blue Donald Duck is called out. Any player with a Blue Donald picture on their card would cover it with a chip. The first player to cover 5 characters in a row with chips wins.

title: Duel Master 4: Arena of Death
description:
Similar in some regards to the Ace of Aces book series, Duel Master takes 2 players, each with their own book, into competition with one another. Play is paragraph based, with each player making their own choices about what they want their character to do.

In the Arena of Death the players take the roles of gladiators in the arena in the city Mortavalon.

title: Het Grote DE Koffiespel
description:
Game given by Dutch coffee company Douwe Egberts to customers which had collected a lot of coupons found on their products.

Theme of the game is coffee (really!); you are a coffee seller buying raw harvested beans and rights for different production phases (blending, roasting, packaging and distribution) to optimize the profit from selling your coffee. You can trade coffee and rights with other players.

One can also buy stock in one of the production plants (squares on the board); when you land on that square you get the rights for free, when others land on it they buy rights from you instead of the bank.

It resembles Monopoly (though it is different enough not to be called a clone) and has a similar limited-but-existing possibility for using strategy.

title: The Simpsons 2 Trivia Game
description:
This is basically the same as the first Simpsons Trivia Game, but with different questions.  The game contains purple and green (!) cards with trivia questions as well as the same character die and poster as the first game.

This version also has different character card games: Who's Who in Springfield, Whose Wise Remark is That, and The Answer is a Question.  A sheet of quotes from various characters is included for the second game.

title: Surrounding Nobunaga
description: A Japanese wargame on an important campaign in Nobunaga's history.

title: Trafficking
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRole PlayingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
From the new Trafficking web site:

TRAFFICKING is a role-playing board game that spoofs the cannabis trade. The game features eight dealers - Reefer T. Johnstone III, Janet Planet, Zerox Roachoid, Sonny Sgurd, Stephie Honey Oil Slick, Biff Spliff, D.J. Stoner and Fast Eddie Toke c pitted against a dedicated, hard-nosed Narcotics Officer, Lieutenant Dick Gumshoe. The object of the game for the dealers is to become the Traffic King, that is to be the first dealer to sell a kilo of marijuana (36 ounces or lids) before being BUSTED by the Narc. Should the Narc succeed in busting all the dealers before any sells a kilo, the Narc wins the game.

This classic was originally released in 1983 but is now back to get another generation of gamers high on fun!

title: Springprozession
description: A race with dice. To get your die into the race roll it. Place it on the matching position. Move a die as many spaces as the die shows. If you move over another die it will change its number. First player to reach the finish line wins.

title: Heiter bis Wolkig
description: Move your pawns over clouds to win a race.

title: EastEnders
description:
This game is based upon the popular BBC television soap.

From the box:
The characters down in Albert Square have seized the imagination of the country and here's your chance to share in the ups and downs of their lives by taking on the part of one of the residents of TV's most famous square.

The goal of the game is to obtain the money to buy two rings, and then reach their character's objective space. Each character also has certain spaces to avoid as they move around the board. Some spaces allow the character to wager money on the dice. There are other spaces which allow all of the players to vote on how a character would respond to a dilemma given on a card.

title: Call It
description:
(From the game box)

The exciting game of instant decisions... Decide what your strategy will be... Make the call, throw the special dice and hope they roll your way. That's Call It!

Predict your dice throw and CALL IT, in this wild race game. You can Advance yourself, Setback your opponents, or do both if you CALL IT right. With the right calls, you'll be the first to reach the Finish Line. SO get ready, get set, and CALL IT!

title: Measles
description:
Measles, the ultimate stacking games, combines the elements of balance, coordination and luck with strategy of attempting to outscore an opponent, or gain a scoring advantage of at least five points.

Game components include 1 base tile and 29 wooden playing tiles.  Each playing tile has a pattern of red spots (measles) on its surface. Every measle is scored as one spotpoint following completion of a round of play.

Each of the 29 playing pieces also has 3 randomly drilled holes in it. This gives every playing tile a unique weight and balance.
...from the rules

title: NBA Interactive TV Card Game
description: This card game is intended to be played while watching a televised basketball contest. Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards, each with a basketball event such as slam dunk, blocked shot, free throw, and rebound.  When a player has a card that matches the event that just occurred on the televised game, they must be the first to play it, thereby scoring the points on the card for that event (the rarer the event the more points). When a player plays all seven of their cards, he gets a seven point bonus, everyone tallies their scores and a new hand is dealt. Play continues until the end of the game and the player with the most points from completed rounds is the winner.

title: The Birthday Game
description: This is a party game for 4 or more players. The person whose birthday it is fills out a special bio questionnaire. Teams move around the board performing silly tasks and answering silly questions to advance. The first team to reach the Birthday Cake space gets a chance to answer the bio questions. The team that answers the most questions correctly wins.

title: Great Day in the Park Game
description: This is a Candyland type track game with a Raggedy Ann  Andy theme. The board depicts a park with a trail winding through it. On your turn, you draw a card and advance to the next space whose color matches that on the card. If you draw a picture, you move to the space on the board that has the matching picture. If you land on a puddle space, you lose a turn. The first player to reach the balloon space at the end of the track wins.

title: Group Loop
description:
This game was designed to be a stand-up version of Twister;

Players have to perform various actions without falling, while intertwined in a long stretchy cord.

title: Tip of the Tongue
description:
From the publisher:
The Tongue-Tied game of 2-Second Trivia! Take turns answering quick-recall trivia questions and receive a point for each correct answer. The questions are not hard, but it can be a challenge to spit out the answer in the 2-Second time limit. Be the player with the most points and you win the game! The unique game case holds the cards during game play and has a built-in 2-second timer (in the shape of a tongue). Includes over 1000 trivia questions, timer, and holding case.

title: Perchance
description:
This Canadian offering is a hybrid of card lottery and poker, played with a large scoring board and nine differently-colored decks of cards (one for each player, plus a dealer deck).

The games is played in rounds, where the dealer plays a number of cards face-up, and one face-down. Players decide whether the round will be lottery-style (person with the most matches to the dealer's hand wins), or poker-style (bidding on your hand plus cards from the dealer's hand).

As an added bonus, the game promises to (and I quote from the box): ...help you and your friends lighten and brighten gloomy days, warm up cold ones and cool off hot ones.

title: Road Scholar
description:
A roll  move game to teach Spanish.  Ages 8 and up.

From the back of the game box:  Pack up your knowledge, memory, and luck and get ready to roll on a Road Scholar Spanish journey.  From the START at the airport to the END at the Ancient Ruins, you'll have great fun learning an amazing amount of Spanish as you navigate the perilous twists and turns of the road.

Components:  game board, English instructions, 300 word and phrase cards, Two 60-minute audio cassettes, playing pieces, colored die.

Game instructions are provided in English.

Publisher's web site:  http://www.pentonoverseas.com/road-scholar.htm

title: Passt Genau
description:
A look-carefully game about abstract and spatial thinking.

The cars are parked hither and yon all across the parking lot - but illegally-parked vehicles get towed immediately! But which cards are parked incorrectly? The players need a keen eye to help out Petra the meter maid.

title: Drake
description: There is a gadget that slides discs of differing size down one side, simulating a waterfall.  On the discs are cubes of different colors which represent different points.  If you cause these cubes to fall off during your turn, they will belong to the player before you.  So this is a mix of dexterity and push your luck game.

title: Mickey Mouse Club Game
description: This is a Cootie type game in which players try to assemble one of the Mickey Mouse Club characters. On your turn you spin a spinner to see what body parts you may add. The characters MUST be assembled in an upright position, so the legs must be added first, then the body, and lastly the arms and head. The first player to complete a character wins.

title: Wie Waldi
description: In Oliver Igelhaut's Wie Waldi, the object of the game is to find blankets that match the various dachshunds. But since all of the dogs look like Waldi, it's easy to lose track of which blanket belongs to which dog. An action-packed card-laying game.

title: Mickey Pop-Along Shape Games
types: Children's Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This children's pizza game, with a Mickey Mouse theme, is actually 4 games-in-one. In the first game, you pop the popper die and find the pizza that matches the shape popped. You deliver the pizza to the character whose hands are shown on the card. The player who delivers the last pizza wins. Game #2 is a memory game. You pop the popper and turn over a pizza card. If it matches the shape and color of the pizza you popped, you take the character card that ordered that pizza. The player with the most character cards at the end wins. Game #3 is a typical memory game where players try to get the most matching pairs. Game #4 is an advanced version of Game #1.

title: James Rizzi
description:
One year after releasing the highly-regarded game and art object Die HolzerSiebeN by Friedensreich Hundertwasser, Kosmos is releasing another art game, this time with James Rizzi - albeit in a much lower price category.

The game idea, invented by Reiner Knizia, is very simple but tense. The 28 large Rizzi art cards have values between 0 and 6; each of the two players receives twelve. On a player's turn, they must discard a card from their hand. To discard, a player must either create a new discard pile or place the card on an existing discard pile - but in that case, the value of the card must be exactly one higher than the card onto which it is to be placed. If there are already three discard piles on the table, then a player has no choice but to discard to one of the piles. If he can't, then he has lost the round and receives as many glass beads as cards left in his hand. The first player to get six glass beads is the loser.

James Rizzi is part of the Kosmos two-player series.

As of 2006 -- It appears that this game may never have been published.

title: Pizza-Flitzer
description: Pizzas seem to be popular with Kosmos these days. In addition to the 'Pizza of Catan' (a promotional tie-in with a Geman pizza company), they are publishing a game called Pizza Flitzer (Pizza Speeders) by Gordon MacLeod. Paul and Paula are the fastest pizza deliverers around. Their good reputation is influenced by the fact that pizzas occasionally slip out of their hands. Clumsiness? Nope! Paul and Paula can simply only deliver pizzas that they are magnetically attracted to. Pizzas of the wrong pole rebuff Paul and Paula. The two of them need a little help. Someone will surely remember which pizzas the two of them should be delivering. The game includes a round wooden game board that looks like a pizza with an arrow spinner in the middle, nine magnetic pizza pieces and two magnetic figures. The two figures, Paul and Paula, have different poles (positive and negative) to ensure that they are never attracted to the same pizza. The spinner determines which figure a player, on their turn, may hold over a pizza piece. If they choose correctly, the pizza, with a click, fastens itself to the figure. The winner is the player who owns three pizza pieces first.

title: Mickey The Balancing Baker
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This game features a Mickey Mouse dressed like a baker. He stands on a wobbly base and holds an empty tray in each hand. All players take an equal number of pie pieces from the supply. On your turn, you place one of your pies on either of Mickey's trays. If you place it without having it, or any other pie already on the tray(s) fall off, your turn is over. If the pie falls, or knocks off any of the pies already on Mickey's trays, you must take the fallen pies and add them to your supply. The first player to get rid of all of his or her pies wins.

title: Xabungle: Walker Gallia
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the anime world of Xabungle.

This is a ground combat game in Zola.

title: Iga versus Koga
description:
This is a tactical ninja wargame based on the struggles between Iga and Koga clans in Japan.

Published by Bandai.

This game is an area type game.
However, Storm Over Arnhem is different systems.


    Setup
        Decide Ninja's ability
            Ninja's ability (eight abilities) is decided(Movement,Detection,Magic ability,Combat Rating,Quickness,Physical strength,recovery power,Ninjyutu).
            It gives a name at the end. 
        
        Appearance unit
            Ninja and Samirai;Casket;
            The ninja turns inside out at the time of initial arrangement and arranges it. 
            The back is disguised as the samurai. 
        
    



    System
        Sequence of Play
    


1.First Player:First movement Phase
2.First Player:Combat Phase
3.First Player:Second movement Phase
4.Second Player:First movement Phase
5.Second Player:Combat Phase
6.Recovery Pahse:Both Player

        Basis of movement
            It is not possible to move diagonally though a length movement or a horizontal movement can be done because it is an area type movement. 
            The movement can be moved the below the floor level and back of the ceiling.

title: East West
description:
TWO CIVIL WAR BATTLES: VALVERDE  OLUSTEE

Tactical scale: 75 yards/hex, 100-125 men/unit

DTP format with unmounted color counters and color map

title: Panzer Grenadier
description:
This is a Japanese tactical level game on the battles of the 1944 Western Front during World War 2.
Platoon level game of tactical battles.

Eleven scenarios from June 1944 to December 1944 from Normandy to the Bulge.

Tank types of the German, British and US armies are there.

title: Operation Winter Storm
description:
SGB-20 Op. Winter Storm (1986) (JPY 5,800) One mapsheet, 504 counters, two identical PACs, one 24-pg rule/scenario booklet (3 scenarios), and one Historical Softbound book entitled Photographic Series of the East Front-Operation Winter Storm (72-pg) (JPY 1,800). The historical softbound appears to have been available separately, but I have three copies of this game and they both came with this item.

Unit scales are infantry divisions, armored brigades/regiments and Soviet Mechanized Corps. Losses are handled by steps with extra Kampfgruppen for the Germans. The map stretches from Rostov-na-Donau to Stalingrad and from Kotelnikovo to north of Millerovo. Each turn is four days and covers Nov. 19th thru Jan. 21st. Supply is tracked by point for individual armies.

title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers Game
types: Children's Game Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: In this game, players assume the roles of Power Rangers on a 3-D gameboard. First, you must roll at least a 5 to turn into a Ranger. Then, you must defeat the Putty patrols on your path by rolling a number higher than the patrol's strength. Power Chips may be used to increase your die roll. Once all the Putties are defeated, you roll two dice to battle the Space Alien on your path. For the final battle, you roll three dice to attack King Sphinx. If all players have defeated all the Space Aliens, a Megazord is built allowing players to roll four dice in the final battle. The first player to defeat King Sphinx wins.

title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers Audio Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This is actually 2 games that use an audio cassette to direct the game play. Game #2 (Side B on the tape) is a more complex version of Game #1 (Side A on the tape). To start each player takes a board that depicts all 5 Teen Heroes. The tape will tell you when to draw cards and when to battle. The object is to cover your Heroes with their Power Ranger counterpart cards. A Rita Repulsa card may be played on an opponent to make him or her lose a turn. A Putty card is immediately discarded (thus wasting a draw). A Space Alien card may be placed on an opponents Power Ranger card forcing that player to play another Ranger card on that space. A Megazord card defeats a Space Alien and/or prevents further attacks on that space. The first player to morph all the Teen Heroes on his or her game board into the corresponding Power Rangers wins.

title: Zankobst
description:
From the publisher:

Four angry families quarrel in the labyrinth-like garden about the fruit. The fathers send their sons to collect the fruit while they try to steal it from the other's sons. The maze changes with every turn and if you don't pay attention, you'll get nothing home at the end.

title: Bauwerk
description:
From the publisher's website:

You try to build bridges on your construction-site. This results in real chaos and soon the first parts will be falling to the ground. Try to keep your eye on your strategy to get the highest score. Limited edition of 150 pieces, numbered and signed by the author.

Each player gets four little plots on the back of the game-box. Depending on the number of empty plots, a player gets material at the beginning of his turn. Now he can use this material to build connections between his plots. There are different building-styles which are more or less difficult and therefore result in more or less points. A player can also use the already built parts of the other player, which is easier and therefore results in less points. If you manage to build very complicated connections, you'll get more points. After a while, the board will be full of chaotically arranged bridges. If something falls, you'll get penalty, so be careful! Once all plots are connected, the game is over and if you didn't plan carefully you again get a penalty.

title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers War of the Zords
types: Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This game, featuring a Power Rangers theme, is similar to the card game War with a few added twists. The deck is dealt out face down evenly among the players. Cards depict Power Rangers, bad guys, or puzzle pieces. Each player simultaneously turns over their top card and the player with the highest value card wins them all. If there's a tie, the tying players continue turning over cards one at a time until someone turns over a higher value card. The player that wins the trick takes all point cards and places them in a separate pile (to be counted up later). Then the winner collects all puzzle cards and puts them in the center of the table either starting or adding to a puzzle. There are 2 six-piece puzzles: one depicting a Megazord, and one depicting Rita Repulsa. The game ends when either puzzle is completed. If the Megazord puzzle is completed, the point values on Power Ranger cards are added up. If the Rita Repulsa puzzle is completed, the point values on bad guy cards are added up. The player with the most points is the winner.

title: Reise durch die Schweiz
description:
The game is a round trip through Switzerland, departing from and returning to Zrich.  Distance is determined by die roll and there are no branches in the route, the only option being to choose to travel clockwise or counter-clockwise.  Each player has six place cards, and if he or she stops at a place owned by another must pay that person one chip or miss a turn.  The winner is the player with the highest total of chips plus bonus points gained by early completion of the journey.

Publication date is not specified but is probably early 1960s.  The box cites both Franz Carl Weber/Jouets Weber (Swiss toy company and chain of shops) and Otto Maier Verlag (later Ravensburger: the box is printed Ravensburger Spiele Nr. 23).  Otto Maier published a different game of the same name in 1891.

title: The Stars Our Decimation: Voidstriker
description:
The Stars Our Decimation is the name for a series of interrelated science fiction wargames built around the actions mechanic. TSOD games all feature hand-built rules, hex grid regulated movement, a unique actions system, and versatile unit design rules.

Voidstriker is one of the games in the series.  It is a fleet-oriented game of starship combat. Ships and fighters battle in deep space and in the gravity wells of important worlds. The rules feature unique, playable vector movement with gravity effects around planets, versatile ship design rules, quick and detailed combat resolution, and easy adaptation to use of miniatures or starship models.

Ground Zero is another game in the series.  It is a tactical ground combat game, best suited to running company-level combats. Rules are based strongly on Voidstriker, so if you know one, you'll have a pretty good handle on the other.

title: Dodl Schach
description:
Board (6x4)
Players should agree whether they play with rows of size 6 and columns of size 4, or with rows of size 4 and columns of size 6.

Rules
Players each have the following pieces: one king, one queen, and two pawns. They may setup their pieces as they want on the first rank of their side of the board.

It's probably better if players alternately setup one of their pieces, with the kings deployed last. Using a screen in the middle of the board behind which the pieces can be set up secretly may also be an idea, but poses both practical difficulties.

King and Queen move as in orthodox chess.

Pawns have the usual moves of chess, but may also move diagonally.

title: Star Wars Electronic Battle Command Game
types: Electronic Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Star Wars Electronic Battle Command Game was a space exploration game that you could play by yourself or against 3 other players.  The screen was an LED grid which showed coordinates.  You could 'zoom' in on a coordinate to get a closer look at a star system, or come across other player's ships.

Quotes from the box:

A game that brings you the space battles of Star Wars with three levels of play...
A self-contained Micro Computer Game which allows you to simulate all the exciting action and strategy of Hyperspace combat.
Display panel which shows you your location in Hyperspace along with planets and enemies.
You can choose to take evasive maneuvers from your enemy, go to battle stations or screen up for invisibility.

From the rulebook:

Star Wars Electronic Battle Command Game is probably the most exciting computer game you will ever play!

title: ATS Briefing Issue 1
description: Issue one of the ATS Briefing magazine, containing a standalone ATS basic game.  1940 Airborne Assault at the Albert Canal, featuring Germans vs Belgians, 2 counter sheets, six scenarios, mapsheet, v1.5 of the ATS Basic rules.  Also contains two scenarios for Scottish Corridor.

title: Stock Rush! A Week on Wall Street
mechanisms: Commodity SpeculationRoll / Spin and MoveSimulationStock HoldingTrading
description:
BRIEF SUMMARY:

Stock Rush is a Strategy Board Game that uses an Interactive Device called the Market Display.  PLAYERS WATCH THEIR STOCKS FALL, RISE, CRASH and SKYROCKET . . . RIGHT BEFORE THEIR EYES! For added excitement, players also Mine for Gold and participate in a Gold Rush!  The Game Play in Stock Rush is so unique and diverse that it spans many game categories including: Strategy, Family, Party, Simulation, Educational, Action and Adventure!
  
For 2 to 10 Players, Ages 8 and up.

DETAILED SUMMARY:

Game play begins on The Opening Bell space and a peg is used to keep track of the trading day.  Players can play a regular game and spend a full business week on Wall Street [Mon-Fri] or they can play a shorter game by starting on Wednesday.  The game usually ends when the trading day peg reaches Game Over which is the slot after Friday.  Other ways the game can end are: Market Collapse in which all companies go bankrupt; One player left in the game after all the other players go bankrupt and All players are trapped in a Cave In.  At the end of the game, all players liquidate [sell] their holdings to the bank and the player with the most cash wins the game.

STOCKS . . .

Players buy and sell [Trade] stocks at the current market price shown by the Market Display [4 Stocks comprise the market in the game, A,B,C and D]. The stock prices are affected by news and rumors that randomly occur throughout the course of the game. There are two types of news and rumors that occur: Market News and Rumors affect the entire market; and Company News and Rumors which only affect a given individual company. Although rumors occur at random; how long they remain alive can be strategically predicted. The longer a rumor remains alive the higher the chance it will be confirmed or dispelled on the next turn. Consequently, players must trade accordingly; they must decide on 4 Criteria: [1] Buy or Sell?; [2]Which Stock to Trade?; [3] How many Shares to Trade?; and most importantly [4] When to Trade?.

COMMODITIES [MAINLY GOLD] . . .

The Stock Rush name was inspired by the California Gold Rush of 1849. As a result, a significant portion of the game is dedicated to that historical event. Players randomly mine for Gold and participate in many Gold Rushes throughout the game. During a Gold Rush players may become trapped in a Cave In.  Trapped players may escape on their own or be rescued by other players.  
Once players accumulate Gold they may strategically sell any amount they wish on the Gold Exchange Market. They must sell according to 3 Criteria:
[1] How much Gold to Sell? [2] At What Price to Sell? [3] When to Sell?  The other commodities in the game are Groceries, Toys, Clothes and Gearthe STUFF we use in our everyday life.

title: Casdon Football
description: Hands on soccer much like the bubble hockey games of today where two players face off in a match of dexterity and control while moving the soccer ball down the field.

title: Mighty Mouse Game
description:
This is a simple track game based on the Mighty Mouse comics. On your turn you roll the die and advance the number of spaces indicated. If your roll would land you on an opponent's pawn, you move backwards instead. If you land on a hazard space, you are stuck, and must spend your next turn(s) moving the Mighty Mouse piece to your space. When Mighty Mouse reaches your space, he releases you and any other player caught in a hazard. The first player to reach the Finish space by exact count wins. If your roll would take you past Finish, you move backwards instead.

This is seemingly a different game from Terrytoons Mighty Mouse Game

title: Hunting In The Wilds
description: Roll and move board game involving Wildlife Hunting. Very attractive board with three revolving sections. Nice period colors on the box illustration. Game includes cards representing animals and tokens representing the hunters

title: Roll-A-Goal
description: A soccer game where you decide every turn to move, pass or shoot on a large checkerboard pitch. You take your team of 9 players and move them around the board in order to defend your goal or to take the ball to your opponents goal and score.

title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
Milk & Cookies
description: This children's memory game features an electronic plastic cow and 4 milk glasses. On your turn, you take a cookie from the cookie jar and dunk it into one of the glasses. If you hear a Boing!, the glass is empty so put the cookie back. If you hear a Mmmooo, you found the milk that goes with that cookie - keep it and put it on your plate (the Mmmooo moves to another glass). If you hear a Mmmooo and the cowbell, you may trade plates with another player. The player with the most cookies on his or her plate when the cookie jar is empty is the winner.

title: Stockbroker
description:
Rare board game set around buying and selling stocks and shares determined by advantage and dis-advantage squares on the playing board, the game is for 3 to 7 players.

Each player takes the part of a broker and is dealt stock cards and money to start the game. Play moves around the board on the throw of the dice.

Do you sell shares or buy shares? You could go for oil, gold, rubber etc.. Wheel and deal is the order of the day.

If a broker is unable to pay a debt in full,  he is said to be hammered - Therefore out of the game. The objective is to be the last remaining broker left standing when all the others have been hammered.

The Brokers in the game Are called:
Knight and Day
Spenlow and Jorkins
Dunn and Haddit
Dimple and Curve
Catchem and Bending
Hookem and Havem
Dodgson and Fogg

title: Duco
description:
Try to get as many pawns to the opposite side as possible. 
You can kick out your opponents pawns.

title: Räuberjagd
description: One player is a thief the other one a police officer. The thief tries to get out of the city without getting caught.

title: Tipi
description: Place Native Americans around their Tipi. Earn points by placing them on the good spots.

title: Weltraumtouristen
description: You own a travel agency. You sell space vacations. Get the most tourists to visit the moon to win this game.

title: Millionaire
description: In this game players try to spell the word Millionaire. Each player is dealt 7 letter cards. To start, you begin by laying down the letter M and any other letters (in sequence) that you can. If you cannot make a play, you draw a card instead. The other players also add letters to the word (if possible) on their turns. When the word Millionaire is spelled out, the player having the fewest cards left in his or her hand scores points equal to all the cards left in the opponent's hands. The first player to score 75 points is the winner. Rules for playing Card Anagrams are also included.

title: Milton
description: Milton is an electronic game where players try to complete phrases. It plays 3 different games but all of them have the same basic mechanics. On your turn, you press a red phrase button and listen as Milton speaks the start of a phrase like Blink your. You then press one of the yellow answer buttons and listen to the response (in this case you're trying to find eyes). If you are correct, you take another turn. If you are incorrect, your turn ends and Milton ridicules you. When all the phrases have been matched with their endings, the player who made the most matches wins.

title: ArtDeck
description:
[FROM THE RULES]

The game of modern masters: Impressionism to Surrealism.

ARTDECK is a game that offers art lovers and game players aesthetic pleasure and an exciting way to learn about modern art.  Play the game as directed, play other games of your own, or just enjoy the images on the cards.  ARTDECK will enrich your leisure hours.

title: Drhombix
description:
A 3-D strategic games with rhombic dodecahedrons to build a pyramid.
Each piece piece has 6 white sides and six black sides.
The contents are 30 plastic pieces, 2 playing grounds (triangular and square), and instructions.
The main game (Cuckoo) is to place your piece at the top of the pyramid.  You can prevent your opponent from reaching that goal through clever piece placement.

Variants include Zebra and Ant rules.

title: Alphabet Race
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
Try to name a word which begins with the letter A and with B and then with C - so on through to Z. That won't be too difficult! But when the word you name has also to belong to a particular group or type of thing, the whole thing becomes much more tricky!

A word game. On a board with 20 letters from A to Z, the players try to move to the last letter by finding words. The players get cards with a generic term and have to think of a word, which falls under this term. In the beginning the players start with the letter A. They have 30 seconds of time. If they cannot come up with a letter the card goes to the next player on the left, who now has to think of a proper word. If the player finds a suitable word, he moves to the next letter. As soon as one player reaches the letter Z the game ends.

A fun language skills game for Ages 7 - 12.

title: The Enchanting Village
description:
This game's subtitle, 'A playful introduction to the people and cultures of Africa' is perhaps overstating things. This game consists of rolling and moving around the board collecting things that are supposed to tell us about Africa (coconuts, tree, necklace, fish, mask, drum, hut...). Each player has a board with pictures of 9 of the 16 objects to be collected and rolls the die to move around the board and fill up her or his board. The only further 'complication' is that there are some arrow squares on the board, some pointing clockwise, some anticlockwise. It would appear that landing on these squares can change the direction the player is going in. Landing on any other square gets one of the objects, if its one the player needs.

This is intended as a child's first game. My copy is missing the rulebook, but it isn't hard to surmise the basic rules.

title: Catch Phrase Junior
description:
Same as Catch Phrase but words or phrases that appear on the readout are familiar to adults and well as children. Anyone who can read can play.  Players sit in a circle and divide teams into every other person. One person is selected as the starting player or Clue Giver. After reading the target word on the game's display, the clue giver yells out associated words, hints, sounds until his/her team guesses the target word. As soon as this happens the player presses the Next button and passes the game device to next player who must now give clues to his/her team.  All the while the timer is ticking down. Beep...Beep...Beep..Beep..Beep.Beep.BeepBeepBeep! 
If your team is not in possession of the game device when the buzzer goes off and you score! First team to 7 wins!!

title: The Miss America Pageant
description: This game recreates The Miss America Pageant with players competing in the Swimsuit, Talent, Personality and Evening Gown competitions. The game uses a spinner shaped to look like a television camera. On your turn, you spin the spinner and advance the number of spaces indicated. If you land on a competition space, you draw a card that tells you what score you received for that event. When you have cards from all the competitions, you place your contestant piece on one of the 3 Semi-Final spaces and start a new contestant. It is possible for a player to have 0, 1, 2 or 3 contestants in the Semi-Final judging. When all 3 Semi-Finalist spaces are filled, the player with the highest point score moves her contestant to a Finalist space. A new round is then played and so on until all 5 Finalist spaces are filled around the base of the camera. The spinner is then spun and the contestant in front of the camera pointer is named 4th runner up and removed. This process is repeated eliminating 1 contestant at a time. The remaining contestant is named Miss America, and the player who controls her wins the game.

title: August der Augenfalter
description: August the Butterfly is a symmetry learning game for young children Ages 4 and up

title: Monsters Inc. Scream Catcher
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Electronic Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This is an electronic reaction game with a Monsters Inc. theme. Players choose a colored Scream Canister and sit directly behind it. On top of the game is a door with Mike and Sulley standing next to it. As play begins, the top will whirl and as the door opens, a scream, laugh, or voice will be heard. You need to hit the Scream Canister in front of you to capture a scream (for 1 point) or a laugh (for 2 points). The player who presses the canister first gets the point(s). If Mike's voice is heard, a player pressing a canister loses a point. The first player to score 10 points is the winner.

title: Enterpriser
description:
This game is presented by the Economist and sponsored by major companies that are represented in the game, like ATT, UPS and Shangri-La Hotels. It is meant to give players a flavor of how a competitive market works, while familiarizing them with economic terms and concepts.

Each player represents an Enterpriser who begins a small business and attempts to be the first to build a financial empire. Players have to decide how and when to invest, how much to borrow, how much inventory to maintain and when to take advantage of special opportunities that may come along through contacts with other companies; all this amidst changing economic times and unpredictable events (manifested through event cards).

title: Battle of Britain
types: Aviation / Flight Wargame World War II
description: This is a Japanese wargame on the Battle of Britain 1940. This is published by Epoch.

title: Catholic Family Bible Game
description:
The first player to move along the pathway through biblical scenes from Creation to Christ wins the game.  The object of the game is to bring families together to share and learn their biblical faith in a friendly atmosphere of fun and competitive play.

Players chose in advance which color group or groups of Question and Answer cards they want to play.  Players also decide which level of difficulty each one will play.  A player remains at that level of difficulty (Elementary, Intermediate or Advanced) throughout the game.

title: Mouseketeer Game
description: This game, based on the Mickey Mouse Club, uses a 3-D cardboard Mouseketeer Club House as a game board. Each player uses a peg to climb up one side of the house. On your turn, you spin the spinner and climb the number of spaces indicated. When you reach the Mickey Mouse space at the top, you spin again. If you spin one of the numbers shown under Mickey, you take a scoring disc off the roof of the clubhouse and return your peg to the starting position where you'll start your next turn. After the last disc has been removed from the roof the game ends. The player whose discs add up to the highest score wins.

title: Mr. Bucket
description: This is children's dexterity game featuring Mr. Bucket - a plastic, motorized bucket with a cartoonish face and a large mouth. To begin, Mr. Bucket is placed on the floor in an open area. Each player takes a colored shovel, and 12 balls (4 for each player) are placed on the floor nearby. Mr. Bucket is then turned on and he begins moving, jingling and circling the floor. Players must immediately try to scoop up a ball that matches their color shovel and quickly drop it into Mr. Bucket. They must hurry as Mr. Bucket will spit balls out of his mouth almost as fast as the players can put them in. The first player to get all of his or her balls into Mr. Bucket wins.

title: Mr. Potato Head Find Me
description: This game features an electronic talking Mr. Potato Head that gives the players clues. Fifteen cards showing Mr. Potato Head in various outfits are placed face-up on the table. Each card has a unique combination of 3 special items that no other card contains. On your turn, you press a Special Part button (such as mustache or glasses) and Mr. Potato Head will tell you if the picture he's thinking of contains that item. If it doesn't, you turn all the pictures that have that item face down. If it does, you turn all the pictures that don't have that item face down. If you select a correct item, you may also guess at the picture by pressing 3 Special Part buttons for the unique parts that are in the one you think is correct. If you guess right, you win.

title: Space Pirate Captain Harlock
description: This is a Japanese tactical board game set in the anime world of Captain Harlock and Galaxy Express 999.

title: Mr. Ribbit's Pond
description: This game features Mr. Ribbit, an electronic plastic frog who sits on a large central lily pad. Nine smaller lily pads are placed in a circle around it. The small pads have a picture of either a bug or a gator on their bottoms. On your turn, you pick up Mr. Ribbit and place him on any small lily pad. If he says Sproing!, hop him to the next lily pad and so on around the circle. When he's through sproinging, he will say Rrribbit! Who's there? You must then guess if the lily pad he's on has a bug or a gator underneath. If you guess correctly, you keep the lily pad. If Mr, Ribbit says Splash!, move him to any lily pad of your choice. The first player to collect 3 lily pads is the winner. A second game may be played where players collect bug tokens instead of lily pads.

title: Wer sagt's denn?
description: Players roll dice to determine two letters. The player who first finds a word with one of the letters as first letter and the other letter as last letter gets points.

title: Timon
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Timon - the bewitched steering wheel - is a simple dice game in which players try to capture a counter from each opponent to win the game. This is done by moving your opponents' pieces across the spokes of a nautical wheel to a capture spot on your own spoke. Movement is determined by rolling 2 dice, one to determine which color can be moved, the other for range. Rolling your own color or the neutral white allows you can move any piece of your opponents. The rules include a variation that permits blocking by stacking pieces on top of each other, hiding the pieces underneath.

A pleasant and simple dice game entry in the Edition Perlhuhn range, played on an interesting and atmospheric board with luck being a major factor.

title: Passing Time
description:
This is an educational item, with ten different games included:

1. The Lotto Game
2. The Chronology Game
3. Self-Correction Game
4. A Game of Association
5. A Game of Patience
6. The Memory Game
7. the Series Game
8. Invention Game
9. The Clock Game
10. The Dominoes Time Game

In addition to the rules, it includes a book, 24 cards, and a cardboard clock which are used in the various games. The cards are half black, half white and have a picture of a clock in one half and a different time written in numerals on the other half. Haven't tried the games with my little one, but the components are quite nice.

title: Falklands or Malvinas
description: From 1982, this Edward M. Lightfoot  Associates, Inc. game is entitled Falklands or Malvinas: The Falkland Crisis. It appears to be complete with full instructions. It has a hard board playing surface.

title: The Littles Pop-up and Play Game
description:
The Littles Pop-up and Play Game is a Milton Bradley board game that is based on the early 80s television series, The Littles, which is based on a series of children's books by John Peterson.  The Littles are little 4 inch tall humanoid creatures that live in the walls of human's homes.

The board was rather interesting because it had pop up sections that made up The Littles' living area.  The object of the game is to collect some inventions and get them to Dinky Littles' room.

title: The Alley Cats Game
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
'It's supper time down on the alley and all the cats are setting out on their nightly prowl.
With fish galore to be found, the cats cross the wall to forage in the dustbins on the other side, BUT WATCH OUT, because hiding somewhere under the dustbin lids are some mean old bulldogs, who together with the other cats are going to try and stop you getting that fish home.'

title: Mr. T Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This game, based on the Mr. T cartoon show, plays like the card game War with a few extra twists. The cards depict various characters from the show and a small board is used to organize them as they're played. The entire deck is dealt out evenly among the players into face down piles. Players then draw the top 3 cards to form their hands. In a preliminary round, players take the top card from their piles and play them onto their board space. If no cards match but one is a Mr. T card, the player who played Mr. T wins all the cards. If two or three cards match, a showdown takes place in which players play cards from their hands trying to be the only player to match one of the non-matching cards played by another player. The winner gets all the cards played. If you lose all your cards you're out. When only 2 players remain, the one with the greatest number of cards wins. Rules for playing 2-player are included.

title: Bringing Down the House
description:
Takes the basic idea of Bunco and adds a house building element.  Players roll special dice, then build parts of their house if the correct symbols were drawn.  Roll dice that did not allow you to build and you must pass the dice to the next player or set of players.  Roll 3 of a kind and you must start over.

From the manufacturer's website -

Bringing Down the House 
The Groundbreaking Dice Rolling Game

Choose your partner, grab the dice and get ready to roll! Bringing Down the House will have everyone shaking in their seats.

Compete against the other players to roll the right combination of dice, at just the right time, to build your house.

Roll 3 of a kind and the Foundation will shake and you must start over. Finish first and ring the bell to win!

title: Positive Negative
description:
From the box:
60 cards with colored shapes on a see through background.  Different parts of each card are colored in such a way that when the right cards are held together they make a solid image that cannot be seen through.  Sometimes two cards are needed, sometimes 3, 4 or 5.  The game is especially suited to help develop the faculties of concentration, observation and combination.  Adults will find fascinating entertainment as the game provides ample scope for tactics.

For 3 to 6 players, also possible for 1 player.

title: Mobile Suit Gundam
description:
This is a tactical miniatures type Japanese science fiction wargame set in the first Gundam series(0079).

Published by Bandai.

This is based off the Mobile Suit Z Gundam anime series and is part of the Mobile Suit Gundam familly of games.

title: Aircraft Carrier
description:
The Japanese wargame with carrier picture is Tsukuda's legendary Aircraft Carrier.
This is a tactical Naval battle in the Pacific.
Main feature of the game is the extensive use of dummy markers.

Published by Tsukuda Hobbies.

title: Rook Plus: The Wild Bird Game
description:
This game might be described as a cross between Rook and BINGO. Each player has a Rook Plus game card, which is divided into 16 spaces (4x4 grid), each with a color and number that corresponds with a card in the Rook deck. As tricks are taken, players mark captured cards on their game card. Players win by filling four spaces in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

Contents

     57 Rook Cards (3additional cards about Parker Brothers but not part of the game)
     4 Wild Bird Score Cards
     50 scoring chips
     English instructions

title: Epées de France
description:
The third release in the Au fil de l'Epe series. 
Released by Frdric and Pascal own brand Canons en Carton. 
Available in English, French or Italian. 
Includes 4 new scenarios: Cocherel 1364 - Auray 1364 - Patay 1429 - Castillon 1453

1 rules booklet
1 scenarios booklet with historical notes
4 A3 maps - 216 counters - 1 color Player Aid Card

title: The Emerald Tablet
description:
Wargaming Rules for Heroic Battles and Mystical Conquests.

A comprehensive (56 pages) set of miniatures rules for conducting warfare in a fantasy setting. Both combat and magic are used to resolve battles. The rules are designed for standard 25mm miniatures, but guidance is also given for playing with 15mm miniatures.

The rules comprehensiveness is readily apparent: almost every aspect of any epic fantasy battle in any story ever published in any century is covered. Really. Behold a random sampling from the rules' index:


     Ceremonial Magic
     Bombards
     Metamorphoids
     Sacrificial Victims 
     Chariots
     Oblique movement of self-disciplined units
     Rules for innate chi projection
     Killing rampaging large mounts
     Infernal Engine Disadvantages   
     Unconscious and mad magic users
     Aerial unit fatigue
     Goetic Magic Hour Correspondence Charts
     Effects of routing units on dray animals
     Klipothic and Beneficient Magic


The rules' color text claims that the magic system is based on the actual grimoires (magical texts) that guided medieval European thaumaturges (workers of miracles). Cardstock sheets are designed to be cut into individual spell cards marked with evocation circles, mystical symbols, demons and angels that have been familiar to magic users for centuries. It is hard to judge the historical accuracy of such statements, but the book is packed with so many spell charts, Astral Force cards, magic critical fail results, and the affects of High Magic Color rules that Merlin would probably sell his left one for just one peek at the last 30 pages of the book.

title: Im Reich der Lotosblumen
description: The game is over when all spaces of the gameboard are occupied. The player with most influence gets points. The player with the most points wins.

title: The Game of Big Rig 18 Wheeler
Battle of Santa Cruz
description: This is a Japanese naval wargame on the Battle of Santa Cruz during World War 2. Uses the same system as Opertion MI.

title: Dürrenstein & Schöngraben 1805
Stalk-1
description:
Stalk-1 is the first incorporation of 1/285th Scale Miniature vehicles into a boxed wargame.  The game is designed to demonstrate the aesthetics of miniatures for tactical wargaming.

The game comes with 4 8x10 modular hex based mapboards and 10 1/285th scale German and Russian metal tank miniatures (from CinC).  A unique movement system has one player secretly plot his/her moves, then the other player makes their moves directly on the mapboard, after which the plotted moves are executed and combat can take place by either player at any time during the execution of the plotted moves.  Turret direction (and speed determined by gun size) are factors in the combat system.

title: Olympia
description:
Olympia, the official game of the 1972 Olympics in Mnchen, Germany, is a dice rolling racing game. The board depicts the emblem of the Mnchen Olympic Games. First person to move two tokens from the periphery to the middle of the board is the winner.

Olympia is part of the Ravensburger Casino Series, a bookshelf line of games published in the Seventies.

title: New Kids On The Block Game
description: This simple track game is themed after the boy band of the same name. On your turn you roll the die and move the number of spaces indicated. If you roll New Kids On The Block, you draw a card and play a card from your hand (these send you to a specific space). If you land on a space with the name of a New Kid, you take a framed picture of that Kid from the supply. When you have 3 or more pictures you may try to win by landing on the Finish space. You then roll the die and add the number of pictures you've collected to the number rolled. If the total is 10 or more, you win.

title: Across the Pacific
description:
(from the Pacific Rim website:)

Across the Pacific portrays the entire Pacific War in five-month turns with units that range from armies to regiments, air fleets to destroyer flotillas. The game system is interactive so that each player is involved at every moment of play. The heart of the game's mechanics is a series of strategic and tactical phases  5 per player per turn  that are sequenced by a chit draw so that each player will know his and his opponents possible actions, but not the order in which they will be undertaken. This brings about continual strategic and operational opportunity as players plan their actions in response to the lifting for of war.

Across the Pacific provides a manageable and fast-paced wargame that has a high level of detail and operational flavor while retaining the strategic scope of the ebb and flow of the Pacific War

Across the Pacific contains:

    36 by 48 inch map of the Pacific Basin from Pearl Harbor to Imphal, Dutch Harbor to Brisbane
    960 die-cut backprinted 5/8 inch counters
    24-page rules booklet
    24-page Designer's Notes, Historical Commentary, and Examples of Play booklet
    two 11 by 17 inch color backprinted Order of Battle charts  one Japanese, one Allied
    two 8-1/2 by 11 inch Unit and Carrier Air Groups Display charts  one Japanese, one Allied
    two 8-1/2 by 11 inch Task Force Dispay charts
    two 8-1/2 by 11 inch Charts and Tables card

title: 18IB
description: 18IB is 18xx set on the Iberian peninsula. Two sets of rules are available: a basic version which is simpler than 1830: Railways & Robber Barons and an expanded version which is more historical and includes different gauges.

title: Bulls, Bears N' Bellies: Commodity Futures Trading Game
description:
This is a bookshelf-style game of commodity futures trading.

The authors describe it thusly: The game is devised to be fun, educational, and fast paced. It is developed in such a way that the uninitiated trader who knows nothing about the factors that affect prices of commodity futures contracts can learn, in a very basic way, about these factors by studying the information and the accompanying price changes on the cards.

title: Predict-a-Ball
description:
The exciting new board game you play while watching or listening to a live baseball game on TV or radio.  Just watch or listen and predict what will happen after each pitch and batter.  Will the next pitch be hit foul?  Will this batter strike out or hit a home run?  Did you make the correct prediction?  Then move the spaces awarded.  Make the wrong call?  You're out!  Yell at the umpire more that the manager! Players are on the edge of their seats from pitch to pitch!  
It's a whole new way to enjoy baseball!
First player around the board wins.  A Winner is usually determined after three innings, but could be over after just one batter, depending on the predictions.
Predict-a-Ball scores big with baseball fans of all ages.  Don't just watch the game.  Get into the Game! -from the back of the box

title: Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ: Core 3
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description: This is an expansion kit for Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ: Side One, and can not play standalone. This kit add space combat rule and 40 new weapons.

title: Gulf Wars
description:
This is a Japanese game. However the name is Gulf Wars, this game actually simulates political conflict in the Middle East.
Up to five persons can play at the same time. Each player commands Iran, Iraq, Egypt, Syria or Saudi Arabia and compete against each other for the position of leader of the Arabs.
Published by Sho Kikaku(STR Games line) in 1991.

title: DX Demoniac Tarot
description:
A Japanese Children's magic game.

Published by Bandai.

title: Geißlein, versteck dich!
types: Animals Children's Game Memory Mythology Number
description:
How many little kids have hidden underneath the bed? Or in the cupboard? Whoever tells the right number, can save a little kid from being caught by the wicked wolf. This memory game for 2 - 4 players contains a variant for younger players as well as the fairy tale to re-read.

There are six metal cups in different colors. At the start of the game, five wooden goat's heads are placed under each of them, and the wolf is placed in the middle of a ring of cups. The players take turns to roll a color die, then announce how many goat heads are under the cup in the corresponding color. When an announcement is correct, the player gets one head and hides the rest under the cup again.
When an announcement is wrong, the player gets the wolf and keeps it until another player guesses wrongly. But when the player who already has the wolf announces a wrong number, he or she has to dump one goat to the wolf.

The game ends when either one player has collected seven heads (and thus wins) or the wolf has six (and thus all players lose).

French description:
Contenu: 6 cachettes de couleur, 30 chevreaux, 1 loup, 1 d multicolore (6 couleurs), 1 d multicolore (3 couleurs, pour la variante simplifie), 1 rgle du jeu.

Dure de la partie : env.15 minutes

But du jeu : sauver les chevreaux cachs avant qu'ils ne tombent dans la gueule du loup.
Un formidable jeu de mmoire comprennant une variante pour les joueurs plus jeunes. Vous pourrez galement y trouver le clbre conte Le loup et le sept chevreaux.

title: Stein auf Stein
description:
Entering this construction site is for children only!  A wooden crane lifts smooth, wooden, colorful blocks around the construction site.  Who will build the highest tower?

A game of skill with color dice for 1-4 crane operators.  With different levels of difficulty.  Wooden crane and building blocks are suitable for free play and stimulate motor skills.

Wooden crane included.

title: Hang Glider
description:
This is a Japanese hang liding game and your goal in the game is to reach your objectives on the map without crashing.

Published by Ad Technos for their Sports and Adventure series.

title: There Oughta Be a Law
description:
In There Oughta Be A Law, each player is a Senator in a committee, trying to make the most money by voting for bills various special interest groups support.

There are two types of cards: bills and events. Bills can be played as amendments to an existing bill. Events modify interest groups positions on bills or alter a players options for play. Each bill lists the interest groups' positions on bills. Players can add hidden amendments to prevent other players from gaining interest group support.

The player with the most money received from interest groups at the end of the game wins.

Published by Sacred Cow Games, 2000.

title: The Bible Stories Game
description:
The object of the game is to collect matching cards that tell familiar Bible stories, including Noah's Ark, David  Goliath, Joseph and the Coat of Many Colors, Jesus in the Temple, and others.  The player completing the most stories is the winner.

Two of each picture are used for younger children, four of each picture for younger children.  The only distinguishing feature from Go Fish is an optional rule where the set collector must tell the Bible Story pictured before counting the set.

Features Precious Moments artwork on the cards.

title: Pooh Honey Pot Hunt Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description: A path with spaces of assorted colors is assembled by color matching the edges of large cards.  The players then take turns moving a single pooh figure with a color-coded spinner.  If Pooh is on a space with a printed honey pot, the player takes a cardboard honey pot counter.  When Pooh reaches the end of the path, the player with the most counters is the winner.

title: Sculptionary
description: Pictionary with clay.  One team member sculpts with clay, the other team members guess what it is, with a one minute time limit.  Successes allow a die roll and another turn, failure passes control to the next team.  The categories are Easy, Medium, Hard, and All Sculpt.

title: Elephants and Bamboo
description: This is a wargame on the Fall of South Vietnam and covers the last month of the war in 1975.

title: Breath of Faith
description: DTP forerunner of Operation Badr that West End published in 1984, remains the best Golan war game.

title: Plains of Khuzestan
description: This wargame is the forerunner of Perry Moore's Death & Destruction: The Iran-Iraq War

title: Locust
description: This is a wargame on a hypothetical invasion of Iran by the Soviet Union in the 80s.

title: Valley of Death
description:
This is a DTP wargame on the invasion of Laos by South Vietnamese forces in 1971 which ended in disaster.

An earlier version of the game is known as II Corps.

title: Drive to the Danube, 1945
description:
A DTP wargame on the German Operation Spring Awakening, Hungary, March 1945.

This is a forerunner of SS Abyss.

title: Strike For the Suez
description: A Perry Moore alternate reality DTP wargame on a hypothetical German invasion of Syria from Turkey during World War 2.

title: Porn Masters: The Board Game
types: Abstract Strategy Dice Economic Humor Mature / Adult Party Game
description:
A board game for 2-4 players. Players move around the board buying up porn related businesses and managing hookers in a bid to be the first player to save up enough money to win the game. Porn industry businesses are divided into seven sub groups where players may attain a monopoly and gain make money even faster.

Collect Fate Cards as you go and gain benefits or the ability to play whammy events against other players. And watch out for the cops, else they bust your hookers and shut down your illegally run businesses.

Porn Masters is a light-hearted game and not meant to be taken too seriously. But don't let that fool you, there is still plenty of strategy involved.

title: Action Baseball
description:
From the Game Box -

With Action Baseball, you are the manager, coordinating your team's action against your opponent - batting, strategic plays, pitching, defense, and counter-strategies!  Your decisions direct the game flow, play-by-play, inning-by-inning.

Action Baseball is an original, two-person interactive card game with play dynamics true to the integrity and spirit of baseball.  No random dice.  No restrictive charts.  Instead, you determine the action!

Enjoy the rich tradition and excitement of baseball anytime, anywhere with Action Baseball!

Action Baseball contains:
two play decks
rule book
fold-out playing field
6 runner discs
score pads

title: Homonopolis
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
Gay-themed Monopoly variant published in a limited edition.

With Homonopolis you'll be bar-hopping in Amsterdam and be visiting the various gay venues. Different things will happen on the way, not only brought to you by the Social Service cards and Now What!? cards, but also by your own ingenuity in negotiations with your fellow players.

You can buy bars and other properties when you land on them. Note that you can only start to buy when you have run the total board at least once!
