The set includes a 3/8 thick by 16 round board, 2 Fleets of 15 pewter cast ships, Rules, 2 dice, and a cloth bag.

title: Plunder: The Commodore's Game
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Exploration Pirates Print & Play
description:
The Commodores Game is an advanced rule set for Plunder. Plunder's Commodores Game is for those with a true pirate and gamers heart.

The Commodores expansion for Plunder is designed to increase the total number of maximum players from 4 to 6. It also includes additional rules that make the game more complex and even more exciting than the base game. In order to play the Commodores Game you will need a copy of Plunder and to down load and print the Commodore Expansion.

The Commodores expansion is a free PDF download from the games fan club website (www.plunderfanclub.com). The PDF downloads include additional Captain mats and ships for two new colors (Black and Silver), new rules sheet, and additional national flags, coins, and cargo counter sheets.

Expands:

    Plunder

title: Guess How Much I Love You Game
description:
Matching and pantomime game for young children based on the book of the same name.

Find the matching cards for your game board, while imitating the motions on the cards. When all the boards are completed everyone wins!

title: London Rules Wargames Section American Civil War 1863c
types: American Civil War Dice Miniatures Wargame
mechanisms: Dice RollingPaper-and-PencilSecret Unit DeploymentSimulationSimultaneous Action Selection
description: Based upon an 'article submission' within the pages of Miniature Warfare Magazine Vol. 1 #-7, and part of a 'Series' for Miniatures Wargaming. This 'Booklet' has a YELLOW 'front  back' plasticized-'looking' outside covers, with BLACK print on the front and plastic 'binding' for the pages. It contains '20'-pages of RULES in a 'half-page'~SIZED format, and covers the 'Basics' of minis gaming within this. It details the use of 'BOUNDS'~written 'Orders' and simultaneously revealing them, for its 'mechanism' of PLAY. You will NEED to provide *SPECIAL* 6-sided-'DICE' numbered as follows:  2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 5 , as well as some regular 'D-6's, various other 'sundry' items associated with this 'genre' as required, and some 'Markers' of the same SIZE as the 'Units' that they will represent in the 'Game'. These 'Markers' can even be 'used' for DECOY 'Units' where applicable, and you would have to obtain additional DATA on 'specifics' for individual 'Battles, Troops,  Leaders' prior to commencing PLAY for this. Calculations for creating 'Casualties' are based upon a 'percentages' and DIE rolls method being employed for resolving 'Conflicts'. These seem to be the 'easiest' and 'quickest' RULES devised at the time, for recreating the many epic Confrontations that were to 'define' the American WAR for Reunification! in the 'period' covered by this 'Rules SET'.

title: Robots! The Game
description:
Who left the Robot Factory door open? The robots are running away with all of the spare parts! Catch the robots and all of the missing pieces. Build your own robot to win the game.

2005 Creative Child Magazine Seal of Excellence

title: Maya & Miguel Word Scramble
description: Race to spell a word before time runs out. Spell words in English or Spanish and score points for the number of letters used.

title: Allo Allo
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme World War II
description:
The 'Allo 'Allo board game was made for the BBC by Powage Press in 1989.  It is based on the very popular BBC sitcom of the same name set in a cafe in occupied France in WW2.

Players can choose to be in the French Resistance or a member of the occupying German army.

The objective for French resistance player(s) is to try to find the English RAF airman Carstairs and Fairfax and get them across the border without being captured.  The German player(s) have to capture them.

Game Contents:
Game Board
6 Character Pieces
100 Cards
2 Dice 
Instructions.

title: Every Second Counts
types: Action / Dexterity Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Every Second Counts is a game of Family fun that gives everyone a chance to shine for 4 players Ages 10 and up

It was made in 1987 by Peter Pan and is based on the BBC Quiz Show of the same name which was hosted by magician Paul Daniels and which ran from 1986 to 1993 in the UK.

The box describes the game as follows:

It's not just what you know - it's how quickly you can shout it out.  Pit your WITS against the clock!

title: Hell by Starlight
description: Hell by Starlight is a unique set of Science Fiction wargames rules designed for games in either 15mm or 25mm scales.  Generic in nature, contains rules for hostile environments, electronic warfare, snipers, bio-weapons, AI, cavalry, medics and psionics, in addition to the usual mainframe of command, reaction, movement, morale, firing and casualties.

title: Ironclads and Ether Flyers
types: Aviation / Flight Miniatures Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is a reprint of the old Ironclads and Ether Flyers.  Ironclads and Ether Flyers is a set of 19th Century Aeronaval miniatures rules.  It focuses on battles between seafaring battleships and aerial gunboats and is set in the Space: 1889 universe.

The rule book covers not only combat rules, but also include scenarios as well as campaign rules.  The rules detail aeronaval combat: movement, attacks, ramming and damage.  Advanced rules address special weapons and vessels.

title: Barbarossa
description:
The Emperor is dead. The throne is empty. The courts are out of order and power is in the hands of whoever holds the sword. Everybody asks: Who will be the new Emperor? Four kings claim the throne. Who will have it?

Barbarossa (translated to Redbeard) was the nickname of Emperor Friedrich I, who lived from 1123 to 1190. He was crowned as king in 1152, and Emperor in Rome in 1155.

The players take roles of medieval kings, trying to get rich by conquering cities and castles. Possession of cities and castles gives the right to claim taxes. Taxes are used to buy knights, squires and archers to protect the kings interests.

Before the game starts, the players agree on a playing time. Whoever is the richest (cash plus value of knights, squires and archers) by that time wins the game. In addition you can win by being the only player with a live king, or by having a certain numbers of cities and castles (2 players = 16, 3 players = 14, 4 players = 12).

There are rules for movement, which depends on the unit, and the terrain moving through. Combat, which depends on the units, and the defenders position. Tax collection, including the ability to bleed the peasants, and their possible revolt. Pillaging of cloisters, buying now units, and drawing a chance card at the end of each year.

Marketed as a family game, but rather complicated for that.

title: Snake Snack
description:
The game is played on board with 4 snakes biting each others tails. There are 11-14 spots on each snake. Players take turns rolling the die and moving one of their 4 counters. When your counter lands in front of a snakes mouth, all counters standing on a spot of the same color as the counters color, is eaten and out of the game. Last player with counters in the game wins.

Found in a book called: John Astrop's Ghastly Games

title: Blue Max: An Aces High Expansion
types: Aviation / Flight Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War I
description:
Blue Max is not a complete game in itself; it is an expansion kit for 3W's popular game  Aces High, dealing with aerial combat during World War 1. Coverage of the Great War in the air is extended to cover Italy, Macedonia and Palestine, as well as the strategic bombing raids on Britain and Germany. Counters and data sheets are provided for 39 new types and variants of aircraft; over 20 new scenarios are provided which use these new aircraft as well as several types which were provided in the original game, but for which no scenario was given. Extra rules are provided extending the detailed coverage of the subject. The numbering of these rules has been kept. consistent with that of Aces High.

The reissued boxed version of Aces High incorporates the additional rules and planes of Blue Max: An Aces High Expansion within the box. However, Blue Max: An Aces High Expansion continued to be sold seperately as a stand-alone expansion.

Expands:

    Aces High

title: Silly Stories
description:
From the box back.

Perfectly sensible sentences get wacky fast when they're scrambled into crazy combinations.

In an original twist on memory card games, kids flip story cards to hunt down the WHO, WHAT, and WHERE that combine to tell a Silly Story.

Simpler and more challenging ways to play give beginners and veteran players alike plenty of brain building fun.

Learning the Silly Stories way...

Pre-readers and early readers alike have fun while they practice their memory skills, word recognition, powers of observation  and giggles.

title: Economaze
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingDice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveStock HoldingTrading
description:
A family game for 2 to 4 players, Ages 10 and up.  Collect salaries and bonuses on every turn.  Buy and sell stocks, CD's, gold coins, houses, and insurance to take advantage of good luck cards and avoid setbacks from bad luck cards.  Exciting continuous player action, including gambling between players and between players and the bank.

In this game you are never so far behind that you cannot come back to win.  Game elements permit rapid changes in standing whereby the losing player at mid-game can easily be the winner.

Teaches children how to manage investments relative to the real economic world in a manner that holds their interest.  A strategic, challenging game for competitive adults.  Realistic financial happenings spiced with the gambling mystique.  (From the box bottom)

title: Middle East Combat
types: Economic Expansion for Base-game Modern Warfare Wargame
description:
From the insert: Middle East Combat is a titanic battle between Iraq, the USSR, Iran, Turkey, and Saudi Arabia for control of oil resources and key neutral nations, played with basic Axis & Allies rules.

Contents:
23x30 bright full color folded map showing region names, oil areas, factories, and capitals(Heavy stock paper)
5 unit placement cards
Ten page rulebook which covers additional rules for
- neutral nation armies
- civil insurrections
- modern weapon technologies
- USSR special rules
- game balance adjustments
- short game scenarios
- map clarifications
- 10 questions and answers from the game

The Red Pact of USSR and Iraq form one side in this war and the Triad Nations of Iran, Turkey, and Saudi-Egypt form the other side.

Victory Conditions, 1) Hold ten oil areas at the end of a full turn, 2) Hold all enemy capitals, or 3) Hold a total of three neutral or enemy capitals.

Another use for your Axis  Allies game pieces.

title: Jo-Jotte
description: Famous bridge personality Ely Culbertson's attempt to create an equally popular 2-person game. Jo-Jotte is named after Josephine Culbertson his first wife and distinguished partner. Unfortunately the game flopped and the couple divorced a year later. The game is basically Belote (i.e. Klobyash, Bella) with the addition of Notrump, a Nullo bid, Slam bid and also bridge-like scoring above and below the line.

title: Semper Fi! Uncommon Valor ATS Upgrade
ATS Blood & Iron
The Dartmoor Game
description:
The Dartmoor game was designed in collaboration with Dartmoor National Park Authority to help improve geographical knowledge of visitors to this National Park in the county of Devon in the UK.

The object of the game is to travel across Dartmoor landing on specific grid references, collect a certificate and then return to your home town.

Movement and points accumulation is through use of dice and answering questions along the way.

Two versions of the game can be played. In the Short Game, the winner is the first player home with a score of at least 100 points. For a longer game, everyone continues playing until the points cards run out, and at that point, the winner is the person with the highest score.

title: Survivor: The Game
description:
If you think you have what it takes to be a contestant on Survivor, this all-new party game brings the hit TV show from exotic locales around the world straight into your living room.

Like the show, players break into two tribes to compete from immunity in a variety of hilarious and daring challenges that can be performed around the home. You never know what talents you'll need to call upon to win immunity for your tribe and send your opponents to the ballot box to vote someone off the team.

There's no trivia component so players don't have to be experts on the show to get off the sidelines and into the game. It's fun, competitive and highly strategic as players outwit, outplay and outlast each other to become the ultimate Survivor.

Note: There may be items required for play not included in the game box.

Comes with over 250 challenge cards, ballots, pencils and ballot box.

title: Sound Effects
description:
Sound Effects

The CD guessing game

What is the sound of one hand clapping? That's one sound you won't be asked to identify while playing Sound Effects, a fun new game that has the whole family listening! You will, however, be required to identify 80 other sounds, including the sound of someone brushing their teeth, a skill saw, a pinball machine, a tree falling or a mosquito...after listening for only a few seconds. Fun for anyone aged 4 to 104, Sound Effects can be played at any level. Players determine beforehand the level of difficulty (the tracks get progressively hard to identify) and how long they'll get to hear the sound before they must write their answer down. Mix it up by hitting random play on your CD player or take it with you in the car.

Includes a CD of more than 80 sound effects, pencils and score pads.
Ages 4 and up, 2+ players

title: Magnetic State to State
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Racing Transportation
description:
Racing game to see who can go from their starting state to finishing state.  Players pick state cards, then can either place them on the board, hold on to them (to mess with the other players), or ask for a state card the other players have to play on the board.  Once a players states are connected from starting state to finish state, they win.

From the Publisher:

Magnetic States cling like magic to the USA
gameboard as player draw or ask any other player for any of the different  State  cards that
will link their starting and finishing states.  Without even realizing it, children will learn state 
capitals, landmarks, and basic geography of the United States.

title: Micro Fleet: World War II
types: Miniatures Nautical Wargame World War II
description: This wargame is a part of the Micro Warfare Series covering World War II naval combat. It is a miniatures-style game that includes cardboard ship counters.  The rules cover individual ship command/gunnery rules, as well as rules for aircraft, weather, specific critical systems hits, flooding, and ramming.  Specific counters are included to fight the Battle of the River Plate (Graf Spee vs. Exeter, Achilles,  Ajax) and the Sinking of the Hood (Bismarck  Prinz Eugen vs. Hood  Prince of Wales).

title: Micro Sci-Fi
description:
This wargame is a part of the Micro Warfare Series covering battles between the Earth (and its galactic allies) and the Zoltan Empire. It is a miniatures-style game that includes cardboard unit counters. The rules include a variety of fantastic weapons, including vortex beams, pluton flares, inertia weapons, and the ever-popular defense screens. Specific counters are included to fight small-scale combats, including attacks on colonies and police forts.

Supplements:
Sci-Fi
 TTG-MA-S01 Xylon Vikings
 TTG-MA-S02 Time Warriors
 TTG-MA-S03 Kripton
 TTG-MA-S04 Star Pods

title: Double Some'R'Set
description:
Double Some 'R' Set is a trick-taking game that uses a unique deck of 50 cards.  The card suits are fractions (ex. 1/2, 10/12, 5/6, 3/8, etc.) with the mid-cards (6/12, 5/10) also being worth extra points.

Double Some'R'Set is best played with partners (like in Spades).

The object is to bid on how many points you and your partner will take.  There are 24 available points, 12 from the available tricks and 12 from available points.

Bidding goes around the table once where the players bid for the two card blind.  High bid takes the blind and decides which suit (fraction set) will be trump.

Like in many trick taking games, and if you make your hand, you get the points.  If you do not, you are set, hence the name (as they say in the rules) Some r set.

See also:
Some'R'Set - 28 card version

title: Shopping Center Game
description:
A Baby Boomer children's game celebrating the new-fangled suburban Shopping Center. A spin and move game where you visit different stores and the first player to buy 6 items and get back to the parking lot wins.

From the bottom of the spinner

The Game of SHOPPING CENTER - for 2,3 or 4 Players

OBJECT: To take one purchase card from each store as a player moves his shopping cart around the board

WINNER: The first player to go out with six different purchase cards. Players take turns spinning and moving the number of spaces indicated on the spinner. A player may take a shopping card only when he stops on a space so marked. When a player has six different cards he moves, in his turn, toward the parking lot of his color. He must spin the correct number to put him out.

title: Professor Wacky's Wahoo Word Lab
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Word Game
description:
From the Publisher:

Phonics strategies for building words are presented with the fun and engaging Professor Wacky. Players practice making words using onsets (word beginnings) and rimes (word endings). Seven different games accommodate varying skill levels.

title: Frog Pond Fractions Game
description:
From the Publisher:

Croak the frog teaches the beginning concepts of fractions, the relationship of parts to wholes. Game promotes quick play and offers hands-on learning with squeezable, solid foam fraction pieces. Multiple skill levels can play together and game adapts as skills progress.

title: Let's Go Shopping Game
description:
From the Publisher:

Kids learn smart consumerism at the shopping mall as they practice addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Fun-filled game builds money math skills and involves all players at every turn. Two versions to challenge multiple skill levels.

title: Professor Wacky's Neon Number Flash Game
description:
From the Publisher:

Learn number sense through fun, strategic play. Versatile cards build math skills including reading and writing numbers, multiplication and division, finding prime and composite numbers, and more! Ten different games encourage collaboration and strategizing, and adapt to varying skill levels.

title: Chip-O! Game
description:
From the Publisher:

The fun, challenging game that combines two compatible skills, picture word recognition and rhyming. Players learn 48 different words and how to strategize in a game format. Colorful game board features photos for real-life learning.

title: Take Four Word Game
description:
From the Publisher:

A fast-paced crossword game everyone plays at the same time. Ready, Set, Go!
 Everyone takes four tiles and starts building words.
 First to use their tiles yells, Take Four more!
 Players can change and rearrange their crossword anytime
 Use the last tile and WIN!
Easy to learn, it teaches word building, problem solving, creativity and strategic thinking.

title: The Iguana Factor Multiplication Game
types: Animals Children's Game Educational Math Number
description:
From the Publisher:

Leaping Lizards! What a great way to master multiplication tables! Friendly iguanas watch every move as kids use multiplication facts to reach their goal. Bumping and capturing moves make this game even more fun.

title: Buy It Right Shopping Game
description:
From the Publisher:

Teach kids the importance of money recognition, adding and making correct change through interactive game play. Kids can set prices, buy and sell items and learn the value of money as they move throughout the game board.

title: Pharaoh's Phonics
description:
From the Publisher:

Spin your way to building better phonics skills with our Pharaohs Phonics game. Multiple skill levels teach long and short vowels, explore beginning blends and practice consonant sounds. Players challenge each other to build 3, 4, 5 and 6-letter words. The student with the first completed pyramid wins.

title: Stad - Land - Rivier
description:
Ever-changing, fast-thinking town-country-river game using the flower-shaped dice randomizer. Flower shape is rolled between two hands, placed flat on the table; players race to write down words using the right letters.

Every player has to write down what comes to mind with each of the six categories combined with the first letter from the dice randomizer.

Six categories are placed on the board (for example: town, country, river, car, beverage, food, TV-star, singer, etc.) and the dice randomizer is placed. Now everyone has to write down a TV-star, country etc. with the first letter that's attached to it.

Points are given for every right answer, unless someone else has given the same answer.
Traditional three player trick taking card game originating in Eastern Europe.  It is quite unusual in that the trump suit can change multiple times per hand due to card play.

title: Blankety Blank
description:
Blankety Blank is a board game based on the horrible, yet amazingly long running low budget UK BBC TV quiz show of the same name first introduced by Terry Wogan in 1977 then Les Dawson and Lily Savage (a.k.a Paul O'Grady) respectively later on in its lifespan, the show itself is based on the 1970's version of the US Game Show MATCH GAME.

The game simply involves guessing the missing blank in a sentence.  The sentence itself often gives an innocuous clue to the blank.  Players then compare answers and score points for matching answers.
 One player acts as quizmaster and the other players take turns to be a contestant and a panelist.  The quizmaster decides who the first contestant is going to be the first question is read out and the contestant and panelists write their answers on the sheet provided.

When everyone has recorded their answer, the contestant reads out his answer first, followed by each panelist in turn. Each time that the answer of the contestant matches that of the panelist the contestant gets a point.

The two contestants with the highest number of points then go on to play the Super Match Game. In this game there are three possible answers to each question--the answers are worth 50 points, 100 points or 150 points. When a player matches any of these answers, they record the number of points won. The player with the most points at the end of the Super Match is the winner and goes on to the Head to Head game, the last round.

title: ElementO
description: ElementO was designed as a learning tool for the Periodic Table of Elements. Players acquire elements by landing on them. When another player lands on an element, which is owed, they must pay the owner protons. The last player with protons wins. This game is a scientific variant of Monopoly. If you are into science, teaching or the Periodic Table of Elements this game is for you. The game board depicts the Periodic Table of Elements.

title: Fistful of Power
types: Collectible Components Dice Fantasy Science Fiction
description:
In a dark age, in a forgotten time, there is a world called Scar. Here, fighters are forced to do battle for the amusement of an evil warlord named Xar. Only a Fistful of Power can destroy him. It's up to you to build an army and throw down the challenge, before all is lost.

This is a ultra-low skill dice-rolling game where the miniatures themselves are rolled. (similar to Pass the Pigs, but much simpler.) Simply throw the figures on the table, and count the point values (printed on the sole of the figures' feet) of the ones that landed face up.

title: Barbie Sparkle Kingdom Game
description:
The Barbie Sparkle Kingdom game is very much like a Barbie themed Candyland.  Rather than drawing cards with colors on them, the player spins a spinner, chooses a flower on the spinner, looks under the flower for the color and moves their piece to the next space on the board of that color.  If that space has a flower, the player gets another turn.  If the player lands on a bumble bee, they have to go back to the spot of the previous bumble bee on the board.  There are short cuts (Rainbow Bridge, Butterfly Trail, Crystal Path) to speed you along your route.  The winner is the player to be the first to Barbie's Jeweled Palace.

Components:
1 glittery game board
4 Barbie playing pieces
1 flower spinner with base
5 plastic flowers
50 glittery stickers
1 spinner and playing piece label sheet
Instructions

title: The Original Fortune Telling Board Game
description:
From the back of the box:

The Original Fortune Telling Board Game  by Jennifer Sands is the only board game of its kind that combines a fun and safe methodology based on modern fortune card readings and empowered by real mystical stones.  With a roll of the dice each player is whisked away on a journey to discover his or her special personalized fortune.  Collect, win, lose or buy LOVE, MONEY, PEOPLE and Question cards in this fun and exciting game where all players win a real personalized fortune card reading of their own.

---

Each player rolls the die, moves his or her pawn, and then does what the landed on square tells them to.  This is almost always either gaining or losing fortune telling cards (from four different decks - love, money, people, and questions) or empowering stones (which can be traded in for fortune telling cards).  The rules state that the object is for each player to collect as many fortune telling cards as possible; but they also state that the winner is the player who draws the last card, which ends the game and allows that player to discard up to three of their cards.

The real purpose is for each player to use the cards collected during the game to have their personal fortune told on the tarot-style card layout board.

If you believe in this stuff, you'll be happy to know that all Jennifer Sands products are created with the assistance of professional psychics, fortune tellers and astrologers.  All Jennifer Sands products use safe fortune telling methodologies.

If you don't believe in this stuff, you'll note this product is for entertainment purposes only.

title: MINT 400 Off Road Game
description: During the first phase of the game, the players roll and move on the outer part of the board, getting their trucks, coupons, and spare parts.  After using the coupons to pay the entrance fee, they begin doing a pre-determined amount of laps on the inner part of the board.  The more laps that were chosen, the more spare parts that will be needed to complete the laps.  There are also good news and bad news squares on the outer and inner board, which act as random events.  The player who completes all the laps, or makes the most number of laps, wins.  The rules book also contains more info on off-road racing and contains driver profiles on Parnelli Jones, Team MacPherson (Jerry McDonald, Jeff MacPherson, adn Joe MacPherson), John Baker, Walker Evans, Ivan Stewart, and Kjell Eriksson.

title: Stocks & Shares
description:
The object of the game is to buy and sell shares in four commodities. Players draw cards that dictate the rise and fall in values and buy or sell accordingly. The skill is in observing the actions of others, predicting the trend of the market and maximizing profit.

A simple game with no upper limit to the numbers of players which is unusual. A typically compact Pepys product with a production style similar to contraband; it is a re-implementation of Win-A-Lot, which was also produced by Pepys.

title: PiQadilly Circus
types: Card Game Educational Racing Word Game
description:
From the publisher:
PiQadilly Circus, the Wonderful Wonderland Word Game, is alive with the spirit of Victorian whimsy. PiQadilly is both a thoughtful word game and a wild, spirited board game. This is a game that kids love to play, the perfect meeting place for adults and children. 2 to 4 players make crossword-style wordplays, then riffle along the ruffle in a madcap race. Word game and crossword enthusiasts will love it! (New Family Classic Game)

title: The Wizard of Menlo Park
description:
From the publisher: 
The Wizard of Menlo Park turns you into one of Thomas Edisons enthusiastic but overworked assistants. Help Edison develop, test, and assemble the incandescent light and the electrical system that would revolutionize the world. Can you help Edison to achieve the seemingly impossible before New Years Eve 1879?

title: The Wright Brothers
description:
From the publisher:
The Wright Brothers has you travel the path of discovery that led to one of the greatest triumphs of technology  the invention of the airplane. If youve gained enough knowledge and experience, be the first to successfully fly the Wrights airplane, the Flyer, on the sand dunes at Kitty Hawk.

title: Gettysburg: Three Days in July
description: For three days in July 1863, 170,000 men, all Americans, fought a climactic battle that would change the course of the American Civil War. Now you and an opponent face off in this action-packed Battle of Gettysburg simulation game. Your units do battle on a high quality mounted map which features various terrain types including streams, roads, woods, towns, railroads and stone walls in this game of America's bloodiest battle.

title: Extreme Rock Climbers
description: YOU control your climber up the terrain of this mountain. It's over 2' tall! Special magnetic grippers that you wear on your fingers make contact with your climber's hands. Try to get to smoother paths if you can as flags mark how far you have gone. Position your climber on a hook if you need to plan you next move. But don't wait too long! After three climbs, the player who has climbed the most distance wins!

title: Animal Twister
description: Animal Twister differs from regular Twister in that there is no spinner and you use cards representing animals and limbs. The object of this game is to be first to place a hand or foot on the animal called and you win the card, who ever has the most animal cards when the cards run out is the winner. This is from Milton Bradley's a stockin' feet game series.

title: Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends Domino Game
types: Children's Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Trains
description: A children's game of dominoes. The pieces are made of thick cardboard showing two engines on each card. The game can be played as a memory game similar to concentration or a simple matching game. The game helps develop memory, color and shape recognition.

title: Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends ABC Game
types: Children's Game Educational Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Trains Word Game
description: This is a children's matching game to learn the alphabet. Each left piece is a letter and the right piece is an Engine whose name starts with that letter.

title: Space Race Expansion Kit
description:
This is an expansion for Fantasy Unlimited's Space Race game.  It is actually bigger than the original, with 63 pages of optional rules and new scenarios.

The new optional rules include

Delay mission
Production costs
Quality control
Safety
Altitude records
Duration records
Publicity
Advanced mission planning
Rescue mission
Budget cuts  overruns
Insurance
Espionage  counterespionage
New types of satellites

The new scenarios are

Original game with new charts
Space in the 1970s
Combining missions
Campaign game
Historical game (US vs USSR)
Business player (has to make a profit)
Solitaire scenarios
Mini-games (short scenarios)

Expands:

    Space Race

title: Trekkers: Genocide
description:
This is a futuristic checkers style of game, and you even get spaceships based upon very familiar themes, shows, or genres that are very easy to recognize. The acrylic gameboard is 3-sided with triangular areas depicted upon this allowing for a third player to be introduced if so desired.  You also get to choose which two kinds of spaceships you'd like for this, from a selection of over a dozen available types.

In the box: 
Acrylic gameboard
Rules
2-sets of metal-cast polished pewter spaceships
A cloth storage bag for those pieces

You have to order an additional set of the spaceships if you want to play a 3-Player game.

title: Bandito
description:
from the publisher website:
Hands up! the bank robbers shout as they ride at full gallop into the western town. This quiet little town has never seen so much action as the sheriff gets a posse together to chase after the robbers. Is it the man with the beard or perhaps the one with the red scarf? The player who recognizes the robber in the wanted poster first, receives a deputy badge. He can only be made sheriff if he manages to catch more than one robber. Contents: 24 cards, 1 picture frame, 1 sheriffs star, 5 deputy stars, instructions

title: Doppia Coppia
description:
Doppia Coppia appears to be a game in a series, TuttiGiochi, published by Dal Negro. The 1987 F. X. Schmid copyright implies it may have been publisehd by that company too. Other games in the TuttiGiochi series (listed in the rules leaflet) are 'Micio-Gatto', 'Gioco Dei Nomi', 'Roulette Scozzese', 'La Torre Di Babele' and 'Sole, Luna E Stelle'.

Doppia Coppia means 'two pairs' in Italian, and reflects the objective of the game - to form a square using two pairs of pieces in two different colours. This simple abstract game for two players consists of a 5-by-5 square board, 5 red pieces and 5 yellow pieces. Pieces of the same colour start in a row at opposite ends of the board and players take turns to move a piece of their colour one square at a time orthogonally. A piece may also jump over one other piece as a move. The central square on the board is occupied by a four-leaf clover and pieces may not enter this square nor jump over it. A player wins when he or she makes a move that completes a square (I interpret this to be a 2-by-2 square) containing 2 red and 2 yellow pieces (the two colours may be side-by-side or crossing diagonally).

title: Catchpenny
description:
Use the money of old England to buy, sell and trade with each other.  Buy My Wares? cards make every sale a different one.

Build the largest mon-o-polies of street pedlars and tradespeople.  Beware, you can lose pedlars in many situations and there are many pitfalls for the careless!

Money will come and go, and for those who find themselves with none, arrest and Debtor's Prison are only a step away.

Catchpenny includes a game board, 6 pawns, two dice, 40 Street Pedlar cards, 12 State Lottery tickets, 11 Arrest Warrant cards, 36 Dame Fortune's Tricks cards, 36 Buy My Wares? cards, the Bailiff playing piece and 144 coins representing Crowns, Shillings, Sixpence and Pence, and 8-page Rules booklet.

title: Robot Rampage:  Rise of the Appliance
types: Card Game Fighting Humor Science Fiction
description:
This is the first non-RPG game from 3am Games, a new company whose first release was in June 2004.  Robot Rampage:  Rise of the Appliance, a beer-and-pretzels style card game, is due out in June, 2005.

From the back of the box:

You're tinkers and engineers who have come to the scrap yard to test your mettle.  From parts and pieces carefully picked from heaps of junk, construct killer robots capable of visiting devastation and ruin upon all who oppose them.  Then, send them into a no-holds-barred, anything goes bot battle to see who's got the roughest robot in the scrap yard!  Well, maybe these bots aren't that threatening.  But it's still fun to let 'em duke it out!

title: War of the Daleks
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Based on the popular Dr Who baddies War of the Daleks is a kind of sci-fi Space-Ludo with Daleks!

The game involves moving card Dr Who figures around a circular playing area aiming to get to the control center whilst avoiding the Daleks. The Daleks themselves are faithful plastic renditions about three quarters of an inch tall, inserted into concentric slots cut into the board. When the pale blue control centre hub in the middle of the board is rotated, the card disc underpinning these concentric slots also rotate, causing the Daleks to move around the board and capture hapless players.

If a player makes it to the central hub, they have a chance to destroy the control centre by lifting it up. Doing so reveals four panels one of which depicts the King Dalek.  If he's next to you he exterminates you and you start again!

title: Vierzig Vagabunden
description:
Each player draws a card to determine their playing colour, which remains secret during the game. The players try to distribute 40 pawns in four colours in such a way that each field on the board (8x5) will be occupied only by one single pawn.  The eight rows will be scored at the end of the game. Players reveal the colour and receive victory points for having the most pawns in their colour per row. The player with the most victory points wins the game.

Edition Spielbox No. 57

title: Die Eroberung von Morundir
description: In Conquest for Morundir two players fight it out on a hex-tiled game board and steer their pawns (three dukes and six knights) to victory. First player to conquer castle Morundir (the hex field in the middle of the board) with one of their dukes or to eliminate the other players three dukes wins the game.

title: Planet Quest
types: Children's Game Educational Space Exploration Trivia
description:
The first animal in space was a dog. True or False? The sun is a star. True or False? Learning about our solar system is much more than memorizing planets! Its full of fascinating facts. Earn planet cards for correct answers. Put the planets in the right order, and you win! 
  
 Blast off into a learning journey through space! Be the first to collect          all the planets in the solar system by answering the True/False question          cards. Watch out for the black hole, asteroid belt and supernova - you          might get lost in space!

* Teaches fascinating facts about our solar system 
        * Planet Fact Sheet Included 
        * Includes two challenging levels of game play 
  
         Contents: 
         Planet Quest         Board Game - unfolds to 48 across! 
         4 Astronaut Game Pieces 
         Spinner 
         Guide 
         132 Game Cards 
         Planet Facts

title: Glück, Verstand und Edelsteine
description: Luck, Wit and Gemstones is a tile placement game. The tiles are divided into simple geometric shapes in four different colors, red, green, blue and yellow. Many tiles will also show one or two gemstones. Players place tiles and build complete chamber-like structures in their respective colors and try at the same time to maximize the number of gems that are enclosed in the chambers. Person with the most gemstones in closed, finished chambers of their color wins the game.

title: Titanic Trivia
description: The Titanic Trivia Board game includes 1000 questions tastefully presented in four levels: Novice, Cruiser, Buff and Historian. Players will be asked critical facts about the building of the ship, the ship's decor, the journey, the crew, the tragedy, and the aftermath. Participants from the casual movie viewer to the hard core historian will thoroughly enjoy this exciting game.

title: The Self-Esteem Game
description: Play the game that builds, boosts and bolsters Self-Esteem!  You'll start your journey under a cloud in Mopesville and make your way toward feeling good good good about yourself! You'll get brainwashed with positive affirmations and learn to cope with problems along the way. Whether or not you're the first to finish, you'll get a lot of out of playing The Game Where Everybody's a Winner!

title: Onto the Desert
description:
Take a wild trek Onto the Desert. Play this exciting interactive          game of survival and become a part of the intricate web of desert life.  Beautifully illustrated cards represent plants and animals that are found in the desert.  Element cards represent the powerful forces of          nature. 
Reveal the awesome balance of nature as you follow the chain of life found in the desert.

title: Pirates!  Miniature Battles on the High Seas
description:
From back cover :

It is time for your miniature armies to join the navy!  Now you can finally add naval, shore, for, and fleet encounters in your 25mm miniature gaming!

Game Features:

     Historical Rules!  Ships and ordinance are based on historical examples, as well as national differences in crew types. C.1400-1650!
     Fantasy Rules! Magic spells, fantasy races, fell beasts, and more!
     A plethora of vessels, both sailing and oared, with the option to design your own!
     Heavy ordinance, small arms, boarding actions and Ramming - mayhem for everyone!
     Custom design rules for star forts, shore batteries, bastions, and buildings!
     Expand your games with a complete campaign system that doesn't bog down!
     Easy to learn and play! Skill is more important that luck, but luck doesn't hurt!

title: Marathon Beginner's
description:
From the box:

The MARATHON BEGINNERS edition is a highly educational question-answer game, prepared under pedagogical supervision specially for children of elementary school age.

MARATHON BEGINNERS has more than 2500 questions about school and cultural matters, classified in three difficulty levels.  240 cards use vivid graphics of famous people, monuments, animals, and many other familiar object to stimulate your childs imagination and memory.

Your child will begin a 10 Kilometer run against IGG KNORANZ, the mightiest representative of the imaginary country I-DONT-KNOW.

title: Yankee Trader
description:
Players start from San Francisco on an around the world trading trip. By buying and selling wisely at various ports around the world players may make a profitable voyage.

Players start with 10,000 in cash which is used to invest in various goods that are available at different ports along the way.

First player to get to New York gets a bonus payoff for being the fastest finisher.

Whoever makes the most money on the trip wins the game

The game itself is simple. 16 tiles are played from a pool of tiles. The player unable to play a tile loses. There are several rules about playing a tile, but it is basically like dominoes.

The 16 tiles each are laid out with a 3x3 grid which can or can not have a pip in each spot in the grid, but the center spot never has a pip in it. There are none to eight pips along the edges of the tiles.

title: Monopoly: Duel Masters
types: Economic Movies / TV / Radio theme Negotiation
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
Join aspiring duelist Shobu and his friends in this special Monopoly edition. All your favorite characters and creatures are included as you move around the board to build up your Duel Masters deck. Collect creatures and spells from all of the five civilizations to become the best duelist in the game!

You can play the standard Monopoly game, buying and selling creatures and properties, or you can add the special gameplay to make this adventure even more exciting.

Contents:
 6 Collectible Duel Masters Tokens! Shobu, Mimi, Knight, Hakuoh, Kyoshiro, Rekuta
 Gameboard
 28 Title Deed cards
 16 Creatures cards
 16 Spells cards
 6 Duel Masters character tokens
 1 pack of Duel Masters Monopoly money
 32 houses
 12 hotels
 2 standard dice
 Instructions

title: Stratego: Duel Masters
description:
Duel Masters Stratego is an advanced version of Stratego set in the famous Anime setting. Unlike most classic game re-themes, Duel Masters Stratego introduces rules changes that allow the game to stand on its own.

From the game's box:

When the forces face off- who will survive?

It's a face off between all of the five forces! When Light, Nature and Water take on the fearless armies of Darkness and Fire- which team will capture the enemy's flag.

Like the Kaijudo Masters themselves, STRATEGO puts you in command of armored vehicles and ruthless creatures. Mark your territory and advance your forces on the gameboard.

title: The Game of Bombardment
description:
The Game of Bombardment recreates naval battle during the Spanish-American War. It is played with either 2 players, or four players in partnership. A spinner is used to determine bombardment values, and play continues until one fleet or the other is sunk.

Contents: spinner, 10 markers in each color, rules printed on game box lid, and a lovely illustration of shore-cannons engaging a naval fleet.

title: Mega Raider
description:
From the promotional blurb:

Wealth and power beyond your wildest dreams are yours...by building a fortune in companies and cash. Outwit and out bluff other players when you secretly bid to takeover their companies. Top secret information and late-breaking news add to the excitement.

Contents:
board, 2 dice, 6 player tokens, spinner, bid forms, play money, rules, stock cards, and event cards.

title: Turn or Burn
description: Turn or Burn is a print-and-play game of space fighter combat for 2 to 8 players.  To start a game, players design their fighters from a deck of system cards.  Each turn, players plot a single action by playing a system or maneuver card face down.  After everyone has played a card, the actions are revealed.  Movement is governed by Newtonian mechanics in 2 dimensions.  Combat is resolved by pulling cards from a hand made up of the target fighters system cards plus a number of miss cards based on range and other factors.

title: Whickers World
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Travel Trivia
description:
A Family game for 2-6 players themed loosely around the TV Series Whickers World.

Components:

Gameboard
250 Question Cards (2000 questions)
Dice
Counters
Rules

Players move round the board through a combination of dice throws and answering questions from the cards.

During his turn a player earns the right to move any of his or her four counters by correctly answering the first question (of 6) on a card - this question normally refers to a picture on the reverse of the card.

The distance moved is determined by dice roll - this roll also being used to determine the number of the next question to be answered (from the same card).  If the player answers the question correctly they may roll the dice again and have another question asked (from the same card).  Play continues in this manner until a question is answered incorrectly or the same number is rolled twice on that particular card.  It is then the next player's turn.

Movement is also influenced by certain of the cards and instructions written on the board.

There is also an element of tactical play in that landing one of your counters on the same square as another player's counter you send that counter back to that player's start point.

The winner is the first player to take all of their four counters around the world (the board) from their start to their finish point.

title: MechWar 2: Suez to Golan
description:
Suez to Golan is a very detailed simulation of tactical combat during the October War of 1973. In addition to being published separately, the game was also published as one half of the two game package Mech War 2 (Red Star/White Star II is the other half of the set.)

Key aspects of Suez to Golan include: The issuance of commands to companies, movement in both column and dispersed formations, infantry fatigue and resting, direct fire (by automatic weapons, main guns, and ATGMs), close assault, indirect fire, morale, minefields, aircraft and air defense, ammunition depletion, effects of night, river crossings, engineers, and electronic warfare.

The Arab and Israeli units are mostly platoons. Each hex is 200 meters across and each game-turn represents five minutes.

The game has 800 counters and two mapsheets. One map depicts the Suez Canal and environs, and the other depicts a region in the Golan Heights.

There are thirteen scenarios in Suez to Golan. A comprehensive guide to scenario design is also included.


    Components :


Map:            22 x 34 single sheet
Counters:        800 pieces
Rulebook:        1 standard; 1 exclusive


    Stats :


Average Playing Time:        3-25 hours 
Number of Players:        Two-? Player
Complexity:            High
Suitability for Solitaire Play:    Moderate

title: MindRings
description:
The box cover invites you to Turn your Mind to the Challenge.

A four-in-a-row variant where the board is made of concentric rings that can be rotated.  Players place one peg at a time into empty spots and then use that peg to rotate the ring.

The game comes with standard and advanced rules; the advanced rules allow players to capture pairs of opponent's pegs.  In either set of rules, the first to get four of their pegs in a radial row wins.

title: Babble
description:
A fast paced, Bible based, outrageously fun game! Babble! is an exciting new Bible game with a fresh style of play.  Every player draws two cards and start calling out the words on the cards. Wait, did someone else just yell out cross? Yes! A match! Both players place their matching cards together. One player grabs a die and rolls it while the other player calls out odd or even. If the guessing player guesses right, that player gets the match! If not, the player rolling the die gets the match. Each match is worth one point. The players then draw a new card and start calling out words again. Its so simple!
 The game contains six decks of cards with each deck being a different category.  The six Categories are Symbols, Books, Places, People, Animals, and Things found in the Bible.  Each card has five words related to that category.  After playing through all six decks the player with the most points wins the game!
 Babble! is a terrific game for a large number of players. It is great to play with friends, family, and church groups!

title: Leviathan
mechanisms: Dice RollingSimultaneous Action SelectionVariable Phase Order
description:
A fast playing 25mm table top fantasy battle system. Though any number can play it's best to keep the combatants to no more than four players. An alternate movement system generates unique tactical situations during the course of a turn and allows intelligent strategists to act and react according to plans they set in motion.

Players select a race to field and the appropriate miniatures and design each scenario on a points-based army build system. D20's are used to resolve all combat and other effects. The game comes with photo copyable templates, rosters and counters.

title: You Be the Judge
description:
You Be The Judge - The game of Real Life Court Dramas.

You be the Judge contains brief descriptions of 500 court cases from around the world.

Players divide themselves into two teams and take it in turns to decide on the outcome of a court case.

One person from Team A selects a card from the box and reads it out loud to Team B, who then have the opportunity to consult with each other before announcing whether they, the jury, are FOR or AGAINST. If they answer correctly then they advance 0, 1, 2, 3 places round the scoreboard, dependant on the number thrown on a dice. If they answer incorrectly, their turn ends immediately.

Team B now reads a case to Team A, who in turn, deliberate and announce their findings . And so on...

The game ends after one Team has completed a circuit of the board (16 spaces).

title: 18GM: The 18XX GameMaster
description:
18GM is an 18xx game development kit.  It features a modular board that allows virtually endless scenarios to be developed.  The game as printed includes one basic scenario, the Aurora Limited, and several variations on it.

Some of the interesting ideas in 18GM are:

1. Tycoons.  These are like private companies in standard 18xx, but allow various special abilities in the stock round, such as exceeding certificate limits or exchanging for shares in the bank pool or initial offering.

2. Buying on Margin: buying a share by paying half now, and half during the next stock round.

3. Making a Market: the president may reduce the price of the Initial Offering shares if the company remains unfloated.

title: Auburnopoly
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingDice RollingPlayer EliminationRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock Holding
description: This is the Auburn University themed version of Monopoly. Unique properties include Toomer's Corner, Jordan Hare Stadium, and Samford Hall. Houses and Hotels are replaced by Credit Hours and Diplomas.

title: Arne Junior
types: Animals Card Game Children's Game Educational Party Game
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemCard DraftingSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
Arne Junior is the simplified version of Arne classic. The game is playable from the age of 5 and takes about 10-25 minutes to play. artwork on the cards is based on aquarelle hand painting.

pick a fruit. The one to collect most fruits of his color wins. but...you really can do everything to prevent the other players of obtaining exactly this.
You can steal cards, change places, pass on your hand to the next player and play before it is your turn. Also there are big hungry birds flying around on the look out for fruit!

Arne is available in a designer metal tin with instructions in English, German, French and Dutch.

title: Holey Cow!
description:
From the Publisher:

The UDDERLY INCREDIBULL CARD GAME! Pass and stack your cow cards, count the holes in the Holey Cows and guess whether you have the most or the fewest holes. To win, count up your points and be the first cow to cross the pasture.
Features the pictures of the world renowned CowParade cows!

title: Scooby-doo! Coolsville 500
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description:
From the Publisher:

Start your engines! It's time for the Coolsville 500-the coolest, fastest race in town. Earn MPH cards that help speed you around the track, but be careful: the Monsters are in the pits! The first player to complete 5 laps wins.

title: Math Around The Home
description:
From the Publishers:

Introduce problem solving challenges that occur in everyday life around the home. Math drill includes basic addition and subtraction of time, temperature, money, metrics, and liquid measurement. For example: Large eggs weigh about two ounces. How many ounces will one dozen eggs weigh?

title: Bank Account
description:
From the Publisher:

Can you balance your checking account? Players learn a variety of processes involved in having a checking account. As they play around the gameboard, they write checks, make deposits, and keep accurate records. Real-life transactions include buying groceries, paying taxes, making car payments and paying medical bills. Checks, deposit slips, and currency from $1 to $100 are included.

title: Allowance
types: Children's Game Economic Educational Math Number
description:
From the Publisher:

Allowance provides a great way to teach young people about earning and saving money, as well as wisely making special purchases. Game cards indicate a task like mowing lawns and cleaning the garage. Choices are made, as in real life, whether to spend money on ice cream, or put it into savings. Coin chips from one cent to fifty cents and currency from $1 to $5 are included.

title: FotoCaccia
types: Animals Card Game Children's Game Memory
description:
From the Kidult website:

Fotocaccia is a visual memory game. In a few seconds you have to memorize the opponents pets and here starts the Fotocaccia. Enrich your treasure as much as you can.
The winner is the one who manages to click more animals (that is to catch them with photo clicks). An easy and quick game for Kidults and kids. But be careful, children are terrific at this game!

title: Laserburn
description:
Laserburn is a set of science fiction skirmish rules, with roughly 12 to 20 figures a side.  It originated as rules for simulating firefights in science fiction role playing games, but soon grew into a set of stand-alone skirmish rules.

Laserburn uses 15mm scale, the basic rulebook is 40 pages in length.  Weapons covered are Lasers, bolters, slug gunes, grenade and missile launchers and conversion beams.  Armour include flak, mesh, light, power and dreadnought armor.

A number of supplements and scenarios were published for Laserburn as well.

title: The Battle of the Alma
description: 1854. Three scenarios for the French (and Turkish) attack, the British attack, and the Alma Campaign. Two 34 x 22 maps. 300 double-sided die-cut counters. 75 yards per hex, 100 men per strength point. The chief focus of the game is leadership, with each leader having a Command Rating, a Command Span, and a Combat Bonus Rating. Morale, facing, and formation built into the counters.

title: F*ck This! (Imperialist Warmongers)
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Mature / Adult Party Game Word Game
description:
from the publisher: A 29-card expansion set for F*ck This! A set of cards that jump on Osama and his ilk, with a few slaps at the media and politicians while we're at it.

Expansion #3 of F*ck This!.

title: F*ck This! (Keeping It Clean)
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Mature / Adult Word Game
description:
From the publisher: A 29-card expansion for F*ck This! A set of cards that you can use to substitute into the main game for use with those who have more delicate sensibilities than you. Only 29 cards might not be enough to pull it off, but it's a start.

Expansion #4 of F*ck This!.

55 is a stand alone game, and also a 55 dice expansion for Spiel.  There are enough dice included to build a smaller version of the traditional pyramid from Das Spiel.  Additional colors and game rules are included to expand the selection of games for Das Spiel.  In fact Reinhold Wittig is not the only designer of this collection - there are many games designed by various authors.

Expands:

    Das Spiel

title: Warmachine: Apotheosis
types: Book Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Miniatures Wargame
description:
From the publisher's website:

This 144 page full-color expansion advances the Warmachine storyline and adds new warjacks and warcasters.

Warmachine: Apotheosis introduces new rules that improve the depth of play and enrich the gaming experience for new and veteran players alike. In addition to new warcasters, some old favorites return with new abilities and updated models to reflect advancement and changes to their characters. The book also includes a new map-based campaign system providing story-driven play.

Expands:

    Warmachine

title: Warmachine: Escalation
types: Book Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Miniatures Wargame
description:
From the publisher's website:

Escalation is a 240 page supplement to Warmachine, including stats and rules for dozens of new additions to Warmachine armies, storyline fiction, a campaign, and a full color feature from the renowned 3D department of Privateer Press.

Expands:

    Warmachine

title: Fragrances
description: FRAGRANCES, The Perfect Blend of Art, Perfume and Game, put out by SentoSphere, Paris, France, in 1990. Description: An amusing original family game about perfume. 2-6 players. Age 12 and up. Contents: 24 scent bottles of essences, 5 women's perfume, 3 men's perfume, one mounted playing board, 8 perfume cards, 6 tokens, 1 die, 54 chips, 30 counters, 33 playing cards, rules. This game teaches you about perfume and its various classifications. The essences used in the game were selected from numerous essence producers to give you an idea of the wide range of materials used in the perfume industry.

title: Poker's Wild
description: Score the most points by creating the best poker hand possible using up to any 5 consecutive cards (your card and up to 4 cards adjacent to it- either vertically or horizontally) on the game board on each turn.

title: Food Fight
description:
From the publisher: 
Chef Alfredo is caught in the middle of a food fight! Children grab their forks and fling their meatballs at the chef as he spins round and round.  The first player to stick all of their meatballs on the chef wins. Have some food flinging fun... with no mess to cleanup! Game includes 12 meatballs, 4 flinging forks an 1 spinning chef.

title: Calamityville
types: American West City Building Economic Humor
description:
The game is set under the gold rush boom and bust. Players build up the town during the boom and the town goes broke under the bust. 
Much of the action is centered on the donkey in the middle of the board. When a player draws a Donkey Goes Wild! card, it bucks its legs to knock down players' buildings. The player with the most assets when the Gold Runs Out card is drawn wins.

Game includes 4 characters, 13 buildings, 1 bucking donkey, property deeds, newspaper cards, money, gold nuggets, 2 dice, game board and instructions.

title: Catch That Kiwi
description:
From Box:  Kuru, the rare giant KIWI is hungry again. He decides to visit his four favorite shops. But the Kiwi Catchers have other ideas and set out to catch the big Kiwi before he returns to the safety of his rain forest home. Watch Out Kiwi - don't get caught.
Object of the game: The winner is the player who finally catches The Kiwi OR the Kiwi who has visited all four shops and returns safely to the forest.

title: Exploration: The Seismic Game of Oil and Gas
description:
From the Rules:

The game of Exploration is a realistic model of the daily events and excitement in an Oil  Gas Exploration Department
Players will instantly find themselves making decisions regarding where to drill, where to run seismic surveys, and how much to bid for prospective land parcels.

Game components include the Drilling Tool (a plastic oil rig with a long pin), the Seismic Tool (a plastic box with iron filings), money, player's score sheets, 4 different-colored Land Owner markers, colored pins to mark drilled wells (White= Dry, Yellow= Average, Red= Super Producers, Black= Wildcat), Crown Land Sale markers, Hazard cards, Windfall cards, and a gameboard with movable multi-stepped, multi-sized Oil Reservoirs placed inside (with magnets embedded in some of the 'super' producing regions).

title: People & Places in The Book
description:
A Bible trivia game a bit different from the usual Trivial Pursuit style.

There are six questions to each answer, in decreasing difficulty (6 being the most difficult).  In this game, players progress along a game track.  Movement forward (or backward for incorrect answers) is determined by the level of difficulty you are attempting.

There are several types of square, which determine who may answer the question.  A solo square means only the person whose marker is on the square may answer.  A Free-For-All square means all players have the opportunity to answer.  A Proxy square means the active player chooses another player to answer for them; the active player advances on the correct answer, but the proxy goes back if they answer incorrectly.  A Blitz square allows everyone to answer as the active player reads the clues from most difficult to easiest.  As soon as someone answers correctly, they and the active player move ahead the number of squares matching the level of clue that was the question was answered on.

Each players turn finishes after one move.

There are also Providence cards, which usually result in either going forward or back a number of squares.

First to reach the finish square wins.

title: Can't Cook, Won't Cook
types: Educational Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description:
Based on the BBC Television Series of the same name, Can't Cook, Won't Cook is a lighthearted family game for 2 to 6 players Ages 10 and up

From the box:

They say If you can't stand the heat then get out of the kitchen! the same is true of this exciting, fast paced family action packed board game.
It's a race to get your ingredients for a perfect meal traveling up and down the board a few times to collect them. sounds simple...well it would hardly be based on the hit TV show, if it were that easy!!
Firstly, it's against the clock, then it's against another player, then you have to answer some Can't Cook or Won't Cook questions, oh and did we mention you could be rolling the pastry, tossing the pancake, chopping the herbs, stirring the pans....

The objective is to move around the board in order to collect points. Points are collected as you collect ingredient tokens. The game ends when the first player has collected all 5 ingredients. Movement is determined by dice roll with each player taking turns to have one minute (a sand timer is provided) to move and accomplish as much as they can.

The spaces on the board dictate the activities to be undertaken on them. These include:
- collecting an ingredient, 
- pausing for a cup of tea (rolling until you get a 2),
- answering questions (cookery related - involving choosing your answer from a choice of four) or 
- performing an action - stir the pan, roll the pastry, chop the herbs or toss the pancake (the equipment for which is all included with the game)

title: Limbo
description:
Limbo - How Low Can You Go?

Components:
5 Limbo Blocks (wooden blocks (5cm x 5cm x 13cm)
1 Limbo Bar (wooden block (0.5cm x 5cm x 13cm) with Velcro pad
1 Limbo-low-nose (with Velcro pad)

The five limbo blocks are stacked on top of each other on the floor with the limbo bar on the top.  Players take it in turns to wear the Limbo-low-nose and bend over an pick up the limbo bar with their nose.  This must be achieved with only the feet in contact with the floor.  Each player has three attempts - players who cannot do this, or touch the floor with any part of their body other than their feet are eliminated.

Once everyone has succeeded or been eliminated the bar is lowered by removing one of the limbo blocks so that the limbo bar is now resting on four blocks.  Players now attempt at this height.

Play continues in this way, gradually reducing the height of the bar until either only one player is left or until at least two players have successfully picked up the bar from the floor.  If this happens all five blocks are placed under the limbo bar again, and the exercise repeated, but this time players are only allowed to stand on one foot!

title: Delta Force
description:
DELTA FORCE - The Game of Strategy, Confrontation and Capture.  Outwit your opponent in a cunning campaign of sacrifice and counter-sacrifice.

Each player has fourteen triangular pieces numbered from 1 to 14.  These are arranged in a matrix on each player's side of board.

Once placed the counters are moved forward towards the center of the board where counters from both sides come face to face in the attack position.  The highest number wins each confrontation.

The winner is the player to capture the most Delta Force counters.

title: Prehistoric Settlements
description:
From the website:

Set about 50,000 years B.C. in an age of hunter gathers, and the last of the strange large mammals, such as Woolly Mammoths, Sabre-tooth Tigers and Giant Birds, the game is a mixture of board games and wargames and was a daunting task to create. It was easy all we had to do was make it simple and quick to play, whilst still blending in a level of complexity that would keep the players interest alive. Well, I am sure that we have succeeded in doing just that. Using a mixture of Metal Miniatures, Resin Buildings and Cards and Counters, there is very little note taking and working out involved as the counters and cards remove this aspect, and the player is free to work on the most important aspect of the game strategy, and this is what the game is really about!

At the beginning of the game all the players start with the same amount of pieces and the basic idea of the game is to grow your settlement faster than the other players, buying Figures and Buildings with game tokens as you go along, hopefully avoiding Natural Disasters and other unforeseen incidents.The game can be played by 2 or 4 players and is for Ages 14 and up and is fun for families as well as boardgamers  wargamers.

A great deal of time and effort was put into the design of the game pieces, which are very detailed. The same figures are used for each different tribe, which are just painted differently. Spears  Shields are cast separately, but come with the figures that they are intended for. The rules are well printed complete with a color cover, and are packed with black  white illustrations. The game tokens are printed in color, on white card.

To sum up, this was daunting but great fum to create, and to play-test, of which there were many games. There isn't a game like it on the market that I know of, and I know that those who buy a set are going to find it an appealing and tactical game. The more you play the game the faster it becomes and the more you will find that you have learned since the last time you played it.

Currently there are 2 expansions that add Shamans and water taskings:

- The Savage Seas 
- Out of the Wilderness

Check more info at the homepage:
http://www.sbarber-models.clara.net/html/settlement.html

or the yahoo group: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/steve_barber_models/

title: Operation Husky
description:
It's June 11, 1943 and the Allies are ashore on Sicily...the race to Messina has begun. As the Allied player, you have 12 division of Americans, Canadians and British. In all, 467,000 troops commanded by two of the Allies's best....Your objectives are to sweep the Axis off the island.

The game was published in Combat! #9.

title: Dino-Czars
description:
Back in the days when the great plains were ruled by dinosaurs, the local Tyrannosaurus came to you and your dinosaur friends with a proposition you couldn't refuse: help eliminate the neighboring Tyrannosaurus to open up a new food supply, and you and your friends won't get eaten. Your brain is the size of a walnut, so this 'not getting eaten' bit sounded like a pretty good idea. Little did you realize that the neighboring Tyrannosaurus had the same idea. Who will be the next Dino-Czar?

Dino-Czars is a shogi-like game where the object is to capture the opposing Tyrannosaurus. Up to two captured pieces can re-spawn by hatching eggs, but gestation takes time and causes a player to lose tempo. A computer version is available for the Zillions of Games engine.

title: Little Polar Bear Memory Game
description:
The Little Polar Bear Memory is based on the traditional game of memory and can be played that way, with players turning over cards, two at a time, trying to find as many matched pairs as possible through luck or by remembering the location of the cards.
The game has 30 regular picture pairs and 12 special Little Polar Bear cards. This addition makes five variations of the traditional game possible. Some of these are easier to play; some are more challenging and difficult.

title: The Great Gumball Game
description:
From the box:

Pop the Gumball, Match the Color, Win the Game!

Take your own miniature machine, press down the dome, and watch the colored gumball rise to the top!  Match the color of the gumball to the next matching-colored space on the board.  Youre on your way!

title: The Masters of the Universe Role Playing Game
types: Adventure Comic Book / Strip Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemCo-operative PlayRole Playing
description: Skeletor and his evil minions have stolen the Crown Jewels, secreting them away in Snake Mountain. Now He-Man and his companions have entered Skeletor's hideaway deep beneath Snake Mountain to retrieve the lost treasure. In this exciting and fast-paced game, players become the forces of good. As they explore the depths of Skeletor's hideout, searching for the treasure, they will  encounter monsters and evil characters, which will try to stop them. Only their cunning will help unless they can find the magic gemstones that will defeat Skeletor's evil.

title: Nobunaga Fuun-roku
description:
This is a Japanse wargame on the battles of Nobunaga, part of Sengoku Gunyu-den series games designed by Makoto Fukuda.

Basic Designer: Makoto Fukuda
System Designer: Hideaki Uehara

title: Champion of the East
description: This is a Japanese DTP wargame on warfare in medieval Japan, the map can be linked to Hero of the West.

title: Hero of the West
description: This is a Japanese DTP game on warfare in Medieval Japan. Can be linked to the game Champion of the East.

title: Chu Han War BC 206-203
description: This is a Japanese DTP wargame on warfare in ancient China.

title: Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ: Dakar
description: This is a Japanese wargame set on the anime world of Gundam ZZ.

title: Hideyoshi Gunki
description:
This is 5th game of the "Sengoku Gunyuden" series.
This game features Hideyoshi Toyotomi in his path to the throne.
Hideyoshi fits into the era between Nobunaga and Tokugawa.

Three scenarios are included in this game. Mt. Tennō is represent the battle of Yamazaki, Hideyoshi against Akechi Mitsuhide the betrayer. Shizugatake is represent the battle of Shizugatake, Hideyoshi against Shibata Katsuie the most powerfull general in Oda clan. Masters' Championship is represent the battle of Komaki and Nagakute, Hideyoshi against Tokugawa Ieyasu the great general in field battle. The length of 3 scenarios is from 8 to 12 turns. There are some a lot of appearance units, but any scenarios are playable.

Each players control one or more clans. The clan's combat units is organized to some troops. 
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The action that can be selected is a movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

Victor of the games is the player who got more victory points. The victory point is provided by the holding of the castle and the removal of the enemy units.

SCALE: Each hex of map is roughly 6000 meters. Each game turn represents one week of real time. Each combat units represents about 1000 soldiers.

title: Combined Fleet
description:
This is the first game of Bandai if Series.

It is rumored that this is the best selling wargame in Japan ever!
In fact, this is a family game with wargame design technique.
You have ZOC with battleship counter and retreat into EZOC means ELIMINATION!
Combat is resolved by playing cards.

title: Yukimura Gaiden
description:
Tactical game on the final siege of Castle Osaka.
Title is taken from one of Japanese folk hero Yukimura Sanada.
He led the small special selected warriors into the horde of Tokugawa army and tried to kill the Tokugawa Ieyasu himself!

title: Height 203
description:
This game is on the climatic battle (or massacre) for Port Arthur during Russo-Japanese War.
Here Japanese lost horrendous casualties by the combination of fearsome firepower and solid entrenchment of Russians.
This battle became the prophesy of the trench warfare of WW1.

title: Midgard
description: Japanese Fantasy wargame on the final battle between the Norse gods.

title: The Siege of Osaka, Summer campaign
description:
Tactical game on the final siege of Castle Osaka.
Title is taken from one of Japanese folk hero Yukimura Sanada.
He led the small special selected warriors into the horde of Tokugawa army and tried to kill the Tokugawa Ieyasu himself!

Published by Bandai.

title: Saga
description:
From the box:

Stimulating and absorbing, SAGA is an exciting chase through our Island's wonderful story and its fascinating legends.

The islands in this case being the British Isles.

The game comprises:

A board consisting of an outer circle and an inner spiral.
6 Playing Pieces
Pack of 36 SAGA cards (6 sets of 6 cards - each showing the date and details of a significant event in British history)
Pack of 16 BLACK SPOT cards (also showing other events in British history)
Dice
SAGA Bonds (money)

Traveling around the outside circle of the board each player has to try and collect five SAGA cards, each of a different color.  As each card is collected the player claims its cash value from the Exchequer (Bank).

When the cash and five cards have been amassed, the player then moves to the center spiral and races towards the finish.  Each time a player lands on a Black Spot he must pay the penalty as shown on a BLACK SPOT card.

The winner is the first player to reach the finish without going bankrupt.  Bankrupt players still have a chance to win - by going back to the start and beginning the journey through history again.

title: Auf Zack!!
description:
The game has 44 picture tiles in pairs, showing items like snails, nails, stars, churches and so on. Each tile has a different number of the item. The game also has a set of numbered wooden discs. I think the players must identify the total when both tiles match, so 4 mice and 6 mice makes 10 mice.

Ages 5 and up.

title: Billo
description:
Perfect information, no luck involved abstract strategy game.

A checkers variant on the classic 8*8 square board.

Every player has two kinds of pieces: round ones and square ones. Square pieces have an hole and round pieces fit into the hole, so two pieces of the same color of different shapes can share the same space.

Square pieces capture opponent's round ones.
Round pieces capture opponent's square ones.

Pieces that reach the opposite side of the board become more powerful, as in checkers.

title: Ping Win
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Dice
description:
Each player has 4 penguins.  Place your penguins on the board and roll a die to move your penguin.  Because of this movement other penguins get closer to the edge of the iceberg. The purpose is to keep your penguins as long as possible on the iceberg. Push other penguins off the ice and win.

From the back of Iceberg box:
The object of the game is to have the only remaining penguin or penguins left on the iceberg by pushing opponent's penguins off the iceberg.
Each player chooses four penguins of the same color and places these on the correctly coloured dots on the playing board. By rolling the die players move either 1, 2 or 3 places to the left or right in order to push other penguins nearer to the edge of the iceberg. or even into the water. A penguin pushed into the water is out of the game. The game is over when only one player's penguin or penguins remain on the iceberg and this one remaining player is the winner.

From the back of the Ping Win box:

The comical penguins have a rare old time playing at pushing each other off the ice floe. The last player to have a penguin or penguins left on the ice is the winner.

title: Strategy: The Game of Armies
description:
The game of Strategy is played upon a board representing a battlefield, between players who move pieces representing the soldiers and guns of opposing armies across the board and against each other in maneuvers resembling warfare.  Each player is equipped at the beginning of the game with an army of twenty playing pieces, sixteen representing soldiers and four representing guns.
