The board is divided into sectors, if a gun is in a sector, it controls the sector and captures all opposing pieces in the sector.  The object is to capture the enemy capital while preventing the enemy from doing the same.  A roll of the dice determines how many pieces a player may move in a turn.

title: Claydonia Conquers the World!
types: Expansion for Base-game Fighting Humor Party Game
description:
Claydonia Conquers the World! is an expansion rule set for Clay-O-Rama. Claydonia Conquers the World! was published in Dragon Magazine #144 pp. 28-31 April 1989. The original Clay-O-Rama game was also published in  Dragon Magazine (issue 125) by David Zeb Cook.

The original Clay-O-Rama had players make monsters (Claydonians) out of Play-Doh in order to battle each other. Powers from a list were assigned to each monster. Some Powers involve dice-rolling to hit, while others required actual physical actions such as throwing clay missiles or poking a finger through an opponent's monster.

In the Claydonia expansion there are Campaign rules and a list of 15 new Powers. The Campaign rules include Claydonian Experience Level Advancement so monsters who survive can get tougher. The new Powers include dreaded attacks such as Absorb Opponent, Use Self as Missile, and Stomp (in which a player uses a shoe or boot).

Expands:

    Clay-O-Rama

title: Boris Karloff's Monster Game
description: Boris Karloff's Monster Game is a simple spin-and-move game, following a preset path on the game board from start to finish. Along the way there are several detours to Haunted locations. Players move their game pieces along the track and encounter monsters, represented by 31 monster markers, one of which is a depiction of Boris Karloff himself.

title: Wolfman Mystery Game
description:
Wolfman Mystery Game is a roll-and-move game where players eventually intersect 8 different locations on the game board, such as Skeleton Heap and Headhunters' Isle. There are no shortcuts or detours. Two spinners are provided, one for movement, and the other one for monster encounters.

Contents; Board, 4 player markers with different colored bases, and 2 spinners built into the game box insert.

title: Celebrity Monstars
description:
A game for 2-6 players Ages 12 and up

Components:
6 Operating Tables
1 D8
104 Cards

The object of the game is to build a Monstar from parts of well known (in 1989) (mostly UK) Celebrities.

Each Monstar requires 7 parts - head, chest, right arm, left arm, stomach, right leg and left leg, and must be constructed in sequence.

Body parts are dealt from the pack with each player only retaining 3 cards in his or her hand.

There are essentially only two options available to a player during their turn:
Lay a body part card, or
Roll the dice.

Dependant on the dice roll a player will either:
-  Draw or nominate someone else to draw from a deck of event cards.  This generally results in gaining or losing body parts for/from your Monstar.
-  take a card from another player's hand
-  Steal body parts from an opponent's freezer.
-  Steal body parts from an opponent's partilaly completed Monstar.

First to complete his or her Monstar and bring it to life through the use of an Igor card is the winner.

title: Winner's Eye View
description:
Winner's Eye View is an auto racing game designed and published by a British race car driver and instructor.

The rules are fairly similar to those of the Avalon Hill version of Speed Circuit.  Cars are built by choosing levels of gearing, amount of fuel, type of tires, etc.  Speeds are chosen simultaneously on dashboards (which are also used to track fuel, tire wear, oil pressure, etc.) with maximum acceleration and braking amounts being observed (although you can exceed them if you roll for penalties).  Corners have maximum speeds posted in each space, although they can be exceeded for more penalty chart rolls or by staying on the racing line.  There are rules for slipstreaming and pitting.

The game elaborates somewhat on the basic Speed Circuit model.  It tracks wear separately for front and rear tires, has a few extra cornering rules, and has optional weather rules (this is where the different tire types come into play).  The movement is also more fine-grained than in Speed Circuit - here cars move one space for every 10 mph instead of for every 20 mph.

One track (Monaco) is provided on 10 A4 sheets which need to be taped together, and possibly trimmed.  Metal F1 cars are provided, as are metal arrows for the dashboard panels.

title: Princess's Court
description: A Japanese card game. The game consists of 110 regular playing card sized cards and a one-page rules sheet in Japanese. The game is similar in play to Uno. Each player plays one card in turn, matching against the last card played in color or value, or drawing a card if not able to do so. The first player to go out scores 0 points for the round, with the remaining players scoring points for the cards remaining in their hands. The game is played in a series of rounds until one player has scored 500 or more points. When that happens, the player with the lowest number of points wins. If a player happens to score exactly 500 points, his score is halved to 250.

title: Kroko-Ei
description:
Crocodile Egg. 24 square tiles show various crocodiles hatching from their eggs. You have to get the heads and tails to match, coming out of the right egg. Very cute graphics.

Ages 5 and up.

title: Oscar: The Film Star's Rise to Fame
description:
Oscar is a board game based on the golden age of cinema.  The players take the role of actors and actresses trying to become Hollywood stars and win an Academy Award.  Players advance by collecting money and assets, avoiding setbacks and win the game by winning the Oscar.

The game contents: 
1 game board
15 cardboard character pieces that can be inserted into the plastic playing pieces 
6 different colored plastic playing pieces
Paper money
Casting cards
Fortune cards
Asset cards
Loan cards
1 standard six sided die
1 colored die with each side matching the color of one of the 6 playing pieces
1 plastic Oscar bust

title: Sovereign Seas Lite
description:
Sovereign Seas Lite is a nautical combat war game which simulates the period from 1860-1870. Sovereign Seas Lite is intended for 2 or more players. Complexity is medium. Time to learn is from 30-45 minutes.

Sovereign Seas Lite is the early descendant of Queen Victoria's Navy, a significantly updated and more refined game that covers naval combat from 1860 to 1906.

Players assume the role of either the British or the French in an attempt to meet the victory conditions of several different scenarios.

Sovereign Seas Lite uses EOR (See Designer Notes March 97), so any kind of dice can be used in any combination.

The Addendum #1 for Sovereign Seas Lite is a collection of beta rules and Design Your Own information for the Sovereign Seas Lite game system. The addendum includes instructions for Design Your Own ship designs, the beta V3.0 rules of SSL, and the original ship lists from v1.0 of Sovereign Seas. This addendum is not a complete game and is intended as an unofficial supplement to the Sovereign Seas Lite game system.

title: Combat Operations
description: A counter and hex based war game, using a diceless combat system. ComOps is a somewhat generic war game system, that can be used to play many different types of combat. This public beta 1 release includes the rules, the map, the counters, and the few tables needed. A primary goal of ComOps was to present a 'real' war gamers war game, that can be played from setup to end in a reasonable amount of time. At this time no further work is being done on ComOps.

title: Eddie Cantor's Game: Tell It to the Judge
Consequences
description:
CONSEQUENCES - The Game of Decisions, Dilemmas and Deceit

From the Box

What would be the consequences if you turned up at a fancy-dress party dressed as St George (complete with his dragon) only to discover everyone else in dinner dress?
Or what if you accidentally ran over the neighbor's cat, and no-one saw you do it?
Do you know what you would do?
Can you be sure your friends would do the same?
Find out in this hilarious board game of decisions, dilemmas and dishing the dirt.
Dishonesty has never been such fun!

Contents:

Playing Board
200 Consequence Cards
24 Voting Cards
Special dice (4 faces show a voting symbol, 2 a writing symbol)
Playing pieces

During a player's turn the scenario on a Consequence Card is read out.  Dependant on the role of a dice players then Vote (using three voting cards) on three possible answers (also on the card), or write down their answer.

Points are awarded for matching responses with other players, with progress being recorded by the movement of a playing piece on a score-board.  The first player to 15 points is the winner.

title: Hard Vacuum: War's End
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame World War II
description:
Second expansion for the game Hard Vacuum, it is freely downloadable from here.

It contains Russian and Japanese spaceships, the battle for the moon, and other stuff.

Expands

    Hard Vacuum

title: Life Begins at 40
description:
From the box

LIFE BEGINS AT 40 - Survive until you're 40.  Then it's fun all the way in this exciting new board game!

SURVIVE UNTIL YOU'RE 40?
In the first part of this fun-packed board game each player has to reach the great age of 40.  Along then way you'll be collecting all those responsibilities like kids, house, car and mother-in-law...and paying for their upkeep, whilst trying to maintain a cash balance - and a sense of humor.  The quicker you reach 40 the less responsibilities you'll take on!

THEN IT'S FUN ALL THE WAY!
The second part of the game is a race to early retirement, the first player there being the winner.  But you can't win however while you still have the responsibility of a Bank Loan, Mortgage or kids - so they'll have to go!

title: Hullabaloo
description:
HULLABALOO - The Classic game of Noisy Charades.

From the box:

Welcome to the loudest, most frantic, most hilarious game you'll ever play!  That's because in HULLABALOO you can only use the language of noise to make yourself understood ... and all in just 30 seconds.

You'll have you team mates in stitches guessing your noise, whether it's a One Armed bandit, a Fun Fair or laying an Egg!

Does your team have the skill to reach the ON square before your opponents?  There is only one way to find out - play HULLABALOO and discover for yourself why it's the game everyone's making such a noise about.

title: Stars and Stripes: Intelligence Handbook on US Armored and Infantry Forces
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
Stars and Stripes is a supplement for Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game, the World War II miniatures game. It provides the complete organization and equipment for US infantry and armored forces in North Africa and the Mediterranean. Also included are variants for Ranger Company, Parachute Rifle Company and Armored Recon Company. History of 'Bid Red One' Infantry Division is also provided.

There are new Reconnaissance rules, tactics guide, painting guide, three American Warriors and two new missions for Flames of War.

title: Stalingrad: Intelligence Handbook on Soviet and German Infantry Forces
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
Stalingrad is a supplement for Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game, the World War II miniatures game. It provides the organization and equipment for the Soviet and German Infantry Forces involved in the battle for Stalingrad.

For the Soviet, there are covers special rules and full stats on the Soviet equipment, guns, vehicles and teams. There are organisation lists for Strelkovy Batalon (Infantry Battalion), Guardeyskiy Strelkovy Batalon (Guard Infantry Battalion) and Batalon Opolecheniya (Militia Battalion). The second two are variations on the Strelkovy Batalon, allowing for either better-trained troops (Guards) or lower motivation (Militia).

The German forces found in this book are the Grenadiers: Grenadierkompanie, Schnellschwadron,  Pionierkompanie and Luftwaffe Feldkompanie.

Street Fighting Rules are also included as well as tactics articles, painting guide, rules for warriors and snipers and new scenarios.

title: Desert Fox
description:
Subtitled 'Intelligence Handbook on German Armored Forces in North Africa', this is a supplement for Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game the World War II Miniatures game.

The book has complete organization and equipment for German Armored forces in North Africa, variants for engineer, armored grenadier and reconnaissance companies, history of the Afrikakorps, tactics guide, painting guide, new missions and new warriors.

title: Diving Eagles
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
Subtitled 'Intelligence Handbook on German Airborne Forces', this is a supplement for Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game the World War II Miniatures game.

The book has complete organization and equipment for the Diving Eagles, variants for early and late war battles, history of the German airborne forces, tactics guide, painting guide, new missions and new warriors.

title: Desert Rats
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
Subtitled 'Intelligence Handbook on British Armored Forces', this is a supplement for Flames of War the World War II Miniatures game.

The book has complete organization and equipment for British Armored, Motor and Armored Car forces in North Africa and Italy, variants for the Death or Glory Boys, history of the Desert Rats, the 7th Armored Division, new anti-tank gun rules, tactics guide, painting guide, new missions and new warriors.

title: City State Warfare
description:
City State Warfare is a tactical combat game set in the Fantastic Era, a place in time and space where technology is Medieval to early Renaissance and the legends live.  This is the age in which most Fantasy Role Playing (FRP) Games take place.  City State warfare is a medium for resolving the larger conflicts which would normally be handled with large miniature battles.  This game may also be used to recreate the epic battles of fantasy literature. -- from the Introduction

This is a standard boardgame of the time, with some fantasy elements thrown in. It also has scenarios for historical battles such as Tours (732), Hastings (1066), Liegnitz (1241), Morgarten (1315), and a few others. It is an easy hex-and-counter game by grognard standards.

title: Moon Race
description:
A game for young astronauts of all ages
Computers Decide Progress

The board (18 x 14 approx) is a cardboard sandwich containing a rotating wheel.  Each player uses a pencil or matchstick (not supplied) to rotate the wheel, which changes the what is shown in the various pre-cut windows.  This includes the distance the player's rocket must move, and good or bad events resulting from landing on certain spaces.  There is no interaction: it is purely a race.

title: InuYasha TCG
description:
From the Inuyasha TCG website:

This game has 4 card types: characters, items, locations and events.


        Characters (white) are personalities in the Inuyasha storyline.
        Items (red) are the things that they use.
        Locations (green) are the places they go.
        Events (blue) are the plot twists that push the story and game along. 


Two Ways to Win:


     STEAL ALL 10 SHIKON JEWEL SHARDS!  You win the instant you control all 10 Shards. Shards are facedown cards that you both set aside when the game begins. You steal shards by defeating characters, attacking your opponent directly, and by using game effects.
     EMPTY YOUR OPPONENTS DECK!  You win the instant your opponent tries to draw or discard a card from his or her deck and cannot.


GETTING STARTED: First you need a deck of exactly 60 cards. The rules for deck building are easy: Unless the card restricts itself, you can have as many copies of a card you want.

title: Gorilla Warfare
description:
From the White Mask Productions website:

Gorilla Warfare is a primal game of explosive jungle combat. Every player controls a team of four gorillas; armed with bulging muscles, bad tempers, and explosive Banana Grenades. The object? To be the king of the jungle, of course.

Gorilla Warfare is here and ready to play! The entire game took only 24 hours to create, but I tell you this; it almost ranks up there with Empires in playable fun. I always like moving my Gorillas around like a S.W.A.T. Team. No one can sneak up on you, and if anyone gets too close, all four Gorilla's are just about in equal throwing distance to fry the primate. Of course, this is a bad idea if an enemy has a Class 5 Banana Grenade, as the explosion can wipe out a good part of the play field...

Outdated link:
View the rules, FAq, etc at http://www.whitemask.com/gorilla/

title: IQuest
description:
Contents:

1 playing board
2,200 Questions and Answers
6 Playing Is
32 Scoring Qs
6 I agree / I Disagree cards
1 Timer

From the rule book:

IQuest provides an absorbing challenge which allows players to explore their own abilities to think creatively.  A range of fascinating word, number, shape and language puzzles in an intriguing variety of game categories awaits you for your quest through the IQuset maze.  Whether you wrangle with a Rangle, or stumble over a Numble, IQuest provides fun and fascination for adults and children alike.

Players must correctly answer a series of questions, at least one in each of five categories, in order to progress towards the sunburst located in the middle of the board.

Players are allowed up to one minute to answer the questions, whilst the other players may choose to agree or disagree with the answer given.  Correct answers result in movement of playing pieces and the receipt of Scoring Qs.

The first player to place his/her token on the sunburst and correctly answer an IQuest category question wins the game.

title: Acquisition
description:
According to the rules Acquisition was created for The Shidler Group (a commercial real estate investment firm) by Prince Joli Kansil, presumably as an educational tool of some sort. It is not clear if it was ever published as such.

The game is designed for 12 players plus an umpire, but can be played by fewer (the rules only specifically mention changes for as few as 8 players). The umpire is not strictly necessary, but would make sense if the game were intended to be played by groups of children. The game is played cooperatively.

Each player has his or her own board. Each corresponds to a city or section of a city in the US, and is a stylized representation of one of its commercial real estate districts. Players move around their board by die roll (using the difference of two dice, not the sum) and can buy properties when they land on them. When a player rolls doubles they do not move, but all owned properties pay rent to the owner (from the bank).

There are a few other aspects to the system. When players buy or sell property they may do so at face value or may try rolling a 12-sided die to negotiate. Odds are they will do better this way but there is a chance they will do considerably worse. A player may travel to another player's board, which allows them or the other player to propose a joint venture, where both chip in to buy a property. Only the board's player gets rent, but since it is a cooperative game this is not an issue. Finally, there are spaces which cause players to draw event cards which do the usual sorts of things.

Play is for a specified amount of time - 75 minutes is suggested in the rules. At this point the net worth of all players is totaled, and if more than one group is playing (which would require multiple copies of the game), the one with the most money is the winner.

title: Ancient Naval Wargames Rules: 500 BC to AD 500
Napoleonic Period 5mm Wargames Rules
description:
A 42 page rulebook that covers the Napoleonic era in 5mm (1:300 scale). In particular the rules address aspects such as command structure and battlefield concentration that is impossible to cover in larger scale.

The rulebook is divided into three sections, namely (1) the definition of units and organization of armies; (2) the actual rules and (3) campaign rules.

A second booklet covering army lists have been released complementing the rules.  The armies covered includes the French, British, Austrian, Prussian, Russian, Spanish and Swedes.

title: 5mm Wargame Rules for Ancient Land Battles, Sieges and Naval Engagements
description:
The 78 page rulebook covers ancient warfare on land and sea, as well as sieges, and focuses on the 5mm (1:300) scale.  The rulebook is divided into four sections, namely (1) the rules for land warfare; (2) army compositions and lists; (3) Naval rules and (4) Sieges.

The focus of the rules are on the period from 300 BC to 600 AD, with an opinion by the designers that one can play with armies up to widespread use of gunpowder.

title: Special Forces: Modern Infantry Skirmish Rules
description: Special Forces recreates small infantry actions of section strength (8 to 10 men) in all theaters of war using 25mm figures and vehicles.  The use of artillery, mortars and ground attack aircraft have been excluded, however helicopters have been covered.  Data tables for most weapons and AFV's used in modern combat have been included.  The game also covers a section where the figures earn skill advancement according to the experience gained per battle.

title: Riot: Revolting People from Watt Tyler to Watts
description:
From the introduction:

Riot is a slightly tongue-in-cheek game about urban violence between unruly mobs and 'security forces' through the ages.  It can be played either multi-player or solo, with the mobs being controlled by the game system and the players taking the role of either the forces of law and order quelling the rioters or journalists recording the event and reporting scenes of police brutality.

This game has been written purely with fun in mind and it is not an attempt at a simulation of urban violence per se.  The rules have been written for 1:300 scale, but can be easily adjusted for 15mm or 25mm.

title: The Necromancer's Bane
description:
The Necromancer's Bane is a set of wargames rules (22 pages) designed to reproduce large-scale battles set in a fantasy realm, be it Middle Earth, Hyboria or any other mythical setting.  The rule set addresses scales from 6mm up to 25mm.

Two supplements are also available, one covering magicians and a more detailed handling of magic (14 pages), and the second addressing sieges in a fantasy environment (14 pages).

title: TG3
types: Miniatures Nautical Wargame World War I World War II
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
TACTICAL GAME

The TG is a complete system of rules for tactical naval combat using miniatures of any scale. It covers the period
1890 to 1945 and contains data for 563 classes of ships from 19 countries. This system is an improved version of our
highly acclaimed TG-2. It uses new randomization and torpedo methods which will make it a classic in tactical games.
It still maintains the features of realism and rapid speed of play. TG can be played solitaire or with a number of players.
A data and calculation CD-ROM are now available.

http://www.panzerschiffe.com/

title: Straight Arrow
description:
Straight Arrow (trademark of national biscuit company) is a 1950 game manufactured by by Selchow  Righter co. The directions are printed on the inside of box cover. The gameboard contains a track which all players follow as the spin and move, and measures approx. 18-1/4 x 18-1/2.

Players attempt to earn golden arrow tokens as they move along the board path.

Contents: Four playing pawns, spinner, 18 golden arrows, 15 metal steers, one Straight Arrow Indian on a horse pawn, game board.

title: Never Mind the Buzzcocks
types: Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Music Party Game Trivia
description:
Never Mind the Buzzcocks is a board game based on the pop music/comedy/trivia themed BBC T.V. game show of the same name.

It's a team game for two or more teams.

You get your chance to sing songs like twinkle, twinkle little star in the style of pop celebrities like Mick Jagger, play the intro round, songs in one sentence, and many other of the classic games from the series.

title: Fun-in-a-Box: The Dr. Seuss Matching Game
description: This is essentially Concentration (or the Memory Game, or whatever you grew up calling it) in board game form.  There is a movement track around the outside edge of the board with one of 20 Dr. Seuss book covers depicted on each space, plus 4 Pick A Book spaces.  There are also 20 cardboard counters depicting the book covers which are shuffled and spread out face down in the center of the board.  Players select a playing piece (one of four cardboard Dr. Seuss character stand-ups) and place it on one of the Pick A Book spaces.  The youngest player goes first (that German influence is creeping into even the American kids' games these days) by spinning a spinner (1 to 6) and moving up to that many spaces in any direction they wish.  If they land on a book cover, they turn over one of the counters in the center of the board attempting to match the space they're on.  If they get it, they keep the counter.  If they land on a Pick A Book space they may take any counter from the center they wish.  If they land on a space for which another player already has the counter their turn ends.  If they land on a space for which they already have the counter they may spin again.  After all 20 counters have been claimed the player with the most is the winner.  The board is double-sided and there is a separate set of 20 counters for each side.

title: Fullmetal Alchemist: Alchemic Card Battle TCG
description:
Fullmetal Alchemist: Alchemic Card Battle is a trading card game based on the Japanese anime and released by Bandai Japan.  The cards and directions are all in Japanese.

The cards are broken down into Character, Support Character, Battle, and Event cards.  The first expansion, File 1, includes 57 cards total.  Starter decks are available that include 30 cards (1 of which is special), gameplay instructions (in Japanese), a play mat, and 1 coin.

Cards are broken down into commons and 3 classes of rares: gold foil lettering, holo, and special (foil lettering + holo + textured).  The rarity is denoted by the number asterisks (*).

title: Extra Innings Baseball
description: A Baseball simulation board game played by rolling three six sided die.  When the die were rolled the first roll chart is consulted.  That directs the next sequence of rolls to determine what happens to the batter.  Straight forward basic baseball simulation game.

title: Baraque de Fraiture: The Battle for Parker's Crossroads
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Baraque de Fraiture is an historical Advanced Squad Leader expansion that takes place in Belgium on December 20-24, 1944. The 9 different scenarios depict the story of a small, but interesting facet of the Battle of the Bulge, which is played out on the provided full-color 22x34 map.

Reprinted and updated by Critical Hit in 2007.

Reprinted again as BdF II The Battle for Parker's Crossroads December 1944, in November 2011.  The 2011 edition includes new counters, which may provide all the counters needed to play, even if you do not own Croix de Guerre, but you still at least need Beyond Valor.  It is unclear to me what else has changed.

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader

title: Neither Fear Nor Hope!
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
A 14-scenario expansion pack playable in the Advanced Squad Leader rules system, dealing with the history of the 2nd SS-Division, known as Das Reich, from Battalion to Panzerdivision.

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader

title: Blue-Light Manual
description:
From the Publisher:

These miniature warfare rules are designed for simulated combat between plastic or metal figures which represent a number of soldiers of the American Civil War. These figures are affixed to stands which are themselves grouped together to represent field organizations of the period.

title: Red Baron
types: Aviation / Flight Miniatures Wargame World War I
description:
Extensively researched, Red Baron is the first set of World War I air miniatures rules to combine historical accuracy with an easily playable rules system. Instead of relying on the luck of the dice, players have to use their wits to respond to constantly changing battle, just like their real-life counterparts.

Features  rules for multiple maneuvers and tailing; aces, legendary aces, and rookies, mid-air collisions, fixed and pivoting funs, stalls, spins, and landing, a wide variety of damage effects gun jams, fires, bailing out, and more.

Red Baron is a rules system for re-creating World War I aerial combat using miniature airplanes in 1/144, 1/285, or 1/300 scale. Each Miniature plane represents on actual plane which took part in the First World War. Each inch horizontally across the gaming table represents one hundred feet, as does each inch above the table vertically. Each game turn represents about seven seconds of actual time. Each movement point equals ten miles per hour. Each burst of gunfire represents about twenty to twenty-five rounds of ammunition.

(From the Designer and Publisher)

title: Za! 30 minutes or free
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemPoint to Point Movement
description:
You are a pizza delivery flunky for Za! Central, which (surprise, surprise) offers a 30 minute guarantee.  To become Employee of the Week and win the coveted Golden Anchovy statuette you have to deliver 10 pizzas on time.  Simple?  Maybe...

This is a desktop-published game with cards and counters you need to cut out, and a large paper game map.  Each turn you need to spend your 10 movement points to pickup pizzas and deliver them to the proper location.  When players deliver a pizza successfully, they receive Tip cards that can be used to mess with the other players.

title: Pokémon Build 'n Battle
types: Collectible Components Dice Fantasy Fighting Video Game Theme
description: Pokemon Build 'n Battle combines model building with a simple dice driven combat system.  Each kit contains lego-like blocks to build a pokemon and its evolved form, as well as a die, a card with statistics for the two forms and some extra blocks for keeping track of the pokemons' statistics.  After enough wins, the player is allowed to use the evolved form of the pokemon.

title: Chem Trak
description:
Chem-Trak can be used by individual students or groups.

A student can play five different games to learn element names and symbols, ion names and symbols, formulas for compounds, and equations for reactions. The games range from timed races to error elimination.

The game board has a chart of 552 compounds on the back. Developed by Bob Gang. Grades 1011.

title: Missão Estratégica
description:
Two islands somewhere on the Pacific Ocean try to obtain the full power, conquering the other.

Each island has 3 bays and one airport. The first player who conquers one bay and the airport of the enemy and keeps the situation the next movement from the other player is the winner.

The most interesting: There's no dice, no cards, no luck at all. Each piece has a diagram that shows all the alternative movements and if will hit or not. It's just strategy thinking and tactical movements.

The board is beautiful, made of plastic. The pieces are made of a type of rubber that adhere to the board, so you can store the game to play again some other game. And believe me : it's necessary.

A pity that this company made 2 games with the same mechanics and pieces and then, disappeared.

title: WWII Micro Armour: The Game
description:
From the publisher:

WWII Micro Armour is more than a set of miniatures rules for simulating tactical armored warfare in the mid-twentieth century. It's a research engine that allows you to experiment with the technology, tactics, and doctrine of all the important players in the real world. Training, experience and cohesion are important factors in deciding who winds and loses.

Everyone's forces are represented: Belgium, Czechoslovakia, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Japan, Poland, Romania, the Soviet Union, the United Kingdom and the United States: over 60 pages of organizational info. You get twenty pages of weapons data, a complete scenario generator, plus full color graphics for artillery impacts, minefields, smoke screens, even wrecked vehicles. Also included are ready-to-play historical scenarios.

And the rules are concise, easy to learn and fun to play.

Nobody models WWII like GHQ - here's THE GAME for Micro Armour.

This is a system designed with the history enthusiast as well as the game player in mind.

There is also a free download version WW II Micro Armour:The Tanks using tanks only.

title: Skull & Crossbones
description:
SKULL  CROSSBONES is a family board game playable with or without a video.

The players represent pirates who have deserted Captain Skull's crew and are trying to locate and steal his treasure, and escape, before Captain Skull returns, captures them and  makes them walk the plank.

Movement is controlled by the use of move cards which direct players to move a number of spaces in a given, or choice of given, directions (North, South, East and West).  In so doing players collect location cards, visit locations, and try and identify the whereabouts of keys which can be used to open Captain Skull's treasure chests.

On the video, which runs in real-time, Captain Skull will intervene to try and stop you finding his treasure.  His parrot 'Crossbones', on the other hand, will be trying to help.

The first pirate to find their treasure and escape the island is the winner, though other players should also try and locate their treasure and escape before Captain Skull's return (after 60 minutes)

title: Count Coup: An Anthropological Board Game of North American Indian Ways
types: American Indian Wars American West Educational Environmental Fighting
description:
Warfare among the Plains Indians was mainly for glory.  Through many skirmishes a warrior could gain prestige and advancement within his own tribe.  A coup (pronounced 
koo) was a brave deed or act done against one's live enemy: touching a live, fallen enemy, stealing a horse, etc.  Upon completing this brave act, the warrior would return to his own tribe to recount for them the full details of his glorious deed--counting coup.

The information in Count Coup has been organized in two ways.  First, four large ecological areas can be seen in the map on the box cover: Eastern Woodland, Great Plains, Desert West, and Far West.  The tribes appearing on the playing cards are placed in their approximate areas on the map.  The colored border on the cards corresponds to the ecological area of the tribe referred to.

Second, the playing cards can be divided into 14 categories: Food-Plants, Transport, Dwellings, Leadership, Tools, Crafts, Hunting, Warfare, Person-to-Know, Trade, Ceremonies, Treating Ills, Social Control, and Tragedy.  Four cards appear in each category, one from each ecological area.  More information can be found for each of the 56 playing cards in the corresponding Explanation Cards, garnered during the course of the game.  These latter cards may be read aloud for a greater understanding of the cultures during the course of the game, or not if a faster game is sought, but the victor must collect four to accompany the movement of his pawns from the Summer Camp to the Winter Camp.

Hazard and Reward Squares corresponding to the Eagle, the Buffalo, Irrigation, and Fire will be encountered in the journey.  If rewarded, the player attends the Pow Wow, where he is temporarily safe.  A coup is made by landing on another player's pawn.

title: Panzer Commander Afrika
types: Card Game Wargame World War II
description:
(from UGG's Website: P500 production)

This game is developed from the Collectible Card Game: Tank Commander: The Eastern Front Edition

Panzer Commander Afrika 1940/1941 is a two- (or multi-) player card game covering tactical combat in North Africa (Libya and Egypt) during 1940 and 1941. The game contains 220 cards that represent British, German and Italian forces.
Each vehicle card represents just one tank, half-track, or truck; each infantry card represents one squad of infantry; and each anti-tank gun card represents one AT-gun and its crew. Moreover, there are cards representing typical terrain, equipment and special events.

Each card depicts in full color either a single tank, an infantry squad, an antitank gun, typical terrain, equipment, and special events. 
A space on the battle board (your table top) represents roughly 500 by 500 meters and each shot equals five real shots. You will find that your playing time
closely approximates the time it really took to fight these battles in World War II.
PANZER COMMANDER AFRIKA 1940/1941 includes eight different scenarios.

Introductory Scenario: Tank Action (Tutorial), Sidi Barrani, 1940

Operation Compass, 1940
In December 1940 the British went over to the offensive and rapidly destroyed the Italian forces in Egypt and Libya.

Build Your Own, 1940

Sidi Rezegh, 1941
During Operation Crusader a wild armored clash took place at and near Sidi Rezegh.

Minefields!
A German armored force has run into a British position
Build Your Own, 1941

Free For All
In this scenario anything is possible - it is not even checked if a unit was available only in 1940 or 1941...

However, the scenario is great fun because all cards are used. In addition, only a minimum of preparation time is needed.
Panzer Commander Afrika uses the system of Tank Commander, The Eastern Front formerly published by Moments in History.

More details about Tank Commander see: Photo Album

Panzer Commander Afrika is a complete, non collectible card game.

Game Features
Designed by Uli Blennemann 
Series Designer John Desch and Uli Blennemann
TIME SCALE 1940/1941 
NUMBER OF PLAYERS  Two or more
Age: 14+

title: His 'N' Hers
description:
HIS 'N' HERS - The Battle of the Sexes

From the Box:

How well do you really know your partner?  Or best friend (or best friend's partner?)
Well now is your chance to find out.  You choose the subject, you choose the questions, analyze the points scored and then you'll find out (what you probably knew all along) if you're living with a Male Chauvinist Pig, a Right Wing Wet, a Left Wing socialist or just a plain slob.  Yes you'll discover the real man or woman in your life.

Contents:
Booklet
Subject Cards
Prediction Cards
Bonus Cards

A questioner selects a subject (e.g. indulgences, work) and reads out the three character descriptions from the booklet, appropriate to the interviewees sex. The players (including the questioner and interviewee) then vote (using prediction cards) on which type of characteristics the interviewee exhibits.

The questioner then selects 6 questions from the Subject Cards corresponding to the subject chosen.  The questioner then reads out the questions and three possible answers. Each answer scores either 1, 2 or 3 points depending on the response given by the interviewee - these points are noted down discretely by the questioner.

Once the six questions have been answered the points are totaled and the score related back to the character traits announced at the start of the round. The character of the interviewee is thereby determined.

Players that successfully predicted which character trait the interviewee would show score points. The winner is the player with the highest score after an agreed number of rounds.

title: Battlestorm
description: Battlestorm uses a simple combat system that stresses action, reaction and interaction. Battlestorm requires an attacker to Declare any melee combat BEFORE he moves. This way the opponent has the option of counter-attacking, fleeing or even attacking some other unit. Combat can fire off an exciting chain reaction that suddenly draws many units into the fray. These are called battlestorms and they often mean a battle can hinge on a few critical decisions that cause an explosion of carnage. It's not for the faint-hearted, Battlestorm is designed for a bold commander who wants to feel the rush of adrenaline as his troops become enmeshed in a tactical chess match with all the violence and pageantry of a medieval fantasy battle.

title: Where the Iron Crosses Grow
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
Subtitled 'Eastern Front Scenarios for Spearhead WW-II Rules', there are 21 scenarios covering three major periods of the war in the East.

Although designed primarily for Spearhead rules, these scenarios are playable with any set of WW-II rules that provides Divisional organizations and uses the Platoon as the smallest combat element.

title: White Star Rising
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
Subtitled 'Western Front Scenarios for Spearhead WW-II Rules-from Normandy to the Rhine', there are 17 scenarios covering the war in the West.

Although designed primarily for Spearhead rules, these scenarios are playable with any set of WW-II rules that provides Divisional organizations and uses the Platoon as the smallest combat element.

title: Blaze Across the Sands
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
Subtitled 'Desert Front Scenarios for Spearhead WW-II Rules', there are 21 scenarios covering the Desert Campaign.

Although designed primarily for Spearhead rules, these scenarios are playable with any set of WW-II rules that provides Divisional organizations and uses the Platoon as the smallest combat element.

title: Hitler's Fire Brigade
description:
Hitler's Fire Brigade is a supplement to Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game, The World War II miniatures battle system. This book provides complete organization and equipment for German armored forces on the Eastern Front. This includes Panzerkompanies, Panzergrenadierkompanies, and variants for both reconnaissance and engineering companies.

New rules for Tiger heavy tanks, minefields, barbed wire, and fortifications are are all included. Also includes a comprehensive painting guide, color photos, historical commentary, a new mission, and a tactics guide.

title: 1825 Regional Kit R1: Wales
types: Economic Expansion for Base-game Trains Transportation
description:
1825 Regional Kit: R1 - Wales is an expansion for 1825 Unit 1, an 18xx game.  It includes:


     Game board
     2 Minor Companies (4 share certificates, 2 tokens  1 pawn each)
     9 Yellow Tiles: 1 each of 3, 4  69; 2 each of 6, 7  8
     6 Green Tiles: 1 each of 10, 11, 13, 14, 23, 24
     3 Russet Tiles: 1 each of 35, 37  38


1825 Unit 1 is required to play this expansion.

title: 1825 Regional Kit R2: South West England
types: Economic Expansion for Base-game Trains Transportation
description:
1825 Regional Kit: R2 - South West England is an expansion for 1825 Unit 1, an 18xx game.  It includes:


     Game board
     1 minor company (4 share certificates, 2 tokens  1 pawn)
     4 yellow tiles: 1 each of 3  115; 2 of 58
     1 green tile: 10
     2 russet tiles: 1 each of 35  37
     1 brown tile representing Highbridge


1825 Unit 1 is required to play this expansion.

title: 1825 Regional Kit R3: North Norfolk
types: Economic Expansion for Base-game Trains Transportation
description:
1825 Regional Kit: R3 - North Norfolk is an expansion for 1825 Unit 1, an 18xx game.  It includes:


     Game board
     1 minor company (4 share certificates, 2 tokens and 1 pawn)
     3 Yellow Tiles: 1 of 8; 2 of 9
     2 Green Tiles: 1 each of 11  14
     3 Russet Tiles: 1 each of 35, 37  38


1825 Unit 1 is required to play this expansion.

title: Meander Expansion Set
types: Abstract Strategy Action / Dexterity Expansion for Base-game
description:
The Meander Expansion set contains four extra tiles, four marker marbles (two red, two green), and a die. A (very) small booklet gives some variations on the original rules and suggestions to use the components of the expansion set. The four extra pieces (one of each of the basic pieces) can be used to make the tile draw a bit more uncertain. The marbles are used to indicate pockets that count as double or nothing and the die is used before each turn to give you extra actions (or make you lose your turn).

Expands:

    Meander

title: The Evolution Game
description: From the designer's web site:  The Evolution Game is a board game for two, three or four players, which was inspired by the concept of biological evolution. During the course of the game, your species will compete for territory with other species. As the environmental conditions change, it will face plagues, endemic disease, starvation, natural disasters and global catastrophes and may even succumb to total extinction. It will take advantage of mutation within its gene pool to establish itself in a series of ecological niches, thereby surviving through the successive stages of the geological sequence from the Precambrian (the dawn of life) to the Pleistocene (i.e. the present day).

title: For the Record: 80's & 90's Edition
description:
From the box:

You were looking for a fun game that covers the broad spectrum of music from this era?  Look no more - it's here!  For the Record 80's  90's Edition covers everything from rap to reggae, alternative to country, pop to punk and more!  The multiple choice format and clever board design make For the Record challenging enough for trivia buffs yet equally fun for people who simply love music.  For the Record brings back the music  culture of the 80's  90's with electric excitement!  Another #1 smash hit - from the request line to you!

title: Border Patrol
description: Using a set of octiamonds (all the different ways to join 8 triangles) players add their pieces to the main figure trying to be the first to run out.

title: Dieppe
description:
Dieppe is a simulation of the first landing in force on Continental Europe by the Allied Powers in World War II. [Introduction from the rulebook]

255 counters = ziploc edition

title: Haggle
description:
Haggle is a simple trading game involving ideas (represented by light bulbs), girls (actually women, but this is from 1970, after all), connections (represented by printed circuits), time pieces, and rhinoceroses.

Each player gets five of each of these items, five value cards, and a rubber band.  By arranging the cards with the rubber band passing through the appropriate notches each item is given a secret personal value from one to fifty cents.  Then everyone trades - trading is completely free-form, with no turns and no restrictions on deals.  When no one wants to trade any longer, the game ends and players add up the value of the items they have.

While there is no credit for a game designer, the graphic design is credited to Don Moyer, who since then appears to have become prominent in the world of graphic and industrial design.

title: Honey Bee
mechanisms: Dice RollingPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: A simple dice rolling version of the old hive game. A color dice roll determines which adjacent colored flower space one of your four counters can jump to on the way to collect pollen counters. The first player to get all pollen-laden bees home is the winner

title: Humps & Horns Rodeo Board Game
description: A simple roll and move game in which players travel around the board paying to enter in bull riding events in different cities. Dice are rolled to determine how long players were able to stay on the bull and money is awarded in increasing amounts depending on the length of their time. If anything lower than 7 is rolled a Hung and Dragged or Bucked Off card is drawn with various penalties against the victim. Play continues until only one player has money left.

title: Fraggle Rock Game
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverPoint to Point Movement
description: A Milton Bradley and Jim Henson game, inspired by the childrens TV show Fraggle Rock. Using a cardboard spinner you must pick up a postcard in Doc's Workshop and visit the Trash Heap and then jump in to the Swimming Hole. First one to do all that wins the game.

title: RoboCop VCR Game
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
mechanisms: Hand ManagementPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: This VCR game is based on the RoboCop movies. You watch the game video (uses actual RoboCop movie footage) and get action cues to make moves. The goal of the game is to be the first to make four arrests and return to the Police Station. There is a warning sticker on the box that states Based on the hit R-Rated move, Edited to be suitable for ages 12 and above.

title: Boomtown Houston
description: Players bid to acquire various properties in the booming City of Houston, trying to earn money by completing various possible (and sometimes conflicting) empires.

title: CATAN 3D Collector's Edition
description:
To commemorate this momentous and joyous event, a special edition is being created. The special edition encompasses Settlers of Catan and Cities and Knights for 3-4 players. This edition features three-dimensional hand painted tiles made of dense heavy weight resin and a complete interlocking border. Each player gets a set of hand-painted settlements, cities, metropoli, city walls, knights, and roads. The special hardwood case is designed to keep your set safe and will feature a special slotted level with felt lined slots to hold each hex. A wooden tray holds pieces for play and storage.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

title: Monopoly: Coronation Street
types: Economic Movies / TV / Radio theme Negotiation
description:
Now you too can experience life on the Street! Travel around the board buying Properties from Britain's best-loved soap. Will you buy Elliot's Butchers, I say will you buy Elliot's Butchers? Or would you rather be pulling pints at the Rovers Return?

Whatever happens, life on the Street will never be the same again!

Game includes: Gameboard, 10 Playing tokens, 2 Dice, 32 Houses, 12 Pubs, 28 Title Deed cards, 16 Chance cards, 16 Community Chest cards, Play money, Banker's tray, instructions

title: Twin Cities in a Box
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveTrading
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Minneapolis/St. Paul, Minnesota. It has spaces such as the St. Anthony Falls, Fort Snelling, Target Center, HHH Metrodome, Mall of America, Walker Art Center, and the Guthrie Theatre. Cards include local events and staples of life in Minnesota.

title: Sneak-a-Snack
description:
See the mice scurrying across the kitchen floor, hoping to get some cheese to bring back to the mouse hole? Will they be able to sneak the cheese past the sleeping cat, or will the cat awake and chase them down.

How to play:
Players roll the die and move their mouse game piece across the board toward the cheese. Pieces of cheese can be captured one at a time when the mouse lands on the squares adjacent to the cheese board. Mice hurry to return to the mouse hole once they have a piece of cheese. Any cheese safely returned is theirs to keep.

Whenever a player rolls the star symbol on the die the cat awakens.

title: The Nitrate War
description:
A small board game covering the Nitrate War. The conflict between Chile and the alliance of Bolivia and Peru. Also represented in the game are Argentina and American Industrialists.

Game includes:
4 pages of rules
17 x 22 two piece map
150+ cut out counters
1D10

title: Europe 1483
types: Dice Economic Medieval Political Territory Building
description:
Europe 1483 is a medieval game of conquest and diplomacy. It represents Europe, North Africa and the Middle East in the year 1483 AD. Players compete cut-throat to expand their empires through war, economic development and diplomacy.

Game Includes:

    432 Plastic Playing Tokens  Stickers
    28 x 40 full color map
    52 page rule booklet
    1 d10
    Territory and resource cut-out chits




Game has enough plastic tokens for 8 nations. Expansion sets allow players to expand that up to the full 28 nations.

The following description is for the PDF version:


Europe 1483 1st Edition is a 2-16 player strategy board game of diplomacy and conquest set in Europe in the year 1483 AD.

1483 presents 10 major nations 6 minor nations that players may assume control of. Players must strive to increase the power of their nation or empire through conquest, trade, and a complex series of alliances with other players. Europe 1483 includes the following nations as player nations:


     Kingdom of England
     Kingdom of France
     Kingdom of Spain
     Holy Roman Empire
     Kingdom of Poland  Lithuania
     Kingdom of Hungary
     Republic of Venice
     Teutonic Order
     Kingdom of Denmark
     Regency of Sweden
     Principality of Muscovy
     Khanate of the Golden Horde
     Ottoman Empire
     Empire of the White Sheep Turks
     Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt
     Kingdom of Portugal


Europe 1483 comes complete with a 32  27 game map, in black and white using shading to clearly identify the different nations. This PDF also includes all necessary game charts and cut out game pieces for all nations, including neutral nations. Though you can easily forgo their use in favor of 3D figures such a metal miniatures, axis  allies playing pieces or some other suitable figure types.

Also look forward to the first editions of Asia 1483, Africa 1483, 1492: North America, and 1492: South America to create a monolithic medieval board gaming experience.

title: Stalingrad! Valor of the 37th Guards
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
This expansion for Advanced Squad Leader contains 9 scenarios and a Campaign Game on a large hex map of the Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works. (Ownership of Red Barricades is required to play this game).

The northernmost of three huge factory complexes along the Volga, the Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works was an extended cluster of warehouses, office buildings and assembly halls built with the help of the Ford Motor Company in the 1930's to improve Soviet farming with modern tractors. The factory itself was bordered by an oil storage facility and worker' housing units. At the outset of the war with Germany, the factory was hastily retooled to make the soon-to-be-famous T-34 medium tank.

The steel ribs of the workshops stuck out amidst enormous mounds of rubble. The German 14th Panzer and 389th Infantry Divisions pounded the Guardsmen and smashed into the workshops of the factory itself for the first time. The factory had been busy, building and repairing tanks to the end, and the last T-34 tanks produced went into action unpainted. Now men cut each other down in brutal firefights staged at arm's length in the broken halls of the factory, while tanks sent shells crashing through the gloomy workshops in showers of sparks.

title: The Stonne Heights
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
mechanisms: Dice RollingHex-and-CounterPoint to Point MovementSecret Unit Deployment
description:
Stonne 1940 - The Battle for the Stonne Heights: May 15-18, 1940 depicts the bitter battle for the crucial village of Stonne, and its dominating heights, during the battle of France, 1940. This is early war tank warfare with waves of B1 bis, H-39 and FCM 36 tanks sweeping into the village of Stonne with orders to force the issue and press the enemy back over the Meuse crossings.

Facing the threat of a collapsing front, the crisis facing the desperate French 2nd Army would be decided at the critical point at Stonne. If they could succeed and throw the Germans back across the Meuse, the enemy attack plan may well have failed. The German objective was to hold open the crucial Meuse crossings and seize the high ground at Stonne. Into this clash was drawn the Infantry Regiment Grossdeutschland, with its artillery and the attached Stu.Pi.Btl. 43. This elite formation would soon face waves of French tanks, including the heavy B1 bis, in heretofore unseen numbers in this classic and historic struggle.

Stonne 1940 includes a historical game map of the battlefield, special rules, six new scenarios, 32 die cut vehicle counters, and a Platoon Leader 2.1 campaign game.

Croix de Guerre: ASL Module 10 and Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 are necessary to play this game.


A second edition was published in 2007. The second edition included a redone map, which is significantly nicer than the map in the original module. Also, the extra campaign games from Critical Hit Magazine are now included in the 2nd edition,along with a full 16 scenarios.

A third edition was published by Critical Hit in November 2011. The third edition appears to include the counters required for play if you do not own Croix de Guerre: ASL Module 10, but you still need to own Beyond Valor. It is unclear whether anything else has changed.

title: Gembloux: The Feint
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Gembloux: The Feint is from Critical Hit and depicts the Battle for the Gembloux Gap between 11-15 May 1940 through eight chronological scenarios and a Platoon Leader campaign game representing the fight for Jandrain on 13 May. GTF also includes an historical booklet and a custom map overlay depicting a typical Belgian village during the period. The Gembloux CG was developed by European designer Pedro Ramis following extensive tours of the battlefield.

Gembloux II The Battle for France 1940 - Gembloux II includes a new board CH1 (their first modular board apparently) instead of the overlay as in the first edition.  New counters are included which may provide all of the French counters need to play if you don't have the official French module.  Otherwise it is much the same as the first edition.

The game is a Advanced Squad Leader module.

title: Fortress
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to collect the specified gold pieces (depending of the number of players) and move any player out of the fortress.... or to be the last surviving player.

Each player places four men on the board, which is a map of the fortress.

On each turn, a player does four phases 
Movement phase - determined by roll of the dice.  You can move any or all of you men.

Combat phase - you fight with anyone you have moved next to.
combat is fought with dice.  The number of dice thrown is determined by the type of character.  The loser of the roll must move back one square... the attacking character eliminates his opponent by winning 10 rolls (or he can't back up any more)...losing one means he stops fighting.

Spellcasting phase - If you have a spell casting card, you may play it now.

Collection phase - If you are on a treasure coin you can take it and exchange it for a treasure card.

title: Arnhem: The Third Bridge
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Arnhem: The Third Bridge is an Advanced Squad Leader module that depicts the battle for the bridge made famous in print and film by Cornelius Ryan's 'A Bridge Too Far'.

The British insisted that their airborne division take on the toughest assignment at the very point of the 60-mile salient which was Operation Market Garden. Montgomery said the operation was a 'springboard for a powerful full-blooded thrust to the heart of Germany.' But the plan had one fatal flaw: Allied intelligence had reported few German units in the vicinity of Arnhem--but it turned out that two SS Panzer divisions and Field-Marshal Walther Model, known as the 'Fuhrer's Firemen' were awaiting the British at ground zero. The one British battalion which was able to fight its way to the bridge was cut off, becoming 'a collection of individuals holding on' awaiting relief that would never arrive.

Arnhem: The Third Bridge includes a well-researched historical game map of the battlefield, eight new scenarios and a Platoon Leader 2.x campaign game. You will also receive extensive new rules providing the flavor of the battlefield and its combatants, including high walls, a new form of breach, and SS engineers. As a special bonus, ATB includes a sheet of color, die-cut game pieces providing Red Devil squads and SMC counters for historical leaders including Colonel Frost and armor leader Captain Grabner. Everything is included to play using your existing rulebook and game pieces. (Ownership of Beyond Valor and West of Alemein are necessary to play this game).
Note the countersheet was a limited time offer with the first edition and was not included in the later 2nd edition of this game.
Module requires Beyond Valor and West of Alemein or For King and Country.

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader

title: The Sunrise Bridge
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Platoon Leader is a system for playing Advanced Squad Leader and tactical level miniatures using a series of interrelated scenarios referred to as a 'campaign game' or CG. The aim of PL is to provide for an enjoyable 'campaign' experience within a reasonable time frame, playable by the average gamer over a couple of evenings.

This Platoon Leader 'Booster Pack' depicts the drop of the British 6th Airborne 'Red Devils' at the Primosole Bridge in Sicily on 14 July, 1943 and the ensuing battle. In addition to a set of new PL CG Cards for each side, one overlay depicting the bridge and several unmounted control counters, you receive the entire PL 2.0 Upgrade rules package, including Chapter Divider.

Expands:

    Platoon Leader

title: Armored Stand
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Armored Stand is a an expansion for Advanced Squad Leader that uses the Platoon Leader campaign game system. Terrain overlays are included.

From the Publisher:

The new Platoon Leader 2.0 'Booster Pack' depicts the battle for San Manuel in the Philippines of 1945. Using Critical Hit's PL 2.0 campaign system, fans of ASL will be able to command the units of the late-war Japanese 2nd Tank Division in its battle against the American 25th Infantry Division and support units. It all plays out using your existing game components, using your choice of two campaigns, one short, one the whole 'nine-yards' covering the entire battle.

title: Cemetery Hill
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Cemetery Hill is an expansion for Advanced Squad Leader that uses the Platoon Leader campaign game system. The campaign depicts the fighting on Crete between Greek/New Zealand troops and German Fallschirmjager for the Galatas Hills. It includes a sheet of color overlays, new Reinforcement Group Charts depicting the Allied and German units, and a Platoon Leader chapter divider. (Platoon Leader is a system for playing ASL using a series of interrelated scenarios referred to as a Campaign Game).

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader

title: Scotland the Brave
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
(from the back sleeve:)

The Epsom Offensive: 28-30 June, 1944

SCOTLAND THE BRAVE tells the story of the BatUe 01 Epsom. Some histories pass over this battle as merely the second of Montgomery's failed attempts to capture the key city of Caen. Increasingly. however historians are  recognizing the true meaning of the Epsom Offensive. This was the battle which ended German dreams of driving the invaders back Into the sea. Hitler gathered the best of his remaining Panzer Divisions and broke them against the resistance encountered. The beginning of Epsom caught the enemy off balance and kept the Germans off balance until Hitler's counter-stroke in Normandy was doomed to failure. Most important, this was a battle in which enthusiastic but untried British troops stood toe-to-toe with some of the best equipped. best led and most experienced combat formations of the Third Reich. The Battle of Epsom was to set a pattern that was to continue for the rest of the campaign in Northwest Europe, from Normandy to the Baltic: the grinding-down of Hitler's elite troops by dominance in the air and by excellence of artillery support.

SCOTLAND THE BRAVE includes a well-researched historical game map of the battlefield, special rules, nine new scenarios and a Platoon leader 2.1 campaign game. You will also receive a comprehensive scenario tactics and designer's notes booklet. Everything is included to play using your existing ASLRB and game pieces.

Ownership of the ASLRB, BV and WoA are necessary to play this game.


Scotland the Brave is an expansion for the Advanced Squad Leader game system and can be linked to Scotland the Brave II.

title: Scotland the Brave II
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
(from the back of the package:)

SCOTLAND THE BRAVE II covers events that took place to the north of StB I. including the first day of action for many British soldiers. 26th June 1944, was the baptism by fire of 15th Scottish division and its support arms. Only two of the Division's nine infantry battalions- the 2nd Argylls and the 2nd Gordons - were Regular Army units, and those had not seen battle (the Argylls had spend much of the early pan of the war in the remote Orkney Islands). Likewise the armored units featuring in these scenarios. 31st Tank Brigade comprised two Battalions (7th and 9th R.T.R.) of highly trained and enthusiastic young men, keen to serve their country and attracted by the infantry tank units' emphasis on training and workmanship rather than the smartness and drill of the traditional cavalry. They would face the ultimate challenge from the best Hitler's war machine had to offer on the battlefields of Normandy 1944: Panzers from SS Hitlerjugend. SS Hohenstaufen and the 2nd Panzer Division Wien.

SCOTLAND THE BRAVE II includes a well-researched historical game map of the battlefield, special rules, ten new scenarios and two Platoon Leader 2.x campaign games. As a special bonus, CG 3 links the maps from StB I with StB II  for a giant Normandy battlefield You will also receive a designer's notes booklet. Everything is included to play using your existing rulebook and game pieces.

Ownership of ASL, Beyond Valor and West of Alemein are necessary to play this game.


Scotland the Brave II is an expansion for the Advanced Squad Leader game system and can be linked to Scotland the Brave.

title: Genesis 48: The First Arab-Israeli War
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Genesis 48 is an expansion to the Advanced Squad Leader game system.

From the game sleeve:
Genesis 48 tells the story of a war unlike any before or since. Kibbutzniks defending their homes, fighting alongside their wives. Homemade armored cars trundling into battle. Davidka mortar shells exploding with terrifying shrapnel--due to the soft metal used in the underground shops--with unexpectedly deadly results. The 1948 siege of Jerusalem. Numerous, well-equipped but poorly organized Arab armies.

It's all here in Genesis 48 in a well-researched and extensive module presentation. Three sheets of color die-cut counters include 20 troop-types ranging from elite Israeli Palmach soldiers to Moslem Brotherhood conscripts. Israeli Molotov Tank Hunting Heroes. And more. You also receive numerous new vehicles, including 3 types of Israeli Homemade armored cars, Davidka and Parosh mortars, the Marmon Herrington IV, Jewish 'Sandwich Car' APC, and a variety of half-tracks up-armed with small turrets and a variety of armaments. You also receive a 22 x 34 historical map of Old Jerusalem, a color overlay of a kibbutz, three color card-stock play aids and a 32-page VARIANT rulebook full of vehicle and ordnance notes. All of this equipment is provided to use with the Jerusalem Campaign Game and the 15 well-tested scenarios provided. (Ownership of ASL, Beyond Valor, Hollow Legions, and Croix de Guerre is necessary to play this game).


Second Edition - GENESIS II The Arab Israeli Wars

From the Publisher:
GENESIS '48 2nd Edition aims to polish every rough edge of its predecessor, while adding value in the form of new counters and situations. Rules such as the Molotov Tank Hunting Hero and others have been streamlined. Squad types have been reduced appropriately and redundancy in rules addressing their use edited down. Scenarios continue to use mostly non-desert, daytime situations and are moderate to small in size and play on geomorphic boards. An all new Kibbutz geo board is provided and a separate JERUSALEM '48 historical map-based module is coming with a fully remastered map that utilizes larger hexes than its predecessor. Thus, GENESIS '48 2nd Edition is a 100% geomorphic board product with 16 exciting scenarios and a LARGE COLLECTION of 1000+ of new counters!  In keeping with the CH approach used in the Berlin and Omaha releases successfully, all you'll need to own is your ASLRB and a collection of marker counters. EVERYTHING YOU NEED in terms of color, die-cut counters is provided in GENESIS '48 2nd Edition! Punch it out and play, no more hunting through tray after tray of old counters to get into the action.

title: Pimps and Ho's
description:
A roll-and-move adult themed board game.  From the publisher's web site:

The craziest board game ever made! Adult game content. It's crude, it's hilarious, it's extremely vindictive, but be warned...it is not a game for the timid, this is a seriously fun game that has you bustin a gut laughin, or gritten your teeth on every play. Looking for a fun adult board game, you just found it! You've never played adult party games like this. It's a board game that weaves sex and strategy into every play. Buy yours today and introduce Pimps and Ho's at your next adult party. We promise...you'll be the hit of the party!

Several expansion sets are available: Sick and Twisted, Drinking, Swingers, and StripTease.

title: Kung Fu
description:
Kung Fu: Chess the Yin/Yang Way

Object of the game

The object of the game is for each opposing force to reunite Yin and Yang. The Yin forces try to capture the Yang, and vice versa. Having captured the opposing force, the winner has achieved fulfillment, and the game ends.

Kung Fu, made in Singapore in the 1970's, is a chess-like game. Instead of a king or general, each player has a Yin/Yang monad and takes on the role of Yin or Yang, controlling a team of Kung Fu fighters (who are dressed in Karategi). The pieces are supposed to represent movements made during the performance of martial arts and have names like Front Kick (Eagle's Onslaught), Hook Kick (Whip of the Dragon's Tail) and Forward Punch (Fist of Fury). Probably influenced by Chinese Chess, each monad is restricted to their own temple of six squares and may not face each other directly in the same file. Unlike Chinese Chess, there is a Guardian piece which stands in front of the monad and which is not restricted to just the temple. However, within the temple, it has the unusual power that when captured within it's own temple, both the Guardian and attacker are removed from the board.

Kung Fu is a curiosity from the heyday of Shaw Brothers films.

title: Buzzball
description: Buzzball is a two-person game, each person choosing a squad of four players from an actual baseball game. The last player on the squad is chosen for you by your opponent. This player is called the Bum. Your opponent will try to pick the worst player for you. The players earn points during the baseball game based on their performances in seven scoring categories. Points are deducted for errors. The winner is the owner whose squad scores the most points. (description from the package)

title: Jätinlinnan Ryöstö
description:
Jtinlinnan Ryst Raid on Giants' Castle boardgame came with Finnish translation of special themed Donald Duck pocket book number five Velhojen Valtakunta Realm of Wizard, an fantasy special with familiar Disney character engaging in Lord of the Rings/sword  sorcery style fantasy adventures. Art of the gameboard comes from comic Taikamiekka (Magic Sword) drawn by Massimo De Vita.

Game itself is of simple roll and move variety, each player starts from one of the four villages pictured on the board, object is to get one of the keys of four different color, get to giants castle trough door of corresponding color, pick the magic sword and return to your starting location.

Board is made of thin cardboard and about 18x24 centimeters.
Players move around chits with four characters from the story printed on them, keys and other objects are also printed on the same kind of thin cardboard. Rules of the game are supplied on small sheet of glossy paper.

Game does not come with dice.

title: American Trivia Game: Spirit of the United States
description: Players take turns getting a chance to answer questions in order to circle flags. Score sheet shows both categories and flag markers that must be crossed off during game play when questions are answered correctly. First team to the agreed upon number wins. Play proceeds clockwise with players either answering the question correctly, or other teams getting a chance to challenge to have the opportunity to answer it themselves.

title: Triple Up
description: Triple Up consists of 40 different cards, each card has no numbers only 3 different symbols from a regular card deck (Heart, Spades Diamonds or Clubs) this is a trump and bidding game. The instructions suggest after all 13 tricks are played, score the game and 1st person to 500 points wins. This game can have almost as many variant card games as a regular deck of cards. Triple Up is a new and refreshing twist on classic trump/bidding card games.

title: Jackpot
mechanisms: Betting/WageringCard DraftingChit-Pull SystemRoll / Spin and Move
description:
A pick-6 lottery game in boardgame form. Players choose ten of 49 Lotto numbers at the start of the game. They have the opportunity to purchase more numbers as they land on the numbered spaces of the game board, which also correspond to several mini-games and the opportunity to win or lose money. Players try to purchase possessions with their winnings, for the object is to have the highest total value in possessions at the end of the game. (Cash does not count.) The game ends when a player matches all six Lotto numbers drawn, plus a Super Number consisting of two rolls of a special die. That player wins the Jackpot and may then spend his winnings on as many possessions as he likes.

Ages 10 and up

title: The Black Prince
description: The Black Prince: The Battle of Navarette, 1367, is a Moment in Conflict series game from the Great Medieval Battles System.

title: Die Tour
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenCard DraftingModular BoardSimulation
description:
One of the most interesting bike race games with a Tour de France theme made ever, but unfortunately also one of the rarest, because only 300 boxes were produced by the authors in 1981. And thats a pity, because all the ingredient's of a great game are there.

Die Tour is a card driven game and all players have 15 cards (1 card = 1 turn) at the start, which they have to work with, until only 2 are left and the hand is filled up again to 15 cards. On these cards are four numbers (= number of fields, the drivers are allowed to move), one for each of the drivers, every team has at the beginning and sometimes special moves for special situations. Each number has to be attached to one of your drivers and the decision how to divide them, is yours.

Rules for group splitting, mountain races, single driver time races and slipstreaming are included in the basic game, but there exists an (even more rare !) advanced rules set, which the authors played with their gaming buddies. Besides various modifications to the basic version, this advanced rules set includes additional rules for group slowing, card exchanges, team time races and more.

Die Tour allows single races (about 60 minutes playing time and there are flat, mountain and time race stages) or an entire campaign game, which is a series of connected stages. Since there are various roads to victory (champion, best mountain driver, highest points and best team), the campaign game is of course the most interesting way, to play Die Tour, because it reduces the effects of luck. But the kings way, to play Die Tour, is to race a campaign game over many gaming nights and to give little prices to the winners in the different categories every evening and bigger prices for the final winners.

An extremely hard to find game, but if you see it somewhere (best chance probably : On flee markets in Berlin-Germany, because the authors are from there), grab it immediately, because you will not regret it !

title: Plaza
description: PLAZA is played with a five-suited pack of 60 cards, the suits being distinguished from each other by color (each color also has a little picture of an animal to help distinguish suits), the cards run from one to twelve in each color. A game turn consists of Draw, Play, Discard. Similar colored cards are placed in a row and similar numbered cards are placed in a column, eventually forming a card grid. The winner is the first player to run out of cards. This game was original enough at the time to get a US Patent (#952939)

title: Honey Tree
mechanisms: Dice RollingPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
The game is a simple roll and move mechanism. The 'board' is a 3 dimensional tree, with 4 platforms at different levels around a hollow trunk.

At the top there are yellow balls (honey) which should be collected. You do this by reaching the last spot and 'jumping' into the hollow trunk to dislodge the honey balls. The bear shaped pawn descends trough the tree trunk to reach ground level with the yellow ball.

You can also push other bears into the trunk, to force them to begin their ascent anew.

The player with the most honey wins the game.

title: Flug um die Welt mit Lufthansa
mechanisms: Player EliminationPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
The Game of Travel

Travel the world with Lufthansa. Whether you plan your course strategically or react spontaneously to the game, your challenge is to defeat both your opponents and chance. Buying the right to fly to an airport is the key within the game because such rights, like in real life, are rare.

What is in the box (German):

1 Spielbrett
1 Wrfel
100 Spielmarken in 5 Farben
42 Ortsnamen-Karten
70 Markierungsstbchen
5 Flugzeuge
10 Sonderflug-Karten
32 Linienflug-Karten
18 berraschungs-Karten
Spielgeld

This is essentially a 1d6 Roll-and-move game where card-driven routes are assigned. Routes are assigned by 1st drawing from the 10 Sonderflug Charters) cards and, when they are exhausted, from the 32 Linienflug (Scheduled) cards. Each connected city uses 1 'movement point'. When the move ends on a city the player pays a 'Landing Fee'. Most fees are 500 but a scattering of 10, 15, and 20 are purchased by the additional payment of the landing fee (a la Monopoly properties). Multiples of these will eventually allow doubling or tripling of fees for the other players.  The only need for reading German is for the 18 Uberraschungs (Surprise) cards. Plays continues until all but 1 player is bankrupt.

title: Fun Fair
description:
