Cut is played on a 9-space track.  Players enter pieces by dice throw at opposite ends and try to bear them off at the opponent's end.  Friendly pieces landing on each other stack and then move together; an piece landing on an opposing piece or stack sends the latter back to the beginning.

In a variant the loser of a round loses all pieces remaining on the board for the next round, and rounds are played until only one player has a piece left.

Unusually, the box is made of wood, and the board is printed on the lid.

title: Hof
description:
Hof, at its most basic, is a 4-in-a-row game for two or three players, on a 6x6 board, using coloured dice as playing pieces. At its most complex it becomes a game in which players use identical sets of dice that all need to be manoeuvred into a sequential row, using the eyes to determine movement range.

At the start, players roll their own colour dice (6 in a two player game, 4 in a three player one). Then, in turn, players position these dice on an empty board space, one by one, and never altering the face value. When a player manages to create a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of 4 own dice, that player wins the round. The victor scores the total pip count of these dice, or the best dice string if the created row exceeds its required length. When all dice are on the board, and no row has been completed, players may move one own die per turn to an adjacent space, but not diagonally. The aim is to score the most points over a given number of rounds.

Anyone vaguely familiar with placement games won't find this much of a challenge, and for these players a couple of trickier variant rules are suggested. Any combination of these variants can be used, to eliminate randomness and increase complexity as desired.

- (2 player only:) to win, a row of 5 or even 6 is needed. 
- players don't start by throwing the dice, but use identical sets instead (1-6 or 1-4).
- a winning row also needs to have the dice in the correct sequence, low to high.
- dice may be moved as many squares as their face value, allowing directional changes too.

The designer isn't credited, but in all likelihood it is Hans-Jörg Nürnberger, as Hanje was the vehicle for Hans-Jrg and Ursula Nrnberger's own designs.

PUBLICATION HISTORY:

     1975 Hof Hanje Spiele-Atelier - out of print




As with some other Hanje games, the small box is made out of wood, and the board is printed on its lid.

ADDITIONAL INFO:

     language skill needed: language neutral. It comes with German rules.
     english translation: none, but the above description should help.
     awards won: none.

title: Joker
description:
In Joker players move 11 pieces each across a 13x13 board in an attempt to get them all to the start positions on the opposing side (a la Chinese Checkers or similar games).

Each piece has 1-4 rings on it which determine how far it can move and/or jump.  In addition there are a number of variants - there are Joker pieces which can be used in a way not entirely clear from the available descriptions, and extra rings which can be added to pieces to increase their movement powers.

title: ZigZag
description:
Each player must concentrate and plan to align his or her four pegs in a row while preventing the opponent from doing so.  The winner is the first player to align the four pegs horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

Contents: 
-  4 orange pegs, 4 green pegs 
- 21 orange roads (7 long and 14 short) 
= 21 green roads (7 long and 14 short) 
= Game board with built-in trays 
= rules

title: Daring Passages
description:
What's the message in this bottle?
A collection of intriguing quotes from famous people - authors , athletes, world leaders, scientists, entertainers... from Charles Dickens to Babe Ruth, from Cleopatra to Elvis Presley. Play Daring 'Passages', the trivia game that will challenge and surprise you. Listen to the quote, then name the person who said it. Get as many as three clues to help you answer. It's a daring passage against your opponents across the nautical course. The first to reach shore, wins!

title: Quibbix
description:
On the Spiel des Jahres 1981 Recommended Games list, Quibbix is a timed tile word game.

A translation of Uwe Petersens short description on the Spiel des Jahres-site:

First you draw 10 out of 120 face-down letter tiles. Then you try to create words by using as many of them as possible within 5 minutes time. The points of the tiles  depending on the chosen difficulty from 1 to 3  are written into your score-board. The score for the longest word is doubled. Then you draw 5 more tiles, combine them with your old tiles to new words and score them again. In a third round you again draw 5 tiles, create words as long as possible with your 20 tiles, score them and determine the winner by adding all points together. With these simple rules Gilbert Obermair (who left the jury of Spiel des Jahres) created one of the funniest word-games of the last time.

Originally published by Intelli in 1980. Ravensburger republished it in 1984.

title: Charlotte in a Box
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveTrading
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Charlotte, North Carolina. It has spaces such as Paramount's Carowinds, The Square, Charlotte Motor Speedway, South 21, Fourth Ward, Mint Museum, and Uptown. The tokens include a football, heart, basketball shoe, trolley car, crown, and a race car. Cards include local events and staples of life in Charlotte.

title: Cleveland in a Box
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveTrading
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Cleveland, Ohio. It has spaces such as Dawg Pound, North Coast Harbor, Sea World of Ohio, Malley's Chocolates, Terminal Tower, Jacobs Field, and The Big Egg. The tokens include a pretzel, heart, baseball mitt, sailboat, dog bone, and a guitar. Cards include local events and staples of life in Cleveland.

title: Teddy Tim
description:
A collection of four children's games using different colored wooden bear tokens, four caves, several cards, and a die.  From the back of the box:

Bear, awake up!  Who will wake the most bears out of their hibernation?  By rolling the die, the children gather each quantity of bear.  One can win everything...or lose much.

Ages 5-15.

title: Sky, Sea and Jungle
description: (From designer's web site) A fast, simple, combined air, sea, and land combat system. Hidden deployment, sometimes compromised by Allied Magic code-breaking intelligence. Primary emphasis on the naval war, with a sleek, factorless combat results system a 3rd Grader can understand. Game includes: B-17s and Bettys, Japanese Long Lance torpedoes, YAMATO, etc. The Guadalcanal campaign (with New Guinea attached) in 9 action-packed turns.

title: Dino Dig
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

Search for specimens and toss mud on two to four paleontologists.

Youre a world-famous paleontologist. Youve been commissioned by a prestigious museum to unearth and assemble a dinosaur. Theres a new dig site rich in fossils. Find the biggest dino!

Object:To gather specific sets of cards while placing useless cards where your opponents will find them.

The game is played on a 'dig site' made up of piles of playing cards. Each player has 3 paleontologists. The players move their paleontologists around the dig site looking for cards they can use to make dinosaurs (each card represents a portion of a dinosaur.) The game ends when one player has at least 5 cards in his 'museum' and has brought all of his paleontologists back to his home space. The player with the longest run (ex: 9-10-J-Q) of cards wins. Ties go to the run with the highest card in it.

title: Spellcycles
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

Create mysteeeerious patterns to cast mysteeeerious spells on two to five mysteeeerious players.

Object: To accumulate Prestige by casting complex spells.

You Need:

* Spell Components: 6 Icehouse sets: Red, yellow, green, blue, white, and black.
    * A Knucklebone: A six-sided die.
    * Prestige Certificates: A standard deck of playing cards.
    * A Casting Field: A checker board.
    * Moon Crescents: Chess pieces or checkers equal to the number of players.
    * An Essence Pool: lots of pennies, stones, or other generic markers.
    * A Spell Deck: lots of index cards and a pencil for each player

Players attempt to cast spells by using components and essence. In most cases, casting spells will gain the players Prestige Certificates. The player with the most Prestige Certificates at the end of the game wins.

title: Looney  Tunes  4-Toon Race
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Race to collect props from your favorite cartoons!

Bugs Bunny, Tweety, Daffy and the Road Runner are on the prowl for the props that made them famous... Race through the legendary cartoon scenes while collecting the items you'll need to win!

The first player to collect a prop from each cartoon scene and reach the rabbit hole wins!  Two to four players roll the die and move their fully sculpted and painted character movers to win.

title: Big Eyes, Small Mouth Anime Card Game
description:
A remake of the game The Great Safari and produced under license from White Rabbit Games, the Big Eyes, Small Mouth Anime Card Game is a hearts variant for three to six players. The deck consists of 55 cards in five suits; four of these suits contain twelve cards and the fifth suit contains seven cards. In addition to suit and rank, every card also has an employer allegiance and a point value when taken in a trick. Some cards also have special abilities described on the card.

The game box contains 55 poker-sized playing cards and a double-sided rule sheet. The art on the cards is taken from the Big Eyes, Small Mouth anime roleplaying game.

title: Seapower II
types: Miniatures Nautical Wargame World War I World War II
description:
Seapower II is one of the older naval miniatures simulations games and covers the period from 1885 to 1945. Fairly comprehensive, it treats ships rather abstractly and includes rules for aircraft, torpedoes, and many other variables. The booklet Seapower III, which is not a standalone game, ups the complexity quite a bit with rules for weather, coastal forts, and deck armor penetration.

Game time is variable but I recall this game not playing too slowly.

From the Publisher's Website:

SEAPOWER 
Alnavco's super-realistic game of WWI  WWII naval warfare; One of the oldest and most widely used systems, it encompasses all aspects of naval warfare incorporating the actual capabilities of warships, aircraft and weapons, both offensive and defensive. It has been designed specifically for wargaming with 1:1200  1:2400 models but frankly is interesting reading even if not used for the purpose for which it is intended!

title: Vertigo
description:
Vertigo is an abstract game with unusual equipment. Players place pieces into an upright Plexiglas disk which turns inside a frame. The pieces can fall out the bottom of the disk, but on which side they fall is controlled by switches and blocking pins.

On a turn a player can add a piece to the disk, turn the disk, flip a switch, or move a blocking pin. The object is to get six pieces to fall on your side.

title: Polit Poker
description:
144 cards (double-sided) with quotes from the platforms of German political parties (CDU/CSU, SPD, Grne, PDS, FDP).

In the first round (of three) all the players need to do is guess which quote belongs to which party. If you answer correctly, you get the card. Some rules (like the Veto rule) enhance gameplay.

In the second round, all players design a party platform with the cards at their disposal, and the players vote for the best one.

title: Woody Woodpecker's Baja Rally
description: Players race around the board collecting their puzzle pieces. The first to complete his or her puzzle and cross the finish line wins.

title: Strawberry Shortcake Card Game Kitchen Capers
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
You can make Strawberry Shortcake deliciously happy by collecting Recipe cards for her housewarming party. But watch out! The Purple Pieman will try to take your recipes from you. The player with the most Recipe cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Deal three piles of cards. Draw a card from any pile. If it is a recipe card, keep it. If it is a Purple Pieman you lose any Recipe cards you have drawn this turn. Keep drawing cards or stop at any time to make your Recipe cards safe.

title: Strawberry Shortcake Card Game Pick-A-Basket
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Strawberry Shortcake is having a housewarming party. She'd love to receive fruit baskets as her surprise housewarming present. How many can you collect for her? Match as many Fruit Basket cards as you can. The one with the most Fruit Basket cards at the end of the game is the winner.

This is a matching game with a twist. Players place all their matches face up in one pile in front of them. If you can match a card to the card on top of their Fruit Basket pile, you can steal ALL their matches.

title: Strawberry Shortcake Card Game Double "Berry" Talk
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Everyone who knows about Strawberryland knows about the Berry Birds. They're the feathered friends of the Purple Pieman, and they repeat everything they hear! Be a Berry Bird by matching each of the Fruit cards that are played. Then use that fruit to make up your very own recipe. The one with the fewest Fruit cards at the end of the game is the winner.

This is a matching game like Uno but the only special card is a wild. If you cannot match a card on your turn, you add the entire discard pile to your hand. The game ends when there are no more cards in the draw pile.

title: Vokabo
description:
Roughly translated from Synes Ernst's description on the Spiel des Jahres site:

The novelty in this game lies in the combination of word or letter play with Rummikub-like mechanics.  With Vokabo the goals is to lay out 15 letter cards according to certain rules as rapidly as possible.  One needs at least 20 points for the first laying out, and the words must be formed from at least three letters.  When laying out one may extend existing words or change them to new words.  In contrast to Scrabble, which develops slowly, the game situation changes constantly in Vokabo.  Flexibility is required as well as constant thought.

title: Fang mich! ... wenn du kannst
types: Animals Children's Game Educational Math Memory Racing
description:
This game has nothing in common with the 2004 Catch Me!.

Translated roughly from Synes Ernst's description on the Spiel des Jahres site:

Catch me! ... if you can is an exciting mixture of memory and chasing game. This makes the uncomplicated, shrewd game of Oded Berman a genuine family game, where children have the same chances as adults. The goal of the game is to overtake, and thus remove from the running, the pieces of fellow players. Who remains at the last is the winner. One moves on a round track, formed at the beginning of the game by 24 disks. The speed at which a piece advances is determined by numbers and symbols on the bottom of the disks. One must remember thus where which disk is.

Catch me! ... if you can: In this unique game the board is made up of cards with numbers on one side  a rabbit on the other. After shuffling  arranging these in a circle, rabbit side up, the players rabbits are placed at random  players must remember the position of cards as they are turned over  what is on each. The last remaining rabbit is the winner.

title: Skript
types: Card Game Deduction Dice Word Game
description: As opposed to building words out of letters a la Scrabble, each player finds a word in the dictionary, which the others must try to figure out during the course of the game. Various cards can be used to obtain hints, including getting the first three letters of the word, getting all the letters in the word except the first three, getting the definition, consulting the dictionary and getting more cards.

title: The Piggeries
description:
The Piggeries game is played by each player gently pulling a string on the back of their respective pig to advance it toward the center of the game, which represents a well.  Players can place bets using the enclosed game counters.  There are four wooden pegged tracks, four hand painted wooden pigs, a well for bets, and a cardboard roof for the well.

The description of the game that appears on the inside of the box lid:

As many persons can take part, as there are pigs in this extremely interesting and amusing game, which holds the players and onlookers spellbound with excitement, from beginning to end.

The game is set up, as seen on the picture.  The players then deposit money or counters in the pool.

The pigs are placed, with their hind legs on the lowest step of the planks.  At a given signal they proceed, step by step, up the plank, by the aid of the string, which the players must pull lightly.  If the string is pulled too hard or violently the pig will tumble and fall from the plank, which necessitates going back to the starting point, thus rendering the game very exciting and making the fun fast and furious.

At first many of these 'accidents' will happen, but with a little more practice, the player becomes adept and the pigs make splendid progress.  The player, whose pig arrives at the trough first, is declared winner and accordingly takes the stakes.  Throughout the game the pigs must not be touched by the hand.

No year or publisher is on the box...

title: Big Game Hunters of the Universe
description: From the publisher - Big game hunting across the far reaches of the galaxy promises all the thrills you crave and the trophies you can show off. Seems everyone wants a Scutapid rug on the living room floor or a stuffed Bixan Norflunt in the reading room. Trouble is, it costs a fortune to bag these beasts. But now you've got a good thing going by leading expeditions when you can't pay for them yourself. Armed with your deadly technology and slick marketing ploys, no creature in the universe is safe. Just hope you can nab the best creatures before your competitors!

title: Connection Games
description:
In this comprehensive study of the connection game genre, Browne provides a survey of known connection games, such as Hex and Y, while exploring common themes and strategies.
The book :
- Imposes some structure on this large family of games. 
- Defines exactly what constitutes a connection game.
- Examines key games in detail.
- Provides complete rules for over 200 connection games and variants.

title: Fearless
description:
Fearless is a Science Fiction skirmish game with 1 or more miniatures per player. Each of these characters has his own stats card. The game is played in an arena, where both sides enter one-by-one through teleportation gates.

The game comes with three randomly selected metal miniatures. Additional miniatures are available from the publisher (and not randomized).

title: Open Card Game
description:
Open Card Game is actually a collection of games (the exact number is unclear) which all use the common mechanic of placing playing cards on a board and moving them.

There are three different custom card decks used and three different boards as well.  The mechanics for the various games involve standard card game mechanics such as higher ranks beating lower ranks, trumping, etc.

title: Open Dominoes Game
description: The Open Dominoes Game is actually a collection of games all played with dominoes on a board.  There are at least three custom domino sets used in the games, which share the common feature of having arrows to control their orientation, and several different boards.

title: Abi: A Game of Word Recall
description: Abi challenges players to exercise their problem-solving skills. Requiring only a single die (included), this pack of 26 cards offers hours of fun for up to four players, ages 13 and above.

title: Alpha Nature
description:
From the box: The object of the game is to move through the letters of the alphabet from A to Z. The winner is the first person to reach Z. You have two levels of challenge to choose from. Level one Ages 8 and up, level two Ages 12 and up.

Basically you move round the board from A to Z and answer questions about nature. You advance one space at a time, when you land on a square has a letter or letters on it you roll the 8 sided dice to decide which of the categories you have to name a nature item on. The six categories are Trees, Edible Plants, Space, Animals, Water, Flowers, Land or any category. You have to name something from the appropriate category beginning with the letter on the square you have landed on. You are not allowed to repeat something that has been used before. In between the letter spaces are alpha nature card spaces, when you land on these you have to answer a question of one of the cards to see if you can advance onto the next letter space. Whenever you answer correctly you move onto the next space, as soon as you are unable to answer a question or name something correctly your turn ends. The winner is the first person to reach the end of the alphabet and name something in the appropriate category.

This is an educational game and there are some variants depending on the players ability.

title: Regatta: The Game of Champions
description: Regatta: The Game of Champions was the official boardgame of the America's Cup 2000 yachting event in New Zealand. Countries included are Japan, United States of America, Italy, France, Australia and New Zealand. The game is rather light and reasonably quick, with cards representing events that can change the race, including wind shifts, tactics and incidents. Movement is set depending on what wind speed your yacht is currently experiencing (the dice are used to determine whether wind speed increases or decreases for each yacht each turn). Regatta can be played as a traditional one-on-one race, four player race or a 3-6 player fleet race.

title: Schnapp die Wurst
description:
Schnapp die Wurst (Catch the Sausage)
Game idea:
The dogs are sniffing and running along the washing-line. Next to the sock there is a deliciously smelling sausage! Whoever is lucky with the dice and gives a bit of thought to pulling of the line, will have their dog standing in the right moment directly underneath the sausage card and collect many delicious sausages. If on the dice appears the bowl, a tidbit can even be taken directly out of the bowl. But watch out: Whoever snatches at the sock hanging on the line, has to return a sausage.
A dice game with movable washing-line attached to real posts.

(From back of box.)

title: Cricket Wizard
description: Cricket Wizard is a simple cricket boardgame which provides an educational insight into how the game of cricket works. It was created with the support of the Clear Black Caps (New Zealand cricket team), New Zealand Cricket and also the Cric Info website. The game relies on dice rolling (a combination of a special 20-sided die and some 6 sided dice) and fielding placement as one team attempts to take wickets while the other team strives to make as many runs as possible. Unfortunately at times the dice can favor the fielding team and wickets can drop very quickly after some lucky rolls. The game does show how to score a cricket game and how the rules of the real game work, so it is possible to learn the basics of cricket just by reading the rules or playing the game.

title: The 1 Game
description:
An abstract strategy game for two players involving a triangular (equilateral) board that has positions for 36 balls, or marbles. i.e., one row each of 1, 2, 3, ... and 8 balls. The game contains 42 silver balls, 8 blue balls and 1 red ball, but only 36 of these are used in each game. A cleverly designed box/board with sliding panel makes setup a breeze as well as randomizing the initial set up.

Players take turns removing any number of consecutive balls along a single horizontal line, as long is there is no gap or red ball between them. The removed balls are discarded into the large hole and underneath the slider, which stops them going astray and gets them ready for the next game. The red ball can only be taken on its own. Any row containing red can only be taken up to the red. A blue ball allows players to take up to, or part of, three entire rows radiating from that blue. Other blues in the path are treated as regular silver balls. The player with the last ball loses.

title: The Wizard of Oz
description:
Dorothy, The Cowardly Lion, Rusty, the Tin Man and Socrates, the Scarecrow travel by way of the yellow brick road to the Emerald City seeking Kansas, Courage, Heart and a Brain.

A simple race game that was published in the early 60's. The game is based on the story of The Wizard Of Oz.

The components include 1 board, 4 character cards, 4 goal cards, 4 colored pawns and 1 die.

Players start in different spots, but at the same distance from the goal. Movement  is dictated by a single dice throw. The first player to reach the goal and collect the correct card wins.

title: Country Music Triviologies
description: Aleken Games COUNTRY MUSIC TRIVIOLOGIESis a party game for Country music fans ages 10 and up and can be played by two or more players or in teams. If you know the nickname of Willie Nelsons famous guitar (Trigger), what Country star played Bo Duke on the hit T.V. show The Dukes of Hazzard (John Schneider) or if you have no problem remembering the name of Kenny Chesneys 2002 hit record (No Shoes, No Shirt, No Problem), youll have a blast with this game. The game comes complete with over 750 questions, including a mix of softballs for the casual Country fan and more challenging Country Star questions for Country music fanatics.

title: Warhammer English Civil War
types: Civil War Miniatures Pike and Shot Wargame
description: This 144-page book is Warhammer Ancients' entry into the English Civil War period.  Unlike the other Warhammer Ancients books, this one includes a whole new rule set.  Gone are commanders rolling to give orders to units, instead, this game covering a more modern period sticks to basic Warhammer rules but makes them more similar to most Napoleonic miniature rule sets.  Great illustrations with art work and photos of the Sealed Knot Society reenactments.  Includes army lists for Parliamentarians, Royalists, The Scots Government, and The Scots Royalists armies.

title: Bench Coach Baseball
description:
Bench Coach Baseball is a game which keeps track of a pitcher's pitch count. Each batter is rated for his swinging at the first pitch, going ahead of the count, falling behind, or hitting with two strikes.  Rules are simple and game is based on 1-200 chances to hit or make an out.  Results are generated from three dice:  a green 20-sided die, and a blue and red six-sided die. A pitcher who consistently fall behind the count will tire more quickly and get hit harder than a pitcher who remains ahead of the hitters. Pitchers are also rated on their ability to hold runners. There is also rules for hit and out location, and sacrifice bunts. Game includes a pitch-count sheet, rules, stadium factors and individual players with their own player cards, like APBA and Strat-o-Matic. The cards for this game are not as aesthetically pleasing as the Strat-O cards or the newer APBA baseball cards:  just cardstock with heavy black numbers and letters.

The main distributor for Adam Games is Taylor Marketing.

title: Streetsafe
description:
STREETSAFE is designed by Trevor Roberts, a former British Ju Jitsu Champion.  It was developed to teach people how to be safe on the street.

The aim of the game is to visit four places in the city (determined by a deal of destination cards) whilst avoiding dangerous areas such as dark alley or parks.

Prior to commencing their journey players may elect to undertake training in the martial arts thereby providing them with a better chance of defining themselves against any dangers that they may come across during that journey.

When they decide to start players move around the game board as the result of a roll of a D6.  On landing on a Risk square a card is drawn and the instructions on that card followed (i.e. go back 4 spaces, go to the nearest Streetwise space...).

On landing on a Streetwise space a card is drawn which presents the player with a scenario such as being faced by one man with a large stick.  The player then has the option of running away (normally the best course of action) or staying.  The results of the encounter are determined by the choice made and the level of self-defense training achieved by the player.

The first player to visit his/her four destinations and return the the Bus Depot (start) is the winner.

title: Send!
description:
A UK National Distribution Game

From the rules:

Each player has a factory, all producing similar products. Each sends these products to customers all over Britain. Some parts are too far away to supply direct, so distribution depots are built to to cut delivery costs. Profits can be used to build more depots, to make more profits. At the end, the player with the most total wealth (factory, depots, stocks and cash) is the winner.

title: Take Your Pick!
description: Take Your Pick is a board game from the 1950's, produced by Bell games and based on the very successful UK ITV game show of the same name hosted by Michael Miles.

title: Petticoat Lane
description:
A trading game based on the famous London market of the same name.  The board is molded plastic, and it came with hundreds of counters, cards and scrip.

From the rules:
Buying and selling is fun when you play Petticoat Lane, where each player tries to become the most successful trader.

Each player has his own market stall, which he opens with a stock of highly unusual articles, never before offered for sale.  As the game progresses he sells these articles, and with the money made, buys more stock.

Each player tries to outsell his trading rivals by attempting to corner the market on some articles, by changing his prices, and by holding promotional sales.

The game ends when one of the players succeeds in selling all his stock.  The winner is the player who has made the most money - unsold stock has no value.

title: Supersell
description:
From the rules:

Supersell is a game in which each player buys cars from the bank and sell them again at a profit to an independent buyer (not one of the players) who move around the board according to throws of the dice. The fun lies in anticipating where the buyer will stop and being there at the right time with your salesmen and cars.

The first player to accumulate 15000 in cash is the winner.

title: Dudley Dodo's Environment Game
description:
DUDLEY DODO'S ENVIRONMENT GAME is aimed at teaching about the environment and the sensitive relationship between man and other forms of life.

Players take it in turns to roll the dice and move the playing piece in a clockwise or anticlockwise direction around the board answering questions on the environment as they go.

A majority of the squares on the board are coloured red, brown, blue or green representing the following subjects - animals, the universe, water and plants.  On landing on one of these squares a question is asked corresponding to the colour of the square.  A successfully answered question allows a player to roll and move again. If the question is answered incorrectly, the turn ends.  It should be noted that there are family questions for older players and junior questions for younger players.

If a player lands on one of the four Dudley Dodo squares (there is one for each category/colour) he is similarly asked a question of the appropriate category.  A correct answer at this point earns one piece of the four-piece Dudley Dodo jigsaw.

The environment square requires players to draw a card and follow the instructions (miss a turn, gain/lose a Dudley Dodo card, etc.).

The first player to successfully collect all four pices of the Dudley Dodo jigsaw wins the game.

title: Send aben videre! Junior
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Electronic Humor Memory Party Game
description:
A player draws a card with a simple question and passes the annoying monkey timer to another player who has to answer the question before the monkey laughs.

When he has answered he passes the monkey (resetting the timer) on to the next player who must come up with another answer before the monkey laughs. This goes on until a player gives a wrong answer or the monkey laughs.

The player with the monkey moves his brain down the intelligence track. The loser is the first to reach the loser level.

Just like Send aben videre!, but only 240 questions and slightly easier.

title: Castles
description:
From the Kaothic Games website:

You Need:

* A piecepack set
    * Pen and paper

The object of Castles is to collect the most gold over a predetermined number of rounds (equal to the number of players, one different a player starts each round). You must place your castle nearest most valuable resource tiles and try to avoid hostile tiles, which deplete the gold you collect from the region. To control tiles you must deploy your armies over the terrain. To count your gains you must attend the tile where you placed your castle and four orthogonally adjacent tiles to that tile.

After all rounds, the player with the most gold wins.

title: Flip Flop Go
description: This is another variant of the late 19th century game of Reversi (aka Othello). Trap other pieces between your own to capture them but be aware that the opponent may do the same. Pieces will change sides (colors) dozens of times. Points are scored every time a chip is flipped, as opposed to OTHELLO where it is only at the end points are scored. Each player also has a STOP chip and two DOUBLE chips. The STOP chip is undetectable when played and only shows itself when the opponent attempts to flip it. The DOUBLE chips always show and it doubles the points scored in that row when it gets flipped. If there are two DOUBLE chips in a row being flipped the score is quadrupled. There are handy thumb wheel scoring devices for each player attached to the games board as well.

title: Macadam
description:
From the designer's website (edited):

Macadam was born on the street and now spreads out on the web. It's an easy strategy board game. To play, you just need a chalk and a few stones. Each game takes place in 15 minutes or less.

This game resembles football or basketball: you simply need to bring your pawns to your opponent's side and 'score' a goal.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Jots and Tittles
description: Similar to Trivial Pursuit but with questions geared toward the LDS community.  The questions fall in six categories: Church History, Church People, Old Testament, New Testament, Book of Mormon and Places.

title: Cross Purposes
description:
From the rules:  Cross Purposes is a game of strategy for two players.

You start a game of Cross Purposes with five trains at your House. Your goal is to get all five trains across the board to your Station, and then to get them all back Home. The train tracks might not run from your Home to your Station, but you can switch the tracks so that they will point where you want your trains to go. Sound simple? It is, except that your opponent has a Home and a Station too, and is trying to run trains on the same tracks. Your opponent will be turning the switches so that the paths run in a different direction. This is why you and your opponent are always at Cross Purposes!

title: Los Angeles in a Box
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveTrading
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Los Angeles, California. It has spaces such as Watts Tower, Venice Beach, Farmer's Market, Hollywood, Dodger Stadium, Malibu, and the Walk of Fame. The tokens include a movie reel, cookie, surfboard, roller blade, sunglasses, and a sailboat. Cards include local events and staples of life in Los Angeles.

title: Rise of the Red Army
description:
The Rise of the Red Army is a territorial strategy game covering the Russian Revolution following World War I. Historical representation of the Bolshevik, Siberian, and Crimean factions, including the Polish invasion of Russia, Japanese occupation, and independence movements from Finland and the Baltic States.

The game comes in a small box, with two large folded (very folded) semi-laminated maps. The components are plastic poker chips with stickers the players affix themselves.

The rules are closely based on Axis and Allies. Each player plays one or more nations, each varying in size and power. There is much greater variation in starting power and capabilities in this game than there is in Axis and Allies. The Bolsheviks control numerous units and a vast swath of territories, while other nations begin with only a handful of each. This imbalance in power is offset by the setting of different victory conditions for each nation. Furthermore, the victory conditions vary depending on how many players are playing and what nations they each control.

Resource collection rules are basically the same as Axis and Allies, (the generic resources are equivalent to the IPC's from Axis and Allies, i.e. each territory is worth a certain number of resources) with slight variations for some nations. For example, the Northern and Crimean White Russian forces gain extra resources if they keep control of their ports (representing aid from the U.K., U.S., and France), while the Bolsheviks and Ukrainian Anarchists gain extra resources from any of the core Russian areas they control (representing support from the local populace).

Combat rules also follow Axis and Allies, with some extra rules for trenches (which aid defense), bi-planes (very weak in the game), generals (who can add their combat factors to any units they share an area with when attacking or defending), etc. Ten-sided dice are used for combat. Certain nations, such as the Bolsheviks, Poles, and Ukrainians, have more effective infantry than others. The handful of Czech infantry controlled by the Siberian White Russians also gain bonuses in combat.

After combat, players must spend resources to incorporate the territories they conquer. Only after a territory has been incorporated can the new owner collect resources from it.

The number of territories on the map is enormous. This increases tactical opportunities, but it would seem that this could make resource collection somewhat onerous for some nations. While the Poles begin the game with 31 resources, the Bolsheviks begin with 306! Of course, the Bolsheviks are under attack from nearly every direction, so they need the bonus.

title: Huis Clos
description: A deduction game in which you can role play a little bit.  All players are guests in an old mansion, but one is actually a murderer, and the other players have to determine who that is.  It is slightly related to games such as Werewolf/Mafia or Bang!

title: Par: 5
description: The playing material consists of 60 double-hex tiles - 42 have one yellow and one green hex, and the other 18 are single-colored and reserved for the player whose color they are.  Players play one tile a turn in an effort to get five hexes in a row of their color without also creating such a row for their opponent.

title: Patterns II
description:
This game of inductive logic is similar to Eleusis. One player is the designer, who creates a hidden pattern of symbols in a 6 by 6 grid which the other players try to discover. The other players can peek at any of the grid cells they wish, but the more they view, the lower their score when they finally guess the pattern. The designer's score is based on the difference between the best and worst other scores, so it's in his interest to make the pattern somewhat, but not too, challenging.

Patterns II was published in Sackson's book _A Gamut of Games_.

title: Parkology
description:
From the box:  Parkology is an educational game designed to entertain the players. As you advance around the board you'll need to decide whether or not to build campsites at the Parks you land on. You'll discover ways to outsmart the other players as you determine when and where to build. But...watch out, the roll of the dice can make a big difference -- you may end up at Alcatraz! (Lost  Found is much more fun!) Good luck!

It looks like a Monopoly variant, but with some differences.

title: The Peoria Game
description: This looks like a Monopoly variant set in Peoria, Illinois, using actual business names from that city.

title: New Orleans in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in New Orleans, Louisiana. It has spaces such as Garden District, Louisiana Superdome, The Times-Picayune, Caf Du Monde, Steamboat Natchez, French Market, and Bourbon Street. The tokens include a pretzel, heart, crab, steamboat, fish, and saxophone. Cards include local events and staples of life in New Orleans.

title: Walt Disney's Sleeping Beauty Game
description: For 2,3, or 4 players. Ages 6 - 12 Includes plastic pawns, spinner, 4 sword cards, 4 shield cards, game board. Based on the 1959 Walt Disney animated feature film Sleeping Beauty. Players advance along a path to the goal, Sleeping Beauty. Various obstacles. First to reach the Sleeping Beauty wins the game.

title: Sodavandsfabrikken
description:
There are lots of different kinds of bottles in the factory: Yellow, red, green, brown, orange and clear. Each player has his own case, where the different bottles are mixed - with exactly 4 of each colour. A handful of bottles are drawn from the bag. If there are fewer than 4 of a kind, they are placed on the transportation track, but if you are lucky and draw exactly 4 of a kind, you may place them in your case immediately. If you get more than 4 of a kind, you will have to return that colour to the bag. The more bottles you draw, the bigger the chance of you geting your case filled, but you also increase the risk of drawing to many.

If you already have bottles on your transportation tracks (from last time you drew), you will add those to the next handful you draw.

title: Serauqs
description:
According to Sid Sacksons A Gamut of Games:
Each player has four pieces which move on a four by four board, with the objective of forming a straight line or a square. But one piece is wild and can be used in the opponent's winning position.

title: Sudden Score
description:
According to Sid Sacksons A Gamut of Games:
The pieces have O for offensive on one side and X for defensive on the other. On a turn a player may flip and then move. O pieces move further and can capture in a novel manner. X pieces are safe. Win by moving seven pieces into opponent's goal.

title: Ready or Not
description:
4 delightful games, all packaged in box and played on a unique plastic platform with interchangeable playing pieces.

All the games are based on classic outdoor games like Hide and Seek, Tag, Hot Or Cold and Leap Frog. Each time you play Ready or Not you will experience the thrill of these outdoor games...right indoors!

(from the rules)

title: Reddy Clown 3-Ring Circus Game
description: A simple roll-and-move game with a circus theme. Try to reach the middle ring of the circus while collecting all of the appropriate pieces.

title: Dough Nuts!
description:
From the publisher's website:

The Evil Mad Scientist has kidnapped a bus load of children, and unless his demands are met they will be plunged over the side of a cliff!

This is where you come in - the President has called on the greatest doughnut bakers in the world. Get out there and bake the largest pile of dough nuts the world has ever seen so when the bus falls it will have a soft landing.

Will you and your fellow bakers be able to create a pile large enough to cushion the bus's deadly plunge? Will The Evil Mad Scientist get away with it? Can you beat out the other bakers and establish economic dominance over them when the dust settles (that is, get rich in the process)? Will you be able to SAVE THE CHILDREN?!?

In Dough Nuts! you take on the role of one of the premiere doughnut bakers in the world. If the players are able to amass a common pile of 100 doughnuts before time runs out, the children are saved and the baker with the most money wins. Beware, though - if there's even one single errant doughnut, the children will plunge to a horrible burning death and all the players lose. You wouldn't want that, now would you?

Dough Nuts! is a comical card/strategy game for 2 to 4 players, comprised of 121 beautifully illustrated cards.

title: Oklahoma City in a Box
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveTrading
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. It has spaces such as the State Capitol, Milk Bottle Building, Bricktown Canal, and Crystal Bridge. The tokens include a Capitol Building, Baseball Mitt, Cowboy Boot, Arrowhead, Trolley, Longhorn. Cards include local events and staples of life in Oklahoma City.

title: Panda-monium
description:
Getting rid of all your cards sounds easy but just as you think you're winning some nasty person throws in their Panda and creates (yes, you've guessed it) PANDA-MONIUM.

CONTENTS

Panda-monium cards
A red number from 1-7 on a white card.
These cards start the piles.

White cards
A green numbered panda from 2-6 on a white card.
These cards build the piles.

Yellow cards
A green numbered panda either 1 or 7 on a yellow card.
These cards close the piles.

Four plastic pandas
These are used to force other players to pick up unfinished piles and add them to their pile.

title: Treckers
description:
2 or 3 players play on a six-sided board, moving their twelve pieces from their Base Line toward their King Row.  The object is the same as checkers: to eliminate the playing pieces of the opposing player(s) by jumping or cornering them.

Treckers comes with five levels of play:

Level 1 - Players move only away from their Base Lines (not sideways or backwards) until a piece is made a King, in which case it can then move any direction.

Level 2 - Level 1 rules plus single pieces can move sideways (in addition to forward).

Level 3 - Level 1 rules plus players may jump their own pieces, thus allowing quicker movement across the board.

Level 4 - Level 3 rules plus single pieces can move sideways.

Level 5 - Players take opponents' pieces by capture, not by jumping (like in chess).  Also, pieces can move one or two spaces, but two spaces only if moving toward the King Row and not sideways.

title: Starfleet Command
description:
Released at the 1973 Star Trek convention, only 100 copies were produced.

Included (26) round counters to be cut out; (12) orange Federation ships, and (16) blue Klingon/Romulan. A pink fire template is included, (8) sheets of various ship logs and a hex map of the area around the Neutral Zone.

title: Cross-Cubes
description:
According to Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games:

Shake six black cubes into place on a five by five field. Then throw nineteen cubes with letter faces and, working against a timer, fill them into the field to form a crossword puzzle.

title: Crossword Bingo
description:
According to Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games:

Each player takes a Bingo card showing twenty letters. Then, working with their own letter tiles, all players attempt to form words before a timer runs out. Matching letters are moved to the card. Continue until one card is filled.

title: Galleon Quest
description: Galleon Quest is the game of salvage operations for competing divers. The object of the game is to expand and build up your dive salvage business with bigger vessels and better equipment. The more salvage work you complete, the more money you earn. Be the first to purchase all the equipment necessary to salvage the great galleon wrecked at the ocean floor and you win!

title: Nebula
description: Nebula is a unique game which combines the elements of checkers, chess, and tic-tac-toe. The object of Nebula is to build rows of three or more stars in any direction, while at the same time blocking the opponents chance to build or lengthen his rows.

title: Syntactics
description:
According to Sid Sacksons A Gamut of Games:

Word tiles are played as sentences along a recessed path winding toward the center of the board. Crossing sentences can be entered at ten indicated locations.

title: Mr. Lincoln's War: Army of the Tennessee
description:
From the contents:

Mr. Lincoln's War is an historical game which captures the epic struggle of the American Civil War.  Mr. Lincoln's War is organized into two games, the Army of the Tennessee, which deals with the western theater, and The Army of the Potomac, which deals with the war in Virginia.  Each game has four short campaign scenarios that recreate the maneuvers and battles of Shiloh, Gettysburg, Atlanta and other monumental Civil War contests.  A grand campaign scenario enabling the players to fight the war in the West or East is provided with each game.  Both games may be combined for a grand campaign game that simulates the entire Civil War on both fronts.

Each game contains the following components:
1) One 22' x 28' mapboard covering the eastern or western portion of the United States.
2) 400 die-cut playing pieces.
3) A rules booklet.
4) A scenario booklet.
5) One player-aid and leader display card.

Each hex represents about 12 miles.
Each strength point represents approximately 2,500 men.

Additional information:

Game features alternating player turns including interception movement by the non-phasing player, leaders required to move infantry, special rules for naval and amphibious operations, supply, railroad construction and repairs, a combat system featuring morale and leadership and a campaign game combining both the Potomac and  the Tennessee games. The campaign game also adds politics and production to the mix.
Turns are monthly, except for the winter turns (November to February), which are bi-monthly.

title: Firefight
description:
Firefight is a skirmish-level adventure game, based on the Ion Age background first developed by Alternative Armies to characterize their metal miniatures. It pits the fiercely independent humans of the Free Companies against their mysterious and powerful foe, the Shia Khan. This particular product is designed for science fiction urban combat, although the same system resurfaces throughout the Ion Age range.

Firefight is extremely fast-moving and demanding. Combat is deadly; combat with weapons of a future era are bound to be even more destructive. Firefight is very unforgiving; the guy who takes the wrong risk at the wrong time is going to be decimated.

title: Valley of Hell
description:
Valley of Hell is a game of the Army of Vietnam's (ARVN) invasion of Laos in 1971. It was the first major ARVN offensive of the Vietnam War and its objective was the North Vietnamese Army's (NVA) supply base at Tchepone, Laos.

The designer published the first edition in 1981, and a second edition was done by Strategic Games Publications in 1986.

title: Beans
description:
Buon Gioco (pronounced bon joko)  - or Good Game was published by Avid Press for Starbucks, and separately marketed as a classic coffee house card game from Italy and from Mexico.

From the publisher:
Originally from Italy, BUON GIOCO is a game of skill and chance for 2 or 4 players. Played extensively wherever people gather for friendship and pleasure, BUON GIOCO is the perfect cafe companion for North American coffee lovers.
The design of the forty card deck is based on traditional European playing cards that date back to medieval times. The name of the suits in Italian are Coppa for Cup, Oro for Gold, Spada for Sword, and Bastone for Club.
For convenience as well as atmosphere, use coffee beans for scoring by collecting one coffee bean for each game point won.

Attractively packaged in a small wooden box with cardstock cover, the game includes a bag of coffee beans (for scoring, presumably not consumption!), a deck of 40 particularly attractive cards, and a small rulebook.

title: Petri
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

Multiply and spread in this strategic territory-claiming, piece-elimination game with a strong dose of chance for two to six organisms.

You Need

* A Chinese checkers set.
    * Two 6-sided dice.
    * A capture cup for each player.

On your turn, roll the dice, transform your pieces (either add or remove pieces on the board), then check for captures (based on the number of adjacent friendly and opposing pieces -- captured pieces, whether friendly or not, go to your capture cup).

The game ends when one player has no pieces left in play or in hand, or if there are no pieces on the board and all players have taken a turn.

If you have the most pieces in your capture cup at the end of the game, you win.

title: The Kites and Darts Game
description:
Kites and darts are the names given to two tiles discovered by Sir Roger Penrose.  These tiles have the very interesting property of tiling the plane aperiodically - that is, they cover the plane completely without repeating their pattern as do triangles, squares, hexagons, etc.
The tilings have many other properties of mathematical interest which can be read about in one of Martin Gardner's books, among other places.

Kadon sells a nice set of these tiles which can be used for making patterns and solving puzzles, but also includes a board and rules for a game that can be played with them.

title: King of the Sea
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Fighting Nautical Territory Building
description:
(From the box cover) Exciting Game of Strategy  Conquest. Players Command Their Own Fleet. Fire Away...Sink Ships...Capture Islands. And Become...the King of the Sea.

Game board is a plastic three-dimensional base in two parts depicting a sea dotted with islands. Each player has five ships which are moved from sea area to sea area in an effort to capture islands. After each move, the player gets to fire cannon balls from spring-operated cannon in an effort to knock down opponent's ships or island bases.

The winner is the first player to capture five islands or sink all of the opposite side's ships. (Note that you will generally be capturing islands on your side of the board.)  (But, that doesn't mean that you CAN'T capture an island on your opponent's side of the board.  It's just harder to do as you get closer and closer to your opponent's cannon.)

Four player game is simply team play with one player on each side taking the role of gunner and the other moving the ships.

title: Alesia
description: A wargame from France dealing with the ancient siege of Alesia.

title: Fuzzi, Heinz und Schlendrian
description:
One of the recommended games for the Spiel des Jahres 1983, the theme features ferrying passengers via trains to their appropriate stations.  The game shares some characteristics with Ludo/Parcheesi, except with two moving tracks and cards instead of dice.

Roughly translated from Jurgen Herz's description on the Spiel des Jahres site:

http://www.spiel-des-jahres.com/spiel/1983/fuzzi.html

On a small round track made from plastic rails, run two trains, each with five cars.  Each player receives four passengers - colored wood pieces - who must be brought to their destination station.  A passenger can only board a railroad car if the vacant car is directly before their entering space.  Once a passenger is on their way, it may happen that the railroad car stops at a changeover station.  Then the passenger must leave and wait for the next free railroad car to come by.  The movement of the trains is determined by small colored cards, which are drawn from a deck.  Since one can choose which of the two trains one moves, here begins the tactical possibilities of this game, which lift it above the mass of simple dice games for children.

title: Wir füttern die kleinen Nilpferde
description:
Children roll and move among the hippos. When their move ends in front of a hippo, they feed it (give away one of their eleven chips). When they meet another child, they can give it one chip. The first child to run out of chips is the winner. A hippo that has eaten five chips falls asleep and doesn't accept more food.

Spiel des Jahres special award winner in 1983.

title: Feuerwehr
description:
The old part of town is burning!  All four fire stations have been alarmed, and the fire-brigade cars are immediately in motion, but unfortunately four vehicles before each fire-brigade car block their way to the house in the center.  The fight against the time begins. All players lose if the house is covered with twelve flames;  all win if every player's fire-brigade car has reached the house in time.

from http://www.spielarchiv.de/spiel/f/feuerwehr/feuerwehr.htm

title: Philadelphia in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. It has spaces such as Penn's Landing, Liberty Bell, Society Hill, Jeweler's Row, Betsy Ross House, Italian Market, and a Philly Cheesesteak.  The tokens include a pretzel, heart, Liberty Bell, Ben Franklin, Love statue, and a Cheesesteak. Cards include local events and staples of life in Philadelphia.

title: PS
description:
One of the early Hans-Im-Glck games - it is about a Grand Prix race - every player sports 3 cars. With special dice (all six-sided displaying different numbers) you move your cars. Also included are advanced rules for fuel consumption. 
Game includes:
- rule book
- 12 racing cars (wooden and additional counter versions)
- 9 PS speed indicators
- game board
- informational counters

title: Marlborough at Blenheim
description:
Simulation game of the Battle of Blenheim, Marlborough's famous victory of 1704 during the War of the Spanish Succession. One player plays with the British and the Imperial troops, the other with the French and the Bavarians.

Game includes a 17 by 22 map, a 8-page rulebook, a charts and tables sheet and 120 back printed counters.

title: Dungeons & Dragons: The Dragon's Den
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Exploration Fantasy
mechanisms: Co-operative PlayDice RollingRole PlayingVariable Player Powers
description:
The first adventure pack expansion to the base board game of New Easy to Master Dungeons and Dragons. The world of the base game and the expansions is called Thunder Rift. There were 3 expansions created for the base game. Dragon's Den, Dungeons & Dragons: The Goblin's Lair ,  Dungeons & Dragons: The Haunted Tower. A dungeon crawl and monster bashing adventure for beginners.

The dragon laughs and prepares to strike. But you were nearly defeated by his minions, and you are now too weak to wield your sword. Your magic-user is out of spells; your other comrades, too, have lost their fighting spirit. What hope have you of defeating the vile dragon? Do you run, or do you try one last, desperate plan...?

Inside this box you'll find three complete adventures, each featuring a different dragon. But before you and your friends can confront a fiendish black, green, or red dragon, you must fight off hordes of evil lizard men, troglodytes, bugbears, and more! Then it's up to you to escape from the dungeon alive!
In addition to the three adventures, there's also a stand-alone board game that uses all the game pieces and poster maps inside. You and your friends will enjoy hours of high excitement with the three adventures and the bonus game, too!

The expansion includes 3 16 page adventure booklets, 3 full color fold up maps, 1d6 and d10, new counters, new floor tiles to enhance the maps, 72 new monster stand-ups, and 8 more character stand-ups. The three adventures can be played separately or as a series of connected adventures.

title: Dungeons & Dragons: The Haunted Tower
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Exploration Fantasy
description:
The third adventure pack expansion to the base board game of New Easy to Master Dungeons and Dragons. The world of the base game and the expansions is called Thunder Rift. There were 3 expansions created for the base game. Dungeons & Dragons: The Goblin's Lair ,  Dungeons & Dragons: The Dragon's Den,  The Haunted Tower. A dungeon crawl and monster bashing adventure for beginners.

Inside this box you'll find three complete adventures. The adventurers are challenged to explore and solve the mysteries of three frightening graves. The most terrible and eerie foes of the DD game are featured in these three adventures: undead (skeletons, zombies, ghouls, mummies, ghosts and even vampires!)

The expansion includes 3 16 page adventure booklets, 3 full color fold up maps, 1d6 and d10, new counters, new floor tiles to enhance the maps, 72 new monster stand-ups, and 8 more character stand-ups. The three adventures can be played separately or as a series of connected adventures.

The Haunted Tower Components Checklist:

Paper minis (sheet 1): Bone Golem, Werewolf x 2, Gnoll x 2, Gnoll Shaman, Gnoll Chieftan, Gargoyle x 2, Black Widow Spider x 2, Tarantella Spider, Pit Viper x 3, Carrion Crawler x 2, Tiger Beetle x 3, Robber Fly x 4

Paper minis (sheet 2): Mummy, Vampire, Ghoul x 4, Skeleton x 10, Zombie x 2, and six PCs (not labelled but look like: blonde male with large shield and sword; female with shield and mace; pony-tailed male resting his foot on a rock; female balancing a knife, blue-cloaked male with yellow knife, dwarf with sword and shield

Paper minis (sheet 3): Wraith, Wight x 3, Specter, Giant Rats x 3, Giant Bats x 2, Giant Vampire Bat x 2, Wolf x 4, Dire Wolf x 2, Basilisk, Doppleganger, Cockatrice, Rust Monster x 2, Displacer Beast

3 Maps: Single-sided, labelled The Fighters' Academy, component code 1081XXX0701; single-sided, labelled Tower of Evil, component code 1081XXX0702; single-sided, labelled Lair of the Vampire Lord, component code 1081XXX0703.

Note: This set also has some sheets of cardstock dungeon dressing tokens.
Expands

    The New Easy to Master Dungeons & Dragons

title: Monopoly: 25th Anniversary
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingDice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
Bearing in mind the game was produced in 1960, the production values were remarkably high.  The 25th Anniversary Edition of Monopoly has the following unusual features:

The box lid is covered in embossed silver foil paper.
The box base is also covered in the same embossed silver foil paper, as is the underside of the board.
The money divider tray is made from gold foiled cardboard.
There is a red edged Banker's Tray.
Each playing piece is provided with its own plastic tray, the trays are set in a red flocked card display unit.
The player pieces are fine cast metal and are gilt.
Three of pieces have glass jewels set in them.
The pieces are: a Basket of Flowers, a Shoe, a Typewriter, a World Globe, a Telephone and a Horse Head.

Otherwise the set had standard cards, scrip, plastic houses and hotels and two sets of rules.

title: Weniger ist Mehr
description:
The title translates to English as Less is More. Players play energy cards to compete for 18 sun cards -- which are worth victory points -- one at a time.

The game took 11th place in the voting for Fairplay magazine's 1994  la carte best card game award.

title: Hello Kitty Best Friends Game
description:
Game components:

Game Board,
54 Hello Kitty Question Cards,
4 Playing Pieces w/ Plastic Stands,
Spinner,
Best Friends Certificates Notepad,
320 Stickers 
Box

The game is set in Kittys neighborhood and the friends get together for a slumber party at Hello Kittys house.

On the way to the party, players spin and land on Make A Wish, Your Favorite Quote and other spaces.

When a player lands on a Friendship space, they draw a card that asks a Friendship, Hello Kitty Says or Dear Diary question.

Example:
- Friendship = Ask the player to your right, What's your favorite outfit? Collect a sticker!
- All Play = I think the most special thing about me is... Collect a sticker from each player!
- Hello Kitty Says = The best way to be happy is to make a friend happy. Give yourself a sticker!
- Dear Diary = If I could make one dream come true, it would be... Give yourself a sticker!

With each question, the player learns something special about another player and collects a sticker for her Best Friends Certificate.

The first player to reach Hello Kittys house with two stickers from each player wins. There are 54 special Hello Kitty playing cards.

This game encourages communication and learning about each other. It is fun and it is also a language development game.

title: The Transformation Game
description: The Transformation Game is a joyful way of understanding and transforming the way you play your life. It's about looking at your life and the kinds of experiences you create, seeing how you react to them and how you can use these insights for your own growth. Throughout the Game you can become more aware of your personal strengths and learn important lessons that can deepen your understanding of how you operate on the Physical, Emotional, Mental and Spiritual levels. The Game can also be used as a powerful interactive tool, by both individuals and groups, for solving problems and achieving desired goals. By providing new perspectives on current life issues, the Game helps you to clarify old beliefs and attitudes and transform negative patterns. The Transformation Game triggers your creativity and lets your realize your full power and potential.

title: Deluxe Memory
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

Remembering those matches rewards you with some strategy for two to four players.

Object: To end the game with more tokens than everyone else. You do this by turning cards of the same rank face-up during your turn.

You Need:

* A poker deck (with the Jokers removed).
    * About 30 tokens for each player.

On your turn, select two cards and look at them. If the two cards are the same rank (like two Fives) and are both Black, show the cards to the other players and choose a player to return that many tokens to the Bank. If the two cards are the same rank and are both Red, show the cards to the other players and choose a player (including yourself) to gain that many tokens from the Bank. If the two cards are the same rank and are different colors, show the cards to the other players and refer to the Mixed Chart [which is included in the rules.] Once the effect has resolved, set the cards aside in the discard pile and end your turn.

If the two cards do not match, put them back in their original spots, face-up. You can choose to put one or both of them back face-down, but you must give one token to the Bank for each card that you don't reveal. Once you've made your decision and shown (or not shown) your cards, your turn ends.

If you run out of tokens, you're out of the game.

The game emds when only one player has tokens left, or when all possible matches have been made. If you have the most tokens at the end of the game, you win.

title: How To Host A Teen Mystery: Barbecue With The Vampire
description: You are invited to attend a barbecue at the very spooky castle of rock superstar Killian Killagan. But when you arrive, you discover that someone at the barbecue is turning helpless citizens into bats. As you assume the role of one of these eight eerie characters and solve the mystery, you and your guests will enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue. All you need is a sense of humor and a light-hearted approach toward blackmail, theft and deceit. How To Host A Teen Mystery is so much fun it's almost criminal!

title: IACTA
description:
From the web site:

IACTA is a completely new dice game for 2 players Ages 8 and up.

Many games are build on historic games or complicated rules.

     IACTA is not like these games.
     IACTA is simple and yet advanced.
     IACTA allows skilled players to play against lesser skilled players.




Try for yourself to throw the dice and experience a fascinating game, where a combination of luck and strategy will lead you to victory.

On a 10x10 colored board, players try to move their 6 dice from one corner to the opposite one according to the result of the thrown dice. One result for the movement length (only horizontal  vertical), the other for the pips that will be shown on the moved dice at the end of the movement.

title: Babel
description: A building game where the cubes have embedded marbles.  You need to keep all of the marbles hidden on the interior of the tower as you build.

title: Colorforms Dress Up Game
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
From the box:

The concept is simple: spin the spinner, pick a piece, and dress up your character.  Choose pretty pants, stunning shoes, or a handsome hat.  There are no wrong choices, and there are countless different ways that you and your child can dress up.  The first player to completely dress a character wins the game.

title: The Way Things Work
description:
How do machines move heavy loads? What is a fulcrum and what is it for? Why does a car move faster when the incline is steeper?

Based on the popular book of the same name, this game enables players to conduct experiments, figure out solutions and test their knowledge.

Players will need to use memory, strategy, learning, observing and math skills to solve the problems and complete the game.

title: Robin Hood and the Friends of Sherwood Forest
Ponies: The New Forest Pony Chase Game
description:
Ponies - The New Forest Pony Chase Game

From the Box:

Ponies, as it is popularly called in our family, was invented heres (Sway) in the New Forest in about 1985 to keep our children quiet on wet days.

Firstly we wanted an interesting game for younger children that was not contentious and would not end in arguments and tears.  Ponies was based upon a drive in the New Forest, taking the routes to our favorite walks.  Players had to collect the Ponies found on the road, and get ten back to their Corral, avoiding the usual hazards of Forest roads.

Then, finding that we adults also wanted to play, we made it more interesting with scope for an element of low adult cunning.  Enter the Verderer and Game Licenses; and Ponies was born in its current form.

The game is ruled by the throw of dice, but the Chase Cards introduce scope for planning and strategy and generate suspense and excitement.  The lucky early leader rarely wins, and the ultimate winner has to run the gauntlet of determined Verderers so that often it is the last throw of the dice which decides the victor between three or four neck and neck contenders.

My family and all our friends have been playing it ever since, both adults and children have remained addicted over the years.  Bowing eventually to everyone's enthusiasm we have at last decided to go public with Ponies: we are certain you are going to become as ardent Verderers as the rest of us!

title: Wightopoly
description:
WIGHTOPOLY is concerned with business trade in the Isle of Wight (UK). The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade and development of businesses - the businesses themselves representing actual firms on the Island.

It has the following features:

- Businesses to buy, trade and sell. 
- The ability (once you own all the key businesses in a colour group) to expand by building shops and superstores. 
- Carisbrooke Castle - a place where you get sent when you have failed to pay your bills - though you are able to visit if you happen to pass by.
-  The Learn 2 Drive Centre where you gain 200 by passing through. 
-  Pay  Take and Good News - Bad News cards.
-  Mortgages
-  Loans from Rosie Jo.
etc...

Sound familiar to anyone?

title: Billy Hamilton's Football Academy
description:
FOOTBALL ACADEMY is designed as a journey through the life of a professional footballer (soccer player).  The game is designed by a former professional player - Billy Hamilton.

The game is conducted in three phases:

The Apprenticeship - three (game) years of learning the skills and demands of being a footballer, as well as performing the thankless, but necessary, tasks essential to the everyday running of a football club.  This apprenticeship is the foundation upon which the professional career is built.

Professional Footballer - As a professional, the player strives to maintain a high standard, on and off the pitch.  He becomes more involved in duties outside the game and must lend himself to charitable and promotional work.  His good performances on the pitch may lead to international recognition.

Gain International Caps - It is the dream of every player to play for his country and win the World Cup.

The Apprenticeship stage is conducted by undertaking three circuits of the outer board based on a roll and move mechanism.  Activities are driven by the actions required of the squares on which the playing piece lands.  After completing three circuits any Skill and Effort tokens earned are traded in for a potential rating which determines which of four paths that player follows through the Professional Stage.

Progress through the Professional Stage is, once again, dependent on the roll of the dice with the effects of the square being detailed in look-up tables contained in the rule book.  The idea is to proceed to the International Stage as quickly as possible, collecting goal tokens on the way.

During the International Stage players roll two dice (one advantage, one penalty) to progress.  Dice rolls can be modified by the trading in of goals gained during the professional phase.

The winner of the game is the first player to enter the World Cup Winner zone at the center of the board.

title: Twiggy
description: A more complete title: TWIGGY -- A Game That Makes Every Girl, Like Twiggy, The Queen of Mod; this is basically a roll and move game based around the supermodel Twiggy and the London fashion scene of the late 1960's. Roll, move, and take the effects of the cards you land on...

title: Alpha Animals
description:
Are you the master of animal kingdom or the bottom of the food chain? With Alpha Animals, Green Board Games first ever game, you will see just how much you know about the animal kingdom. Players race around a spiral board naming animals from specific groups (birds, fish, mammals, reptiles  amphibians, insects, spiders  crustaceans). However, along the way challenging multi choice question may have to answered or an animal action performed. Can you name an insect beginning with A? A reptile starting with Z? Which has more neck bones, a giraffe or a mouse? Join our Alpha Animals Adventure and find out! Learn and improve your animal knowledge with 2 different question levels as well as reading the animal facts in the rule book. Perfect for children and the whole family. This game is made from recycled materials. All questions and rules are in English, French and Spanish.

Players    2 - 6 players or teams,
Ages    8 - 108,
Contains    1 game board, 1 wooden die, 6 hand-carved wooden animal playing pieces, 2 packs of question cards, 1 rule booklet with animal facts,

title: 7-Spot Yott
description:
According to Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games:

Five dice with card and joker faces are supplied. Player can throw up to three times and then must choose to score in one of twenty-two categories. Mostly poker hands.

title: Auction Tripoley
description:
According to Sid Sacksons A Gamut of Games:

Collect chips from pots by playing the matching card or cards. The suit of these money cards is chosen by the winner of a auction, held after players see their hands. A key card, set by dice throw, can win the auction payment.

title: Poker Royal
description:
According to Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games:

Each player has an area on the board that ends with eight face-up cards. In turn a player can place a card from his hand into his own area or an opponent's. Poker hands win bonuses and pots in various ways.

title: Duplic
description:
According to Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games:

Each of two players has four pieces placed on a three by three field. In turn they move a piece to the vacant space, attempting to match the pattern on one of six cards they hold.

title: Just Another Bug Hunt
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemDice RollingModular Board
description:
Taken from the introduction:

Is this going to be a stand-up fight, sir, or another bug hunt - Hudson

These rules are inspired by the films Aliens (tm). They can be played solo as the Aliens are all generated by dice rolls. Two possible games can be played:

(1) The players are Colonial Marines who are exploring a base where a group of colonists have settled. Earth has lost all contact with the colonists. The marines are sent to check the base out.

(2) The Colonial Marines are planet side defending a group of settlements where contact has been made with the bugs.

Further scenarios may be created too if preferred, use the films for ideas. Any scale of figure will do from 10mm to 25mm, a collection of D6 are required. Measurements used are by squares if using floor plans otherwise substitute inches for squares.



System makes use of standard action point allowance.  Players control colonial marines in a randomly generated hulk.  Aliens are either game master controlled or on auto-pilot (they are after all perfect killing machines).  Lots of room for back story and role-playing aspects, in fact the game probably plays better in this fashion.

title: Empires of Arcana
description:
Empires of Arcana is a fantasy empire-building board game, designed over the past 2 years. In it, you will play a warlord trying to dominate Arcana, using a variety of troops to conquer your enemies. As you build up your empire, you will be able to collect more gold and mana, allowing you to build still stronger structures, support larger armies, and cast more powerful magic.

It was designed to be simple to learn and fast-playing, but there are many roads to victory and strategies can be complex. Some players strive for magical supremacy, allowing them to cast enormous amounts of spells per turn, including collapsing enemy structures or destroying entire armies in rains of fire. Some build networks of gates, providing enormous flexibility in maneuvering troops and giving a boost to income. Some try to rapidly build castles up in their territories, giving great bonuses to defense and income, while allowing many dragons to be recruited per turn. Still others simply strive for rapid conquest, using basic infantry and cavalry to their best effect and depending on large land holdings to pay for their armies.

Empires of Arcana was also built for flexibility. Two different ways to play come with the game, including an aggressive goblin scenario that puts player cooperation to the test and is perfectly suited for solitaire play.

title: Mystic Adventures
description:
Mystic Adventures is a simple to play but complex game of exploration, war and adventure, a game where endless hours can be devoted to mastering the many possible strategies needed to win. Using a system of tiles to create the map board, each game becomes a unique experience, one that is different from all others played before.
