mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionTile Placement
description:
WATCH YOUR GARDEN GROW is a simple and enthralling game for children Ages 5 - 10.  Each player has a garden which, starting from seeds has to be brought into bloom.  The garden goes through a natural growth cycle and through the seasons.  But you have you watch out for pests and bad weather!

Players take it in turns to roll the die and move their gardener playing piece clockwise around the board.  The square that is landed on provides instructions on which plants can be put in the garden, which are in bloom, which have been killed off by frost etc...

Seeds, bulbs and flowering plants are taken from a tray known as Mother Nature's Garden Shop and placed in the appropriate place on the player's garden card. In so doing the garden becomes populated with seed, bulbs and plants which mature and flower as the game progresses.

The first player to get their whole garden into bloom is the winner.

title: Four-Up
description:
FOUR-UP is an abstract boardgame with two players taking it in turns to place a marble on the board with the aim of making a row of four marble next to each other horizontally, vertically or diagonally.  The first to do so is the winner.

The box carries standard rules, but also rules for Advanced play and Solitaire play.

title: Claustrophobia
description:
From the back of the box:

The Fast Moving Game of Encircling Strategy

General Rules: After the board is set up, each player attempts to surround his opponent by moving his blocking pieces.  Each player has three opportunities (option chips) to either escape from the circle before being encircled... or take a double turn and perhaps quickly end the game.

title: Dark Millennium
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Science Fiction
description:
This is a supplement to the Warhammer 40K 2nd Edition rules. From the box rear: This box contains over twenty full colour vehicle datafax including everything from bikes to battle tanks and dreadnoughts. A new deck of vehicle custom cards is also provided to let you individualize and convert your mechanized forces.

Due to the nature of Games Workshop revising their game rules, few of these components are usable in the current edition.

Box contents include (according to Dark Millenium rule book):

    - 48-page Dark Millenium Rulebook
    - 24 Vehicle Data Cards
    - 60 Psychic Power Cards
        - 8 each for Orks, Eldar, Librarian, Inquisitor, and Adeptus
        - 4 each for Slaanesh, Tzeentch, Nurgle, Squat, and Tyranid
    
    - 36 Warp Cards
    - 18 Strategy Cards
    - 10 Vehicle Cards
        - 4 Imperial
        - 2 Ork
        - 4 General
    
    - 9 Counters
        - 6 Rad markers for Rad Grenades
        - 1 Traps marker
        - 1 Virus marker
        - 1 Slaanesh effect marker
    
    - 7 Templates
        - Da Krunch template
        - Eldritch Storm/Force Dome
        - Death Wave
        - Destructor/Stream of Corruption
        - The Gate
        - Hellfire/Machine Curse
        - Smite/Firestorm of Tzeentch
    
    - 55 Wargear Cards
    - 18 Strategy Cards
    - 4 Mission Cards

title: Rude Gestures
description:
From the box:

RUDE GESTURES is the rib-tickling adult game of naughty charades.  Played in teams, the first to complete a circuit of the board is the winner.  You have only one minute to perform your naughty charade to your team.  There are three naughty tongue in cheek categories to mime - Film Titles, Song titles and Places.

Could you act out In Bed with Madonna, Great Balls of Fire or Seven Mile Bottom!  RUDE GSTURES will provide hours of riotous red face fun.  Ordinary charades will never be the same after you have played RUDE GESTURES !!!

title: Afro-American History Mystery I
description:
This black-oriented game uses black history as a theme. Correct answers to quiz-card questions regarding contributions of blacks to American history and culture earn players the chance to fit pieces into one of four picture puzzles of famous Afro-American men. Game II will include the historical contributions of black women, overlooked in Game I.

Mentioned in article Games with Soul published in Newsweek magazine 10/9/72.

title: Colony, American History Games Series
description:
Players examine trade relations between American colonies and Britain before the Revolutionary War. The basic conflict between England and the colonies revolves around economic rule of the colonists. Players, in the roles of British government officials, bankers, and colonial merchants, engage in legal trade and smuggling. Merchants seek to maximize profits and the British government tries to balance revenues with expenditures.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, game board, chips, chance cards, spirit masters.

title: Arithmetic Tic-Tac-Toe
description:
The object of play is to win at Tic-Tac-Toe and to earn points by declaring true statements as required at intersections occupied by discs. Sets build skills in addition and subtraction, multiplication and division.

Materials: Game board, playing pieces, transparent overlay piece, instructions.

title: Bankplan
description:
Teams [1-4 players each] representing the management of six competing banks allocate their resources in four sectors: savings, accounts, trust management, general current account services, and loans, in accordance with the opportunities and problems in the specific area described in each scenario. The policy objectives of each bank are defined in such a way as to obtain the greatest share of new business.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' scenarios, circular game board, chance cards, chips.

title: Bushman Exploring and Gathering
description:
A two-phase board game designed to teach the concept of cultural adaptation to a harsh environment. It illustrates the subsistence economy of bushmen hunters in the Kalahari Desert of Southwest Africa. Players assume the roles of explorer groups and then the roles of heads of small bushmen families.

Included in the developmental versions of Man: A Course of Study curriculum and game series.

title: Chemandments
description:
Chemical fundamentals are presented as game action introduces names of the elements, their chemical symbols, correct formulas, combinability, atomic numbers and weights. No previous chemistry background is needed to participate.

Materials: Game board, player's manual, play money, atom replicas and accessory pieces.

title: The College Game
description:
Players simulate the experience of one freshman for three weeks of college. Each of the three players [or teams] is given the assignment of attempting to allocate time for one aspect (academic, social or personal) of the simulate student's personality or motivations. They make their decisions independently and then share them on a common game board. The conflicts are worked out through a bargaining process.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, game board, dice, playing sheets and student profile.

title: Come Out Even
description:
To play this game of mathematical rummy, pupils add simple fractions and find common denominators. Shadings and markings on cards help in recognizing equivalent fractions.

Materials: two decks of cards.

An educational mathematics game for elementary students.

title: Community Disaster
description:
Each player assumes a role in a community hit by a disaster, such as a large fire, explosion, hurricane, tornado, flood, or earthquake . . . During the disaster, each participant has two concerns: to make sure his family members are safe, and to help the community.

For high school through adult. Revised 1970.

Materials: Administrator's manual, players' manuals, game board and accessories.

title: Three Pips
types: Abstract Strategy Dice Number Print & Play
mechanisms: Pattern BuildingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Players: 2

Equipment:  8x8 chess board, two sets of 6 dice for each player (of different colors), and one more pair of dice (any color).

Setup:  Arrange the 6 dice on the first row of the board.  They should be placed in ascending order of 1-2-3-4-5-6 from left to right from their owners point of view.  The one should be on the second square from the left and the six should have one empty space to its right.  Hereafter, these dice are called dicemen.

Object:  To use exactly two of your own dice and one of the opposing players dice to form a string of three consecutive numbers.  This string of dice does have to be adjacent to one another either horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

title: Comput-a-tutor
description:
The flow chart is one of the principle components of computer technology, a graphic representation of a sequence of operations in a computer program. To familiarize laymen with computer programming, the game's central focus is the construction of a flow chart by arranging the playing pieces in a sequence that gives the highest score. A basic version and an advanced two-stage version may be played.

For ages from junior high school to adult.

title: Tortellini Football
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
A football game for two players played on a checkerboard.

Each player has three pieces to represent his team. There is a ball. A goal is scored when a team successfully lands a piece carrying the ball in its opponent's end zone. The game ends when one team has successfully scored five goals.

Each turn, pieces of the team with the ball -- the offensive team -- can either move or pass the ball. The defensive team's pieces can only move in an attempt to take possession of the ball. If the defensive team takes the ball, it becomes the offensive team.

Moves and passes are declared in secret and then simultaneously revealed. Pieces move simultaneously.

Official Rules: http://boardgames.about.com/library/games/on/bl-simul-tortellinifootball.htm

title: Frames
description:
Frames is played by two players on a Go board with its pieces, and a few neutral pieces. It can also be played with pencil and paper, because once placed, the pieces can not be moved.  The moves are simultaneous. In each turn, both players place one of their pieces in an intersection of the board.  If the intersection chosen by both players is the same, a neutral piece is placed instead. Otherwise, both pieces just placed define a rectangle of intersections on the board.  The player who has more pieces inside that rectangle (the pieces in the borders of the rectangle are not counted) earns a point.  The first player to earn a total of ten points is the winner.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Moriarty
description: To win the game, you must score the most points over your opponent. This is done by cleverly moving pieces on a gameboard in order to gain the best advantage. Also, if you can deduce what color your opponent has selected, you will score ALL points on the board.

title: PerSiVic
description: PerSiVic is a abstract strategy game that is played between 2 players in a square board. Each cell of the square can be empty or have a number of stones. Can be played with different configurations but the standard board is size 9x9. Each player have 3 stones of their own in each cell of their first row. In each turn, the stones of each player move a distance (graph-distance) equal to the number of stones in that cell.

title: Praetorian
types: Bluffing Deduction Print & Play Spies/Secret Agents
description:
This is a cat-and-mouse type of game where one player takes the role of police trying to track down an assassin (the opposing player) before he strikes.  Both players have access to the bulk of the game pieces.  Only the Assassin player, however, knows which pieces are the assassin and his marks.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Consonant Lotto
description:
Players match pictures while gaining skills in recognizing initial consonants of words.

An educational game for 1st grade elementary students.

title: Henry
description: Henry is a memory game that uses sounds instead of the usual pictures.

title: Consumer
description:
Consumer simulates the economics of installment buying and will interest groups studying problems of consumer education, home economics, mathematics, citizenship and democracy. The structure of the game encourages the consumers to weight the added cost of financing a purchase against the additional value of having the item immediately; to determine whether their purchases are yielding the greatest utility for their money; and to guard against unanticipated events not generally covered by insurance.

For players from junior high school through adult.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, profile folders, display boards, dice, chance and purchase cards, play money, various business forms and score sheets.

title: Destination
description: [Two] teams randomly select a foreign country and plan a trip from there to a United Nations General Assembly meeting in New York, to arrive at a prescribed date without spending more than the allotted sum of money. Players learn basic geographical concepts and develop skills in solving travel problems as they use maps, time tables, rate schedules, foreign currencies and conversion tables to solve four phases of increasingly complex travel situations. For junior high school students.

title: Dignity
description:
Dignity is a human relations board game which seeks to portray the frustrations of people in the ghettos. The object of the game is to reach a square called Dignity. To get there, a player, who is given five cards and $100, tries to avoid Shanty Town, Housing Projects, Skid Row and other unpleasant places. A shortcut through Uncle Tom's Limbo precludes playing Freedom Move cards, generally helpful in the game. There is another shortcut through the University, but that costs $2000, which is difficult to acquire. Players will encounter setbacks as well as unexpected opportunities to reach Dignity.

Materials: Game board, cards, play money, accessories.

title: Bulls Hit
description:
From the box:

BULLS HIT is a fun game involving watching each others' flies as they zip in and out of their favorite cowpat.  The first fly that's 'dungroamin' is the winner.

Each fly must start in the very bowels of the country pancake and then wind their way out again.

Dung - the final frontier.  Set your flies in motion as you travel from the very heart of the 'dung-eon' of no return.  No holes are barred in the windy city of flies.

You'll play this game until the cows come home!

The aim of the game is to work your way out of the middle of the cowpat by telling stories or making statements convincingly enough to make your opponents guess wrongly as to them being Bulls-Hit, No Bulls-Hit or Total Bulls-Hit.  The winner is the first player to get out of the cowpat.

title: Empire
description:
Empire was designed to demonstrate the place of the American colonists in the British Empire, and how their membership in it affected the way they made their living. Teams representing London merchants, New England merchants, colonial farmers, European merchants, southern planters, and British West Indian planters compete for profits from trade in the 18th-century Empire. In dealing with mercantilism and trade regulations players experience London monopoly, arbitrary trade laws, risks of smuggling and piracy, protection and enforcement threats of the Royal Navy.

Age or grade: 8th grade, junior high school, high school.

Materials: Instructor's manual, team manuals, map board, playing pieces, cards.

Part of the From Subject to Citizen curriculum game series, Unit 3, The Emergence of the American.

The teams are the six groups listed above plus a team representing the Royal Navy.  Each team has goods available to sell or trade and a set of goods they wish to acquire.  They negotiate sales and barters and then have to ship the goods to the receivers. Only a few teams have ships, the other teams must arrange to rent or buy them from the owners.

Many possible trades are illegal according to British law of the time. The Royal Navy team can board ships for inspection and seize illegal goods.

The object is to acquire the greatest percentage of your team's desired goods.

title: The Fate Of Our Food
description:
On the game board players follow three swallows of food (boluses) through the simulated digestive system and become familiar with the muscles, organs, and fluids involved in the process.

Age or grade: elementary - junior high school.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, cards, game board.

title: Futurity
description:
Students face problems of the growing world population, and the need for adequate food supply, water, and shelter. Each round of play represents 20 years elapsed time with the resultant population growth, need for resources and necessity for problem solving. Intended for high school use.

Materials (for each team): Game board and three plastic maps, representing resources of a nation underground, above-ground and in space; data sheets of each round; technology sheets; markers.

title: The Games People Play Game
description:
Players gain insight into social actions and their consequences. The game was evolved from the book Games People Play, based on interaction seminars at San Francisco State University under the supervision and guidance of Dr. Eric Berne.

Age or grade: Junior high school - adult

Materials: Instructor's manual, game board, cards, dice.

title: Generation Gap
description:
Generation Gap simulates the interaction between a parent and an adolescent son or daughter with respect to certain issues on which they may have opposing attitudes. Conflict is presented within a context of rules which reflect the structure of power and interdependence in the family. The purpose is to generate some understanding of this structure and to shape effective strategies for handling the conflict. Parents compete against parents and teenagers against teenagers for scores. Formerly called Parent-Child.

Materials: Instructor's manual, playing boards, issue cards and covers, satisfaction cards, alphabetical letters, score sheets.

title: Invincible Armada
description:
Players plan the strategy for both sides of the simulated confrontation between the English and Spanish fleets in 1588, based on information on the geography of the theater of battle, and the leadership and weaponry of the adversaries.

Age or grade: 8th grade, junior high school, high school.

Materials: Instructor's manual, players' manuals, game board, map sheets.

Part of the From Subject to Citizen curriculum game series, Unit 1, Queen Elizabeth: Conflict and Compromise.

title: Marble Quest
types: Abstract Strategy Children's Game Educational Trivia
description:
Description      
Its a trivia game. Its a strategy game. Its Marble Quest! Test your knowledge and your skills in this unique game that combines 3 dimensional Tic-Tac-Toe with multiple-choice trivia questions in four categories; social studies, the human body, earth science, and pop culture. Three levels of game play mean the whole family can get involved. Play only with the rotating, 3-tiered Tic-Tac-Toe tower for an unusual twist on an old favorite or add in the trivia cards and the board game for an added challenge where players earn marbles to play on the 3-D tower by answering trivia questions. Game comes with game board, 200 trivia questions, 32 glass marbles, plastic game tower, dice, and instructions. For 2  4 players or teams.

Winner Top Toy of the Year Award 2004, Creative Child Magazine.

title: Getset
description:
Games for beginning readers (preschool). A series of reading readiness games through the pre-primer reading level acquaints children with basic language skills.

The games in the set are Silly Sentences, Stop Dot, Animal Race, Dominoes, Pickafit, Broken Letters, Picture Words and Sentence Train.

title: Ghetto
description:
Ghetto is a game of mobility which simulates the pressures under which the urban poor live and the choices they face as they seek to improve their life situation. Players learn that the condition of their neighborhood affects all of them, whether or not they are concerned about it. They can improve neighborhood conditions by investing effort in community action.

Age or grade: Junior high - adult.

Materials: Instructor's manual, player profiles, game sheet, dice, spinner, chance cards, victim cards, information sheets, block markers, player chips.

title: Group Sounding Game
description:
Players work to win and gain word recognition skill by covering the words on their playing cards, as the words are read aloud.

Age or grade: 2nd grade, elementary

Materials: Instructor's manual, bingo cards, playing pieces, word list.

title: GUNS or Butter
description:
Guns or Butter models an international system of five to seven nations with various resources and power. Players in the roles of decision-makers seek to advance the security and economic and political welfare of their countries by means of trade agreements, common markets, military alliances, and even war.

Age or grade: Junior high school, high school

Materials: Instructor and player manual, game board,    
Director's Manual
2 Control and Messenger's Manuals
2 Trade Agreement Earnings forms
pad of Trade Agreement and Defense Alliance or Common Market Agreement forms
5 Nation Folders with instructions (shields)
25 pin-back buttons (5 for each of 5 nations)
5 nation pies
5 Nation Top Secret pies
Approx. 100 plastic chips

title: Happy Bears
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Word Game
description: Players match pictures on cards by learning distinguishing words. For kindergarten and 1st grade students.

title: The High School Game
description:
The High School Game is a social simulation which reflects some of the structural and processual phenomena that characterize the social system of the high school . . . Players assume specific student profiles in a hypothetical high school . . . Achievement brings esteem points from parents, peers and self, in accordance with the value placed on the activity by each group.

Age or grade: Junior high school, high school, college.

Materials: Game board, student profiles, achievement chips.

title: Innocent Until...
description:
This role-play exercise simulates the courtroom drama of trial by jury. The case is one of a manslaughter charge against an allegedly drunken driver on the way home with his wife from a 'night on the town' -- the victim a star high school athlete. The defendant, his wife, the lawyers, policemen, and various other witnesses appear before the court as the jury deliberates the case.

Act or grade: Junior high school or high school.

The game was designed by uncredited employees of Abt Associates.

title: Commercial Breaks
description:
COMMERCIAL BREAKS - The game Full of TV Ad Teasers.

From the box:

Test your knowledge of (UK) TV ads with 1000 crazy crazy questions featuring commercials both old and new - love 'em or hate 'em but can you remember them?  You'll have great fun finding out.

Collect 'category cards' by racing around the board, answering the teasing, quirky questions from five categories including - classics, jingles, trivia, slogans and stars.

You might have to name the actor who always managed to soak Joan Collins, or describe what happens when for a refreshing change the dog sniffs around a lamp post in a cider commercial.  Would you know which singer gets the fish jumping for Russ Abbott?

Have the ads worked on you?  Time to find out when you play COMMERCIAL BREAKS.

title: Tri-words
description:
Players try to score the most points by making words from randomly drawn Tri-tiles (the 5-sided triangular pieces) consisting of letters and wild cards (designated by stars)

The rules describe play for 2 to 6 players. However the cover states the game is for 1 to 6 players, and it's not difficult to see how a player could play solitaire against the timer.

title: The Rules According to Ral
description:
These are simple rules for Medieval combat using miniatures.  Ral Partha was a miniatures manufacturer (now owned by Iron Wind), and they gave these rules away for free in an attempt to sell more miniatures.  The rules are 4 pages long with an additional 1 page player aid sheet.

Fairly standard medieval miniatures rules for large armies.  12 infantry to a stand to represent a large unit, or 6 cavalry.  Leaders are individually based.  The rules cover morale, bow combat, melee, movement, individual combat between leaders, and point cost for building armies.

Iron Wind has an adaptation of these rules for free on its web site, minus the player aid sheet.  They even kept the same artwork, but added fantasy armies, which are lacking in the Ral Partha original.

title: Digital Empires
types: Ancient Fantasy Medieval Miniatures Modern Warfare Science Fiction
description:
An ambitious project, Digital Empires attempted to cover rules for all miniatures periods and scales: skirmish to large armies, caveman wars to science fiction battles of the future.  It was only available as a pay-per-PDF file from the publisher, and was over 50 pages long.  It covered everything in miniatures combat: movement, morale, ranged weapons, melee, terrain, etc.

Later expanded into:
All-purpose Miniatures Rules

    All-purpose Miniatures Rules

title: Maid of Orleans
description:
Maid of Orleans is a miniatures combat game set in the era of Joan of Arc (the Hundred Years War, early 15th century).  Specifically, it is set in the siege and relief of Orleans, the battle that made Joan famous.  Over half the book (35 of 50 pages) is devoted to creating the fortress, pier, gatehouse, river, bridge, other terrain, cannons, boats and painting the models!

The rules themselves cover movement, missile fire, cannons, melee, morale, wounds, and special rules for Joan, ladders, rocks and unit organization.

title: Monster Combat
description:
The first edition of this game was published in 1975 and was originally titled Rules for Prehistoric Animal Combat.   In 1979 the game was re-published to include the Fatasy Creature Combat Set.   The original game contained 12 Dinosaurs.

Ankylosaurus
Cetiosaurus
Corythosaurus
Dimetrodon
Iguanodon
Megalosaurus / Gorgosaurus
Monoclonius
Stegosaurus
Styracosaurus
Triceratops
Tyrannosaurus
Allosaurus

Three Dinosaurs were dropped from the 2nd edition, Cetiosaurus, Corythosaurus and Dimetrodon.   The individual dinosaur stats were also modified from the original stats.

Subtitled Wargame Rules for Dinosaur and Fantasy Creature Combat, this is a set of miniatures rules that covers just that.  The main thrust of the game is in the Jurassic and the Cretaceous, but rules have been added to allow dragons and other non-sentient fantasy monsters.  You can use any toy dinosaur or dragon figures you can find in toy and department stores - rules are given to adjust scale for size of the figures.

The rules cover creating the terrain and its effect on movement and combat.  Rules are given for the various types of dinosaur attacks (as well as fire-breathing) and defenses.  Various dinosaurs are covered in particular: Allosaurus and Tyrannosaurus, Stegasaurus, Triceratops, Ankylosaurus, etc., and which period they were found in.  Actions are broken down into 12 phases: faster creatures get an action each phase, while a slower one might only act every third phase.  Rules are given for degrees of arc from the spinal plane a creature can bite or tail strike, and illustrations show where creatures are armored more heavily.  Lots of detail in this small booklet.

title: Busy Bee
description:
The cards are divided in four diagonally, with half an animal on each section.  They are then played to match up the halves, points given as parts are matched up. If you make the Busy Bee character, however, you lose points.

Also has a flip-book pictures on the back of the cards to show a bee pollinating a flower.

This game is made for younger kids.

title: A House Divided: The Brothers War
description:
From the game box:

You and up to two other team members will take command of one of the three theaters of operation for the Union or for the Confederacy. Although you have your own armies to command, and generals to oversee, you will need to work closely with your other theater commanders. Together you must decide which generals should command which armies to best take advantage of their unique talents. You must also decide who will control armies as they travel from one theater to another. Will you retain control of an army outside of your theater or relinquish control to your teammate? Each side has it's advantages and disadvantages, so carefully consider your decisions.  The fate of the Union and Confederacy hang in the balance!


The basic mechanism for resolving combat is similar to the one found in Axis  Allies.  However, the overall rules are designed to represent the American Civil War, and have quite a few differences from both AA and Risk.

The following is provided in the game box:

4 panel map/board of the USA  CSA during the ACW
45 general cards
52 event cards
general and territory control markers
rules

The dice and game pieces are not provided.  One must provide their own game pieces similar to those found in Risk (infantry, cavalry and artillery), for up to six players.

title: Besetzt
description:
Essentially a Skittles/Devil amongst the Tinkers variant with event cards and cardboard houses rather than a wooden board to manuever through.  Printed in an edition of 500 copies; I could not find an author credited, but there are many, many pages of text, only a few of which seem to make up the rules.  The idea behind the game is credited to a Mrs. F. Haag.  The rules also include a detailed accounting of the finances of the company:

- 27% printing  material expenses   
- 31% salaried work of the principals (10 Swiss Francs/hour)   
- 2% author royalties  
- 2% postcards  
- 6% chaos 
- 32% store margins

title: Tribes
description:
This game by Jim DuBois uses only things that gamers usually have lying around in plenty: lots of six-sided dice and chips/tokens in 4 colors.  The story as told in the Overview: You are simulating a small tribe seeking to establish itself. Your goal is to survive and make 3 art (culture) before anyone else does.  Each die represents an individual in a tribe, and the four types of markers represent food, houses, art, and penalties.

Each round all players roll all their dice to determine the productivity of the individual tribe members.  Players then allocate the roll values, aka productivity, towards food, housing, more tribe members, or art.  Bad luck as determined by a separate d6 and penalties also play roles in determining which tribe will become the most culturally successful, but the main factor is a good deal of strategy on the players' parts.

title: Die Herren aller Länder
description:
Who is President Bush? Too easy? Then try to guess who Jan-Peter Balkenende or Gloria Arroyo is.  Whoever can guess the politicians the best is the winner.

It's an easy game, and as with Anno Domini, guessing is more important than knowing.

title: TechnoTycoon
description:
Monopoly with computer properties. However, there are a good number of differences. Board has a path across the center that you move on if you roll either even or odd. Also upgrades to your software come in the form of computer magazine awards which you receive from drawing cards (ie chance and community chest cards)

Also it isn't just pass go collect $200 the more programs you own the more you collect, also you collect payments from the bank when competitors land on your space.

One other interesting feature is that you can stage a hostile takeover and claim a piece of software from someone if you draw the right card.

Game ends when someone gets to 1 billion dollars cash.

The company's one, and as far as I can tell only, press release:
SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Sept. 25, 1995--Yes! Your Expression Solution !nc. proudly announces the release of TechnoTycoon(TM), the fun and exciting board game where the object is to become a BILLionaire(TM).

In the last decade the software industry has created more millionaires and billionaires than any other industry. Microsoft alone has created the world's richest individual as well as a few other billionaires and several thousand millionaires. Now, with TechnoTycoon it's your turn....

You begin with $50 million. As you play, you acquire various software products by paying their development cost, hoping the return in sales amasses you a fortune of over a billion dollars. TechnoTycoon's software products are parodies of best-selling software and include familiar names like WinDoze, Fun-2-3, WordPurrrrfect, Cyberpunk-In-A-Box, HardWork Graphics and 30 others....

As the players move around the board, they receive sales when other players land on their software. If your software wins awards from computer magazines such as PC Geek, MacAbuser, WinDoze Magazine...sales skyrocket. And if you're fortunate enough to own a software suite, sales are more lucrative for each suite member.

You can cruise the Information Super Highway to faster upgrades and a better chance at becoming a BILLionaire. But watch out for hostile takeovers, the Justice Department, and greedy lawyers. Advertising, taxes and new versions are costs which should be avoided. TechnoTycoon is a game that will be enjoyed by nerds and non-nerds alike.

The price of TechnoTycoon is $29.95 (Washington residents add sales tax of $2.46). TechnoTycoon is only available directly from YES! Your Expression Solution. To order, call 800/U-BUY-FUN (800/828-9386) or send check or money order to YES!, P.O. Box 5753, Kent, WA 98064-5753.

CONTACT: YES! Your Expression Solution !nc.

Brad Stowell or Ted Crane, 206/439-7581

title: Significa & Trivia
description: Popular American author Samuel L. Clemens (Mark Twain) patented this board game in 1893. It sold few copies because it was too complicated.

title: Panzer Leader: For King and Country
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
This add-on to Panzer Leader variant includes unit corrections for the Armies of the United Kingdom Forces. Also includes new scenarios that put the U.K. effort in 1944 to liberate Europe and defeat Germany in proper perspective. 
Ever wonder why the FireFly Tank with its 17lbr is valued incorrectly in the original game? This NEW and exciting variant brings to life the struggle of U.K. forces over Germany - from Dieppe to the Ruhr Pocket!

Variant INCLUDES: 
Rule booklet for UK Variant 
New Scenario's such as:

Villars Bocage
Operation Totalize
Ibbenburen
Hells Highway
Menzelen
Bieville
Douvres
Bretteville
Saint Lambert
Dieppe

Over 140 Factory DIE CUT Counters

Expands:

    Panzer Leader

title: Giftschrank
description:
Translated from the publisher's site:
Der Giftschrank (poison cabinet) is a strategic game that is full of suspense right from the start - running into the third dimension it requires planning skills and the ability to keep a level head and to make the right decision even in complex situations.

title: Invader
description: Invader is a boardgame adaptation of 'Space Invaders'.

title: War Gaming
description: Introduces the hobby of war games, describing the different kinds and suggesting how to build, paint, and organize miniatures and battlefields and how to make rules for original games.

title: Tank Battles in Miniature 5: A wargamers' guide to the Arab-Israeli Wars since 1948
description:
The Middle East has seen almost continuous warfare from the Israeli declaration of independence in 1948 to the present day. There have been four major campaigns, of which those of 1967 and 1973 - the so-called 'Six Days' and 'Yom Kippur' Wars - are of particular interest to wargamers as they involved the largest tank battles since World War 2. Israeli Centurions, Pattons and M-60s vie for battlefield supremacy with Arab T-54s and T-62s, and the arena has become a testing ground for new weapon systems and tactical doctrines while retaining an overall similarity to the armoured conflict of World War 2 which forms the subject matter of earlier books in this series.

This book begins with an introduction to the subject, a short chapter on the origins of the Arab-Israeli conflict, and a detailed description, with maps, of the 1967 and 1973 campaigns. There are two detailed chapters on Arab and Israeli armoured fighting vehicles and their characteristics, anti-tank missiles, conventional artillery, infantry weapons, tactical missiles, minefields and helicopters. There are also chapters on Arab and Israeli armoured organisation and tactics, and two specially commissioned sections on the war in the air by Mike Spick, author of Air Battles in Miniature. Finally, there are detailed playing rules, an appendix listing model suppliers, a technical glossary and an index, making this the ideal book for the increasing numbers of wargamers interested in this fascinating arena.

title: Napoleon's Campaigns in Miniature: A wargamer's guide to the Napoleonic Wars 1796-1815
description: The empire strikes back with a vengeance in the latest edition of this widely acclaimed book which enables any reader to reverse the tables at Waterloo or avert the French disasters in Spain and Russia! Packed with information on every aspect of Napoleonic warfare, it shows the wargamer how to make his miniature battles look even more realistic and satisfying through a proper understanding of strategy, lines of communication, logistics and other essentials, down to the price of a musket ball or a pair of infantryman's boots. Stimulating and full of ideas, it is no wonder that this book is the one against which all others on the subject are judged.

title: Battle: Practical Wargaming
types: Book Miniatures Wargame World War I World War II
description: Charles Grant enjoys a great reputation as one of the earliest exponents of the fast-growing hobby of wargaming and has indeed played a large part in contributing to that expansion and popularity. This book comprises a series of monthly articles that appeared in our Meccano Magazine now offered for the first time in book form. It contains a number of suggested rules for wargaming, with tables of score values, designs for score valuation devices plus a sound appreciation of the special values of the various arms of a modern army. Unlike some other publications it is confined almost entirely to wargaming for the periods of World Wars I and II. Useful chapters are also included on valuation of morale in warfare. Whilst suited to the novice, this is really a book to be appreciated by the gamer with a little experience now ready for serious play.

title: Shipping
description:
An Ahoy series game, published in England. The general idea of the game is to pick up and deliver as much cargo as possible.

With the capital gained you buy more harbour facilities, thereby collecting greater harbour dues.

The player having most capital, which includes face value of the port cards held, value of cargo and cash in hand at the end of the game is declared the winner.

If at any time during the game a player loses his ship, he may re-purchase it for 10,000.

This may entail selling some of his ports, which can be done by auctioning them among the players.

If he is unable to raise the necessary capital, he retires from the game.

Contents



1 x Game Board.

6 x Playing Pieces.

6 x Plans.

Money in Four Denominations.

1 x Pack of Met Report Cards.

1 x Pack of Owners Signal Cards.

1 x Pack of Lloyds Cards.

1 x Pack of Port Cards (or chips)

Bullion Cards (or chips)

Cargo Cards (or chips)

2 x Dice

1 x Set of Rules.

title: Star Encounters
description:
STAR ENCOUNTERS - The zodiac game - provocative, fun and revealing.

STAR ENCOUNTERS is not only fun to play - it's a game to be treasured.  Illustrated with images from original 14th century Italian manuscripts - Roman gods, ruling planets and mythical creatures exquisitely illuminate the splendor of the star signs.

Your objective is to travel the zodiac and complete your crystal star.  Crystals are won by answering questions on how different players react in various humorous and real life encounters.  Use your own experience and the clues provided to select the right answers, but beware - choose a player cards can surprise you, topple your lead or even lose you the game!

As play unfolds and interaction develops, personalities are revealed, passions aroused and secrets discovered - all adding to the fun and excitement of STAR ENCOUNTERS, even for those with no knowledge of star signs!

title: Care Bears: How Many Bears?
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: How Many Bears is a children's card game about counting and color matching.  Players turn over cards from their hand and try to match cards in the middle of the table by either color or number of bears on each card.  The player who collects the most matches wins.  Ages 4 - 8

title: Hocus Pocus
description:
Hocus Pocus is a card game based on some of the mechanics of Uno, combined with the nasty 'Take That!' of games like Hearts. It revolves around a battle between a number of mages (4 is best) trying to damage each other with a ball of power.

Currently the game is in prototype (which it may never leave), so I am adding it here to release it to the masses, and to get general feedback so I can improve it.

title: Zetre
description:
A mathematical game where the object is to get rid of all of your cards.

Players are dealt a hand of cards numbered 1-10 or containing a letter from the game's title (these are given numeric values before the game starts, typically 11-15).

Players then take turns rolling three dice.  Each player then discards cards whose values correspond to a combination of the dice.  A combination is valid if it uses all three dice and standard mathematical operations applied in any order.

title: Quantum Traders
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemDice RollingModular BoardPick-up and DeliverSimultaneous Action SelectionVariable Player Powers
description:
The collapse of the Galactic Empire sparked a Dark Age stretching centuries. Many of the colonies on the edge of galactic space were doomed, but a few survived. The Strong. The Resourceful. The Ruthless.

In Quantum Traders, take command of a trade ship of one of four factions. The Galactic Dark Age is ending and a new age of commerce begins. Travel the known galaxy, trading resources for profit. Fulfill contracts to gain prestige. Choose to spend hard earned credits to buy political influence, or upgrade your ship. Complete contracts, provide logistics support of military actions, or transport influential diplomats in exchange for future favors. Who will gather enough clout to become the galaxy's next Merchant Prince?

title: Die wilden Fußballkerle: Reservebank Expansion
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Sports
description:
With the expansion each trainer receives another 30 cards for each team.  The game becomes more interesting with a few new rules thrown in as well affording new possibilities and tactics.

The Wild Bunch now get Felix, der Wirbelwind and Maxi Tippkick Maximilian and the Unbeatables get tsche Grtsche and Rotze so each trainer can immediately swap out two players.  A 4th and 5th card for all other players are also added to the play mix with new special abilities.

Each trainer can now assemble a crafted team of players with special abilities such that the opposing trainer won't know which team members they'll be playing against.

title: The Amazing Game Board Book
types: Abstract Strategy Book Children's Game Dice Educational Math
description:
A book with more than 50 games and activities for adults children.

THE AMAZING GAME BOARD BOOK
Exercise Your Brain!

More than 50 games and activities, including:

Foam Chinese Checkers Board with 60 Colorful Pegs ○ 28 Dominoes ○ United States Word Search ○ Secret Codes ○ Magnetic Checkers ○ Write-ON/Wipe-off Drawing Board with Erasable Marker ○ Mazes ○ Brain Teasers ○ 30-Piece, Two-Sided Jigsaw Puzzle ○ State That State Geography Game with Color Die ○ 7- Piece Magnetic Tangrams ○ Superstar Hangman ○ Reusable Fortune-Teller ○ 20 Questions ○ Fill-in Fiction Language Game ○ Optical Illusions ○ 84 Magnetic Tri-Za-Ic (tm) Pieces ○ Tic-Tac-Toe ○ Cosmic Science Games ○ Add-iplication Operation Math Game ○ Easy-To-Follow Game Instructions

Plus dozens of spin-off activities and built-in storage box!

GREAT FOR TRAVEL!

Written by
Shereen Gertel Rutman

Illustrated by
John Clementson

Designed by Carrie Abel

Ages 6-99

title: One Piece Card Game
types: Card Game Collectible Components Comic Book / Strip
description:
A collectible card game with the characters from the successful manga series One Piece. Nice artwork and easy rules make this game a good entry into the world of CCGs.

Two players build their own deck with 32 cards and fight each other with pirates, special abilities and nasty tricks.

title: Dugi
description:
AIM: Capture your opponents pieces by surrounding it on opposing sides. When your opponent has only two pieces left, or cannot move on his/her turn, then you have won the game.

SETUP: The board is a circle consisting of 7 rings, divided into 24 segments. There is a circle in the center called the dead zone. There are 12 black counters and 12 white counters. Arrange these on the board on the outer spaces (one per space on the outer ring of the board), with the black pieces closest to the black player, and the white pieces closest to the white player.

PLAY: Players take turns moving one piece per turn. The pieces may be moved forward (toward or away from the center of the board) or sideways (left or right around the ring). The pieces may be moved as far as the player wishes, but must not leave the board on the outside, enter the dead zone, move diagonally or jump a piece in its way.

To capture a piece, you must move your piece so that it completes a surround, then remove the captured piece from the board.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games


Released under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial licence. Hosted here: http://superdupergames.org/rules/dugi.pdf

title: Treasure Island
description:
Treasure Island is an exciting game for two players. It is based on Robert Louis Stevenson's famous book Treasure Island. The object of the game is for each player to travel by land and sea from England to Treasure Island and to accumulate the most shares of the buried treasure (pieces of eight) in competition with the other players during the game.

Contents:

- Two wooden tokens, one for each player, for traveling from Benbow Inn (starting point) to Bristol (sailing point) and to travel to the main treasure are of the island.

- 1 ship which is used by both players to cross the ocean; it being steered by the magic wheel.

- Two magnetic compasses (one for each player) for treasure hunting on the island.

- 9 pieces of eight are used to keep score; 1 worth 50,000 shares, 2 worth 20,000 shares each and 6 worth 10,000 each.

- Captain Flint's manuscript for playing Treasure Island.

- 1 game board.

title: Black Magic Ritual Kit
description:
Avalon Hill's trademark for its Psychic Demonstration Kit.

Produced by AH in 1974, concurrent with the Witchcraft Ritual Kit.
Both kits were based on research by Dr. Brooke Hayward Jennings.

From the back of the box:

Please read carefully. You have in your possession a kit that allows you to simulate the magic circle accurate with all the specifics needed for the hour of casting according to traditional rituals.

You have further a ritual made of authentic, traditional passages of the textbooks of magic.

It is precisely from such elements that the tradition of magic and spirit conjuration have been derived.

The makers of this kit have been concerned only to explain the principle parts and demonstrate how the magic tradition is used. The consequences of performing the ritual are dependent upon the psychic awareness level and skill of the performer.  It is here recognized that persons vary as to their level of psychic awareness and belief in spirit worlds.

No claims are made with this kit as to results.  The ritual has been modified to assure beneficial spirits. Use of the kits for other purposes is beyond control of the maker.

Use the kit in fun and stay within the confines of the spirit indicated.  These spirits are good and will serve you well.  And, you may have fun as your mind and spirit relate to these forces.

Convert the image to malevolent spirits at your risk. Remember Crowley's warning that the textbooks of magic are all that are required to conjure any spirit.

title: Top-Secret
description:
Hypothetical conflict in the Middle East.

Attack your opponent with tanks, rockets and find a way to build an atomic bomb to raid his Headquarter but protect  your industries and precious oil-wells too!

Game comes with a lot of metal miniatures (war units, industries, food storages, oil-wells) an abstract board to battle a chess-like war, cards representing wealth (food, oil and industry production).

title: Ocho Vampiros
description: OCHO VAMPIROS is a strategic, double-sided card game based on the urban myth of border-crossing Mexican vampires (Vampiros). One side of each card represents a Street or City Park; the opposite side of each card represents a Room -- Bedroom, Art Gallery or Gymnasium are examples. This represents players movement along dark city streets and into and out of unlocked buildings. Players DO NOT conceal their cards, and points are accumulated by playing VAMPIRO (vampire) cards atop the cards on an In-Play pile. Each time any player places a DOOR card on the In-Play Pile, all cards are flipped, revealing the cards opposite side. Play is fast-paced. A good memory will benefit play. OCHO VAMPIROS is best as a strategy game when played with four or six players in teams of two, working in conjunction to accumulate points. Cards are art-quality and sold online and through art galleries Only one deck is required for play; however, experts add additional decks to increase strategy options.

title: Panzerfaust: Armored Fist
description:
(The entry currently only has details for the 4th edition.)

If you would like a free PDF copy of the 4th edition rules, please see the Web Links section below.

Now featuring compulsory troop classes and morale ratings which give each nation an historical flavor, eg a small elite-veteran force of SS will outmaneuver and out shoot a larger reliable-conscript Soviet force which must use numbers to try to overwhelm the enemy. The morale system is now somewhat brutal, and there is an effective command-control system where each company HQ throws one movement-pip dice. Players purchase and field companies, though these can be 'ad-hoc' companies made up of platoons from different sources. The extremely detailed armor and gun charts have been completely re-written including footnotes notes on every item. Also soft skin and truck-mounted gun charts, and very detailed army and equipment lists for all thirteen nations. Usable with 1/300th, 1/76th or 15mm scales, these rules have a 1:1 ratio, though infantry are based in fire teams/crews. Infantry fire-fights are quickly resolved and require only 1 dice thrown per group of combatants, with casualties being complete teams. The nations covered are Belgium, Britain, Finland, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Japan, Poland, Romania, Soviet, US Europe and US Pacific. These rules are complete, no future supplements or expansions will be needed. Page count has increased from 70 to 121 pages. The rules are not full of glossy color photos, however, when it comes to content, they are without compare. Panzerfaust Armored Fist covers all thirteen major nations, for the entire course of the war, with complete equipment lists with years of service and rarity, complete tank charts, guns charts, soft skin charts, and very detailed organizational charts.

title: A Fenda do Bikini
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: A card game with the character Spongebob Squarepants. On their turns, players can put a character card on the table, buy more cards or score a location card. The goal is to score all the 8 locations of the game.

title: Het Aandelenspel
description: Learning to speculate with a game! Het aandelenspel simulates the trade on the Stock Exchange. Every player has to make a fortune by buying and selling 6 shares. The dice simulates the unexpected movements of the shares, but the players can also influence the price, buy information from a financial newspaper and trade  la baisse. The players even have to pay transaction costs when trading shares. A tactical game with a portion of luck, like the real Stock Exchange.

title: Fascination Pool
description: The board is a miniature pool table with a maze built onto the surface.  The object of the game is to get the six colored balls in the six pockets of matching colors (green ball into green pocket - yellow ball into yellow pocket and so on).  The game includes a triangle to place on the colored triangle in the center of the table.  The six balls are placed into the triangle.  The rack is removed and the table is picked up so that it can be tilted.  One point is scored for each ball that goes into a matching colored pocket.  The first player who scores twenty-four points is the winner.

title: Skate Pro
description: Players must roll dice and move, from square to square, through a town collecting skateboard equipment. The player that lands exactly in the winner's circle with all of the store item cards wins the game.

title: Akropolis
description:
The board shows the temple mountain of the Akropolis and the surrounding buildings. It is covered with a grid network that divides the mountain and some adjacent houses into fields. At the edges there are additional marks for the initial positions of the players. In addition the central mountain fields are provided with numbers between 1 and 3.

Each player has several small temple buildings and with the help of Oracle stones (small wood disks) they indicate how far they want to pull their own temples in a round.
The goal is to place as much as possible own buildings on the temple mountain. With 2 players one must place 7 buildings in order to win (there are 13 spaces). With 3-4 players one must achieve at least 12 points to be the winner. Each round is divided into three phases.

In the first phase each player decides the number of steps that he wants to move one of his building. Accordingly it takes and puts as many Oracle stones into its right hand, while keeping the remaining Oracle stones covered in the left hand. Every player place a bet on the total amount of Oracle stones that will be played in the current round by all players (it's not permitted to call a number already called by a previous player). After each player called a value, everyone open their right hand, and if someone called the exact value, he will have benefits in the third phase.

In the second phase every player moves one of his buildings (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) according to number of Oracle stones played. During the movement one can jump over one or more buildings, but the target field must be however free. If one jumps over an opponent building with the next to last point of movement, he can strike this at the end of its movement, if he wants to. The building is then put again into the supply of the opponent.

In the third phase only the player that called exactly the value in the first phase can place one of its temple on a free starting position on the board. If all starting positions are occupied or if the player has already all temples on the board, the action is not taken.

title: Twelve Tarot Games
description: Extensive details for tarot games from all over Europe. Note that there are also variations in the tarot packs used for the games. ISBN 0715614886

title: Original Card Games
description: Difficult to find book of card games designed by David Parlett. Many (but not all) of these games found their way into Mr. Parlett's Penguin Encyclopedia of Card Games (2000 edition).

title: Word of Mouth
description:
Shake the letter dice inside the false teeth and toss them out and form words. But, hurry to form as many as you can before the sand runs through the timer!

Contents: 

    12 dice
    teeth dice shaker
    60-second sand timer




Word of Mouth is a word dice game.

title: The Bunny Money Game
description: This game is based on the books about Max and Ruby by Rosemary Wells. Max and Ruby are going shopping for Grandma's birthday! They want to buy her a nice present but have other things to pick up along the way. Can they earn some money to help buy the present? Will they spend too much and run out of money? You can play the Bunny Money game, too!

title: Curious George Nutrition Game
description: Young Curious George fans will delight in identifying the food cards and matching them to the pictures on the game boards. Sorting and organizing skills are developed as players learn to classify the objects they see, and visual discrimination and fine motor skills are enhanced as they play. Best of all, as the game is played, knowledge of the basic food group units is acquired, reinforcing the importance of good nutritional habits.

title: Mystic Adventures, City
types: Adventure Dice Expansion for Base-game Exploration Fantasy Fighting
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingModular BoardRole PlayingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Mystic Adventure, City, takes one of the most important places in the Mystic Adventures game, the city of Mordenhelm, and expands upon what you can do there.  No longer is it just a small region among many, but now a place all to itself.  Enter the walls of this great city and you can find all you might need in your quest to become the ruler of the lands about you.  Wealth, power, lore and danger all wait for those that brave the many city streets and back allies of this great metropolis.

Expands:

     Mystic Adventures

title: Mystic Adventures, Outer Planes
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Exploration Fantasy Fighting Wargame
mechanisms: Dice RollingModular BoardRole PlayingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Mystic Adventures, Outer Planes is the latest expansion in the Mystic Adventures game system.  Take your quest into the outer reaches of reality, explore the lower planes of the damned and then move on to the halls of the gods.  The elemental planes call to you, and if you answer, you can command their powers.  This expansion will offer players a whole new realm of adventure, one that is dangerous, but whose rewards are great.

Expands:

     Mystic Adventures

title: Oldies but Goodies, The Ultimate Music Trivia Game
description: The ultimate music TRIVIA challenge. This game contains over 3,500 Rock N' Roll questions...including one FREE cassette with over 400 short musical teasers of some of the greatest Rock N' Roll hits of all time. TEST YOUR MUSICAL MEMORY!

title: Imagine That! The Puzzling Memory Matching Game! Under the Sea Edition
description: You'll need a sharp eye and a keen mind to make a match from the sea of cards. Each match gives you another piece of the picture, but beware of the your opponents - they are trying to solve the same puzzle! Who will be the first to collect all nine pieces and win? Hidden among the cards lie rewards and perilous dangers. Search for the elusive Treasure Chest and steal a card from any player or hook the Big Catch and discover two extra cards. But watch out for sharks! A Shark card means you'll have to put a piece back!

title: Boer War
types: Card Game Post-Napoleonic Print & Play Wargame
description: A free historical card game simulating the Boer War.  One player is the British Empire the other player is the Transvaal  Free Orange State Boers.  The game is free to print and play from the Ludi Popina web site.

title: Friendo
description:
FRIENDO is a game that challenges your ability to guess how others will react in a given situation.

For every sitting of a game, one story, along with 5 related questions, is used. This item is known as a Case 'N Questions.

Total Score = Points x Friendo Chips.

The objective of FRIENDO is to maximize Total Score.  To do that, you must be able to 1)correctly guess how others answer their questions AND 2)partner-up with somebody and correctly guess each other's answers.

If you stay single, (i.e. without a partner), you get no Friendo Chip, and thus, will always have a Total Score of zero.

Game is over when either 1)all the answers (20 if there are 4 players) have been guessed or recalled or 2)when, as a result of players going bankrupt of Points, only 3 players are left on the board.  There must be at least 4 players for a game to continue.  Then, whoever has the most Total Score wins.

Free online multi player game available at www.friendo.com.  Click Play Online.

title: Zombie Plague: Crawlers
description:
An expansion for Zombie Plague. This expansion introduces legless/torso Zombies into the game. Although slower moving than normal Zombies (which isn't saying much) they have the ability to latch onto humans and are replaced on a two for one basis.

Expands:

    Zombie Plague

title: 25 Super Cool Math Board Games
description: A book which lets kids play game of multiplication, division, fractions, probability, estimation, mental math, and more.

title: 25 Instant & Irresistible Math Board Games (Grades 2-4)
description: A book which lets kids play games which teach: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, time, money, fractions, geometry, and more.

title: The All New Brit Quiz Game
description:
One (the third(?)) in a series of simple quiz games that require, as the name suggests, knowledge of British trivia...

Players take turns to roll a die and move that number of spaces round the board. The player then tries to answer a question determined by both the colour of the space he or she lands on, and the actual number rolled on the die. If the question is answered correctly the player moves forwards an additional three spaces as a reward. There is no penalty for getting the answer wrong.

The question categories are:

Orange - History  This And That
Yellow - People
White - Places
Green - Showbiz
Blue - Best of British luck
Red - Sport
Brown - Up The Creek

The questions for Sport, History  This  That, People, Places and Showbiz all require straight answers to a straight forward question.

The questions for the Best of British luck are in a different format with 6 different types available - Multiple Choice, Odd Man Out, Missing Letters, Anagrams, Whereabouts, and Draw - with the last four of these categories being conducted against a 30 second timer.

'Up The Creek' is a special category that asks the player to perform an activity rather than answer a question. If the player fails to carry out the activity to the satisfaction of the other players, or refuses to even try, he or she has to move backwards three spaces.

The winner is the first player to complete a circuit of the track around the board.

title: Brit Quiz II
description:
The second in a series of quiz games that require, as the name suggests, knowledge of British trivia...

Game play is as for the first edition:

Players take turns to roll a die and move that number of spaces round the board. The player then tries to answer a question determined by both the colour of the space he or she lands on, and the actual number rolled on the die. If the question is answered correctly the player moves forwards an additional three spaces as a reward. There is no penalty for getting the answer wrong.

'Up The Creek' is a special category that asks the player to perform an activity rather than answer a question. If the player fails to carry out the activity to the satisfaction of the other players, or refuses to even try, he or she has to move backwards three spaces.

The winner is the first player to complete a circuit of the track around the board.

Question categories are slightly changed from the first edition, and the questions are new:

Orange - History  This And That
Yellow - People
White - Places
Green - Showbiz
Blue - Animals  Plants
Red - Sport
Brown - Up The Creek

title: Suzy's Zoo: My First Words Game
description:
From the Manufacturer:

My First Words Game features illustrations of familiar objects. To play, place the cardboard tile on top of the matching object on the board.

title: Charlotte Square
description:
From the box:
'The board is a bird's eye view of George Street, Charlotte Square and St. Andrews Square in the New Town of Edinburgh.'
'Players must first park their car and then visit up to eight shops or businesses in the area. However, many hazards await them - Parking Meters, Traffic Wardens, Endless delays and Diversions'
The idea is to 
1) park your car and put money in the meter. This determines how many turns you have before you must return to your car.
2) visit the shops as determined by a random card allocation
3) return to your card before your money runs out (or the Traffic Warden gets you!)
4) Repeat until all your errands are finished and you drive away.

title: BUX: the matchin' cash-in card game
types: Bluffing Card Game Dice Party Game
description:
The differences: No cards are ever taken in your hands. Your cards are kept in front of you, side by side, on the table, symbol side up. These cards are called your 'spread'.

Your objective: is to have the most chips when the game ends.

The Big Idea: buy or swap cards to add to your spread. From your spead make matching 3-card sets to sell back to the Bank for chips. Like Life Put it together and get Paid.

You start with 3 cards and the value of 200 chips

On your turn, you choose any one of the following:
Draw - turn over 3 cards and everyone gets to bin on them
Swap - any of your unwanted cards for someone else's unprotected on
Cash In - cash in a 3 set set of matching symbols or shapes or both for more chips

The game ends when the 3rd BUX card appears

title: Point Zero
description:
POINT ZERO - The UNICEF Strategy Game is a roll and move and tile placement board game simulating the development of an under-developed region of the world by UNICEF.

The board is divided into four regions, one for each player, representing a village in the African Bush, the Amazon Basin, the Sahel Belt or South East Asia. An information card for each area provides details of the kind of assistance required and the types of trained personnel required to provide it - this varies from region to region.

Players take it in turns to move their Community Leader around the outer circuit of the board the number of spaces determined by the roll of either one or two dice. In so doing the players collect (and on occasion lose) a variety of Community workers, Medics, Technicians, Teachers and Social workers. The directions in the spaces also initiate good or bad events in the region.

At various points on the board these helpers can be used to develop part of their village. The player developing the Sahel Belt, for example, will need to construct a safe water supply, Milk Processing Plant, Health Care Center, School etc... Construction requires then right compliment of experts and may also cost points which are earned through completing circuits of the board.

The construction undertaken and equipment purchased is represented on the board by a series of jig-saw pieces which are placed within a frame that is positioned over the game board. The pieces can be added into the frame in any order, but successful redevelopment of a village will require a total of 11 pieces.

The winner is the player that is first to have successfully reconstructed his or her village by covering the developing area with 11 reconstruction pieces.

title: P.T. Boat 109
description: Billed as an 'exciting game of strategy and imagination' but looks and plays a lot like Battleship.

title: Beat the Competition
description: In this game, you are a traveling sales person who is sent around the country trying to make sales.  It is a basic roll and move game, with everyone choosing a different home territory (starting place).  You must pay for expenses along the way, and the winner is the person who makes the most money.

title: First to Five
description: First to Five is a fun, challenging Go-Moku game of tactical moves and counter moves. The object of the game is to be the first player to place five marbles in a formation like the five on a die. Players take turns placing marbles and may make the 5 pattern any size on the playing board as long as all the marbles are equally spaced.

title: White Ensign
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Modern Warfare Nautical Wargame
description:
There was a time when the sun never set on the British Empire. The sinews that kept the empire together were the ships of the Royal Navy, and later, those of the Commonwealth nations. Today, just like it was in the past, whenever those ships sail, one can see the White Ensign.

White Ensign discusses each conflict in which Commonwealth naval forces were involved from 1960 to the present day. These include: Yemen 1960-67, Borneo 1962-66, Rhodesia 1965-66, Iceland 1972-73, Falklands 1977, Desert Shield/Storm 1990-91, Kuwait 1961 (Operation Vantage), East Africa 1966, Suez 1966-73, Cyprus 1974, Falklands 1982, Adriatic 1993-96.

Perhaps the most comprehensive study of the modern Royal Navy outside of official publications and a valuable reference book in its own right, White Ensign is meant to be used as a supplement to Harpoon4 and requires the use of Harpoon4 rules to derive the maximum value from it. All ships, from carriers down to patrol/fast attack craft, as well as ships taken up from trade (STUFT) during the Falklands War are included in the ship data annex, as are all aircraft that were or could have been used in a naval environment. Also included is an extensive bibliography which includes official sources and internet sites.

title: Billy Goat
description: Children's game for Ages 4 - 10.  Players take turns stacking blocks at the end of the playing surface.  Eventually the weight of the blocks will cause the rubber-band loaded billy goat to launch into the wall of blocks, knocking them down.  The player who was putting a brick on the wall when the billy goat was triggered is now out of the game.  The goat is reset, and play starts over.  The last player remaining wins.

title: Mission 'N' Possible
description:
A Mystery Theme Party for 6 to 20 Players.

Get Ready for an evening of fun, laughter and suspense as you and your guests race to save the world.

This game includes both an adult and child version of the game.

Great for Family Get Togethers, Neighborhood Fun, Birthday Parties, etc.

The only thing that's impossible is not having fun!

Dr. Jones has stolen top-secret information, which he plans to publish on the Internet. Your mission, should you decide to accept it, is to travel as teams to five foreign countries and decode the secret information in each one. Teams follow a travel map to different country locations. As always, should any of your team be caught, the host will disavow any knowledge of this mission.

title: Don't Cook Your Goose
description: A children's game in which players spin the spinner to determine which section of the pivoting game board they must place their plastic goose piece on.  Players continue adding pieces until one side of the board weighs sufficiently more than the other and tips over, spilling the geese into the pot below.

title: Games: American Boxed Games and Their Makers
description:
From the Publisher:
In America, games have become a part of our national heritage. Their brightly lithographed boxes and themes based on morals, nursery rhymes, history, television and geography have reflected the growth of our country for over 150 years. Games: American Boxed Games and Their Makers profiles and prices thousands of games manufactured from 1822-1992. Histories of hundreds of manufacturers, including the big four (McLoughlin Brothers, Milton Bradley, Selchow  Righter, and Parkers Brothers); collecting guidelines for both experts and novices; and advice on determining the relative value of a game will help you know whether to tiddle or wink.

This 197-page book includes short histories of many American game companies, along with many pictures from Whitehill's huge collection including 10 color pictures.  Original retail price $19.95.

title: The Games We Played
description:
This 159-page book is a pictorial of boards and a few playing pieces from games in the New York Historical Society's collection.  Really a coffee table book, there are very short descriptions of the games.

From the back cover:
The Games We Played: The Golden Age of Board and Table Games brings together more than one hundred eye-catching examples of America's most spectacular games. A veritable encyclopedia of late nineteenth- and early twentieth- century games, this playful visual survey provides a revealing look at the social values and preoccupations of the culture that produced them. Organized around themes such as moral education, city life, sports, war, and travel, this book casts its entertaining subject matter in a fascinating new light, for avid and occasional game players alike.

title: Victory By Any Means: Campaign Moderator's Companion
types: Civilization Economic Expansion for Base-game Exploration Negotiation Science Fiction
description:
Expand your Victory by Any Means (VBAM) campaign with 
this book of advanced rules and options for use with the VBAM Campaign System! This companion includes rules for high-detail star system generation, non-player entities and diplomacy, ground combat, exploration, and much more. Perhaps more importantly, the CAMPAIGN MODERATORS COMPANION includes all of the rules a player needs to play a solo campaign.

Expands:

    Victory By Any Means: Campaign Guide




Expanded by:

    Stars Divided: The Terran Civil War (Victory By Any Means: Campaign Guide and Victory By Any Means: The Starmada Edition also required)

title: Victory By Any Means: The Menagerie
types: Civilization Economic Expansion for Base-game Exploration Negotiation Science Fiction
description:
The Menagerie features a set of full custom race design rules for the Victory By Any Means Campaign System. Now players can design their own custom empires with special physical and social traits and government types, making the campaign experience even more interesting! Also included in THE MENAGERIE are over a dozen pre-defined custom races, unit lists for their empires, and additional star maps for use in your campaigns.

Expands:

    Victory By Any Means: Campaign Guide

title: Victory By Any Means: The Starmada Edition
types: Civilization Economic Expansion for Base-game Political Science Fiction Space Exploration
description:
This book provides the rules links you need to play a campaign using a combination of both Starmada Space Tactical System and the Victory by Any Means Campaign Guide. It also includes the rules that you will need to design your own Starmada ships for use in a campaign game, so that you can hurl them mercilessly against your opponents defenses. Not only do you now have the rules to play a Starmada campaign in great detail, the materials and ships for the Wars of the Boltians and Kuissians setting are also included. Requires both VBAM: Campaign Guide and the Starmada Tactical System.

Expands:

    Victory By Any Means: Campaign Guide




Expanded by:

    Stars Divided: The Terran Civil War (Victory By Any Means: Campaign Guide also required)

title: Reflexion
description:
Two players each have a board with a mirror at one side and two two-sided pieces with a red and yellow pattern on them. Each round, one of the cards is turned face up, showing a pattern that can be made with the two pieces and their image in the mirror.

Simultaneously, both players try to create the pattern on the card with their two pieces. The first player who manages this gets the card, which counts as a victory point. When the deck is exhausted, the player with the most cards wins.

For solitaire play, the rule book includes extra patterns using all four pieces.

title: World Championship Dodge Ball
description:
From the publisher:

It's that time of the year again: the best teams have made the playoffs, and the World Championship is about to start. The top players have come from around the world: Chicago, Detroit, Atlanta, Lima, Sao Paulo, Amsterdam, Tokyo, and Phuket all have ballers in town. Though gone to the public, dodge ball is certainly not forgotten. It's time for World Championship Dodge Ball! Screw fame and fortune - you're here for BLOOD! Put on your shorts, inflate the balls, and remember: HELMETS ARE FOR WIMPS!

World Championship Dodge Ball Features:

- Rapid-fire dodge ball action for 2-4 players in 10-15 minute games 
- Hilarious card assortment based on dodge ball's heyday in the 1970s 
- Deck-building strategy based on assembling a team of top dodge ball competitors 
- Once play begins, it's a game of speed and skill where you try to counter your opponent's throws while simultaneously making your own

Box contains: 110 cards and rules

title: What Shall I Wear?: A  Fashion Game for Girls
description: The goal of this game is to be the first player to be dressed for two invitations.  Players roll dice and move around the board to different sections, the Daytime Boutique, Sports Fair, and Formal Salon collecting parts of different outfits.

title: Phantom's Vortex
description:
Print and play game with a monster theme.

From the website:

In this game, you're one of four Phantoms racing around a crumbling Druidic Temple, hoping to be the
first to take control of the VORTEX (which controls all space and time, binds the universe together, and
picks up FM radio like you wouldn't BELIEVE)! You'll have to battle the fearsome Sentinels that guard
these ruins, and your opponents will be attacking you with a variety of horrible creatures. This game's
very easy to learn to play, so phantoms of all ages can enjoy it. And once a few Phantom's start
hurling savage ravenous monstrosities at each other... well, it's sure to be a fun time!

title: Midnight Banshees
description:
From the website:
In this game, you're one of four Banshees racing to be the first to collect five skulls from the surrounding tombs. Standing on the red-stained stones (I'm not certain why they're stained red, but I suspect it's leakage from the tombs), you perform the mystic ritual of 'Spinning the Bones' to overcome the magic spells of the Stone Sentinels (which keep the tombs closed). Next you peer inside the tomb, hoping to find a skull to steal (the skeletons don't mind because then they're able to watch the race, which they enjoy greatly), and hoping not to find a Vampire (because you would then have to give the Vampire a skull for having disturbed him). Racing away with a skull, you think you might WIN this time...and then you see the horrible Zombie lurching towards you, intent on eating...that's right....your SKULL!!!

(MIDNIGHT BANSHEES has a spinner under the gameboard,
so you never know which tomb might contain a Vampire!)

title: OMMS: On Map Military Strategy
description:
OMMS is the board game that everybody already owns.
