It uses an everyday map as the board, coins, playing cards and matches for counters and cards.  Every game is different, because you can just try out a different map.
The aim is to defeat the other players by battling their units, sieging settlements and fortifications, and expanding your territories faster than they can.

Full rules available via the Web Link section near the bottom of this page

title: Fel, fel vitézek!
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Classic battle game from World War II. Two enemy players fight on the opposite sides (the red and the blue bases).
The game includes a classic gameboard for the trench fighting, and 20-20 amazingly detailed hand painted army miniatures. Commanders deploy their soldiers through the fields, special terrains, and other objects.
The game mechanics are quite simple. Dice rolling movement, and special fields. (POW camps, Hospitals)
Average game length is between 30 and 60 minutes.

The title translates as Get up! Get up, valiants!

title: Bogyman
description:
From the instruction sheet:

BOGYMAN

A spine tingling board game of strategy and risk for 2-5 players

About the Game - The Bogy man has risen from the grave, stalking the town of Homewood by night, and hiding in the shadows of the old abandoned mansion by day. The only way to send the Bogyman back to the grave is to enter the old mansion, find the nine missing pieces to the magic medallion, and assemble it. Four brave town's people have accepted the challenge even though others before them have tried and never returned. Their chances for survival are very small, but that's their problem.

Contents include:
Instruction sheet 
Game board
28 cards
Five standard pawns
One six-sided die

title: Card Games For Two
description:
From the book cover:
Card Games For Two offers a feast of card games with something suitable for all the family. From children's favorites such as Old Maid, through classic games like Whist and Rummy, to the exotically named Julepe and Klob, or the fiendishly competitive Bezique or Spite and Malice, this book has something for everyone. There are more than 100 games (including variations), fully described and graded for difficulty. Neither you nor your friends will want to be without a deck of cards again!

title: Capitaneus et Defensor
description:
An historical simulation of San Marino during the year of Italian Renaissance. Up to six players, that represents several factions of the country, fight in order to rule the small Republic. Each player controls a group of councilmen in the San Marino parliament (named Arengo). They fight each other in order to obtain more concessions and more adherents. However players have to act like a single person towards the numerous external forces that will try to destroy the small and rich Republic. The player that gain the most influence point win the game.

The game was produced in an edition of 492 copies.

The rulebook includes Italian and English rules.

title: Superstar Lineup Talking Football
description:
An electronic game simulating an NFL all-star football game where players key in offensive and defensive plays and listen to an electronic announcer for play results.  Game features star players from the late 1980s such as Joe Montana, Dan Marino, Jerry Rice, etc.  Offense and defense each have six formations (which are announced to both players upon keying-in), and each formation allows approximately 6-8 plays.

Game consists of a 3D plastic stadium game module with keypads for both players, instruction booklet, 2 play books, 12 formation cards, 34 player cards, and scoresheet.  Can be played by 2 players or solitaire against the computer.

title: Dragon Poker
description:
Players use cards to construct a dragon and provide it with treasure.

A gambling game using a custom deck of 68 cards. The cards depict different parts of dragons (head, wings, tail, body) in six different colors. Various combos may be played, from Serpent (just a head and a tail, for one point) to Gold Dragon (all four pieces in gold, ten points) or Hydra (six heads and one body, twelve points.) When a dragon is played, extra points may be scored for treasure cards in the players hand (Gold, Gems, Dragon Eggs, or a Maiden.) The player who plays the combination worth the most points wins the hand.

A free card game where players use the cards, which represent parts of a dragon (i.e., head, body, wings, tail), to make combinations (similar to Rummy or Poker games). There are also special cards representing Treaures, Gems, Maidens and Dragon Eggs (which are wild cards).  The game is free to print and play from the Ludi Popina web site and the designer's own web site.

title: Dork Frag
types: Comic Book / Strip Fighting Humor Video Game Theme
description: A free game given away in Dork Tower #25 and in the Dork Tower game.  It's Frag with characters (Ken, Carson, Igor, Matt, Kayleigh and Gilly) from Dork Tower. The board is the Pegasus Games store. The board, pieces and cards are paper and should probably be laminated before using.

title: Sextett
description:
Sextett is a collection of 6 abstract strategy games packaged in one box.  According to the rules none of these games had been published before, although in fact at least a few are traditional games. Ravensburger catalog #12.026

The game box includes several sets of multi colored pawns used in all games and 3 double sided hard playing boards.

The games included are:

Quicki - a dice rolling race game where players move around an abstract grid of points trying to reach their colored places in the board center, players can be sent back to their starting places by other players choosing to land on their current position.

Ponte - from the translated rulebook: The object of the game is to reach the island by crossing streets and bridges with one figure as fast as possible and then build a tower and reach it by jumps.

The Magic Star - The object of the game is to try to move clockwise around the star on the outer or inner path beginning from the starting point.  The player who manages to get all of his game figures into his own star corner first wins the game.  A blockade figure constantly changes the aspect of the game.

Piggy Back - The object of the game is to get all the figures across the board first, whereby the players are forced at times to carry the opponent's figures piggy-back across the board or even to be carried in the same way themselves in order to reach their destination.  The point of the game is to try to take advantage of the piggy back rule whenever possible.

Fox Jumping - A gathering of foxes (2 or 4 fox families make 40 foxes) is disturbed by a hunting party.  Hastily each fox tried to hide in one of the 39 neighboring dens.  But since there is room for one fox in each den, the slowest fox loses the race.

Surakarta - This game originated in Indonesia.   It bears the name of the old time-honored city of Surakarta on the island of Middle Java.  The game is played on a grid of points with all points on the outer edge connected by a curved line that leads back to another board edge.  The idea is to move your pawns around the grid trying to get to a curved line that can be used to move to another side of the board and more importantly eliminate your opponents pawn.  The game is played actively in Indonesia by drawing lines in the ground and playing with pebbles.

title: Doro Nawa: The Struggle for Singapore
description: Operational treatment of the Malayan campaign, December 1941 - February 1942.

title: Lynch Mob
description:
From the back of the game box:

Welcome to the lynch mob -- a riotous place where your own survival rests entirely on the good graces (or bad!) of your fellow man. Whether you are the marshal, a criminal , or just an honest citizen, your ability to convince others of your innocence is the only means to avoid the dreaded lynch mob.

Contents of the game include 22 citizen cards, 22 role cards and a rule booklet (or set of rule cards).

title: California Wine Quiz
description:
Requires a knowledge of California wines. Comes in a wooden box which looks almost identical to Bowker's 'The Winery Game' .

The board consists of California wine maker labels, each numbered. Using the number, you look up questions in either the Odd Book or the Even Book. Points are scored based on the answers.

Includes:

1 Wood box w/slot for the game board.
1 full color, mounted game board which also acts as the sliding box top.
2 question books, about 80-pages each, 11-1/4 x 7-1/2
1 pad of score sheets, 11 x 3-1/4
4 Wine cork playing pieces, colored on top
1 6-sided die

title: Scarne's Encyclopedia of Games
description:
Large book mainly covering card games but also has sections on dice games, parlour games, lottery games, tile games, chess, checkers, gambling games and a section called Games requiring special equipment which covers some traditional board games. There are also some original games by John Scarne sprinkled throughout the book and a glossary of game terms.

The ISBN is 0060138130.

title: Full Thrust Fleet Book: Volume 2 (The Xeno Files)
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Full rules and ship design systems for three alien forces in the Full Thrust universe - the KraVak, SaVasku and Phalons, plus ship illustrations and stats for the navies of these three races.

Fleet Book 2 also includes some additional rules and updates to the general Full Thrust game system.

title: Battlestations
types: Miniatures Nautical Wargame World War II
description: Miniatures rules for naval combat from 1930 to 1945.  Has beginner's and advanced rules, plus ship data.

title: Police Alert
description: Players move around the playing board trying to solve as many incidents or crimes as possible. However, the incidents and the locations can change quite suddenly. Points are accumulated for the various incidents and the player with the highest score wins when all incidents have been solved.

title: Six Victorian & Edwardian Board Games
description:
From the book cover:

Here are six authentic board games from the Victorian and Edwardian period ready to play. Everything you need is here - the playing boards with their charming illustrations, counters and full instructions.

Chosen by Christie's expert, Olivia Bristol, each game is in its original form. Family entertainment as it was enjoyed 100 years ago.

Includes the following games:
The Prince's Quest
A Day at the Zoo with Daddy
Cycling
The Wonders of The Deep
A Trip to Mars
The Tailess Donkey

title: Try Time: New Zealand's Rugby Trivia Game
description:
From the box:

Try Time is the exciting new rugby trivia game for rugby enthusiasts. So you think you know your rugby? .... Try time will give you and your friends hours of fun and rugby banter - play the game 2 ways - collect categories, with the winner being the first to collect them all or set a time limit and accumulate points through tries, conversions and the occasional drop kick. Either way, a feast of fun awaits as you attempt to step your way to the line on New Zealand's foremost rugby trivia game.

title: Ball Park Baseball
description:
Ball Park Baseball was developed by Professor Charles Sidman from the University of Kansas in the early 1960s. Each team from 1894 up to the present (2006 season) is available and includes every pitcher with 29.3 IP or hitter/position player with a significant contribution to the team's performance.

The game is played according to the rules of baseball. The action of the game is based upon random numbers between 1 and 50. Numbers 1 through 25 determine the strength of the batter; numbers 26 through 50 provide the capability of the pitcher. Batters have ratings for arm (catchers/outfielders), fielding (by position) and running (catchers have and additional rating for handling pitchers). Pitchers have ratings for fielding and holding runners on base.

The game also has very detailed (and essential to game play) unique ball park charts (capturing the dimensions and effect of each field) for several historic baseball stadiums.

Each card and ball park chart is based on actual statistic performances of the players.

title: CON!
description:
CON! is a fast paced card game where players compete to the be most popular attendee at a generic convention.  Character cards are bid on as they come into play.  Each character has a set point value and changes the effects of the bids that are used to win the characters.  After each player has a chance to put a character into play, the hands refresh and new characters are dealt into play.

The bids consist of four suits: Stuff, Hobbies, Freakness and Tales.  Certain characters have different effects on the suits that maybe played.  Other cards Stops and Trumps allow to to eliminate rival player's cards or even knock them from the bidding entirely.  Hand management comes into play as your cards do no refresh until everyone has put a character into play.

Game takes approximately 10 minutes to play and is scalable, so the game takes the same amount of time regardless the number of players.  It is pure beer and pretzels and will have future expansions featuring more stereotypical con goers.  The game is best described as 1/3 luck, 1/3 strategy and 1/3 spite.

title: Atentado no Cassino
description: Secret agents (the players) walk around a casino, trying to protect an important politician. It also happens that one of the agents is a traitor, and is trying to kill him instead. Players may play roulette, black jack or dice to earn money to buy poisoned darts and paralyzing gas to attack other agents, or antidote and anti-gas masks to protect themselves.

title: Giro Binaca
description:
This game is another cycling race game.

The race track is formed out of 15 cards which are laid one after another. There are 10 'incident' cards which are put face down on the table, and each player also has 14 movement cards, on which there are depicted 4 possible actions and one or more arrows.

The players choose a movement card simultaneously and put them together. The arrow(s) on the card of player 1 determine the actions player B has to take and vice-versa.

First to finish wins the game.

Originally released by Edizioni Gioghi Lasco from Milan, 1952, this game was re-released in 1993 by Edizioni Lo Scarabeo from Torino.

title: Battleships at War: Atlantic
description: Battleships at War: Atlantic is a stand-alone game covering WW2 tactical level ship-to-ship combat in the Atlantic, Med, and Baltic theaters. Includes sixty ships from five nations (Britain, Germany, France, Italy, USSR), rulebook, a dozen scenarios, Reference Card, and a Convoy module, in ziplock packaging. In the old-style Minden tradition, counters must be cut out prior to play. But, components are in COLOR, and game is fully compatible with The Mighty Hood game appearing in Panzerschreck #14. If you liked Graf Spee in Pzsk #13, my guess is you'll love both The Mighty Hood and Battleships at War: Atlantic.

title: Somewhere in the Honduras
description:
From the publisher:

We are local business partners collecting various goods from the countryside and delivering them to Coastal Export Warehouses, Inc. CEW pays us in Lempira for everything we bring in plus bonuses for completing certain contracts. The pay is poor and the dangers many. If we are not avoiding snakes, chagas, flash floods and the like, we are watching out for robbers. So, why bother, you ask? It's a living and a lot of rural workers depend on us. If you lack the necessary pride, wisdom and courage, don't join us, join the banditos.

title: Monopoly: MCI Classic
description: Your standard Monopoly with the theme surrounding the MCI Classic Golf Tournament. These were not made available to the public. There were only 5,000 copies made which makes it both rare and desirable to the Monopoly collector.

title: Net Ball
description:
A board game simulation of the popular Net Ball game.

Described on the box as: A fast moving game of skill and accuracy

title: GROPOS
types: Miniatures Movies / TV / Radio theme Wargame
description:
From the publisher:

Because YOU demanded it - Ground Combat in the Babylon 5 Universe is here! GROPOS (Ground Pounders) stand ready to begin their assault on outposts, cities, and planetary surfaces near you! Command tanks such as the Earth Odin, Minbari Chrystalis, Narn D'Va'Tren, and Centauri Hexus in your bid to overwhelm the enemy with raw, nail-biting firepower! Do anything a futuristic ground combat unit can do - call in orbital strikes, zip low over the ground in VTOLs, hide in dense urban areas, customize units with optional equipment and officers - and much more! The GROPOS Core Rules also serve as the entry point to the new MAXIM rules system, which will allow you to play ground battles in nearly any setting throughout history and beyond!

title: Way of War
description:
From the publisher:

Universal Miniatures System
Along the endless road, war is a constant companion. Displaced civilizations from throughout time and imagination battle each other. Armies that have stepped from the pages of history face armies that could never have existed. This is the Way, an endless Road that the lost are drawn to, whether it is lost to history, to accident, or to imagination.

The Way of War is a universal miniatures system that allows players to control the kind of game they play. It allows everything from Napoleonic formations to wizards casting spells to vehicles running a muck to artillery of a most unusual nature.

The Way of War allows you to bring any model you want into the game, whether historical, fantasy, or just plain weird. The Way of War can incorporate any model, no matter how fantastic or with what special abilities, into the game.

Twenty armies are included, all new and different from what you've seen before.

The Way itself is a world in which any kind of battle that is possible to the imagination can be fought.

This is The Way of War. A miniatures game that allows you to do anything you can conceive.

This is merely a rulebook. You'll also need 10-sided dice, a ruler, and miniatures to play. Some useful templates are included on the last page of this book.

title: Top Secret
description:
From the box :

The most fascinating game you can play with friends. Take one card from each of the four categories: ethical, serious, surprising or intimidating disclosures. Are you willing to admit to your partners that the statement on one of your cards applies to you? If so, read the card out loud and win a token! Then for an additional token, try to guess who would be willing to admit what you just admitted. Nothing to confess? Take four new cards for your next turn. TOP SECRET - your guarantee of laughter, fun and excitement.

Consists in revealing shocking secrets about yourself and trying to find out who would also agree with you.

title: Royal Toad
description:
From the publisher:

In Royal Toad, Prince and Princess cards are chosen from each player's hand to find their noble matches.  The player who holds on to the Royal Toad card before it hops off is the winner!

A SimplyFun version of the card game Old Maid, with the twist that players are trying to keep the Royal Toad instead of get rid of it.

title: Debate This!
description:
Description from their website:

Debate This! is the hot new board game that celebrates the art of lively banter and creative embellishment. In a test of words and wit, players debate topics ranging from social norms to sports, pop culture to politics, relationships to personal behavior. During each round, teams square off to deliver the most clever, creative, entertaining and persuasive argument to support their position and win points from the independent judge. The judge likes to be amused, entertained and enlightened. More entertainment, more points. The first team to cross the finish line wins the game. But it's the debates that will have people talking the next day. When family and friends get together, Debate This! is the game that gives them all a chance to speak their mind.

title: Discovery Channel Space Brain Twister!
description:
From the publisher:

Brain Twister! is the only double-sided memory game in the world. Designed by master puzzle-maker Klaus Schrer, Brain Twister! offers a unique twist on the classic matching game: both the front and back images of each playing tile must be matched in order to score. Brain Twister! features educational and scientific artwork that will appeal to players of all ages.

Brain Twister offers a unique twist on the classic memory matching game.  The Discovery Channel version of the game features 90 double-sided tiles with fascinating images from across the universe including the Space Shuttle Endeavour, a remnant of a supernova, and the International Space Station.

title: Runebound: The Scepter of Kyros
description:
From the Fantasy Flight Games Website:

As if the return of the Dragon Lords wasn't bad enough, Terrinoth is under assault by another enemy, if anything more devastating and more implacable. With the return of the Dragon Lords comes the return of one of their most ancient foes: the Giant Lords.

In this expansion, Runebound (Second Edition) is played as normal, except that the cards from the expansion replace the Encounters and Events in the normal adventure decks. The blue challenge cards represent Giant Lords that are trying to conquer the world of Runebound.

When 8 Giant Lords have been defeated, an special endgame scenario begins where giants invade and occupy a number of cities on board. Defeating these foes will be a challenge, as they can even use items from the marketplace of the occupied cities!

This expansion of 30 cards includes:

    6 green Events and Encounters
    6 yellow Events and Encounters
    18 blue Challenges




Belongs to the Runebound Series.

Expands:

    Runebound (Second Edition)

title: Runebound: Crown of the Elder Kings
description:
Belongs to the Runebound Series.

From the Fantasy Flight Games Website:
Thousands of years ago, in a time shrouded by the mists of history, the Elder Kings came to the continent of Terrinoth. They conquered the land and established a line of kings that ruled the entire continent. In time, these kings became lazy, decadent ... and cruel. Eventually, the Elder Kings were overthrown, the cities became free, and then came the Dragon War and the Elder Kings were lost to the mists of history. Until now.

In Crown of the Elder Kings players assume roles of tyrants and villains in the world of Runebound, gathering vassals to become Elder King. The goal is to be the first to collect a set of three vassals (blue challenges), which triggers the endgame. When this happens, other players try to defeat that player and his or her vassals.

This is an expansion pack for Runebound (Second Edition). It replaces elements of the adventure deck and creates a completely new story with new challenges, new events, new rules, and new victory conditions.

This expansion includes 30 new adventure cards:

    9 green Challenges
    5 yellow Challenges
    16 blue Challenges.




Expands:

    Runebound (Second Edition)

title: Runebound: The Dark Forest
description:
From the Fantasy Flight Games Website:

With the elves in decline, the forests of Terrinoth grow more dangerous with every passing year. The trees grow closer, the creatures deadlier, and the air darker ...

The Dark Forest expansion pack introduces an assortment of dangerous new monsters, encounters, and events that can be added seamlessly to the Runebound (Second Edition) basic game. There are no new rules to learn; the players can simply shuffle these new cards into their adventure decks and begin playing with them immediately.

This expansion includes 30 new adventure cards.

Belongs to the Runebound Series.

Expands:

    Runebound (Second Edition)

title: Runebound: The Terrors of the Tomb
description:
From the Fantasy Flight Games Website:

Since the Dragon Wars, Terrinoth has been a dangerous place. Once-mighty empires have fallen, and now the landscape is dotted with their relics and remains - dark and forsaken crypts, looming burial mounds, and ingeniously-trapped tombs. Great riches may be found there, to be sure, but also great peril...

The Terrors of the Tomb expansion pack introduces an assortment of dangerous new monsters, encounters, and events that can be added seamlessly to the Runebound (Second Edition) basic game. There are no new rules to learn; the players can simply shuffle these new cards into their adventure decks and begin playing with them immediately.

This expansion includes 30 new adventure cards.

Belongs to the Runebound Series.

Expands:

    Runebound (Second Edition)

title: Runebound: Artifacts and Allies
description:
From the Fantasy Flight Games Website:

Terrinoth is a land of great magic. Whether bound into the commonly-used Runes, imbued into great artifacts of mystical might, or even inherent in the fantastic creatures that inhabit the land, this magic is everywhere.

The Artifacts and Allies expansion pack adds new items and a new type of ally - the Familiar - to the Runebound (Second Edition) basic game. Familiars have useful abilities and can be acquired in addition to the usual three allies each character is allowed.

This expansion includes 30 new market cards.

Belongs to the Runebound Series.

Expands:

    Runebound (Second Edition)

title: Runebound: Relics of Legend
description:
From the Fantasy Flight Games Website:

During the Dragon Wars, the free cities of Terrinoth created powerful Items as tokens for their champions. They gave these Artifacts, Weapons, Armor, and even Allies (in the form of magical animal statues that come to life) to the Heroes of the land. Now the Relics of Legend are scattered, but great power will come to those who gather them.

The Relics of Legend expansion pack adds new Market cards - both items and allies - to the Runebound (Second Edition) basic game. There are no new rules to learn, simply shuffle the cards into the market deck and begin playing.

This expansion includes 30 new market cards.

Belongs to the Runebound Series.

Expands:

    Runebound (Second Edition)

title: eMemo Art & Architecture
description: eMemo memory matching games are fascinating and educational memory-challenging games that explore the world. eMemo games stimulate and enhance the memory while teaching about Geography, Architecture, Design and History. The theme of all eMemo games is that they play similarly to a traditional memory game, except that instead of matching two identical images, eMemo requires players to match a photo with a zoomed-in section of that same photo.

title: A Little Golden Book I SEE YOU! Game
description:
From the publisher:

Shy Little Kitten and friends want to play Peek-a-boo, I See You!, with your child. Place a character card in a sleeve and insert screens that progressively reveal more of the picture. Can you guess who's there?

title: Thomas Tic Tac Toe Game
types: Abstract Strategy Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Trains
description:
From the publisher:

Thomas, Percy, Mavis and James are racing to see who can make three in a row! Rules for different skill-levels of play.

Contents: Game board, 20 engine tiles, instruction sheet for different skill-levels of play

title: Monopoly: Japan
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description: The colour sets to collect are major cities around Japan. Instead of railway stations, there are complete railways. This seems to be a fairly straight translation of the more well-known game.

title: Monopoly: Roppongi Hills
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
Roppongi Hills is a huge residential/business area in Tokyo that was opened in 2003. It includes a television station, galleries and museums, and very tall office towers. Instead of houses there are kiosks, and hotels are bigger retail shops ... and if you build enough shops, you get to build a Mori Tower.

(Mori was the businessman who spent billions buying up the land over a couple of decades - including the Australian Embassy, which was in a historic building which had an even more historic and beautiful garden.)

title: Monopoly: Ultraman
types: Economic Movies / TV / Radio theme Negotiation Science Fiction
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
Ultraman is a creation of the 1960s and a huge part of popular Japanese culture. Various incarnations of Ultraman battle an assortment of weird monsters.
   The Ultraman Monopoly edition has Ultrapods instead of houses and Ultratowers instead of hotels.

title: StapleWars
description:
From the designer:

The StapleWars board game is a game which combines action games, which involve moving parts (along the lines of Mousetrap or Weapons of War) and strategy games, which involve building and conquering, (like Risk or Axis and Allies) in one. All units and structures are made out of HEAVY DUTY staples, which can be found at any hardware store. Staplewars plays like a strategy game... until it is time to attack. Ammunition staples are flicked at units and structures, and if the units or structures are knocked down, they are destroyed! The purpose of this page is to encourage people to play this exciting game, to give people instructions for their own StapleWars arenas and sets, and to clarify information about this exciting new game. Give it a try, it is a lot of fun!

title: The Great Muppet Caper Game
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
From the rules:

Join KERMIT THE FROG, FOZZIE BEAR, MISS PIGGY and THE GREAT GONZO on a wild romp through the streets of London. Your favorite Muppet friends are in search of four very hard-to-capture thieves who are trying to steal a legendary jewel called the Baseball Diamond. Join the Muppets on their adventure. If you're the first player to catch the four thieves and save the Baseball Diamond, you'll wind the game.

Here's some of the fun you'll have...take a cab and a bus, both of which are controlled by hidden wheels underneath the gameboard...be careful, though...if you spin the wheel too much or too little, you'll miss your bus or fail to hail a cab! Visit the Dubonnet Club with its mysterious spinning room and the Mallory Gallery where the Baseball Diamond is hidden. To enter the Gallery, you must make a precarious climb up the side of the Gallery Building. Then before you can save the jewel, you must be sure you own four different Thief cards. If you own the four cards, turn the hidden dial in the Gallery hoping that the jewel will be set free and come rolling out the front door of the Gallery (the jewel will be dislodged only when this hidden dial is spun a certain number of times). The player who frees the jewel from its hiding place wins the game. Have fun!

title: Motala Strom
description:
Motala Strom is a unique 1-dimensional abstract strategy game where one tries to capture all of the opposing pieces, or having your very last piece standing in your home base.  The board consists simply of 9 spaces.  The game is named after a river in Sweden.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Coronation Street
description:
A trivia board game based on the popular UK ITV Soap Coronation Street.

Features a board that looks like the famous street and includes a who's who booklet.

title: Land Rover
description:
A children's game which is effectively a promotional item for Land Rover cars. The game is a simple roll and move game similar to Snakes and Ladders.  It comes with a laminated board, a set of rules, and a cut-out spinner and pieces.

The winner is the first player to reach the finish on an off road track, but you have to beware of hazards along the way, such as broken fan belts, mud, etc.

title: Colpevole!
description:
A Clue-style game.

One of the players plays the guilty party (Colpevole) and knows the story (there are 40 different scenarios). All the other players have to find out the motives and dynamics of the murder.

title: CyborGladiators
description:
Kidnapped from your home world by decadent aliens, you have been transformed into a deadly cyborg warrior battling in star-crossed arenas for survival, glory, and, just perhaps, your freedom. You are one of the CyborGladiators!

This fast, fun, and furious tabletop fighting game includes rules for creating your own cyborgs with more than 30 unique cybernetic implants, earning glory in careers mode, and building an endless variety of arenas filled with dangers such as flamethrowers and pools of boiling acid for exceptional replay value. Featuring a cover by Bart Willard and interior art by Bart Willard and Richard Cox, the game includes a cardstock sheet of foldable color cyborg figures or you can play using your own action figures or miniatures. Ages 13 and up, no game master required

Expanded by:

    Invincible

title: Home Run Baseball Challenge
description: Home Run Baseball Challenge is a two player baseball game where pitches, hits and fielding are determined by the rolls of custom dice and plays are planned using field action strategy cards.

title: The Simpsons Horror Show
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
The story is short: You move one of five well known characters from Springfield (Homer, Bart, Lisa, Flanders or Krusty) through the Springfield cemetery. The player who first finds three treasures is the winner.

It's possible to transform into a zombie or to steal treasures from your opponent.

Every character has two different attributes (normal and zombie). For example: Homer can move walls as a zombie and walk through walls when he is normal.

title: Thomas' Station Stop Matching Game
types: Children's Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Trains
description: A memory variant with pictures of Thomas the Tank Engine and friends.  Three different games are included: Station Stop Matching Game, Thomas  Friends Memory Game and Sir Topham Hatt's What's Missing? Memory Game.

title: Serata in Giallo: Il Mistero del Nuraghe
description:
Serata in Giallo (Evening of Mystery) is the premier collection of murder mystery games to appear in Italy. The players are invited to an Evening of Mystery, during the course of which each player enacts the role of one of the protagonists of the event. The games unfold in acts with a theatrical flavor, and the game may or may not include an investigation team.

Il Mistero del Nuraghe (The Mystery of the Nuraghe)

The nuraghe, as they are known, are mysterious ancient stone buildings that are found only in Sardinia
Andrea Centofanti had been fine-tuning his personal theory that held that the nuraghe were none other than the birthplace of fire. In order to verify his theory, he had decided to go to Sardinia to live for a few weeks inside a nuraghe.
     Four other people went with him, with the idea of spending a vacation that was a bit outside of the ordinarywithout some of the comforts of home and without electric power.
     They thought they had prepared for everything, but none of them had counted on the tragedy that soon befalls them.  Angelo Corsini, one of the members of the expedition, dies in the blaze that he himself mysteriously creates in the nuraghe where he sleeps!

PlaceSardinia (Italy)

Time1985

CharactersFive (3 men and 2 women):

Donatella Carta:  30-year-old professional assistant to a Milanese fashion designer. Girlfriend of Andrea Centofanti.

Andrea Centofanti: 35-year-old archaeologist. He is the boyfriend of Donatella Carta.

Fanny Corsini: 22-year-old aspiring actress. She is the girlfriend of Giovanni Lo Presti.

Giovanni Lo Presti: 25-year-old medical student. Fannys boyfriend.

Marisa Piccoli: 38-year-old athlete and actress. Married to a rich building contractor from Milan.

title: Serata in Giallo: Luna di Miele sul Nilo
Dragon Booster Trading Card Game
types: Card Game Collectible Components Fantasy Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description:
A CCG based on racing and fighting dragons.

From the website:

Dragon City is a place where the different colors of dragon are bred for sport, profit and industrial use. Different colors of draconium are purified and machined into various forms of gear and accessories designed to enhance dragon power. Dragon City is the place where the power struggles of the planet are played out on the vast Elite Class racing tracks. Here, mighty racers like modern day gladiators battle in 200 mile-per-hour competitions using glowing draconium gear and dragon energy in fierce hand to hand and dragon versus dragon struggles. In the deeper parts of the city, teens race and battle on the All City Racing Circuit hoping for a shot at the big time. Below in the depths, in a place called Squires End, dangerous Down City Crews wait, like street gangs, trying to fight their way up, not realizing that they are the remnants of the original empires that caused the first dragon-human war.

title: Malhação
description: In Malhao, players try to discover each other preferences. Each one writes down their favorite song, movie, travel spot, etc. Then players arrange meetings on the board and exchange confidences. Some places have special powers, and each player can lie three times during the game, so knowing whether to trust or not an information is very important.

title: Twin Treasures
description:
From the back of the box:

There's a bounty of learning contained in this high seas memory game where children match objects hidden in an adventurous tropical environment.

title: Cars, Boats & Trains
description:
From the box:

A domino game.  In this simple game of observation, children lay brightly colored picture cards of cars, boats, trains, fire engines and helicopters on the table, next to other cards that show the same picture.  The first player to get rid of all his or her cards is the winner.

Ages 3 - 6

title: Alapo
description:
Alapo is a strategy game. Each player owns twelve abstract pieces, two each of six different kinds. Round pieces move in any of the eight directions on the 6 by 6 board; square pieces move only orthogonally and triangular pieces only diagonally. Large pieces move any distance, small pieces only one field per turn. 
Opponent pieces can be eliminated by moving onto their position. The goal is to reach the opponent's base line with one of your pieces without the opponent being able to eliminate your piece in his/her next move.

title: Colossus
description:
Bonus game included in Dragon Magazine #271.

Through Research, Development, and Fighting, you must improve your creature until he has a 6 or more in each of his body areas - 2 arms, 2 legs, heart and head.

Equipment: Pencil and Paper, six 6-sided dice, at least five 8-sided dice.

From the intro paragraph:

In Colossus, each player is a mad scientist building some sort of creature.  Perhaps it's a stone golem, perhaps it's a wicker man, perhaps it's a plain old laser-shootin' butt-kickin' giant robot.  Whatever the details, you're building them, and you like to make them fight.

title: Abandon Ship!
description:
Bonus game from Dragon Magazine #273.

Cards can be discarded or used in a battle. When the draw deck is empty, the ship sinks, and there is a showdown to see who ends up in which lifeboat. Points are totaled for the hand, and multiple hands add up to a game target of 200.

A variation for 6-8 players and two decks is included.

Components are the rules and a battle mat depicting the pirate ship and lifeboats. Illustrations by John Kovalic.

From the intro paragraph:

The rats are long gone, but you're still here. You and your greedy pirate pals are hustling around the deck of a sinking pirate ship, trying to scoop up as much treasure as you can hold. You've got to have a little treasure to buy your way into a lifeboat, and the best lifeboats are the ones with the most treasure in them. It's kind of complicated. Then again, maybe you're just not very smart.

title: Victory: The Blocks of War – Elite Blocksets
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
The Elite blocksets for Victory: The Blocks of War add additional unit types, and are available in the same player colors as the base game and expansions. Red and blue are the original colors, but green, orange, gray, and black are also available. Note that each color of elite blockset is sold separately, so you'll need at least two elite sets (presumably a red elite, and a blue elite set each to start with) in order to allow play with elite units.

Like the original game's 50 units per side, each Elite blockset has 50 block units, but in 12 new unit types: elite fighters, torpedo bombers, medium bombers, destroyers, cruisers, elite armor, artillery, mechanized, mountain, engineers, marines, supply and resource units.

Expands:

    Victory:  The Blocks of War

title: Victory: The Blocks of War – Additional Blocksets
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Without expansion, Victory is a two-player game. The regular expansion blocksets for Victory each contain 50 wooden block units in any of 6 available colors: the red and blue of the base game, or orange, green, gray or black. Expansion blocksets come with a few simple additional rules for multi-player games.

Expands:

    Victory:  The Blocks of War

title: Victory: The Blocks of War – Logistics Set
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
The Logistics set adds factories and other logistical issues to Victory.

Land, sea and air units each have their own factories, replacing the generic city production points of the standard game. Airfields can now be built, allowing air units to land even without a city or town. Mulberries are temporary ports that can be built by Marines. A storm affects a cluster of seven hexes and moves randomly each turn, preventing unit movement. All the logistics installations can be attacked and damaged or even destroyed, as can now bridges and canals, and appropriate markers are provided.

Expands:

    Victory:  The Blocks of War

title: Grafolampo
description:
From the rules:

Grafolampo is a new, enthralling and instructive amusement, which has been invented for intelligent boys and for adults who are keen on puzzles.

Grafolampo is a competing cross-word, which leaves no ground to fortune but assigns victory to the promptest and shrewdest player.

The box includes:
4 game boards
300 letter cards
1 card distributor

title: Crazy Ates
description:
From the publisher:

Tacos, spaghetti, and steak with ice cream.  Lay down cards that match either the tasty foods or cool colors.  No matching card?  Play a wild crazy #8 and name a new color!  With a bit of strategy and a pinch of luck, the first player to get rid of their cards wins!

A SimplyFun version of the card game Crazy Eights, using oversized cards with engaging artwork depicting various foods (instead of standard card suits). Ideal for play dates and parties.

title: Chums
description:
Fish love to be with their friends!  Can you bring all the Chums back together?  Ask others for cards by number or go fishing to try and catch a pair of matching Chums.  The player with the most pairs at the end of the game wins.

A SimplyFun version of the card game Go Fish.  Cards depict colorful fish.

title: Texas Politicos
description:
A game of MONEY, POWER, and FUN For the OFFICALs and UNOFFICALS in and out fo the great state off TEXAS!

Dedicated to the FIGHTIN' and FUN LOVIN' members fo the TEXAS LEGISLATURE  (direct quote from box cover)

A satirical game about collecting enough votes and cash to achieve office in Texas.  The bank in Sharpstown plays banker under the table and from a brown bag, while another player (the election judge from Duvall County) tracks the winning conditions.  The rule sheet is half a page long, and does not include any instructions other than setting up and winning the game.  However, it appears to be a simple roll the dice, react to square landed on game while the players tour a linear board (the only path is to follow the outline of the state) until they can get enough votes and cash to reach the middle.

title: Kubla's Gambol
description:
Components:

7 KublaCoins with values 1-7 
Two sets of 10 KublaCards with values 1-10

Game Idea:

Both players start with one set of KublaCards and play them alternately next to one of the KublaCoins. When all cards have been played, the player with the higher total power next to it, controls the coin. The player with the higher total value of controlled coins wins the game.

This was given to attendees of KublaCon 2005.

title: Off to See the Wizard
types: Dice Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Racing
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Off to See the Wizard Game - based on the animated TV series.

Players assume the roles of Dorothy and her friends, competing with each other, trying to capture the Witch and bring her to the Wizard.

The Game is played in two parts. The first part consists of chasing and capturing the Witch.

Player pieces travel on red circles and the Witch disc travels on yellow triangles. If a player piece and the Witch disc coincide on a black square the player captures the Witch.

The second part is getting the Witch to the Wizard.

The player with the Witch disc tries to get it to the Wizard while chased by the other players.

The Witch may exchange hands several times before one player succeeds in getting her to the Wizard to win the game.

Components:

- 5 die-cut markers with stands representing Dorothy, Toto, the Lion, the Tin Woodsman and the Scarecrow.

- 2 six-sided dice (1 red  1 white).

- 1 Witch disc.

- Playing board.

- Two-part box.

title: Mirror Mania
description:
Which Reflection Goes Which Direction? You Make the Connection!

At the start of the game, a random maze of Mirror Blocks is set up on the board.  Players use their spatial relations skills to try to predict various paths through the maze in an attempt to find the highest-scoring path.

In the simplest version of the game, the player is allowed to see the arrows on top of the Mirror Blocks to find scoring paths that lead to Target Pegs.  The instructions also include optional rules to increase the difficulty of game-play for more expert players.  Players can move or rotate a Mirror Block to increase their score or to try to block their opponent.

The player places the View Cube at the beginning of a selected path.  They then place their finger on the Target Peg that they think is at the end of the path.  The player looks down into the View Cube.  If the predicted Peg is seen, the player scores by adding the values of the Mirror Blocks and the Target Peg to their existing score.  If the selected Target Peg is not correct, the player scores nothing

Mirror Mania is a fun and relatively quick-playing game, and the Day-Glo hot pink, electric yellow, and fire orange Mirror Cubes are a retro blast!

title: Mirror Mania
description:
Take the driver's seat in this sensational, brain-teasing game! Just follow the road from start to finish. Sounds simplebut can it be done using a reflected image? Whether alone, with friends, or at a party, Mirror Mania is sure to bring hours of fun, laughter and excitement.

Contents: Easy-to-Assemble Game Tray, Play sheets, 2 Felt Tip Pens, Instruction Sheet.

Follow the simple instructions for the easy-to-assemble game tray. Choose a play sheet and pen. Now you're ready to get behind the wheel! Observe the reflected image through the eye holes on the viewer panel. Place a pen at Start and goOops! Stay on the road! Fun to do, hilarious to watch. The eyes see an image the hand won't follow. Your mind says go, but your hand says no!

title: Football Dice
description:
NFL Football simulation. Three colored dice for offense. Two more colored dice for special actions.

Roll the dice and see if you scored a touchdown or not.

title: Schreck lass nach!
description: The aim of the game is to invite nice relatives to your family feast, but watch out for the nasty ones (such as your mother in law)!

title: Salta
description:
Two players sit opposite a 1010 checkered board with a light square in the lower right. Each player has 15 unique pieces in his own color, arranged on the dark squares of the nearest three ranks. From left to right, the pieces are one through five stars (first rank), moons (second rank) and suns (third rank).

The pieces move one square diagonally in any direction to a vacant square, or must leap over one opposing piece (only opposing pieces, but without capture - there are no captures in Salta) if the square immediately beyond is vacant. Only one jump is made (no chain jumping), and missed opportunities to jump may be forced by the opponent, although a player is free to choose among several available jumps. Blockading all of the opposing pieces is not allowed, although some may be temporarily blocked as long as the opponent still has a legal move.

The goal is to be the first player to move all of his pieces as into the starting places of the corresponding opposing piece. That is, reading from right to left, the goal position is one through five stars (tenth rank), one through five moons (ninth rank) and one through five suns (eighth rank). The player first achieving this position wins by as many points as the number of moves opponent would need to achieve his goal position.

If neither player reaches the goal position by the time 120 moves have been made by each player, the score is calculated as the difference between the number of moves each player would need to reach the goal position, as if the board were clear of opposing pieces.

Online Play


     http://www.iggamecenter.com/ - igGameCenter (real-time)

title: The Comical Game of Who?
description:
This game includes 60 cards; each with an answer on the top, number in the middle and a question on the bottom.

The cards bearing uneven numbers are divided among the men or boys. The even numbers are divided among the ladies or girls.

The player holding Number One card begins the game by reading the question on that card.

The player holding the Number Two card reads reads the answer at the top, getting up and making a courtesy as she does so. She then reads her question at the foot of the card, and Number Three reads his answer, standing up and bowing as he does so.

Proceed thus until all the cards are read. The answer to the question on card Number Sixty being read by Number One.

Per the rules: The fun caused by the ridiculous questions and answers can be imagined when the game is played by a lively company.

title: Donald Duck Flips His Lid
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Using two Donald Ducks, you flip cone shaped pieces to score on a numbered board...  Think Tiddly Winks meets Disney marketing.

title: Think Twice
description:
Originally published in GAMES Magazine in May 1986, Think Twice is a quick and light pencil and paper game for 2 players.

Sid Sackson invented this easy to learn game that involves shading spaces on two grids in an attempt to score the most points.

title: Archimedes
description:
Originally published in the July 1988 issue of GAMES Magazine, Archimedes is a nautical battle game for 2 players.

Archimedes can be played with a standard checkers set. The board is an 88 grid, and each player has 12 ships represented by checkers of one color.  The object of the game is to capture opponent's ships in an attempt to land on the enemy's home port.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Monopoly: Edição Sporting
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingDice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos ό (alone or single) + polein ῖ (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is a Monopoly edition dedicated to one of the best Portuguese football (soccer) teams.

title: Perry Rhodan Sammelkartenspiel
types: Card Game Collectible Components Novel-based Science Fiction
description:
This German Trading Card Game is based on the weekly science fiction series Perry Rhodan. You you can play over the story from about the first 100 novellas issued. The game is broken up in different phases which you can play separately or one after another for a very long game. The phases with different backsides are:

Phase I: Die Dritte Macht (The Third Power, 1996)
Phase II/III: Topsider  Springer (1996)
Phase IV: Vorsto nach Arkon (Approach to Arkon, 1997)
Phase V: Atlan  Arkon (2003)

Fanpro canceled the game in 1998. Finally Between The Stars (a company founded by fans of the game) took over and released phase V in 2003.

The player with the most victory points wins this complex game. You get victory points for completing phases and for completing side plots. Only after a phase is completed the players can draw cards from the next phase (you need separate decks for each phase you will play).

The cards show different planets, star systems, mutants with psi-talents, other persons, troops, spaceships, fleets, accessories, event cards and galactic riddles. There is also an action card deck to randomize the fights someway.

Every card can be Pro, Anti, or both (Dual). In a game you have to play two sides at the same time, the pro-side (the good guys) and the anti-side (the bad boys). After you have built up your fleets and armies (you normally hide them below other cards) you fight space fights and invasions on enemy planets: With your anti-side you attack the pro-sides of your opponents, and with your pro-side you damage their anti-sides.

title: Piquet: Archon II
types: Ancient Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame
description:
Refight 3000 years of history covered by Archon 2nd Edition. Can you decisively change history by defeating Alexander the Great, Caesar, or Hannibal? Will the Greeks throw back the Persians or will Xerxes reign supreme? Fight through the centuries of East Asian warfare, or try your hand at the mysterious armies of Central America. Archon 2nd edition has been re-worked and re-tooled including extensive Campaign Musters. Be a leader, not a follower, and take charge of history!

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet: Cartouche
types: American Revolutionary War Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame
description:
Cartouche is an eighteenth century supplement for the Piquet miniatures rules.  It covers such conflicts as the Wars of Marlborough, Seven Years War, and the American Revolutionary War.

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet: Les Grognards
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Napoleonic Wargame
description:
Les Grognards 2nd Edition includes rules for 3 different game scales: Company scale (basic infantry unit is a company), Battalion scale (basic infantry unit is a battalion), and Grand Tactical scale (basic infantry unit is a brigade or regiment).  Using the game scales in Les Grognards 2nd Edition, small actions from a few companies up to multiple Corps  are possible.  The three game scales allow experimentation with games of different scopes and scales  with existing troops and mounting systems.  All three scales use the same basing system; there is no need for rebasing.

Les Grognards 2nd Edition also includes Horizon Movement rules for the Battalion and Grand Tactical scale games.  Horizon Movement eliminates virtually all measuring for movement.  Horizon movement allows units to move based on the tabletop terrain and enemy unit's positions.  Rather than measuring moves in small increments, moves are  made based on limiting terrain or tactical situations.  The result is a game that features dynamic, flowing movement rather than the same moves broken down into small increments as in standard measured movement games.

Les Grognards 2nd edition features completely new material, incorporating 5 sets of rules (Company scale, Battalion scale, Grand Tactical scale, Horizon Movement Battalion scale, Horizon Movement Grand Tactical scale) and 37 different army lists.  The new lists allow the  unique characteristics of a wide variety of  armies to be represented on the tabletop.  The armies covered in Les Grognards 2nd Edition include:

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet: Hallowed Ground
description:
The 2nd Edition of Hallowed Ground has been greatly expanded to cover additional periods, as well as providing rules for new game scales.  Hallowed Ground, 2nd Edition, provides three complete rule sets that cover the 19th century period from the Texas Revolution through the Russo-Turkish War.  Periods covered in Hallowed Ground 2nd Edition include:

The Mexican Wars  (Texas War of Independence, Mexican-American War)

The Wars in India  (Sikh Wars, Indian Mutiny)

The Russian Wars  (Crimean War, Russo-Turkish War)

The Taiping Rebellion

The Risorgimento (1848-49, 1859)

The Great Paraguayan War

The Wars of German Unification (1866 Austro-Prussian War, 1870 Franco-Prussian War)

The American Civil War

Three scales of game are introduced in Hallowed Ground 2nd Edition - the Company Scale game, the Battalion Scale game, and the Grand Tactical Scale game.  The Company game which uses the company as the standard infantry game unit gives you the chance to be a battalion or a brigade commander in the thick of battle;  the Battalion game uses battalions as the standard infantry game unit - players can easily command a division on the tabletop.  The Grand Tactical game uses the infantry regiment as the standard infantry game unit - allowing players to command Corps on the tabletop.  The variety of wars, battles, and skirmishes throughout the period covered by Hallowed Ground, 2nd Edition requires rules that can cover engagements of all sizes.  You can use Hallowed Ground to play a skirmish between Texans and Mexicans in 1836 up to the large battles of the American Civil War and Franco-Prussian War.

Specific sequence deck compositions and army ratings for each period and army, combined with three unique sets of rules that cover different scale games, gives Hallowed Ground 2nd Edition unparalleled flexibility in gaming the vast array of conflicts of the 19th century.

title: Piquet: Din of Battle
types: American Indian Wars Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame
description:
Din of Battle covers the conflicts between the colonial powers of the 19th century and the native peoples of their intended colonies.

These rules plead no cause - most of the causes for which these past warriors fought are long ago gone. In many cases the winners would be surprised if they returned today to view modern South Africa, Egypt, China, or Morocco. So what these rules celebrate is the honor and bravery of men who fought for lost reasons in remote and alien lands and the courage of men who attempted to save a doomed and, in some cases, brutish way of life.

It also commemorates some of the kindest, meanest, most charitable, most selfish, bravest, most craven, brightest and most incorrigibly ignorant people that have ever walked the earth: the Victorian on a mission, the Calif with murder in his heart, the merciless Zulu, the totally mad Gordon confronting the equally mad Mahdi. What color! What excitement! This is the era of the mysteries of the Nile's source, or the hidden interior of Peking's Imperial City!

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet: Point of Attack II – The Blitzkrieg
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
The Blitzkrieg is unique in the Piquet system in that it has three different game scales included.  The different game scales allow for a wide variety of scenarios, game sizes, and game types.

The Game Scale Rules section includes unique rules for each of the three scale games included in the The Blitzkrieg game supplement (Squad, Platoon, and Battalion).  Each game scale has its own Weapon Adjustment Table, game play reference sheet, quick rating BDV Tables, and organizational information.

This allows a gamers to play everything from a vicious, house-to-house skirmish combat to a multi-division, multi-day battle on the plains of Russia.  The movement, combat, and morale sections of the rules were deliberately developed to fit the zoom concept mentioned in the original Piquet rules.  By using a few unique rules, and different troop ratings, a gamer can easily move between the three scales.  The basic rule mechanics are the same, only the details change.  The Squad scale game is new with this version of the rules.  It allows for large skirmish actions, instead of the small, highly individually personalized game typical of skirmish rules.  The Squad game allows skirmish detail in games with a platoon or more of infantry on a side.   The detail players enjoy in skirmish games is still there, but it is imbedded in the game system.  As an example, it would be very easy to just add rules to the basic rule skeleton to handle unique cases.  Consider armor in a skirmish game.   Obviously, there is a difference in the combat readiness of a tank that is buttoned up compared to one which is just moving down a road.  The Squad game easily handles this difference by requiring that vehicles be in a declared status - either march or deployed.  March status indicates a tank or vehicle that is not combat ready, but is primarily intent on moving rapidly.  Deployed status indicates a tank or vehicles that is tactically aware prepared for the uncertainties of the battlefield.

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet: Anchor of Faith
description:
Anchor of Faith warfare in the seventeenth century.  At the beginning of the seventeenth century armies deployed in large units comprising many thousands of men. Firepower, while important, was still subordinate to shock of contact and the use of pole arm weapons. The period can be characterized: - The introduction of smaller formations, reduction in the use of pike and increased reliance on firepower and the development of linear tactics. Anchor of Faith allows the gamer to recreate the battles and tactics of this colorful period.

Anchor of Faith covers warfare in Europe and the fringe nations in the Middle East and Asia. The supplement introduces new rule mechanisms, formation types and army generation tables particular to the period 1600 to 1690. It combines the main rules that allow battles to be played at a regimental scale, and a sub set of rules, the Twelve Apostles, for fighting smaller actions with units typically representing a few companies of infantry or troops of cavalry. The latter being particularly useful for fighting large English Civil War skirmishes.

Anchor of Faith includes a range of new formations definitions including tercios, Swedish brigade, deep line, caracole cavalry, commanded shot, galloper cavalry and war wagons. New period rule mechanisms are introduced to mirror both the abilities and shortcomings of the troops of this era. New rules include revised pursuit rules, morale points by command and new fire rules to reflect the low effect of musketry and the importance of  push of pike in deciding the outcome of engagements.  Many of the new ideas and mechanisms can be used in other Piquet periods.

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet: Band of Brothers
types: Expansion for Base-game Medieval Miniatures Wargame
description:
From the designer:

Band of Brothers was a pleasant surprise for me as I found my interest in the period became greater the longer I worked on this supplement.  If one is looking for a variety of unit types, tactical doctrine, or weaponry, medieval/renaissance warfare has much to offer.  If one wants colorful dress and dramatic costumes, then the Landtsknecht and the Ottoman Janissaries are but a few of the many available troops.   Even more appealing is that this is a period of fascinating transitions in the practice of warfare.

Two of the greatest transitional effects are the introduction and growing effectiveness of gunpowder weapons, both in the form of artillery, as well as personal weapons, and the ability for nations to field semi-national armies.  The creation of these larger forces and their supply was a necessary social foundation for the Military Revolution that allowed the great armies of the 17th century and later.

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Grand Piquet
description:
Grand Piquet 2nd Edition - Many changes were made for this new edition of Grand Piquet.  The Army commander now plays a more pivotal role in the command and control of a Corps.  These formations no longer move whenever or wherever they wish.    A D12 is now the basis for all initiative rolls, which effectively eliminates the need for phases, as well as mitigates the wild swings in initiative.    The Sequence decks have been radically altered. Now there are Action cards, by type of unit [e.g. Infantry Action card], whereby there is much greater flexibility in actions taken by units.  Also, the basic Sequence deck is now made up of 20 cards, instead of 28.  The combat system is based primarily on Target type, so there are fewer modifiers to calculate. The basic concept of chipping within the morale system is intact, yet there is no need to keep track of morale chips. Unit / sub unit designations are determined by numbers of men and not by regiment.  Players determine the size and make up of a unit, thereby effectively tailoring each Command Group to a particular situation or task.  These are but a few of the changes that have been made. 
It is hoped that this new edition will keep the flavor and excitement of the original, while improving the mechanics, which will give a more fluid, less static feel to the game.  One final comment that deserves remembering:  Piquet is an innovative system designed to give players the opportunity to make command decisions based upon finite resources.

title: Piquet: Point of Attack – Barrage
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War I
description:
BARRAGE is a rules set designed to re-fight battles during the period of 1904 - 1935. Not only is the Great War (1914 - 1918) covered in detail, so is the Russo-Japanese War (1904 - 1905), Russian Civil War (1917 - 1921), and the Russo-Polish War (1919 - 1920). Typical unit sizes are infantry companies, cavalry squadrons, machine gun platoons, and artillery batteries. A player would generally command either a regiment or a brigade of soldiers.

The World War One portion of the rules covers the following: African, Balkan, Egypt  Palestine, Eastern, Italian, Mesopotamian, and Western fronts. The Tables of Organization  Equipment have detailed information for 16 different nations. The rules are designed to re-fight the open warfare of the early part of the WWI along with the more static trench battles later in the war. Can you lead your troops in a successful offensive?

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet: Forgotten Heroes
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Vietnam War Wargame
description:
Forgotten Heroes provides a complete package to allow you to recreate the Vietnam War.  The rules will work equally well for those who want to depict the early Search and Destroy days of the war against the VC and for those who want to recreate the desperate days of the 1975 collapse.  In general, the Vietnam War was fought at the company level, with the platoon of 2 - 4 squads (representing anywhere from 20 to over 40 men) being the basic maneuver element.  Previously, this scale has been neglect by most miniatures rules dealing with the Vietnam War, which have focused on the individual's perspective.  Forgotten Heroes enables the you to command a full infantry company (of 3 - 4 platoons) or more, and the accompanying assets, in a way no other Vietnam War era rules set has done before.  It is only in this Scale that the gamer can really recreate the village sweeps, helicopter insertions into hot LZs, assaults on bunker complexes, VC convoy ambushes, riverine actions, and fire base assaults, that typified the major actions of this conflict.

Forgotten Heroes includes rules for the unique aspects of the Vietnam War.  These rules include the following: VC/NVA tunnel systems, riverine craft, civilians, caches and stores, rules of engagement, booby traps, ground surveillance radar, command detonated mines, night combat effects, and many more.  Forgotten Heroes also includes special event cards that can be added to the normal sequence decks, such as Chieu Hoi, DiDi Mau, General Visits Front, Hearts and Minds, Media Circus, the dreaded FUBAR, and more.

Forgotten Heroes bas been designed to be as accessible as possible to both a newcomer to the Vietnam War and he gaming veteran.  The rules include information on the varied equipment used in the war and full TOEs for the US Army, US Marine Crops, ARVN, Australians, Viet Cong, and NVA.  Two introductory scenarios are included, as a bonus supplement, rules are provided for the First Indochina War including sequence decks, equipment and weapon lists, and TO Es for the French and Viet Minh.

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet:  Theater of War
description:
Theater of War generates linked, tactical tabletop games in a larger strategic setting. Theater of War is designed to be used with miniature collections of existing, fixed sizes (no more collecting and painting forces for the next game just in order to meet the order of battle requirements!) while providing an entertaining background for a campaign with a definitive conclusion. Theater of War provides a system for determining tactical scenarios, based on decisions made by the campaign players. Theater of War includes rules for organizing campaigns in all of the periods covered by the Piquet rule system.

Theater of War vividly represents the fog and friction of war, modeled by sequence decks and initiative rolls. Battle Hands made up of Sequence cards are used to move from the campaign map to the tabletop. Battle hands determine what type of tabletop battle will be fought, as well as any particular advantages (relative army sizes, terrain, set-up) that will exist.  This combination and interplay of Battle Hands is the heart and soul of Theatre of War.  It allows a campaign to be fought without an umpire making rulings about force strengths and scenario definition, as well as providing for pre-battle maneuvering as both sides attempt to gain an advantage. Theatre of War places the gamer in the predicament of not knowing for sure what the tabletop game will hold - that is, not knowing until they've committed and played their cards!

Theatre of War is designed to provide a campaign framework for Piquet tabletop miniature games.  In order to play Theatre of War, both the Piquet master rules and the period supplement in which the campaign is set are required.

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Piquet: Jump or Burn
types: Aviation / Flight Miniatures Wargame World War I
description:
Jump or Burn is an exciting new rule system for fighting World War One aerial dogfights using miniature aircraft. Games are ideally suited for two or more players each controlling a single aircraft.  These rules have a unique unpredictable turn sequence that does away with move by move order writing and makes dogfights fast and furious. Jump or Burn is easy to learn, fast to play, but hard to master.

Jump or Burn is a stand-alone product published under the Piquet banner. Although it shares the concepts of cards and dice adjustment mechanisms it does not require Piquet Master Rules to play.

Goggles on, chocks away, and try to get back in time for tea and medals.

title: Piquet: PKowboys
types: American West Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame
description:
Pkowboys is intended to represent skirmish combat between rival gangs (outlaws, lawmen, gunslingers, and townsfolk) in the American West between 1860 and 1900.  Players represent the leaders of different gangs, or in large battles a player may act as the leader of multiple gangs.

Pkowboys does not use the standard Piquet initiative system.  Instead, We have developed a fast an furious method to handle individual figure movement and action on the tabletop.

Here are the principles behind the design of Pkowboys.

Western combat was quick and decisive.    Gun battles lasted minutes or seconds. Any shot has the chance of being lethal. Many gunfighters lost their nerve and fled when under fire. Leadership was as important with gangs of outlaws or lawmen as it was in large battles. The Jesse James/Wild Bill Hickock Theory:  being unlucky is a bad thing no matter how good you are. Gunfight tactics in a nutshell:  move into a good position and shoot like mad.

Saddle up pardner and fire away!!!!!

Expands:

    Piquet

title: Skeletons in the Closet
description: Rather than using rote memorization, put an exciting new spin on learning the names, location, and relationships of the major bones in the human body (skull, pelvis, tibia, rib cage and more). First player to assemble their skeleton in the closet wins. Bones are labeled with letters to help identify each bone and assemble the skeleton faster. Six challenging games with varying levels of difficulty. Includes 50 True/False Fun Bone Facts, 10 milk cartons, 30 closet cards, closet box, four plastic skeleton models, four skeleton boards, game guide, and spinner.

title: Ambition 5000
description: Ambition 5000 is a dice game where you try to get to 5000 points. It uses 3 special dice marked A, P, D, 50 or 100. Special rules allow for surprising turns of events.

title: Rodeo, The Wild West Game
description: Rodeo is a family game where players participate in up to five different rodeo events (bulldogging, calf roping, bull riding, etc.).  Action is controlled with a spinner, so luck is usually the governor of outcome.  But so is the selection of a bull when you're riding. A fun game for the family.

title: Coupez !
description:
The gameboard represents a movie theater. You advance from seat to seat by answering questions and solving riddles correctly. The first player to reach the screen wins the game.

The game comes with 500 questions and is packaged in a wooden box.

title: Generatorb
description:
Generatorb is a game of jumping and capturing where you attempt to get one of your own pieces in your opponent's generator square.

Generatorb is played on a basic 88 square board (a checkers or chess board works great) that is turned sideways so the squares become diamonds. The playing pieces, called Orbs, should be flat disks that can be stacked (red and black checkers are great). You'll need 24 Orbs for each player.

Rules: http://www.tjgames.com/genrule.html

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Peon
description: Try to move up the ladder in medieval society, from the lowliest peon to the loftiest king... but beware: this ladder goes both ways.

title: Looney Bin
description: Compete to identify the zany mental ailments of your teammates -- without letting the other side in on your diagnosis. Fantastic game for parties, mixers, and long road trips.

title: c-jump Computer Programming Board Game
mechanisms: Dice RollingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Discover the fundamentals of computer programming by playing a board game! c-jump helps children to learn basics of programming languages, such as C, C++ and Java.

The game teaches basic commands of a programming language, such as if, else, switch, and introduces variable x concept.

Skiers and snowboarders line up at the start location and race along the ski trails. Spaces on the board show statements of programming language. First player to move all skiers past the finish line is the winner.

Players calculate number of steps in the move, including addition, subtraction, division, and multiplication of small numbers. The game helps to develop understanding of a complete computer program, formed by logical sequences of commands.

title: Marvel Super Heroes Game
types: Children's Game Comic Book / Strip Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: A roll-and-move kids' game where players try to hire super heroes onto their team and capture super villains.  Features traditional Marvel super heroes like Spider-man and Hulk as well as X-Men.  Ages 6 and up

title: 100 Plus
description: A ladder-type trick-taking game in which the object of the game is for players to first make 100 points by taking ten tricks of ten points each.  Second is to make whatever number appears on the randomly-drawn plus number disk, thus making 100 plus.  The first player to do this wins.

title: Somewhere in the Rockies
description: We are partners in the TKRL Transport Business, with our own lines of trains and trucks for collecting and delivering various goods to Mr. Big's coastal warehouses. Mr. Big pays us well for everything we bring in plus bonuses for filling each warehouse. The risks are great, what with the roads and rails getting wiped out by snow storms and rock slides, not to mention government cutbacks leaving the infrastructure in dangerous shape. Only partners with nerves of steel and alert brains need apply for the job. If you have what it takes, join us in a railway and trucking adventure.

title: Ogres & Elves
description:
The royal elf family is coming to visit their mountain kingdom. They want us elves to fill their treasure chests with the different gems we mine. However, ogres have heard about the visit and plan to grab all the valuables for themselves. We must do our best to get royals and ogres alike to share the goodies. Easy to say. This requires lots of tricky teamwork with each game increasing in difficulty. Strap on your invisible shields, dear elves and head for the mines. The royals are coming.
Ages 5 and up.

title: CSI: Miami
description:
FEEL THE HEAT OF MIAMI!

Behind the sun, surf and palm trees lurks a darker world. You will quickly learn that each suspect is capable of deceit.  By rolling the CSI: Miami die you will follow the evidence, identify the killer and reveal the truth.

Can you handle the heat?

Follow lead criminalist, Horatio Caine, and his team of CSIs to collect three levels of evidence in order to solve each crime. CSI: Miami The Board Game features eight crime stories written in the fascinating, compelling style of the hit series, CSI: Miami.

The object of the game is the be the first investigator to submit a correct arrest warrant, proving means, motive and opportunity for one of the three suspects.

What's in the box?
CSI: MIAMI Game Board
8 Crime Cases
40 CSI: Miami Challenge Cards
22 Suspect and Evidence Cards per Case
The CSI: Miami Handbook
Arrest Warrant Pad
6 CSI Player Pieces
12- Sided Die

Expanded by:

    CSI: Miami Booster Pack

title: A History of Games Played with the Tarot Pack: The Game of Triumphs
description: Two volume set covering virtually all that is now known of Tarot, Tarock, and Tarocchi games. The sole concern of these two volumes is the evolution of the Tarot card game rules with only a mention in passing of the occult uses of Tarot cards in the preface and very few illustrations of Tarot cards.
