A player wins by orthogonally connecting all of their remaining pieces to the far end of the board marked with their symbol (not necessarily in a single connected group, but all pieces orthogonally connected to a piece on the goal line).  A player may also win by pinning an opponent's piece on his own starting line.

title: Rallye
types: Card Game Print & Play Racing Sports
description:
Aim: To be the fastest driver on the special stage of the rally.

Principle of the game : The players must go through the different road sections of the special stage made with special cards put on the table at the beginning of the game. They must read the difficulties of the road and adapt their speed and the orientation of the wheel. To change speed and direction of the wheel, players have cards with points. Players will have to drive over the speed limits (but not too much) to win the race.

End of the game: The game is finished when someone crosses the finish line. The player with the fewest seconds chips is the winner.

This game received a mention spciale du Jury at the 2004 gathering of Boulogne Billancourt for game designers.

title: STREET WARriorS Collectible Card Game
description:
(From the Street Warriors Main Website)

The STREET WARriorS is a Collectible Card Game (CCG) where you battle against your opponent and use weapons like AK-47s, Brass Knuckles, Desert Eagles, Glocks, Knives and other deadly weapons...

Add extra excitement to the battle by strategically using MURPHY'S LAW cards like Get Crunked!, Pimps Up, Hos Down and the Race Card!

Choose whether you want to be a Good Guy or a Bad Guy, the choice is up to you.

Play as gangstas or crime bosses with groups like the Triad, Jamaican Posse, La Raza Escogida, Thugs, or Pimps. Or beat down the criminal element with law enforcement agencies like the ACU (Anti Crime Unit) or USU (United Security Unions). Don't wanna be a Johnny Law or a straight criminal? That's cool, play as a Freelancer... In fact you can mix and match to suit your style of play, with each group having their own distinct strengths and weaknesses...

The STREET WARriorS is heavily influenced by the Hip-Hop/Reggae/Heavy Metal/Punk music and lifestyle scenes. From the Tattoos to the Bling, we've blended a lot of real-world elements into the game and have gone through great lengths to provide players with an authentic Urban genre where you as the player can relate to the characters in the game.

The base Alpha set will be launching June 30th, 2005 at Origins.  In the Alpha Set there are 9 Holofoil Boss Cards, 84 Low Level Character Cards, 23 High Level Character Cards, 2 Assassin Character Cards, 47 Murphy's Law Cards, 34 Equipment Cards, 34 Holofoil Character Cards, and 2 Never to be Printed Again Cards, bringing the Alpha Set total to 235 Cards.

title: Mighty Beanz Trading Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Collectible Components Humor
description:
An educational collectible card game designed for younger children based on the popular Mighty Beanz series of collectible toys.  Moon Quest, the first wave, contains 131 card to collect.

Card come in 40 card starter decks and 9 card booster packs.

title: DareBase
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
DareBase attempts to recreate the feeling of the classic schoolyard game of team-tag, in a 5-on-5 contest. It adds some capture-the-flag elements to give each team an incentive for having their players run deep toward the opposing end of the field.  Dice rules force players to make some tense decisions while giving the players a glimpse of options available within future turns.

Several different scenarios are available to play the game in different ways.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Air Combat Trainer
types: Aviation / Flight Educational World War II
description:
The up-to-the-minute game that gives you a chance to try your skill at combat flying, using 48 exact miniatures of war planes and combat maneuvers-helps you identify planes in the sky!

The game was actually produced in conjunction with the War Department, and is part of the Air Youth series of games.

title: Jagdpanzer
description:
Jagdpanzer is a set of rules for World War II armored combat. The game mechanics are straightforward and uncomplicated. The anti-tank combat is a simply system that provides decent, realistic results.

The basic rules are very basic, but there are several optional rules that can be added for chrome.

The scale of the game is 1 inch = 25 metres, 1 turn = 1 minute. The figure scale is 1:1 for tanks and guns with infantry represented as squads.

The rule booklet combines the rules with a great deal of organizational data and many pages of data on every AFV, gun, and airplane that was used in World War II.

title: Rendezvous in Space
description:
In this very large game (22.5 x 32.5), players race to explore the eight other planets within the solar system.

One unusual gimmick to this game is its use of a stack of slide transparencies (vs. regular cards) in concert with a board randomizing mechanism. Pulling a lever rotates the obstacles to movement on the board as well as pushes a transparency off the bottom of a stack into position. Movement of the transparency into place causes a small light bulb to turn on, lighting the slide and revealing the instructional text.

title: Team Out! Hockey
description:
In this hockey themed card game, each player attempts to build a starting line-up of NHL players (1 Goalie, 1 Center, 2 Wings and 2 Defensemen) while hindering their opponents attempts to do the same. The game is played over a series of hands building up points until one player reaches at least 400 points and is declared the winner (or Team Out! Champ).

The game comes in a small box with a set of rules and a 60 card deck. The cards consist of 30 NHL Player cards, 3 Power Play cards (which is a wild card allowing a player to substitute one for a starting player), 18 Action cards (which hinder opponents), and 9 Protection cards (which protect players against Action cards).

title: Where's Willie?
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
A plastic house with four doors stands between the two players. One player secretly places Willie, a little man in a swimsuit holding a flower, behind one of the doors. The other player has to guess behind which door Willie resides by opening the door. If Willie is there, a little bell goes ding! and the player scores a point. There is no penalty for a wrong guess. Players alternate roles until someone scores four points to become winner.

Wheres Willie? was an activity on the television show Shenanigans.

title: Eddie Arcaro's Riders Up
description:
Ten races are run. Each race will have eight horses. Each race varies in length from three to ten furlongs. Two factors handicap each horse: the odds of each number being rolled on the special dice vary with the lesser numbers being favored (One appears on every die while Eight appears on only two dice) and horses carrying less weight have an advantage over more burdened beasts.

Players place their minimum $2 bets before each race. The starting gate is placed the appropriate distance from the finish line and the horses are placed in the starting gate according to the weight they are carrying. The dice are rolled and each horse is advanced one space each time its number is rolled. Bets are paid when three horses have finished.

Advanced rules lets players own the horses and get a payoff whenever the horse wins.

The game comes packaged in a massive box that measures 25 x 14 x 3. The gameboard folds out to become sixty inches long! The game is named after the legendary jockey who rode two Triple Crown winners.

title: Hard Times: The Money Management Game
description:
From the publisher:

Can playing a board game stop your child from making grim financial mistakes as an adult? Thats the aim of Hard Times, the money management board game for kids (and their parents) that seeks to eliminate those future financial mistakes.

Players start out with a line of credit and loop through the path any young adult might take: dinner with friends, college, finding a job, shopping for house supplies. But Hard Times lives up to its name: get fined for parking in the handicapped space, max out your credit card, and turn down a job only to be faced with a hospital bill? Real life hurdles lurk.

Players compete to build personal wealth. The first player to be gainfully employed, purchase and furnish a home, buy a car, and  heres the tricky part  end up debt free, wins the game.

title: The Pollution Game
description: The Pollution Game allows students to simulate in a game the progressive contamination of our environment and then try to reverse the contamination to preserve the environment.  During this game, students will experience the antagonisms and frustrations of trying to change technology and social behavior.

title: The Road to Honnoji 1576-84
description: This is an area movement card driven wargame on the Japanese feudal wars.

title: Three Kingdoms of Korea
description: This is a point to point movement Japanese wargame set in an ancient (7th century) war to unite the Korean peninsula. The war was fought by the T'ang (China), Silla Kingdom, Goguryeo Kingdom, Baekje Kingdom and the Wa Kingdom (Japan).

title: Pax Romana
description: This is a Japanese card based game on Roman Empire Politics. Players play factions within the Roman Empire who try to take over.

title: Three Kingdoms War
description: This is a Japanese area movement wargame set during the Three Kingdoms period in Chinese history. Published as part of the Bandai If series of wargames.

title: Prehistoric War P.I.G.s
description:
From the publisher's website:

The newest in the popular War PIGs (Plastic Infantry Guys) series, Prehistoric War PIGs uses plastic dinosaurs and cavemen as miniature figures in a high-action combat game where each player does their best to raise and maintain an army of dinosaurs. Tactics and strategy combine as players balance resource management and giant lizard mayhem.

For 2 or more players Ages 10 and up
.

title: BANG! Face Off
types: American West Bluffing Card Game Deduction Expansion for Base-game Fighting
description:
From the publisher (edited):

BANG! Face Off features three characters: a Sheriff, an Outlaw and a Renegade; the latter will be moved by both the players and, as in the original game, will be an ambiguous character that will not openly take a side.

The two players take the outlaw and sheriff sides and face off on a board representing either a canyon of death or the OK Corral. The renegade is moved by both the players. The Bang! cards are used to move and fight with the characters.

The rules also explain how to use BANG! Face Off with the official expansions produced by daVinci Games.

title: On découpe le monde en tranches
description:
At the beginning there is enough space. Everybody can build his own houses on his preferred continent. And then, everything becomes more complicated as places begin to disappear. Fires, alliances, treason... who will be the first to control 2 continents?

A visual game, mixing tactics and bluff... and where your allies of the moment can quickly become your enemies!

title: RoboCop and the Ultra Police
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description: Capture the hooligans,collect the ultra hero medals and hang onto your vehicle cards. Try to get most of the medals and cards to win the game.

title: Dragons & Danes
description:
A game (supposedly) reminiscent of Viking games of old, this game was first available in museums with the Vikings: The North Atlantic Saga traveling exhibit.

From the publisher's web site (edited):

Dragons  Danes is an exciting new Combat style game that uses our unique Throwing Disks that will either score you points or enter you into a Battle mode. You may find yourself in the middle of a War, fighting a Skirmish, Ambushing your enemy or find yourself saying OH NO! as your Ambush backfires in your FACE!
On each turn you either win or lose pieces of treasure from your treasure hoard. Of course everyone knows, He who getteth the most treasure WINS!

Dragons  Danes is hand-crafted in our studios. Each game set gets hand-assembled by our in-house game-crafters. The same pair of hands sees each game through from start to finish.

Each set of Dragons  Danes includes:
1 set of 5 hand-crafted Throwing Disks
1 custom made carry-anywhere pouch
1 booklet with complete game rules
30 jewel colored Treasure Horde pieces

title: Diamond Chess
description: Diamond Chess is an elegant variation of the classic game.  The playing surface is composed of 98 alternating black and white triangles, a shape that provides for new and intriguing movements.  The pieces move analogous with their counterparts in conventional chess, although familiarity with that game is not necessary to understand and enjoy Diamond Chess.

title: Formel Card
description: Small card game with qualifying and racing rules.

title: Brandy Station
description: Just after Chancellorsville, the biggest cavalry engagement occurred on June 9, 1863. Reorganized Union forces under Pleasanton engaged JEB Stuart's Confederate Cavalry. This game was recently published in the new Panzerschreck issue #14. This is a 9 turn game on a small map with 10 units per side. Should play quickly. The game has initiative, disruption, counterattacks, event chits (which modify a rule or condition). Victory is determined by comparing (at the end of the game) the randomly drawn Victory Chit (by the Union player) with the status at the end of the game. The Confederate player does not know what goal the Union player has. The CRT is relatively bloodless, but you accumulate Disruption Markers which represent losses and reduced combat/maneuver abilities (sort of a step loss system).

title: Barbacan
description: The game can be played by two to six players. They try to be the first to get their men from the board's circumference into the castle by moving the pieces along the defined lines. An edition published in the 1920s also permitted to move them around the two circles outside the castle, which were omitted from later designs.

title: The Legacy of Kings
description:
The Legacy of Kings was a boardgame set in the ADD Birthright world.  It was played at conventions in the late 1990s.  In 2000 it was made available for download from the Wizards of the Coast website.

The game covers the grand strategic conflict for the continent of Cerilia.  One player is the game moderator and also controls the Awnsheglien.  The other players act as regents of the various realms.

title: Laputa Castle in the Sky
description:
This is a Japanese game based on the anime Castle in the Sky, formerly known as Laputa: Castle in the Sky. The English-language subtitle is The Game of the Castle in the Sky Laputa. The game in all the pictures here on BGG has the Japanese title 「ティディス城塞」, meaning Fort Tidisu. (There is another official Castle in the Sky board game, titled 「天空の城ラピュタ」 like the film itself. Perhaps the entry you're reading was originally named after that game, not the one in the pictures here, but BGG will not allow the other game to be added to the database without details on its rules.)

This game has three scenarios:

1. The Dola family of air pirates attempts to penetrate the military surveillance net around the airship transporting Muska and Sheeta.

2. The Dola family attacks the airship itself, as in the opening scene of the film.

3. Pazu and the pirates try to break Sheeta out of Fort Tidisu, where Muska has imprisoned her.

title: Quin Mantha: Armored Combat in Gundam 0088
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Expansion kit for Psyco Gundam, can not plat stand alone.
Add new units and map from Mobile suit Gundam ZZ and Char's Counterattack.

title: Lippstadt Campaign: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

This is set in a specific but crucial battle in the anime.

title: Le Loto Des Odeurs
description:
This is a game that uses the sense of smell. Contents include 5 individual player boards and 30 small vials of various scents.

Each player receives one or two player boards.  Players takes turns with each scented vial trying to successfully recognize the scent, and place it on their game board if a match is found.  The winner is the first to correctly fill his board(s).

title: Babar Game
types: Animals Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
A simple children's roll and move game with Babar as a backdrop. This is different than the Babar King of the Elephant game which is a bit more elaborate.  It is targeted for Ages 4 - 7
.

title: Waku Waku maar mee
types: Animals Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
description: Players must answer questions about all kinds of animals. For each correctly answered set of questions the players are rewarded with 'monkeys'. The first player who has collected two monkeys in each category wins the game.

title: Sportz Dice: Tennis
description: A dice game that has nothing in common with Tennis except the name and terminology.  The game consists of three dice which include one Serving dice and two Rally dice.  The first player rolls the Serving dice and if a Good Serve is rolled then the 2nd player rolls the Rally die trying to roll a Return result, whereupon the first player will then roll the Rally die.  This continues until one player rolls an out result.  Play continues using standard Tennis scoring rules.  Play best out of three or five sets to determine game winner.

title: Verbosus
Sahibba
description:
It is the first Malaysian version of Scrabble in Bahasa Melayu, invented in 1976. In 1978, a bi-lingual version was introduced which can be played in BM or English individually or both languages at the same time.

It is in fact the world's first invention of a bi-lingual crossword boardgame. Today, SAHIBBA is a household name and the most popular Scrabble in Malaysia.

title: Vocable
description:
It is an English crossword boardgame introduced in Malaysia in 1985. This game stimulates the mind and encourages wider vocabulary use and spelling.

The latest edition (2003) is in fact the world's first crossword boardgame created for the millennium featuring a larger board of 17 x 17 cross squares and a unique letter distribution system making VOCABLE the only crossword game currently available that can accommodate more and longer words found in today's Information Technology, Mathematics and Science vocabularies.

Due to the Malaysian Government's encouragement to learn English in Mathematics and Science, VOCABLE for the millennium is now promoted seriously among school students.

title: Strobe
description:
An electronic game similar to SIMON, but with an even more futuristic look. The unit features three different games:
Pass the Flash in which you must press one of your three buttons when your dome lights up, thereby passing the light to one of the other players. The light accelerates the longer the game continues; Xcelleration in which you must pass the light in the direction indicated by the Strobe; and, Electronic Tennis in which one, 2 or 4 players serve the light back and forth across the board.
Each game also has three skill levels.

title: Grandma's Treasure
types: Card Game Children's Game Party Game
description:
This is a deck of cards that can be used to facilitate a treasure hunt around your house. The game consists of a deck of 26 cards; 1 Treasure card and 25 cards with images of objects that you would typically find around your home: Blue cards: shoe, dresser, clock, bed; Orange cards: tissue, window, vacuum; Green cards: couch, tv, table, lamp, books, chair; Yellow cards: bottle, milk, pot, spoon, salt, refrigerator; Red cards: door, ball, pencil, key, phone, plant.

The hunt organizer (Grandma?) selects one of the cards and holds it in reserve. She then places a second card at or near the object/location shown on the reserve card. Another card is placed at or near the object/location shown on the second card. The organizer proceeds in this fashion, placing as many cards as she chooses, and placing the Treasure Card last. The participant(s) are handed the reserve card and follow the trail of cards throughout the house to the Treasure card. The participant(s) them redeem the Treasure Card for a prize.

title: High Wire Harry
description:
High Wire Harry is a childrens balancing game that can prove difficult for the shaky handed player.

Each player is given a set of eight props  2 chairs, 2 stools, 2 picture frames and two umbrellas. On his turn, a player rolls the die and places the corresponding prop either on Harrys crossbar or on Harrys coat hanger (which is balancing on his forehead). Once the prop is placed, the player must roll Harry down his tightrope by using a lever located at one end of the board that tips the tightrope forward and backward. Press too quickly and Harry smashes into the building, probably losing his props. Press too slowly and youll fail to ring the bell that signifies a successful roll (and suffer the derision of the other players!). Any props that Harry drops become the active players and will have to be loaded on Harry again.

Once you have loaded all your props, you have to take Harry for one last run, this time with his pet monkey riding on his hat!

title: Skittle Pool
description:
Skittle Pool is similar to Skittle Bowl, however the pins have been replaced by nine 2 billiard balls. The table is approx. 24 inches square with 3 pockets each on the left and right sides. At the bottom of the board is a pendulum device that acts as the striker. The cue ball is placed in a special pivot foot and that foot is rotated to aim the cue ball at a target ball. The striker, a ball similar in size to the cue, is lifted and released (or gently thrown) to strike against the pivot foot which in turn transfers the energy to the cue ball.

Most billiard type games can be played on the table. A scoring rack (wire with plastic scoring chips) is included in the game.

The game was most notable for its promotion by American actor Don Adams who was well known for his role as a bumbling secret agent in Get Smart on 1960s television.

title: PrimePak
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Math
description:
PrimePak - Four Card Games

Master multiplication, division and factoring skills while having fun playing card games with this unique deck of 171 cards. In all four games players form factor sets. Because 80 = 8 x 10, the numbers 80, 8 and 10 form a factor set. Factor sets can have more than three numbers. For example, the set 42, 3, 2 and 7 is also a factor set. Prime wild cards are used for prime numbers only. Adapts to 6 levels. For 1 to 6 players. Ages 7 to adult.

Prime Challenge - Players in turn form factor sets from a 12-card (or 10-card) foundation. Challenges are made by opponents when a player overlooks factor sets or makes a mistake.

Prime Solitare - To win, a player must clear a foundation by forming factor sets. This must be done before going through the draw pile once, one card at a time.

Factor Rummy - Holding a hand of 11 (or 10) cards, players try to be the first to fill their hand with factor sets.

Prime Canasta - A sophisticated Factor Rummy game. For serious game players.

SIX DECK LEVELS

The PrimePak deck of 171 cards adapts to many levels by removing certain cards. Six deck levels are defined in the rules booklet. Players play with deck level 1 (then 2 and 3) until they have mastered the multiplication facts. They continue playing at level 3 until they learn to think of numbers in factored form. The rules booklet includes important divisibility rules and factoring strategies.

title: Case Closed TCG
types: Card Game Collectible Components Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Based on the animated TV series, Case Closed is a CCG where players will prove that One Truth Prevails as their detectives face their opponent's criminals in the quest to solve cases. Gadget, clue, character, case and event cards combo together to unlock a game environment featuring danger at every turn. Solve these cases to win a match - take two matches and win the game.

title: Who's Had Who?
description:
From the box:

Who's Had Who? The Celebrity Gossip Game

All the fun of after dinner seduction with none of the practical difficulty.

Who's Had Who? the ultimate in after dinner entertainment, at least seven times funnier than getting drunk and falling asleep in an awkward position.

A box full of hilarious gossip about the rich and famous together with the chance to play at seducing a host of celebrities from Ronald Reagan to Marilyn Monroe and Des O'Connor.

Who's Had Who? contains over 1000 hilarious gossip questions, but these are just one element of the game. As in real life luck, skill, technique, wit, the possession of the right attributes and even the ability to induce a headache in Joan Collins so as to protect her from Warren Beatty, all play their vital part.

Based on the best selling comedy book 'Who's Had Who' the game is devised by its authors and the inventor of the best-selling strategy game 'September'.

Raucous, flirtatious and always good for a giggle, Who's Had Who? invites you to play with the largest range of celebrities ever available in one box.

title: Pet Detectives
description:
Race against other detectives to find the most lost pets. Ask other detectives if they've seen pets such as Tootsie the Tortoise, Mr. Wigglesworth the Boston Terrier or Churchill the Cat. When you match the lost and found cards for a pet, you win reward money. When you build up $100, you buy an Action Card. Be careful! An Action Card can help you or work against you. Be the detective to find the most lost pets by the end of the game and you win! This game features real pictures of animals and custom cards so you can include pictures of your own pets in the game.

Includes: 80 pet cards w/real pet pictures, 4 custom pet cards, 26 Action Cards, 50 Pet Dollars, Instructions

title: Marvel Trivia Game
description:
The Marvel Trivia Game comes with 200 trivia cards, each with five questions relating to Marvel Comics' various superheroes.  The questions are assigned to five categories, although these categories (Strength, Ultimate Intelligence, Power, Energy Control, and Resistance) are not clearly defined.

The game also comes with 24 Super Tokens, small chits with one of the categories printed on it.  Each turn, the player draws one of these Super Tokens to determine which question they will answer.

Scores are recorded on a special scoring sheet with five scoring tracks for each player, one for each category.  If a player correctly answers a question, he gets two points on the scoring track for that category.  If a player incorrectly answers a question, all of his opponents score one point on the scoring track for that category.  The winner of the game is the first player to score five points in all of the five categories.

title: Pegs in the Park
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Number
description:
From the insert inside the box:

Come take a fun visit to the Park with some happy, lovable little Pegs as they race and jump from hole to hole along the colorful tracks in the Park.  If you beat the other Pegs to the Ice Cream Car, you win!

Pegs in the Park includes a cheerful deck of 44 cards depicting the many happy sights and activities you will see in an eventful day at the Park.  But look out!  The stormy rain clouds or some hungry ants would like to ruin the Pegs day in the park and keep your Peg from reaching the Ice Cream Cart.

Pegs in the Park is both great fun and educational.  The lovable little Pegs will delight young players.  This child's board game goes beyond entertaining and challenges the youngster in an exciting learning adventure.  The young player will have opportunities to practice counting, learn the concept of forward and backward, come to understand plus (+) and minus (-) along with developing small motor skills and hand-eye coordination.

title: Distant Foreign Fields: The Great War 1914-1918
description:
From the publisher:

Distant Foreign Fields: The Great War 1914-1918 is a division-scale wargame covering the First World War on all major fronts. Seven maps can be used together to play the entirety of the war from 1914 until its completion. Or, one map can be used to play a smaller scenario covering one important battle.

title: We're Talking Proud: All About Buffalo
description:
This limited edition game was published as part of the We're Talking Proud Buffalo, NY campaign.  Other games exist in this series for other communities.

The object of the game is for players to travel from their residence square to each of the locations on their shopping lists and return home.  Locations and special cards are based on actual local businesses and personalities at the time of publication.

title: Disney Group Photo
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The objective of this game is to be the first player to match all of the characters on your character card with the playing cards in your hand.  You draw either the top card of the draw pile or the top card of the discard pile and then discard a card.

Each character card has 6 Disney characters on it.  The deck of cards contains two normal and one ID version of each character.  The ID version of the card contains biography information for each character and in order to win the game, two of the six cards in your hand must be ID cards.

In addition, there are:

Red Eye cards, which let you get any card out of the discard pile
Overexposed cards, which force any player of your choice to get a new randomly chosen character card
Photo Shy cards, which are a wild card substitute for a character card
Say Cheese cards, which are a wild card substitute for a character card OR an ID card

The characters in the game include:

Ariel
Baloo
Bambi
Belle
Cinderella
Genie
Lady
Mickey Mouse
Mulan
Peter Pan
Pinocchio
Pluto
Scar
Simba
Sleeping Beauty
Snow White
The Beast
Tigger
Tramp
Ursula
Winnie the Pooh

title: Die Siedler von Catan: Paper & Pencil
description:
This is a simplified promotional version of Settlers of Catan.  It was produced to celebrate the 10th Anniversary of the original version of Settlers of Catan, in conjunction with a pizza chain, Hallo Pizza - it was given out with orders of their special Catan pizzas.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

title: Janken-Plus
description:
Components:
4 3X3 interlocking board pieces
24 Janken (Rock, Scissors, Paper) pieces in orange and blue
1 bag

Janken Plus is a production of Gakken, an educational publishing company in Japan, in the Embrain Goods line. The games are touted as being good for the brain.

There are at least four different games you can play with the Janken Plus set, though not all of them are Rock-Scissors-Paper games.

1. Janken Game: Because the four boards are interlocking, they can be arranged differently, as a 6X6 square (basic game using all 24 janken pieces), or other arrangements with games for 12 pieces.

The pieces can be moved in any direction, any number of squares. Pieces are taken in the traditional Rock beats Scissors beats Paper beats Rock way. The game ends when one player has only two pieces left. On the box it says it's a similar game to Shogi.

2. Play-off Janken: Each player places their pieces face down; they can arrange the pieces as they like. The board isnt used. They each choose one piece and play janken. The winner is the player who captures the most of their opponents pieces. (This is not a thinking game.)

3. Tic-Tac-Toe variant: Using one board, the players play a Tic-Tac-Toe game aiming to get three pieces in a row. Once a player has played three pieces, he or she can only move them on the board. A variant is to use two or more unconnected boards and more pieces, with the ability to move pieces from board to board.

4. Pinch-pon: Players use six pieces each on the 6X6 board. They capture their opponents pieces by sandwiching them between two of their own (as in the ancient game of Hnefatafl and similar games).

title: Voyageur
description:
Voyageur is a global travel game that serves well as an educational game (though the geography is now 20 years out of date and counting) but is light enough to be playable even by those not in want of a geography tutorial.

It is played on an 8-segment 32x48 map of the world, which is mounted on a thick cardstock attached to half-inch-thick foam backing.  Each player is randomly assigned one of twenty 'itineraries', listing the six cities of the world they must visit in any order before returning to New York - the first player to reach New York after touching all cities on his/her itinerary wins.

Travel is handled by a roll of a die which determines which of five travel decks (Walk, Car, Train, Ship, Plane) the player must draw from and execute - most cards dictate a number of kilometers that the player may move (subject to terrain - ships travel by sea, trains/cars/walk by land).  The player drives a pushpin into the map at his/her destination and wraps a like-coloured thread around it - so as the game progresses, a crisscrossing network of coloured pushpins and thread show the paths that each player has traveled.

title: Mysticards: Deck of Dragons
description:
From the rulebook introduction:

Mysticards is a card game designed for four players, Ages 8 and up, who are divided into two teams of two.  One game consists of several hands, with each hand being made up of 15 tricks.  During each trick, every player gets to play one card, with the best card winning the trick.  Teams collect points for each trick they win.  In addition, each team can earn extra points for meeting certain conditions, such as winning tricks with gemstones, or defeating an enemy dragon.

title: Tommy Guns Blazing
description:
Tommy Guns Blazing is a miniatures game (using the Matrix system) set in the 1920s (Prohibition in the USA).  Players take on the role of rival gang members and try to gain control of the illegal speakeasies.  Players must provide their own equipment (dice, map or miniature buildings, counters or miniature figures, etc.).  The game consists of a single 8-page rulebook, including two pages of tables.

The game requires a referee to assess the difficulty of any proposed action.  Success is stated in a number of 6s.  An easy task may require only one 6 to be rolled, but a difficult one might require six 6s.  Likewise, movement is 2 per 6 rolled, and combat is also resolved comparing 6s rolled.

As in most Matrix games, the player chooses how many dice to roll at any given time, which can vary at his whim.  For an easy task, a player may opt to roll only one die, or two dice, or a dozen.  The catch is that while 6s succeed, every 1 that is rolled causes something bad to happen to the character of the die roller!  The more 1s you roll, the worse it gets.

title: HMS Rules: His Majesty George III's Sailing Rules
types: American Revolutionary War Miniatures Napoleonic Nautical Wargame
description:
HMS Rules is a naval combat miniatures game (using the Matrix system) set in the Napoleonic/American Revolutionary era.  Players control either the British, French, Spanish or American fleets.  Players must provide their own equipment (dice, map with squares, counters or miniature ships, etc.).  The game consists of a single 16-page rulebook, including a few pages of tables.

The game requires a referee to assess the difficulty of any proposed action.  Success is stated in a number of 6s.  An easy task may require only one 6 to be rolled, but a difficult one might require six 6s.  Likewise, movement is 1 as a base, but can be more depending on the number of 6s rolled, how the ship handles in general, and ship's angle to the wind.  Combat is also resolved comparing 6s rolled.

Before the game, every ship has a record sheet and must be rated for Handling, Hull (ability to take damage), Crew Combat Quality, Crew Morale, and Crew Damage Control.

As in most Matrix games, the player chooses how many dice (d6s) to roll at any given time, which can vary at his whim.  For an easy task, a player may opt to roll only one die, or two dice, or a dozen.  The catch is that while 6s succeed, every 1 that is rolled causes something bad to happen to the ship of the die roller!  The more 1s you roll, the worse it gets.

title: Dragon Wars
description:
Dragon Wars is a card game included in the RPG aid, Dragonlance Saga Fate Deck.  While the main purpose of the Fate Deck is to play an RPG using the Saga system, the deck includes rules for a stand-alone card game, Dragon Wars.  The RPG rules included in the game are credited to Steven Brown, Steve Miller, and Ed Stark, but no designer is mentioned for Dragon Wars.

The deck consists of 82 cards: eight suits numbered 1-9 and one suit (dragons) numbered 1-10.  To play, the dragons are removed from the deck and shuffled.  Every player gets one dragon.  The remaining 72 cards are shuffled and six are dealt to each player.

Three of the suits are attacking suits, three are defending suits, and two suits may be used for either.  On your turn, you attack a dragon of your choice (but not your own!) by playing attack cards.  The owner responds by playing defense cards.  The attacker may continue the attack if he has more of the same suit he started with.  If he does, the defender may defend with any defensive suit.  Once the attacker calls a halt, subtract defense cards from attack cards.  If the number is positive, the dragon takes that many hits.  (Each dragon has a number of hit points equal to the number on the card.)  Dead dragons are placed in the attacking player's victory point pile, and the defender draws a new dragon to defend, if there are any left.

Rules are provided for despoilers - players whose last dragon is removed after the dragon deck has run out.  (In a ten-player game, that's always!)  The game ends one round after there is only one dragon left in play: everyone else has one turn to try to defeat it.  The numbers on the dragon cards are VP.

title: Buck Fever Challenge
description:
From the box back:

Are you ready for the ULTIMATE hunting challenge?  If so, Buck Fever Challenge puts the challenge of the hunt at your fingertips.  This award-winning board game puts you in the pursuit of the North American deer in the comfort of your own home.  The objective of the game is to be the first hunter to obtain a legal deer and return to camp.  To accomplish this, you the hunter may be challenged by other hunters, bears, wolves, natures obstacles, and the law.  Buck Fever Challenge can be enjoyed by the entire family. From the novice hunter to the seasoned hunter.

title: The Mighty Hood
types: Miniatures Nautical Wargame World War II
description: A mini-sim from Panzerschreck Magazine #14 - using a modified Graf Spee system. Portrays the battle between the Bismarck/Prinz Eugen and the Hood/Prince of Wales. Essentially a miniatures game with cardboard miniatures. the scale is 1 = 1,000 yards and the turns are 1 hour (with 7 rounds). There are some extra ships and some additional scenarios.

title: Race to the Vistula
description: An intermediate complexity simulation of the Soviet offensive against the German Army Group North-Ukraine from July 1944 to August 1944. Published in Panzerschreck #14. Typical Attack-Defense-Movement counters, differentiating armor/infantry/mech - Soviet Armies-Corps and German Corps-Divisions - special units (Air - Flak - Artillery divisions - German Armored Train) - Supply rules - A different Sequence of play (Soviet Movement - Joint Air - Soviet Combat - then a die roll to determine if German movement or combat occurs - German reinforcement - then the other German phase, combat or movement)

title: King of the Realm
description: King of the Realm is a board game for 2 to 6 players.  The board (called the Realm) comprises a number of Counties (tiles), which are divided into four different types (Cities, Farmlands, Landmarks, and Mines).  Each player is dealt a hand of cards; these cards allow the players to take control of the different Counties in the Realm by placing Units of four different types (Armies, Bishops, Merchants, and Nobles) keyed to whatever problem the County is afflicted with (Anarchy, Bandits, Heretics, and Poverty).  At the end of the game, players form Duchies out of the territory they've conquered to score points.  Bonuses are earned by forming Duchies that have one of each Unit, one of each land type, or both.  In addition, proximity to the center of the board is rewarded by an additional bonus.  The player who forms the most valuable Duchies earns the most points and therefore wins!

title: Rap Rat Video Board Game
description:
From the box(?):

Just press 'PLAY' and you're on the way, rappin' with a little rodent with a lot to say!  RAP RAT - the host of this innovative, interactive Video Board Game for two to six kids who just want to have FUN!

Sensational!  Recreational!  Inspirational!  Educational!  That's a FACT!

Make up your color coded puzzle first, then press STOP to beat RAP RAT.  But if the cheese gets eaten, you all get beaten!

Contents:
40-minute VHS cassette
6 cheese wedges
6 cheese jigsaw puzzles
Game board
Coloring book
Colored dice

title: Flashback: Sitcom Edition
description: Covering over 60 of your favorite sitcoms from the 70's, 80's and early 90's, Flashback will test your sitcom knowledge while providing hours of fun for all. Each card contains four questions ranging in difficulty from Book Worm to Couch Potato. Board advancement (or the ability to send others backwards) is based on the difficulty of the chosen question.

title: The Game of Earth
description:
From the back of the box:

A perfect formula: The Game of EARTH + family, friends, or classmates = fun and excitement! The toss of a die determines whether you'll be quizzed about Earth's Environment, Atmosphere, Rocks, Tectonics, or Hydrosphere. Four challenging levels permit players of like and different ages and abilities to join together in unraveling the fascinating mysteries of our planet. Be first to correctly answer one question in each of the five categories, and win!

The game comes with a couple of dice and 150 cards asking educational questions about Earth and its environment; each card has four levels of questions to provide different challenges for different age/knowledge groups. The rules provide with a few different variants of play: Regular Play, EARTH Master (a game show variant for large groups), EARTH Face-Off (spelling bee), and EARTH Challenge (team play).

title: Xaviera's Game
description:
By the Author of The Happy Hooker

From the cover:

Dear Player:

Youve probably read about my sexy adventures in The Happy Hooker. Now instead of just reading about them, you can play along with me!!! Can you think of a better teacher for fun and games than Xaviera???

Step into my apartment and be one of my girls of a very eager customer But be willing to hang up your hang-ups and try to keep your hands above board .. At least for the first few rounds!!

There havent been any dull moments in my life, and there wont be any for you when you indulge in Xavieras Game!!!

title: The Romance of the Three Kingdoms
description:
The Romance of Three Kingdoms takes place in ancient China, the Three Kingdoms era. The goal of the game is to conquer the opponents' capital cities. Unlike other wargames, the number of armies one nation can control is limited to four, providing more compact and brief game play.

The game consists of two phases, internal affairs and battles. Both economy and battles are affected greatly by the ability of staffs and generals. And the key to success is to strategically allocate proper subordinates to best provinces.

There are 129 characters in the Three Kingdoms and 40 castles on the map. The tactics cards are based on Sun Tzu's Art of War and other ancient books. The miniature armies are made of metal. Different scenarios are planned to be available on the web.

title: Mini Golf
description:
Originally published in the June/July 1987 issue of GAMES Magazine, Mini Golf is a card game for 1-4 players.

Sid Sackson created this puzzle-ful game of beating par by moving a marker over a series of cards on the table.  Various cards represent the holes as in the game of Golf.
The game can be played solitaire but if the simultaneous action mechanic is added (as Sid suggests), this game supports more players.

title: Battle of Marignano
description: A free wargame about the Battle of Marignano.  Takes place during the Italian wars, and simulates a large battle which took place in Italy between the French and Swiss in 1515.

title: Corrida de Cartes
description: A cart racing games for 2 to 4 players. Roll the dice to know the number of spaces your token advances. There are bonuses and penalties spread throughout the track like Yellow Helmet (advance 4 spaces) or Wrench (withdraw 2 spaces). Majora game 493/2 released in Portugal in the early 80's.

title: Dog Fight
description:
From the rules:

Dog Fight very closely approaches an actual combat between fighting planes, bombers and anti-aircraft guns. The play takes place on a vertical board which allows the important consideration of altitude to become a part of the play. The planes against the sunset sky make a most realistic picture.

By making use of the allowable moves of the planes and of the spinner which controls 'Hits' it is the purpose of each contestant to silence the anti-aircraft fire of his opponents and to disable and put out of play his opponent's aircraft. Players accomplish this by obtaining proper position with their planes and diving on or shooting down opponents and bombing anti-aircraft guns.

The game board is a vertical piece of cardboard in which the wings of miniature aircraft are inserted to give a feel of the current layout of aircraft.

(Note that this is different from the 1963 game of the same name.)

title: Three Blind Mice
description:
Shuffle the pack of cards and place face down on the table. Starting with the youngest and going in a clockwise direction, each player takes a turn to pick up a card from the top of the pack. If this is a head card the player places this face up in front of him. If it is not the card is placed face up at the side of the pile. Play continues with each player taking a turn to pick up a card from the top of the pack. Once a player has a head card, he may add a body card and then a tail card. The player may collect up to three head cards before he starts adding body cards. should a farmer's wife card be picked up and some of the players mice have tails the player must return a tail card with the farmer's wife to the reject pack. If the players mice do not have any tails the farmer's wife is returned to the reject pack.

The game is finished when a player has in front of him three sets of Blind Mice.

title: Squails
description: A game close to that of Crokinole and Bowls or other Bocce-related games.  The object is to get your colored or otherwise marked Squails (round flat disks, usually 4 in number) as close to or touching the Procese/Jack (smaller diameter, but thicker and heavier flat disk) by setting your Squail on the edge of a table and striking it with the palm of your hand.  There is a version from House of Marbles in thier Around the World with Eight Great Games series, which details some terms to be used in the playing of Squails, such as To Flute-To strike a Squail or the Procese off the table and Excrunch-To hit an enemy Squail very hard.

title: Fullmetal Alchemist: Trading Card Game
types: Card Game Collectible Components Fantasy Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
An American designed trading card game based on the popular Fullmetal Alchemist animated television series.  Both players field teams searching locations for clues to the location of the philosopher's stone.  Each location specifies one of three statistics printed on the card which characters use to battle each other in an attempt to gain an advantage.

This game is not the same as the existing Japanese trading card game; it is a new design from a new company, Joyride Entertainment.

title: Holper Stolper
description:
Description by the publisher:

The animal scientist Bumby Stumble (Holper Stolper) has purchased new provisions and is on his way back to the research station. The most arduous part of the track is still in front of him: he has to drive the jeep with the precious load right through the rough jungle. That will only be possible if he watches carefully all the way and can avoid the potholes.

title: Warfighter 101: Movement to Contact
description:
Components: Four pages of color rules, four operations orders, two player aids describing the units, one sheet of mounted 7/8 counters (not die cut) and an 11x17 map (double-sided).

Game covers clashes at the National Training Center between a heavy battalion and an OPFOR motor rifle force.  Both sides have supporting artillery and helicopter assets attached.

Mechanics are straightforward with both players moving and then firing - damage takes effect after combat.  Fire is resolved by rolling a handful of dice, counting the hits and then subtracting the target's armor - units may be stunned, forced to retreat, take losses or be killed outright.  The advanced rules add a sort of opportunity fire where a unit may interfere with enemy movement by declaring it as a target (provided the enemy is within a certain distance).

The Operations Orders set up victory conditions and other effects (such as defensive positions) - thus, in a 2 player game, some information will not be shared between players.  A blank template for scenario creation is provided and blank forms may be downloaded from the publisher's website.

title: Triple Flips 3: Wild Animals
description:
Triple Flips 3 includes Save the Whale, Call of the Wild, and Cheetah Race.


     Save the Whale is a game for 2-4 players.  As the whale moves slowly around the outside of the main playfield, players try to exit the playfield directly on or adjacent to the whale, scoring 10 or 5 points respectively.  The goal is 25 points.  About 2/3 of the playfield's spaces have arrows depicting valid exit directions from that space.



     Cheetah Race is pretty much a rethemed, 2-player version of the solitaire game Curse of the Pyramid from Triple Flips 2: Monsters.  Each of you is racing agains your own time, as well as each other.



     Call of the Wild is a game of progress for 1 player.  You have four animals to progress along their respective tracks.  The tracks vary in length from 11 spaces to 19 spaces.  In ten turns, you try to get the four animals as close to the goal as possible.  Each turn, you roll the die, and choose an animal to move.  If you roll a 1, then you roll again, and move an animal double the second roll.

title: Lieber Augustin
description:
A game for 2 to 6 children Ages 5 and up

The game comes with 5 dice (each showing 2 balls, 2 rings and 2 skittles) and a deck of 33 cards. Each card shows a clown juggling a mixture of 5 balls, rings and skittles.

Three cards are dealt face up to the table and each player takes turns to try to win one card by throwing the five dice and obtaining symbols that match the symbols on one of the three cards. The player is given 3 tries and can roll any of the dice again at each try. If a player wins a card that shows five symbols that are all alike, the player gets an opportunity to win another card.

The player who wins the most cards wins the game.

title: The Dozens
description: Based on the classic urban pastime of exchanging Yo Mama jokes with your friends, this collectible trading card version features 150 different snaps, complete with point rankings. Challengers can compete by trying to outrank each other by having an audience decide which insults are the funniest. Rare Oooh! cards are randomly inserted into packs, allowing players to make up their own jokes.

title: Tactics
description:
From the rules:

Not a war game but a game of world strategy.

TACTICS duplicates actual world conditions today.  It places the player in the position of the head of some neutral or belligerent country and lets him use his own judgment as to how present international problems should be met and overcome.

TACTICS may be played by two belligerents, or by two belligerents and one or both neutrals.

The object for belligerents is to blockade opponent belligerent's SEAPORT and for neutrals to trade for profit.  Blockade is accomplished when a belligerent's SEAPORT is completely cut off from the sea.  Trade is accomplished when a SUPPLY SHIP is moved into another player's port.

Neutrals accumulate victory points through trade, but may be attacked by belligerents, which allows them to play a diplomatic protest card. If a third protest card is accepted (they can be dodged by paying a gold), then that neutral joins the war against the offending nation. Neutrals may try to provoke attacks in order to pile on and share the war loot with the victorious belligerent.

War is a game of manoeuver: battleships kill transports easily, but killing a battleship requires getting two friendly battleships on opposite sides of the target. Each nation has two planes, but these only come into play through chance cards, as do submarines (each of which lurks in a particular square of the board and kills an enemy ship that moves onto the square).

title: Viking Adventure
mechanisms: Card DraftingDice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
The Viking Adventure Game is an award winning historical game that is both fun and educational for the entire family. Learn the history and mythology of the Vikings as you sail your ship to far-off lands, conquering countries and winning treasures. Follow the treasure map to sgrd, the fabled home of the Norse Gods. Ride the rainbow bridge to seek your destiny as the Gods influence the outcome of your fate.

Up to 6 players, of all ages, can play this game at the same time. The game features playing pieces in the form of 6 different miniature replicas of real historical ships: the Fram, the Griffin, the Kon Tiki, the Oseberg, the Skuldelev and the Viking. The game comes with a ships log detailing the fantastic historical voyages these great ships made. It will be cherished by your family for years and years to come

The game also features 6 decorative treasure chests to store your loot during game play, and neatly store the ship playing pieces when you are finished playing. Also included are Norse coin replicas, colorful playing cards, a treasure map game board and more. Viking Adventures compiles research from dozens of renowned sources to create a fun and memorable learning tool for the entire family.

title: Mortality
description:
From the publisher:

Mortality is an uplifting LDS board game about life rather than strictly a church game. It isn't made to teach a list of facts about the gospel. Instead, gospel principles are woven into the very fabric of the game. It doesn't give any advantage to the scriptorians or historians. Succeeding at the game requires cooperation, caring for other players, knowing how to build a solid foundation in one's youth, and an understanding of how faith and testimony help you endure trials, and any player who approaches the game in this manner can win.

The game is great at fostering friendly interaction among the players. Even the losers enjoy it, because they tend to end up being the focus of charitable efforts by the other players. Succeeding at the game requires strategy, luck, and advance planning. It teaches LDS values, including the importance of building a foundation that will withstand the adversities of life, the value that hardships can have in building testimony, and the benefits of selfless service. Yes, there is competition in Mortality, because there is a winner, and that's a big part of the entertainment value. But a great part of the fun is in the joking that surrounds the dealing together with experiences and trials in the game that are so much a part of life, but are presented in a somewhat humorous way.

Mortality takes about an hour to an hour-and-a-half to play, depending on the experience and luck of the players. It requires a minimum of three players and up to six can play. Young children can be helped to play the game, but truly understanding it requires an age of at least eight.

You start the game in the childhood section. Here you gain points or Testimonies as they are called, strictly by chance, based on what your family does. From there you enter the youth section. As a youth, you begin making decisions on your own that can help you later on or be a detriment to your later progress. You can serve as an LDS missionary, go on dates, and either get a civil marriage or a temple marriage. Avoiding a civil marriage may require some careful advance planning in order to avoid landing on the civil marriage square. From there you move into the adult section. One player gets to be the bishop. This assignment may pass from player to player depending on what happens in the game. As you move around in the adult section, you encounter trials of faith. Depending on how many Testimonies you already have, these trials can hurt you or help you. You also have an opportunity to help other players, for which you will gain even more Testimonies. The first player with 150 Testimonies finishes mortality and is the winner.

title: Chessgammon
description:
The aim of the game is to land your 4 kings on any 4 squares of the same color in the center of the board.  Pieces are moved according to the throw of the dice.  Captured pawns are removed from the board.  Captured kings are placed back on their home squares.

Unrelated to Chessgammon.

title: History of the Samurai
description: A new game using the same system as the Ragnar/Avalon Hill History of the World game, but covering Japan's history, and the rise and fall of feudal clans.

title: Square on Sale
description:
Square on Sale combines elements of Othello, an auction game, and Manhattan.  Players bid for the right to build stories of buildings on different blocks.  However, in a manner very reminiscent of Othello, when you build in two different blocks, you also get to add a floor of your color to any building in between.  When the game ends, the player who owns the top floor of the building scores all of the points.  The components are mostly wood, and of good quality, but this is clearly a scratch-built game.

1st Place 2005 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb.

title: Project A-KO Fighter
types: Card Game Fighting Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Based upon the Japanese anime Project A-Ko, the game tries to re-create the endless battles between A-Ko and B-Ko for the friendship of C-Ko.

Project A-KO fighter is a card game based upon the mechanics found in the card game Heavy Gear fighter and Video fighter. The games are even compatible with one another.

This particular game is made of 36 different playing cards that were included in the Project A-Ko: The Roleplaying game book. Included in the roleplaying book were two different character sheets (one for B-KO and one for A-KO), that needed to be photocopied in order to keep track of the progress of players during the game. Their number of action points left, their remaining health, etc. as well as being used as a reference sheet for the various special powers each character had.

The game was meant as a stand-alone card-game that could also be played within the boundaries of the role-playing game as a player's aid for the game. Players were encouraged to describe verbally how exactly their characters attacked the other using a particular card. It provided those players that described the action behind a card play with special bonuses to their character's statistics, such as increased delivered damage to their opponent.

Also included in the book were various other characters that could be used against B-Ko and A-Ko, such as ordinary persons, tanks, mechas and spaceships, which could bring the game to more than 2 players (to an infinite number if needed), although no character-ready sheets was made available for them in the RPG book.

title: Denk mal
description: Denk mal is Mastermind turned into a word game. Each of the two players chooses a word and notes some clues about the word on his pegboard. Then the pegboards are exchanged and every player tries to come up with the word of the other player.  Whoever guesses the word of the opponent first wins the round.

title: Jubilee
description:
A game released to coincide with the golden jubilee of the reign of King George III of Great Britain, who came to the throne in 1760. The game board consists of a spiral track. The spaces contain pictures showing events which took place during the reign of George. These include his wedding, the birth of his children, various wars (with Spain, France, and the American colonies), the discovery of the source of the Blue Nile, riots in England, the founding of Botany Bay, the kings first alarming illness (1788), and the abolition of the slave trade among other events.

One of the many games inspired by the Royal Game of Goose, described in RC Bell's Board and Table Games of Many Civilizations.

Players race down a spiral track, all starting from different corners, collecting rewards and paying fines. The first player to reach the middle space, Jubilee, wins. The Jubilee space depicts George III on his throne.

title: CardChess
description:
In this chess variant for up to 4 players, the game is played on a 10x10 board with four suits of sixteen cards corresponding to traditional chess pieces.

Four games can be played with this set.

Cardchess: Players shuffle the 16 cards of their suit and place them randomly face down in eight pairs of two on the letters A, R, D, C, H, E, S and S. Each player has two moves each turn. They first turn over a card. Second, they pick any face up card and move it according to chess rules. To win the game, a player must capture all of his opponents' Kings by checkmate. Once a King is captured, all the pieces from his team are removed from the board.

Positional Cardchess: The only difference between Cardchess and Positional Cardchess is the initial setup. In Positional Cardchess, the eight cards of highest value are placed face down on letters A, R, D, C, H, E, S and S in the same order as traditional chess.

Memory Cardchess: All player cards are shuffled together and placed face down on the board in a configuration which depends on the number of players. On each turn, players have two moves. They first turn over a card. The card remains face up if it is in their suit. If it isn't, the card must be clearly shown to other players so they can memorize it. Second, players move the card they just turned over or any other previously exposed card according to chess rules. To win the game, a player must capture all of his opponents' Kings by checkmate.

Traditional chess: The game board and cards allow to play a traditional game of chess.

title: Choo Choo: The Number Color Train Game
description: All players start with an engine and a track.  Players spin for a number, take the corresponding car and place it behind their engine.  If the corresponding car is at the end of another player's train, the car is removed from the opponent's train and placed on the player's track.  The winner is the first player to get 5 cars on his track behind the engine.

title: Word War: Competitive Crossword Game
description:
From the box,

It's a war of words as players use vocabulary skills and the turn of a card to compose words, letter by letter.  Players rack up points as letters merge and cross, forming completed words. The more word power, the higher a players score.

Contains 9 wipe off boards, 4 felt tip pens and 54 letter cards.

title: The Second Korean War: 2009
description:
From the website:

Learning from their mistakes from the 1950's, the North Koreans are set to launch another invasion of the South all along the 38th parallel in order to bring about reunification under Kim Jong Il's rule. With the United States heavily committed across the globe, the North feels it cannot lose. Will the communists drive the Allies into the sea or will the American and South Koreans press on past the Yalu and bring total peace to the region?

With this, you'll get the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc. While you'll need to provide the pieces from various sources - of which those will be clearly obvious. This involves the use of most Axis  Allies components with some extras as denoted.

title: Cuban Missile Crisis: 1962
description:
From the website:

Thirteen days in October 1962 nearly brought the world to the brink of thermonuclear war. Fortunately, with a combination of political maneuvering and luck, President Kennedy resisted his advisor's  insistence for invasion and finally convinced Nikita Khrushchev to remove the Soviet nuclear missiles in Cuba in exchange for removal of US Jupiter missiles in Turkey. What would have happened if no agreement had been reached? What form would the US invasion of Cuba have taken if Kennedy had listened to his advisor's? What would the Soviet response be? Time to find out!

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis  Allies or related games.

title: Vietnam Conflict: 1969
description:
From the website:

The US was engaged in the Vietnam Conflict from the late 1950s until the mid 1970s costing the lives of over 60,000 Americans and over 3,000,000 North Vietnamese, thus being the first American defeat in war. What if the American military had decided to launch an invasion of North Vietnam to force them to sue for peace? Could things have turned out differently or would things have been made even worse?

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis  Allies or related games.

title: Operation Iraqi Freedom: 2003
description:
From the website:

Operation: Iraqi Freedom 2003 took only three weeks for the Coalition to conquer Baghdad thus bringing the tyrannical reign of Saddam Hussein to a close. It seemed that the demoralized army in Iraq had no chance against the superiority of American technology. Or did it? Could Saddam have held out against the United States, inflicting unexpected loss of life that would send weak-kneed diplomats to sue for peace? Or would the United States finish the job by not only removing Saddam, but eliminating all foreign fighters and resistance units thorough the country and securing Iraq as the first democracy in the region?

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis  Allies or related games.

title: The Balkans 1999
description:
From the website:

NATO air strikes have failed to stop the mass killings in Kosovo or force the Milosovic government to sue for peace. NATO and US forces feel that the only way to stop the ethnic cleansing in Kosovo is to launch a ground campaign against Serbian forces to not only liberate Kosovo, but to bring about regime change in the Milosovic government. Meanwhile in the east, Russia refuses to sit idle while an old ally is attacked by outsiders and begins to bring volunteer forces into the area. Who will win this showdown in the Balkans?

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis  Allies or related games.

title: Axis of Evil 2007
description:
From the website:

Angered by continued American influence around the world, Russia, China, and the newly formed International Islamic Alliance ally themselves together to become the next superpowers of the world. There is only one way for them to bring their nations to the status of greatness: WAR! Once again the United States and the European Union stand together to defend liberty and freedom from the new Axis of Evil, but will it be enough? From Aegis destroyers to Chemical SCUDs and from Close Air Support to Nuclear Weapons, the world is at war with the most destructive modern weapons any nation has possessed.

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis  Allies or related games.

title: World War III: 1988
description:
From the website:

With a brief but deadly skirmish between NATO and Warsaw Pact forces on the border of Germany quickly expanding, Soviet generals see their chance to bring war to NATO forces and destroy the alliance once and for all and bring all of Europe under the Soviet flag. With approximately 20,000 Soviet-made tanks in Europe and over 1 million men under arms moving into the Fulda gap and other choke points along West Germany, NATO may be in for the fight of its very existence as each nation involved as both hunter and prey. Based on the first three novels of the series, WW III by Ian Slater.

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis  Allies or related games.

title: World War III: Arctic Front – 1989
description:
From the website:

World War III is over. Or is it? Moscow has surrendered, but Siberia defies the cease-fire, and General Freeman must eliminate the threat of nuclear warfare and launch a bloody ground assault through the frozen Siberian tundra. However, the icy waters of Lake Baikal conceal a deadly weapon that will determine the fate of millions. In addition, Siberia has enlisted the aid of China to hit the American-led UN force in a deadly suprise attack. Based on the 4th and 5th novels, WW III: Arctic Front and WW III: Warshot, of the WW III saga by Ian Slater.

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis  Allies or related games.

title: Warbeast
description:
Warbeast is first self-produced game created and illustrated by Angelo Porazzi in 1998. 
The game is an alternative system of play of Warangel, 1st edition in Italy in 1996 as collectible issues. 
Warbeast System is more suitable for multi-player and beginners, designed to be an easy and fast Family Game. 
Warbeast Box includes the 4th Generation of Warangel, a rulebook split into 3 levels to allow children and beginners to easily approach this universe. 
In the box you have a complete game compatible with Warangel, which includes nine warrior races plus the Warbeasts, which are deadly creatures that you may fight or control. 
On 2006, with Warangel 10  Years Edition, 100 compatible warriors races are available and two systems of play: Warangel and Warbeast. Choose your race and the system you prefer and you'll experience fantastic matches with warriors and battlefields always new. 
In Warangel 10 Years Edition find all adaptations and the pre-cut laminated counters of all these warriors as a bonus, exactly with the shape of standard Warangel counters.

Integrates with:

    Warangel

title: Nacht der Diebe
description:
(from the back of the box)

During the day, Kashmar is a peaceful town. Trading is prospering. The numerous pubs are packed. On the streets, live is pulsating. The inhabitants are wealthy and content. But when daylight is replaced by the dark of the night, the night of the thieves has started.

Night of the thieves is a fast and exciting game full of surprises. Each player is the master of a guild of thieves and sends his fellow thieves to rob the most valuable treasures in the city. Good planning and a little luck are necessary to be successful. The biggest treasures go the master of the guild that can trust his instincts...

Contents:

1 rulebook
 24 dice
  6 location cards
 66 playing cards
150 playing pieces (wooden discs)

Playing time: 2 - 3 hours
Number of players: 3 - 6
Age: from 12

Tactics: 3 (on a scale from 1 to 6)
Entertainment: 6 (on a scale from 1 to 6)
Interaction: 5 (on a scale from 1 to 6)

title: An Eccentric Excursion to the Chinese Empire
description:
The game is a race from England to China via Europe, North Africa, and India between four players travelling by steamboat, the railway, a flying machine, or on foot.

Players are randomly assigned to one of four possible methods/tracks to get to China: Steamboat, Walker, Aerial Machine and Railway. Those tracks cross each other permanently on their way to China. Players do not remain always on the same track but move according to the throw of a four sided tee-totum. As in many Victorian games, there's also a system of fines/rewards. The first player to reach the end of the track wins the pool.

title: ¡No Pasaran!: Las Batallas por Madrid 1936-37
description:
Although the rules are dated 1991, the cover is dated 1995.  I gather this is a reprint.

960 counters, rules in Spanish but with English translation provided.

This is the first in LudoPress' Serie Guerra Civil Espaola (volumen 1).  Also in this series

Mallorca 1936
Balaguer 1938

and a soon to be released C.T.V. - Guadalajara 1937 (serie Guerra Civil Espaola volumen 2).

Adapted from LudoPress web site:

This series gives a detailed tactical-operational treatment to several battles of the civil conflict. The level of detail is high for aspects such as supply, combat or organic organization of divisions/army corps, but the system always uses mechanisms as simple and intuitive as possible.

The objective with this series was to give the Spanish Civil War a specific treatment. Until then, what most designers in Spain and abroad did to simulate SCW battles was simply to adapt systems designed for WW2 games. No Pasarn! is a system specifically designed to show the peculiar features and differences of the civil war with respect to other conflicts, especially the First and Second World Wars.

title: ¡No Pasaran!: La Quinta del Biberon – Balaguer 1938
types: Civil War Expansion for Base-game Wargame
description:
Alea Magazine issue 27, along with Gamonal 1808.

Another scenario for Ludopress' ¡No Pasaran!: Las Batallas por Madrid 1936-37 system on the Spanish Civil War.

title: Where Art Thou?
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Memory Trivia
description:
An artistic twist on four classic games: use these full-color cards depicting details of thirty-six paintings from eleven American museums, along with the accompanying fold-out game sheet 10x25 printed with full black and white painting of each detail shown in the 36 pairs of cards, to play concentration, bingo, trivia, mix-and-match/parent and child, and other variations.

For two or more players; Ages 3 and up.

title: I.Q. Challenge
description:
A lateral thinking game in which players draw puzzle cards and attempt to solve them before the timer runs out.  Each puzzle has a score which is proportionally related to its difficulty - harder questions equal more points.

Play solo, or against as many individuals or teams as you want.

title: Dave Campbell's X-tra Bases Baseball Game
description:
From the box:

ESPN-TV's Dave Campbell has created what many are calling the best baseball boardgame ever.

- Hours of fun for the entire family.

- Use your own baseball cards and the stats on the back in X-TRA BASES.

- Exciting Baseball trivia with two levels of questions (so any) baseball fan can play X-TRA BASES.

- Choose your own team of All-Stars or play your favorite team against their rivals.

title: Star Fleet Battles: Module C2 – New Worlds 2
types: Expansion for Base-game Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

This module adds rules, ships, and scenarios for the Andromedans, Neo-Tholians, and ISC.

title: Star Fleet Battles: Module C1 – New Worlds 1
Star Fleet Battles: Module C3 – New Worlds 3
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

This module adds rules, ships, and scenarios for the Tholians, Andromedans, WYN, LDR, and Seltorians.

title: Star Fleet Battles: Module F1 – The Jindarians
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

This module adds rules, ships, and scenarios for the Jindarians.

Publisher Blurb:

The Jindarians have been in space, flying huge ships built from hollow asteroids, for 100,000 years. They care little about borders, governments, and wars and just travel from system to system, mining asteroid belts. They push aside any competition using their warp augmented railguns to fire thousands of cubic meters of gravel and rock at your ship. This is the 2005 update of the original 1995 product with extra SSDs and several rules changes.

title: Star Fleet Battles: Module J – Fighters
Star Fleet Battles: Module K – Fast Patrol Ships
types: Expansion for Base-game Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

This module adds rules, ships, and scenarios for Fast Patrol Ships and PF Tenders for all races.

title: Star Fleet Battles: Module R1 – Bases & Auxiliaries
Excuse Me!  A Game of Manners for Children
description: Contents include twelve white question cards, 36 small, numbered correct-answer slips and 76 small, unnumbered incorrect-answer slips.  When you answer a question correctly, you move that many spaces.  Play this game and learn to be polite!

title: Fantastic Four vs. Dr. Doom Game
Over and Out
description:
Over and Out is a variation on Lobo 77 and Blackjack.

From the publisher's site:

OVER AND OUT is the exciting numbers game for players of all ages. (It's a fun way for kids to learn adding and subtracting, too!). Add your cards to the pile, but don't go over the Tip Top limit. As the numbers add up, so does the excitement. Last player in the game wins! Use some strategy, along with a little luck, to put your opponents OVER AND OUT!

title: Fire Brigade
description: Fire  Brigade is a World War II miniatures game, played at the platoon/company level with each inch representing 100 yards and turns which span ten minutes. Fire Brigade offers an innovative combat system based around the concept of combat cohesion rather than actual casualties. With rules covering para-drops, amphibious invasions, off-board artillery, and airpower, Fire Brigade allows players to replay any Pacific or European battle that occurred during World War Two.

title: Bible Brainstorm
description:
Combining five of your favorite games into one, Bible Brainstorm is never boring and always outrageous! Players move around the board using at least one of their God-given talents to win the game.

Categories include music, word puzzles, drawing, trivia and charades. The ultimate in level playing fields, so anyone can win!

title: Millennium Vacation
description:
The millennium is upon us and everything has gone haywire.

Power shortages cause the airports, gas stations, banks and others to be out of service.

Can you get to grandma and grandpa's house for their 50th anniversary, and then back home?

Play Millennium Vacation and find out!

Glow-In-The-Dark Millennium Vacation Family Board Game For 2-8 Players Ages 10 and up.
