Each turn players roll the dice. The number rolled represents the amount of squares that the player can use to move his marbles. Only 1 base color is permitted to move per dice roll. To his choice, the player can move as he pleases the 2 marbles (if possible) of the same base color.

A player can push more than 1 marble.
A player cannot push his own marbles directly. He has to do it by pushing the opponents marbles(s) on his own.
A marble moved cannot end up on the same square it started its turn on, unless it has pushed one of the opponent's marbles before ending on this square.
The center square is made up of 4 distinctive squares. A marble has to be pushed to make a move in the center square.

When a marble is pushed in the center square, this marble is considered taken and cannot be used or moved directly. To take out a marble from the center square, one of the opponent's marbles will have to be pushed against it in order to push it out of the center square.

title: Addique
description: The game consists of 48 'cross' shaped tiles, with a number between 1 and 8 on each arm.  Players take it in turns to place a tile and score points if they can make numbers that are multiples of 9 (special score sheets are included to simplify this) using their tile and those adjacent.

title: Thomas' Tracks & Trestles Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Racing Trains
description:
Tracks and Trestles is a board game based on the popular children's television and book series, Thomas the Tank Engine.  Gameplay resembles Chutes N' Ladders, but with the familiar Thomas characters and a train racing theme.  Be the first to make it back to the sheds to be the winner!

Game includes:

1 Game board
1 Sir Topham Hat Spinner
6 Cardboard stand-up characters
6 Plastic stands

title: A Game of Thrones: A Storm of Swords Expansion
types: Bluffing Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Negotiation Novel-based Political
mechanisms: Area MovementAuction/BiddingCampaign / Battle Card DrivenPlayer EliminationSimultaneous Action SelectionVariable Player Powers
description:
From the Publisher's Website:
Storm of Swords is the second expansion to A Game of Thrones: The Board Game!

This new expansion includes rules and components for the following:


     A new variant game with a new map, pitting Houses Stark, Lannister, Greyjoy, and Baratheon against one another for control of King's Landing and the Riverlands. 
     The new claim based concept challenges to take control over Westeros not only militarily but also politically.
     New neutral houses to sway to your cause in the variant game, including House Arryn, House Frey, House Tyrell, and the many brigands, mercenaries, and broken men that people Westeros! 
     Powerful new tactics cards for use in both the variant and classic games. 
     New, alternate Westeros decks. 
     Robb Stark, Jaime Lannister, and many others take the field directly with the new Leader rules, including two Leaders for every house (including Martell), for use in both the variant and classic games. Take hostages and execute prisoners for the first time! 
     New House cards for every house (including Martell), for use in both the variant and classic games. 
     A new deck of Wildling cards, making each Wildling assault a unique event! 



A Storm of Swords requires the main A Game of Thrones Board Game to play. It is entirely compatible with the A Clash of Kings expansion, but does not require that expansion to be enjoyed.

title: Bolton Bonanza
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
BOLTON BONANZA is one of a series of Monopoly style board game developed by local YMCAs in the UK to generate funds for their activities. The games in the series are essentially the same, but as in the different versions of Monopoly, the board and the businesses are specifically themed to the town or city represented in the title - in this case the City of BOLTON in the North-West of England.

Players progress around the board as a result of the roll of 2D6. When landing on a Company square a player may purchase a share in that company (there are two shares available in each company), if he wishes. If not he may put the share up for auction, with any excess over the sale price being retained by that player as his fee for being the auctioneer.

Players landing on companies that are already owned must pay to visit, with the payment due being based on how many shares are owned in that particular company and in the other two companies in the same colour series. Since shares can be owned by two different players both may demand payment from a visitor.

Certain squares on the board require the drawing of a Chance card which normally result in income being received from or paid to the bank.

The New Share Quotations square results in the changing of share prices for some of the blocks of companies. This will result in players losing or gaining money on the shares that they own. It also requires players to put up one of their shares for auction thereby permitting players to trade in shares.

The game can be ended in three ways, which should be decided before the game starts:
- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.
- When all but one player has gone bankrupt.

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.

mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:

- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.

- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.

title: Hooked On Hereford
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
HOOKED ON HEREFORD is one of a series of Monopoly style board game developed by local YMCAs in the UK to generate funds for their activities. The games in the series are essentially the same, but as in the different versions of Monopoly, the board and the businesses are specifically themed to the town or city represented in the title - in this case the City of Hereford in the West of England on the border with Wales.

Players progress around the board as a result of the roll of 2D6. When landing on a Company square a player may purchase a share in that company (there are two shares available in each company), if he wishes. If not he may put the share up for auction, with any excess over the sale price being retained by that player as his fee for being the auctioneer.

Players landing on companies that are already owned must pay to visit, with the payment due being based on how many shares are owned in that particular company and in the other two companies in the same colour series. At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.

title: Lucy's Tea Party Game
description: A very large game which has a large picture of Lucy on the cover, and smaller pictures of the gang playing the game. Came with a large vinyl play mat, plastic serving tray, four plastic tea cups, tea pot, and plastic sugar cubes. Players actually filled up their cups with water, and as sugar cubes were awarded through the game, put them in their cups until they overflowed. First player whose cup overflowed was the winner.

title: Do the Urkel!
description:
From the back of the box:

There's lots of crazy fun when you get to be TV's favorite nerd - Steve Urkel! The challenge is to collect bow tie cards. To win them, roll a special die. To keep them, do what Steve does - like hike up your pants....laugh and snort...or say one of his favorite expressions! But watch out! Any opponent may suddenly make you DO THE URKEL - and that could lose you some cards. The first player to collect 8 cards wins!

Includes gameboard, 1 6-sided special die, 1 plastic die-rolling tray, 29 bow tie cards, 1 pair of cardboard glasses, 1 cardboard finger puppet, and instructions

title: Control Your Destiny
description: In Control players try to get four of their eight pyramids directly to the other side of the board. The control element in the game is the fact that once a pyramid is on top of any other pyramid the covered pyramid can't be moved until the top one is moved off.

title: Revlon's $64,000 Question Quiz Game
description:
Based on televisions sensational quiz game.

From the rules:

The $64,000 Question Quiz Game is and educational and entertaining game for children and adults based on the popular television program. There are 12 different categories, each containing 55 questions with a grand total of 660 questions. They begin at a simple level for $64 and become increasingly difficult on the climb to the $64,000 question. Any number of players can play.

title: Musée du Louvre
description:
Subtitle: Jeu des trois dimensions - Lettres, Chiffres, Images

Contents: 72 cards of which three jokers and 69 cards containing a letter, a number and a picture of art belonging to the Louvre museum. (e.g. there is a card depicting Mona Lisa, containing letter R and number 11)

The target of the game is to make up the name
muse du louvre, taking into account the three dimensions of the game:


     lettres = the word muse du louvre must be laid out in order



     numbers = the first card must have number 1, the second number 2 etc. This is only important for letters that occur more than once, e.g the u and e



     pictures = no picture may appear twice while constructing the word


A turn consists of picking up a new card, and putting one down, either on the discard pile or for constructing the word muse du louvre. You are also allowed to replace a card already laid out with another one from your hand.

Players start with 4 cards in their hand.

Jokers can be used to replace a card TEMPORARILY, i.e. by the end of the game a player must have replaced all his jokers with the corresponding cards.

First player to make the word is the winner, other players total the numbers in their hand; after a few rounds, the winner is the player who accumulated the least points.

title: Playmaker's Hockey
description:
Playmaker's Hockey is an exciting stat-based hockey simulation.

It differs from Strat-o-matic in that players actually move the puck up the ice and into the offensive zone.  This game has a great feel and flow to it and accurately depicts that action on the ice and recreates the stats of the many real historical seasons that have been produced.

title: Sorry! Madagascar Edition
types: Animals Children's Game Dice Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: The classic Game of Sweet Revenge with a theme from the animated film Madagascar.

title: Palabres
types: Card Game Educational Real-time Word Game
description:
This is a game where you have to form words. Three letters are randomly turned over and then you have to make words in which the letters are used in the order they were drawn.

For instance if the letters drawn were A T E, you can make the words AfTErnoon, AlTErnative, AnoThEr,....

For each word you can make you get a token. The one who has the most words gets a bonus. Winner is the one with the most tokens at the end of the game.

title: Hoopla
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverPoint to Point Movement
description:
Unique mid-sixties contraption/dexterity game.  The box is large (approx 21 x 15 x 4).

Prior to play the contraption is assembled.  A spinner at the base of the contraption directs the action of players at they attempt to collect small plastic colored hoops of varying values from the end of a plastic chute, using a unicyclist.  The unicyclist moves around a circular 'trapeze' wire by manipulating the angle of the circle using handles which are attached to the device.  The plastic chute in which the hoops are placed is located at the top of the contraption; gravity replaces captured hoops at the chute opening.  Hoops are worth 10 (red), 50 (black) or 100 (blue) points, depending on the diameter of the hoop hole.

There are two settings on the contraption - 'EASY' and 'HARD'.  Players have the opportunity to acquire opponents' hoops during the game if they manage to get the unicyclist to collect hoops when on the 'HARD' setting.  Hoops equal to the value collected by the player on that turn are taken from opponents in any combination.

If either hoops or the unicyclist fall from the contraption during a player's turn, they are penalized.

When all hoops have been collected from the chute by the unicyclist, scores are tallied and the player with the highest score is the winner.

title: Bargain Hunt: The Game
description: This game is based on a popular BBC game show entitled Bargain Hunt.  Players buy antiques from the Antiques Fair and try to sell them for a profit at auction utilizing Auction Event cards and the luck of the dice.

title: Raise the Roof The Board Game
description:
Based on the ITV series. Players move round the board, asking questions when landing on specific squares. All players except the questioner and any excluded from the question, anyone getting the question right gets their stake from the questioner, anyone getting it wrong loses their stake to the questioner.

All questions are multiple choice but you cannot use an answer previously read out after the next answer is read, and the questioner may give the three answers in any order.

Stakes are of compulsory value but can be raised at various points in the game. Player with the most money when someone lands on the End square wins.

title: Potala
description:
A Strategy Game for Enlightened Minds

For over 1,000 years, Tibet's Potala Palace has been a center of knowledge, meditation and peace. As the seat of the Tibetan government, Potala has been the home of Dalai Lamas, Tibetan Kings and countless generations of Buddhist monks.

Deep within the Palace is a Secret Garden where Buddhist Elders bring student monks to test them in the arts of focus, meditation and concentration. On the floor of the garden is etched a grid of 312 squares. Here, 2-4 students at a time are challenged to place colored stones on the grid, with the ultimate goal of placing more stones than the others. Their work is guided by two deceptively simple rules...

In addition, as the stones are placed, an Elder walks silently around the perimeter of the garden, keeping a tally of all he sees...

Online Play


     Cycloops (turn-based)

title: Hexagonal Chess
description:
Over the years a number of chess variants have been proposed for boards featuring hexagonally shaped cells (commonly called hexes). The most popular of these is Hexagonal Chess which was invented in 1936 by Wladyslaw Glinski of Poland.

David Pritchard says, in the Encyclopedia of Chess Variants, that Glinski's game is played by over half-a-million people, mostly in Eastern Europe.

title: Het Grote Sprookjes & Legenden spel
description:
A quiz about tales and legends.

Each player gets a fairytale card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the fairytale card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the fairytale card. 
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

title: The Pitch! TV Edition
description:
From the Publisher:

The Pitch: TV Edition: Step into the role of a TV Executive competing to get your shows on the air. Combine Character, Plot, and Twist cards into broadcast classics like Vampy the Buffalo Slayer, Swapping Pants, and Pokechu Bites Again! The player whose shows get the most laughs will beat out the competition and walk away with millions, but only if they can keep their audience! This game is designed for 5 or more players, Ages 8 and up.

title: Felithian Finance
description: Felithian Finance is a game of stock accumulation, coupled with a 6 by 6 grid upon which corporate markers are played. Players are dealt 4 cards from a deck of 110 cards. There are 10 shares each of 10 corporations. Each player's turn consists of buying a new share and playing a corporate tile on the 6 by 6 board. Tiles on the board increase the value of shares held. By judiciously playing tiles, players can augment the value of the corporations they control and thwart the growth of the holdings of others. Dice are rolled to determine if dividends are played. Eventually the game comes to an end and the player with the most galactic credits (money) is the winner.

title: All About Town: The Game of the Racine Area
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingDice RollingPlayer EliminationRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock Holding
description:
All About Town: The Game of the Racine Area is a localized monopoly clone where the players move around a board trying to acquire 8 travel cards while stopping at popular locations in the Racine, Wisconsin area.

The players pawns, money, game territories, travel cards and surprise cards all contain advertisement from local area business.  The box also contains 2 sheets of 12 coupons for free goods and services from local businesses.

The layout of the game board and other game components could easily be changed for any other city that wanted their own board game.

In fact, the family on the cover is playing the game on a board with a completely different design.

title: LETTERIP
description:
From the instructions:

Use the exciting combination of scrambled letters, fast clues and definitions to find the original word.

Step 1. Mix the cards up in each separate group

Step 2. each players draws a card from the 4 letter word category

Step 3. every player makes up a new work from the word theyve picked

Step 4. First player begins by telling everyone their newly created work

Step 5. All other players must guess in 90 seconds what word first player originally picked

Step 6. A clue will be given every 30 seconds

Step 7. Record Points

Step 8. Move to next player, then advance to next level

---

In a nut shell there are 10 levels of cards 4 letters through 13 letters.  The object of the game is to use as many letters as possible on your clue card to make a new word.

Scoring is based on how many letters from the clue word are used in the new word, excluding any added letters and how quickly the word was guessed.

Every round all players play with words of the same length, advancing to longer words at the beginning of every new round.

An example card:
4 letter
Knob : A small rounded handle

title: County Stadium Pro Baseball Game
description:
This is a simple dice rolling baseball game that is localized to a specific field.

There are 21 possible dice combinations that each have a specific game effect.

For example rolling a:
 3  4 = Strike out
 2  5 = Bunt Single
 1  6 = Error - All runners advance one base

The box art and field art are unique to the featured stadium, in this case the Brewers old County Stadium that existed from 19531999.

title: 3-D Game Board
description:
This is actually four games in one:

Four Straight - 3-D Tic-Toe variant for up to 4 people. Indicates no tie ever on record ;-)

Triple Check: a 3-D checkers variant. For 2 players.

Space Pirate: A 3-D chase game - evidently similar to farmer and the Pig. For 2 players.

Space Chess: This really is the rules only as it states in the rules that the chess pieces are not included.

The board consists of 4 clear plastic shelves of 4 levels. There are marbles that sit in holes of these shelves in 4 colors.

Quite hard to find.

title: Ad.dic'tion
description: A simple but somewhat clever word game. The players alternate turns placing cards with letters on them on the board, creating an ever-longer string of letters. Strangely enough, the object is to avoid spelling an actual word. However, the string of letters must always be such that it could conceivably be made into an actual word by adding more letters. The round is awarded to a player if either her opponent plays a card making the string of letters into a word, or if she catches her opponent making a play that eliminates all possible words that could be made from the string of letters.

title: Tally-Ho
description:
Tally-Ho: for 2-5 players - is a game of chance and observation. Tiles are all face-down on the board to start with, and as each player turns a tile over, points can be scored when certain combinations of numbers or colors are observed by them.

Tally-Lo: is a variation of Tally-Ho with the aim o get the lowest score.

Pyramid: is a game for one player. The aim is to take down a pyramid of number-tiles, from the bottom, by removing sets of tiles that add up to a specific target number. Can be played at different challenge levels.

Elimination: is a game for one player, with Target Numbers. It is played on the Tally-Ho board. the aim is to choose and add up a Chain of tiles, which total the same as the 
target Number.

50/50  Hindsight: is a pair of games for one player using all four basic mathematical functions: + - x divided by. It is played with the tiles face down and Hindsight follows, on the same board, with all the tiles turned face up. The aim is to reduce a running total from the starting number of 50 using addition, subtraction, multiplication and division to reach reach zero.

Number-Path: is a game for one player who uses the four mathematical functions as above to create an equation along a vertical or horizontal 7 tiles on the Tally-Ho board, where the equation results in the value of the 7th tile.

title: Agoniz'n
description:
Game play is an almost identical clone to   Aggravation, although only 4 players may play.  However, the board is compressed plywood, making it a true Board Game.  The sounds of marbles hitting the wood is unforgettable.

Players move their five marbles around the board from Home to Finish. Lucky die rollers can make use of the shortcut spaces to speed movement.  Players can not pass their own marbles and landing on any one else's marbles sends the landed-on marble back to Home where it must start again.  First player to get all five pieces to Finish wins.

Since a 1 or a 6 are required to start a marble on its path, an optional house rule is that no one can jump your only marble if they have another choice, unless it is your last marble.  A shorter version can be played using three or four marbles.

title: The Wild Seed Game
types: Children's Game Educational Environmental Farming Memory
mechanisms: Card DraftingMemoryPattern BuildingPoint to Point Movement
description:
This Ampersand Press game is an innovative nature game for children. 
It requires no reading. 
There are four different games that can be played at multiple levels. 
Wild Seed teaches children about life cycles and gives them an awareness of the environmental conditions needed to stimulate plants. 
The game stimulates interaction and discussion with a beautifully illustrated game board and action cards. There are color spots to designate movement around the game board, and a storybook that can be read to the child to introduce plant science. 
Also included are additional learning activities. This game will intrigue your children and they will learn a great deal. 
They can play in small groups with adults and have a great time with follow-up activities. 
They learn why some seeds grow and others dont.

It is an excellent and socially responsible game in terms of its theme and in the way it helps children to learn about nature.

Game Description:
Play the Wild Seed Game for fun, fast-paced action, and strategy! Learn about wild seeds and what helps them grow. Find out why some seeds make it and others don't.
 Pick a card and move your playing piece ahead or back and be the first to move your seeds through the seasons to home.

Contents:
96 Action Cards
Game Board
12 Playing Pieces
Rules for playing 4 Games with multiple levels of strategy
Wild Seed Story
Parent and Teacher discussion topics

Dr. Toy Award 2003

title: WWE DVD Board Game
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Negotiation Sports
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionSimulation
description:
From the game:

WWE DVD Board Game by SBG.

World Wrestling Entertainment presents a DVD Board Game experience that puts you and your friends behind the desk of a WWE Manager, Purchase Superstars to build your stable into a dynasty and try to collect all the Titles from either Raw or Smackdown to be declared General Manager. Grab the mike and call out your long time rival! Have a Cage, No Holds Barred or an I quit match for the WWE title. Use a foreign object to gain the upper hand.

Each DVD board game comes with:

    WWE cash
    WWE Game Board
    3D WWE Ring
    8 different games of new WWE DVD content
    23 Raw and 23 Smackdown Superstars
    3 Red and 3 Blue dice
    WWE Shop Cards
    WWE Chaos Cards
    WWE Score Belts
    Championship title Pieces




Re-implemented by:

    WWE DVD Board Game (2nd Edition)

title: SAD... The Game of Depression
description:
Welcome to Depression... that lonely isolated room locked up in the back of your mind. Well somehow you're locked in it now and the only way out is by reaching the end of the tunnel. However, its not as easy as walking around. As you go through the tunnel you must collect mind tokens because in the end, only the one with the most mind tokens gets out.

Depression is the first boardgame to be released by MC Comics and can be downloaded for free here at BGG. All you need to do is download and print a single 8.5 by 11 file that contains both the board and the rules. Then all you need to get is a D6, D4, three pawns, and a few items like pennies to represent mind tokens. Once you have that you'll be ready to escape DEPRESSION...

title: The Battle of Guilford Courthouse: The Beginning of the End
types: Age of Reason American Revolutionary War Print & Play Wargame
description:
The Battle of Guilford Courthouse: The Beginning of the End, simulates the meeting between the forces of General Nathan Greene and Lord Earl Cornwallis. The player controls by moving counters across the map and combating enemy formations the American and British formations that fought in the battle. The maps, counters, and cards must be downloaded, printed, and cut out before play. The maps must be trimmed to fit each other.

The map covers from just west of Hoskins Farm, where the British deployed into battle formation, to west of Guilford Courthouse. The counters represent companies (50-100 men) and artillery batteries (2-3 guns). Each turn represents 10-15 minutes.

title: Doll House Game
description:
Little girls will squeal with glee, as they advance their pieces from room to room on their way to the patio. Special added 'play it alone, all by yourself' feature provides and enjoyable single-player version. Complete with colorful gameboard, multi-colored die, pawns and rules for 1 or more players, Ages 4 - 8.

(description from Avalon Hill games catalog, 1963)

title: Musopoly
description: Thousands of music students are enjoying this stimulating, popular game designed for learning and reviewing the basics of reading music, the musical alphabet, treble and bass clef note names, musical symbols, musical facts, reading and writing rhythms, and performance. In Musopoly, notes and rests become money. All answers are included. Play can be adapted for all levels of students: beginning through advanced, and it's fun for children and adults. Best of all, it's non-competitive - all players become winners. I guarantee you'll enjoy music learning like never before! - Michiko Yukro, music educator and designer of Musopoly.

title: Warpath
types: American Indian Wars American West Fighting Miniatures Wargame
description:
A Wagon Train has been laid siege by four attacking Indians (mounted on horses), who try to capture the Wagon Master (cowboy mounted on horseback) in the Wagon Train Enclosure.  The Wagon Train Defenders (four Cowboys on foot) must save their Wagon Master from being captured.  The attacking player uses the four mounted Indians.  The defending player uses the four Cowboys (on foot) and the Wagon Master.

The Object of the game:  (A) The attacking player tries to capture the Wagon Master; (B) The defending player tries to eliminate the four Indians before his Wagon Master is captured.

title: Indian Arrow-Heads
description:
The game consists of 42 arrow-heads and a score card.  The arrow-heads have a colored triangular head and a different colored tail into which another triangular head can fit.  They also have a picture of an Indian with the name of a tribe (Potawatomi, Kiowa, Sioux, etc.) on the body, but for playing purpose, the tribes are irrelevant.  The score card consists of jutting triangles of different colors and boxed numbers in 5 colors.
The arrow-heads are dealt out to players face down.  Each player in turn places an arrow-head on either the score card or a previously played arrow-head so that the color of the head matches the color of the tail it fits into, thereby creating a box of one color.  Players attempt to optimize their score by finding the match for their arrow-head that results in the largest available score on the score card.  The score is recorded each time an arrow-head is played.  If there is no available match for the player, he forfeits his turn, and must try again with the same arrow-head next turn.
Play continues until all arrow-heads have been played.  The winner has the highest total.

title: Gambling Games of Malaya
description:
This book was written by an Assistant Commissioner of Police as an aid for Magistrates in Malayan Courts who had to hear cases involving all manner of gambling games common in the region at the time.

As the author, Dobree, says in his preface to the book, dated 1st February 1955, The book contains detailed descriptions of the majority of gambling games, betting and lottery games and betting which usually form or which may form subjects of charges in this country under the Common Gaming Houses Ordinance No. 26/1953 and the Betting Ordinance No. 47/1953.

Also mentioned for the most part briefly, are other popular gambling games mostly in the card game category, which do not usually form subjects of criminal charges as they are invariably played under circumstances which do not constitute any offense under the Ordinance ...

Although intended to be a functional legal document, this book has concurrently become a major reference work for gambling games in South-East Asia, containing descriptions and rules for games not described in English in print elsewhere. Dice and playing card collectors will find this volume to be an indispensable repository of information on rare and unusual Asian specimens. The work is liberally illustrated with colour plates of gambling implements.

A list of the contents follows:

Foreword
Preface
Notes on Legal Aspects of the Ordinances
Definitions
DOCUMENTARY BETTING AND LOTTERY GAMES:
 An Introductory Note to the Games of Chee Fah or Hwah Hwey, Chee Tam and Chap Ji Kee
 Chee Fah, Hwah Hwey or 36 Numbers
 Whay - Kelantan version of Chee Fah
 Chee Tam or 80 Characters
 Chap Ji Kee
 Sap Sam Tai Poh
 Wee Sua Peow or Wei San Piew,or Tong Sua Peow or Quay Suay Peow
 Pak Kap Piew or Pigeon Lottery
 Tikam Ekor or 100, 1,000 and 10,000 Number Games
 Lucky Numbers at Fun and Similar Fairs
GAMES WITH CARDS:
 Games with English Cards
 Games with Chinese Cards
  - Soo Sik Pai
  - Luk Foo Pai
  - Seong Kum Pai or Pin Kum Pai
  - Chi Kee Pai
  - Sap Ng Hor Pai
  - Tung Koon Pai
  - Oh Peh Pai
 Pair
 Sap Sam Cheong or Lushun Poker
 Three Cards, Sam Cheong, Pa Kau or Daun Tiga
 Koo Kiew, Ten Kiew or Soo Kiew
 Tau Ngau
 Twenty One
 Thirty One
 Ten and a Half
 Minta Daun
 Three Card Trick, Mai Wong or Tikam Raja
GAMES WITH DOMINOES:
 Pai Kow
 Tau Ngau
 Tien Kow
DICE GAMES:
 Yew, Yee, Sam or One, Two, Three
 Tai Sai or Big and Small (Simple Form) 
 Luk Kow or Dicing Six
 Sepat
 Ta Kai or Cockfighting
 Chong Yuen Chow
 Sek Poh
 Sek Chai Tan or Kok Kok
 Tai Sai or Big and Small - using Staking Board
 Tai Sai combined with Sek Chai Tan
 Hoo, Hey, How
MISCELLANEOUS GAMES:
 Chap Ji Kee Pangjang
 Daun Empat or See Kee Yah
 Fan Tan or Tuahn
 Four Numbers
 Poh, Lien Poh or Ewok
 Staking Methods in Fan Tan, Poh, Four Numbers and Sek Chai Tan
 Pek Bin
 Belankai
 Dadu Katak Ular (a Javanese Game)
 Dadu Muka Enam (a Javanese Game)
 Dadu Belankas Mata (a Boyanese Game)
 136 Numbers
 Solhi (a Punjabi Game)
 Games with Mah Jong Tiles
 Games in Amusement Parks
 Fruit Machines
 Horse Race Betting and Bookmakers

N.B. Page numbers and Chinese characters have been omitted from the listing of the contents.

title: Feudal Lords
description:
Feudal Lords is a freely downloadable card game where players are medieval nobles managing their feud.
The game is available here:
http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/warpspawn/FreeGames/FeudalLords.html

title: Care Bears Cloud Catcher Take and Play Game
types: Animals Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
A simple children's game wherein players user a spinner to attempt to collect a set of five Care Bear character tiles and place them on their Cloud Card.

The first player to collect all five Care Bears is the winner.  Comes in a vinyl carrying case.

Ages 4 and up

title: Who's Poor?!
description:
From the back of the box:
IF you aren't rich by the fourth week in this game, you're really upon hard times. Be prepared for a lot of razzing by the other players.  Once you are rich, see if you can stay that way. The big move could knock you flat. Or, another rich player could challenge you for all of your wealth. You'd better challenge him first!

Components are listed on the back of the box. Includes gameboard, dice, playing pieces, big move cards, unexpected expense cards, option cards, gold and silver bar cards, bankers FIC cards, play money, money tray, and rules

title: Riotous Applause
types: Deduction Party Game Trivia Word Game
description:
Ages 10 and up.

The objective of Riotous Applause is to reach and ascend the central podium and successfully complete a challenge nominated by an opposing team. The curtain drops when the first team achieves this.

Similar in respect to Trivial Pursuit or Cranium, required challenges must be performed when a space is landed upon. These categories include:
CHARADES of a film, play, book, song or proverb.
CROSS QUESTION - answering yes/no to questions in an animal/vegetable/mineral approach.
IMPROMPTU WAFFLE - must talk on a given topic for 30 seconds without deviation, hesitation or repetition.
WORD GAME - Similar to Call My Bluff. A word and four definitions are given. The team must guess the correct definition.
CLUE-NUNCIATION - Pretty much Taboo. Describe a word without using certain listed words.
FREE CHOICE - Choose from above.

title: Roar! Roar! Dinosaur!
description: The game where extinction stinks! Choose your beasts one by one, then shake the rock and see where it lands. Will you get to capture one of your opponent's dinosaurs, or will one of yours become a fossil? Roar! Roar! Roar as your dinosaurs go extinct!  Contains: 24 Dinosaurs, Earthquake Mat, 1 Meteor, 24 Fossils, Rules.  Ages 5 and up.

title: Världs-kontroll
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingCo-operative PlayRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Vrldskontroll is a Monopoly-stylish educational game published by the swedish fair trade association Tanzania Import.
Vrldskontroll is a game about industrialized countries, underdeveloped countries, the so-called nic-countries and the multinational corporations. It deals with their roles in the economic order of the world. (translated from Swedish)
Players assume the position of either a poor, semi-poor or a rich country, or even that of a multinational corporation. The game has three different phases: in the first phase the game simulates the current economic world order. In the second phase some rules are changed in favor of the poor countries. In the third phase the players are to make rules that are fair to all players.

There is also an earlier version of the game called Vrlds-Monopol, with the only difference being the name.

According to the manual, the game has been published in Swedish, Danish, Norse and English. Even Finnish rules can be found.

title: Dungeon Clash (Nin-Gonost Introductory)
types: Adventure Dice Fantasy Fighting Medieval Miniatures
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemDice RollingVariable Player Powers
description:
Dungeon Clash is a stand alone introductory set to familiarize players with the tactical dungeon combat of the Nin-Gonost gaming world.

The rules are the basic heart of the Nin-Gonost game mechanic, using their unique die system and character cards for each miniature, eliminating math and tables from combat resolution.  Play is extremely fatal and fast.

This set contains 25 color coded dice of the Nin-Gonost system and 9 Adiken miniatures, including the extra large Half-Troll, for two 150 point teams.

The map is printed, although players may purchase the modular magnetic pieces separately if they choose to.

title: La Guerra de los Mundos
mechanisms: Area EnclosureArea MovementCampaign / Battle Card DrivenPoint to Point Movement
description:
Based on H.G Wells's novel, the board game LA GUERRA DE LOS MUNDOS allows the players to take control of a Martian's ship invasion and to compete against other players in trying to gain  the maximum  possible area.

A game of trickery, strategy and diplomacy where you try to conquer for your Martian allies  before humans gain  control

title: Razoo: The Great Australian Game
Turenne: Campagne d'Alsace de 1674
description:
Low complexity operational simulation, set in the reign of the Sun King (Louis XIV), of Marshal Turenne's defense of Alsace against a German coalition in 1674-75.

3 pages of simple rules simulate combat and siege, with geographical and political objectives. The system bears a passing resemblance to SPI's Frederick the Great. Played on an elongated map 29x82cm showing the Rhineland from Mannheim in the north to near Basle in the south.

Includes 88 generic counters which need to be mounted.

Appeared as an insert in the French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 37 - Apr 1987).

title: Martian Mud Wrestling
description:
Published by Looney Labs in 2002, in Hypothermia issue #15.

Martian Mud Wrestling is a game for two players, using two stashes of Icehouse pieces and a 5x5 grid board.  There are only three rules to the game: how to move individual pieces, how to remove pieces from the board, and how to lose.  The designer claims that this game tends to draw between players of equal skill level.

title: The Game of Great Composers
description:
From the back of the box:
Players travel the board collecting Works and Travel cards necessary for acquiring Composer and Period Cards.  Active interaction between players allow for frequent exchanges.  The goal is to acquire Composer Cards and Period Cards for three historical periods.  On a second level of play, the winner is the one who can correctly answer questions about the composers collected.

title: I.N.I.T.I.A.L Response
description: Players select a category, then repeatedly spin two spinners to determine 20 pairs of letters.  Players then fill in the provided score sheets with as many names as possible that match the category and initials.  When everyone's through, each guess is scored based on how close the name matches both the initials and the category and whether anyone else used that name.  Bonuses are awarded for answers in shaded scoresheet rows and for getting 20 acceptable answers.  Highest score wins!

title: Dent pour dent
description:
Try to win the boxing tournament with your family. The first who uses his combined forces to gain 7 KO's wins the tournament.

A winner of the 1997 Concours International de Créateurs de Jeux de Société.

title: Smullers
description:
The map of this children's game shows a spiral parcours. On the fields there are six different animals and their favourite fodder shown. The cards show the animals printed on the map while eating. The pieces are big wooden pawns. The kids roll and move. If they land on a field with an animal that's eating and they have the card with their preferred food on the hand they roll again otherwise it's the next players turn. The first player arriving at the end wins.

A lot like game of goose. On the board there are drawn several animals, all with their favorite piece of food. You can use cards to move faster if you land on an animal of which you have a card. (for example: if you land on a monkey you can use the monkey card to move to the next monkey) You start the game with four cards, but you can gain additional cards during the game.

title: Wild Zone
description:
A card game.  To win, have the lowest points, once a player reaches 100 the game ends.
A round ends when one player discards their hand.  Remaining card points are now tallied.
Each person gets seven cards.  There are blue and wild zone cards.  Blue or wild can be played with another blue or wild card if the sum of the cards played and the top card of the discard pile sum to ten.
Players can play out of turn using only wild zone cards, again totaling to ten.
If a play cannot be made, the player must pass and draw one card, only if the top card is wild.  A play is now allowed if able.  If everyone passes, the top draw card is placed on the discard pile.

title: Jem Fashion Flash
types: Children's Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Music
description: The Holograms are excited about flying to Paris to make their very first music video.  But their rivals, The Misfits, have mixed up all the fashions Jem, Kimber, Shana, and Aja have picked out for their trip!  The situation seems hopeless- but you can help the Holograms by finding and packing their mixed-up clothes in time to catch their plane.  It will take a good memory and some truly outrageous moves.  The first player to do it wins the game!

title: Pokino
description:
An odd fusion of rummy and dominoes for two or more players.

Object: To score points by playing card sequences that match sequences of adjacent numbers formed by dominoes in play.

You Need:

* A set of double-12 dominoes.
    * A poker deck.
    * A bunch of beads or other tokens. Pennies work well.

On your turn you may play a domino from your hand (to create a future point-scoring opportunity) or play two or more cards from your hand (to score points). When you play domimoes, you earn tokens. Tokens are necessary to play cards (You may not play a card that you cannot pay for.)

If you have no cards in your hand at any point during the game, call out 'Pokino!' The game ends immediately. You win the game. Winning this way is hard to do, but not impossible. The game also ends when there are no dominoes left in the poke. The player with the highest score wins.

Download the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/100/pokino

title: Ziggurat
description:
A domino-stacking game for two or four players.

Object: To score points by stacking dominoes on other dominoes with matching numbers.

You Need:


     A set of double-six, double-nine, or double-twelve dominoes.
     Paper and pencil to keep track of each player's score. 


Players compete by laying dominoes on the table to form the beginning 4x4 base of dominoes. As the players place the dominoes they score one point for every square on a domino that they played that matches an adjacent square on another domino in play. After the base is completed, players start forming new levels to the 'ziggurat' by playing each domino so that it exactly covers two squares on the level below it. Once all available plays on the current level have been filled (and not before), the players start a new level.

The game ends when all dominoes have been played or if a new level is started with only one valid place to play. Tally the points for each player. The player with the most points wins. If there is a tie for points, then the player with the least dominoes left wins. Additional ties are shared wins.

Download the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/96/ziggurat

title: Federation & Empire: Advanced Operations
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Expand your Federation & Empire campaign with new ships, rules and systems.

     Raids strike into the heart of the enemy.  Battlegroups combine many small ships into powerful fleet elements.  Admirals increase command and control.  New Scouts give advanced warning of the threat.  Fast drones rip into the enemy.  Flagship escort groups protect the commanders.  Carrier groups expand to become impregnable squadrons.  Oversized fighter squadrons take attrition warfare to new levels of fury.
     Bases can now be built at low cost without their fighters and patrol ships, which can be added later.  CVAs can 'cash in' fighters to become Space Control Ships.  new accounting for fighters, neutral zones, and dreadnoughts give increased flexibility.
     X-ships can outfight anything on the map.  Casual PFs enhance combat power.  Fast warships, heavy war destroyers, penal ships, F111 carriers, and new dreadnoughts are just some of over a hundred new ship-types and special units.
     Winds of Fire portrays the six deadly battles of the General War's turning point.
     A complete 26-page Ship Information Table lists every ship in the game system!
     864 counters portray the powerful new ships and devastating new units.

title: Federation & Empire: Planetary Operations
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Planetary Operations is about more than just planets!
Expand your Federation & Empire campaign with these new ships, rules, and capabilities.

     Police Carriers, Police Flagships, Monitor PF pallets, Troop Pod counters
     Special Raids can now use drones, fighters, spies, and commandos.
     Four scenarios provide alternate starts to the General War.  In Crosswinds, the Klingons and Lyrans each fight their own enemy.  In Backdraft, the Kzintis launch a pre-emptive attack.  In Fire in the East, the Klingons attack the Federation first!   And in Demon of the Eastern Wind, the Gorns and Romulans start the General War!
     Cloaked decoys, Megafighters, Tholian pinwheels, Blockade Running, and more!




Of course, we do have Planet rules as well, including:

     Colonies allow you to build a planet' anywhere!  Planetary docks repair ships.
     Marine Major Generals lead planetary invasions.  Over 400 new playing pieces.
     Build new shipyards to expand production or replace losses.
     Depot repairs return destroyed ships, conversion during repair, combat repairs.
     Deficit spending, allowable substitutions, annexing provinces, and WYN Trade routes.

title: SARS War
description:
SARS Wars  Sha Si Zhan Qi

Towards the end of the SARS (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome) outbreak in Singapore in 2003, an enterprising media company published this simple roll-and-move board game, incorporating the public health education messages that were issued at the time. It was sold at branches of a book-cum-stationery shop chain, Popular Bookstore.

The game is for 2 to 6 players and players each have a coloured pawn that moves along a spiral track towards an End Point. Along the way, players follow instructions on spaces they land on, including taking two kinds of chance cards.

The Personal Hygiene card is drawn when landing on a Personal Hygiene square  players follow whatever instructions are written on these cards. The See Doctor cards may be drawn when landing on a Symptoms square, or also after landing on a Check Your Temperature square and rolling a 4, 5, or 6 (on lower numbers your temperature is normal, so you naturally dont need to see a doctor).

Players may also get sent to Hospital or be put under Home Quarantine. Being in the Hospital is worse as the player proceeds to Home Quarantine after discharge from hospital.

The game has lots of humorous touches that reflect the atmosphere at the time. One of the pre-game preparation rules is, All players must wash their hands thoroughly before playing. Theres also a rule concerning expulsion from the game, You are not allowed to continue with the game when you are expelled because of reckless, irresponsible personal misconduct that jeopardizes the entire community.

The first player to reach the End Point is the overall winner of the game. The other players can continue to play the game. Ominously, the last player left is the loser, who may be punished appropriately.

title: Pass På
description:
Based on an older Swedish game called 'Mugg'. Contains a deck of unsuited cards numbered 1 to 15. The object of the game is to get rid of your cards, and you do this by playing cards on a deck in front of you in sequence with the card already there.

Similar to:

     Flinch

title: Kille
description: A game played with a deck of 42 cards of 21 different kinds, all in the same suit. 12 of the cards are numbered, the rest are named cards with special abilities. Each player is dealt one card. Going round the table a player can choose to swap his card with the player to his left, but some cards have special abilities and will 'kill off' e.g. the player wishing to swap. The object of the game is to be the last remaining player, and thereby winning the pot.

title: Ice Market
description:
A real-time trading game for three or more players and an Icehouse set.

Deep under the frigid crust of the ice-moon Europa, a new fad has emerged. All of the truly fashionable Jovain dolphins are wearing exotic crystals from the underside of the frozen crust of the outer oceans.

Equipped with the latest tips and rumors about what's cool and what's not, you've brought your refrigerated collection of ice crystals to the EIEIO (Eurpoa Ice Exchange Independent Organization). You've managed to finagle your way into a five-minute trade session with a few other hobbyist traders. Competition is fierce, and there's a lot about the market that you're not sure of, but with your bartering skills and Luck willing, you hope to come out on top.

Object: To end the game with the most valuable collection of ice crystals.

You Need:

* A poker deck
    * An Icehouse set
    * Paper and pencil for each player, or an Ice Market trader's tally sheet
    * A 5-minute timer

Players in Ice Market do not take turns. Once the 5-minute timer starts, swap and trade for all you're worth until the timer stops. You may swap anything that you possess: cards, pieces, information, etc. Your goal is to end the game with the pieces worth the most points.

The player with the most points wins. If there is a tie for points, the player with the most pieces wins. Further ties are shared victories.

Download the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/95/ice-market

title: Coral Reef
description:
Build a calcareous masterpiece without noticing that youre practicing addition with another marine polyp.

Object: To use all of your corals in building a reef.

You Need

* Two decks of poker cards, ideally with identical backs.
    * Alternatively, you could use a bag of number tiles, like the ones available in the childrens section of department stores or a teachers supply store.

Take four nines from the deck and lay them out face-up as seeds for four stacks. Taking turns, each player attempts to get rid of all of his 'corals' (cards/tiles) by placing any number of corals on top of one stack such that the sum of the corals he places equals the number that had been on the top coral at the beginning of his turn. Corals are worth their pip value, except for face cards which are worth negative points.

The first one out of corals wins.

title: Jam Doodle
description:
One part art, one part communication. For two or more players.

Object: To describe a drawing composed of basic figures accurately enough that your partner can draw it.

You Need: Paper and pencil for each player. A small sketch pad works better than 8.5 x 11, but any paper will do.

There are two roles in Jam Doodle: creator/describer and drawer. During the game, you will take turns swapping roles. When you're the describer, choose a doodle and begin describing it to your partner. When you're the drawer, try to draw your partner's doodle as accurately as possible from the description.

When both of you agree that you're done, turn around and compare the doodle to the copy that was just drawn.

* If the copy is an accurate duplication of the original, then you've accomplished your goal. It's okay if the copy is drawn to a different scale, as long as the ratios between the objects are accurate.
    * If the copy differs from the original, then take some time to discuss where it differs, why it differs, and what information could have made it come out differently.

Once you're done, swap roles and start again.

Several variants to the basic rules are available on the website as well.

Download the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/92/jam-doodle

title: Penguin's Night Out
mechanisms: Modular BoardPick-up and DeliverPoint to Point MovementTile Placement
description:
A race game on an ever-changing field for 2 to 4 players

You've kept your beak to the grindstone with a hard week of catching fish and keeping eggs warm. Now it's time to gather your friends together, group at your nest, then head into town to party the night away.

Unfortunately there's only one dog sled available to go into town, so the first group that's ready to leave gets to ride in style, while everyone else has to walk. To complicate matters, local drilling is causing the ice to crack and shift unpredictably. The path that you take to get to your buddies may not be there on your way home. On top of that, the Polar Bear Gang has been making life tough, so you'll have to be super-sneaky if you need to go through their territory.

Even so, you're not going to let these obstacles stop you. You deserve a break, and you'll be darned if you're going to make the long, cold, 60-mile hike to town on flipper. Be the first one to gather your buddies up and get home again and you'll be ready for a...

Penguin's Night Out!

Object: To be the first player to collect all of your buddies and return home on an ever-shifting playing field.

You Need:

* A set of double-six dominoes.
    * A penguin pawn for each player. Assorted chess pieces work well.
    * Two buddy tokens for each player. Pocket change is a good choice.
    * Two six-sided dice.
    * Paper and pencil.

You and your opponents take turns moving around the board (made up of dominoes) and altering the board. End your turn in your nest while carrying both of your buddy tokens to be the first group to get your   dog sled into town and win the game. Yippee!

Download the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/113/penguins-night-out

title: Dungeon (ICP)
description:
A dungeon-crawling card game for 2 to 4 players

Captured and incarcerated, your only goal is to escape the underground prison you find yourself in. As you search for the hidden route to freedom, you must overcome the underworld's hostile inhabitants and dangerously unstable passages.

Object: To escape from your underground prison, or be the last one alive.

You Need: At least one standard deck of playing cards with Jokers. A single deck will suffice for a 3 player game, but such a game will be extended and bloody! Two decks can be combined for 3 or more players, allowing a quicker and easier multiplayer game.

You and your opponent(s) take turns playing cards from your hand, trying to escape the dungeon while making it hard for the other players to escape. There are three basic card types in Dungeon:

1. Passages (the value cards, 2 through 10) represent the tunnels, passages, and rooms you must navigate to escape.
   2. Creatures (the picture cards, Jack, Queen  King) represent creatures of the underworld.
   3. Aces represent your finely honed adventuring skills.

If you escape the Dungeon or all of your opponents are dead, then you win!

Download the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/392/dungeon-update

title: Jackpot Las Vegas Game of Fun and Thrills
Das Bierquartett
description: 32 German brewers present their wares, with information in 5 categories, including alcohol content, year the brewery was founded, etc. The game is played according to the standard Quartett rules  each player plays out a card and each cards entry in a particular category is compared  highest number wins (except for founding year, which is in reverse).

title: Haselwurz und Bärenklau
description:
From Spielbox:

In the game, the players build up a landscape with six-sided tiles (forest, rich meadows, lean meadows, farmland, lake, village and quarry). The players look for rare plants and animals at the corners of these tiles. There are four face-up animal or plant tiles which indicate which landscape types they must touch in order to be found there. Plants and animals, once found, are worth points.
The players travel as gnomes via dragonfly, badger, bird and grasshopper. The landscape determines which tiles can be crossed with which type of transportation. Players can only use the same type of transportation again after they have used all four at least once.

title: Karlsson på Taket
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Childrens game published in Sweden and themed on Karlsson p taket (Karlsson on the roof). The gameboard depicts Karlssons house and the apartment where the boy, Lillebror, lives.

Contents:
Gameboard
Die
7 figures
39 cards

Ages 5 and up

title: Bosse Bildoktorn
description:
Swedish game themed on a popular TV-series, Bosse Bildoktorn (`Bosse the Car Doctor). Very enthusiastic car mechanic teaches the viewers just about everything in Do-It-Yourself. The game is basically roll, move and answer questions on cars, tourism in Sweden, entertainment, etc. Players may also buy motels and garages to make other players pay, Monopoly-style.

Contents:
Board
385 cards with 1925 questions
Some other cards
Players pieces
Dice
Motels
Garages
Money
Pencil
Rules

Ages 13 and up. Language: Swedish.

title: Tintin et le Piège du Totem Dhor
mechanisms: Dice RollingMemoryPattern RecognitionRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Vanished! Stolen! ... The eight ebony totems and the prestigious gold totem, vestiges of an ancient civilization, were stolen by Rastapopoulos from the ethnographic museum. Tintin and his companions set out at once to recover them. But the stolen copies of the totems are spread out around the world and confuse the tracks of the investigators. Only a magic key will make it possible to find the treasures of the museum.

Of the 20 ebony totems, 12 are real! Only the magic key will reveal them to you... collect as many of the Totems as possible, but avoid conflicts with Rastapopoulos the gangster. Character cards direct you in your investigation or help you to thwart the schemes of your adversaries. Brought into play at the end of the game, the gold totem must still be recovered for victory.

translated (badly) from rulebook and entry from Club de Stratgie de Moissy-Cramayel

Translated from the Dutch box:
A breathtaking game full of adventures with Tin Tin and his friends.
Face Rastapopoulos in a duel and win the mysterious Totem Dhor.
But beware! 12 of the 20 Totems are traps! Only the magical cassette can point you in the right direction.

Gameplay information:
Every square on the board represents one of Tintin's adventures and contains a black totem pole. You have to use a magnet to learn if the totem is a good one or a trap. If the totem moves away from the magnet, it is a trap. If it pulls towards you it is one of the 8 good ones. Players check the totems individually and place it on the middle of the appropriate adventure square. This means the nature of this totem is known to one of the players. He must memorize all the totems he checked. In the second part (when all totems are known by one or more players), when a player starts an the adventure players have to tell the other players what status the totem has, if he is right he gets the totem. If he gets it wrong he loses a research point.

When all 8 good totems are found the golden Rastapopoulos totem is placed for the final adventure. When players cross Rastapopoulos himself they have to fight him (by a throw of the dice).

When a player loses all his points he has to start at the beginning of the board and receives 4 new points to re-enter the race until the golden totem is reached.

title: Election
mechanisms: Area MovementCampaign / Battle Card DrivenDice Rolling
description: Players move across a map of Europe to gain popularity for the upcoming European elections. Points are scored for completing secret goals indicated on different colored cards.

title: Waarom? Daarom!
description:
On your turn you draw a card and read the question out loud. The correct answer is also printed on the card. Questions range from absurd to very difficult.  eg : Why is a carrot orange and a tomato red? or What happens to the caffeine that 's extracted to create caffeine free coffee?
Each player writes an answer in secret on a piece of paper. The player who read the question writes down the correct answer in his own words. Answers are gathered, shuffled and numbered. The answers are read out loud and every player votes on what he thinks is the correct answer. The other players get a point if they guess the correct answer or if someone thought his or her wrong answer was right.
The first player who reaches the end of the 20 step score track wins the game.

title: McHale's Navy Game
types: Bluffing Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing World War II
description: Each turn the player draws a card from the supply deck and moves one space. If he announces he has a pair or more, he is entitled to Bonus Moves. You may bluff announcing a pair, three of a kind or four of a kind. The other players may challenge and if the bluffer has the cards he make make the bonus moves and the challenger moves back 4 spaces. If the player is bluffing and doesn't have the cards, he moves back 4 spaces. In addition there are instruction cards that move all ships ahead and penalty instruction cards that move the player backwards. In addition there is a cardboard torpedo which can be fired to move ahead. The winner is the first player to cross the finish line.

title: Counter Punch
description:
Counter Punch, designed for the real fight fan, is a game that combines the excitement and strategy of boxing.  Counter Punch is a game where everyone has an equal chance to win. As in an actual boxing match, this card game requires strategy or you could find yourself on the seat of your pants or, even worse, KO'd!

Counter Punch is a 2 player card game. There are 49 cards total, on which appear numbers and punch words. Example: Jab-1, Body-2, Hook-3, Overhand-4, Uppercut-5, Combo-6 and Power Punch-7. The higher the number, the harder the punch.

Before each round of play, 12 cards are dealt to each player.  The last player to win each trick, throws out the next card first.  Whoever played the highest card wins the trick.  After the end of each round (each has played their 12 cards), scoring is as follows:

6 to 6 = even round
7 to 5 = Out Pointed Opponent
8 to 4 = Opponent was Hurt
9 to 3 = Knocked Opponent Down
10 to 2 (or better) = Knockout (instant victory)
3 knockdowns in one bout = a Technical Knockout Victory

title: Stones: Seven Challenges of the Pharaohs
description: This series of abstract games are played on a cloth banner with nicely polished stones. There are a total of seven different games. There is one solitaire game and the remaining six games are either for 2 players or 3 players. This game is packaged in a mailing tube. The contents include a cloth banner for the playing board, a rule book, a cloth bag with draw string, 15 finely polished stones and 1 six sided die.

title: Turning Point
description:
Published in 2005 by BSO Games (DTP), the description is from the GMT website, when it was on their p500 list.

It's Turning Point, a game covering the pivotal battle of Freeman's Farm, at Saratoga. It features all the units, from Morgan's Rifles to the British grenadiers, and all the dense, wooded terrain you would normally expect, but in a way you've probably not seen before.

The game uses two decks of cards, one deck for each player to drive the game. Each player gets a certain number of his cards each turn, never his full deck, and his allotment is usually different (in terms of number and type) from his opponent. The cards are used to determine movement, combat, and special items, such as Indian Stealth, Counter-Attack, Rifle Fire, and Rapid Movement, among others. Players may play as many cards as they wish when it's their turn, using each card for only one of the possible three purposes. Play passes back and forth between players, until both players have used all their cards  and the Turn is over.

Turning Point is thus a game of card play and management, which unfolds on the map of Freeman's Farm, which uses squares, rather than hexes,. You're still moving units, trying to outflank, attacking with what you hope are better odds (since you don't know what cards your opponent will play, if any, and you never know what his final strength will be), and using your cards, and wits, to outplay your opponent.

Turning Point was a nominee in the Charles S. Roberts awards for Best DTP-Produced Boardgame (Charles S. Roberts Awards) for 2005.

title: Sibling Rivalry
description:
Sibling Rivalry is a commissioned game from Richard Garfield for the game design textbook Rules of Play, by Katie Salen and Eric Zimmerman.

Players are siblings trying to annoy each other.  The game is played on two boards: the challenge board and the score track.  By advancing a marker on the challenge board, you can score points on the score track.  The first player to reach the end of the score track wins.

The heart of the game is a push your luck dice mechanism to advance on the challenge board.  A player begins by rolling five dice, setting aside ones.  Other numbers can be used to advance a pawn along one of five columns, representing Looks, Faces, Tickles, Ouchies, and Teases.  After each roll, you can either stop or keep rolling.  If you stop and your pawn is the most advanced pawn in that column, then you remove any pawn it passed.  If it is not the most advanced, then you remove your pawn from the challenge board.  If your pawn has not been removed from the board by your next turn, then you score points for it on the score track.

You can keep rolling dice to advance your pawn farther up the challenge board, but when you accumulate three or more ones, your parents have caught you picking on your sibling.  Your turn ends and you lose points.

title: Monopoly: Uniquely Singapore
description: This game was introduced as part of the country's Uniquely Singapore tourism campaign. The key difference between this and the Monopoly - Singapore edition is that instead of street names as real estate for purchase, the new board features clusters like the tourist attraction cluster - Singapore Zoo, Jurong Bird Park etc, the shopping cluster - Marina Bay, Orchard Road, and the arts and entertainment cluster - Victoria Concert Hall, Esplanade, etc. The game also introduces two new tokens of local flavour - the Kucinta cat and the trishaw.

title: Deck of Dogs
description:
Endorsed by the American Kennel Club.  Seven suits of eight cards each, the suits being Herding, Working, Sporting, Non-Sporting, Toy, Terrier, and Hounds.  Each card bears a picture of a different breed.

Two games are provided, one rummy variant and one Uno variant.

title: Toot and Otto
description:
From the manufacturer:

A fun strategy game for older players who like tic-tac-toe and checkers...   One player is TOOT and the other player is OTTO.  Each takes six O's and six T's.  The first player who spells his or her name - up, down, sideways, or on the diagonal - wins!

A fill  find game for younger players.  Simply drop all the T's and O's in the tower and when it's full, search for how many TOOT's and OTTO's you can discover!

title: Charoodles
description:
From the manufacturer:

Charoodles - the nonstop, fun props charades game!

Can you act like a jellyfish using a foam square as a prop?

Charoodles (sha-roo-dles) is an exciting new way to play charades using props.  Players divide into teams and take turns acting out the items listed on one of the category cards.  But there's a twist!  Players MUST use props (a tube, a cup, a ball, and a square) to help them give clues.  A 90-second timer makes the game fast paced and often downright hilarious.

title: Baffle Gab
description:
From the manufacturer:

Gabby gives you 5 word cards to write a story. Add your own words and change the beginnings or endings on Gabby's words to create your story in one minute. Get all 5 Gabby words in the same sentence and double your Bone Bucks for the round! At the end of each round, read your story out loud and get lots of laughs. Risk your Bone Bucks when you challenge other players on the use of a Gabby word or their sentence structure. Be the Bone-yard Banker and pay out earned Bone Bucks after each round!

title: All About Harrisburg
mechanisms: Card DraftingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Two to six players attempt to outsmart and out-luck each other in a riotous race ALL ABOUT TOWN. The first player to collect a total of eight (8) Travel Cards and return to his/her Residence is declared the winner.

title: Murder à la carte: Chinese Takeout
description:
The scene is a San Francisco townhouse filled with mementoes of Emily Boggs' days in China. The past has become present in the person of Anita Mumm. A long lost daughter? Or is she an impostor? Dinner turns deadly when Mrs Boggs' fortune cookie predicts no future.... for her.

The suspects :-

Chew Chow - Ms. Emily's cook and loyal servant for 25 years.  His only humble request is to return to his homeland rich... and maybe at any cost.

Penny Sylan - A live-in nurse hired to care for Ms. Emily.  Though she has a wonderful bedside manner, Penny has a history of losing her patients.

Axel Dent - Ms. Emily's chauffeur was driven crazy by her back seat driving.  Did she push him to take the wrong turn on the road to life?

Lai Low - A young traditional Chinese maiden staying with Ms. Emily to learn western way.  Lai has the face of innocence and purity but a heart filled with scorn.

Him Wong - A retired police detective from China who claims to have spent years searching for Ms. Emily's daughter.  Has he accomplished the impossible or is he a master of illusion?

Anita Mumm - Ms. Emily's long-lost daughter... or is she?  Anita bears a resemblance to the late Mr. Boggs, but is she really their missing heir or a clever con?

Contents:-

6 Invitations and envelopes to be sent to your guests 
Character booklets for all 6 suspects, includes their roles and background information. 
Cassette tape with an introduction, summary of events and the solution to the crime 
Party planner booklet 
6 secret clues 
6 place cards

For six players Ages 12 and up.

title: Toy Story 2 Cone Crossing Game
types: Comic Book / Strip Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description: Based on the scene in Disney's Toy Story where Buzz Lightyear and company race across a busy road while hiding under traffic cones to rescue Woody.  In this game designed for ages 4 and up you first roll a die to determine how many action points you get on a turn. Then you have three choices move the cones (you and your opponents cones are identical so you better remember which cones are yours). Or you may move obstacles to impede the path of your opponents. Or you may send the truck down the street (sending any cone it hits back to GO).

title: Sporting Triangles
description:
SPORTING TRIANGLES - ITV's Question and Answer game for all the family.

Now everybody can be part of the quick-fire question and answer fun of the top rated TV show.  With 3,000 sporting questions to help and harass you it's a race around the triangular board for up to four players or teams.  Those who use their sporting knowledge to best advantage and are the first to complete the 'sporting triangle' win the game.

Contents:

Game board
3,000 questions and answers
Scoring base and pegs
Four playing pieces
Die

title: Barbie: We Girls Can Do Anything
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
From back of box:

What would you like to be when you grow up?  A glamorous actress, a graceful ballerina, an out-of-this world pilot?  Choose a career, then follow the path that leads to success.  As you work your way toward your goal you may experience occasional setbacks, but don't be discouraged.  the first player to fulfill her dream of an exciting career wins the game.

Basically, a simple spin-and-move game that has players collecting chits and working their way, ring by ring, towards the center of the board.

title: Funny Train Card Game
types: Animals Card Game Children's Game Trains
description:
Object: Make a train with an engine, caboose, and 4 different animals.

Includes 34 cards plus 2 instruction cards.

title: RAVE Master! Trading Card Game
types: Card Game Collectible Components Comic Book / Strip
description:
Based on the mega Japanese hit mange RAVE Master that in Japan has spun off into an anime series and multiple video games as well.

Synopsis of story:
The Continent of Song is in chaos. The sinister secret society known as Demon Card is using the power of Dark Bring to destroy everything in their path. The only things capable of stopping Dark Bring are the Rave stones. Unfortunately, the Rave Stones were scattered around the globe in an explosion 50 years ago, so now they must be collected by the Rave Master in order to stop Dark Bring once and for all.

title: Kakapo Rescue
description:
From box:
Five Kakapo are in danger! In this game you team up and go into the wilderness to find the Kakapo and bring them back to base camp. Trap any predators that block your way and share equipment for the Kakapo Rescue. Kakapo are endangered New Zealand flightless Parrots.

This game has a concept license from Jim Deacove.

title: E.S.P.
types: Bluffing Card Game Deduction Print & Play
description:
From the publisher's site:

E.S.P. is a game for two players, powerful ESPer (person gifted with mental powers).

Five dice are rolled and put as a prize. Players put and move multipliers played hidden near these dice, struggling to match on their side their best tiles with the highest rolls, in order to gain victory points.

During each round, after the initial placement, you can use five special mental power in order to manipulate dice and multipliers: your goal is both to increase your score and to prevent your opponent in doing the same.

Each round may be either very quick or slow because of long reasoning; the ESPer winning three games will be the winner.

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

title: Sexual Secrets
description:
From the back of the box:

HIS: 
The first time I touched a naked woman I....
On a scale of 1 to 10, I think my buns are...
When I get drunk, the sex gets...

HERS: 
The thought of making love to two men at the same time
  really makes me...
When I finally lost my virginity, I was...
The excuse I most often use for not making love is...

These are examples of sexual secrets; tasty little tidbits from deep within your very own wealth of intimate personal experiences. Do you dare confess your innermost confidences to other players or make up wild fantasies they might believe?

Includes 36 voting cards, 3 dice (1 red, 1 white, 1 black), 1 male confessions booklet, 1 female confession booklet, 1 scorepad, and original instructions. The back of the box mentions something about 432 sexual secrets, but the instructions do not list any such thing so I am taking it to be a misprint as even the picture on the back does not show anything that is not already present.

title: Pegged Out
description:
From the packaging:

Socially interactive game for everyone.

Simple Rules, easy to learn and fun to play

Totally self-contained, easily transported. Can be played virtually anywhere.

Ideal for parties, family get-togethers, or when you just want to have fun!

The objective of the game is to lose all your pegs and 'Peg Out' before anyone else. Each player starts with 10 pegs which must be shown at all times.


                
            
        
    


To 'Peg Out' and win you must place your last 'Live Peg' down the 6 hole.

By rolling dice, the players determine which holes they are able to place their pegs in this turn. holes 1-5 are narrow, and a ridge around the peg means the pegs rest in the hole. the sixth hole is larger, allowing the pegs to pass through. the aim is to get all the pegs out of your hand, however the last peg must go down the 6 hole.

Game components:


     Plastic tub with Lid containing the six 'peg holes'.
     100 pegs (All one colour - though three colours available)
     2 Dice

title: The Rooster Coop
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemSet CollectionTile Placement
description: The Rooster coop is a game where the players try to collect their family of chickens. It is done by moving the marker on the board and by sliding the tiles and by that changing their position. The rules are very simple that can be explained in a few minutes, but wining the game is a bit more tricky. The players try to collect their chickens, but at the same time, can try preventing other players from collecting their chickens by changing the positions of the tiles. Fun game for all the family.

title: Six Points College Football
description: Six Points (as its name implies) is a college football board game.  Each team is represented by a series of tables representing rush and pass defense, special teams, all facets of the offense, and some miscellaneous tables.  Results are obtained by having the offense pick a player and a play (pass or run).  The offense rolls a die or dice for a result.  The defense then rolls on the appropriate table to modify the result.  Optional rules add defensive play calling to the game.  Seasons are known to exist from 1975 through 1981.

title: Kave Kapers
mechanisms: Dice RollingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Object of game is to the first spelunker to successfully map a cave. The arrangement of the boards create a different each time you play it. Players must avoid water hazards, rock falls, and low passages.

title: COSMIC Super Business
Dodeca Baseball Game
description:
The new and superior baseball game for fans of all ages. Each of the 2 players of the game is the manager of a team. His line-up may consist of players from his favorite Major League team or fictitious players. Each line-up of 9 players must, at all times, consist of 3 players designated as good hitters (blue 12-sided die), 4 players designated as fair hitters (red 12-sided die), and 2 designated as weak hitters (yellow 12-sided die). Two of the nine players should, also, be designated as fast runners.

White die = scoring of the play
