Along the way the Phantom Virus will try to set you back.  So choose your friend: Scooby Doo, Shaggy, Velma, Daphne or Fred and let the adventure begin.

title: Auction
description: Not to be confused with the 3M/AH game Auction. Cheap looking, low budget bookshelf game of bidding and buying (as it says on the box). Very similar in mechanic and feel to 3M's Auction, though I'm not sure which came first.

title: Zoo Mania
description: Try to get rid of your cards and trap your opponents with as many cards as possible.

title: Hide n' Seek
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSecret Unit Deployment
description:
Trying to recall this from memory, as it's been close to 30 years since I last played this one.

Hide n' Seek is a childrens game.  For those days when you couldn't play outside, and playing the real thing inside would have driven mom nuts.

One player is it.  The other players put their pawns under any of the 9 hiding locations, and up to two players can hide in any one location.

It rolls the die and moves toward one of the the hiding places.  Some of the hiding places are alone on paths, some are located on paths that diverge to more than one hiding space, and of course there are near and far spaces to hide.

After It moves, the other players can decide to make a break for it, trying to reach home before It can catch them.

title: Hanging Monkies
description:
Players attempt to hang their monkeys from the tree as carefully as possible without causing it to collapse. The first player to successfully hang all of his monkeys is the winner. If the tree collapses the game is over and the players start again. This game contains rules for three different variations of the game: 1. Turn based with the use of a positive/negative numbered die, 2. Time based where all players move at the same time, 3. Team based where you can only hang your monkeys off of your teammate's monkeys. For ages 3 and up.

Similar to:

    Monkey Business
    Monkeying Around

title: Thomas the Tank Engine:  Thomas Numbers Game
types: Children's Game Educational Math Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Number
description:
From the box:

Self-correcting Adding Fun--Thomas the Tank Engine rolls down the tracks bringing an exciting new numbers game for children.  Come and play with Thomas and his friends.  You'll learn your numbers and how to add them, too!

To Play:  Spin the spinner to choose the numbered pieces that fit in your train.  When the train is completed, the pieces add up to the number on the end of the car.  Verying levels of play make the game fun for beginning and advance players.

Skill for Young Players:  Beginners can play by recognizing and matching numbers.  Advanced players will understand that various combinations can be used to add up to the number on the end of the car.  All players learn important social skills:  taking turns, sharing and respecting others.

Contents:

4 Playing boards
24 Number pieces
1 Spinner

title: Max Steel
description: A boardgame based on the Max Steel property.  Released only in Latin America.

title: Barbie and the Magic of Pegasus
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
A boardgame based on the Barbie movie Barbie and the Magic of Pegasus.

From the publisher:  Help Annika and her sister, Brietta, break the evil wizard's spell that turned Brietta into a Pegasus and their family into stone!  Race to collect the 3 items needed to build the Wand of light,then be the first to arrive back at the castle to rescue the royal family.

title: The Champagne Game
description:
A Game of LIFE, LOVE, ROMANCE and CHAMPAGNE!!!

A romantic game for two, where you learn more about your partner... and even more about your self!

The board is 48 pieces which when put together form the shape of a champagne bottle. Champagne pieces run down the centre and each time you remove on of these, you drink champagne! But pieces to the left and right must first be removed to release the Champagne tiles and these can only be removed by players appropriate responses to the instructions on the cards. On the basis of TRUTH, CORRECTNESS and SATISFACTION. Your responses will be assessed by your partner. Play continues from the cork to the bottle.

Players may be asked to:

Answer questions,
Give an opinion,
Discuss their inner feelings,
Perform small acts of love,
Examine their likes and dislikes,
Drink Champagne
and more....

This game is a powerful recipe for a romantic makeover, guaranteed to keep that spark glowing bright....

title: Words
description: A Canadian variation of the free game Dictionary, more popularly marketed as Balderdash.  Words has cards with real words and their definitions, which must be read by one player.  Other players must try to guess the meaning, or else make up a plausible-sounding definition, after which all players vote on which definition they believe is the correct one.  This Canadian edition was published in 1983 and comes with a large box of word cards with definitions.

title: Eagles of the Gulf!
types: Aviation / Flight Expansion for Base-game Modern Warfare Wargame
description:
Eagles of the Gulf !, part I was published in Battleplan #9, as an expansion to the Air Superiority line from GDW.

The material was the ground support companion to the Desert Falcons expansion. The introduction notes that to play this expansion requires owning Air Superiority, Air Strike and Desert Falcons, making it risky to publish as a regular module. So the magazine format was chosen to publish the material. The material was to be published in two installments. Unfortunately, Battleplan,No.9 turned out to be the last issue so part II was made available in two parts in issues 11 and 12 of Air Power, a newsletter published by J. D. Webster and Tony Valle.

title: Sam's Hooligan
description:
From the rulebook: A dice game to please everyone; the crapshooter, the cardplayer...even ardent gamblers. Sam's Hooligan has the excitement of a crap game and the tension of poker, combined with a scoring system that changes the odds with each roll of the dice.

Sam's Hooligan is a dice game with terrific action and changing odds.  It's a challenging game developed during the 30's by a disreputable crapshooter from Chicago.

This is another variation of the traditional game Yacht (like Yahtzee and Yum) but this uses 2-color card images on the dice, adds flushes as possible hands, lowers the value of a hand for each re-roll you use, and includes 2 jokers on the dice.

title: History of War: Pacific Edition
types: Card Game Wargame World War II
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenCard DraftingHand Management
description: Just the same game as History of War, but with new cards from Japan vs. USA

title: Color Cubes
description: Game consists of a 5x5 3d grid and contains 25 cubes with different colors on each side.  Sitting across from the other player you must play cubes one at a time until one player gets five different colors in a row either verticall, horizontally or diagonally.  The cubes have differnt colors on each side, so when playing a color on your side you play another color on the opponents side.

title: Excuses
description:
Excuses is the hilarious card game that's packed with the wackiest excuses ever. Some are believable and some will only get you into hot water. Each player has to play his best excuse according to the situation card to collect as many tricks as possible and win the game.
The group votes on whose excuse is the best eg funniest or most believable or whatever.

title: Hallmark Celebrations!
description: This is a trivia game that challenges your ability to remember the special occasions that other players share with you. You'll also be quizzed in birthday and holiday trivia. Answering questions correctly scores points. The player with the most points at the end is the winner.

title: Holiday Shuffle
description:
From the box:

Bet you didn't know that Sibling Appreciation Day was in the same month as Mother's Day. And National Relaxation Day is the day before Joke Day, with Watermelon Day two days after. In this game of fun days and holidays you must take the dates you're dealt and rearrange them in chronological order. So plan your strategy and pick your day. You may even find a new holiday as you play.

title: Professor Noggin's Life in the Ocean
description: Part of Profesor Noggin's series of educational games to teach kids about their favorite subjects.  The game contains 30 cards, each card has six questions, three easy and three hard.  Players roll a special three-numbered die to select questions.  The fronts of the cards feature colorful pictures of sea life.

title: Trivial Pursuit for Kids: Nick Edition
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description: This version of Trivial Pursuit for kids challenges your knowledge of the Nickelodeon cable channel. How much do you know about Nickelodeon live-action shows or favorites like SpongeBob SquarePants, Jimmy Neutron, and The Fairly OddParents? The game includes four decorative tokens and 1200 Nicksclusive questions.

title: Cat 'N Mouse
description: This children's dexterity game features a moving carousel shaped like a circular clothesline. Plastic mice are placed around the rim of the circle. Each player has a lever with a plastic cat on it. Pressing the lever launches the cat upwards and (hopefully) knocks a mouse off the carousel. The player that has caught the most mice when time runs out is the winner.

title: The Big Breakfast Game
types: Action / Dexterity Humor Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description:
THE BIG BREAKFAST GAME is a 60 or 90 minute (dependant on the number of players) themed on the UK Channel 4 TV Series The Big Breakfast.

The board is divided into 8 areas which are visited by the players based on spinning the spinner.  On arriving at the designated area players have to complete an activity in a manner similar to the items featured on the TV show:

SNAP CACKLE POP - A memory game in which players have 30 seconds to memorise 14 items on a list and a further 30 seconds to recall them.

WHOSE WASHING LINE - The player has to guess the identity of someone from clues read from a card.

ON THE BED - A player must convey the identity of someone to the other players without using any of the words written on the card.

ONE LUMP OR TWO - A drawing game in which players try to reproduce the picture on a card with their eyes shut.

THE CRUNCH - Players perform silly actions as described on a card.

DOWN YOUR DOORSTEP - Players must guess where they are from the description on the card.

EGG ON YOUR FACE - Players must mime or impersonate the individual on the card for 30 seconds.

INVENTION CORNER - Players must attempt to answer general knowledge questions.

Points, in the form of breakfast items (sausage, tea, marmalade, egg, toast ...) are awarded for succesful completion of activities.  After a predetermined time (60 minutes for 4 or less players, 90 for 5 or 6 players) the game ends.  The winner is the player with the biggest breakfast (i.e. the one with the greatest number of points).

title: Top: 3
description: Triangular backgammon for three players (with a variant for two). During the game, one player with three or more pieces out of play can became the killer, with special rules.

title: Ferienspiel Jungfrauregion
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
FERIENSPIEL JUNGFRAUREGION is a Swiss game that has more than a little of Monopoly about it.

Players progress around the board according to die rolls.  When landing on property squares players hae the option of electing to purchase them from the bank, though larger properties cannot be purchased until the three smaller properties in the same set (of four) have been sold.  As in Monopoly other players landing on property that you own have to pay a charge.

Random elements are thrown in through squirrel and clover cards which are generally of the go to..., pay the bank..., get from the bank... type.

2,000 Fr are received for passing through square 70 (not START), but the principle is the same.

There are no houses or hotels to buy, but fimilair rules for mortgages, credit and bankrupcy apply.

The winner is the player, who after two hours (or other pre-determined limit) has the most money (cash and property less bank loans).

title: Justice League Unlimited Champion Checkers
description:
This is the game of checkers with superheroic powers.  Each side has 7 superheroes among their checkers: Superman, Wonder Woman, Batman, Hawkgirl, Green Lantern, Martian Manhunter, and The Flash.

There are 3 variants descibing how to use these powers: one has them activating powers once they are kinged, another has the superheroes open to both players, and the last has all the checkers shielded, like in Stratego so you don't know which of your opponents' checkers is which.

title: Supercharge
description:
Supercharge is one of the four Folio games included in North Africa Quad, but also sold separately.

Supercharge covers several battles around El Alamein in North Africa in 1942. In fact there are three scenarios:


    1. Battle of Alam Halfa: A short offensive by the Afrika Korps attempting to push east (8 game turns).
    2. Battle of El Alamein: The first British attack on the German line near El Alamein (15 turns).
    3. Operation Supercharge: The big offensive that brokethrough the German lines and routed the Africa Korps (7 turns).  


The components consist of the following: a 'Standard' Rules fold-out 'sheet'(about 3-Full pages) for the game series; an 'Exclusive' Rules sheet(1-page); a 4-COLOR paper Mapsheet-(17 by 22); a set of cardboard counters(around 120). Players must provide their OWN 6-sided DIE prior to play.

On the Mapsheet are the Turn Record Track, a Terrain Key, and the set-up locations for the Units of both the 'Campaign'  'Sidi Rezegh' games. Overall, the COLOR of the Mapsheet is WHITE with BLUE-(Water/Sea, Allied 'Fortified Box', Minefield Hex-sides), BROWN-(Rough), Light GRAY-(Broken),  Dark BROWN-(Roads, Trails). The Area encompassed by this Mapsheet is the coastal road and areas south centered on El Alamein, and Alam Halfa Ridge.

The game counters are TAN-with BLACK print for Germans, TAN-with GREEN print for Italians, GREEN with BLACK print for British. Game scale is given as 1.7 Miles across each hex, each Turn represents 1-Day, and Units range in size from Battalion up to Brigade level.

One unique thing of Supercharge is that the supply rules in the standard rules game are ignored completely.

title: Linx Game
description:
From the website:

LINX is a word game for people who love playing with words. There are over 3,500 four letter words in the English language, and we have invented a NEW WORD GAME called LINX using just four letter words. LINX is quick to learn, easy to play but fiendish to master. A game can take five minutes, or one can play for a whole evening.

You can play LINX by yourself as well as with one or more friends. It is suitable for players aged over 12yrs and over.

You can read more about this game at www.ThinkingGames.com

title: Die Wilden Fussballkerle: Tooor! Das wilde Fussballspiel
types: Educational Math Movies / TV / Radio theme Sports
mechanisms: Modular BoardSecret Unit DeploymentSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
A fast soccer game in that the players play the Ball through solving of multiplication tasks. The various Numbers on the Gameboard are interchangeable, so every Match is a different challenge.
( Please excuse my bad english )

title: Where In The World is Carmen Sandiego? Card Game
types: Card Game Educational Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia Video Game Theme
description:
Object: Track Carmen and her gang by correctly identifying well-known people, places, and things.
Contains: 28 trivia cards, which can be reversed to make a puzzle of a world map.
Rules:
1. The first player becomes the Reader, and takes a card from the deck.
2. The player on the Reader's left chooses a number between 1 and 20, and the Reader reads that clue. The player guesses the secret identity, and receives the card if correct. If incorrect, the Reader reads another clue to the next player. Play continues in a clockwise direction until someone guesses the secret identity and wins the card.
3. The player on the Reader's left becomes the next Reader, and selects a new card from the deck.
4. The first player to collect five cards catches Carmen Sandiego and wins the game!

title: Dungeon Twister: Forces of Darkness
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Exploration Fantasy Fighting Horror
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemArea MovementHand ManagementModular BoardSecret Unit DeploymentTile Placement
description:
Forces of Darkness is an expansion in the Dungeon Twister series of games.

With Powers of Darkness discover 8 new characters, 7 objects (from which to select 6), and 8 new rooms and all the rules which relate to them. This expansion contains all the material necessary for a game for 2 players except for the basic rules, the charts of combat, and the folding screens. It can also be combined with the base game and other expansions.

You will be able to work out new tactics and strategies centered on the exploitation of the casualties. Dark death and arts will not have any more secrets for you.

A new type of terrain based upon the darkness will enable you to discover a new and innovative mechanism using new material elements. Without the torches, equipment essential to any adventurer who respects himself, you will not be able to be enter the oppressive darkness.  Many other elements of terrain will come to enrich your party and could also be used to create your own original scenarios.

New creatures include:

The Vampire(4/2): Undead. His combat value increase each time he kills an opponent. Can change to an undead  bat with (6/0)
The Mummy(3/4): Undead. Break porticullis. Strong and not too slow, but he has a flaw: if all adjacent oponnent in a fight has a torch, the mummy's owner is forced to play his 0-card.
The Ghoul(6/2): Undead. He can carry the opponent's wounded character. If he exits the dungeon with any wounded character, he gets an extra Victory Point.
The Undead Dragon(2/6): Undead. Can regenerate just like the troll. Gives two victory points to the player killing it.
The Necromancer(4/2): Magic User. For one action point, he can transform an adjacent wounded character, even the opponent, into a zombie(3/2, undead). Can raise a zombie from a grave (special terrain type).
The Angel of Light(5/1): Can light the darkness as if she was carrying a torch, using her magic ability.
The Shadow(4/2): Undead. Can act in the darkness as if it was a normal terrain type.
The Specter(4/0): Undead. Can move through any terrain type. Gives no point if it exits the dungeon. Can resurrect into an opponent wounded character. The specter die. The wounded character is considered fully healed and is now in control of the player who owned the specter.

Expands

    Dungeon Twister

title: Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game
types: Game System Medieval Political Science Fiction
description:
Stonehenge is an anthology board game, a new concept where five award-winning game designers, all using the same gaming components, create five very different games in one box. The ancient ruin of Stonehenge will never be the same. The five games are:

     a magic game by Richard Garfield (Magic: The Gathering, RoboRally, The Great Dalmuti)
     a political game by Bruno Faidutti (Mystery of the Abbey, Citadels, Knightmare Chess)
     a battle game by Richard Borg (Battle Cry, Liar's Dice, Memoir '44)
     an auction game by James Ernest (Kill Dr. Lucky, Diceland, Pirates of the Spanish Main)
     a science-fiction game by Mike Selinker (Risk Godstorm, Pirates, Axis & Allies Revised)




From racing through the ruins to auctioning them off, these five games and other new games designed for it, will keep Stonehenge fresh for years to come.

Rules for additional Stonehenge games can be found at the http://paizo.com/paizoGames/library.

title: Saxum
description:
A rather straightforward dice game by Sid Sackson. Players alternate rolling two dice and allocating markers onto a 5 x 5 grid at the coordinates corresponding to the numbers thrown. If a six comes up, it can be counted as any other number by sacrificing six points from the acting player's score, or else simply re-rolled. Players are allowed to choose in which order the coordinates are read off the dice, so that each roll (other than doubles) gives two possible placements. If an occupied grid point is selected, points are scored according to the number of adjacent grid points contiguously occupied by stones of the owning player. The game is won by the player first player to reach a pre-determined total score. (The rules suggest 177, but this can lead to extremely long games...)

The game was originally published by Gamescience/Renwal. It was re-released by Das Spiel as Saxum, with some significant rules changes.

title: Pari-Manie
description:
Pari-Manie is basically a gambling game in which you want to become the richest player and ruin every other gambler aroud  the table. Simple dice rolling is used to move along a board filled up with mini-games opportunities. Games such as: Poker, Horse racing, Black Jack, dices, Lucky 7...

Every game is played (solitaire) against a designated dealer, The only time you will be able to play against your adversaries is when you venture toward the middle of the board (instead of moving around the board). Then if you happen to stop on the middle space, called Pari-manie, the fun begins. You will challenge an opponent to play a mini-game with you, the wager will be the total amount ($$$) of the poorest player (of the 2 playing). The player that was selected decides what game will be played from: 

    Poker 
    Black Jack 
    Dices
    or a simple cut a card from the deck.




If the poorest of the 2 players loses, he is eliminated (losing his whole wager). If he wins, he gets to double his money (courtesy of the loser).

Game contents:



    
        style=text-align:right;|1

        Board

    
    
        style=text-align:right;|1

        Plastic tray with money bills

    
    
        style=text-align:right;|1

        Traditional 52-card deck

    
    
        style=text-align:right;|10

        Horse racing cards

    
    
        style=text-align:right;|12

        Fruit cards

    
    
        style=text-align:right;|3

        Color-sided dices

    
    
        style=text-align:right;|2

        6 sided dices

    
    
        style=text-align:right;|8

        Player pieces

    
    
        style=text-align:right;|5

        Control cards

title: Tumble Bug
description:
ORIGINAL BOX: 22  x 6 x 3 

The unpredictable 
TUMBLEBUG 
sensational race

The tumblebugs are individually colored, small capsule-shaped objects about 1 high with a small mobile lead weight inside. The game components, apart from the lead weights and scoreboard/instruction sheet, are composed entirely of plastic. The gameboard consists of a gently meandering 4-laned track which is almost 2 long. The track is raised at one end by a 5 high stand. Above the stand is a starting gate which holds the tumblebugs prior to release.  A finishing gate located at the other end of the track is designed to shut as the first tumblebug passes, preventing the remaining ones from reaching the finish. The edges of the interior lanes are incomplete, allowing the tumblebugs to change lanes randomly.

Before the tumblebugs are released, each player tries to predict which color will reach the finishing gate first. The first player to guess five results correctly is the winner.

(N.B. game was re-released in the early 1970s in a smaller box with the distinctive string handle favored by Schaper during this phase of their history. The track came in pieces and required assembly).

title: Bible Mystery Events:  The Case of the Missing Professor
description:
Strange things are afoot in the small Appalachian town of Wallar Hollar.  Recently the great Professor Davidson was killed in a prison riot.  And now his body has gone missing.  On top of this a strange man named Jesse Coleman has appeared in Wallar Hollar asking everyone uncomfortable and probing questions about these unusual events . . . Welcome to The Case of the Missing Professor.

In this interactive murder mystery event, 5 to 25 players each take on the role of a unique character in this quaint little mountain town as they try to discover what happened to Professor Davidson's body and who this Jesse Coleman fellow really is.

title: Flint & Steel
types: Age of Reason American Revolutionary War Miniatures Wargame
description:
(from publisher:)

Flint  Steel Miniatures Rules for the American Revolution  Age of Reason

Flint  Steel continues the standard of excellence in wargaming established by Clash of Arms. More than an outstanding set of rules, Flint  Steel brings together in one source a wealth of information for this exciting period of warfare. No need to have miniature figures in order to use and enjoy these rules. You can easily get started right away by making your own units from templates provided inside.

Special Features: 
For 5mm, 15mm, 20mm, 25mm, and 30 mm figures
Comprehensive rules that play quickly
Ratings and details for almost 700 individual American, British, German, French, and Indian units from the American Revolution
Unique, simple command and control system
Ratings on over 500 different types of units for 26 different armies from 1740-1789
Performance data on 50+ different artillery types
Recreates battles in North America, Europe, and the Far East
Ratings and details on over 300 leaders of the American Revolution
Optional rules to fully recreate a wide variety of maneuver battles
Introductory scenarios from the American Revolution and Seven Years War
Includes unique scenario generator
140 die cut counters to mark play progress

Contents: 
Size: 40 page soft bound rules book with full color cover plus a 64 page unit and weapon data book. 
Examples of Play: Included. 
Diagrams and Illustrations: Included. 
Complexity: Moderate, figure templates allow play without miniatures.
Players: Two or more recommended while solitaire suitability is excellent. 
Author: Richard J. Kane.

title: Bratz Twister
description: Exactly the same as Twister, but it has pictures of the Bratz toys and costs $2 more. Also known as 5th Horseman of the Apocalypse

title: Teddy Bear Look and Find Lotto
description:
The Teddy Bear Look and Find Lotto game has four busy picture boards of teddies having fun, and the object is for each player to be the first to collect all ten picture cards that correspond to his picture board.

Components: 4 picture boards, 40 picture cards.

To play:
1. Each player takes one of the four picture boards.  The 40 cards are shuffled and placed in a central pile face-down.
2. The first player takes the top card, and tries to describe the picture in as much detail as possible.
3. If a player finds the describe card on his board, he takes the card and places it on one of the ten squares around his picture board.
4. The game continues until one player has filled all ten squares on his picture board.

title: Victory By Any Means: Fire As She Bears Edition
types: Abstract Strategy Economic Napoleonic Nautical Print & Play Wargame
description:
From book:

Welcome to the latest chapter in the VBAM Series: the Victory by Any Means: Fire As She Bears! Edition. In these source materials we explore the exciting world of naval combat at the height of the Age of Sail. It is a time when Englands Wooden Walls kept her commerce alive and the armies of Napoleon at bay. A time when tall, proud warships prowled the vast waterways of the world, and such ships as the U.S.S. Constitution were to earn their place as legend.

For those of you who are new to either Victory by Any Means or Starboard Tack Press products, welcome! This game is modeled after the popular Victory by Any Means: Campaign Guide, and has been carefully developed and tested to fit the unique feel of the Age of Sail. By using the Origins Award (2005 Vanguard) winning Fire As She Bears! game as our tactical system, we can finally give gamers a fluid product that lets you worry about important decisions and planning of the Admiralty. For this latest source, the VBAM team has worked with Phil C. Fry, the author of the popular Napoleonic tactical naval game Fire As She Bears! to bring you a supplement which enables you to fight the war at sea as the Admiralty of a nation, subject to the whims of the crown and to generate gritty battles where sailing skills and cunning decide the fate of the battle.

This is a stand alone book that requires no other VBAM Games products to play, although Starboard Tack Press Fire As She Bears! Second Edition is highly recommended for a complete Age of Sail experience.

title: Italy
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Italy is a great variation of Axis & Allies: Europe. It changes setup, and some rules (only Italian language at the moment).

Expands:

    Axis & Allies: Europe




Home Page: http://giocolab.135.it

NB: Rules are given in English in the review:

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/2683755#2683755

title: Little Polar Bear Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Number Puzzle
description:
Match four cards by their colored picture symbols.  Arrange the sets of cards to create a delightful picture from hans de Beer's popular Little Polar Bear books.  Make the most sets and you win the game.

Little Polar Bear Card Game is a variation on Go Fish, and is geared towards young children ages 4 and up.  With no reading or number skills required, this two-part game will help reinforce basic counting, color identification, memory, and puzzle-solving skills.

Components: 32 full-color cards, instructions, plastic draw-pile tray.

title: Guesstures: Bible Edition
types: Card Game Party Game Real-time Religious
description:
Guesstures, Hasbro's family fovorite of split second characters now comes in a fun-filled BIBLE EDITION from Cactus Game Design, Inc.

QUICK!  You only have few short seconds per word!  Your four words this round are Baptize,  Cross, Moses and Lamb.  It looks easy, but its not.  As soon as your team guesses the word on the card  grab it before it gets swallowed by the card-hungry Mimer-Timer.  Then hurry on to the next card!

The harder the word, the more points its worth.
Grab the most points to win!

title: Zebra Zucht
mechanisms: Area EnclosurePattern BuildingPick-up and DeliverTile Placement
description:
Zebrazucht.

Northern Germany

The year is 2119.  Global warming has pushed northern Europes yearly average temperature to 27.7 C. The sale and breeding of exotic animals is one of the fastest growing businesses in the world. Breeding in captivity has become a necessity for the survival of most of the species existing 30 degrees longitude north and south of the equator. This massive area is so hot and dry that the remaining animals are simply fighting for survival and have no energy left for breeding. A massive movement to save these animals from extinction and the preservation of a living gene pool for genetic engineering has become the focus of many different organizations around the world.

Schleswig Holstein is the world leader in the art of genetically engineering exotic animals. They are highlighting and creating new traits in animals. Zebrazucht is a clinical experiment by two of the leading companies in the field of Genetics. One company genetically stripped male Zebras of most white coloration. The second company was able to genetically create female Zebras to be void of most of their black pigmentation. This six-year-old project is now in its final stages and the animals are being brought together for the first time in the height of mating season.  A special breeding facility was created to accommodate the project.

Players take on the role of scientists from both companies trying to bring as many pairs together as possible. The calculated end result should produce offspring Zebras that revert back to a more brilliantly stripped black and white color. If things go wrong the offspring might be hard to distinguish if placed amongst Holstein cows.

In this two-player game players move two workers towards each other and place a fence of their colour in that space.
Once a player has four fences of his color surrounding a corral that player places his Zebra in the space.The person opening the most corrals to unite black  white Zebras wins.

title: Dog Pound
description:
Dog Pound is a fast condition-recognition game similar to Slamwich, Twitch and Bongo. The cards are cut to resemble dog biscuits, and contain matching pairs of dogs and owners who bear an uncanny resemblance to each other. Whenever a pair appears on the card pile, the first person to slap the pile wins all of the cards.

There are also three special action cards that add a twist to the pattern recognition required in the game. The fire hydrant card costs you an extra card, which is added to the pile. The dog catcher card allows you to pick up the pile, but you have to leave the dog catcher behind. And finally, the dog biscuit card is a sort of wild card, and whoever slaps the pile first with a dog biscuit on it wins the pile.

The player who collects all of the cards in the deck wins.

Contents:

20 Dog Cards
20 Dog Owner Cards
2  Fire Hydrant Cards
2  Dog Catcher Cards
4  Dog Biscuit Cards
Rules on the box

title: The Wind in the Willows
types: Animals Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
The Wind in the Willows game is a simple roll and move game for up to four players.  The game was published by Reader's Digest using artwork and characters from the TVC London production of The Wind in the Willows for Carlton TV.

Players take it in turns to roll the dice and move their character (Mole, Ratty, Mr Toad or Badger) the number shown.  Throughout the game players will land on spaces that will slow down or speed up the progress to the celebration party at Toad Hall.  The instructions on the various squares must be followed when they are landed on.

The first player to land on the Finish at Square 49 with an exact throw on the dice is the winner.

title: Battle of Berlin
types: Card Game Print & Play Wargame World War II
description: This is a two player card game simulating the battle of Berlin (4/3/1945  5/2/1945).  Players are Russian Generals competing to be the first to capture Berlin. One player is Marshal Georgi Zhukov (First Belorussian Front). The other player is Marshal Ivan Koniev (First Ukranian Front). The game is free to print and play from the Ludi Popina web site.

title: Nebula Raiders
description: This low-complexity science fiction simulation game was distributed online in printable electronic format.  Players move their spacecraft around on a hex grid representing an unstable region of space.  Their objective is to collect a full cargo load of valuable pseudo plasma and return home.  This is complicated by two factors: everyone is armed with blasters, and the turbulent nebula causes random movement and damage to ships.  In addition to using counters to represent ships and potential hotspots on the mapboard, each player also has a status card where additional counters track ship system condition and repair status.  Optional rules are included for sensor probes, ship enhancement, team play and a few other add-ons.

title: Puck!
description:
Puck! is an ice hockey simulation game. Each player receives a hand of nine cards showing either a player position (Defenseman, Wing, Thug, or Center) or an action (such as Hook, Line Change, Breakaway or Great Save) as well as a value.  Generally, players have higher values, but lack the special abilities given by action cards.
To begin play, each player simultaneously plays reveals one card for the faceoff.  After seeing the opponent's play, each person chooses two other cards to add to their play. Whichever players set of 3 cards has the highest total value has the advantage and may take a shot.  A card from the draw pile is flipped over in order to decide if the shot was on goal and what the target number for success will be, then one more card is flipped over.  If the value of the second card, plus any modifiers from players cards such as Breakaway, or by having a much higher three card value than your opponent exceeds the target number, a goal has been scored.  If there is no goal, players check for penalties (if a Hook was played) or fights (if each team played a Thug), both of which are resolved by reducing the hand size of one of the players.
Play continues with the cards in hand, even if one side is unable to play 3 cards from injury or penalties.  If at the start of a round, a player has no cards, they draw a new hand of nine (a Line Change).  Line Changes also occur after goals (for both teams) or by playing a Line Change card during a round.
Once the deck is exhausted and not enough cards are left to complete a round, the period ends.  The player with the most goals after three periods wins.

title: Rabbit Guessing
description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin (similar to an Altoids tin) and contain small wooden pieces.

Place the carrot patch in the center of the playing area and the two rabbits (one belonging to each player) equidistant from the carrot patch (approximately 12 inches).

Players take turns. On your turn, secretly distribute the three carrots between your hands. The other player then selects one hand without knowing how many carrots are in each of your hands. If that player selects a hand that has carrots in it, they line up the carrots lengthwise in front of their rabbit and in the direction of the carrot patch. They then move their rabbit to just in front of the last carrot (closest to the patch).

First player to the carrot patch wins.

!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!

title: Mouse Acrobat
description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin (similar to an Altoids tin) and contain small wooden pieces.

The tin lid is placed on the ball (can be done in two ways - one making the game more challenging than the other). Place the mouse in the center of the lid. Each player gets 6 wedges of cheese. Players take turns pushing a cheese wedge onto the lid. It must be completely on the lid and no wedge can be placed on top of another. If you cause any wedges to fall off, you must take them. If the lid slips off the ball, you must take all the pieces that had been on the lid, reset the tin lid with mouse and then push a wedge on. Whoever is left without cheese first wins.

!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!

title: Dog's Luck
description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin (similar to an Altoids tin) and contain small wooden pieces.

Components: 4 dogs in 4 colors (one for each player), 5 bones, 1 die (sides are 1/2/2/3/doghouse/doghouse) and game tin with the lid half open (doghouse).

Place the doghouse in the center of the playing area and place the 5 bones in it. The players' dogs begin next to the doghouse on the long side to the left of the doghouse opening (door).

Players take turns. On your turn, roll the die. If the doghouse is rolled, turn the doghouse one quarter turn in any direction. If you roll a number, move that many 'spaces' in a clockwise direction around the doghouse, each 'space' being one side of the doghouse. If you can land inside the doghouse with an exact roll (jumping in from the short side with the door), you take a bone from the doghouse. If you are in the doghouse and you roll a doghouse, you cannot leave it on that turn.

First player to collect 2 bones wins.

Ages 5-99

title: Avanti Savoia: Intelligence Handbook on Italian Armoured and Infantry Forces
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
Avanti Savoia is a supplement for Flames of War, the World War II miniatures game. It provides the organization and equipment for the Italian Armored and Infantry Forces.

There are complete organization and equipment lists for Carri, Bersaglieri, Fucilieri, Motociclisti and Paracadutisti Companies in North Africa, Sicily and Italy. Additional rules and variants include German Allies, variants for ARMIR (Italian Army in Russia), variants for the 6th Army in Italy. There is also the history of the 132nd 'Ram' Armored Division.

Tactics articles, painting guide, and rules for warriors are also included.

title: Hairy Maclary Game
description:
A children's game based on the characters from New Zealand author Lynley Dodds' award-winning Hairy Maclary series of children's books.

Hairy Maclary from Donaldson's Dairy and his friends Hercules Morse, Bottomley Potts and Muffin McLay, are out for a walk, and must return to Donaldson's Dairy without getting caught by Scarface Claw, the toughest Tom in town.

Object of the game - The winner is the first dog to complete its walk from its starting position on the board - around the playground, the zoo, the beach and the park to reach Donaldson's Dairy, avoiding Scarface Claw.

title: Heat of Battle:  FireFights!
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
'FireFights!' scenarios are small, intense scenarios compatible with the ASL game system or any other tactical level wargame. All aspects of the game system are covered - with infantry, armor and artillery set in a variety of terrain and theatres.
Variety and re-playability are key components of FireFight Packs. Each scenario has a variable Order of Battle and most have variable entry turns and reinforcements. The reinforcements, when received, are historically accurate as to equipment available to that particular unit while it was in combat. Fog of war is also enhanced through set up and Scenario Variables. As a bonus each FireFight scenario comes with its own historically based 8 1/2 by 11 inch map for playing.

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader

title: Tim and Tam
description:
A lovely amusing children  family game for 2-8 players. Tim Tomato and Tam Paprika take you to the market to sell fruits and vegetables. Who gets paid most for the fruit and vegetable cards wins!

Players take turns moving around the board collecting fruits and vegetables. Once all the fruit and vegetable cards have been collected, one of the players randomly selects one of the three market value cards. Using the chosen card, the players add up their points. Whoever has the most points wins.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/timtam.htm

title: Time Jump
description:
Funny family  party game for 2-6 players. Who can guess the other's plans? Who's fooling who? You better stay 'cool' flying through the dimensions...and be aware of the nasty timeholes!

Players take turns moving their spaceship around whatever 'dimension' he is in (each dimension is represented by a circular board, and there are three dimensions.) The object is to move your ship through each dimension, starting with Dimension 1. Turning each round, one player acts as the 'Time-Master' and is able to place 1 to 3 'timeholes' which cause players either to go back to the start of the dimension (if you are in Dimension 1) or to drop back to the previous dimension on the space corresponding to the space you landed on (i.e. If you were on space 6 in Dimension 2 when you landed on a timehole you'd go back to space 6 in Dimension 1.)

The winner is the first player to pass the Time Jump space in Dimension 3 safely (i.e. If you pass the Time Jump space but land on a timehole, the game continues.)

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/timejump.htm

title: Q.A.X.
description:
Interesting stock-market  trading game for 2-4 players. Make the most profits by buying, selling and clever, tactical moving and trading!

Each player tries to earn the most money by moving his pieces around the board, buying shares and attacking other players (to get shares of stock from him.) After each move, players can trade shares of stock to earn money. The first player to gain a certain amount of money (based on the number of players) wins.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/qax.htm

title: Matrix
description:
A simple abstract game played on a 5x5 board (minus the corners.) The board has a 3x3 area in the middle with the numbers 1 through 9, plus 3 blank spaces adjoining each side of the board. The object of the game is to reach all 9 numbers by creating 'matrixes'. Each player has 2 pieces which are placed one at a time on the bank spaces on the outside edge of the board. Each player also has a list with the numbers 1 through 9 written on it. On a player's turn, he moves his pieces 3 to 5 spaces along the outside of the board, trying to form an intersection with a number. Each time the player forms an intersection with a number, he marks it off his list. The first player to mark all 9 numbers of his list wins.

http://www.printgames.net/english/matrix/detail_e.htm

title: Uncontrolled Squid
types: Bluffing Card Game Horror Print & Play
description:
Whos afraid of the big, bad squid? Im sure you know two to eight (or even more) players who arent.

Object: Establish your supremacy over all other squid cults by retaining the favor of the Squid Totem for three rounds.

You Need:

* A Squid Totem (We used a plush orange squid.)
    * A poker deck for every four players

Players, playing in teams, attempt to contol the Squid Totem by playing the highest card each round. However, if two players tie for highest card, the totem goes to whoever played the lowest card. If all players tie, the totem returns to the center of the table. Each player plays with their own set of cards, made up of one entire suit from a deck of cards. Each time a team (or the totem) wins, that team (or the totem) gets a point. The first team to get three points wins. However, if the totem gets three points, or if all cards are played without a winner, the totem wins and everyone elso loses. There are also some variants to these rules available on the website.

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/211/uncontrolled-squid

title: Der kleine Eisbär und das Schollenhopsen
description: Characters (Lars, Greta, Lena, Robbie or Caruso) are placed on an ice tiles which is slowly but surely losing parts (as determined by dice) - whoever places/moves his character with most skill (and luck) wins.

title: Manta Manni
description: board game dedicated to opel MANTA a famous german sport car late 80's...

title: Regatta
description: Command a colorful fleet in this dazzling game of pattern recognition. With 55 different races and two levels of exciting game play, Regatta is the ultimate single-player game for all ages. Pick a card, and place your crew in their boats and columns according to color and size of each boat, with the captain at the bow. Now, as fast as you can, rearrange your crew and boats to match the colors in each column-but never move the captain or sail a boat to another row. once all crew members are rearranged into solid color vertical columns, you've won the race. Includes 55 cards, 22 boats, 80 colorful crew members and an ocean-blue game board with built-in card holder and boat trays. Grades 1+ Ages 6+

title: Chrysanthemum Throne
description: Game in the days of the Age of the Country at War! The rules provide for play with all the fundamental unit types  samurai, ashigaru, matchlocks, mounted samurai, ambush parties, shinobi, and foot samurai, as well as the important characters - taisho, tsukai-ban, daimyo and champions. Experience the flavor of late-samurai warfare with rules for spectacular suicides and challenges. Campaign and tournament play are facilitated by the short play time (about 2 hours), the fate of characters, and the allowance for withdrawal. Finally, Chrysanthemum Throne includes a plain English guide to painting samurai armies.

title: Le Petit Empereur
description: Le Petit Empereur is a fast play rule set for the Napoleonic period gamer. It is designed to get you started quickly in this fascinating period by offering a short, concise rules set, army lists that require around 125 painted figures each, expandable terrain to meet your desires and the requirements of historical re-fights, minimal equipment requirements, and a mechanism called the morale clock that drives the game to its conclusion in less than two hours. To give a flavour for the period and its many quirks LPE includes rules for infantry in square, national differences, the differing impact of artillery and cavalry, troops of varying types and capabilities, and the impact of leadership and morale on the outcome of the battle.

title: Chipco Chess
types: American Civil War Ancient Fantasy Medieval
description:
Chipco Chess takes the basic movement rules of chess and adds wargame-style combat rules.

Outcomes are no longer certain because of the use of a d10. Chipco Chess is not solve-able, in the sense of standard chess, since thinking ahead is not possible. Players of all abilities have a more equal chance of winning the game.

Chipco Chess is played using a standard board with either chess pieces or wargame bases.

Variants are included that tailor the game to certain periods:

Ancient/Fantasy
Crusades/Medieval
Samurai
American Civil War

title: Zombies!!! 5: School's Out Forever
description:
Raise your hand if you thought Zombies!!! 4: The End... really was the end.

At Twilight University, the normal curriculum has changed. Instead of studying science and art, students at this school study improvised weaponry and major in SURVIVAL!!!

This expansion could be played stand-alone with shotgun guys (or other player markers) and tokens for bullets and hearts.

title: Lilypad
description:
A checkers variant for two players.

Every spring on May Day, sprites and spriggans, dryads and trolls across the world all gather together in a secret place for the Unseen Revel--one boisterous week of music, merriment, revelry and sport. One of the most popular games at the Unseen Revel is a simple game called 'Lilypad': Two tiny fairies try to race across a pond filled with frogs and turtles without getting wet, and the first one across wins. To complicate things, one fairy is allowed to only step on turtles and the other is allowed to only step on frogs, and they start on opposite sides of the pond.

(Oh, by the way... If little sprites dancing on turtles and frogs is too fey for you, then just pretend that you're futuristic gladiators battling on hover drones over a pit of red-hot magma. That should get your testosterone pumping.)

The players attempt to move their pawns across the board without being captured. The first person to get his pawn across the board wins. If both players' pawns are captured, the game ends in a draw.

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/107/lilypad

title: Psi Squad
description:
A logic game for three or more players. Object: To end the game with the most status by guessing the keys to the other players cyphers while keeping your cypher's keys as much of a mystery as possible.

It's 2138 AD. You attend an exclusive academy for individuals with psychic talents. For the past two months you've been under consideration for admission to an elite program. Now it's just down to you and a handful of others: The best of the best. If you pass this final test, you'll be sent on an important mission to an outpost outside the solar system!

In this test, you will choose a sequence of four concepts, or 'keys'. This specific sequence of keys is your 'cypher'. You and your fellow applicants will be locked in an isolation chamber. Your mission is to use your telepathic abilities to probe the minds of your rivals to uncover the keys to their cyphers while protecting your own cypher from discovery.

Success means a promotion and adventure. Failure means another 21 sessions of Dr. Quinto's 'Meditation Under Extreme Duress' class.

Do you have what it takes?
http://invisible-city.com/play/104/psi-squad

title: How To Host a Scavenger Hunt: Animal Safari
description:
A party game from the makers of the popular How To Host A Murder series.  How to Host A Scavenger Hunt: Animal Safari combines the zaniness of a road rally, the adventure of a treasure hunt, and the thrill of a race against the clock - ending at the point-totaling post-hunt party.

Components: 1 host's guide, 20 team badges, 4 team paddles, 4 badge card clue lists, 4 official things lists, 4 team envelopes with instructions, 1 official scoresheet, 16 postcard invitations, 16 badge cards, 4 stuff bags.

title: Take 12
description:
Boxed set of two red dice, a green playing field, and twelve white cubes numbered one through twelve.

Object of the game is to win as many of the cubes as possible by rolling the dice and matching the total of the dice with the numbers on the cubes.  It's a just very slight riff on Shut the Box.

I wonder if the name of the game is a play on the jazz song Take 5, which was a huge hit starting in 1959.  The art direction on this game is great.  It feels so very cool late 50's, like a Rat Pack movie.

title: Treasure Trail
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description: Race for riches in this gold gathering game! The object if the game is to be the first player to collect 4 different types of treasure n their chest and take it back to the boat.

title: Jasper Memo
types: Animals Children's Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This is one of three childrens games featuring the friendly penguin Jasper, that every child knows from the german TV program Sendung mit der Maus. The little penguin is always curious and discovers our world.

title: Bürokratie: Ausgabe Schulen 2005
description: Brokratie - Ausgabe Schulen (Bureaucracy - School Edition) is by Jrgen Junghanel and is a strategic card game that plays like a board game and deals with excessive bureaucracy in a critical manner. Those who know many bureaucrats and use their knowledge get ahead. Just putting in an honest days work as a teacher isnt good enough. You get closer to the desired bureaucrats, when the class sizes increase, by playing out new school, school board or ministry of culture facilities. The better facilities attract more bureaucrats  that much is obvious. When the class sizes shrink, you can increase the number of bureaucrats by skills: new laws, new rules or certificates. To play out facilities or skills you need various cards such as party book, lobbying, intrigue, catastrophe and honest work, which you get for teaching and are therefore easiest to get in the schools. The player with the most bureaucrats wins. But theres also  although rarely  justice: The player who manages to get 7 of the 10 school cards receives an award from the government and immediately wins all the bureaucrats.

title: DRG: Das Spiel – Ausgabe Innere Medizin 2005
description:
DRG - Das Spiel - Ausgabe Innere Medizin 2005 (DRG - The Game - 2005 Internal Medicine Edition) by Jurgen Junghandel is a bluffing card game about the new accounting methods used in German hospitals (DRG stands for Die Riesige Gemeinheit, or The Huge Injustice). The game was released last year in a Neurology edition, but was completely reworked for this year. Whats it all about?

The game casts players as doctors doing their bookkeeping. They have to make sure that the numbers work out as much in their favour as possible  they can leave the cases that will incur huge costs to their colleagues. Cases are laid out  a primary diagnosis and a face-down waiting card which eventually becomes a secondary diagnosis. Depending on the difficulty level of the secondary diagnoses, a table defines the value that the primary diagnosis will have in this case. This value can be changed by other players by playing out on call cards. The next player tries to capture the trick by playing out a case with a higher value. When scoring, the waiting card for each case is turned over separately and the value adjusted for a long or short waiting time. The costs are tabulated and the gains recorded. Over the course of the game, after months cards can also be played that can ruin the best cases.

title: Star Fleet Battles: Module T – Tournament Battles
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the cover:

Module T includes everything you need to compete in deadly SFB tournaments:
- SSDs: Completely updated for the Millennium, including entirely new ones.
- Detailed rules on every aspect of tournament competition.
- Judging Standards and Procedures: How to run an SFB event, and how to be sure that judge is running a fair tournament.
- Tournament Scenarios: Six special battles just right for deciding who in your group is the Top Phaser. You have no friends; you have no allies.
- Tournament Tactics: Detailed information from the experts on how to fly any of the tournament ships to final victory.
- Stellar combat map, special tournament play aids, plus 216 special tournament counters and 108 extra ammunition counters.
- Federation  Empire: The official tournament scenario and rules.

title: Star Fleet Battles: Campaign Designer's Handbook
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the cover:

Campaigns are the ultimate expression of Star Fleet Battles. Only in a campaign setting does everything  cost, fleets, technology, availability, movement, economics, deployments  come together into a complete picture of war in space!

The Campaign Designers Handbook provides options allowing you to create a campaign that suits your own tastes and interests.

Strategic Arena: Maps and ideas on how to lay out your universe for conquest! Historical, hexagonal, octagonal, large, or small, its up to you!

Economics: How to buy, build, and supply your massive space fleet, while keeping the amount of paperwork under control so you can focus on the battle. New SSDs are provided for Naval Construction Docks and Warp Gates. The innovative TechBlock system provides players with the opportunity to buy the technologies that will win battles, or gamble on the technology to win wars! Everything is covered, including repairs, refits, upgrades, plus new improvements and variants. Wars are fought for money  design yours so you can play to win!

Scenarios are the whole point of a campaign; everything else is designed to deliver your ships to the battle. This handbook includes several options and concepts for generating, setting up, and controlling the size of scenarios.

Races: How to fit them into your campaign so that each can strive to fulfill its destiny.

And More: Strategic Sequence of Play, legendary officers (including several new types), outstanding and poor crews, and entirely new rules on espionage, sabotage, and random events!

title: Star Fleet Battles: Module P6 – The Galactic Smorgasbord
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Description from the back of the cover:

All new challenges for Star Fleet Battles, FE, Prime Directive, and Star Fleet Assault!

The Early Years: The Paravian Raptor Light Cruiser with its fiery Quantum Wave Torpedoes is here to kill Gorns or die trying!

The Vudar Enclave: A subject race rebels against the Empire! Their War Destroyer rampages through Klingon space with Ion Cannons blazing, protected by the Ion Pulse Generator.

New Weapons and Rules: Megaphasers! Megaphotons! Mini-photons! Stonefish Drones ! High Energy Decelerations ! Comets get in your way! Drag Space got you down?

New Scenarios: A Crab inhabits the nebula and will eat your ship for lunch! An alien Derelict ship deserves investigation. Can you escape the Ambush Over Remus?

The Hispaniolans: A new simulator race armed with the rapid-fire Proton Torpedo and Gatling Phasers, complete with four new SSDs!

New Ships: Dreadnoughts, Cruisers, War Destroyers, and variants will bring the Deltans, Britainians, Canadiens, and Flivvers into your campaign! The Frax join in with their new X-Ships!

New Stuff for Prime Directive (Vendetta) and Federation  Empire (ships from R6)!

Designer Notes: Just what will be in Module V  Operational Movement, Module C3A  The Andromedan Threat File, Module X2  Second-Generation X-Ships, the Tactical Intelligence Handbook, the Ship Comparison Chartbook, and Star Fleet Assault? Answers are here!

title: A Sky Full of Ships
types: Aviation / Flight Miniatures Science Fiction Wargame
mechanisms: Action / Movement ProgrammingDice RollingSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
[From the Book]
A simple (but not too simple) set of starship combat rules, which allow huge fleets to engage each other in epic battle 
(and finish in a reasonable amount of time).

You take the place of an admiral, commanding entire fleets. 
Using simple, fast-moving game mechanics, these rules attempt to portray the important aspects of huge fleet engagements without becoming to bogged down in time consuming detail.

They're for those players willing to sacrifice some complexity to achieve a fast-moving, playable and most importantly, FUN game.

title: Das grosse Hollywood Spiel
types: Card Game Dice Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
This is a very rare Boardgame designed by Wolfgang Kramer for a German Pay TV - channel named Premiere.

Game components:

1 Board
1 Rulebook
6 Player figures
5 Film Company disks
105 Playing Cards (15 Joker)
27 Event Cards
5 Dice

Game Overview:

The Players take the roll of filmproducers.

The Cards and disks are divided in 5 different film types:
Love, Western, Science-Fiction, Comedy and Action

The cards show values from 1-6
Every type of film could only be played on the same type of film except Jokers, which could be played on every type of film.

Every round everybody choses one type of film and draws a card from the chosen type. The Starting player can draw 2 cards.

Then he must roll all 5 dice and move forward with every single film company with exact one dice.

When a film company lands on a yello field a film is produced and starting with the player left from the starting player everyone could play cards from the same type of film and jokers. The player with the highest value on his cards gets the most points, the second... Nothing New ;)

Then anybody who played cards on this movie must discard one card and take back the others.

When all but one film company completed the first round on the board the last film company is discarded for the rest of the game.

On the point-track on the board are some special fields like
Random Events (Event Cards), Bonus Points or Loose some points, so sometimes it could be better, to produce a bad film.

Game ends, if at least one player reaches the last field of the point-track. The Player with the most points wins the game.

title: Witch Stones
description:
A 2-player abstract strategy game in the vein of Pente or Othello. Four types of stones are arrayed on a 9x9 board: earthstones, suns, moons, and crowns. One player plays the suns, and the other player plays the moons. Players take turns removing stones or groups of stones from the board. A player may make one of three moves:

     removing one earthstone,
     removing one of their own stones, or
     removing all of the stones in an unbroken line between two empty board spaces.




Players score based on the type of stone removed: 1 point for an earthstone, 2 points for an opposing player's stone, and 5 points for a crown. The first player to reach 50 points wins.

The product is available in PDF format and includes rules for using the game as a MacGuffin in a role-playing game but is itself a stand-alone strategy game.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Double Hi-Q
description: This is a two-player version of the popular Solitaire peg-jumping game in which a player attempts to remove 32 pegs from a cross-shaped grid of holes.  Whenever a peg jumps over another peg and lands in an empty hole, the jumped peg is removed from the board.  In competitive play, players begin with 25 points.  Each round, both players attempt to complete the solitaire puzzle.  When no legal moves remain, each player subtracts the number of pegs remaining on the other's board from his or her score.  The first player to reach zero points wins.

title: Suits by Twelve
description:
This is a trick-taking game with fairly standard mechanics.  Players are dealt five-card hands (or equal hands of less than five cards, if the deck is nearly exhausted).  The highest card played wins a trick, and players must follow suit if possible.  Players who cannot follow suit can play a non-trump card (automatically losing the round) or a trump card (potentially winning the round, unless a higher trump is played).  The trump suit is determined by rolling a special die showing the four suits plus one side with both red suits and another side with both black suits.  When a side with multiple suits is rolled, the dealer gets to pick which suit is trump.  The trump suit and dealer change every time the deck is exhausted.

Small plastic poker chips also play a part in the game.  Players start with an equal amount of chips.  A plastic tray is kept at the center of the board during play.  At the end of every trick in which a trump was played, all losing players have to place a chip in the Suits section of the tray.  Whenever a King is played, players place chips in the Jackpot section of the tray.  Each player has a game card showing the four suits.  Whenever a player wins a trick, he or she places a special yellow Hoyle tile under the leading suit for the trick.  Whenever a player fills all three spaces under a suit, he or she wins the chips in the Suits area of the tray and the other players have to put chips into that area.  Whenever a pre-determined number of suits are filled in, the Jackpot is won along with the Suits area.

After a player has filled in a suit, he or she gains the ability to freeze the suit -- upon winning a suit for the fourth time, the player can flip over one of the tiles on his or her card.  This prevents any other player from placing a tile under this suit -- instead, the only option they have is to unfreeze the suit by flipping their opponent's tile back over.  It's possible for all three tiles to get flipped, making it very difficult for anyone else to win in the suit.

The game has no predefined end.  The rules suggest playing for a certain amount of time, eliminating players who run out of chips until only a single player remains, or playing for a pre-determined amount of time.  The play time listed in this entry reflects a single round of play, not an entire game.

title: Shove Off
description:
This game is played on a four-by-four grid, and the object is to get four disks of your own color in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row.  At the start of the game, the board is populated with neutral brown disks.  Each turn, the current player pushes one of his or her disks onto the board using one of eight entrance ramps.  As a result, a different disk gets pushed off the opposite end of the board.  Players may shove off neutral pieces or their own pieces, but not pieces belonging to their opponents.  If a player runs out of men, then the player may use a neutral disk. The plastic game board doubles as a storage case for the pieces.

CONTENTS:
16 Tan Discs
8 Orange discs
8 yellow discs
rules 
board
tray that attaches under board to hold pieces

title: The Wordmaster Game
description:
This game includes seventy two-sided cards printed with different crossword puzzle patterns.  Players compete to score the most points while filling in the puzzles.

[note -- sorry this entry isn't more detailed; my copy is missing the instructions]

title: This Sceptered Isle
description:
This Sceptered Isle consists of 4 battles of the Wars of the Roses. Towton, Mortimer's Cross, Barnet and Tewkesbury.

It uses an evolution of the system from his pre-gunpowder quads published through 3W (Age of Chivalry, Crusades, Sword & Shield, Henry V, Crusades II). The command system has been changed to accommodate leader character - leaders are rated as aggressive, controlled, or timid, and are likely to gravitate to an order stance that is in keeping with their character as the battle unfolds. Correct exploitation of their capability in the battle plan is important for victory.  The melee and fire combat mechanics are also quite different from the other games in the series.

The counters are nicely done, icons. The maps are DTP standard. Best of all, the rules are short, counters few, and you can set up and play and finish in an hour.

title: Battle Cells Game Cards
description:
A strategy game on immunology and microbiology, the game includes two decks of 40 cards each. One is the pathogen deck and the other is the immunity system deck. Players can choose to attack or defend, and the first player whose deck is exhausted or who runs out of immunity points loses the game.

Called Battle Cells Game Cards, the cards do not involve mystical beings or suits like diamonds and spades. 
.Instead, they are adorned with pictures of viruses, pathogens and pills, along with facts and the classification of the each organism.
The cards were developed by a biotech company and a team of Raffles Institution students who have decided that that there are others ways to learn life sciences aside from textbooks and stacks of notes.
First conceptualised by Genecet Biotechnologies, a leading biotech company that provides education in life sciences to schools, the prototype was then passed to the RI students Melvyn Kee, Hoe Si En, Nicholas Leong and Tan Ee Kuan  to improve on.
.Said Genecet Senior Manager Mr Jeffrey Lee: Being students, the RI boys had a different perspective on the game, because we as adults don't really know what they would enjoy.
.

title: Team Work: Religion
description:
Team Work is a small and easy to understand but nevertheless very entertaining card-game. The rules are easy to understand and can be explained in under 2 minutes. Team Work is not a game about winning or losing - it is a game of having fun. Team Work Religion is one of several expansions that add new themes and terms.

Expands:

    Team Work Original

title: Fast Rules
description:
Fast Rules for Table Top Battles using Minature World War Two Armor, Artillery,  Infantry

A simple playable ruleset for WWII. Mike Reese and Leon Tucker collaborated for this mid-level skirmish game. Don Lowry illustrated the cover. A precursor to their collaboration with Gary Gygax with TSR for Tractics in 1975, Fast Rules has 24 pages in a booklet format and was one of several rulesets in the many periods for miniatures that Guidon Games produced in the 1970's.

title: Bastogne: Command Decision Series Module
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description: Bastogne is a Command Decision Module for the Battle of the Bulge. Covering the battle from an operational point of view,  the 48 page book has many photos and rule changes to the Command Decision II rulesset. This module can be used for any comparable ruleset of operational level combat. Included are complete OOB, Maps and 16 scenarios to recreate on the tabletop.

title: Barbarossa 25: Command Decision Series Game
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description: Barbarossa 25 is a scaled version of the Command Decision Series. This module recreates the initial attack of Germany on the Russian front. The scale is 1/25 of the attack with the maps set up to take advantage of the great expanse of the Russian campaign. The Command Decision rule set is required, yet the book modifies some key factors in playing this game. As an operational level game, Finland and Romania OOB are included with the obligatory Russian and German OOB. Also Weapons charts, scenario and notes are included. Other rule sets can be used for these battles that somewhat start as a board game to create the miniature battle locations for the table.

title: The Last Crusade: The Russian Front
types: Card Game Wargame World War II
description:
The Last Crusade was a CCG, but the Russian Front expansion is a totally stand alone game, with all of the cards included.  Two Starter packs of the CCG original game are included if you have not yet started to play this game in it's original form, or you can dovetail in your existing German deck.
320 Cards with 200 new cards (120 are from the 2 starter decks)

title: Star Fleet Battles: Advanced Missions
types: Expansion for Base-game Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the box:

Prepare for Advanced Missions! New rules expand the Star Fleet Battles game system and add rich detail to your campaigns of galactic conquest!
- Maneuvering: nimble ships make mid-turn speed changes and dock at bases
- Combat: catastrophic damage, tactical intelligence, surprise and passive fire control
- Weapons: advanced drones, the deadly mauler and the rapid-fire plasma rack
- Systems: super computers, mine fields, elite crew and legendary officers
- Adventure: 20 new scenarios and campaigns, as well as over 100 new ships
- Challenge: gravity waves, ion storms, supernovae and three new monsters

The latest edition includes:
- 192 page Captains Advanced Missions Rulebook (1999)
- 216 die-cut multi-color playing pieces
- 144 page SSD Book with all charts  tables (2003)

title: Saved by the Bell: The New Class
description:
From the back of the box:

It's time for some hilarious new adventures at everyone's favorite school, Bayside High. And to make it even better, Zack and Kelly are stopping by to join in the fun. The object is to be the first player to collect 3 prank tokens and have three differen date-cards- one each of WHO, WHAT, and WHERE. You date may end up being a romantic who takes you to a scary movie and then out for a picnic. Or maybe your date is athletic and you go to a baseketball game and then eat pizza with everything. Your date can be different every time you play.

Includes gameboard, date cards, prank cards, prank tokens, movers, game die, and original instructions

title: Mt. Everest
description:
Players each climb a different face on the pyramid shaped, 3-D mountain, rolling the die in a race to the summit. The climbers have magnets in their boots (base), so they stick to the metalicized mountain as they advance. A roll of six causes an avalanche (lose a turn). There are a couple of shortcuts available on each route, but it takes a exact dice roll to cross them.

The game comes with a 16 page booklet that contains photographs and information about Everest, including the successful summit by Edmund Hillary and sherpa Norkay Tensing just two years prior to the game's publication

title: L'île lettrée
description:
A question game about the French language, expecially suitable for Canada/Qubec.

There are two levels of questions, and categories are: anagrams, spelling, definition, grammar, anglicisms and synonyms, proverbs, literature and miscellaneous.

title: Macius: Achtung, fertig, los !
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Memory Puzzle
description: Each player has a puzzle-like board onto which he must fit a complete set of characters. The characters are shuffled and put in the middle of the table, whoever finishes first has won. The boards contain the same sets but have different layouts, i.e. characters fit in different parts of the respective boards and also have different sizes from one board to the next.

title: Sternenkinder
description:
aka Star Children.

This game can be played for ages 4 and up.  It involves the collecting of stars in order to distribute sweet dreams to the children on Earth.  Nominee for Kinderspiel des Jahres 2005.

title: Ene Mene Muh, gib mir deine Kuh!
description: Players move farm animals into their stables and become familar with farm animals.  For ages 4+.  Nominee for kinderspiel 2005.

title: Libertadores 1810-1824
description:
Libertadores is a game system that allows players to have a fast but historically accurate simulation; the low counter density allows player to finish each battle in 2 hours maximum. Scales: battalion sized units for infantry, two squadrons for the cavalry and batteries for the artillery. 150 mts per hex and 1 hour per turn.

With Libertadores, Ludopress is trying to cover a vacuum that has lasted too many years: the campaigns and battles which decided the fate of a continent had never been simulated as a board wargame.

The Eight Battles included in Libertadores are:


     Ayacucho 1824. Gen. Sucre's victory that decided definitively the fate of the Peru.
     Boyac 1819. Bolvar' decisive victory after their epic crossing of the Andes range.
     Carabobo 1821. The intervention of the British Legion decided the outcome of the battle.
     Viluma 1815. Crushing Royalist victory by one of their most brilliant generals, Pezuela, that prolonged for several years the Spanish sovereignty over the Upper Peru (What today is called Bolivia).
     Puente Caldern 1811. The rebellion is crushed initially in Mexico, which will not become independent until 1821.
     Maipo 1818. Victory of San Martn' army that secured for good the independence of Chile.
     Vicalpugio 1815. Royalist victory decided in extremis by an unexpected cavalry charge.
     Chacabuco 1817. The Royalist are defeated by San Martn and lose a good opportunity to finish off the army that the following year will free Chile.

title: Zobmondo!! Would You Rather...? Pocket Version
description:
From the Publisher:
In this version you'll find questions that are ethical, bizarre and mind-bending, but each is a field-tested conversation starter that is guaranteed to provoke ridiculous fun, break the ice at any party, and - if played correctly - open a unique window into the wild imaginations of friends and family!

title: Ato-Blitz War Games
description:
This is a Stratego-like game that's actually two games, an army game and a navy game.  Pieces are set up on a board in a manner similar to Stratego, but rather than being linear (numerical values), the units have a rock-paper-scissors relationship.  i.e. the tank unit is superior to infantry and engineers but is inferior to aircraft, artillery, and mine units.

For those who want to recreate the (army) game, the pieces are as follows:  Private, corporal, sergeant, staff sergeant = 3 each.  Second lieutenant, first lieutenant, captain, major, lieutenant colonel, colonel, 1, 2, 3, and 4 star generals = 1 each. Tanks=2, plane=1, Anti-aircraft/anti-tank=5. Mines=6, Engineers=6. A-Bomb=1.

Infantry take each other according to rank; infantry also takes anti-aircraft/anti-tank and engineers.  Tanks and planes take infantry and engineers. Plane takes tank, anti-aircraft/anti-tank takes planes and tanks, engineers take mines without damage.  Mines are stationary pieces that explode and destroy anything that triggers it except an engineer. The A-Bomb is essentially a movable mine that destroys every piece in a surrounding square when it explodes.

The pieces are like mah jongg tiles arranged so that the opponent cannot see what kind they are -- he just sees blank pieces advancing toward him. When a piece is attacked or attacks, it is turned over so that the face is visible.  It then becomes a known piece for the rest of the game.
