We played the game in Hawaii in elementary school in the late 1950s.  There were two blank pieces included, presumably in case a piece got lost.  We sometimes used these to create two additional pieces, the brainwasher and the kamikaze.  The kamikaze was simply a flying bomb.  The brainwasher changed an opponent's piece into one of your own.  It was not possible to brainwash the A-Bomb.

title: Rolf Harris Cartoon Pics
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description:
From the Box:
Let's see who's Quickest on the Draw with Rolf Harris's new drawing game! Turn the eggtimer and race against your friends.  The idea is sketching charades on paper. The first team to successfully guess 8 charades wins.

Contents:
6 Non-toxic crayons
Over 2000 words and phrases
8 Wipe-off boards
One die.

title: Top-ography
description:
This game teaches American geography - in particular city names and locations.

Players take turns selecting either red or black and then spinning the Alphabet Top.  The player then announces either the red or black letter as appropriate.  Next, that player inverts the sand timer and places pegs next to cities on the map of the United States that start with the letter spun.  When the sand runs out, their turn is over and play passes to the next player.  The first player to place all 25 of their pegs onto the map correctly wins.  If a peg is placed incorrectly, 2 additional pegs of that player are removed as a penalty.

title: Domodots
description:
From the box:

A new game to increase number skills.

There are tiles of three colors with variable number of black and white pips positioned at random on the two ends of each tile.  Players match tiles based on color and one of: (1) the total number of black and white pips on the tile halves, (2) the number of black pips on the tile halves, or (3) the number of white pips on the tile halves.

title: Centre Court
description:
Tennis replay/simulation.

Uses rating cards and dice. Aim is to enable whole tournaments to be run - so an average match should take no more than a couple of minutes.

title: Four Field Kono
description:
This is one of the new mini-leather travel games by HiKu that comes with a a leather game board in a 7 by 7 cm wooden box. This is a small tactics game from Korea.

Korean abstract strategy game. In Denmark it is also known as Gok.

The board consist of 16 squares, 4 by 4. Each player has 8 pawns, which are placed with the 8 whites at the top 2 rows, and the 8 black at the bottom 2 rows.

The are two ways of moving:

Move one square, vertical or horizontal, into an empty square.

Jump over one of your own pawns and land directly on top of an opponent's pawn, vertical or horizontal, and thereby taking the opponent's pawn out of the game.

The goal is to take away all of the opponent's pawns, or to force him into a situation where he cannot move.

title: Lam Turki
description: This is an ancient solitaire game from Bengala. This is one of the new mini-leather travel games by HiKu that comes with a a leather game board in a 7 by 7 cm wooden box.

title: Robinson & Freitag
description: Robinson  Freitag (Robinson  Friday) is a bluffing, bidding and building game by Michael Palm. As Robinson, landing on an isolated island, the players try to collect materials to build various things on their islands. Eventually, events such as wild animals, droughts, tidal waves (even Robinson had to deal with natural disasters) occur. The player who is best prepared for these events is ahead, and when Friday comes for the second time the day of departure for the player with the biggest raft is nigh.

title: Money Spinner Game
description:
From the rules:

To make a fortune in business, one has to Make a Product by buyin up business elements [or Money Spinners] that combine together.

The object of the game is to make enough money to out bid all opponents on all cards auctioned.

title: Flippin' Penguins
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Electronic Real-time
description:
Childrens dexterity game that involves using a spring-loaded flipper to launch penguin figures onto a plastic iceberg. The iceberg has an electronic motor that causes it to tilt unpredictably, making it harder to time your shots.
Penguins that miss, or are knocked off, the iceberg end up in the sea - a gutter around the base which deposits the penguins into the players' flippers as it tilts with the rest of the iceberg.

title: Little Noddy's Taxi Game
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
This is another game from the Noddy genre.
In this game, each player has a taxi cab and moves around a board 1, 2 or 3 spaces at a time.  The currency is nickels, and depending on the space you land you, you gain or lose nickels.  The goal of the game is to reach the house of your passenger and take them to their destination, both of which are decided at the beginning of the game.  The first player to do this and reach the taxi stand again gets 4 bonus nickels, the next gets 3, and so on.
This game comes with a board, 4 destination cards, 4 passenger cards, a taximeter, a box of nickels, 4 ceramic taxis, and 4 ceramic passengers.  The ceramic pieces are what make this old game quite unique.  The game is very fun.

title: Giseh!
description:
Intersting Connect Four 3D-variant with great looking material. Score as many rows with 4 marbles of your color as possible before the pyramid is completed. Simple rules, fast gameplay.

Obwohl es nur darum geht, whrend des gemchlichen Aufbaus der Pyramide mglichst viele Viererreihen mit der eigenen Farbe zu legen, ist es doch um so schwieriger, den berblick ber die Kugeln des Spielgegners zu behalten. Durch die vielfltigen Spielmglichkeiten in der dritten Dimension wird man schneller ausgetrickst als man glauben will. Vorausschauendes Handeln und Konzentration sind gefragt. 204 Kugeln lang Spannung pur, bis die letzte Kugel gelegt ist - denn erst zum Schluss entscheidet sich, wer der wahre Giseh!-Meister ist.

Individuelles Design
Hier bleiben keine Wnsche offen! Wir bieten Ihnen nicht einfach nur ein Spiel an, sondern auch ein Designobjekt, das nicht nach jeder Spielrunde wieder in dem Karton verschwinden muss. Denn diese Spiele knnen sich sehen lassen! Durch ein erstklassiges Produktangebot stellen Sie Giseh! ganz individuell nach Ihren Wnschen zusammen.

Fr drei oder vier Mitspieler knnen Sie ein Erweiterungsset bestellen.

title: Njal's Holiday
description:
(From the designer's website)

In Njal's Holiday, you try to make the ultimate viking horde. In true fashion, you raid your neighbors, kill other vikings, loot the gold and take thier women.

The norse gods like to help or hinder your progress however. Other hardships of Viking life are here, too. Random invasions, strange beasts and natural disaster await you. Darwinism might be proved correct, for only the mightiest Viking clan will survive!

Find out why NJAL'S HOLIDAY is the fastest growing late night con pickup game around!

Njal's Holiday is a game for 2 or more players. 3 or more players is highly recommended.


             To produce the game as inexpensively as possible (and passing the savings on to you), The game elements come on uncut sheets of card stock. ***
        
    


The game contains: One rule sheet, One page each of 80 counters for Vikings, Women and Gold, One Sheet of six Boats and 7 sheets of 10 cards (68 for the game and 2 blanks so you can be creative).

You will need 1 six-sided die for each player, a pair of scissors to cut the cards and a little patience to cut them with.

title: Rings on Your Fingers
description: Children's memory game. Rings are placed upside-down on different coloured spaces. On each turn, the spinner determines what color spaces you are allowed to choose a ring from. If the ring you chose to look at matches your card, you may keep it. Players must find the five rings represented on their card.

title: Space Barons
description:
(Description based on prototype.)

Space Barons is a quick game of trading space commodities, with commodities and thematic elements found in Felithian Finance, another Tom Wham unpublished game.  The theme includes many funny elements, such as the green eggs which could hatch, resulting in a fight against the awful green things from outer space :-)

Inventory: map showing star systems and connections between them; rocket ship pawns, home base pawns, transporters (similar to monopoly houses), galactic credits (money chits), 46 spaceship card with subsidiary engine and cargo hold cards, deck of delivery cards, deck of insurance cards, two six-sided dice.

Players begin by selecting a spaceship dealer and rolling two six-sided dice, then buying one of the available spaceships.  They then build their home base (which doubles as a permanent transporter), selecting a star system from the map.  Each star system has a cost to build, ranging from 10-50, which indicates the value and number of deliveries that can be made to that system.

On each turn, players are dealt two delivery cards, which specify a cargo and three destinations, varying in value.  The cargo is automatically available at the system where the player's rocket pawn is located.  The player may keep as many cards as their spaceship has cargo holds, freely selecting between new cards and previously retained cards.  On a player's turn, they may move their rocket pawn a number of systems equal to the number of engines on their spaceship.  Upon arrival at a system specified by their cards, they are paid for the cargo.

There are no restrictions on arrival at a system.  However, to depart from a system a player must possess a matter transporter at that system, or pay another player to rent their transporter.  If no transporter is present, the player must build one on a later turn in order to move.

During the game, players choose from a limited number of special actions, such as upgrading ships, building new transporters, advertising (to receive two extra delivery cards) or simply taking money (the least appealing option).  Only one special action may be taken each turn.

Random events are included in the delivery deck.  Some of these can result in loss of spaceship or transporter, or devaluing of cargo.  A player may buy an insurance policy, partially covering the cost of losing a ship or transporter.

The delivery deck has a reshuffle card.  Upon reshuffling, an end-of-game card is added to the delivery deck.  The player with the most money when the end-of-game card is revealed wins the game.

title: Helix
description:
The board consists of 12 rods arranged in a pattern of a circle with 2 perpendicular diameters and 2 sets of co-terminal arcs arranged at a 45 degree angle with respect to the the diameters.

Players start with 24 beads (either blue or red).  The goal is to create patterns of 4 beads along any line either horizontally or in a stair-step pattern.  The line can be along the outside of the circle, along one of the two straight lines, or along one of the arcs.  A line along an arc in a stair-step pattern is called a helix.

After all 48 beads have been played, the game is scored as follows:

1 point for each line of 4 beads
1 bonus point for the first line of 4 beads
2 points for each line of 5 beads

The player with the highest total score is the winner.

The game can also be played as a partnership game with partners sitting across from each other and sharing a color.

Similar to:

    Score Four

title: Radical Racers TCG
description:
A new TCG with an automotive theme.  Start the game with a set MPH (miles per hour).  Each player Battles through the race playing four mutant racer cards attempting to decrease opponents' speed, while at the same time increasing their own.  Some interesting mechanics is that a player can force a tie, instant win or lose all their mutant cards.  The racer at the end with the highest mph wins.  They have also added an Advance game where you play until one player has captured all their opponents' Racers.

Online Play

     CCG Workshop (no longer available)

title: Junkyard Wars
description:
Junkyard Wars is a print and play game available as a downloadable pdf. It consists of several decks of playing cards, counters to represent the players bots and playing mats to keep track of all your resources and upgrades.

[From the Manufacturer]
Junkyard Wars is a tactical game of battle and resources gathering where players take on the role of a robotic factory and the Bots that it manufactures to act as its slaves.
The game consists of players trying to both out maneuver their foes, while at the same time trying to gather the needed resources that are required to both upgrade their Bot slaves and to achieve total victory over their foes. Nothing short of the destruction of the enemy factory will see you winning the game, so play smart and be ruthless in your machine like drive to survive.

title: Donde No se Ponía el Sol
description:
Alea Magazine issue 30.

Donde No se Pona el Sol (English:  Where the Sun Never Set) is a wargame which includes four battles from the era of the Spanish tercios:  San Quintn 1557, Otumba 1520, Nieuport 1600, and Tunis 1535.

title: Scuba Dive Game
description:
From the instructions: OBJECT OF PLAY-Scuba Dive Game is a game designed for the non-diver as well as the diver. Many basic concepts are introduced to the player as well as a variety of realistic problems and hazards. Each player must become a certified SCUBA diver and is then allowed to dive the board and work toward obtaining treasures from the various sources on the board.

The basic goal of the Diver is to obtain enough money from the SCUBA obtainable treasures to purchase the certification and equipment necessary for Hard Hat diving. Only after obtaining the Hard Hat gear and certification card can the Diver enter the Blue Hole in the center of the board and obtain the $1,000,000 treasure which wins the game.

title: Chicago
types: Bluffing Card Game City Building Print & Play
description: Chicago is an auction game. It takes place from 1871 until about 1910, an exciting time of change when America was transformed from an agrarian to an industrial economy. You and your fellow players have come to seek fortune and glory in rebuilding Chicago. You will strive to become giants of industry and commerce. You will help settle immigrants who will work for your businesses. You will use your profits to engage in philanthropy to create cultural landmarks in a contest to see who will become the grandest person in Chicago.

title: Don Martin's Kartenspiel
description:
Don Martin's Kartenspiel is an excellently funny card game with an own special deck which contains 82 cards: 64 colored cards in 8 different texts and in 4 different colors plus 18 black  white action cards. The complete box includes also a couple of spare cards, some measurement cards that can be used to measure the size of your ear, and a c-cassette containing sound effects from the cards.

A single round of this game begins by dealing each player a certain amount of cards (10 - 16) depending on the number of players - more cards with less players. On each round every player has two goals: to get rid of all his/her cards, and to collect sets of 3+ colored cards with a same text.

During each round The first player who manages to empty his/her hand wins the round but isn't necessarily the player who receives the most points. That's because the most points are awarded from the collected sets. The winner, however, receives bonus points according to the cards still left in the hands of other players and other players get a lot of penalty from those cards. There is also a 100 point bonus awarded for a player who wins the round with only a single set on the board.

The game is played over multiple rounds which all are scored. The winner is the player who first reaches 500 points. Because the amount of points gained from a round can vary from -150 to +450 the games can last forever or only for less than an hour.

The fun part of the game is that when a player plays a card he/she must say what's printed in the card, like: Splappa dap!, Arra Argh Yargh, or Fippaditty Fappaditty Fappa daMap! It comes naturally after a few games, believe me.

title: Disney WordCrossing Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Word Game
description:
From the Box:
From Buzz to Belle, The Lion King to Lady  the Tramp, have fun with Disney's Word Crossing! There are two wonderful ways to word cross across the colorful game board.

Using your word strips,
  Match the letters of yout favorite Disney Characters.
  Match up the pictures from your favorite Disney movies.

Word up, word down, word cross. Tinkerbell will help you spin for more. The first player to play all his/her word strips wins!

title: Xiaolin Showdown TCG
description:
The Xiaolin Showdown Trading Card Game creates epic warrior showdowns blending Kung Fu skills and magical Shen Gong Wu.  Players battle with skills  such as Tiger Kick, Four-Grasp Punch and Eagle Claw  and obtain Shen Gong Wu often disguised as everyday household objects  such as the powerful Lunar Locket, the mysterious Orb of Tornami and the valuable Reversing Mirror.

Each player begins with seven cards.  After building a defense with skill points, either player may place a Shen Gong Wu in the Showdown Arena.  Both players battle to win the item using the Shen Gong Wu they possess.  The player whose Shen Gong Wu cards and power point cards add to the greatest number of Power Points wins the item.  The first player to collect 4 Shen Gong Wu wins.

title: Thapos and Alexandria
description: A Classic Historical War Game Two complete games using the system from Bill Banks classic war game of Hoplites and Charioteers

title: ESPN All Sports Trivia Challenge
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Sports Trivia
description:
If you love sports and think you know sports more than anyone else, then heres your chance to prove it! Created by sports fans for sports fans, ESPN All Sports Trivia Challenge is an exciting and unpredictable head-to-head sports competition like no other!

To win, youll need more than sports knowledge and luck on your side because strategy is what separates this unique sports trivia game from the pack. Every move must be calculated  offense or defense  just like a real sports match up.

The object is to control a 25-box playing field by strategically picking questions and correctly answering them to win boxes and points, while blocking your opponent from doing the same.

There are 1,500 sports trivia questions jam-packed with facts and stats covering 10 sports categories, such as nicknames, football, baseball, basketball, golf and one that features ESPN-specific questions written by sports trivia legend Howard Howie Schwab

title: Lance
description:
From the author:

The rise of feudalism saw the continuation and subsequent peak in the rise of the armored cavalryman as masters of the battlefield. Most systems were centered around this element of the army. Battles such as Hastings tended to confirm their supremacy. By the fourteenth century there appeared in various nations trained infantrymen in numbers greater than previously hitherto. Battles such as Courtrai and Crecy were the first of many battles in which the infantry were to play increasingly decisive roles. Thus we see how the feudal system of castles and knights gave way to missiles and trained infantry. By 1500 gunpowder weapons were establishing a supremacy of their own, subsequent armies became balanced professional forces which are outside the scope of these rules.

Lance is a set of medieval 25mm miniature gaming rules that provides melee and ranged weapon attacks, terrain effects, leader rules, visibility and detection, unit formations, and morale.

title: Inwest
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
Inwest is yet another Monopoly copy which introduces trivia questions and treasure hunting to the standard setting. This time the game takes place in the surroundings of Pietarsaari (or Jakobstad in Swedish) which is a small town on the coast of Gulf of Bothnia in Finland.

The game is very typical roll and move economy game. Two dices are thrown and doubles give another throw. Players should collect sets of stocks with the same color to make corresponding squares on the board more expensive. This time there are no buildings to be built, you just need to get the stocks. Trading of stocks may be done freely between players.

Yes, random event cards exist in this game too. Some cards take the player to treasure hunting, which means a lot of money. Some other cards may contain trivia question which can be very tricky - especially if Pietarsaari region is unknown. By answering a correctly to the question the player earns some money, and with a wrong answer the money must be paid.

Players decide together how much initial money is given and when does the game end. Therefore the game can be played as long - or short - as the players want to. The winner is the player whose fortune is the most valuable at the end of the game.

title: No Man's Land: Where the Wisest Women Win
description: An adult party game for women only. This is perfect for a girl's night out or a bachelorette party. Good-natured, male bashing fun for 2 or more adults.

title: Winx Club Magical Fairy Game
description: A collectible card game with a manga theme, aimed at teenage girls.

title: HumanKind
types: Card Game Collectible Components Modern Warfare Science Fiction
description:
Welcome to the contest for the future of HumanKind. Choose your team. Fight for the Future.

The second CCG produced in Chile, HumanKind depicts the underground war between four great factions (the Corporation, Acracia, Quimera and Abismales) for the control of the world. Each player represents a faction in the game, with his forces and resources represented by his 54-card deck. Your objective is to destroy your opponent's Sanctuary before he destroys yours, through the use of your Characters, Technologies, Manipulations, and Virtues.

Remember, the future of HumanKind is in your hands.

More information in the game's official site:

http://www.humankind.cl

title: Lock 'n Load: A Ring of Hills
types: Expansion for Base-game Fighting Modern Warfare Wargame
description:
A Ring of Hills is an expansion to Band of Heroes.

A Ring of Hills depicts the ground combat between the British and the Argentines in the The Falklands War of 1982.  A Ring of Hills comes with 12 Scenarios, 5 gorgeous geomorphic maps, 170 counters, module-specific rules, and a player-aid card.  The 12 Scenarios feature the combat from Goose Green and Darwin Hill, to the commando raid on Top Malo House, to the fight for the outer and inner Ring of Hills to the west of Stanley, including Two Sisters, Mt. Longdon, Wireless Ridge, Mt. Tumbledown and Mt. William. The initial seizures of Stanley and the island of South Georgia (a scenario that includes the Argentine corvette the Guerrico, the first Ship in LnL!) are also featured, as are two what-if scenarios that depict an opposed British landing at San Carlos and a last-ditch fight on the outskirts of Stanley.

Accompanied by Harrier and Pucara Strikes and plenty of artillery, Argentine Conscripts, Marines and Amphibious Commandos take on British Paras, Royal Marines and Gurkhas for the bleak, windswept islands of the South Atlantic, in historical battles that fit perfectly with the LnL Tactical Gaming System.

This game is no longer available, the new, improved and expanded edition can be found in Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Falklands

title: Jack's a loss
description:
This is a game a lot like the game 'Hera and Zeus' but you use playing cards.
  Each player receives 9 cards to start off the top of the draw deck. They are placed in front of themselves in a row, upside down, making sure that there is a gap between the two rows.
  During the game, battles take place to see what cards get removed and which don't (higher cards beat the lower cards(except '2' beats 'ace', seeing as nothing else does!)).
  You can have up to five rows by nine columns. This creates a reserves system. That creates a bluff mechanic.
  The game ends when two jacks, or the jack of hearts is destroyed by the opposing player.

There is also a 1 player version, where there is a default of nine cards placed alternately face up and face down. You do this as well, but yours are all face up. The rules are now the same, except for some other things, that are mentioned in the rules.

title: Lifesaver Game
description: The Lifesaver Game provides a comfortable setting for parents to instruct children about the importance of safety and how to avoid dangerous situations. Children today live in a very active and sophisticated world. As a result, they need to know how to react to emergency situations. The best way to teach children is to make it fun. In the game, children and adults are asked safety questions and parents are encouraged to help the child get the correct answer. The child is rewarded with Lifesaver tokens for each correct answer. They could win a penny, five cents, a hug, a stay up 1/2 later token, etc. Honoring the tokens makes the family fun last long after the game is over. It also motivates children to play the game again and again, thus reinforcing principles of safety.

title: Witch of Elsmea
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemArea MovementChit-Pull SystemMemoryPattern BuildingPick-up and Deliver
description:
Elsmea, another world of warlocks and witches.
You are high school students at Academy of Witches. 
A half year before graduation, doctress Diana invite all of you into her lab. Welcome and congratulations, my bewitched girls! She says  You are elected as candidates for the most valuable witch. Then, the elfin doctress adds niceties with gorgeous grin. Only one of you will be laurelled as the Witch of Elsmea of the year. The winner should read ambitious message at graduation. Questions? 
Doc, One of you say what is standard for the examination?
The instructor witch winks. People of Elsmea know the way. They need fetishes or magick items for their poor lives. Go ahead and make their days happy! Class is dismissed.

Yes. Like the legendary witch who made glass shoes, pumpkin coach and mouse-coachmen for Cendrillon, you must create and use or give some magick items for citizen of Elsmea. Every 3rd month, doctresses check the folks' Favors of each region about you, and fill in report cards as Brownie Points (BP). Who can be the best? At the end of 6 months, the player scored highest BP win a game as the Witch of Elsmea!

To create fetishes, you must collect and fuse elements(clear colored beads) from all over the Elsmea (Game-map).
But your rivals aim same thing. And fusional process is static. Thus to win, you must control all things!

title: Smack-A-Roo
description:
Smack-A-Roo is a fun family game that is actually 10 games in one: Baseball, Smack-It, Skeebol, Knockoff, Bowlaround, Duck Zoop, 6 Lil Indians, Impossi-Bowl, Clownaround, and Shoot the Works.  Some of these titles reveal the type of game: Baseball, Bowlaround, and Impossi-Bowl, are all pretty clear, for instance.  Other titles are Ideals proprietary titles for games or variations that they have devised for this unique arena-style playing board. Its all explained in the instruction booklet, which illustrates how to play each game.  Gameplay is kind of a mix of Skittle Pool, Zig Zag Zoom, and Rebound or Bumper Shot.

There is a cool little marble-shooter gadget and marbles, of course.  There are other gadgets and equipment, too: tenpins for bowling games, a triangular pin-setting device, a spinner device and an abstract clown used as challenging obstacles during play, and a sidelines bat for baseball-type games.  Any number of people can playincluding solo (which isnt much fun, however)but Smack-A-Roo is best suited for 2 to 4 players.

title: La Legion
description:
From 1907 to 1927 Spain fought in Morocco a long war, full of ups and downs, brilliant victories and crashing defeats that touched the Spanish society.
In 1909, after the disaster at the Ravine of the Wolf, the war became headline news at the same time as the Tragic Week in Barcelona. The Franco-Spanish treaty of 1912 gave Spain the zone of the Protectorate, that Spain started to occupy from Ceuta, Melilla and Larache. 
In spite of the resistance of the Moroccan leaders El Raisuni and Abd-El-Krim, the troops of General Berenguer slowly conquered the rebel territories. In 1921, the General Silvestre suffers in Annual a crunching defeat where 13000 soldiers died and Melilla was left vulnerable to the enemy. 
In 1925, General primo de Rivera disembarked in Alhucemas, defeated Abd-El-Krim and achieved the end of the Pacification of the Protectorate. In 1926 the war in Africa ended. (Translation from the back cover)

title: Rejseholdet
description:
A murder has been committed and the local police call for back-up. In complicated cases it's never easy to find the killer.
In this game you get the opportunity to test you skills as a police investigator. Interrogation, gathering of evidence and finding the right suspect is all in a good days work for the special murder investigation force.

title: Taxi and the city
description: Taxi and the city seems to be (according to the information of the publisher) a new line of games, in which the players try to earn the most money by working as a taxi-driver in a certain city during the agreed playtime. Right now it is only available concerning the German city 'Wiesbaden', but others are planned.

title: 100 Other Games to Play on a Chessboard
description:
This book contains, as the title implies, the rules of 100 games that can be played on a chessboard. It includes chess and draughts variants, designer games like Focus and Laska, traditional games and puzzles.
ISBN 0720606179

title: Techmate
description: Each player controls a team of robots. The player that can transport his robots into his opponents' starting spaces first wins.

title: No Time to Waste
description:
No time to waste is a cooperative trivia-game. The central piece of the game is a clock with an arrow that starts at 12 o'clock, and than starts moving clock-wise, taking exactly an hour for one turn. Surrounding the clock are tiles that are face down at the start of the game, but that are turned up during the game (showing colorful pictures of nature) if the players succeed in answering trivia questions about environmental topics. The clock-arrow indicates how well the players are doing because if the tile-turning is ahead of the arrow the players are doing well, but if they are behind they are in trouble!
Other trouble for the players comes from wrong answers, because after a wrong answer a red card has to be turned over, which may mean that the Greenpeace ship is blocked. In case of a blockade progress on the dial is stopped (but the clock moves on!). Luckily good answers not only turn over tiles, but also give players green card that they can use to remove blockades.
The game is cooperative because everyone wins if the last tile is turned over, and everyone loses when the clock runs out.

title: Stikord
description: Roll four dice with a letter on each. Then describe and word, but only use words starting with the letters you rolled.

title: Wild Kids
types: Adventure Animals Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Childrens game (Ages 8 and up) with title taken from a Swedish TV show. The show was a bit like Robinson (Survivor in the U.S.) but more friendly and starring 11- and 12 year-olds. In the game, players move around the board and take part in five competitions. These include solving riddles, answering questions about wild animals, and forming patterns with wooden sticks. The first player to complete three competitions is the winner.

Contents:
Gameboard
4 pawns
1 ordinary die, 1 color die
240 cards with 5 card boxes
1 hourglass
4 wooden sticks
rules

title: PriceWaterhouseCoopers
description:
A promotional game developed by Identity Games for PriceWaterhouseCoopers.

Players try to gather as much 'right answer' tokens and as little 'wrong answer' tokens as possible by answering trivia questions. The winner is the person with the most 'right answer' tokens at the end of the game.

title: Victory at Sea
types: Miniatures Nautical Wargame World War I World War II
description:
Victory at Sea is a set of privately published miniatures rules from 1971. The rules simulate ship-to-ship tactical combat from 1898 to about 1970. Compared to more recent rules sets, these rules are almost just an outline. The heart of the rules are several sets of charts for gunnery, torpedoes and movement.
The to-hit system uses a 2D6 roll compared to a chart that gives chances per 36 for a hit.
There are three scenarios included: Coronel, 1914; River Plate, 1939 and Denmark Straits, 1941. A photocopy sheet has 1:1200 ship plans to cut out for those who don't have miniatures.

title: The Green Pipe
description:
Finalist for 2005 About.com Deduction Game Design Competition.

The first player places the head of the pipe on a 4x4 board; the second player, the tail of the pipe.  Then each player draws a secret pipeline path between the two, crossing at least three spaces.  Each player then marks three spaces of her pipe with holes.

By placing and moving injectors of colored liquid, as well as probes, on the board, each player reveals information about both players' pipes.  The first player to correctly guess the location of her opponent's three holes wins!  (Each time you make a wrong guess, you may not guess again for G turns, where G is the number of wrong guesses you've made so far.)

title: The Quest
description:
The exciting game of Biblical knowledge. The game is similar to Trivial Pursuit in which you roll the dice and move your piece around the board acquiring pieces of the Armour of God. Once you have answered the Biblical questions correctly and acquired the six pieces of the Armor of God, you can move towards the center of the board to win the game by landing on the Circle of Victory and correctly answering a question.

The questions are divided into 5 categories: Quotations, Unbelievers  Believers, Events, Saviour, and Towns, Places  Objects.

Before you can obtain a piece of the Armor of God, you have to obtain 2 Character Points.  You get one Character Point for each correctly answered question. Each player must gain two character points before he may attempt to obtain additional pieces of the Armor of God.

title: Bloomsday
description:
A racing game that simulates the 10k Bloomsday race in Spokane, Washington.  Players simultaneously choose a number of Endurance Points to burn.  Players burn these points to move along the board, but if you don't burn more than your opponents, you only move one space!  Be sure to keep something in the tank for the final stretch.

The board consists of a long track labeled with the different stages in Bloomsday.  The board spaces can also make the player go forward or backwards or lose turns.  Some spaces give you special cards, like injury or special training that you can play on yourself or your opponent.

title: Gunjin Shogi
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementSecret Unit Deployment
description:
Literally meaning Soldier Shogi, Gunjin Shogi is not really related to Shogi other than by having a military theme and pentagonal pieces. The game is more similar to Army Chess (Lu Zhan Jun Qi) or Stratego, featuring hidden pieces and a hierarchical system of combat, where higher ranked pieces defeat lower ones: the objective is to capture the opponents flag. Like Army Chess, Gunjin Shogi requires a third person to act as umpire and resolve combat. Unlike Army Chess (and more like Hai Lu Kong Jun Qi), Gunjin Shogi includes planes and tanks.

Each player has 23 pieces, consisting of a flag, 12 officers, 2 planes, 2 tanks, a cavalry unit, two engineers, a spy and two land mines. There is a hierarchy of ranks, with some exceptions  planes naturally cannot be destroyed by land mines and engineers deactivate land mines, for instance.

The game dates to at least before the second world war (I base this on an incomplete pre-war set I was shown in an antique shop in Japan).

title: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot Wacky KHAKI Booster
types: Animals Card Game Expansion for Base-game Humor Negotiation
description:
The Wacky Khaki Booster Deck adds 55 cards to your existing set, a Highest Officer Rank card and 18 colored Chips.

Other fantastic cards include: Army Of The 12 Bunnies which will hunt you down any hour of the day, Locked In which forces players to use their Top and Bottom Run cards and The Lonely Ranger who roams free!

Can you avoid a crippling blow from Mad Bunny Disease, or psych-out your opponents with Truth or Hare! Why not seize the danish with Carpe Scriblita or move a weapon targeting your bunny to an opponent's bunny with the help of the Sky Waitress? Grab one yourself or send a lacky, but don't miss the next Booster Deck named Wacky Khaki!

CONTENTS :: 55 large cards, 18 colored Chips, a Highest Officer Rank card and stand  Instructions.

Expands:

    Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot

title: Hühnerhof
description:
From the box: Early morning six hungry chickens wait to be fed. There is the farmer's daughter with food. She doesn't put it all in one place, but distributes the food across the farm yard. Now one has to make sure to be quickly at the right spot, to eat the food before it's gone.

Children's game Ages 5 and up.

title: Warplan: Dropshot II/III
description:
The Turbulent 60's and The End Game, take Bruce Costello's popular simulation of the Cold War turning hot, Warplan Dropshot from the 50's to the 60's and 70's-90's.

Dropshot II: The Turbulent 60's scenarios: In the Berlin, 1961 World War III starts at the Berlin Wall. In The Cuban Missile Crisis, 1962 what almost happened happens. In The Six Day War, an accident in the Mediterranean sparks the big one in 1967. In The Czechoslovakian Crisis, 1968 Soviet and NATO clashes escalate into total war. Border War in the Far East, 1969 has the US getting involved in a nuclear war between China and Russia.

Dropshot III: The End Game scenarios: In Middle East, 1973 the US and the Soviet Union get too involved with the Yom Kippur War. In 1976 - Bolt from the Blue Kremlin hardliners opt for a preemptive war while everyone is taking dtente. December Surprise - Iran, 1979 has President Carter invading Iran and the Soviets having to react. In Solidarity - Poland, 1981 the labor movement is crushed and the West reacts. In Deep Paranoia a NATO exercise pushes the Soviets too far. Hardliners Last Gasp, 1987 supposes an alternative end to the Cold War.

400 km/hex on strategic map and 75 km/hex on map of Europe, 2 months/turn, armies.

This is a DTP game with die-cut counters. Two 8.5x11 inch strategic hemispheric maps, one 11x17 inch map of Europe, 616 counters, play aids, charts.

Warplan: Dropshot II/III was a nominee in the Charles S. Roberts awards for Best Modern Era Boardgame (Charles S. Roberts Awards) for 2005.

title: I Am NOT a Communist
types: Bluffing Card Game Deduction Party Game Political
description:
The year is 1955, and communism is spreading in the US Senate! One by one, it is silently overtaking a majority of the voting Senators--that is, unless the stalwart Special Investigator can help the remaining red-blooded, freedom-loving, true-blue American faction as they hold hearings in an attempt to oust the evil Original Communist in the nick of time.

For the growing communist faction and their stealthy Original Communist leader, the goal is to convert a majority of the voting members of the Senate to communism. For the freedom-loving members of the Senate, the goal is to successfully identify the Original Communist and remove his voting rights before his evil creed takes over.

title: MiniMonFa Fairy Expansion
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Humor
description:
This is the first expansion for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)
Now its is possible to fill your dungeons with new incredible creatures like dryads, gnomes and ents. You also get 6 new heroes like an Warrior Elf and an Centaur.

With this expansion it is also possible to play the game with more than 2 players.

Expands:

    MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)




Other Expansions:

    MiniMonFa Undead Expansion
    MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
    MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis

title: MiniMonFa Undead Expansion
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Humor
description:
The second expansion for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy) brings a crowd of terrible monsters like zombies and a vampire. You also get a new set of heroes with unique special abilities.

Expands:

    MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)




Other Expansions:

    MiniMonFa Fairy Expansion
    MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
    MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis

title: Za Stalina: Handbook on Soviet Armoured and Cavalry forces
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Wargame World War II
description:
From the Publisher's website:

The treacherous fascist invasion has awakened a slumbering giant. It has triggered the massive mobilization of brave soldiers and diligent factory workers. Together these comrades have built the mightiest army the world has ever seen  the awesome RKKA, the Red Army.

The foolhardy Germans will now feel the wrath of the Soviet people, and be crushed by it. All that will be left of the Hitlerites will be their gleaming bones turned over by our plows in the summer planting.

Inside You Will Find

 Complete organization and equipment for the Tankovy Batalon (Tank Battalion), Mixed Tankovy Batalon (Mixed Tank Battalion), Motostrelkovy Batalon (Motor Rifle Battalion), Rota Razvedki (Reconnaissance Company) and Kazachya Sotnya (Cossack Squadron).
    
 Variants for the Gvardeyskiy Tankovy Batalon (Guards Tank Battalion), Gvardeyskiy Motostrelkovy Batalon(Guards Motor Rifle Battalion), Gvardeyskiy Rota Razvedki (Guards Reconnaissance Company) and the Gvardeyskiy Kazachya Sotnya (Guards Cossack Squadron).

 History of the 3rd Mechanized Corps.

 Inspiring colour photos

 Fantastic Artwork by Vincent Wai

 Tactics guide

 Comprehensive painting guides

 Exploits of Mariya Oktyabrskaya, winner of the Hero of the Soviet Union, the highest award for heroism.

title: Contraption
description:
Contraption is a unique, motorized game from Lakeside. The game itself consists of 2 sets of colored marbles and a single unit with 4 gears on its surface. The gears are laid end-to-end, with the larger gears in the middle. Each player claims one of the smaller end gears as their home gear.

To play, the unit (requiring 2 D batteries) is turned on, which sets all 4 gears spinning. Then the marbles are dumped into the large central gears. Each player controls a switch that, when pressed, lowers a gate between their home gear and the larger gear, allowing marbles to pass through -- but also letting marbles pass back out to the larger gears.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to capture all 6 of your marbles in your home gear.

title: Fart!
description:
Manufacturer's Description
Fart
Flatulent fun with your CD player!

Fart is the sound-sational game of rip-roaring fun that will challenge even straight-laced Aunt Grace to keep a straight face!

An instant source of laughter, Fart is the hilarious game in which you race to be the first to play out of cards whilst accompanied by a fast 'n' frantic Fart-chorus!

Every now and then an unrealistically enormous explosion will let rip forcing you to change direction, pick up penalty cards or 'Pass the Wind' to your neighbor!

Wild hilarity at the press of a button, Fart is the side-splitting game that helps you to unwind and release a little pressure!

Box Contents

99 Track Fart Effect CD
Score Pad + Rule Book
Fart Game Cards

title: Onslaught to Orsha
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
A Battle study for Advanced Squad Leader covering Operation Bagration.
From the publisher's website:
The Minsk-Moscow Highway, Belorussia, 23 June 1944:
The 16th Guards Rifle Division was one of three heavily reinforced infantry divisions that were to create holes in the German lines and allow tank forces of the 2nd Guards Tank Corps of the 5th Tank Army to make rapid and deep penetrations along the Moscow-Minsk Highway. The zone of the 16th was south of the highway, and along the Smolensk-Minsk Railroad. They were reinforced with the following units: 148th Tank Regiment (PT mineroller tanks), 63rd Guards Heavy Tank Regiment (KVs), 517th Tank Regiment (FT tanks), elements of several Self-Propelled Artillery Regiments, 2nd Guards Assault Engineer-Sapper Brigade, as well as numerous towed artillery units. The Soviet forces trained as a combined arms team prior to the attack, and were well prepared. In most sectors of Army Group Center, the Germans had relatively thin lines, and most armor and heavy artillery was stripped to defend expected areas of attack. The area of the highway had seen much heavy fighting in the winter of 1943-44, and the Germans expected an attack to come in this direction. When German intelligence detected the buildup of artillery and armored forces, as well as the movement of ammunition, their reaction was to ensure forces in this area retained significant combat strength. The 78th Sturm Division, already the most powerful infantry division in Army Group Center, maintained its structure which included the 189th Assault Gun Battalion (StuG), a Heavy Tank Destroyer Battalion (PzJgIII/IVs), 5th Nebelwerfer Battalion (120mm Mortars), and Army Antiaircraft Battalion 293 (mix of 88s/20s). These forces defended from probably the most dense network of mines, trenches, and bunkers in Army Group Center, including special rotating bunkers housing machine-guns.
 Years of extensive on-sight research along with vigorous play testing by the veteran game designers at Heat of Battle brings you ONSLAUGHT TO ORSHA.
 ONSLAUGHT TO ORSHA contains:

* Color 29x56 historical map featuring 1 hexes of the Smolensk-Minsk Railroad area
    * Chapter OtO, that includes rules for new units, terrain types and vehicle notes
    * Campaign Game, 22 scenarios and 2 Solitaire Missions
    * 17 Page Map Study and Order of Battle
    * And, over 180 new, full color counters covering vehicles and weapons not seen in an tactical wargame system are included for free!

title: Add & Subtract Chekker Math
description: Play checkers and enjoy improving addition and subtraction skills. This fun and fast paced game may be played by two individuals or two teams with similar or different learning ability. Grades 2-6

title: Jungle Bungle Game
description: Jungle Bungle is a truly new kind of game that's out and out fun. With its talking dice, lucky dip bag and exciting game play it is a must for kids of all ages. Players are out to get a full set of snaps of the wild jungle animals prowling the board. Each turn the dice, growls, trumpets, roars, laughs or tells you what to do.

title: Doh Nutters
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Humor Party Game
description:
Dohnutters a crazy, noisy, nutty game of elephantine fun!

Play the part of a crazy doughnut-loving elephant in this hilarious game of fast action fun.

Can you be the first elephant to get all your doughnuts on your trunk?

The first one is easy, the next harder and with the final doughnut tension reaches an all time high!

Box Contents
- 4 Elephant masks (with adjustable straps)
- 12 plastic doughnuts
- 1 playing board.

title: Munchkin 4: The Need for Steed
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Fighting Humor
mechanisms: Card DraftingDice RollingHand ManagementTake ThatVariable Player Powers
description:
Publisher's Description

Munchkin 4: The Need for Steed is the latest expansion for the original Munchkin - 112 more John Kovalic-illustrated cards for killing monsters, stealing treasure, and backstabbing your fellow players. This set introduces Steeds, the trusty mounts of legend... Oh, wait - this is Munchkin! So these Steeds include not just the Dragon and the Tiger, but the Giant Mutant Gerbil (drawn by guest artist Shaenon K. Garrity of Narbonic), the Chicken, and Big Joe, who might be a Steed or might be a Hireling. It's hard to tell.

Hireling? Yes indeed, The Need for Steed has lots and lots of Hirelings, who look quite a bit like Sidekicks from Super Munchkin, or Minions from Munchkin Bites! Add these valuable characters to your retinue, use their special abilities, and sacrifice them without a thought to save your own skin! Or, better yet, kill somebody else's Hireling. That's the way a Munchkin does it!

Feel the need... The Need for Steed

				
					Other

Part of the Munchkin series.

title: Renegade Legion: Leviathan – The Wake of the Kraken
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Renegade Legion: Leviathan Scenario Book - 64 pages with 15 new scenarios.

This book includes a background story of the INS Kraken and it's new commander, Rear Admiral Luther Catalus.  Catalus has run afoul of Imperial politics and has been sent on a suicide mission.  The book covers the campaign fought by the INS Kraken and it's escort squadron in 15 interlinked scenarios.  The campaign is designed to be played through with the same units and track damage between scenarios.  Rules are included to cover resupply and repair.  Complete profiles of the key members of the Kraken Squadron are also included.

The book also provides the designs of several ships, many of which are also included the Renegade Legion: Leviathan Capital Ship Briefing.  Other ships are new to this book.  These ships are:
   Leicester Class Freighter
   Republic Class Battleship
   Gav'Rosk Class Cruiser
   Raptor Class Destroyer Carrier
   VLCA design
   GavRon Listening Post

Special scenario rules also include a battle within an asteroid field that has hidden units and objectives.

Expands:

    Renegade Legion: Leviathan

title: Renegade Legion: 2nd ACR Armored Cavalry Regiment
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Renegade Legion: Centurion Scenario Book - 48 pages with 12 new scenarios, as well as new units, characters and equipment.

Expands:

    Renegade Legion: Centurion – Blood & Steel

title: Renegade Legion: Centurion Blood & Steel Vehicle Briefing
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
Renegade Legion: Centurion Vehicle Briefing Book - 128 pages describing 58 different vehicles and variants.

Expands:

    Renegade Legion: Centurion – Blood & Steel

title: Chase Decimals
description: Here's a great, competitive, fun-filled game. Each player chooses a colored pawn and follows the track around the board by spinning and moving to a specific number in either the tenths, hundredths, and thousandths place. The winner is decided by the first player who makes it once around the board and follows their colored alley to the center of the board. Grades 4-7

title: Einparken bis zum Abwinken
description:
This uses a similar idea to the popular 'parking' puzzles but in a strategy game. Each player has 5 vehicles - 3 normal cars (2x1 spaces), a bus (3x1 spaces) and a Smart car (1x1). On your turn you have 3 choices: 1) Place a vehicle face down, 2) Turn one of your vehicles face up and choose its direction of travel without altering its position (so the larger vehicles can choose two directions, the Smart can choose four), 3) Move one of your vehicles one space in its direction of travel. 
The aim is to be the last player to be able to move. Even if one cannot move at some stage of the game if your way is subsequently cleared you can still move then.

title: Play Gauss
description: This is a collection of 12 games playable with the same components released to commemorate the 150th anniversary of Gauss' death. The games are mainly 2 player. They use a set of wooden blocks which come in lengths of 1 to 6. A die is used in many of them to determine the length of the piece to be placed. There are variants on connecting-sides-of-the-board, placement-within-a-limited-space, moving- across-the-board, blocking and capturing games. 8 are adult games, 4 children's games. There are also an additional 2 adult games by Peter Lewe.

title: Die Wackelpudding-Jagd
description:
In the center of the board, there are wobble puddings in a clearing. Players roll a die and move their 'little monster' to collect them and bring them back to their home. But the puddings are guarded by a dragon, which may be moved when the players roll its symbol. Players can be send home like in pachisi, with the capturing player also capturing the pudding.

The game ends when all 10 puddings are distributed. They have 1-3 points on the bottom side, and the player with the highest total wins.

title: Gamegame
description:
A description from Greg Costikyan:

Aki Jarvinen has posted cards and rules for GameGame 1.0 which he pitches as an attempt to do for games what Understanding Comics does for comics: that is, to provide insight into the nature of games in a game, in the same what that Understanding is both about comics and a comic.

Thus, his cards are things like Goal and Environment and Victory/End Condition. Theres both a coherent set of rules for determining victory and a roleplaying element: players must improvise what the game they are creating is like, e.g., describing what their Victory/End Condition isbut they can only have one if they have the relevant card.

Version 2.0 recently became available at the website below.

Website:  http://gamegame.blogs.com/

title: Henne Berta
description: In Henne Berta (Hen Berta in English) the player feeds a hen with grain and in return gathers eggs to a little basket. The first player that gets 3 eggs to basket is the winner. The game contains a wooden board, large wooden pieces and little baskets for every player.

title: RPM
description: RPM is a race simulation released by Grow during the 80's in Brazil.

title: Operação MX-1
description:
Most likely the first real wargame (by today's standards) released in Brazil, it had lukewarm reception during the 80's and has been discontinued. 
The game simulates a battle between two fictitious armies, using an hexagonal board and two sets of rules: basic and advanced.
This is the same Avalon Hill's Tactics II (1958), with a redesigned hexgrid mapboard.

title: Foxhole 2: Poland
description:
Jon Compton's tactical hex and counter game of WWII combat. This set focuses on Germany versus Poland at the start of the war.

Each hex on the map represents an area approximately 100 yards across. Each playing piece represents about 40-60 men (a platoon) or half a dozen vehicles or towed weapons . . . For ease of play, the game scales are approximated. Time is also abstracted, thus turns represent several minutes.

The FOXHOLE system is simple to learn and fast playing that focuses on the invasion of Poland. Its a good diversion from the more heavy fair of historical board-wargaming.

FOXHOLE SET 2 includes:
-Ten new scenarios, six exclusively with this set, and four incorporating elements from Set 1.
-Twenty-four unit cards
-Over one hundred playing pieces -Tactical Battles Map A - and One rule book

title: Sillage
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Novel-based
description:
Approx. translation of the box.
 Card game in the universe of Sillage.  The comic of Philippe Buchet and Jean David Morvan.

The Sillage convoy explores space trying to find worlds to colonize while looking for aliens species that are in danger of extinction.  In this game you create a Sillage Ops and, with action cards, you try to install aliens on different planets.
Be careful, the competition is rough : the other players can play poukram (NB : favorite swear of the heroin) to make your task more difficult.

title: Number One
description: This game is played on a hex board, you have 3 Figures, the first (King) can move only 1 step (if you lose that piece you are out of the game), the second piece can move 2 step and the third can move 3 step. When you move on a hex a stone fall, so the hex is no more usable. When you must move one figure on an empty hex, the first time you can turn over the figure, the second time the figure goes out of the game. If is the King all your figures go out. The last player on the board is the winner.

title: Romans
description: Players journey around the Roman Empire, conquering garrison forts in a race to proclaimed Caesar! The fascinating history of the Roman Empire will be explored whilst playing the game!

title: Picdoku
description: Picdoku is a brand new pictorial version of the Sudoku craze that has gripped us all! It can be played individually or competitively by 2 players or teams. Each game includes 182 sturdy re-usable tokens and 30 double-sided playing boards so that 60 different games can be played again and again.

title: Santiago 1898: Final del Imperio
description: Santiago 1898: Final del Imperio is a simulation of the campaign of Santiago de Cuba during the Spanish - American War.

title: Trasimeno 217 a.c.
description: Battle of Lake Trasimene (217 BC) during the Second Punic war.

title: 1860: I mille
description: Expedition of the Thousand: Garibaldi's campaign against the Kingdom of Two Sicilies.

title: Adua 1896
description: Battle of Adowa : Italy against the Abyssina.

title: Alamein
description:
Uses the same game system as Invasion of Italy, Red Parachutes and Red Steel. As far as we know, this is the first detailed treatment of the battles that, at last, stopped Erwin Rommels attempts to take the British position in the Nile delta. They also established Bernard Montgomery as the British general finally able to defeat the Desert Fox.

Following the fall of Tobruk in May 1942, the Commonwealth forces in the desert struggled to reach the last real defensive position before Alexandria and halt what seemed to be an unstoppable Afrika Korps. At battalion and company level, four turns a day and 2 kilometers per hex, this game includes German, Italian, Indian, British, South African, New Zealand, Australian, Free French and Greek units that fought in the desperate struggle.

Scenarios include the Australian and South African spoiling attack in mid-July, the late June battle for the Mersa Matruh position where slow response almost cost the Commonwealth the bulk of the New Zealand Division, the first Axis attack on the Alamein line in early July, the last Axis attack to break the Allied line at Alam el Halfa at the end of August, Operation LIGHTFOOT: the Eighth Armys attack against the Axis line in late October and the massive campaign from the end of June to the beginning of November 1942.

Four full-sized maps and 2,100 game pieces.

title: Tiger of Malaya
description:
Using the same game system as MacArthur's Return, Blood on the Snow and Winter Fury, this game covers the fighting in southern Malaya as the advancing Japanese drive the British, Indian and Australian forces back on their base at Singapore. What is different about this game is that it allows the British player to request the 7th Australian Infantry Division and 7th Armored Brigade, historically at sea during the battle and considered as a possible remedy. These two powerful formations might just turn the tide and defeat the Japanese.

Can the British player hold on long and well enough to convince General Wavell that the situation can be restored? Can the Japanese player out-manuever and outfight the British forces defending Johore province and gain a toehold on the island before resistance stiffens or reinforcements arrive?

One full-sized map, 420 game pieces.

title: So You Think You Know Maine
description:
From the box:
A game of Maine trivia suitable for natives and people from away.

Players start in Kittery (Southern Maine). Counties in Maine represent different categories. As players roll and move around the board, they must collect cards at each county seat. Players then race to Fort Kent (Northern Maine) to win the game.

title: Overlord
description:
Overlord is a 2 player game of pure 3D strategy
The game is played on a 7x9 board with a wall located on the middle row on the longer side.Both players have 14 pieces located in the back 2 rows on each side of the wall and attempt to capture the opponents pieces by landing on top of them. Only pieces on the top of stacks can move and the game is won when one player is down to only one available piece.

title: V-Attack
types: Abstract Strategy Card Game Fighting Print & Play
description: The year is 2340.  Just as in all of history, conquest is at the heart of mankind.  Enslave or become a slave is the future.  You are in charge of breaking through the wall of your enemys city to allow the entry of your battalion to take over.  Organic Titazium metal (O37T2y) has been used in the construction of all walls during this time period, which makes them virtually impenetrable.  The wall cubes must be removed carefully or the wall structure will collapse and repair itself thus defeating your mission.  While you are attacking the walls of your enemy, they in turn are attacking you.  By using limited means, you must minimize the damage directed to your city.  Victory belongs to he who enters the city first.

title: The Complete Book of Games
description:
This is a very large book (900 pages) explaining rules to all kinds of games.  The first 300 pages are dedicated solely to card games.  The book then moves on to traditional board and dice games such as checkers, backgammon, and craps.  There are many word and guessing games.  Outdoor activities are also listed, including races, snow or water games, lawn games, and full-blown sports.

Ideas for adults' get-togethers include quick-thinking contests and even dancing games.  The book details countless games for children, suitable for everyday play or social events such as birthday parties.  Some of the party games are geared toward specific holidays.

This huge volume devotes one little paragraph to branded games such as Monopoly, Pit, and Flinch.  It only mentions that they exist, and require special equipment, which is purchased along with the rules.

Although you'll find very familiar entries such as bridge, marbles, and baseball, many of the games are less known, or a variation on a more familiar idea.  Some of the names are intriguing in their own right.  Here's a sampling of names of the many games to learn:

Misery Nap
Bierspiel
Anti-nudist
Hearts of Lettuce
Skeegee-Weegee
The G Man Never Takes His Ease
Literary Salad
Strawberries Without Cream
Schnozzle Race

title: Hey, Bartender!
description:
In Hey, Bartender! everyone is trying to take change from a friendly bartender.  Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards.  The 'bartender' also gets seven cards, played face up on the table.  The object of the game is to trade cards with the bartender, making change such that the bartender gives the player more points than the player gives the bartender.  Play continues until all players have exhausted their hands, at which time the player with the most points wins.

Hey, Bartender! was designed as another version of Pennywise played with cards, and was published in Game Trade Monthly in 2000.

title: Wolf im Schafspelz
description: Wolf im Schafspelz (Wolf in Sheep's Clothing) is a deduction game, wherein players take turns trying to pick the wolf out from a flock of sheep using sheepdogs.  For those desiring a more complex game, trees are included to break up the sheepdogs' lines of sight.

title: Alternative Games for Those Who Like  a Challenge
types: Abstract Strategy Action / Dexterity Book Card Game
description:
From the back cover:

The alternative games in this booklet are all designed to be played with standard equipment. They offer exciting new dimensions to games played on or with draught boards, cards, dominoes etc., helping to eliminate the constant financial burden of purchasing expensive and often short-lived new games.

The games in Alternative Games for Those Who Like a Challenge are based on popular games that have been modified so they are even more competitive and exciting.
At the same time, they are easy to learn if you already know the standard edition, providing hours of inexpensive entertainment, making this booklet desirable for most game lovers.

Other books designed by Tony Crow are:
Alternative Games for the Family and
Alternative Games for the Studious

This book contains rules for modified card games, draught board games, Scrabble games and billiard table games.

title: Black Abyss
types: City Building Civilization Exploration Science Fiction Space Exploration Territory Building
description: Black Abyss is a space civilization game where players explore the galaxy for habitable planets and then scan the planets surface for beneficial terrain.  Players will expand their empire by colonizing these planets and erecting buildings that best use the terrain and available space of each planet.  A player will win by means of expansionary, militaristic, diplomatic, or scientific policies.  The game features great details of empire building and fleet management.

title: Pisaturm
description:
With 42 wooden rods ( six color groups of seven rods each) you should try to build as high a tower as possible. The color die decides if you have to put new rods on top of the tower or if you can pass the die to the next player without adding rods.

The game starts with 2 different colored rods placed parallel on the playing surface.

The first player rolls the die, if rolls the same color  as one of the rods on top of the tower, he can pass the die to the next player.

If he rolls a different color as one of the  two rods on top of the tower, he must place to new, differently colored, rods on top of the tower. These have to be placed at a right angle to the others.

You continue to play like this clockwise in turn.

The game is over when the tower collapses. The player who caused the crash loses the game.

title: La conquista del Oeste
description:
From the English instructions of play.

The conquest of the west reproduces the phases through which the colonists had to go, being first obliged to obtain their traveling equipment and then to set of into the unknown west. 
This game does not belong to any specific time in XIX century and so people and historic events that really took place on different dates appear at same time.

From two to six players can take part, the winner being the one who first reached the points with a red circle inside, situated on the pacific coast.
First of all, each player must obtain this traveling equipment consisting of oxen, arms, provisions, and a wagon in the east, that is, on the green section of the board; then having acquired his equipment, the player enters the red section, which is the west, in order to attain his objective

NAC edition 1982
Factor Games edition 1990

title: Messines: 1917
description: Scale is 240 yards per hex and each unit is a battalion or regiment.  There are also some German companies for the front trenches.  There are two 13x19 maps with over 200 counters. There are two rules books - standard rules that are 5 pages and Messines:1917 rules that run another 4 pages.  There are two scenarios - first day and campaign. Artillery is the centerpiece of the game with four different types of bombardment (saturation,  standard, intermittent, and gas) possible.  There are three types of guns - field, medium, and heavy with each best suited to certain roles.  For Messines the addition of mines makes initial set up and play a real chess match.  The key to victory is correct deployment and effective use of reserves.  For the Allies, one of the key decisions is how much to bombard.  It is very effective but it also destroys the drainage systems of the area and leads to a quagmire that with eliminated possibilities.  For the German player, commitment of reserves is the key.  He has to guess correctly at the main points of attack by the British player before they have sufficiently evolved to make the attack plan apparent.

title: JoBa
description: This trick-taking game is played with a standard deck of playing cards.  Each game, a pair of dice is rolled.  The first die determines how many cards are held in each player's hand (1-6); the other die is special and determines the trump suit.  The second die may come up no trump (there is no trump suit) or no suit (suit doesn't matter, only face value).  Chips are used to keep score.  Players must ante up before each hand, and the pot is won by the first player to reach eleven points (or to have the highest score after four hands).  Scoring centers around the fact that at start of each game, players use bidding wheels to predict how many hands they can win.  Penalties are applied for guessing incorrectly, while guessing correctly and winning all tricks in a hand can lead to an instant win.

title: Your Number's Up!
description: Your Number's Up is a fast-paced game for 2 to 6 players. The object of the game is to score as many points as possible, by completing simple sums. The first player lays a number card down and subsequent players have to complete the sum. The player completing the sum takes the three cards as their trick and starts the next round. Sounds easy? Well maybe! What happens if you cannot complete the sum? You have to pick up a spare card and wait for your next turn. This game can be played by people with all levels of ability and in our testing, we found some people with devious minds who tried to stop others winning tricks. I'm sure you wouldn't do this! It's fun, but make sure number isn't up by having a handful of cards at the end.

title: Trilemma
description: A multi-level maths game to support the national numeracy strategy in an entertaining way. Trilemma tests the times tables and other mathematical functions non-sequentially. This challenging game of chance and skill can be played in a mixed age group with different players choosing different levels within the same game.

title: Abbott's New Card Games
description:
This book contains nine new card games mostly played with a regular deck. Some of these games were also published separately.


    Babel - A real time party game that simulates the stock market. This can play a large number of people as long as you have enough card decks to pull it off (1/3 the number of players)



    Leopard - A card game that allows you to sabotage your opponent.



    Auction - An auction game where the playing cards are money.



    Variety - A game that uses bidding to counteract the possibility of getting a bad hand.



    Metamorphosis - A trick taking game where the rules change each hand.



    Switch - A partnership game where the partners switch every hand.



    Eleusis - An induction game.



    Construction - A board game where the board is built with cards.



    Ultima - A fast action chess variant.

title: Addition and Multiplication Dominoes
description: Eleven games are included in this domino game. It's a great activity for individual drill on addition and multiplication, or it can be used in a small group in a learning center.

title: Battle of the Monsters
description: Battle of the Monsters is a set of several games that can be played using the trading cards included in the Weird n' Wild Creatures collectors set. Weird n' Wild Creatures is a set of colorful data cards covering monsters of nature and mythology. The creatures on the data cards are also depicted on trading cards which list values for attack, defense, and life, which are used to play the Battle of the Monsters games. Some cards also list special powers. The games that can be played with the cards range from the very simple (a war variant where cards and drawn and attack values are compared) to the strategic.

title: Sergeants! Scenarios Book 1
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
From the publisher:

Sergeants! Scenarios Book 1 contains 23 new scenarios that appear nowhere else. In addition, inside are Map boards 2, 3 and 4 (which have been provided on our website), and are now included professionally printed along with brand-new Map board 6. Requires at least one Sergeants!  On the Eastern Front game set.

Included:

4 Map boards

Scenario Booklet

title: Tic-Tac-Sum
description: Here's a basic addition activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover addition problems from 1 to 20. Great for home use or in learning centers.

title: Tic-Tac-Subtract
description: Here's a basic subtraction activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover subtraction problems from 1 to 20. Great for home use or in learning centers.

title: Tic-Tac-Times
description: Here's a basic multiplication activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover basic multiplication problems. Great for home use or in learning centers.

title: Tic-Tac-Divide
description: Here's a basic division activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover basic division problems. Great for home use or in learning centers.

title: Genial daneben: Das Spiel – Zusatzfragen
types: Expansion for Base-game Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
description:
Extra question cards for the game with the same name.

Expands:

    Genial daneben: Das Spiel

title: Thalassa
description:
A nautical quiz game where navigators must sail the seas and answer questions about ecology and the rules of the sea.

Themed on the show of the same name on France 3.

title: Strudel
description: Strudel (Eddies) is essentially Parchisi in reverse; players try not to be the first to lose all four pieces to the eddies.  Every turn, players roll two dice, advance any pieces from their start area if possible, and then use any remaining dice to move their own pieces or even whole rings of currents.

title: Vampirino
types: Action / Dexterity Card Game Children's Game Memory
description: The sneaky bats have escaped!  Fly to their rescue with Mother Bat and bring them back to the cave!  With luck and skill, be the first to catch four bats!

title: EinStein würfelt nicht! Erweiterung
description:
3-4 Players expansion to EinStein würfelt nicht!

Online Play


     4-player version on DevilPlay  (called EinStein wrfelt nicht - Quattro there)

title: Die Regenbogen-Karawane
description:
The board displays a rainbow with 6 colored tracks. The player pawns are animals. Each animal carries a jewel on its back.
At each turn the player throws a die and moves his/her pawn. A player may move forward or sideways. If the jewel on the back of the animal corresponds with the course of the rainbow, the animal moves faster. Otherwise the animal moves slower.
The first player with all of his/her animals at the other end of the rainbow wins the game.

title: Mauerfall 89
description:
From the game's website (www.mauerfall89.de):
Mauerfall 89 is a game with a political background which tries to focus the oblivion of the GDR (former eastern Germany). It deals with the fall of the Berliner wall in 1989. Goal of the game is the fall of the wall (respectively game stones) with demonstrations and attempts to escape - but the regime doesn't sleep...

Mauerfall 89 was released in 2005 as a limited first edition.

title: Hermann und Thusnelda verprügeln die Römer
description:
From the publisher website:
Hermann und Thusnelda verprgeln die Rmer (Hermann and Thusnelda beat up the Romans) deals with the Varus battle in the year 9 AD. In contrast to reality in the game the Romans has a real chance to win...
By request the game rules will also be in Latin!

title: The Mystery of the Scream
description:
This game is positioned as a family game it allows players to portray police detectives investigating the robbery or thieves who steal art. The game includes 36 cards that teach the players about different artwork.

The game is inspired by the theft of Munch's Scream, because of this the game has stirred some controversy

title: Kick-It
description:
The fast game for long flanks, ideal passing and tactical moves.

A simple abstract strategy game of soccer with four players per side.  Released in 2005 at Essen.  I'm not positive about the actual name of the publisher.

title: Finale
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingPoint to Point Movement
description:
A dice driven soccer game where the rolls move your teammates into the best positions to score. The teams are on the pitch and soon the finale will start. Which trainer will be the most successful in getting their players into good positions.

Players alternate rolling a die and moving a player with the appropriate number. A goal is scored if you move one of your players into an opponent goal. Alternatively you can score by blocking your opponent from moving.

Actions are based more on abstract strategy rather than soccer mechanics.

title: Charge!
description:
Become a general in the Napoleonic Period and challenge a friend on the battlefield.  Charge! is a non-collectible card game for 2 players.  With Charge! you can revive the emotion of leading an Army and win a battle.  Dispatch your orders to your infantry regiments, fire at the enemy army with your cannons and force it to retreat with your cavalry charges.

A card war game involving advancing your units to break the line of your opponent.  Debuted at Essen 05.

title: Die wilden Fussballkerle: Das dampfhammerharte Fussball-Spiel
description:
First a wild master, then a world master.

Die Wilden Fussball Kerle now have a full sized soccer board game.  Full teams of eleven players maneuver it out rolling dice and moving their players to get into position to score.

Simple rules and low complexity gear this towards younger players and those not seeking an in depth soccer simulation.

title: Battle of the Little Bighorn
types: American Indian Wars American West Wargame
description:
Reprint of the CSR Award Winner: Best Desktop Published Wargame, 2007.

The Battle of the Little Bighorn, also known as Custer's Last Stand, was the epic fight between a massive combined force of Plains Indian tribes and the 7th United States Cavalry under the command of Lt. Col. George Armstrong Custer. The battle was the most famous event in the Indian Wars and was a crushing victory for the Indians. Custer, already famous for his Civil War exploits, became an American folk legend. Little Bighorn was the last great victory for the Sioux and Cheyenne. Defiant and proud, they were determined to preserve their way of life but within a year they were broken and defeated by a nation swept up in the emotions of the Centennial and bent on revenge for the death of an American hero.

The Battle of the Little Bighorn is the third game in the Indian Wars of the American West series.  This game also includes the Montana column led by Col. Gibbons.  This column was the third column in the field within General Terrys campaign plan.  Crooks Wyoming column was the other part of this campaign, and included in Volume II of the series, The Battle of Rosebud Creek.
The Montana column includes Col. Gibbon, the 7th Infantry, 2nd Cavalry, and Lows Artillery Battery of Gatling guns(?) and a 12 lb howitzer.  Players may now explore the possibilities and capabilities of these guns, and what effect these forces could have had on the outcome of the battle.
