Scenarios included the historical game, the Montana columns arrival, assigning the Gatling guns or the 2nd cavalry with Custer. Is this last line correct?
The new expanded maps (from the original DTP version), allows for the relocation of the Indian village, the arrival of the Montana column, and if Custer had waited for Terry or was delayed because he took the Gatling guns.

title: Bist Du sicher?
description: Bist Du sicher? (Are you safe?) is a game about life, and the problems that come one's way.  Players draw tiles, resulting in both positive events and successes, as well as setbacks.  However, players can take the cash they collect to buy insurance to negate the negative effects of the setbacks.  It is essentially a multi-player solitaire game, and each player has a private board to track their accomplishments.

title: Expedition zu den alten Mayastätten
description:
Players are on an expedition to discover ancient Mayan temples and capture their treasures. You must help each other on the trek through the jungle, but if you reach a temple site, you must then compete for the rewards. The card game has different phases in which players secretly lay cards to make the expedition's total value exceed the hazards. You can try and trick the others by resting on the journey, but if this means that trek fails, you must pass out your highest cards to the others. Then at the temples, players use their cards to beat each other to the treasures.

The 64 card deck uses authentic bw illustrations from contemporary explorations of the nineteenth century, which lend the game a strong theme. The cards have simple German text. The cardstock is laminated but flimsy, and while the production is good for a first release, gamers may expect better. However, the price at Essen 2005 was only 4 which was fair. German rules only in the box.

title: Munera Sine Missione
description:
Munera Sine Missione is a free set of miniatures rules which are designed to allow players to recreate gladiatorial combat in the arenas of Ancient Rome. The are designed to give a very quick, simple game, which can be played in ten or so minutes

The game uses a hex grid to regulate movement, and each gladiator has a number of action points to spend each turn. These points can be spent to move or attack other gladiators. Attacks are resolved by a simple roll-off between the attacker and defender, with the attacker getting bonuses for position. The defender gets a save roll to avoid wounds. Play continues until a gladiator loses all of their wounds.

Rules for a wide range of weapons are included,and all major historical gladiator types can be depicted with little problem.

Munera Sine Missione is available as a free download from http://hordesofthethings.blogspot.com.au/p/free-stuff.html. The current version is 2.4 (September 2016)

title: Picture Perfect
description:
Be the first player/team to score 50 or more points by identifying famous faces randomly assorted in 5 major categories: Movies, Television,  Radio; History; Sports, Recreation,  Leisure; Music, Arts,  Literature; and Miscellaneous.

Includes 400 famous faces cards and instruction sheet

title: Sonic Skillball
description: The Aim  Score Arcade Action Game!  With Electronic Light and Sounds.  A game for the entire family!

title: Zoboomafoo
types: Children's Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Box front:

What a wonderful party!  Gather three animal friends and the foods they eat.  Get them to the party first, and win the game!  Fun for the entire family.

Box back:

You're invited to join Zoboo, the loveable lemur, and all his Animal Friends in Animal Junction!  Travel around the colorful gameboard and look for the three animals that are on your special invitation card, plus a food that each of them likes to eat.  After all, it's no party without snacks!

Children will have fun developing matching skills while learning what their favorite animals like to eat.  The first player to get matching cards for all three animals on their card AND one yummy food card for each animal is the winner.

Ages 3 and up.

title: Tower Siege Expansion: Elemental Adversaries
types: Card Game Dice Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Fighting
description:
Elemental Adversaries is a 15 card expansion pack for the non-collectible customizable Tower Siege fantasy card game (#4649).

It contains the following cards:
Arromus 
Amulet of Spell Casting 
Apprentice 
Boiling Oil 
Divine Light 
Electrum Coin 
Hidden Powerstone 
Librahm of Sorcery 
Lore Stone 
Mine 
Priest 
Raze 
Roklor 
Shelter 
Vein of Gold

Online Play

     CCG Workshop (no longer available)




Expands:

    Tower Siege

title: Tower Siege Expansion: Fiendish Foes
types: Card Game Dice Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Fighting
description:
Fiendish Foes is a 15 card expansion pack for the non-collectible customizable Tower Siege fantasy card game.

It contains the following cards:
Adventurer's Guild 
Arcanium Stone 
Barbarian 
Battle Axe 
Bloodlust 
Exorcist 
Fire  Brimstone 
Hill Giant 
Hidden Mine 
Mine 
Merchant 
Platinum Coin 
Power Surge 
Ring of Resistance 
Sarcophagus

Online Play

     CCG Workshop (no longer available)




Expands:

    Tower Siege

title: Tower Siege Expansion: Thaylen's Rogues
types: Card Game Dice Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Fighting
description:
Thaylen's Rogues is a 15 card expansion pack for the non-collectible customizable Tower Siege fantasy card game.

It contains the following cards:
Anti Magic 
Altar of Power 
Amulet of Resistance 
Battle Fog 
Scribe 
Kenium Coin 
Resist Magic 
Ring of Skill 
Onx Stone 
Powerstone 
Battle Chest 
Yardov 
Goblin Wizard 
Orc Sorcerer 
Ogre Warlock

Online Play

     CCG Workshop (no longer available)




Expands:

    Tower Siege

title: Conquest Europa
description:
Conquest Europa is a derivative of Britannia, which deals with the full scope of European history from AD400 (The Fall of the Roman Empire) to AD1480 (The Fall of Constantinople).

As with Britannia players control various historical factions (Romans, Huns, Mongols, Persians, Poles, Ottomans etc) and gain victory points from pre-defined activities (occupying areas, destroying enemy units etc).

The game was manufactured as a pre-production evaluation/test version and was never mass produced by a games company. Approximately 20 copies were hand-manufactured between 1989 and 1992.

25 years on from the first version ... a 2014 Edition is available on BoardGameGeek as PDF download (see below) comprising updated components and some minor rule/scoring changes.

title: You're Pulling My Leg!
description:
You'll laugh out loud as you and your friends try to fool each other with outrageous stories about your lives. When a card is drawn and a question is asked, the secret roll of the die tells you if your answer should be true or made up.

When you hear a story, bet tokens on whether you think your friend is telling the truth or pulling your leg. You'll win tokens if you're right but lose them if you're wrong. Think you know your friends? How well do they know you? Bluff other players but don't let them fool you. Score enough tokens and you win!

Tell me about...

a time in your life
you would repeat.

something you got away with as a kid.

something you learned about life from
your mother.

Recommended age:  Ages 13 and up

title: You're Pulling My Leg! Junior
description:
Now the award-winning You're Pulling My Leg!! has been adapted for kids and families. You'll laugh out loud as you and your friends try to fool each other with wacky answers to outrageous questions. When a card is drawn and a question is asked, the secret roll of the die tells you if your answer should be true or made up.

When you hear a story, bet tokens on whether you think your friend is telling the truth or pulling your leg. Watch out! You'll win tokens if you're right but lose them if you're wrong. Think you can fool your friends? Don't let them fool you! Score enough tokens and you win!

Tell me about...

a time when you couldn't stop laughing.

something gross you've eaten.

a time when you thought you might get in trouble but didn't.

Recommended age:  Ages 9 and up.

title: Traber Derby Spiel
description:
From the translated rules:

The players are harness race drivers. Each driver tries to maneuver  his team into a good racing position using the colored dice and by the skillful play of 'spurt' cards. The player with the highest total of points after three races over different distances is the Derby Winner.

title: Negamco Pro Golf Game
description:
a 1962 Golf game with 25 individually rated golfers of the time by Nemadji Game Company of Duquette Minnesota. There are several charts (Tee-off, Fairway, Off-Green) that you (representing the golfer) use to move your golf ball (marked by a Tee) down the 9-hole course. The individual player cards are only used once you are on the green. There is a spinner in the bottom of the box where you get a result of 1 to 25 and look up a result on a chart or on the player card. 
Some of the golfers included: 1942 Byron Nelson, 1937 Byron Nelson, 49 Sam Snead, 54 Snead, 53 Ben Hogan, 51 Hogan, 35 Gene Sarazen. I think this was a set of All-stars and might have been an extra option. There is also a set of 1962 golfers: Weiskopf, Crampton, Dent, Wadkins, Watson, Player, Floyd, Nicklaus, Trevino and others.

title: Swipeout Ski Challenge
description:
Swipeout Ski Challenge is three games in one, a card game, a board game and combined card and boardgame.

When you play the full Swipeout Challenge game (The combined card  boardgame), you build up your resources for your mountain adventure through a competitive card game.  You also acquire carious action cards, known as Game Cards, which will help you or hinder other during the boardgame that follows.

The winner is the player with the most money left at the end of the game.

title: JabberJot
description:
Quick! You've got 90 seconds to write a story about a musician, a phone booth and the desert. Make sure you use the words juggle, tasty and rebel and write it in the theme of time travel. It doesn't have to make sense - the wackier the better! If your story is the favorite, you'll win the challenge.

JabberJot is the hilarious word game where you create all kinds of wild tales. In each round, you race against the timer to jot out a story using three pictures, three words and a theme that are different each time.

When time is up, you'll win the challenge if the jabber (the player judging) likes your story the best. You'll fall on the floor laughing when you hear the outrageous stories your friends and family concoct. Score enough challenge cards and you win the game!

title: Nemesis
description:
Nemesis is a (collectible) card game about gladiators, set in ancient Rome.
Each deck represents a type of gladiator (Myrmillo, Dimachaera  and Retiarius decks were made) and the total of cards in a deck determine a gladiators total life points. Each turn a player takes cards from his life deck into his hand and attacks other players. Damage is taken by discarding cards from your hand or your life deck. The last player to have cards left in his/her life deck wins the game.
There is a pile of Arena cards as well that determine random events that occur in the Arena - some good, some bad.

Game was handmade, monochrome drawings on colored cardboard cards. Some 200 copies were made of the basic set (rules, Arena cards and two gladiator decks; Myrmillo and Dimachaera) and the first expansion set (Retiarius).

title: Cien Cañones por Banda
description:
Cien Caones por Banda is a set of rules that allows to simulate fast but elegantly any naval battle of the 1750-1830 period. The battles range from the Napoleonic wars to the battles of South American independence to the American Revolution. The ships represented, rated for crew, crew morale, firepower, speed and hull, range from the nimble frigates to the Victory, Nelson's flagship at Trafalgar to the biggest sail and wood ship-of-the-line ever built, the 130-gun, 4-decker Santsima Trinidad, also known as The Escorial of the Seas. the admirals represented include Gravina, Nelson or Villeneuve.

In this first installment of Cien Caones por Banda there are ships, scenario rules and leaders to simulate the following battles:

Cape St. Vincent 1797 The Prelude 
Finisterre 1805: Brothers in Arms
Trafalgar 1805: The Abyss of an Empire 
Trafalgar 1805: The Gravina Touch (hypothetical scenario)

title: Alphabet Runner
types: Children's Game Educational Math Memory Word Game
description:
Alphabet Runner  combines four game in one - a word, memory, board and card game - and a mix of skill and luck helps children with literacy and numeracy. The game helps children build and memorize three, four and five words and reinforces spelling, turn-taking and concentration.

Alphabet Runner promotes these skills:
Social interaction,
Communication skills,
Speaking and listening,
Small movements,
Hand-eye co-ordination,
Literacy skills,
Mathematical thinking,
Problem solving.

title: The Yoga Garden Game
description: In The Yoga Garden Game you roll a die and move a bumblebee through a circular garden. If you land on a yoga space, you try to do a classic yoga pose or invent your own. This game is for teaching young children Ages 4 and up about yoga.

title: Speller Senior
description:
From Publisher's website at http://www.creativeeduaids.com/whats.htm:

Senior version of our very popular game in which the players spell the words correctly to move around the board and score maximum marks.  A highly challenging and educative game to learn spelling, pronunciation and improve vocabulary.  Contains and beautiful multi-color play board and 300 spelling cards with 900 spelling of varying difficulty levels.

Components:
1 Board
4 Playing pieces
300 Spelling Cards
1 Special dice

Publisher's contacts:
Creative Educational Aids Pvt. Ltd. 
6, Toy City, Udyog Kendra, Greater Noida,
Dist. G. B. Nagar, U.P. 201306. India
Tel.#  +91-120-2350875, 2350292, 9891082313

New Delhi Office Tel# +91-11-25381813, 25381759, 
Fax: +91-11-25381790
Email: pradeep@creativeeduaids.com

title: Codex
description: Set up a 5-letter-word and try to guess the opponents. The mechanic is to ask the other person which letter is on the nth position of his alphabet - the missing letters are omit and so the transition tells you the alphabet.

title: Durchs Gartenjahr
description:
This games simulates one year gardening: You start in January and roll your pawn through the seasons. 
You also draw cards with crops and flowers. If you are in the right month you can plant or harvest them

title: Splat!
types: Card Game Fighting Humor Party Game
mechanisms: Dice RollingStorytellingVariable Phase OrderVariable Player Powers
description:
The Birthday Party has not been going well. The soup was lumpy and the main course was stodgy and overcooked. Now dessert is servedthe table is laden with Chocolate Mousse, Rice Pudding, Cherry Pie, Fruit Salad and so much more. The guests start to grin wickedly

The object of Splat! is to furiously flinging food at other players while dodging food they are throwing back at you. The more food that hits you, the messier you get. At the end of the game, the cleanest players are allowed to think that theyve won.

The game uses three types of cards:

Food Cards : Each food card has a special power which takes effect when the food is either eaten, or is thrown at another player and hits.  Some of these powers are long lasting while others are instant (e.g. the banana split is vitamin fortified and so increases a players hand size, while the revolutionary cupcakes contain added additives which force you to throw all your food at other players). Food cards are either green (generally beneficial powers) and red (generally not beneficial).

And Then Cards : Event cards which can be played during the food throwing process to impact the course of the game.  These cards act as interrupts which provide much of the interactive story telling character of the game (e.g. Amy throws Birthday Cake at Clare but Bob catches it and throws it back at Amy on his next turn). These cards can also be played as dodges to avoid food that is thrown at you.

Object Cards : Throughout the game players may also stand in front of objects (e.g. The Children, The Gnu, Uncle Harry or The Mirror).  If a player standing in front of an object dodges then the food hits the object instead and the thrower gets yelled at by either the Host or the Hostess--forcing them to discard all their And Then cards and eat a food (if they have one).

Each player has a 'You' card with 5 hit locations--when food hits someone the thrower rolls to see where (Head, 2 x Arms, 2 x Legs, 1's miss).  Food which hits a location that is already messy replaces the previous food.

The Butler (Jeeves) also has a hit location card--players may choose to throw food at him through the game and in addition any food that is thrown which does not hit a player or an object may hit Jeeves instead.  Once Jeeves is completely covered with food he chases the players out of the house, ending the game.

Splat! is a reworking of Ed Carter's 1992 food-fight card game, Kersplatt!

title: MOCKBA
description:
Mockba International Teams  (W122)

CONTENTS

280 counters
01 rigid map (in two pieces)
01 book of rules
01 book of example and tables
01 6 sided die


GAME DATA

Unit scale: Division through Brigade
Turn length: 1 week
Hex scale: the game doesn't mention it but I think 12 mile for hex
Complexity: IT value OOOO


To the end of September 1941 the forecasts of the Fuhrer seemed to come true: the end of the campaign, before the advent of the winter and the complete destruction of the
Russian army, it was to capacity of hands.
The armed order of the day of the group center very spoke 73 divisions about infantry and 13 destroyed enemy armored divisions.However the situation was not still completely under control regarding the previous experiences, in fact the great created bags did not yield but they continued to
resist beyond every expectation.A last effort was therefore necessary.With a superiority of men and means of 2 to 1 and in sky of 3 to 1 that one began that had to be the last and definitive offensive...

Re-implemented by:

    Moskva

title: Summa Summarum!
description: Each player gets 18 discs of a color and places them face up  in front of him. Alternating the players place now the discs on the board. The first disc could be placed entirely free, all further must be placed in the row or the column where the last chip has been placed. If one has a higher sum than the fellow player thereby in a row, then you turns all face up chips of your opponent face down and if your (if there are any) face down chips face up. The game ends if no player could place a new chip according to the rules. The player with the highest face up total wins.

title: Turmbau zu Babel
description: The board is made from solid wood and stacked high representing the Tower of Babel. Each player is given a secret color.  On your turn you roll the die and move pawns of any color around one of the rings. When rolling the die you choose to use either the top or bottom number of what was rolled and then you give the other number to the next player for them to move a pawn. As pawns are grouped together they get to move up to higher levels of the tower. When you get pawns to the top you score points based on the position of your color.

title: Happy Dog
description:
Line-making cardgame (including 2 kind of games).

Number of cards' lines is default according to player-number( or kinds of game).
In your turn, you must place a card to a line from your hand. But point on card must be next to former one (excepting first card of the line).

There are 3 kind of special cards (illustrated like Japanese).

Happy Dog: Wild card. Tie breaker. Its point is same as last card or next card card. After Happy Dog, any card can be placed.

Phoenix: bring back one of your cards from any line to your hand. Or, stop someone from one line placing card.

Dragon: Remove an end card from any line.

At the end of game, a winner is determined by scoring each line. Each player sums points on her/his cards at the line. The player with the most points wins the line and take all cards of the line.
After determining winners of every lines, the player with the most cards (Except phoenixes) wins the game.

title: Battle Group Commander
description: Every second counts in this action packed game of strategy and tactics, as each player attempts to take control of the battlefield and become absolute commander. Skill, cunning and tactics are the only thing that will see you through! If you think you have nerves of steel, and the strength of character to make men take the battle to the enemy under a hall of withering fire, then maybe you can be 'Battle Group Commander'! Soften the enemy up first with pop up attacks on any unit that is getting too close with the helicopter, or bombard longer-range targets with the launcher. Try and take out as much of the enemy specialists as soon as possible, but remember while you are doing all that to your enemy, they will be trying to do the same to you!

title: Ice Pirates of Harbour Grace
types: Adventure Card Game Exploration Fighting Maze Nautical
description:
Arrr, yes!  The legendary treasure of the Pirate Admiral  They say its buried somewhere on Kellys Island, it is  But where the island is, and where t dig for it once ye get there, I couldnt tell ye  Unless I was properly persuaded, if ye get m meaning

The object of Ice Pirates is to sail through the frozen waters of Conception Bay in order to find and dig up the Pirate Admirals treasure and stash it somewhere no other pirates (your opponents) can find it.

Conception bay is laid out as a board of cards with Bell Island in the middle and named ports around the outside. Each port offers a particular ship upgrade that will assist players in their quest to find and keep the treasure (e.g. Cannons at Harbour Grace, Ice Breakers at Cupids Harbour, Telescopes at Pouch Cove).

The rest of the board starts the game face down--hidden in the bay are three lost islands (where you can find treasure maps) and Kelly's Island where Peter Easton (the Pirate Admiral) had his secret base and (according to legend) left buried treasure when he left for warmer climes. The first player to find, or steal all three treasure maps and reach Kelly's Island gets to dig up the treasure--at which point the game switches to a treasure run with every other player attempting to steal the treasure off them.

Most of the bay cards contain icebergs, which block your movement if they come up in the wrong places, and three shipwrecked mariners who will join your crew if you find them and rescue them--increasing your fighting strength.

title: The Arcane Warfare Project
description:
Arcane Warfare (AWr) was a set of miniature fast play rules dedicated to Ancient and Medieval wargaming, versions 1 to 3, out of print.
Renamed AWR 4 and 5th editions, out of print.
Next version will be AWE 10, to be released soon.

title: Elixir:  Alambic
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Humor
description:
This first expansion for Elixir provide new spells, new magic items, a new transaction and a set of component.
A new card named Alambic help to cast spell.

Expands

    Elixir

title: Shadows over Camelot: Sir Bedivere, the 8th Knight
description:
The 8th Knight was part of the (German) Spielbox-Magazin Number 3/2005.

It was also included in:
- Game Master Magazine, issue n0 (Italian)
- Jeux sur un Plateau, issue n16 (French)
- Games International issue n22.

Subsequently, the miniature along with the character card and an orange die appeared in Shadows over Camelot: Merlin's Company.

title: Mark Twain's Memory-Builder
description:
In 1885 American humorist and author Samuel L. Clemens (Mark Twain) received a patent for Mark Twain's Memory Builder, a game designed to help players retain important dates and facts from throughout history.
Points are awarded by what type of fact is given: 10 for an Accession of kings, presidents, and other rulers; 5 for Battles; and 1 for minor events such as births, deaths, and inventions. Additionally, one point is awarded for facts not related to dates, such as the number of bones in a human foot.
The board consists of a table with areas marked 1-100 representing the years of any century with 3 rows of dots for the three kinds of facts previously mentioned and a separate section for un-dateable facts. As a player names a fact he places a pin in the related pinhole. Anything worth remembering is admissible.
Play continues in turns for a previously agreed upon amount of time.

title: Elixir: Mandragore
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Humor
description:
This second expansion for Elixir provide some new spells and magic items.

The big improvement is places (cards giving to his owner a free component) and panels (cards indicate if a place is open or not)

This expansion no longer exist alone.  You can find it in the box called 'la Compil' with the two others expansion.

Expands

    Elixir

title: Elixir: Alchimie
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Humor
description:
This third expansion for Elixir provide new mechanism.

Special cards are put on the middle of the table to form 5 alchemical formula (ex : dragon breath + fairy powder = effect).

This expansion no longer exist alone.  You can find it in the box called 'la Compil' with the two others expansion.

Expands

    Elixir

title: Diagonale
description:
This is an Italian game by Gastone Fiori.

Look like 3D Checkers with 3 transparent octagonal boards.
Put one over the other like a tower.

There are 3 kinds of pieces; a diagonal one, a concave one and a convex one (that perfectly fit the concave shape.

The convex one appears like a little House

You put 2 concave, 1  convex and four diagonal pieces on the line Cross..

All the piece can eat like Checkers in the same board.. but can eat in different mode on parallel board according with their shape. Convex and concave pieces may Kill pieces on other boards if they are in a reflected diagonal with an opponent piece.. diagonal pieces may kill pieces on other boards if they form a diagonal with the opponents piece.

title: Build!
description:
In Build! You have to play the role of a pitiless businessman who wants to build up as many construction projects as he can, regardless of their nature and without caring about the damages they can deliver to the environment and to public health. To achieve your goal, you can use different kinds of Cards: Land Cards, on which you can build up constructions; Construction Cards, representing the different buildings you can put on your land; Actions Cards (Attack  Defense), which have the objective of damaging the enemy and/or defending yourself from enemy attacks; Catastrophes, which are terrible events that could happen and damage all the players in the game (Eg. Earthquakes, Volcanic Eruptions, etc.)
All the card illustrations are very funny, the rules are easy and the playtime is about 15-20 minutes, but you can add some strategy to the game, using all the rules included in the game, so that playing time is increased to 30 minutes. 
The game box includes two card decks, (each of 55 cards) and the rules. 
The size of the card is 8,7 x 6,3 cm.
The game is designed for 2-8 people.

title: The Rocky Horror Trivia Game
types: Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Trivia
description:
This trivia game is based on 20th Century Fox movie, The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Recommended for Ages 17 and up.

From the box:

It's just a jump to the left...to play the Rocky Horror Trivia Game. Pick one of over 1,200 questions about your favorite transsexual movie and its stars. It's astounding!

And then a step to the right...to roll the custom die and earn 5,000 Rocky points to win the game, which is simply a figment of your imagination.

Put your hands on your hips...and do the pelvic thrust. Drive your opponents insane as you relive this sinful experience and immerse yourself into the twisted world of Rocky Horror to earn bonus points.

The true fans, not virgins, of this horrific, sci-fi, B-movie, are invited to celebrate the 30th Anniversary of one of the most exciting and entertaining films of all time. Test your knowledge...Hot Patootie, bless my - _____. Act out your favorite character in Wild And Untamed Thing. Dance The Time Warp, and enjoy erotic trivia game fun...guaranteed to thrill you, chill you and fulfill you!

Contains: 250 trivia cards, 1,231 Questions, score pad, oversized die, and rules.

title: Dimension 0
types: Card Game Collectible Components Fantasy Science Fiction
description:
Summary
Japanese trading card game designed by Nakamura Satoshi (Fairy Tale, Yuhodo). The game is somewhat like Magic: the Gathering, and somewhat like Duel Masters. Units move and fight on a 3x3 grid. The game is set in a mixed science/fantasy setting, with both metal robots and dragons. Depth of game play is claimed to be one of its features.

title: Starmada X: Brigade
description:
Starmada X: Brigade is a source book for The Universal Game of Starship Combat, providing background and starship designs for seven different factions, each taken from Brigade Models' excellent line of starship miniatures.

The 72 different ship classes included in this book have each been designed by players of Starmada. They present a wide variety of philosophies and strategies, illustrating the flexibility of the most comprehensive starship construction system available in any space combat wargame.

Brigade includes the complete rules for Starmada X, allowing you to start blasting your opponents into just so much space dust right away!

title: Iron Stars: The Merchant War
Adjugé
description:
Become the richest collector!
Six rare objects are for sale at the auction, no one knows their real value.

title: Babylonia
description:
From the publisher:

A points scoring game of facing capture, waiting capture void captures  capture proper for 2 to 8 players played on an classically designed, yet attractively different, checkered board where war is fought IN every direction  FROM every direction!

A Classic in Waiting, in Tradition, and in Style, Babylonia is a social 2 to 8 players points scoring capture game, where the winner is the player with the most point at the end of the game after deductions have been made. In this game the players men are called Zealots.

Taking turns, a move is to lay your Zealot on the board, then totaling your scores, if any, for that turn - and thats about it really, but don't be misled; from humble beginnings the whole board will soon have you on your toes! So watch out. You have been warned!!!

title: Pizza Box Football Expansion
description:
Pizza Box Football's 32-Team Expansion Game is based on the 2004-2005 season.  All 32 teams are modeled after their strengths and weaknesses.  How will you shut down Indy's powerful passing? Penetrate Pittsburgh's stalwart defense? Slow Atlanta's running QB?  Can anybody beat New England?
  
The expansion also adds 3 additional play calls for the offense and 3 additional play call for the defense.  Beware of the defense's blitz!  Watch out for the screen pass!

The expansion comes in its own envelope, allowing it to store easily inside your existing Pizza Box Football game.  The envelope holds the cards for the 32 teams as well as the expansion play sequence cards.

Expands:

    Pizza Box Football

title: Autoduel Champions
description:
SJG Game # 7107

8.5 x 11 book which crossed the Champions and Car Wars systems. Had rules for auto dueling in Champions as well as super powers in Car Wars. Helicopter construction and combat rules were first introduced here.

title: Street Fighter
description:
Street Fighter - An Auto-Combat Solo Module (#AV-1005)

8.5 x 11 book was the fifth AutoVentures Car Wars supplement by Aaron Allston. In 1985, Task Force Games took over publishing this line of supplements.

title: The Gauntlet
description:
The Gauntlet - An Auto-Combat Solo Module (#AV-1006)

8.5 x 11 book was the sixth AutoVentures Car Wars supplement by Aaron Allston.

title: Autoduel America
description:
From the package:

Looking for adventure? Trouble? A route across the bandit-ravaged countryside of America, 2039? Or just a safe truck stop?

Autoduel America puts the world of 2039 right at your fingertips. Two beautiful 23 x 35 full-color maps detail the North American continent, including road conditions for the major interstate, U.S., and state highways; nuclear zones; truck stops; cities; fortress towns; ruins; military bases; national forests and parks; state and national capitals; no dueling zones and lawless areas. Use them as posters or as game aids for Car Wars or GURPS Autoduel campaigns.

title: La carga de la Brigada Ligera: Batalla de Balaclava
description:
Wargame published by NAC Espaola, wargame Series, in little format. It represents the Battle of Balaclava in 1854. An expeditionary mixed force (French and British) with 56,000 men and 5,000 Turkish began the invasion of the Crimean Peninsula. Their main objective was Sevastopol.

- Board: 24 x 38 cms.
- 112 counters.
- Rule book (in Spanish).

Juego de simulacion belica publicado por NAC Espaola. Recrea la batalla de Balaclava, con la famosa carga de la Caballeria Ligera. El juego viene en una minicaja de 20 x 13 cms.

title: Whoa Nellie
description: Girls and Boys of all ages are high in the saddle. Everyone rides in the state fair, but only one will win the Gold Cup. Choose the right move, make the most jumps, collect your flag, and ride back to collect your prize! Whoa Nellie entertains players who enjoy horses and rewards players who like the challenge of planning ahead. Whoa! This is fun! Climb on!

title: Harry Potter and The Goblet of Fire Quidditch Dice Game
types: Children's Game Dice Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Travel
description:
From the rules:  Roll the dice and place them on the Quidditch Pitch to earn goals and catch the Golden Snitch, or to block your opponent from scoring.  The first player to catch the Golden Snitch ends the match, and the player with the most Goal Points wins!

Components:
1 trunk (travel-size game case)
1 score board  die holder
1 Quaffle Die (Red 12-Sided)(*)
2 Bludger Dice (Black 12-Sided)(*)
1 Golden Snitch Die (Gold 6-Sided)
1 Keeper Die (Black 6-Sided)
4 Goal Dice (Blue 6-Sided)
2 Quaffle Score Markers (1 Blue, 1 Red)
2 Golden Snitch Score Markers (1 Blue, 1 Red)

(*) All 3 12-sided dice in this game are actually 12-sided D6's (meaning they are numbered from 1-6 twice).

title: Conservation
description:
Players are attempting to gain tricks of three bird cards: a male, female and young of the same species. The game uses a deck of cards, comprising: 75 bird cards (3 of each species), 6 Hazards, 6 Protection cards and 1 Appeal card.

6 cards are dealt to each player at the start of the game. The players then pick a card from the deck (or discard pile) and then play. Sets of species are built (Male, then Female, then Young) and a completed set forms a trick and is put to one side. Sets are built up in the spaces along the edge of the board facing the player; the species has to go in the appropriate habitat (as indicated on the card).

Partial sets can be protected by Protection cards and destroyed by Hazard cards. The Appeal card allows you to take one card from another player, in return for the Appeal card, which can then be used again by its new owner. Some of the species are Rare Species. Completing these sets gains the player the appropriate counter.

To end the game you have to get a certain number of sets of species, with the rare ones counting for 2 or 3, depending on the value on the counter. Points are then totaled, with each species set being worth 50 points, with the appropriate multiplier (x2 or x3) for the Rare species, and cards in front of each player (but not yet in completed sets) being worth 10 points each.

title: Sticks and Stones
description: Sticks and Stones is a trading game, where 12 different resources and one club are traded between players. Players advance their resource production by purchasing more sticks and stones through resource sets of 3 or 6 respectively. Fires can be built for sets of 9. The first person to build 4 fires wins. The player in control of the club gets to make the rules and also gets to go first.

title: SUDOKU: Das Brettspiel
description:
Another game to play SuDoKu - a kind of crossword puzzle from Japan.

In the beginning you have to copy one of many tasks from a small card to the washable boardgame by using a marker.

Now you can start the game.
Every player has 30 seconds to find numbers that match in the cells. The other players have, first to control the time and second, the correctness of the numbers.
To write the numbers on the board, every player uses his own marker in a different color.

After finishing the puzzle, every player has to sum up the numbers he had put in - the player with the highest sum wins.

title: Fang Bang
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Fighting Humor Party Game Real-time
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRole PlayingSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
Competitors wear crazy face masks while trying to pop opponents' balloon snakes with their own balloon snake.

Snakes consist of incredibly long, thin balloons (the type you twist  model) with a plastic snake head mask secured to one end by an elastic band.  Each snake head has a 'tongue' with an abrasive surface which is used to burst the inflated balloons.

title: Hocus Pocus
description:
Unusual game from Transogram that really relies on components which glow in the dark for gameplay mechanics.  Comes in a very large box (17 x 12 x 8).

The game consists of a large hat with spring platform, four plastic rabbits (three of which glow in the dark), a large silk Hocus Pocus handkerchief, a wand with four detachable tips and many rings that are the game's 'currency' which also glow in the dark and must be  worn on the fingers of players.

When a player has won enough rings during gameplay (they must be wearing 10 rings BEFORE their turn) they get the opportunity to insert the tip of the wand into the hat  release the spring, causing the rabbits to pop up in the air.  This may or may not occur, depending on whether the correct wand tip is chosen.

The first player to make the rabbits fly out of the hat is the winner.

Although this game can be played in the light (by pretending the black rabbit is 'invisible') it is much more atmospheric and exciting in the dark.

title: Total Football
description:
Totalfootball is a Football (soccer) strategy game. It consists of a hard plastic carrying case which is, when opened, the football field. Each player has a team of 11 players, including the keeper, just as in the real game. The rules are an abstract version of the real rules, and in order to execute the actions, dice are used for details.

The game is published by a company from Kazachstan (Mind Game inc.) and several other Kazachstan companies have aided with this production. Besides a rulebook in a lot of languages also a CD-Rom with the game rules is included.

title: Assault on Narvik
description:
An LPS bonus mini-game, Assault On Narvik is a simulation of the ground, sea and air battles that raged around the far northern port of Narvik in Norway during the spring of 1940.  Gamers can take both games and compare just how much each side learned about amphibious operations in the three years that separated the two battles.

The game has an 11 by 17 map, 95 half-inch counters, 2 pages of charts and tables and 10 pages of rules. The game covers the Allied landings just after the Royal Navy went in and blew out of the water the German destroyer flotilla (that had just landed their troops).

The game uses a clever mechanic that ties in units' Fatigue Levels whenever they perform any sort of operation (move, attack, defend, retreat, you get the picture). The terrain and weather were so inhospitable that units can get worn down pretty quick, and players have to be thinking ahead to win the game.

Rules cover formation integrity, air support (mostly the Luftwaffe), limited intelligence, combined arms, even an armistice and/or internment of German units in Sweden. There is a lot packed into this little game, and we're very happy to be able to shoe-horn it in.

title: The Playing Card Kit
description:
Two decks and a book of games for all the family.

This set includes two decks of regular playing cards, and a 144 page book with rules for card games.  The table of contents is organized as follows:
1. History of Playing Cards
2. Rules of Play
3. Children's Games (12)
4. Social Games (22)
5. Games of Skill (12)
6. Gambling Games (14)
7. Solitaire Games (10)
8. Further Reading  Index

title: Sound Off
description:
Two teams attempt to reach the end of the board by acting out. When a team lands on a space, the actor on that team (it changes every turn) must act out what's on the card in 30 seconds or less. The catch is, they *must* use sound - the rules include a provision where if the other team catches them not using sound, they lose credit for a right answer. Only sound effects - no speaking - are allowed however.

The board spaces are as follows: Action Reaction, which is a long form charade such as passing gas and blaming it on the dog. Famous Expressions is usually a cliche or popular phrase. People, Places  Things is self explanatory.

The fourth category is Hot Spot. Five items are on this card, and the team gets 60 seconds. If the actor can convey three out of the five, they get credit and continue to roll and move. Getting all five earns a Safe  Sound card. This can also be earned via its own space on the board. Safe  Sound allows an actor to pass a charade - but only once on a given turn, regardless of the amount of SS cards they have.

Some spaces are designated all play by an arrow. The finish space of the game is an All-Play Hot Spot. Whichever team gets the majority of the five items in 60 seconds gets credit - and if you're on the team on the final Hot Spot space, that means you're the winner.

title: Polly Pottwal
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Real-time
description:
Try to catch as many fish as you can with the help of Paula. 
On a Magnificent wooden board the whale is placed right in the middle. You have to use Paula on the edge of the board (wooden Pawn) and a string (connected to the whale) to catch the fish. This is much more difficult as you think, because you have to act under pressure of time.

There is an expert rule: Throw a  die and catch only the fish of this certain color.

The author Robert F. Watson is better known on the BGG as robbirob.

title: Tiltin' Milton
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Humor Real-time
description:
DON'T TILT MILTON WHILE HE'S SNOOZIN' ...
... I'LL BE WINNIN', YOULL BE LOSIN'

so goes the rant on the box of this typical late sixties plastic offering from Ideal.

The object is to place as many objects on Milton as possible without causing him to topple out of his hammock.  Objects come in pairs - 10 large objects (e.g. bird nest, hat) and 10 smaller 'accessory' objects which pair off with the relevant larger object (eggs, feather etc).  The first player places one large object on Milton  their turn ends.  The next person to play places the relevant accessory object and then also another large object on Milton  their turn ends.  Play continues in this manner until Milton topples out of his hammock; the player who causes this event to occur is eliminated from the game.   All objects are removed from Milton, who is replaced in his hammock  play commences again until only one player, the winner, remains.

title: Miss World Game
description:
Players select their contestant from a pool of four supplied small dolls, complete with swimsuit.  A robe is purchased for each and play commences with Miss World contestants circling the board on their 'World Tour', earning money for various tasks.  When a contestant thinks they have accrued enough money (points) they may elect to parade on the Miss World catwalk stage.  Each space on the stage costs points (money) and any contestant who runs out of points is eliminated.

The first player to reach the Golden Spotlight on the stage is awarded the winner's crown and the title of Miss World 'to the enthusiastic applause of all beaten contestants' - so sayeth the rules!

title: Monopoly: United States Marines
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
From the website:

USMC Monopoly Game an Exciting Salute to Bravery, Commitment, and Patriotism! 6 Unique Collectible Pewter Tokens! - This has to be one of the most original ways you and your family can salute the United States Marine Corps - a super-exciting USMC Monopoly game! Be the first to fight as you buy, sell and trade the most prized assets of the U.S. Marines. It's your chance to control and command the branch of the armed forces that has never - in its entire history - retreated in war! 
Brought to you by USAopoly, this exciting Monopoly board game has players vying to own the battle ready AV-8B Harrier II, CH-46E Sea Knight Helicopter, EA-6B Prowler and much more! And each player gets to choose from 6 unique collectible pewter tokens: Assault Amphibian Vehicle, HMMWV, AV-8B Harrier II, Helmet, Boots, or the USMC Initials. Get in the action, and order now!
MONOPOLY   2005 Hasbro.

This USMC Monopoly game from USAopoly features:
From the Monopoly American Classics series! An exciting and innovative version of the classic Monopoly game, designed to honor the United States Marine Corps
Comes with 6 collectible pewter tokens: Assault Amphibian Vehicle, HMMWV, AV-8B Harrier II, Helmet, Boots, and USMC Initials
Board, playing and packaging showcase dynamic artwork and graphics of Marines on parade and in action
For 2 - 6 players, ages 8 and up
Box measures 20 W x 1.25 H x 10 D

title: Settlers of Catan: Rockman Edition
description:
Perhaps the only Euro-game to have a huge following in Japan, its popularity has spawned the Rockman Edition of Settlers of Catan. Rockman - known in North America as Megaman - is a well known video game character around the world, and the number of games in the Rockman line continues to be churned out until today.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

title: Dinosaurs: The Game of Survival
mechanisms: Area MovementDice RollingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Another great children's game from Ravensburger, this one getting your dinosaur (one of four to choose from) past the volcanos, across the stone bridge, through the swamps to the feeding grounds. Last dino standing wins.
As with all Ravensburger games, this one has outstanding components. The dinosaurs are plastic and nicely detailed. One of the hazards is a nice sized plastic boulder. And, the box bottom is part of the gameboard. As usual, Ravensburger makes a game that should make US Publishers hang their heads in shame.

title: Xtreme Zombie Hunter
types: Adventure Fighting Horror Miniatures Wargame Zombies
description:
From the publisher:

Xtreme Zombie Hunter is a comedic table-top miniatures game compatible with all 25mm miniatures of Zombies and the personality types that might hunt them. Set in a fictitious modern day America where Zombies are real and hunting them on national TV has become all the rage! XZH delivers a simple system, which is character driven to encourage replayability, full of laughs and can be enjoyed by 1 or more players. XZH lets you experience the hysterical nature of a B style Zombie movie with a twist.

DEAD LINK
Home Page: http://www.xtremezombiehunter.com/

title: I Love the 80s Board Game
description: Players group together up to 4 teams.  Each team have to answer questions regarding trivia from different years (80 to 89) sometimes by drawing or acting out the answers, winning a token for each year they answer correctly.  Categories include TV, Music, Movie, Sports and a category on fads (products, toys, news and events).  The first team to collect 10 tokens, one for each year, wins the game.

title: Walt Disney's Wonderful World of Color Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description: A game based on the TV program. The object of the game is to be the first player to travel all the space orbits, collecting the six different colored pieces to complete a TV screen.

title: StockItToYa!
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock Holding
description: This is a game where you attempt to get the most money at the end of the game.  You purchase stocks throughout the game, and when all of the stock for a company has been purchased, the stock gets sold.  You get a bonus if you are the first to sell the stock in a company.

title: Millennium Mania 2000
description:
Description :
You can win by being the biggest trivia buff in the group or by providing the best bluffs. If you convince the other players that your bogus answer to a question is right, you gain the advantage.

title: The 400
description:
The 400 Game - The Aristocrat of Games
Manufactured by Morris Systems Publishing Company
Copyright 1933

Know 400 pertinent facts about a subject and you will have laid the foundation to become master of it.

Game comes with:
8 32-page question and answer books,
6 score pads with instructions,
1 spinner.

The question and answer books are in the following topics:

Riddles
Etiquette
World Events
Love and Marriage
American History
Famous Sayings
Foods and Cooking
Spelling (National Spelling Bee Series)

Bears the 1933 National Recovery Act (NRA) Eagle Emblem We do our part
on the box front and spinner box.

title: Opiumkrieg 1839-42
description:
From Spielbox . . .

In Opiumkrieg 1839-42 (The Opium War 1839-42), the goal is to be at the right place at the right time and then do the right thing. On the eve of the first Opium War, the players sail their junks through the China Sea and buy silk, spices, porcelain or tea from the various harbors. These wares are sold for a heavy profit in the canton where the English freighters are. But the freighters also bring a trading good with them, one out of India that is worth much gold in the harbors along the sea: Opium! The only catch  dealing in Opium is punishable by death. Each player can choose in this game: a long life, or get rich quick. After war breaks out, the needs of the dealers change on a daily basis, forcing flexibility: A harbor that might have been shut yesterday is now open again, where Opium trafficking might be punished heavily today, tomorrow the English might allow it again. The historic events of the time are also included and have an affect on the way the game goes. And yet, theres still enough variety in the game to make it play out differently each time and allow the players to influence the game in many ways!

title: 18Kaas
description:
The gameshop 'de Joker' in Utrecht, Netherlands, released 18kaas, an 1830 style 18xx-game in Holland (different from Rob  Paul's 1839 and different from Theo Jansma's version), available in fold-able or hardboard and mounted map style, party proof version (1830: Railways & Robber Barons components required). In 2004 another 100 copies were available.

Though this uses components of 1830 this is not an expansion, but is a separate standalone game.

title: Beneluxreise
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: Like Deutschlandreise, Beneluxreise is a predecessor to Journey Through Europe. Players try to optimize their route to visit six randomly dealt places in The Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg.

title: Monopoly: Boy Scouts of America
description:
(from bsa-gyc.org):

The world's best-loved board game now celebrates 95 years of strong Scouting values, leadership, and fun! Monopoly: Boy Scouts of America is played just like the original game, but now features a custom board, cards, money, and pewter playing tokens, including a campaign hat, pocketknife, Scoutmaster cup, Boy Scout sign, flashlight, and Yucca backpack. This officially licensed Monopoly game is great fun for the pack, troop, team, family, and friends. A perfect gift for anyone in Scouting.

title: Kleine Ausreißer
description: Mama Duck's chicks can't listen and swim without precaution on the river. Mama Duck now has to catch them! Each player's three chicks try to enjoy their freedom as long as possible. The player who last has a free chick wins.

title: Candle Quest
description:
Candle Quest is a quick set-collection, auction and money-management game in which you buy/sell/auction cards in order to be the first to collect the entire set of candles necessary to light your Menorah.

On your turn, you either flip over a card from the draw pile, then buy, sell, or auction the card; or loot a card from a personal discard pile. The auction starts with you and goes once around but does not come back to you. If you win the auction, you pay the bank; if another player wins, they pay you and take the candle. In addition to candles, the deck includes unlit candles that you must pay off, but which can be used to pay off other unlit candles or loot candles. The deck also includes dancing candles that are wild, and can be used in place of any color.

In the basic game, the first player to collect all eight differently colored candles wins. In the advanced game, the player with the highest score at game's end wins. Candle Quest includes a junior  variant for ages five and six that removes auctions and discard pile purchases and changes unlit candles so that they can be used to steal a candle from another player.

Candle Quest is a re-theme of It's Alive! with a new publisher and artist; while It's Alive! was a re-theme of the original self-published 2005 version of Candle Quest which was called The Menorah Game.

While the theme features a Menorah related to the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah, there is no religious content in the game.

What's In The Box?:

    One full color 9-page Rules booklet
    60 Candle cards
    5 player screens
    54 Shekel coins
    One bright red, 9 1/4 x 5 7/8 Standard cardboard VPG game box
    One beautiful box cover sleeve
    One Wipes-A-Lot napkin
    One charcoal desiccant packet

Reimplemented by (and reimplements)


    It's Alive!

title: Turncoats
description:
From the publisher's website:

Turncoats is a game of espionage where allegiances can shift at any time during conflict. Players must outsmart their opponent and manipulate the neutral force (which both players have control over) to win.

This fast-paced game combines strategy, luck and ingenuity to create a game that is fun and intriguing for people of all ages. The games concept is roughly based on the idea of a military conflict where two warring factions must manage the effect of a third force which can be influenced by either side. The French and Indian war is an example of a conflict similar to what players will encounter in Turncoats.

title: Running Charades
description:
It's charades with an exciting, fun and frantic twist. To start, players divide into two or three teams. Each team moves to a different corner of the room or even to different rooms if space allows. now, one member from each team goes to the host who opens the first door on the specially-designed game console to reveal the first charade. The players run back to their teams and act out the charade. As soon as a team member guesses the charade correctly, they run to the host to get the second charade as displayed in the game console. The first team to get all 7 charades wins.

Traditional Charades also included in this game. The game also includes all you need to play traditional charades. Teams move along the game board and land on the seven different categories. Take a card, turn the timer over and start acting out the charade.

Contents:

     Charades game console
     Double-sided charade cards with over 2000 charades
     Gameboard
     Sand timer
     Movers
     Team markers
     Game die
     Category Tokens
     Instructions

title: The Guinness Game of Records
description: From box: It couldn't be easier to play. Make an educated guess for questions such as how many letters has the longest place name in Australia? or what is the height of the largest recorded wave?. the player who comes closest to the correct answer after two guesses takes the lead.

title: Splittin Infinitives
types: Economic Miniatures Negotiation Political Science Fiction Space Exploration
description:
Splittin Infinitives is a space-strategy board game where each player takes command of an entire race and attempts to conquer the galaxy by military force, colonial expansion, superior technology, underhanded politics, or any combination of the above.

The board is made up of space-tiles each with a different geography laid out randomly, and each player has their own space fleet and starting technology.  A technology deck describes the various technological advances players can get.  Older races begin with more tech, younger races can acquire more.

The beginning of the game is primarily exploration and colonization using the star-fleet, dealing with random anomalies in space such as black holes, or space-pirates.  Once players make 1st contact, then military force and star fleets, and the political deck, come into play.

The winner is the player with the most colonies on the board when the last planet in the galaxy is colonized.  Planets are also drawn from a random deck, each with different difficulty ratings, mineral wealth and population maxima.

Splittin Infinitives is suitable for an afternoon's or evening's gaming.  The various decks give variety, and keep it light-hearted, while the base allows for strategic serious play.  The rules are simple enough to fit on one page, and it can be played right out of the box.

title: The Mayor of Hooverville
description:
Its October 1931 in Seattle Washington, and youve had a tough couple of years. The Stock Market crash of 29 brought on hard times. You lost your job last year when the lumber mill shut down. Nobodys hiring. The local bank where you kept your money saved made loans to those businesses that were shutting down. Depositors panicked and there was a run. The bank went into receivership, and your savings were wiped out. With no job and no savings you couldnt make your house payment, and your mortgage was foreclosed on. Like millions of Americans you find yourself jobless, penniless, homeless.

Down by the Port, on the site of the old shipyard, some men are gathering supplies for winter: cardboard boxes, tar paper, firewood. You have decided to join their shantytown and to try to start again.

Who will eat the most food? Who will wear the least tattered clothes? Who will live in the finest hovel? Who will become The Mayor of Hooverville?

title: Long Winding Road
description:
Long Winding Road provides the chance to run a full season's Marathon Championship with the 141 men and 78 women each running 6 races during the year. You can choose from over 40 courses together with their Weather Modifiers. A Championship season of 12 races for men and 10 for women is suggested, so with each race taking about 2 1/2 hours playing time such a season would take around 60 hours to complete - well within the realms of possibility for many replay gamers if feedback from you is anything to go by.

The aim has been to try to recreate the way in which actual Marathon events develop, with small groups of runners breaking away off the front of the main pack, and others losing ground off the back.

We recommend 40 to 70 starters, although the system can cope with larger numbers if necessary, and we deal with the race in 1 kilometer stages, so it would not be sensible or enjoyable to require a dice roll for every competitor each kilometer. With a field of 70 that would entail around 3000 dice rolls!

So we only concern ourselves with identifying those runners within each Group (in game terms a Group consists of any number of runners from one upwards occupying a single 10-second space of our Endless Track) who need their Rating checked for that particular kilometer of the race to see whether they stay with their present Group, or make a forward or backward movement - that is gain or lose around 10 seconds on their Group over this kilometer.

National, European, Commonwealth, and Asian Championships can be run within the context of the main season's Championship, plus a Team Championship on a race-by-race or full season basis.

title: Booktastic! Family Edition
description:
Booktastic!
Family Edition
for ages 10 and up
Features Children's Literature!

Booktastic is a fun-for-the-whole-family game that combines traditional strategic and competitive play with the sharing of literary trivia! Booktastic appeals to rudimentary readers, bookish braniacs, and everyone in between. Because the casual reader questions are opinion-based and have no wrong answers, anyone can play including children and non-readers. During the game players move around a quaint town square of bookstores to buy, sell, and trade books according to a collection card they receive at the beginning of the game. Before each turn, players earn money by choosing question cards. The player with the most valuable collection of books and cash at the end of the game wins!

title: Borderline
description:
An abstract strategy game where the object is to reach the other side of the board (or take all your opponents pieces).

The game takes place on a 6x9 grid and each player has 12 pieces.  Each piece is quartered and each quarter numbered from 1 to 4.  This indicates the number of spaces that piece must move in that direction.  Opponents pieces are taken by moving over them (jumping) or by landing on them.

title: Zoodiak
description:
The players place their pieces on a central board trying to recreate the constellation patterns that appear on their cards in order to win.

The game comes with a cloth board, 20 double-sided wooden cylinders and 2 black cylinders (used for blocking board positions).

title: Encontro Marcado
description: Each player must avoid the other player on a labyrinth. Every time you make your move, you influence the other player decision for the next move. The one that reaches the center first is the winner.

title: Pavia 1525
description: The battles of Pavia: France against Spain for the control of Italy.

title: Magikon
description:
Magikon is a simple Role Playing Game published in Italian + French only by International Team in 1984. 
The guide to encounters includes 22 different kind of people with illustrations made by Mauro Moretti.
The background: Every 1000 years, the shadow master organizes a competition between magician-knights to chose who will succeed to him as governor of the Magikon castle and the surrounding region.
The players will explore the roads around the castle to find monsters, traps and villages. Every player has the same kind of background, so the team working is not necessary and usually, each player explores different areas.

title: The Space Game
description:
A game of interstellar trade and conquest. Players explore new worlds, make deals with resources, build fleets and do battle with their fleets, with agents or on the market.  Each turn you may: 
1.Place a piece 
2.Move your ships and/or place agents
3.Bribe stars (to conquer them), battle over stars or build ships.
The object of the game is to be the last surviving player or the player with the most stars and resources wins.

title: Dicefest
Puzzle Train
description:
Puzzle Train

Puzzle Train is a boardgame 'German type' (puzzle slide-game) for 4 players design by Jos Carlos de Diego Guerrero, based in Puzzle Railroad pc-game by XD Games and it is a crossover of Mississippi Queen and Carcassonne.

This game was published in the magazine Tabula #6 (in Spanish).

Links:

Review in Revista Tabula #6 (in Spanish)
http://www.labsk.net/index.php?topic=127.0

Download (in Spanish, previous register)
http://www.labsk.net/index.php?topic=143.0

title: Operation Warboard
description: An entry level tabletop wargame, that in fact has a greater level of detail than most beginner rule sets. Taking the approach of low cost gaming, the pictures and diagrams all depict ways to cut costs and begin gaming, and as such tends to relegate this rule set to a beginner level. Set as a platoon or company level engagement, the rules have a unique MG grid to infantry fire resolution. A good example of low detail for those that are painting impaired.

title: All For One
mechanisms: Hand ManagementPick-up and DeliverPoint to Point MovementVariable Player PowersVoting
description:
France, 1630. The Royal Musketeers are personal guards of King Louis XIII, defending the King against the dubious plots of Cardinal Richelieu. Athos, Porthos, Aramis, d'Artagnan, Rochefort, and MiLady DiWinter move around Paris, fighting duels and completing missions to earn the favor of the King and Cardinal. Both characters and players earn Favors throughout the game and bonus points are scored at the end when players reveal their true allegiances. The winner is the player who's earned the most Favor!

All For One is a pickup/deliver game for 3-5 players. Players are not tied to any specific character, rather each turn you choose which character to activate and then take actions with that character. Each player is secretly assigned one of the characters whose score will be added to their own at the end of the game. Your 'secret identity' helps drive decisions during the game, but in order to win you'll have to utilize all of the characters.

The board is an interconnected web of streets, some of which are patrolled by Cardinal's Guards. The guards serve to hinder the musketeers' progress. There are 6 named locations where the characters begin the game, and the other 18 locations are home to 1 plot token each. 2 of the tokens are horses, which can be ridden by the characters. The rest are used to complete missions.

The missions are printed on Mission Cards, which detail which character must complete the mission, which Plot Tokens are necessary to complete the mission, and the location at which the mission must be completed. Completing these missions involves collecting various Plot Tokens from around the board, and bringing them to specific places. Some missions involve getting 2 of the characters to a specific place at the same time, and some missions involve a duel between two characters.

title: Amnesia: The Short-Term Memory Game.
description:
From the Publisher's Instructions Sheet:

Amnesia is a short-term memory game where you can score if you remember ... and score if you forget. To WIN, just start on START and make it around your triangle to the center of the board.

title: Arcadia
description:
A tile-laying and -stacking game, a basic set consists of 40 hexagonal tiles worth different numbers of points.  The tile are ridged so that three tiles together can form a base for a fourth tile to sit upon them.

Gameplay consists of playing tiles from a hand of three tiles.  Tiles laid on top of other tiles are required to have the same pattern inscribed on them as the tile making up their base.  Tiles placed above the first level score depending on the point value of the tile played and the level it was played on .

Sets come in a single color, and different sets come in different colors, allowing for expansion and more advanced play in which color also becomes a factor for scoring.

title: Real Numbers
description: The REAL NUMBERS game was designed as a prelude to EQUATIONS. It comes in a handy 5-game kit that can be clipped to a pen in your shirt pocket. The REAL NUMBERS Game provides a practical introduction to the process of finding Solutions from randomly generated symbols similar to what occurs in EQUATIONS. The REAL NUMBERS Game deals with real, rational, irrational, integer, and natural numbers.

title: Lady Oscar
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Children game based on the Italian version of a popular Japanese cartoon (The Rose of Versailles, called Lady Oscar in Italy).

title: UNO: Batman Begins
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Based on the 2005 Batman Begins movie.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Special Justice Card. ???

title: Gazala-Tobruk
description:
Gazala-Tobruk game system, of medium complexity, puts the emphasis on armored combat, with tank/armor units at battalion level and regiments and brigades for the infantry. Each type of unit exerts a type of ZoC depending of the quantity and/or quality of its anti tank/armor assets, from rigid ZoC to semi rigid or no ZoC at all.

Other outstanding aspects of the rules are the HQ units that give combat support (There are HQ at the Army, Corps, Division levels, and even at Brigade level for independent British Armored brigades); minefields, air support and Allied redoubts or boxes.

title: Mimikri
description:
Mimikri can be played as two variants of traditional chess.

In the first, players know the identity their own pieces but not that of their opponent. Only by studying the opponent's moves, can the pieces be identified.

In the second variant, players know the identity of their opponent's pieces but not of their own. Moves are made blindly. If a player moves a piece inappropriately, the opposing player says no, the piece is returned to its original position and it becomes the opposing player's turn to move. However, if the move is appropriate, the piece remains in its new position thus revealing its identity. Subsequent moves can be made accordingly. It is now the opposing player's turn to move.

title: Civil War Wit
description:
A simple trivia game covering the American Civil War.  Each card (two standard decks' worth) has a photograph or etching reproduction on the front and a point value.  On the back are two questions--one buff level, the other scholar level.  Get either question right--it's not clear, from the rules, who gets to choose which question gets asked, the asker or the answerer--and you get the points listed on the card.  There is often no clear connection between the point value of the question and its difficulty.  The pictures, however, are very nice.

In an odd twist, if a card's question goes unanswered, the answer is then read aloud and the card set aside.  After all the rest of the cards have been dealt with, this pile of discards--whose answers, again, have been revealed--gets shuffled up and gone through again.  Presumably this is to test short-term memory.  The game ends once all cards have been correctly answered.

This is part of a series of WIT games from this company, which included trivia games on wildlife, National Parks, and other Americana topics.

title: Asesinato en el Orient Express
description:
A murder has happened on the Orient Express train. There are 12 characters, the suspects. One player moves the characters around a map of Europe, and he is the only one to know the identity of the killer.
Each of the other players leads a team of 3 detectives around Europe, accomplishing missions that give them clues about the killer's identity, while the killer tries to mislead them.
The detective teams must cooperate, but remembering that only one player will be the winner. If the killer has not been discovered after the set time limit (between 1 and 2 hours), he wins.

title: Port Dover
description:
From the rules:

Once, the small village of Port Dover, situated on the north shore of Lake Erie, harboured the world's largest fresh water fishing fleet.  Now, become one of the local captains deploying fishing tugboats and vying for the precious freshwater fish.

Essentially, a set collecting / stock manipulation game, players collect fish or cubes in 5 different colors.  To collect fish, you send out your boats to one of five ponds.  Usually, when you dispatch a boat to a pond, you change a fishes vaule and move a fish to a different pond.  After three rounds, players score for the value of any fish type for which they have the majority.

Very fast playing, published and distributed for free at Great Lakes Games III.

title: Dumb Luck the Ultimate Gambling Party Game
types: Bluffing Card Game Dice Party Game
description:
Dumb Luck is the Ultimate Gambling Party game, which combines poker, blackjack, hi-lo, and 19 other exciting games of chance with a race to the finish line where the winner cleans out what is left in the bank.

The Dumb Luck game is even set up as a $20 buy in if playing for some friendly cash is desired (and allowed). Among the many pieces included are 300 11.5 gram poker chips, 3 decks of cards, 8 dice, custom spinner, full color hinged board, and a beautiful locking carrying case.  Take a look at www.dumbluckgame.com

title: Musical Bingo
description:
Each player gets a musical bingo card.  The cards consist of a diamond of whole, half, quarter, eighth, and sixteenth notes distributed across the two musical clefs (treble and bass).  Each card either has notes on the lines or notes on the spaces between the lines.  The placement of the high/low notes are staggered and each card has a different placement of the various note lengths.

The caller selects one of the musical note chits, which have a particular pitch and duration.  Players check their boards to see if they can match that pitch and duration.  If they can, they place a marker on the appropriate note.  Play continues until someone can make a run of 5 notes.

title: Metropolitan Washington Trivia
description:
This Trivial Pursuit clone has cards with six categories: People, Politics, Places, Culture/Entertainment, Fine Points, and Sports.  The questions relate to the Washington D.C. area.

The included instructions have players take turns rolling a die (not included) and answering a question in the corresponding category.  Answering two questions correctly in a row gives the player one letter marker (a piece of cut-out paper).  Once you have gotten 10 letter markers (spelling WASHINGTON) you win.

The rules also state that the cards can be used with other trivia game boards - just use our colors instead of theirs.

title: The Game of States and Cities
description:
The cards in this game contain a map side and a question side.  The map side contains a map of the United States with a state blackened in.  The question side has the name of a state and 6 questions about the state (state flowers, topographical features, capitals etc.).

There are two games to play.  The first involves players looking at the map sides of the cards and making guesses as to which state is blackened in.  If they are correct they score the card.  If they are wrong it goes to the bottom of their card stack.  The second game involves players asking the trivia questions and the other players answering (each player gets one guess and the the players are asked in order around the table).  If you answer correctly you get the card.  If no one answers a question you ask, you get that card.  Most cards win.

The game is covered by U.S. patent 1745946.

title: Der Natur auf der Spur
description: Your adventure takes you from the tree house to the dock at the pond. Along the way you try to correctly answer as many questions about the plant and animal worlds as possible. For every correct answer, and for landing on environmentally friendly spaces, you receive point chips. You lose points for landing on environmentally unfriendly spaces. You may also gain points by successfully rolling to acquire all the parts to a five piece butterfly puzzle. Whoever has collected the most points when the first player reaches the dock is the winner.

title: La sombra del aguila
description:
La sombra del Aguila (Shadow of the Eagle) rules are a consolidation of the game system that appeared in Alea Magazine issue 16. With a basic rules and advanced rules.

It includes three scenarios: 

    Alcaiz 1809, 
    Maria 1809 
    Castalla 1813.

title: Lomby Zombie
types: Fighting Horror Humor Science Fiction Zombies
description:
A tile-based, tactical, roleplaying game with a touch of humor. Players fight their way to clear out and secure a house from an ever increasing horde of zombies.

A zombie master creates a house using sets of tiles that players explore. Players allocate statistics to create a character for their play style.

Each round, a new event occurs that affects an aspect of the game is played.

title: Hearts Card Game
description: This game comes with a special 44-card deck with pictures of animals.  Players try to avoid taking raccoon cards which are negative points.  Play is faster than Hearts since the deck is smaller.  The scoring and play rules are also simplified for children.

title: Dr. Kildare
description:
Medical game for kids Ages 7 - 12.  Based on the TV show of the same name.  Players make rounds in the hospital diagnosing patients.

Contents include:  game board, four pawns, spinner, analyzer, 11 red doctor cards, 40 blue doctor cards, 39 diagnosis cards, and instructions.

title: The Game of Yertle
description:
A balancing game of skill based on the popular book by Dr. Seuss.  Based on their spin, players must place Yertles on a balanced plate without causing them to all fall down!

Contents includes: Tumbler, spinner, 21 Yertles.  (Instructions came printed inside the box top.)

title: Would You Believe?
description:
Contents:  Six pawns, score card, answer cards, question cards, and the instructions.

Object:  Move up and back down the score card by the use of the move values on the question cards.  Be the first to arrive back at start.

title: Operation: Sealion 1940
types: Dice Miniatures Wargame World War II
mechanisms: Area MovementCampaign / Battle Card DrivenDice Rolling
description:
From the web-site description:
It is the year 1940. France has surrendered. The British and the remains of the French Army have retreated across the English Channel. Germany now controls the whole of Western Europe. The United Kingdom stands alone, waiting for the Germans to strike. Hitler approves plans for an upcoming invasion of the United Kingdom. A plan called Operation: SEALION. The invasion of the United Kingdom is about to begin!

This follows in the same vein as some other 'Battle' GAME based upon the Axis  Allies series, while you'll need to procure the necessary 'bits' from one of those to play this. There are entirely NEW components made up for this, with Order of Battle charts, the 'Gamemap', and with '3' SETs(or 'kinds') of CARDs for use in it.

title: Powerplay: The Game of Knowledge and Strategy
types: Economic Educational Environmental Party Game Political Trivia
description:
POWERPLAY is a question and answer game of political and social issues.  The questions are based on 5 categories (committees): War, Environment, Commerce, State (International politics and policies), and Domestic Policy (U.S. policies and public opinions).  There is a range difficulty from lots of people know this to Wow!  I didn't know that.  More difficult questions have multiple choice answers and higher point (vote) value.  Using political reasoning and/or logic can yield a correct answer even when it is not initially known.
