Whilst freebies continued to be used by various companies in an effort to get noticed, they often took the shape of fashionable and pointless pins that people could stick on their clothes, or, after a more inspired moment by Jumbo, were god's gift to gamers on Essen: jumbo-sized carrier bags - with appropriate logo off course.

For all the concentrated creative energy on show, it's amazing that it didn't seem to dawn on anyone what the potential of promo-games were when it came to getting people to your stand. It took until 1995 before the next noteworthy Essen promo-expansion appeared: Goldsieber's 13th constellation for Sternenhimmel (although this was not free). Kosmos followed in 1998 with a robber-gang-figure for Die Siedler von Catan, probably embarrassed by the success of the game and in a genuine effort to thank the fans. But it wasn't until Hans im Glck released a player's expansion for its El Grande that the promo floodgates truly opened. Hans im Glck is possibly still the worst offender with an endless flood of yearly Carcassonne add-ons. But where Hans led, many followed, and any visitor to the Essen Fair these days will find roaming bands of keen players trying to snaffle up all the special Essen promos on offer. It is rumored that not all of these end up on eBay. I won't join the debate weather this is racketeering or entrepreneurial. I do however applaud the recent initiatives from certain game companies to claw some of those eBay profits back, by no longer offering these promos for free, but asking a small donation for charity instead. Everyone a winner.

The game itself, off course, hardly got noticed and was easily forgotten. What do you expect from a sheet with a large plane and a game-of-goose type track of fluffy clouds that have different shapes but lack any explanation?

Nevertheless, now the Essen Freebie Game (Expansion) has became a bit of an institution, it might be time to pay tribute to the very first one: Hexagames, we salute you with a BGG entry for what must have been a great laugh.

(*) If you are left wondering:  Hexagames - Specially made for the first Essen Game Fair 1983 - The Speedy Stunt Plane Game - With Do-it-Yourself Rules

title: Wetwar
description:
From Black Powder's Website:
The Species Conflict

The year is 2038.

Man has grasped deep into the ocean, the wild lands, and into the orbital space, colonizing and tearing resources for the peoples use in a darkening future.

The future at a glance seems hard, for the birth of Risen animal species to intelligence and form like the human kind. Species hatred flares as humans have employed these new lifeforms where humans deem fit. Life has been hard for the Hybrids and the Risen, often worked to their deaths in colonial construction.

As well, many humans are fearful that they may be placed the loser in species conflict. Older folk are afraid of the frog, rat, and feline folk that now live next door.

All the while the Corporate Lords take their due as new leaders of the 21st century.

Welcome to Pacifica, your role is as a thief and a soldier. Leaders of Buka Units such as yourself will do battle, live as a rogue, and all the while laugh at those who do not know honor and freedom. Southeast off the shore of Japan, is where you are needed as the the 1,000,000 souls of the Pacifica Ocean Settlements are at odds with seeming rebels. These insurgents may be backed by powerful forces, so beware.

Pacifica makes its pay from oil drilling, tourism, research programs, and especially, the Titan Naga Platform that taps and collects geothermal energy from the earths core.

Of course, the internet now exists as both the wire of mother earth, and as playground. Webcrawlers with HUD net access fly as Deva across the shadowy illusion that is the Cybernet. Pays to keep a few of those people around.

Some, like yourself, will make their pay by covert operations. Welcome Buka rogue,

Enjoy your stay.

The game is a build-it-yourself PDF download.  It includes a modular board, units (infantry, vehicles, and weapons) a rulebook, and 44 cards used to represent background cyber-combat, or the opponents' wrestling for control of the computer system of the building they are in.  Physical combat is decided by a more conventional roll-to-hit system.  Rules are included to simulate combat in flooded and fully submerged locations.

This game is out of print.

title: Sailor Moon: Web of the Negaverse
description:
From Box:

Queen Beryl, and her wicked minions have banded together, casting a Negaverse power into our universe. They've managed to capture Sailor Moon. You, with the other Sailor Scouts must join together to rescue her...and save our universe.

title: The S.W.A.T. Game
description: Based upon the mid-1970's U.S. television show S.W.A.T. (Special Weapons And Tactics). Players compete to have their SWAT teams (each player controls two) be the first to capture the fleeing culprit. Players load their teams into a truck and race to the various hideouts where the culprit lurks. The teams disembark and attempt to get to the space occupied by the culprit by exact count.

title: Secret Weapon
description:
An action packed family boardgame, fast playing with lots of give and take. The secret plans keep moving and players must remember what parts are in the vault!

Each player is a spy attempting to steal the blueprints for a SECRET WEAPON from the inventors laboratory. The first agent to decode the blueprints on the decoder card is the winner.

title: Go Anna!
description:
Three Australian environmental card games for the whole family. For ages 4 and up.

Play Go Anna! and enjoy classic games with an Australian twist.
Play Go Anna! and learn about Australia's unique wildlife.
Younger children develop skills in recognizing colors, words and Australian animals. They develop skills in counting and memory.
For older children there are challenge levels to develop creativity and lateral thinking skills.
Go Anna! features beautiful, whimsical illustrations by Caitlin McDougall, talented actor and artist. Games design by Kribo and Yodit Ackerman.

The three games in the set are:

Go Anna!: Collect sets of possums, wrens or other animals in this fun four-of-a kind game.

Cinnamon's Surprise: Cinnamon the superb blue wren will help you win all the cards in this fast paced game.

Ella  Louis' Wonderful Connections: Match up one Tawny Frogmouth card with another, or birds with birds, mammals with mammals and so on, in this great matching game.

title: Sound FX
description: In sound effects you are trying to be the first team to correctly guess as many oral sound effects as possible and advance clockwise around the game board from start to finish.

title: Mickey Mouse Card Game
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Math Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The side of the card packet displays the name as the Mickey Mouse Card Game while the front cover displays the name as the Mickey Mouse: Educational Card Game and inside card instruction displays the name as the Mickey Mouse Number Game.

Most of the cards have either green circles that represent Mickey Mouse, red circles that represent Donald Duck, blue circles that represent Pluto, or yellow circles that represent Goofy.

The game can be played with two to four players.  The four-player game can be played with a set of two partners.  The game begins with each player being dealt 4 cards.  Three cards are placed face up in the middle of a table, although the 3-player game requires five cards to be placed face up in the middle of the table instead of three.

Players can claim cards in three ways.

1. By matching: A player can claim a card that matches on in his or her hand.
2. By combining: If there is a Mickey Mouse Lucky One on the table, a player can form a +1 addition equation to place this card on another card already on the table and pick it up with a next highest number card in the player's hand.
3. By building: A player can attempt to form an addition equation to pick up a set of cards.  For example: If there is a 3 on the table, a player can place a 4 on a 3 to build a 7.  If player can use a 7 card next round to pick up the 4 and 3.  However, this player could lose this 4 + 3 in two ways.  Another player could take this 4 + 3 before next turn by playing a 7, or another player could attempt to build a higher number equation by placing another card on the 4 + 3 stack.  However, a player cannot build unless he or she has a card to pick up the stack.

A player that cannot match, combine, or build must place one card on the table.  The player making the last play takes any cards left on the table.  A player gets 3 points for having the most cards, 2 points for a Lucky 2, 2 points for a Lucky 10, and 1 point for a Lucky 1.  The player or team that is the first to get 25 points wins the game.

title: War to End All Wars: World War I Expansion with War of 1812 and Mexican War
types: Dice Economic Educational Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War I
mechanisms: Area MovementCo-operative PlayCommodity SpeculationRoll / Spin and MoveVariable Player Powers
description:
This supplement is actually four different games.

The first two games War to End All Wars with this expansion and America Goes Central use the existing rules from War to End All Wars while the other two games are simulations of the War of 1812 and the Mexican-American War.  When using the game as a supplement for War to End All Wars, the same rules are used, while  granting additional North America playing area.  The supplement has a color map of central North America similar to the one used in The War to End All Wars: Box Set Edition.

title: Forchess
description:
This game is similar but different from Fouray or 4 Player Chess.  The biggest difference might be that traditonal 4 Player Chess has 96 open spaces in the initial setup while Forchess only has 4 open spaces.

There are two version to this game.

1.  Standard Forchess has fixed alliances
2.  Cutthroat Forchess focuses on fluid alliances

In this game, four traditional chess sets are placed on the smaller and traditional 8 by 8 board with one pawn removed from each player's side, meaning that conflict occurs quickly due to a lack of available space.  In this version, the pawns move forward diagonally and capture forward vertically and forward horizontally, but they can never move more than one square at a time and thus there is no en passant capture technique in this game.  Castling does not exist in Forchess.  It is suggested that kings should be captured like other pieces, although opponents should still say check when putting a king in jeopardy.  Furthermore, a player cannot place a teammate in check.  If a player cannot move any of his pieces, he must remove one piece from the board per turn until he can move a piece.  If a player captures a king, he may then use all of the removed player's pieces!

title: Bible Rummy
description:
(From the back of the box)

Bible Rummy
Jumbo Card Game

Now families with young children can enjoy this popular game with a spiritual bonus.

     12 beautifully illustrated stories from the Bible
     Jumbo-size cards are easy for little hands to hold and organize
     No reading required
     Set contains




48 brightly colored story cards.
   1 instruction card with Bible story references
   1 Faith Parenting card

title: Snakes Alive!
description:
This game is best played in a largish area with the competitors sitting in a circle on the floor.  A plastic basket containing a coiled 'snake' is placed in the center of the players.  The 'snake' consists of a large, material-covered spring with a plastic head on one end.  The basket has a number of holes, one of which will activate the latch on the basket and release the snake.

Players select a colored Swami  place it in position at the base of the basket closest to them.  During the game, players are not permitted to move their hands away from their Swami unless it is their turn or their name is called during play.

Players start the game with 5 snake tokens each.  A turn consists of paying a token into the 'snake pit', calling out an opponent's name and pressing a hole in the basket.

If nothing happens, the player can elect to continue their turn for as long as they want, rotating the basket, pressing successive holes  calling out an opponent's name each time, paying a snake token into the snake pit before each press.  Whenever a player manages to get rid of all their snake tokens, they take a ruby from the 'treasure trove' and a fresh set of 5 snake tokens from the snake pit.  A player may end their turn at any time without having released the snake.

If the snake is released, the relevant opponent must catch the snake or they are penalized - they must return one ruby to the treasure trove or take 5 snake tokens from the snake pit if they have no rubies.

If the snake is successfully caught, the caller must give the opponent one of their own rubies.  If no ruby is owned, the opponent gives the caller all the snake tokens they currently hold and - since they now have no more snake tokens - they take a ruby from the 'treasure trove' and a fresh set of 5 snake tokens from the snake pit.

Any player who erroneously attempts to catch the snake or otherwise removes their hands from their Swami at an unauthorized time during play is penalized.  They receive a snake token from each of their opponents.

The first player with 5 rubies is the winner.

title: Family Choices Proverbs Edition
description:
(From the publisher's website - http://www.faithkids.com)

Family Choices Board Game - Proverbs Edition
Applying the Biblical Wisdom of Solomon to Everyday Situations
ISBN/SPCN: 9834503369      Item #: 101588
Size: 14 X 6.5 X 2

Families! Play this game together and know where you are spiritually!

* Anne Marie has a great singing voice, but another girl got picked for a solo part at church. Anne Marie got angry and wanted to stop going to church. What would you say to her?
    * Dad says no tattoos, but how would he ever know unless Megan shows him? Shouldn't she be able to make her own decisions? It's her body, isn't it?
    * Mom found out her friend at work was going to be let go, but she told her boss she wouldn't tell. Should she keep her promise to her boss or should she be loyal to her friend and let her know?

Making the right choices in life can be tough. But with the help of Family Choices: Proverbs Edition, learning to make the best decisions becomes exciting entertainment!

Make Family Choices part of your Family Night fun, and get ready to come face-to-face with some of life's toughest real-life issues--issues we all face in today's world. Learn how real heroes of the faith, such as Solomon and his descendants, got wisdom for living by following God's laws. Now you can follow their example by talking about and learning eighteen Proverbs from the popular NIV translation of the Bible. Designed to be played by all the members of a family--from the youngest to the oldest--Family Choices: Proverbs Edition will become a favorite family activity. Included are a colorful game board, six player markers, 150 situation cards, 6 principle cards, and an instruction/reference booklet.

title: Snookcard
description: A card game based on the table snooker ball game.  Each player starts with seven card(ball)s.  The top cardball from the deck is turned over and becomes the 'option cardball'.  A player then takes either the option cardball or the top card from the deck and then places a card on top of the option cardball.  A player may then make a break.  A minimum break consists of a white cardball, a red cardball and a colored card ball (following the rules of snooker).  As the red cards are played they are placed in the pockets in the snookard box.  Later the colored balls will also be played into these pockets.  A player replenishes back to seven cards.  A scoreboard is also provided.  The winner of the frame is the player with the highest number of points when the final black is potted.  There are also special cards: miscue, snooker, foul, safety shot and free ball.

title: Dobývání hradu
description: Magnificent Czech game about two armies . Each army wants to destroy the others' castle.

title: Billion Dollar Bustout
description:
This is a gambling game developed and produced by Rick R. Windedahl. He states in the acknowledgment that he developed the game in 1977 for personal home play and that after 5 years of private play he was urged to get a copyright and publish the game.

The object it to become a Billionaire. Each player starts with 300 million dollars and the game continues until only one player is left with money or one player accumulates 1 billion dollars in assets.

The game comes with 300 chips, 16 casino tiles, 6 tokens, 5 dice, 4 betting strips, a gameboard, a slots deck, a regular deck a spinner and the rule book.

Players roll either 1 or 2 dice (their choice) and then move around the board and either play the gambling game of the casino that they land on for small profits against the bank or buy the casino (casinos are grouped, sort of like Monopoly squares, by the same color) and then own and become the bank for that particular casino making the payoffs for others who gamble in that particular casino. The games of chance in the game are SLOTS, WHEEL, DICE, BLACKJACK, ACEY-DUCEY and various forms of POKER. (There is an explanation on how to play any of the games included in the rule book..

Acquiring a set of the same colored casinos allows one to get a bonus by selling them back to the bank for double the buying price.

Sometimes the wording of the rules shows perhaps a lack of proper English and so are not as clear as they could be.

title: Guerra Civil Española: Expansión no oficial para The Rise of the Luftwaffe
types: Aviation / Flight Card Game Civil War Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Alea Magazine n22.

Add-on to play Spanish Civil War campaign using the Rise of the Luftwaffe rules published by GMT.

The magazine includes also:

     one new scenario, errata and additional rules for Triumphant Fox (MIH)
     scenarios and additional counters (unmounted) for the games 3rd Fleet and 5th Fleet (AH)
     seven new scenarios for Machiavelli (AH). 




Expands:

    Rise of the Luftwaffe
    Triumphant Fox
    3rd Fleet
    5th Fleet
    Machiavelli

title: Die Steinmauer (Fan Expansion for Carcassonne: Die Jäger und Sammler)
types: Expansion for Base-game Fan Expansion Prehistoric Print & Play
description:
Carcassonne: Die Steinmauer (The Stone Wall) is an unofficial expansion to Carcassonne: Hunters and Gatherers, created by JeuxParJe and is part of the Carcassonne series.  It is available as a free download.  The stone wall replaces the start tile and spans 12 tiles, as Carcassonne: The River does for Carcassonne.  Since the tiles have no beginning or end, they may be played in any order, simply extending the wall.

Carcassonne: Die Steinmauer includes rules for Stone Wall  Scout, a variant of the Carcassonne: King & Scout expansion.

title: Rustlers
description:
A strategy game where one person takes the roll of the Cowboys (along with their cows) and the other takes the roll of the Rustlers (along with their horses).

The players take turns rolling the die and moving a piece, within the grid on the board, attempting to steal your opponents livestock or attempting to throw your opponents cowboys/rustlers in prison.

The first player to capture their opponents 11 cows/horses or 3 cowboys/rustlers wins.

title: Whistler Challenge
description:
Be the first player to complete a day trip to Whistler (in B.C. Canada).

-Drive the awesome route from Horseshoe Bay to Whistler Village

-Ski three challenging runs on the mountains

-Then return to Horseshoe Bay

Box Contains:
1 Gameboard
1 Die
6 Pawns
20 miss turn tokens
18 Ski run medals
11 Chance cards
11 Apres ski cards
6 First aid cards

title: Batman: The Robin Climbing Game
types: Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
All players start on the street. The youngest player spins first and moves his/her playing piece the number shown on the spinner. Play continues with the next player on the left.

Players can move from side to side along ledges, and they can move up using fire escape ladders, windows, or Batropes.

The first player to climb from the street to the top of the building and saves Robin wins.

title: Batman: The Chase Through Gotham City
description:
The eerie quietness of Gotham City has been shattered by the sound of the prison alarm. The Chase Through Gotham City has begun!

With the forces of good and evil racing to the hideout - who will win? Will one of the villains get to the hideout and go free or will one of the heroes get to the hideout first and block the entrance?

This game features glow in the dark game board, pieces, and spinner.

title: All-Star Face-Off
description:
Face-Off was designed to provide fine family entertainment for children and adults in conjunction with promoting their awareness of hockey. This game offers sociable, stimulating, exciting, competitive action. -From Instruction

Players roll the dice and move around the board attempting to land on the Goal spaces while trying to stay out of the Penalty Box.

The first player to score 5 goals is declared the winner.

title: Kaleidomaze
description:
From Box:

Kaleidomaze is a simple to play board game in a new dimension, which offers you the most unique experience of zigzagging through a maze - AN EVER CHANGING MAZE!

The object is to score from your opponents by taking over their BASEs and trapping their SUBJECT tokens in the maze with your STRESSOR peg. It sounds easy! But remember that your opponents are also trying their best to do the same - taking over your base and trapping you in the maze. Under these competitive conditions, the players manipulate the existing maze into a dynamic ever changing maze, that is KALEIDOMAZE.

As in life, very often you than CHANCEs (cards) for better or worse; and occasionally save one or two CREDITs (cards) to be used under certain adverse situations. Sometimes you may encounter such a dilemma of being trapped by your competitors; but fortunately many times you are able to develop intricate strategies and tactical moves to revert the embarrassment. Very often, your goal appears so close and yet it suddenly becomes so far. Many times, it appears so unlikely and yet it suddenly becomes so easy. This is KALEIDOMAZE.

You need strategy, judgment and luck to win the game. The rules are simple, and the skillfully designed gameboard and playing pieces allow you a wide choice of moves. This puzzling maze, being manipulated by you and your opponents, many times is very rewarding, but can also become a frustrating and aggravating challenge.

title: Empire Mania: The Hockey Conquest
description:
Each player starts the game with millions of Empire Mania dollars; and then proceeds to collect assets by purchasing teams and free agents, collecting bonuses, winning points for the League Standings, and staying clear of the Penalty Box Squares. As well, you can trade Teams and Free Agents - a strategy that can make you a bundle, or cost you a fortune.

Imagine the thrill of buying your favorite teams of the NHL, combined with the excitement of developing your own strategies to win the game. The player who has the greatest financial empire at the end of the game wins!

(This game was an Official Licensed Product of the NHL)

title: Hornet Leader II: Carrier Air Group
types: Aviation / Flight Card Game Expansion for Base-game Modern Warfare Print & Play Wargame
description:
Included will be: F-14s, A-6s, EA-6B, E-2C, FA-18Es, Phoenix Missiles, 2 new Campaigns (North Atlantic 1986, and Taiwan 2008). Also included will be cards for 2 more skill levels for each of the 18 original HLII pilots.

Other Leader series games by Dan Verssen

Expands

    Hornet Leader II

title: Criss Cross
description:
Opponents roll balls down one of two tracks on the plastic gameboard, depending on whether they are the 'offense' or 'defense' for that particular play.  One track is straight; the other meanders in progressively diminishing arcs.  There are catching depressions where the tracks intersect, each worth a different score if the meandering balls are knocked off the track by the defense.  Two balls are launched down the meandering track; the defender is allotted four balls to prevent these from reaching their intended destination.

A default 15 points are awarded to the offense for each ball that successfully reaches the end of the meandering track.  Points are scored by the defending player for each ball of the offense that FAILS to reach the end of its path, according to the amount on the depression that the ball rests in.

After each play opponents swap roles.

The first player to accumulate 300 points is the winner.

title: Nickelodeon Clarissa Explains It All Game
description:
Based on the quirky Nickelodeon situation comedy Clarissa Explains it all, this game captures much of the angst and annoyances of the lead character Clarissa.
Players answer questions picking from five predetermined answers and creating one of their own. Each of the predetermined answers garners a certain amount of spaces to be moved based on the answers popularity in a survey of Clarissa's friends. If any players match their made-up answers each player collects one of twelve keys in six colors from the center or another player. Moving takes place simultaneously with each player preforming the action on the space they land on.
Certain spaces lead to Crisis cards, which can be countered with collected Rescue cards. Others allow players to attempt to win a Driver's License by picking three numbers and attempting to roll one of them on a die. Still other spaces just allow you to hang out or go get a snack.
If a player makes it around the whole board with at least one key and a Driver's License they choose one of six Car Cards and try to match the color of one of their keys. First player to match a car and a key wins.

title: Company
description: Company, play the principles is a board game issued by Siemens probably to educate their personnel about corporate values. Players have to move through the 5 values (People, Innovation, Value, Responsibility, Customers) to reach the goal. In each player's turn the movement is driven by dice for the player and a whirling arrow for all the players together.

title: Fridolin Fuchs
description:
There is unrest on the farm! Fridolin Fox is on the prowl. All animals run and hide in the bushes. Save the animals by bringing them into the safety of the stable. Who will save the most animals before the fox finds them?

There are 7 tiles with bushes placed on the table. Upon these bushes there are placed six sound devices. So one bush isn't occupied. When a player pushes on the devices it makes the sound of an animal. (dog, cat, duck, frog, rooster, pig). Then the 30 cards are shuffled and placed, face down, around the bushes.

In a players turn, the player turns around a card and must find the correct animal sound. When the player has turned on a device, the device is moved to the empty bush. If the sound and the card are matching, the player keeps the card and plays again.
If Fridolin Fox is the turn end. The player places the fox on the foxholes. The game ends when all six the foxes are found.

The player with the most cards wins the game.

title: Numaro
description:
From manufacturer's website:
With Numaro, the answer to every question is an amazing numerical fact, which allows every player to guess on each question. The player with the guess closest to the actual answer wins the round. For example, how many episodes of the TV show, The Cosby Show, was produced? (Answer: 204) .

title: Bratz Babyz Stylin' Scavenger Hunt
description: The Bratz Babyz have left their stuff all over town. The players travel around the board gathering their baby's items. The first player to collect and deliver seven of their nine items is the winner.  Management of action cards (each allows the baby to move in some fashion and then to take an action on the board) makes this game far more interesting than most aimed at the same target audience.

title: Freddy Vs Jason Killer Trivia Game
types: Horror Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
description:
The bloodbath continues, but now its your turn to slay. Jason Voorhees and Freddy Krueger, the most iconic cinematic serial killers of our time, have nothing on you. Recount your knowledge of all ten Friday the 13th films, seven A Nightmare on Elm Street films, and the only Freddy vs. Jason film in an effort to collect corpses and accumulate enough bodies to win.

Choose to play a Friday the 13th trivia game with 500 questions, testing your brainpower on 2 decades of atrocious homicides. Or play an A Nightmare on Elm Street trivia game with 500 questions to keep you wide-awake through Freddys dreamy killing spree. And if you have enough time for a double homicide, play a combo game for twice the scare.

With over 1,000 questions, a custom die, and coroners reports that challenge you to recount the gruesome ways that Freddy and Jason slaughtered their victims, this trivia game is sure to provide frightening fun for all horror film fans.

Ages 17 and up 2+ players

title: Sword & Spear
description:
Sword  Spear - Individual Man-to-Man Combat in Ancient and Medieval Times

Sword  Spear is a set of wargame rules for small skirmishes in the millennium before effective gunpowder weapons. Each player commands a small detachment (two to ten figures) in a battle of close-range missile and hand-to-hand combat. Although most attractive when played with metal or plastic painted figures mounted on stands, various substitutes or just the stands can be used instead. Includes section for mythological gaming.

24-page rulebook, including tables, for miniatures game.

title: Phantasia in Kinderhand
description: In a similar game to his Barbarossa, this Klaus Teuber game has players molding clay with the attempt to make figures that are just hard enough not to guess immediately, but not so hard as not to be guessed.

title: Les 7 Royaumes Combattants
description:
From the box :

The 7 fighting kingdoms is a strategy and diplomacy game, taking place in the antique China.
Each player is leading a kingdom; his aim : Unify China, and by all means, war or negotiation, money or betrayal, because in order to be the China master, you must be a great general as well as a fine politician.

Including :
800 counters
1 color map
7 game charts
1 rules booklet
Rules for 2 to 7 players
Complexity : 7/10

title: Corduroy's Birthday Games
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Party Game
description:
Synopsis:

Ten activity games that can be played inside or outside the house.  Truly a party in a box.  Find the red triangle, then the blue party hat, then the square birthday cake.  The last one there will be too late.  This is your invitation to FUN, FUN, FUN.

The game pieces are incredibly durable and the pictures are cute! If you are familiar with the storybook character, Corduroy, than you know the cute bear sketch that I am referencing. In addition to the bears, there are party hats, cakes and presents. The floor tiles assist toward shape and color recognition. I enjoy observing which/how many children count the candles on the cake(s) (there are five). And because there is a connection, via the character, to books... it is my belief that this game inspires reading...this set is best suited, for day care, preschool or kindergarten aged children.  It would be great in the classroom; especially with the storybook, as a compliment.

Out of the 10 activity games 3 are non-competitive while the other 7 are competitive in which case the winner receives prize tokens.

title: Looping
description:
LOOPING is a simple card game with the theme of aerobatics.  Each card represents the side view of an aircraft completing a maneuver - climbing, diving, looping or some other similar action.

The start card shows an aircraft taking off and to this players add further cards in a sequence with the smoke trails on the cards indicating where two cards can be connected together.  The card also indicates the difficulty of the stunt - and the points gained if the maneuver is successfully completed.

Then idea of the game is to attempt to add cards allowing the aircraft to gain and lose altitude undertaking a variety of tricks on the way.  Whether the trick is achieved or not is determined by a die roll (throwing higher than a given number shown on some of the cards). Points are earned for a successfully completed maneuver. If you fail any part of the sequence then you score nothing.

The game ends when the aircraft is brought in to land, through the laying of the appropriate card, at a level at the same altitude from which it took off.  The winner is the player who scored the most points during the flight.

The game has three variants OVER THE CLOUDS (3-5 players)  DARE-DEVILS (2-4 players) and SKY-RIDER (3-6 players)which, though broadly similar, do make the game suitable for differing numbers of players.

title: Kong: Skull Island Game
description: Features two game boards! Start out on Skull Island and try to be the first player to find King Kong. Then take a ship to New York City and get past the military planes to the skyscraper. Save Kong and win! Features 3-D game board and parts. For 2 to 4 players.

title: Arsouf 1191
description: A simple wargame on the battle of Arsouf (1191) between Richard the Lionheart and Saladin. This game is quite similar to Bouvines 1214 of the same publisher. It includes some nice chrome such as the Naffatums. The game materials are entirely in French.

title: Lako's School Days Game
description:
Lako's School Days Game is an education board game for children ages 4 and up. During game play, players draw cards with pictures such as red pizza, blue mittens or yellow giraffes and then attempt to classify the pictures into color, number and object categories. In a turn, a player may count grapes or socks, match blues or reds, and group donuts with food or squirrels with animals. Success moves Lako along the game boards sidewalk path and the winner is the first to get Lako to the red schoolhouse.

Along the way, children land on Lako spaces which award school activity cards such as Lako doing homework at his desk, or Lako showing his name tag in show  tell. These cards educate kids about school activities and create a positive attitude toward them by rewarding children with advances on the board.

title: Submission
description:
From the publisher's website:
Submission was developed for the true wrestling fan, by true wrestling fans. Whether you watch wrestling on television, or attend local wrestling events, this game will test your wrestling knowledge to the fullest in a fun and creative way. With 7 intense modes of gameplay, over 100 unique categories, the INSANITY of the Tap Out Deck, and Mini-Games that really mix things up, you and your friends can battle it out for hours, until one person is crowned the Submission Champion!

title: Caymanopoly
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description: This is the Cayman Island themed version of Monopoly. Community Chest has been renamed to Pirate's Chest and many properties have been renamed based on sponsors. A 2005 revamp was released to raise money for the Cayman Islands' Junior Achievement program.

title: NFL Team Trivia Blitz
description: This was an official NFL release.  It is not related (directly) to Trivial Pursuit.  Players answer trivia questions about the NFL.  Of course, records post-1992 will not be here, so don't answer Barry Sanders or Emmitt Smith.

title: Luck of Life
description: A children's game where you spin a dial to collect wages or other life experiences.  Players try to move from the lower class to the middle class to the upper class.  Winner is the first to reach a million dollars.

title: Calculink
description:
From the publisher's website:
Calculink is an adventurous math game that enhances your mental arithmetic as you link numbers to reach certain totals. Points are scored on each play and extra for bravery, while strategy is used to avoid traps and to block your opponents. You learn to master several math skills through the popular Calcutest cards, which offer fun-filled exercises on a range of school-based topics. And if you are a lucky, you just might pull the right Cue Card to give you that edge on your opponents.

title: Bouquet
description: Trivia game about wines. Choose to play as an amateur, professional or connoisseur. Roll the dice, move your cork and attempt to answer from 900 questions in six categories, Grapes, Region, Estate/Producer, Spirits, Fortified Wines and Vocabulary.

title: Monopoly: Desi
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description:
Monopoly Desi is the Indianised version of regular Monopoly. Players get to travel from Broadway in Southall, to the citys Nehru Centre, stopping en route at Kiribati - all places associated with the Asian community in the UK.

Cutting a wider migratory map, the other important halts in the games four main travel squares include several Indian destinations such as New Delhi Station, Shivaji Chattrapati Station in Mumbai, Chennais Central Station and the Howrah station in Kolkata. Some of these zones even carry adverts on the expatriate tribe, Pataks curry pastes, Asian NGOs and, even one for an Indian cable TV.

title: Isonzo
description:
ISONZO is a division level strategic game of the Bainsizza Italian offensive and the Caporetto counteroffensive on the Italian front in the 1917.
The game has 1 map, 332 counters, tables and rules

title: Tumbling Down
description:
Tumbling Down is an abstract-strategy game played on a checker board with 58 pieces in two colors.

Gameplay involves moving stacks of pieces by tumbling them in one direction. Tumbled stacks leave one piece of the stack on top of anything on a square for each square it travels in that direction. The object is to capture your opponent's largest stack.

Online Play

     boardspace.net realtime against live opponents or robots
     Richard's Play-By-eMail Server (PBEM)

title: Romantic Rendezvous
description:
Two games of love, intimacy and adventure. This game provides any couple from 18 on up, married, dating or living together, an atmosphere of fun while experiencing a romantic, intimate, pleasurable time together. Romantic Rendezvous extends the relationships foundation so a couple can grow closer, laugh and delve into the joys and delights of being together.

The board game offers over 120 different activities that are detailed on a beautifully designed board. During the game, you and your partner will have the opportunity to experience intimate sharing; romantic, loving, and playful activities; meaningful and informative communication; wishing, hugging, kissing and touching. The board game also provides bonuses and interesting twists that can add plenty of excitement!

The card game is a game of self-expression and communication, giving and receiving and will add some spice to your love life. The game consists of 54 Romance Cards that contain fun, playfully adventurous and intimate activities for you and your partner.

Playing the two games together adds an exciting dimension and creates the Romantic Rendezvous Experience. However, neither game is dependent on the other.

Playing is easy and both players WIN at every turn!

title: Zagami
description:
Zagami is a game of Martian microbial life for four players.  It requires a standard chessboard and a set of Icehouse Pieces.

Each player controls a single-colored colony of microbes, which moves and expands across the small meteorite in search of food. Multicolored stacks begin to form - microbes eating microbes eating microbes. As the game progresses, each colony evolves enzymes which allow it to metabolize other microbes into energy to be used for growing, sporing, attacking, and escaping. Only one colony will survive the long journey from Mars to Earth. Will it be yours?

title: Balancing Act Challenge
description: Balancing Act Challenge is based on the Canadian government's Canada's Food Guide To Healthy Eating, which organizes nutritional needs into four food groups: grain products, milk products, vegetables  fruit, and meat  meat alternatives. The object of the game is to be the first player to collect the required number of each food group's Serving Cards. There are challenge squares that would allow players to challenge each other for food-serving cards. If a player lands on the Canadian flag, they may move anywhere on the board.

title: Curtatone Montanara
description:
This is a game about 2 battles (Curtatone e Montanara and Goito) of the initial periods of the Prima guerra d'Indipendenza in the Italian Risorgimento.

Each battle has a map and a set of counters.

title: Two Armies
description:
This electronically refereed game is the best and closest game-board realization of the battlefield tactics from the Chinese military strategist Sun Zi (500 B.C.) in his celebrated work The Art of War:

Warfare is the way of deception. Therefore, if able, appear unable; if active, appear not active; if near, appear far; if far, appear near. If they have advantage, entice them; if they are confused, take them; if they are substantial, prepare for them; if they are strong, avoid them; if they are angry, disturb them, if they are humble, make them haughty; if they are relaxed, toil them; if they are united, separate them. Attack where they are not prepared, go out to where they do not expect.

Each player commands a troop of 25 game pieces: 1 Flag, 1 Army, 1 Corps, 2 Divisions, 2 Brigades, 2 Regiments, 2 Battalions, 3 Companies, 3 Platoons, 3 Engineers, 3 Mines, and 2 Bombs. To win a game, one must either capture the Flag piece or defeat all the movable pieces of the opponent player. When two opposing game pieces are engaged in a battle, the identities of the two pieces are only revealed to the electronic referee system (not to the players) which determines the winning piece and the defeated piece. The battlefield consists of railway tracks along which the pieces can move continuously, country-road routes along which the pieces cannot move continuously, and bases which provide shelters to any pieces occupying them. On each side, the Flag piece is to be secretly placed in one of the two castle-shaped headquarters and guarded by movable troop pieces and unmovable Mines. Lively military figures, numeric numbers, and words in both English and Chinese are shown on the game pieces.

title: Cheesy Parcheesy
description: This is a new version of Parcheesi with a cat and mouse theme. Players race to get their four mice pieces around the board, up their secret passage, and onto the Cheese Feast space in the middle of the board. Like normal Parcheesi you may bump other players back and form blockades. You can also land on Cat spaces that send your mice back, and draw Cheese cards that help move them forward. The first player to get all four mice to the Cheese feast wins.

title: Oxford: the Great Oxford Game of the English Language
description:
The object of the game is to move from the center of the spiral on the board to the final square of the outer circuit. Along the way, three small Oxford 'dictionaries' are collected. These are obtained by passing the special dictionary squares on the board or by winning a duel. The first player to cross the line with three dictionaries is the winner. To move forward, questions must be answered correctly. Players may choose questions from three levels easy, difficult or very difficult. Normally you can choose the level you want. Correct answers to more difficult questions make for faster progress. But beware: difficult usually means really difficult! The special squares on the board add extra excitement to the game.

This game is the same as Das grosse Dudenspiel and Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal, but in English.

title: Powerball
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveSimultaneous Action Selection
description: Powerball Das Spiel is played within a wooden frame that is assembled in two halves.  The playing surface or pitch slopes down from the middle to the two ends where the players stand.  In the center of the pitch is a small indentation.  A ping-pong (table tennis) type ball is placed in the indentation.  The players each have one or more wooden shoots under their control, which they use to launch ball bearings at the ping-pong ball.  In front of the shoots at each end is a bar or barrier.  This is suspended just above the playing surface so that there is sufficient room for the ball bearings to run underneath, but not the ping-pong ball.  In the center of the bar the gap is higher.  This is the goal area where the ping-pong ball can also run underneath.  The idea of the game is to launch the ball bearings at the ping-pong ball and direct the ping-pong ball into the opponent's goal.  Play can be to a specific number of  goals or for a particular time period, with one to three players on each team.

title: Don't Dump The Daisy
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Party Game
description:
This game is another in a line of square-box molded-plastic board releases favored by Ideal Toy Corp. during this period.  It incorporates several elements seen either alone or in combination in other action/dexterity games produced around this time - marbles, gravity, a spring.

Players start the game with ten marbles.  Marbles must be placed on a large, plastic centrally-located daisy, which has vague depressions on each 'petal' for the marbles to rest in.  The stem of the daisy is a strong spring.

There are 16 cards, all of which direct the holder to either 'put' or 'take' a given number of marbles from the daisy each turn.  Four are dealt to each player; a turn consists of playing a card  following the directions.  If either the placing or removal of marbles causes the daisy to tip over, the player causing the incident must take all the marbles that fall from the daisy.

When all four cards are used (i.e. when each player has had four turns) the pack is reshuffled and a fresh set of four cards is dealt to each player.  Play continues in this manner until a player is able to place their final marble on one of the daisy's petals without causing any to fall.

The player who achieves this is the winner of the game.

title: Thing Ding
description:
Players compete to be the first to successfully construct a complete 'thing' using the Thing Ding Machine.

Players make their robots from parts they pull from the conveyer belt on the Thing Ding machine. The robots include dad, mom, baby, and the pets dog, cat, and bird.

title: Adultery
description: Adultery is a game for the piecepack game system.  Players move their pawns around a ring of tiles (really a square) attempting to land on Home wreckers or other player's Spouses while avoiding their own Spouse.

title: Play On Words
description:
The Object of the game is to build high scoring words crossword fashion with as many cubes as possible before the timer runs out.  This is done by using higher value dice letters to form words which cross bonus squares.  The player who exercises the greatest skill and strategy will attain the highest score.

Plays like Scrabble, but each person takes their own turn having the board to themselves and see how much they can score before time runs out.  Then the board is clear an the other player gets his turn.

title: What Will You Think Of Next?
Raising Cattle
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description: Raising Cattle is a family game which shows you the obstacles that Ranchers and Farm families have to deal with on a daily basis. Roll the dice and move your way around the board. Watch out for the Cow Pies - they can be both good and bad. The first player to collect 12 Calf's wins the game, if you don't run out of Hay first.

title: Syncrohearts
description: Syncrohearts is a game designed to bring a couple closer together. Some spaces require the players to hug, kiss or massage each other. Players will go around the board once. There are also four categories of cards including Couple, 4-Fun, Hot Stuff and Insights. When a player lands on one of these categories, they select the top card and answer the questions or follow the directions. If they are not comfortable with the questions or directions then they can select another card or pass their turn. Players will typically both answer any card that asks a question.

title: Persona: O Jogo das Mutações
description: Bizarre party game from the 70's: Players turn the lights off,  take some candle and, then, look each other through the double sided mirrored glass, hence fusing the reflections shown on each side of the glass. The game develops around a kind  of flux of consciousness emanated from interaction between players and images. The author developed the first version of this game as a conceptual art installation first exhibited at the XII Art Biennal of So Paulo (1973).

title: Nokaute
description: Nokaute (variation of the Portuguese word nocaute, knock out) is a dice game that simulates a boxing match. Players throw a die and, with the help of two separate charts, distribute the punches over the body of the other player's boxer. This was, probably, the only game released by Mimo, a toy maker that folded in 1992.

title: Tango
description: From the rules: Tango - A game of men and women. Tango is a new game of revolutionary conception - to win, one must conquer your opponent  and, at the same time, let your opponent conquer you. Knowing how to give and to take pieces is fundamental in this game. A player who only captures pieces or who only loses pieces probably will not be the winner.

title: No Limite
description: Based on reality TV show No Limite (a kind of Survivor). Players are divided in two teams, trying to accomplish the tasks proposed.

title: Monopoly: Taiwan
description:
Typical regional Monopoly game.

Place names are specific to Taiwan.
For example:
Boardwalk - Mt. Taiping
Park Place - Taroko
Reading RR - Taipei Train Station

The 8 tokens are bronze colored and included in some of the Parker Brothers Anniversary Editions.  While these are not the standard Monopoly fare, there is nothing uniquely Taiwanese about them.

The board and all the cards are printed in English and traditional Chinese.  Prices and currency are all 10x standard Monopoly, too.  (10, 50, 100, 200, 500, 1000, 5000)

Each property on the board has a full-color picture of the actual locale and the board has a nice background in the center.

title: Antavlan
description: Each player takes the role as a genealogist and your mission is to identify as many relatives as possible in 10 different families. You compete with limited resources and can build on your opponents' success or use their unused resources. Whoever has the most points when the last subscription appears wins.

title: Jerusalem 1099
description:
The capture of Jerusalem during the First Crusade.
1 map (1 hex 40 m.), 222 counters, rules and table

title: Wavell's War
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
The first Grand Europa module, Wavell's War is a module that links Europa games Balkan Front and War in the Desert together with East Africa. Ownership of both Balkan Front and War in the Desert is required for a complete play of WW, covering 1940 to 1943.

It also updates Balkan Front and War in the Desert rules and counters to the latest Europa standards. It additionally provides previously published optional rules.


(from HMS/GRD website:)

The module provides 21 mapsheets covering all of East Africa and much of Sudan and the Arabian peninsula, 1 mapsheet overlay to Balkan Front, 3 countersheets of revised/new counters for Balkan Front and Italian East Africa, extensive play aids including eleven game charts and a scenarios and appendices book.

Includes 16 scenarios. 22 quarter-size maps, 3 countersheets (840 counters).

title: Deduction
description: A game of logic and elimination played with a standard piecepack.  Deduce the missing tile by asking the other players about what tiles they have hidden in their hands. The questions a player can ask are limited by the suit and number value on a drawn coin. Part of the game is inventing a effective way to record the information you have gained.  This game is very similar to Sleuth by Sid Sackson.

title: Viva Fidel
description: Solitaire Wargame of the Cuban Revolution - only a pencil and eraser needed. The player commands the guerrilla forces. He/she wins if the city of Bayamo becomes pro-guerrilla.

title: Ham-N-Ex
description:
Pass the pigs with ham and eggs instead of pigs!

Throw the 'dice' (2 eggs (sunny side up) and 8 pieces of ham) to get valuable combinations like 'ham on eggs' or br'egg'fast.

title: Triple Flips 7: Great Adventures
description:
Triple Flips 7 includes Jungle Explorer, Dangers of the Deep, and Abominable Snowman Hunt.


     Jungle Explorer is a roll-and-move game for 2-4 players, whose path becomes increasingly perilous as the pawns progress.



     Dangers of the Deep is a 1-player game of risks, in which you attempt to take your bathyscaphe to as great a depth as possible.  Each roll of the die has a 50% chance of increasing your risk.  A 4 increases the undersea current, a 5 increases the water pressure (nicely depicted by drawings of a progressively crushed bathyscaphe), and a 6 reduces your remaining oxygen.



     Abominable Snowman Hunt sets 2-4 players tracking the Abominable Snowman in an attempt to capture it.

title: Challenge Rummy
description:
The game is basically rummy with tiles.  Each person has their own separate discard pile which only the next player in line is able to take from.

Other than that, most standard rummy rules apply.

title: Sports Dice: Golf
description: Small travel Golf game.  3 standard dice plus a Special die on a table where players choose the club.

title: Colony: A Strategy Game
description:
Colony A Strategy Game is a strategic conflict and colony building game.  Small counters represent warships and townships, which are deployed on the main map.  Status sheets record the condition of the ships and status of the construction of the colony.
Colony building along with conflict takes place on the same turn, so decisions need to be made to balance advancing victory conditions versus elimination of opponent's assets.
The winner is the first to build an entire colony, which consists of nine CM's being built.

title: Ascent
description:
Ascent is a game about getting to the top! It is a game of mountain climbing. Through the play of cards you try an attempt to climb the mountain choosing a route which best suits the resources you have available to you. You may choose one of five routes to climb. Each has its only difficulties and requirements.

Through the use of card play you gradually climb the mountain choosing the best route available to you, surrendering cards as you climb. There is always the possibility of disaster as dictated by possible avalanches which can force you to start all over again from the base camp. The avalanche possibility is dictated by a nice system of die rolls. Roll 2D6, first is the route that is effected from 1 to 5, the second is the increase in avalanche likelihood. Each route has an avalanche dial on the board as the points amass on this dial the likelihood of an avalanche gets nearer. If the dial clicks around to the 12 position an avalanche occurs and it will knock climbers back to base camp who are caught on that route.

Interesting game of tension and resource management with a fair amount of luck thrown in. Nice looking board and cool mountain climbers. Some strategic play possibilities.

Components:

8 climbers
Equipment cards
Weather Protection cards
2d6

title: Le Balene
types: Card Game Humor Party Game Word Game
description: The Whales - Italian game issued for Greenpeace campaign against whales hunting. 108 double faced cards for a fun party game where players creates absurd but formally correct phrases to close their hand.

title: Eat It!
description: Heres a trivia game you can really sink your teeth into! Test your taste buds with fun trivia questions about the foods you love to eat, from Chocolate  Candy to Snacks  Desserts. What kind of animal is Cheetos mascot, Chester? How many fudge stripes are there on a Keebler Fudge Stripes Cookie  3, 5, 6, or 7? When Americans scream for ice cream, what is their favorite topping? The answers  A Cheetah, 5, and Chocolate Syrup! This fun and tasty trivia game redefines the food pyramid, with Snack Attack, Cookies, Ice Cream  Desserts, Candy and Chocolate categories occupying the spaces. Answer the questions correctly, make your way to the top of the Snacks  Sweets Pyramid, and youll be the Snacks  Sweets Trivia Superstar! Game comes with Eat It! Game Board, 1 Box of 400 Eat It! Question  Answer Cards, 1 Set of 35 Eat It! Pyramid Cards, 1 Die, 6 Game Pieces, and Game Instructions. For 2  6 Players, Ages 13 and Up.

title: Sports Dice: Baseball
description: Travel Baseball game - 5 defensive dice (defensive men), 2 red offensive dice, 3 pawns as runners.

title: The Great Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade Game
description:
Illustrator Gerry Olin Greengrass loved a parade so much she decided to create a board game to hold onto the feeling year-round. Game enthusiasts now get to join in the fun with the release of The Great Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade Game. As in the annual Macy's march down Broadway, Santa Claus takes center stage. The player (two to four can compete) whose Santa travels the entire parade route and enters the Herald Square store first wins. Depending on the roll of the dice  and the float or balloon square landed on  game pieces move forward or loss ground. Surprise cards keep the action going.

Greengrass enjoys playing the game with her 4-year-old grandson, but says she'll be out on the real parade route again this holiday.

title: The Amazing Chan and the Chan Clan Game
types: Children's Game Deduction Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
1973 Hanna-Barbera Productions, Inc.

OBJECT:
To be the first player to bring Charlie the missing clue that correctly matches the clue space on which Charlie is standing.

title: Can-Doo
description:
PREPARATION:
Stack the cans in a pyramid.  Shuffle all cards and place the deck face down, in easy reach of all players.

THE PLAY:
A player is chosen to be first.  He takes a card from the card deck and now attempts to remove the matching can from the stack.  He keeps the can and the card and the next player goes.

FALLING CANS:
If on a player's turn only one can drops from the stack, his turn is over and he must return the fallen can to the stack and the card to the bottom of the card deck. He scores no points for that round.  If more than one can drops from the stack, the game is over and the player who upsets the stack scores no points for that round.

WINNING THE GAME:
Each player counts the total point score of his cards.  Highest point score wins the game.

title: Byzantine Chess
description:
An ancient chess variant which uses a 16 X 4 circular board.  Piece movement is the same except that Queen moves only one space diagonally and Bishop moves two diagonally, jumping the first space.  Additionally, two pawns blocking one another's paths may be removed (both are removed).

A modern variant by David Reynolds using the same board is known as Circular Chess.

title: Courier Chess
description: A popular chess variant with a 12 X 8 board.  Pieces are arrayed in four columns.  New pieces are added including a Counselor and Spy.  Couriers and Bishops are similar but move slightly differently.  The Queen starts in an open position in front of most pawns.

title: Patron-ow
description: Players take turns playing 'Russian Roulette'. Beginning of the players turn one out of 7 bullets is 'loaded'. Player rolls a die and can take any number of bullets (one after the other...) until he stops or draws the loaded one. He receives points equal to the number of bullets times the die roll - of course these are negative when he drew the loaded one.

title: Tryline
description:
Tryline is a head to head Rugby Union simulation. 
It consists of Fast Action Cards, Team Cards, a color coded pitch made up of squares and a blue and red reversible counter that changes color once possession changes.

The FAC's control the Kicking, Passing, Running, Rucks, Mauls, Scrums and Lineouts etc. These are turned over by players depending on the previous FAC command or on the strategic placing of a Team Card.
The Team Cards have 2 functions only one of which can be used when it is played. The first function called the Territory Part uses a move value attached to Kicking, Passing and Running etc. which are implemented when the player has been allowed to on the FAC. The second function is the Action part which can be used to counter play determined by FAC's or indeed by the placing of other Team Cards.

Tries are awarded when the counter lands on the Tryline by means of Running, Passing and Tap Penalties. If Kicks, Mauls and Scrums move the counter onto the Tryline then players turn a FAC to see what the outcome is on the Grounded Ball section.

At an advanced level, once players become used to the basic game, Tryline offers you the opportunity to introduce Substitution Cards and a Yellow Card system.

title: Mesopotamia
description:
Crawl into the skin of a Mesoptamian ruler during the age of the great Hammurabi of Babylon. Relive how kings managed to secure their power and gain the respect of their tribes. The construction of temples and canals, agricultural development and military victories can all spread your fame and secure your rule. Make constant decisions on how best to govern your land: rely on the rule of law and the gentle persuading powers of the Ishtar priestesses and strife for a blossoming agricultural system, or turn to the fanaticism of the Marduk priests and the battle strength of their troops. However you choose to exert your rule - you can only win the game if your rule is so successful that your fame, in the eyes of your subjects, has acquired a god-like status, making you the undisputed ruler of Mesopotamia.

This is the first game from Hilmar Mhlmann and has undergone several years of development. Its final version was made available to the gaming community through his website and ebay. Having acquired a copy it is obvious that this is a labor of love. The design of board and cards is beautiful - the rules are well tested, clearly presented and relatively short for such a ambitious game. Ongoing support for players is in place through website updates and direct communication. And having just acquired my copy, I wonder if the price asked actually covers the materials provided. An impressive entry for this budding designer and a one to seek out for players who enjoy games like Settlers of Catan but yearn for something a bit meatier and with a stronger theme. With an Arthurian themed game in the pipeline, this one-man act might be an interesting one to follow.

The aim of the game is to have the most military units and construction works of your color on the board. This can be done over 2 to 5 rounds. Resources can be acquired through natural growth, trade and military conquests. Trade takes place along caravan routes. Players can trade freely with their trading partner, pay toll to players whose territory is crossed en-route, or exchange resources against a set course with the bank. These resources can then be used to generate new buildings or units. Each turn a player can use an influence card, adding flavor and variety without unbalancing strategic play. A nice twist is that players who allow toll-free trading between other players if the caravan route passes their territory see a generous windfall from the opening of this trade route in the next round, when some resources are added to the storage in that province. Each year round ends with construction and military campaigns. Conflicts are settled by dice rolls which are modified by markers on the board.

This game appeared in 2 versions:

The self-published 2D version (quality is at the very high end of desktop publishing).
Some assembly is required, mainly joining the 8 pages that from the superbly produced full colour game board. In total you get 39 multicolour A4 sheets, including several photo-quality prints, six pages of clear and well presented rules, and lots of event cards, markers and game aids.

The wooden case with the handmade 3D version of the game board is fit for a king, and for those with a rather large game budget.

title: Fortress Chess
description: An ancient four player chess variant from Russia.  The board contains four 4 X 4 blocks out the outer corners of a 12 X 12 board.  These spaces make for good defense in a four player chess assault.

title: Commando Chess
types: Abstract Strategy Fighting Modern Warfare Wargame
description:
A chess variant using pieces based off of modern military units. There are seven types of pieces: infantry, calvary tanks, armor tanks, fighter planes, attack helicopters, bomber squadrons and a HQ Flag acting as the king.
The pieces have different movements from the standard chess game. The number of pieces is the same, 16 on each side, and the board is a standard 8x8. However, in living up to its name the game board has a camouflage background.
The ground units move and capture similar to chess pieces, but the three air unit types may jump over other pieces like the knights in chess. The bomber is a partial exception to this rule, it can only jump over pieces on its own side.

title: Outburst: Travel Edition
description:
Now experience Outburst! fun anywhere you go!  Outburst Travel Edition offers all the original uproarious game play in a handy take-along design.

Just as in the original Outburst! games, teams have 60 seconds to yell out answers that fit familiar categories.  Teams may shout out as many answers as possible, but only the 10 answers that appear on the Topic Card will score points.

This pocket-size versions includes a 60-second Timer, Viewer/Card Holder containing 160 Common-Knowledge Topics, Scoreboard and Market.

Outburst Travel Edition is as easy as it is fun.  Try it - Can you name 10 Annoying Things That Other Drivers Do?  You have one minute, go!

title: SuDoKu Mania
description:
Sudoku is played on a grid divided into 9 large squares (3x3), with each square made up of 9 cells (3x) for a total of 81 cells.

The objects of Sudoku is to fill in a (9x9) grid in such way that every row, column and (3x3) square contain each number from 1 to 9 once, and only once.

In this game, the rules book show about 150 grids and their solutions.

45 Easy grids 
45 Intermediate grids
45 Difficult grids
15 Evil grids

Like you'll see in the game material, you game play with the tiles or by writing directly on the board.

Game material :

1 dry-erase game board
90 number tiles 
1 black dry-erase marker
1 red dry-erase marker
1 game rules and grids booklet

This game can be played alone or in group.

title: Convoy
types: Card Game Nautical World War II
description:
Players take it in turns to run convoys of ships in partnerships. Two players are chosen by spinning the compass card to create a convoy. They become players 'North' and 'South'. All other players act individually to try and stop them.

A convoy is a running sequence of 4 'Merchantmen' cards and the 'Home' card. The merchantmen are numbered from 1-6 so there are 3 ways of making a convoy. The convoy has to be in North's hands to score, so North and South work together to realign their cards. When they have a convoy North calls 'Convoy' and the round ends.

Any other player (not North) can halt a round by declaring their hand when they have collected certain configurations. Other cards
include 'torpedoes', 'mines', 'cruisers', 'destroyers' and 'submarines'.

After adding up the points the winner is the first to 1000 points.

title: Black Quest
description: Black Quest is a game designed to educate the player in the history of African-Americans.  The game consists of a deck of question cards, a deck of bonus cards, a die, a tumbler, and a score pad.  A turn consists of a players rolling the die, then answering the question from a question card corresponding to the number on the die.  A roll of 6 allows the player to answer a question from the Bonus deck.  The turn continues until a question is answered incorrectly.  Each correct answer is awarded 5 points, while bonus questions are worth 10 points.  The first player to reach 250 points wins.

title: Locarno: Europe 1926
description:
Locarno - Europe 1926 seeks to portray the restored Concert of European Powers following the Treaty of Locarno, Oct. 1925. Players assume the role of European statesmen seeking to  outclass their geopolitical rivals and attain a position of predominance.

The game is based upon Allan B. Calhamer's classic Diplomacy. However, its treatment of minor powers is strikingly different as these have their own military units. Players secretly bid influence points in order to obtain the support of these lesser powers.

Re-implemented by:

    The Road to War: Europe 1936

title: Il Ribaltone
description:
Il Ribaltone is a game on Italian politics. It focuses players' attention to the intrigues and machinations that made the Italian governments so weak during the First Republic.
Each player takes the role of a political party. His goal is to achieve the most political influence by cumulating the head chief offices inside the Government during the 5 years covered by the game.
Laws ad personam, scandals, bankruptcies, breakdowns of institutions, strange affairs, volatile alliances, backstabbing, riots inside the Parliaments... everything can happen during a match.

The game can be FREELY downloaded for print, cut  play at:

www.calvinuslab.tk

Italian version is the only one currently available. The game subject is strictly linked to Italian politics, so no English version will be published.

title: Alcatraz Escape
description: A dice game for 2 players. You have to transport your prisoners from one side to the other. The first one with all his prisoners at the other side is the winner. You have to throw with a black and a white dice. The numbers on the stones represent the escape gate. For instance when you throw 3 with the white stone you put one of your prisoners in the third white gate, with the black stone in the black gate. With six you may choose which gate.

title: Giants and Castles
description: Players move their Giants around the board, ripping castles apart looking for treasure rooms. First player to acquire 4 treasure rooms (as the giants are trying to build their own golden castles) wins the game. Each player gets 5 actions points a turn. Action points can be spent to move to an adjacent space, pick up an adjacent room from the top of a castle or giants stack, place the top room of your stack on an adjacent square, or cast a spell, provided you have enough rooms to give to the local sorceresses.

title: Birds Eye Race Against Time
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
An exciting race against time to get your peas to the Birds Eye factory.  But watch out, your opponents' harvesters and shuttle lorries aren't far behind.  And your peas may not be small enough or picked quickly enough to satisfy Birds Eye quality controllers.  So get your harvesters rolling.  The first grower to unload a batch of peas wins!

A collect a coupon promotional game which Birds Eye offered in 1981 to its consumers suitable for Ages 7 and up.

The game is split into 2 phases, Harvesting and Delivery.

Each player takes it in turns to roll the dice and move around the outside spiral of the board representing The farm and stop at various harvest areas to collect magnetic pea counters which stick to the top of your harvester.  
Action Cards are drawn whenever a player lands on an action card space, consequences range between delays or move backs and extra moves or turns.

The player then aims to get to the transfer area and begin the delivery phase taking the shortest route they can to reach the factory. Delays or detours are printed on the board and must be taken if landed on.

At the factory the player draws cards in order to unload peas of the matching color.

The standout feature of the game are the two sets of playing pieces (Harvesters and Lorries) which were nicely detailed with the Birds Eye logo on the side and had a small piece of metal in the top for the magnetic peas to stick to.

title: Blood & Iron Map Pax 1
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Map Pax 1 is an Advanced Squad Leader compatible expansion concerning the actions of the US 27th Infantry at Item Pocket, Okinawa, in 1944. This folio-style package includes an original 22x32 color map, 10 new scenarios and a unique Cave Set Up play aid.

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader

title: Airborne Stand!
description: An Advanced Squad Leader compatible scenario and map pack depicting the actions around the area in Normandy that would later become known as The Marcus Heim Causeway. Contains 12 small-action scenarios and a large-hex 25x35 color map.

title: Viva Zapata!
description:
Viva Zapata! is a traditional hex-and-counters wargame, which pits Mexican rebels against the Mexican government. Gameplay is pretty standard (for a wargame), including terrain modifiers for movement and combat, as well as a pretty standard combat resolution table.

Apart from the theme, the originality of the game comes from the use of trains (necessary for both players, as their forces are scattered throughout the map at the beginning of the game), and dynamite to blow up the railroad tracks.

title: Daisho
types: Card Game Fighting Medieval Print & Play
description: A free downloadable card game from Warp Spawn games.  The subject is man-to-man combat between Japanese characters.  The game can be found at http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Daisho.html.  A set of the cards needed can be found at http://digilander.libero.it/zak965/thoth/daisho.zip.

title: Between the Posts
description:
A rugby simulation that tries to capture the end to end excitement of top class Rugby Union.  Using real team and player stats, the game aims to simulate a full match rather than just the attacking highlights system used in it's predecessor, Line Out.

Many team cards are available, where real teams are rated for Attack and Defence plus their ability in set scrums, rucks, loose mauls and line outs, as well as individually rated players for each team - to produce statistically accurate results and scorers.

Players roll dice and refer to various charts depending on the action, field position, and team ratings, to determine the outcome of events.  Players have opportunities to dictate teams tactics or actions during the match, and the result is the full end-to-end flow of a match, the grim battle between the opposing packs, tactical defensive play, the power of the loose maul, the rucks and scrums driving forward, and the sweeping open play as the backs come into the game.

It's the Strat-O-Matic of rugby gaming!

title: Line Out
description:
Line Out is a replay simulation of Rugby Union.

Teams are rated for Attack and Defence plus their ability in set scrums, rucks, loose mauls and line outs.

The game recreates the 'highlights' [potentially dangerous attacks] of a match based on the attach / defence ratings of the teams.

When either team's Attack number is rolled a simple procedure establishes how the attack started, which player has possession and where exactly on the field of play the attack is centered as you join the action. From then on dice rolls on one or other of the various Charts plot the outcome of the attack until it either breaks down or points are scored. Most of the actions are taken from the Action Chart which is  common to both teams, but approximately one in six are taken from the Team's own Team Card, helping recreate that team's particular style of play, strengths and weaknesses. Other 'actions' are  dependent on individual Player Ratings.

A marker is moved on the Field of Play to chart the  development of the attack, another marker on the Team Card shows who has possession, and a third is used on the Time Clock to keep track of time.

Team Cards use named players and substitutes, with individual Player Ratings to produce accurate results and scorers.  Teams from many seasons and competitions available, allowing for some great what if matchups, as well as full season replays.

title: The Great Running Game
description:
A head to head rugby game, where players play cards to move the ball around the pitch or to attempt to stop their opponents moves.

Various situations are catered for by the cards held, from rucks and rolling mauls, to sweeping moves by the backs.  Several kicking options are also available from little grubber kicks, to towering bombs, to huge touch finding clearance kicks - although beware of your opponent scooping up the loose ball and cutting through your defense.

This is a fast paced, end to end, rugby game, which is quick to learn, and no two matches ever play the same.

Additional rules are also included for playing with 3 or 4 players, or even solo.

title: In-Sekt-Surprise
description:
Game from the same series as e.g. Patron-Ow and Ham-N-Ex etc.

Start of each round a small bottle of champagne (without champagne of course...) and a bug each are hidden beneath one out of four miniature champagne coolers. Player chooses one cooler and turns it over - if it's the champagne or nothing he scores some points and may continue if he wants. If he finds the bug he gets negative points.

title: Warlock
description:
This small game was inspired by the Warlock stories by Larry Niven.  Players use mana to create creatures and cast spells.  Each player starts with equal powers.

A game comes with a rule book with a combat table, a 8 1/2 x 12 inch hex grid, a sheet of spells, a 5 x 6 inch sheet of 90 counters representing warlocks, conjured beings, and effects of spells.

The creatures include bats, goblins, wolves, eagles, cobras, flying dragons, fire-breathing dragons, and demons.

title: Mental Blocks "The Block Party"
description:
This game is published by Perigee Books, a member of The Putnam Publishing Group, in The United States and by General Publishing Company in Canada under the exclusive license from The Stonesong Press, Inc.  The Block Party is a trademark of The Putnam Publishing Group.

This game is made up of 16 cubes that allow players to find up to 96 pictures and almost 2000 pictorial variations by arranging the cubes into four-by-four squares or other patterns.

The game has three levels of difficulty, or you can create your own game.

Block Party is the first version to be published in a material other than wood.

title: Billion Dollar Player
description:
From the publisher:

The top sports stars receive many income opportunities. Players sign deals, receive awards, and lead their sports in categories that help and hurt their earning potential.
