Now Sudoku can be played in teams. Players race to see who can complete their Sudoku puzzle first.

More than 100 different puzzles designed at three different levels. Teams can choose their level or roll the dice and meet the challenge.

title: De Kolonisten van Catan: De Specialisten
types: City Building Civilization Expansion for Base-game Negotiation
description:
De Specialisten van Catan (Catan's Specialists) is a separately sold expansion for The Settlers of Catan. It also needs Catan: Seafarers.

Players build their villages on small islands with only a limit number of resources available. None of the starting islands provide sheep. The specialist trade ports gain importance. Additionally players can become specialist in one or more of the resources gaining additional victory points and free resource cards each turn.

title: The Fitness Challenge
description:
From the back of the box

It's the game that can help you lose weight!
Pick a Partner...and engage in a friendly competition.

The Fitness Challenge rallies you and your partner (spouse, relative, friend, co-worker) to exercise for eight weeks. It doesn't matter if you are just starting out or if you have been exercising for some time, The Fitness Challenge allows you to play no matter what shape you're in.

Game rules are designed to motivate you to exercise at least three days a week, every week, for eight weeks. From walking to mountain climbing, the range of workout choices accommodates any lifestyle.

With The Fitness Challenge Scorecard, you and your workout buddy get a fun and simple way to track your progress as you progress on your track. Pick from a selection of zany coupons to make up a Wager Book. The Wager Book is your incentive to stay on track... and your opportunity to stick it to your partner if they don't hold up their end of the bargain!

title: Spider and Fly
Brother against Brother
description:
Miniature wargame.
American Civil War small action rules. Including optional rules for the French  Indian war, and other periods.

Brother Against Brother is a rule set for small actions and skirmishes between company or smaller, sized units. In order to allow for a wargame to be completed in a short length of time - about 3-4 hours - the rules are as simple and short as possible, but maintain the feel of firefight from the American Civil War period.

Equipment needed:
1 or more tape measures in inches.
3 or more D10 dice.
Cotton balls.
Appropriate figures (about ten figures/squad).
Scenery for the table (the more the better).

title: COO-COO
description:
COO-COO is a party game published in 1921. Players punch out a hole in the pegboard using a metal key. A little wad of paper is pushed out, which when unrolled reveals a slip containing some stunt the player must perform. Each pegboard contains 100 stunts.

from the box:

Every COO-COO game contains 100 different stunts. COO-COO is issued in series; every series is entirely different from every other series. The numbers are shown on the end of the boxes.

DIRECTIONS FOR PLAYING

are shown on the front of the game board.

A good variation is to have the player do the stunt called for on his slip, while the others attempt to guess what he is doing.

Sometimes the hostess will select one of her men guests to start the game. When he has done his stunt, he gives the board to any lady he chooses for the next stunt. After playing she hands the board to a man, etc., till all have played.

COO-COO will be even more successful if the hostess announces before the play starts that a prize will be awarded to the lady and another to the man doing his stunt the best.

The judges may declare a tie and require two more stunts played by ech of those tied, thus prolonging the fun.

title: Alien Galaxy
description:
Guided by the voice of Mission Control, Squadron Commanders must avoid deadly Laser fire, pierce Meteor storms, defense missile systems and many other perils of the Alien Galaxy....Surround yourselves with the sound of Intergalactic Adventure as the play the cassette tape included with the game....

The object of the game is to maneuver your spacecraft avoiding the hazards, black holes etc ..The winner is the last player with any of their spacecraft surviving..

title: Mini Double Dice
description:
A Yahtzee like game where there are 5 hollow, transparent, six-sided dice. Within each is another smaller die.  You get three rolls and get to keep any number of dice on each roll, just like Yahtzee.  You then score based on 13 categories.  Categories are Ones, Twos, Threes, Fours, Fives, Sixes, Odds, Evens, Lo In/Hi Out, Hi In/Lo Out, Lucky 7-11, One Away, Double Dice.

An example of scoring is Lo In/Hi Out: After the third roll, total all the Double Dice (both inner and outer) that have a lower number on the inner die and a higher number on the outer die.  If all 5 Double Dice are Lo In/Hi Out, total all dice and DOUBLE the score!

title: Waddington's Cricket Game
description:
From the box:

Waddington's Cricket Game with batting and bowling. An activity game of real skill and excitement.

Players can either bat or bowl. Although only two players can participate others can act as onlookers or wait their turn to bat and bowl in teams.

Waddington's Cricket Game recreates a cricket pitch on your table or floor. There is a plastic ramp for the bowler to use to deliver small ball-bearings. Another plastic mechanism holds a bat in tension with an elastic band. The batsman releases a trigger to strike at the ball. Scoring depends on how far the ball ends up from the nearest fielder. Fielders are press out cardboard figures that fold into a 3D shape.

title: Crow Hunt
description:
This 1931 game from Parker Brothers was advertised as a splendid shooting game. Crows were inserted on a slide at the rear of a target and automatically appear one at a time. Using a repeating rifle which shot 6 elastic bands, the object was to hit the birds who slid down the ramp and into an opening in the background target.  When you hit one the next one slid down into place. Each bird that you hit was worth 1 point. The last bird hit was a duck named Elmer He was worth 5 points if you successfully hit him. First person to get 25 points won the game.

the ad for the game stated that additional ammunition (60 elastic bands) were available for 30 cents from Parker Brothers.

title: Teddy Bear Panda and His Friends
types: Animals Children's Game Racing Word Game
description:
This game is for young people. It was designed to teach them their A, B, C's. The object of the game was simple. The first person to move his piece from a to y and z wins the game.
Color determines the move. Each player selects a piece to move (Panda, Kitty, etc. The a player spins the arrow and depending on which color shows up he/she moves to the corresponding colored letter. Other players spin and then place their piece on the first unoccupied letter with the color that they spun. First person to get to y or z (both winning letters) wins the game.

title: Hole in One: the Game
description:
A trivia roll and move board game......Object of the game: acquire the trivia tees(par,birdie and eagle) and have the lowest scoring round of golf.
Trivia tees categories:
Eagle: extremely difficult for pro players
Birdie:golf courses..rules,golf records etc..
Par: golf basics etc

title: Trivial Pursuit Music Master Game: The '60s Edition
description: Stock question card combines with 99 track CD and answer booklet. Some of the songs are British hits instead of American, but many of them are worldwide hits.

title: Big Mouth
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Humor Real-time
description:
Big Mouth comes in quite a large box (15 x 16 x 3.5).

Each player is given a large 14 red plastic fork and a paper plate on which there are 6 different plastic food items and a green bug.  A thin piece of cardboard is placed over a plastic bowl.  The cardboard is designed in the shape of a cute clown with a hole forming the entrance to his oral cavity, which is formed by the bowl.

A spinner directs gameplay.  There are 7 equal segments on the spinner, representing each food object  the green bug.

If a food object is spun, players race to be the first to feed it to the clown with their fork.  Losers replace their food object on their plate.  If a player has already successfully fed that particular food object to the clown on a previous turn they instead try to feed the clown the green bug.  If successful, opponents cannot feed the clown the food object that was spun on that turn and the bug is retrieved from the mouth of the clown  returned to its position.

If the green bug is spun, ANY food object may be placed in the clown's mouth.

The first player to feed all the food on their plate into the mouth of the clown is the winner.

title: Monkeys!
description: Monkeys! Who knew it could be so tough to keep a banana?  Scare the monkey away from your precious bananas or send monkeys after your opponents.  Oh, and try to stop laughing before time runs out.  Join your friends in a frenzy of fast-paced silliness!

title: Happy Landing
description:
Each player is given four wooden chips (or airplanes) of a color and one wooden shooter (or propeller).  'Airplanes' are placed onto the 'propeller' and are catapulted onto the gameboard by tapping the far side of the 'propeller'.

The board consists of a box insert depicting various features surrounding a landing strip, each labeled with either positive or negative points.  In the center of the board is a cup, which is the highest scoring feature and true target.

Excerpted from the box:

The game is based on the principle of an airplane trying to land safely without cracking up. This is called a Happy Landing.

title: Shmo
description:
I'm a Shmo and that ain't good.

Each player is provided a Shmo marker (a plastic boy in short pants) which is placed onto an oversized board. Players roll the dice and move along a path containing such features as Forgets his trousers..., Takes wrong school bus... or Walks through wet cement.  Each special feature directs the player to advance a number of spaces and pick a Shmo card.  The cards direct the player to perform some silly act and declare himself a shmo (Scratch your back 10 times and say, I'm an itchy shmo!).

At the end of the path is a large box declaring: First one here is a SHMO...  ...and that ain't good!

Shmo is a Tumblebum dice game, which is to say that the two dice are placed into an hourglass-shaped device (Tumblebum) which is spun around in order to roll the dice.

title: SuDoKu: Battle Lines
description:
SuDoKu - Battle Lines is a strategy game where players battle for territory on the game board using color coded, numbered tiles.

Based on the very popular Sudoku number puzzle (where each 3x3 grid, each row and each column must contain all the numbers 1 to 9), this game adds the extra dimension of player combative interaction. For those who enjoy solitaire games, a number of Sudoku puzzles are included - ranging from easy to extremely hard.

title: Gemblo Expansion Set
description:
This 18-card expansion alters the play of the basic game by giving players cards used to bend the rules in various ways.

It also addresses the disadvantage that later players have in larger games by giving them greater choice of cards.

Contents:

18 Special Cards (2 each of 9 different cards)
1 vinyl zipper (ziplock) bag
1 instruction sheet (in English and Korean)

The cards are still in die-cut sheets, and have to be punched out by hand.

The expansion seems to be included with most games purchased from vendors in the United States; it isn't clear if that applies elsewhere in the world.

title: Diversion
description:
This fairly ancient Racing Game (my copy seems at least 50 years old) has no dice whatever, an unusual feature for the genre. The gameboard has a series of turntables on it, which can be rotated so as to alter the paths in front of the players: the skillful manipulation of the turntables lies at the heart of the game. Each turn the player's piece (a small racing car) moves 1,2,3, or 4 squares forwards, at the player's discretion. If he lands on a space with black dots, he can rotate a turntable anywhere on the board, either to clear his path to the finish line or to hinder someone else. The Finish squares when reached give you points, and then you return to the start, only winning when you have 100 pts. It is possible to become completely trapped in an area with no black dots, and this carries a penalty of 20 pts and return to start. 
The theme is pasted on, but the deduction and 'screwage factor' involved should appeal to many.

title: Twenty One
description:
Based on the original (1956-58) scandal-riddled game show, one player acts as Quiz Master for two players or teams and chooses a random category for the round. In turn, each secretly chooses a question by number. There are eleven questions, numbered 1-11, and are of graduated difficulty with 11 being the hardest. A right answer adds that amount to their score, a wrong answer takes it away (but scores cannot go below zero).

Neither team knows the other's score, and either may stop the game at any time. The game ends when either 1) a  team asks to stop the game or 2) one team has 21 at the end of the round, and the winners receive $500 for each point difference in the scores.

If the game ends in a tie, another game begins at zero with the cash award increased by $500 per point. The team with the most money at the end of gameplay (set by the players) wins.

title: Attic Antics
description:
Attic Antics is a party game!

The game where you just might see a side of
your friends that you've never seen before.

This is much more than a drinking game!

Innocently enough you'll move around the board
collecting money for performing various acts of idiocy.
The first player to $5000 wins.  Sound simple?
...not so fast.  As the money moves around, some
players will be able to buy their way out of
potentially embarrassing situations - and some won't!
As the drinks flow and the money goes, so do the inhibitions!  Have a camera ready,
this game is sure to fill a scrapbook with some hilarious pictures.

To see it, visit: www.nomanor.com

title: Jay Jay Counts Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
From the publisher:

Watch your preschooler soar as they learn numbers 0-12 with self-correcting matching pairs. Award Winner of Canadian Toy Testing Council.

title: DiceHoldem
description:
Who needs cards? DiceHoldem is the Ideal Portable Poker Game! Played just like Texas Holdem!

Players use a combination of guile and luck, bluff and planning, to compete for the pot.

Using unique dice with the letters H, O, L, D, E, and M on them, players compete to make hands of the best combination of their 2 player dice and the 5 community dice.  The betting rounds are the same as Texas Holdem and each one rolls another community die.

Variants are included for faster play, advanced play, and Can't Holdem (a two-player variant that has players bid for a guess at one of five dice that are thrown).

Set includes a zippered carrying pouch.

title: Het Grote Piramidespel
types: Adventure Ancient Comic Book / Strip Trivia
description:
Get me the magical heart scarab of pharaoh Cheops. It lays in the royal tomb chamber of the great pyramid. The god Seth wants it, and you will obey him. Therefore you must go find the magical scarab. Throw the dice and try to be the first to find it.

Het grote piramidespel was included with comic N21 of the series of Papyrus.
You roll the dice and answer to the trivia questions if you answer is right, you have luck, if it's not, you don't.

note: the game was also included with comic N22 of the series
of papyrus, with new characters and questions. This way it's possible to play the game with 12.

title: Earth Gone Mad
description:
From the web page-

Overview:
The Mayan calendar is one of the oldest and most accurate calendar systems in human history. Using no more than their knowledge of the Earth, Sun, and stars, the Mayans were able to tabulate days, weeks, months, and years from 3113 BC until December 21, 2012 AD. No one knew why the Mayan calendar ended on that date..

On December 22, 2012, a small asteroid swung in from the outer solar system and clipped the moon.

For over a year astronomers had been tracking the asteroid, but due to its small size had not thought it a serious threat. It proved, however, to have a much higher density than expected. Its impact with the moon imparted a distinct 'wobble' to the lunar orbit and ejected megatons of lunar material into Earth orbit.

Scientists estimate the moon's orbit will return to normal in a few years. But, its erratic orbit will have catastrophic effects on Earth's biosphere during the first year. By the end of 2013, all life on the six northern continents will be extinct.

Welcome to mankind's last year

Two versions of this game are available:  A PDF (Print and Play) version and a Vassal version.

title: King Solomon's Lost Mine
description:
Players race into the depths of a lost mine to recover a rainbow colored gem that will prove that this indeed is
- King Solomon's Lost Mine.

title: Low Bidder: a Game of Management Strategy
description:
From the rulebook:  Low Bidder is the business game that was originally developed for the 1964 Engineering Foundation Research Conference, and was initially presented in its session on 'The Strategy of Bidding.'  Players bid on a number of randomly selected construction jobs.  The low bidder wins the job and receives his bid, but must then pay labor and material costs for the job.  Labor costs are modified by a random card draw.

Though the game is explicitly listed as 2-25 players, it's noted that 3-8 makes the best game.

title: King of Pearls
description:
Players simultaneously choose how many stones, up to four, they wish to play each turn. Then they sow them along a diagonal line of empty spaces on an 8x8 board, each picking up where the other player left off. When either player reaches the edge of the board, he chooses any empty diagonal line of spaces to continue sowing his stones.

After the board has been filled, the players count the number and size of the strings of stones they have created along an orthogonal axis of the board. Players earn points for sets of strings that contain one of each of the four allowable sizes of strings and lose points for strings that can't fit in a sequence.

title: Zapt
description: In Zapt, players roll three dice and can choose a numbered space to place a chip. Lining up four chips will score. Players can choose on there turn to try to get closer to four in a row or to try and  block an opponent   (which is when you Zapt them.).  The modular board means that each game can be different than the previous one.

title: Pikachu no Tankentai Ki Nobori Gemu
description: Pikachu's Tree-climbing Explorer Game. Another in the enormous line of Pokemon merchandise. A game for children Ages 7 and up played on a double-sided board and using building blocks to simulate tree climbing.

title: Kinchan no Shukan Kinyoubi
description: Kinchan no Shukan Kinyoubi or Kinchan's Weekly Friday Game. Based on the 1980's Japanese TV Variety show. Players move around the board answering questions and competing in several mini-games.

title: Homestay Snoopy
description: Join Snoopy and his pals as they travel around the world and make new friends in this Japan-only game. Collect a variety of travel cards and use them to move from country to country.

title: Ai-Jo Monogatari
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Prepare for the perfect wedding day in this Japanese children's game. Race around the board collecting all the things necessary for your big event and the winner will receive the golden bracelet and the entitlement to lord it over her envious rivals until the next session.

title: XX Olympic Winter Games: Torino
description:
A merchandising-game ordered by Italian Olympic committee and made by Italian Fun Box.

Four boards, simulating runs and tracks of 8 different Winter Olympic disciplines.

Winner is the one that makes the most points.
Whoever wins gets the gold medal.

The box contains:
Dice
4 boards with runs and tracks
Colored pawns
Gold, silver and bronze medals

title: Ultraquiz 91
types: Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme Travel Trivia
description: Japanese trivia game based on popular TV show from the early 90's where students competed to earn a trip to the USA. Contains over 2500 questions on American culture. Players take turns playing the role of quizmaster, the others must be the first to press their buzzer to be able to answer.

title: F-Zero Knight League: Real Racing Simulation Game
description: Racing simulation based on the computer game. Players use random cards to power their vehicles around a variety of tracks. Each player and their vehicles have different levels of performance.

title: Ai-Nori: Card Game
description: Card game based on the popular Japanese dating show. Use the two decks (a couples deck  an event deck) to build up a matching hand with another player and/or sabotage other players.

title: Gaiking
description: Based on the 1976 cartoon (also known as Giant Sky Demon Dragon Gaiking). Players use the built in roulette wheel to move around the various sections of the board and battle the alien enemies.

title: Angling
description: Subbuteo does fishing! All the thrills and spills of course Angling, but without the long wait to catch something. Turn based game where you collect all your fishing gear from the tackle shop, then buy some bait and then go fishing. You play your bait to buy strike cards some of which have fish on them, if you catch a fish, you win some points.

title: Lawsuit!
description:
From the publisher's website:
Lawsuit! is an educational game for adults and children ages 6 and up. Players experience and learn about the law as they make their way through law school, past the bar exam and into their own law practice and the courtroom.
    
The board is divided into 62 spaces. Players proceed through law school; the nitty gritty of running a law practice (hiring a secretary, paying office rent); and the ups and downs of bringing a case (preparing papers for court, going to trial). Players also land on spaces, where they are directed to pick cards describing all sorts of interesting and amusing (and family-friendly) case scenarios.

When a card is chosen, a player must decide whether to accept the result or appeal it. On an appeal, a player may double or even triple his award -- or lose some or even all of it.

Instead of advancing when it's their turn, players may also choose to settle a case by drawing a Settlement card. Like appealing, settling a case can result in gaining -- or losing -- part or all of one's winnings.

Players may also double the stakes by buying into a partnership. All awards and costs are doubled for partners. Whether or not to become a partner is therefore a key strategic decision, and adds to the suspense and intrigue, as everyone wonders whether it will pay to have become one.

title: The Great Cake Chase
description:
An exciting game of colors, counting, and sharing.  Teaches Biblical values!
Kids: Help Christopher Churchmouse's friends find what they need to bake a cake for Christopher's birthday!  But watch out for Tuffy the Cat!  Based on the popular Christopher Churchmouse Classics written by Barbara Davoll and illustrated by Dennis Hockerman.

title: Stubborn
description:
Stubborn(tm) is the easiest of the Mining Order From Chaos (tm) games.  Stubborn does not have a game board, thus simplifying the task of finding a home for your tiles.  Stubborn is a great solitaire game, but can easily accommodate up to six players.
The game is played by each player blindly choosing six tiles.  A specially marked Starting Tile is turned face up, and then the players take turns placing their tiles in correct color pattern and numerical sequence.  The first person to place all their tiles (the most stubborn player!) wins.
There are three increasingly difficult levels of Stubborn: Simply Stubborn, Downright Stubborn and Certifiably Downright Stubborn.

title: Hercules: The Legendary Journeys Trading Card Game
types: Card Game Collectible Components Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Another Arc system game - basically a lite version of Magic the card game.  Compatible with C-23 and Xena: the Warrior Princess.

Game is very similar but not identical to Magic.  Each player begins with a deck of exactly 40 csrds, you win when your opponent has no cards left to draw.

On your turn you play resources, which come in red (direct damage), green (combat) and blue (manipulation).  You use those resources to summon creatures or cast spells always with the goal of running your opponent out of cards.

On your turn you can do the following in order:
Untap your creatures/heroes/resources.
Draw a card
Play a resource
Use resources in play by turning them sideways (tapping) to pay for the cost of a card in your hand to put in play 
Attack with any heroes you have in play

Play then passes to the other player and continues until the winner empties his opponents draw deck.

Although compatible with C-23 and Xena, all three sets have different backs which makes mixing less useful than you might hope.

title: Terrific Toy Box
description:
The Terrific Toy Box card game was distributed by Target Stores in 1998. The cards depict various toys available at Target along with one card labeled Empty Tox Box. The cards are essentially ads for toys (with brand names and logos displayed prominently).

Two games that can be played with the cards are described on the back of the package. The first, Match the Toys, is simply blind Go Fish. Players take turns drawing cards from each others' hands in order to create matches in their own hands. The only card that cannot be matched is the Empty Toy Box card, and the player left holding this card is the loser.

The second game described on the package is The Memory Game, in which  players use the cards for a simple face down matching game.

title: Ben Hur
description:
A colorful antique boardgame based on the epic chariot race from the novel Ben Hur.

Components include large game board, four wooden pawns, and two spinners. The rules are printed on the bottom of the box.

title: The Never Ending Feelings Game
description:
A game intended to assist in teaching positive reactions to processing feelings, to assist in learning social skills, and to get adults and/or children talking.

A totally noncompetitive with no winners or losers.

CONTENTS: 144 cards, 8 playing pieces, laminated game board, 1 die,  instruction booklet.

title: Cricket Wicket
description:
From the Publisher:

Before now, it was difficult to play a boardgame on the sport of Cricket because a simple, yet enthusiasm-maintaining way had not been used to score runs and dismiss batters while encompassing most, or all of the possible play scenarios associated with the real sport.

The key is the adaptation of the total real-game essence to a boardgame format through the unique scoring method.

title: The Christmas Stocking Game
description:
An antique children's card game of toys and presents brought by Santa Claus. The game may be played by any number of persons.

32 gift cards, 11 Christmas stocking cards, and a Santa Claus card (unknown if complete, rules do not specify the number of cards).

title: Gilligan's Island Game
description:
Based on the CBS TV show. Ages 6 - 12.

Equipment includes game board, spinner, four stand-up characters (Gilligan, Skipper, Mr. Howell, and a money), a number of cardboard chits, and a 25 piece jigsaw puzzle depicting a raft.

title: Jonny Quest
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Johnny Quest in exciting escapades all over the world. As seen on ABC TV.

Contents include plastic boats, two spinners, 6 red cardboard guns, 6 blue cardboard guns, cardboard chests, and instruction booklet.

title: Jonny Quest Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Players try to win each round by being the first to discard all the cards in their hand, at which time one point is scored for each card held by the other players. You win the game by accumulating 11 points (with two players), 21 points (three players), or 31 points (four players).

Contents include 42 cards (numbered from 1-40 plus two wild cards), rules booklet, and scoring booklet.

Ages 10 and up.

title: The Adventures of Superman
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description:
The object is to be the first player to move his Clark Kent piece from his starting corner into the editorial sanctum square at the center of the board.

Components: four different colored Clark Kent pawns, four Superman cloaks in corresponding colors, die, playing board, and two rules folders.

Released less than two years after the very first appearance of SUPERMAN in ACTION COMICS #1 in 1938, this board game was initially sold in Macy's department stores in 1940. (Source: David T Alexander Collectibles)

title: Teleporters
description:
From GAMES Magazine review:

On your turn, move two poles and two ports. Poles can move one or two spaces orthogonally, or they can teleport. A port has two ways of moving: It can either reorient (that is, spin so that its right angle is flush with any corner of the space it occupies), or it can glide across the board like a chess rook. A port forms a teleport by landing on a square with another of its color, with each right angle in opposite corners of the square. A teleport enclosing an enemy pole sends the pole back to one of its home spaces.

A pole teleports between any two of the following:  friendly teleports, home spaces, and goal spaces (except that a pole can only teleport to a goal space from another goal space). Poles can be blocked by port walls or other poles, but they can also move between the board's left and right edges as if the edges were connected. A pole completely blocked by the opponent teleports home.

title: Major League Baseball Game
description:
The wooden frame game box folds open to display the baseball field on one half and a large spinner on the other half. The spinner lists various results in two concentric rings - hit, ball, strike and out appear all around the outermost ring, while various other results appear sporadically in the inner ring (foul, fly to center, hit to right, out at first, etc.)

Lineup cards for various teams are included. The selected teams are inserted into the playing field and list the players for various teams of the era. The playing field has holes in it for wooden playing pieces to track scores, runners on base, the positions of players in the field, etc. Strikes, balls, and outs are tracked with rotating wheels.

title: Transformers: Beast Wars
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveVariable Player Powers
description: Japanese board game based on the Beast Wars TV cartoon and toy line in the Transformers Universe. From 1-4 players take the role of one of twelve different robots and race to accumulate power-ups and other bonuses before facing off against one another with the built-in action roulette wheel.

title: Donkey Kong Board Game
description: Japanese board game based on the Video Game character. Choose Donkey Kong or one of four relatives and explore the mysterious island collecting banana chips in order to buy cards used to battle your enemies. Make sure you accumulate enough power before your final face-off with King Koopa.

title: S Club 7 Board Game
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Music Trivia
description:
How much do you think you know about S Club?

How much do you know about your friends and how much do you want to know?

Well here`s the game that puts all that to the test.

Game based on the English pop band SClub-7. Show your dedication to the band by answering trivia questions. First to collect six rings, one from each member, wins. However, at times the band members might ask you to perform a dare, reveal a secret or quiz you on the other players.

Here`s where you might find out just a bit `too much` information about your friends!

title: Bullseye
types: Action / Dexterity Movies / TV / Radio theme Sports Trivia
description:
Family game based on the classic British television darts quiz show. Aim your darts at different categories marked on the board, the higher the points, the more difficult the questions. Play through the rounds, get to the final and try to win Bully's Star Prize.

Contents: Magnetic Dart Board, 6 Darts, 100s of Questions, Score Pad, Pencil, Rules

title: Play Your Cards Right
types: Card Game Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
description:
Family trivia card game based on the popular TV show, itself based on the US Game Show CARD SHARKS.

Full of humorous questions and surprising answers. In the first round of the game teams guess higher or lower as the card turns, trying to earn a stake with which to play the next round. Teams then gamble away their money as they try to guess the outcome at the turn of a card in the second round. Suitable for two players or teams.

title: The Game Of Lose
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock HoldingTrading
description: An interesting and humorously packaged alternative take on Monopoly, with players accumulating property and trying to bankrupt their opponents.  The big difference is that bankrupt players, though they can no longer win, are not eliminated; they instead go on Swellfare and are given rubber checks with which to pay their rents.  To win the last solvent player must pass the start/finish line with at least $100.  This is hard to accomplish and most games end with everybody losing.

title: Melvin Purvis' "G"-Men Detective Game
description:
The object of the game is to capture the Public Enemy. The player who brings a G-Man together with the Public Enemy wins the game. The game starts with one G-Man chasing the public enemy, but after 30 minutes a second can be brought into play.

Contents include game board (with fingerprint chart), Action Dial spinner, two blue G-Men figures, one yellow Public Enemy figure, 16 G-Man cards, rules folder, and G-Men Telepad.

title: Megapolis
description:
This exciting and realistic finance and investment game is the first computer based economic game in the world. Economic thinking together with the computer`s flexibility in programming give maximum freedom to the players to plan the accumulation of millions. With the electronic computer, the haphazard chance of rags to riches is replaced by skill and judgment. The player who learns the value of economic planning will most likely win the game.

Trading simulation game from the 70's in which players use an included computer to generate stock data used to see how successful their investments become.

title: The Jury Box
description:
This Parker Brothers game series from the thirties is somewhat similar to the modern murder mystery party game genre. Each game in the series included six cases and twelve crime scene photos.

The game is currently being reprinted by On-Line-Products. The following information is from their website:

Unlike modern murder mystery party games, which are elaborate affairs that sometimes require extravagant character portrayals, The Jury Box is a more informal, easy to play party game. The players are members of a jury who get to examine evidence against an accused person. They each then try to unravel the case and decide if the defendant is guilty or innocent.

Each series of The Jury Box comes complete with six different court cases that you get to solve. The cases have an outline with state's evidence against the defendant, along with two pictures of the crime scene and ballots for the jurors to cast their verdicts. You even get the actual solutions to these realistic cases.

title: Snatch
description: Listed on the box as Worlds Liveliest Family Game  A Game of Action Snatch is almost identical to the traditional card game Spoons. It uses a deck of 40 cards with 4 each of 1 through 10 and a set of wooden dowels to replace the spoons. There are two notable differences between it and Spoons. In scoring the player caught out gets a letter marked against then, first the letter S then N and so on the game ends when one player goes out having spelled SNATCH, the winner being the player with the fewest letters. The second difference is that a greater number of sets are used in play compared to the number of players. 3 players 5 sets, 4 players 7 set and for the rest it also uses 3 more sets than players.

title: Strawberry Shortcake Card Game
description: Play along with Strawberry Shortcake and all her Strawberryland friends in this berry fun card game. Match pairs of cards to get rid of the ones in your hand. The player who has the special Berry Card when all the pairs of cards have been matched is the winner.

title: Missä lahjat herra Hakkarainen?
description:
Mr Hakkarainen (famous character from Mauri Kunnas' children books) has messed up birthday presents in vans. Each players object is to find his/her presents as soon as possible.

The playing mechanism uses a wheel of fortune (which is attached on the gameboard) which tells how many steps the character can move and what to do when certain things happen.

title: Read and Rhyme Memory Match
description:
This game is published by Judy/Instructo, a division of Frank Schaffer Publications, Inc.  It appears to be recommended for children Ages 5 - 8

It consists of 10 nursery rhyme cards and 30 word cards.  The word cards are shuffled and spread face down.  Each player chooses a nursery rhyme card and places it in front of him or her.  Players take turns picking up a word card and reading it aloud.  If the word rhymes with the boldfaced word on his or her nursery rhyme card, the player keeps it and takes another turn.  The game continues until one player has collected all three words for his or her nursery rhyme.  That player must then read the proper completed nursery rhyme to win the game.

title: The Archers
types: Farming Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
mechanisms: ActingDice RollingRole PlayingRoll / Spin and MoveVoting
description:
Family game based on the British radio drama. Players compete to show their knowledge of the fictional village of Ambridge. Players take on the role of one of six characters and travel around the board gathering information from other players or acting out situations from the show.

Contents: Board showing the village of Ambridge, card deck, six character counters, timer, rulebook.

title: Bread
description:
Family Board Game based on the BBC TV comedy.

The object of the game is to be the first player to successfully leave home. To leave home,the player must satisfy their mother's requirements:
1. Have a job.
2. Have a partner.
3. Find somewhere to live.
4. Get a telephone.
5. Buy furniture.
6. Buy a form of transport.

Some of these items can be picked up on life's travels - a job and a partner - others will need to be purchased with hard won money.

Contents: Gameboard, rulebook, Money, 6 Playing pieces, Dice, 6 Character cards, 50 Dhss cards, 55 Mrs Boswell cards.

title: Trick Tock
description:
Children's game from the Nickelodeon TV channel. Players have 30 seconds to name as many items as possible from a given topic. However they must do so while performing a Nick Trick  (spinning around, flapping their arms, etc.) and also have to obey the Nick no-no (Don't move your feet, do blink, etc.). If they make a mistake they'll be squeaked.

Contents: game board, scoring sheets, 3 decks of cards, player counters, squeaker and timer.

title: The Original Sudoku Game
description:
This is yet another in the line of Sudoku games released in 2005.  The game contains a quad-fold board, a 60-second sand timer, 100 puzzles (with solutions, of course), and wooden tiles to play the puzzles.  It follows the same rules as the Sudoku games, where you're trying to place 1-9 in each column and row, and in each 9-square region of the board.

There are rules for playing with 1, 2, or more players.

title: Renegade Legion: Leviathan Capital Ship Briefing
The Real Ghostbusters
types: Horror Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Ghosts have invaded Manhattan in New York and its the Ghostbusters job to liberate the city from these ugly creatures.

Each player takes the role as one of the four members in Ghostbusters, each with their strengths and weaknesses. The goal is to make as much money as possible.

Districts are assigned to players and they are to get to that location and attempt to clear that district of ghosts before they get a new district assigned.

Theres a wide range of inventory that can be purchased throughout the game and aid the players, everything from ghost traps and magical books to the copter Ecto II that can travel great distances in one turn and fly over traffic chaos on the streets.

title: The Count Duckula Game
types: Children's Game Comic Book / Strip Fantasy Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanisms: MemoryPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Count Duckula the vegetarian vampire is on a mission to find four treasures that have been buried around the world by one of his distant cousins.

Its a memory game where both friends and foes can get in the way of count Duckulas way. Theres also the unreliable castle that can teleport around the world.

title: Psychedelic Cipher Caper
description:
Welcome to the late 60's.  A spy is selling government secrets by encoding them into the artwork of psychedelic posters.  The transfer point is Sy's Psychedelic Disco.

Suspects include:

Sy Silver - owner of Sy's Psychedelic Disco.

Thunder Showers - TV weatherman who is remarkably vain.

April Showers  Ex-wife of Thunder Showers, April is a Go-Go dancer at Sy's Psychedelic Disco.

May Flowers - A genuine child of the 60's, May is a hippy flower child.

Lenny Thinker Spencer - a philosophical draft-dodger.

Jean Boaz - a dreamy poet.

Ralph Rubble - a light-hearted jokester, who seldom takes anything seriously.

Teresa Wainwright - a stuck-up rich kid who acts as though she shuns the money upon which she so richly lives.

Unlike a lot of other murder mystery games where you ad-lib, this one provides a script for each player.  This is a great way to introduce people into these types of parties.  Next time they will feel more comfortable if you choose one where they have to hold a conversation on their own.

Attire and prop suggestions are included.

title: Små kloka på djuphavsfiske
description:
The task in this game is to explore the deep sea and find so many fish as possible.
The wise deep-sea fisher will find different types of fish like, sharks, moray eels, octopuses, amongst other small and big fish.
If you answer the questions correct you may fish in water with lots of fish. If you answer wrong you must fish in waters with very little chance to catch any fish.
The person with the most fish in the end is the winner.

title: Rumble in the Jungle
description:
You're a daring explorer racing through the jungle, trying to be the first to send the golden monkey statue flying from its hiding place. But the monkeys have set seven treacherous traps to knock you off track. Suddenly there is a rumble in the jungle as a boulder crashes down from the treetops. Look out... if you're the one in its path! Will you escape? Or will you be the one to reach the treasure first? Whatever happens, watch your step and remember - if you hear a rumble in the jungle, then trouble is never very far away!

Ages 5+.

In this game, player try to get to the middle of the board while avoiding the traps.  The traps are set off when the Wheel of Doom is turned a certain number of times; the wheel is turned when a player lands on the proper space.

title: Symbio
description:
Symbio was inspired by the immune system's ability to surround pathogens, and so the game creates a system where each player's groups of cells, or pieces, attempt to surround each other.

Players either place or move one of their pieces adjacent to another of their pieces, on an 8x8 board, every turn. In order to make a move, the players' formations of pieces must have an open space adjacent to them. The game ends when one player can no longer make a move.

title: Gobbler
description:
One player controls two gobblers who are attempting to eat as many of the other player's sixty littles as possible before they scurry out of their reach.

Any number of littles may occupy a space on an 8x8 board and they will automatically disperse one space away from a gobbler when it lands on an adjacent space. A gobbler makes two Chess-knight moves on its turn and any number of littles may move one space on their turn.

title: Snowblind
description:
How do you win a game if you have more control over your opponents pieces than your own? Figure out the answer in Snowblind, a quasi-strategic Icehouse game for 4 players.

Object: To maximize your score and minimize your opponents scores by putting pieces in taller and smaller stacks, respectively.

You Need:

* Four Icehouse stashes of different colors.
    * An opaque bag (or other opaque container).
    * A 43 grid. A Volcano board or chess board with some squares blocked off works just fine.
    * Some paper and a pencil for tallying scores at the end of the game.

On your turn, take a piece out of the bag and put it on the board. When you put a piece on the board, it must point upward. Pieces are played by these rules:

* Any piece may be placed in a vacant space.
    * A smaller piece may be 'engulfed' by a larger piece if the smaller piece is resting directly on the board.
    * A piece of smaller or equal size may be placed on another piece of equal or greater size.

Once you have placed a piece, play passes to the left. The game ends when all pieces have been played. After this, all the stacks are scored. Stacks have a value equal to the point value of the pieces in the stack, multiplied by the number of pieces in the stack. Points are tallied separately by color. A piece that is 'engulfed' is scored by the color thats engulfing it, not by the 'owner' of the engulfed piece. Engulfed pieces do not count for being in a stack.

The player with the highest total at the end of the game wins.

Several variants to the rules are also available on the website.

Home Page: http://www.invisible-city.com/play/174/snowblind

title: Thermopylae
description:
This Krieg-Kit conflict game was designed and published by Marty Silva in 1973. The game deals with the both the  strategic and tactical aspects of the Peloponnesian War.

There are two large monochrome (light and dark blue/black)map parts that depict Ancient Greece in 480. There is also a small 8 page rulebook, a battle results table and a counter sheet with adhesive printed counters that must be cut and peeled. There are a 138 counters, both men and ships. Basically, the game is a very early homemade DTP effort (long before the term was invented)from Orland Park, Illinois.

Fairly rare in wargaming circles, yet a simple and quick simulation of one of history's great wars.

title: Professor Noggin's Wildlife of North America
description: Another of the Professor Noggin series of children's trivia games.  The mechanics are fairly trivial:  one attempts to collect question cards by answering trivia questions: in this case, perhaps surprisingly, questions about North American plants and animals.  Each card has six questions by default, three each graded Hard and Easy.  (The suggestion is that parents should choose Hard questions and children Easy when playing together.)  The player rolls a d3 to select the question randomly.  If answered correctly, the card is retained by the answerer; if incorrectly, the card is returned to the bottom of the pile.  Occasionally, a card contains a special claim a card from another player action instead of a question.

title: Die Maus im Nacken
description: The object of the game is to score points by moving your set of elephants around the track and either getting them home or onto the couches that surround the track.

title: Au hasard de l'histoire
description:
Au Hasard de L'Histoire is a game retracing France's history from the Gaul tribes to the end of World War II.

Players will try to be the first to reach the end of the board by answering history questions of different types: facts, true or false, guessing the origin of an expression...

Some minor decisions must be made so as to manage your budget. Indeed the winner will not be the first one to reach the end of the board, but the one who has more currency (old coins, and bank notes) when everyone has reached the end.

title: Cross Currents
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemModular BoardRoll / Spin and Move
description:
On a 7x8 board made up of randomly-chosen dominoes, players attempt to move all seven of their pieces to the other player's side of the board.

The number of spaces a player can traverse during each turn is determined by his roll of a die, his opponents previous roll, and the difference between the pips on adjacent spaces of the board.

Cross Currents appeared in the August/September 1989 issue of Games Magazine.

title: La Petit Armee
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemModular BoardSecret Unit DeploymentSimulation
description:
Game billed as a complete Napoleonic miniatures system in a box.

Box contains three two-panel mounted, green-flocked boards combining to measure 3' x 2'.  Game includes a selection of terrain to use on these boards to create battlefields, including six different hills, two different villages, two different farms with farm fields, hedgerows, stone walls, roads, streams, rivers, two forests and a bridge.  Roads, streams, and the forest footprint are in colored felt.  Buildings are painted and cast from resin.  Tree bases are magnetized for secure storage inside the box.

Boxed set includes rules, charts, two rulers, two ten-sided dice, casualty/morale caps, command/rally counters, deployment/dummy markers scaled to unit base sizes, objective/line of communication markers, and two fully painted, based and flocked Napoleonic armies.

Each army consists of four line, one light and one elite infantry brigade; two light and one heavy cavalry brigade; three foot and one horse artillery batteries; and one General with two separate lieutenants used for command extension functions.  Each brigade includes a flag of its nationality.

Infantry is mounted four to a magnetic stand, three stands to a brigade representing about 2200 men.  Cavalry is mounted two to a magnetic stand, three stands to a brigade representing around 700 men.  Guns are mounted individually, one crew member for a field/horse battery and two crew for a heavy gun.  General is mounted with a foot figure; lieutenants are mounted individuals.

Figures in the standard starter set are painted Risk figures from the shako edition of Risk.  Additional painted brigades representing helmeted cavalry, lancers, etc. may be ordered from the producer.  Supplemental terrain boards and terrain elements are also available.

The rules are playable and concentrate on command and morale.  Units out of vision distance or line of sight are initially represented by hidden deployment markers, revealed as units come within sighting range.  Units may also be assigned to off-board flanking forces and/or reserves.

Initiative is determined each turn, as are available command points for each army.  Command points may be used either to activate units for movement and combat, or to rally shaken or demoralized units.  Army command diminishes as brigades are demoralized or destroyed.

The game system allows for considerable expansion and accommodates multiple players on a side.  Entire large battles can be gamed using this system and additional unit, but an interesting game can be played with as few as four or five brigades on a side.

title: I Scream
description:
Yummy! What a collection of ice cream treats!  Can you be the first to hold a set of 4 of the same treat and cause all the players to scream with delight?  A true ice cream frenzy that's sure to get your mouth watering.  Hungry for more?  If you lose the first round, you'll get another chance to snag yourself a treat in round 2,3,4 and more!

Object: Collect a set of 4 identical ice cream treats.

title: Haunted
description:
Haunted is a card-based game of strategy, set in the
dark, shadowy world of Edwardian Gothic horror.
Through the course of the game you will be
confronted by creatures good and bad, while
encountering situations and objects that will help or
hinder your path to your final destiny. Everyday
situations can very easily be the gateway to
unspeakable evil  chance discoveries may lead you
unwittingly to a nightmarish fate. It is your task to
escape these terrible consequences by wit and guile
(and maybe a little luck!)

title: Triangulate
description:
An entry in the 2001 About.com 8x8 Game Design Competition.

Triangulate is an abstract strategy board game that can be played with 'found objects.' In other words, it's a game, not unlike checkers or chess, but one that can be played with game pieces or other objects that you probably already have at home.

The first player decides which of their small pieces they would like to move first. In order to actually make the move, the player first takes one of their LARGE tokens and places it onto the square to which they intend to move a SMALL token. (The proposed square must be directly adjacent to the original square, touching on any side or corner) They then move their small token from its current position to the new square; placing it on top of the newly placed larger token. Then the next player takes his turn, etc. A player may move one of their small tokens onto a square already occupied by one of their own or one of their opponent's small token. In this case, the player does NOT place one of their large tokens in advance of the move, but simply places their small token on top of the other small token already in place. If this move is onto an opposing piece, that piece is not captured, but effectively blocked. Until the player on top moves their small token, the piece below may not move.

Play continues in this manner until one of the two players is able to Triangulate three of their own small pieces on a single square on the board.

title: Travel Australia Game
description:
A trivia game based on a map of Australia. Players roll 2 dice to move. If they land on a letter, they are asked a trivia question, with a correct answering advancing them and an incorrect answer sending them back. Cards earned at major cities confer other bonuses.

The game is aimed at the tourist market, and is sponsored by 40 Australian tourism companies. The board is the heaviest is my collection.

title: Pavilion Cricket
description:
Pavilion Cricket is a year round game designed to simulate, as realistically as possible, the results, performances and individual averages of the real game. In order to achieve this, Pavilion Cricket consists of three separate games:

1. Domestic Cricket
      This game covers domestic tour and one-day matches in England, Australia and the West Indies. A typical county match takes approx. 15 min. to play.

2. One-Day Cricket
      This game covers One-day Internationals and Domestic finals. More detailed than number 1., a typical game takes approx. 60 min. to play.

3. Test match Cricket
      This game provides a ball-by-ball simulation of a full five-day test match. As the most detailed of the three games, each day's play takes approx. 90 min. to play.

By using a combination of the three games, a full season or tour may be played on an ongoing basis.

The Teams Book provided details full squads of players for a broad range of teams; falling into three categories: Domestic, Current International (early 1990's, but later Team Books are available), and Modern Greats. The inclusion of the Modern Greats teams allows many previously unresolved debates to be tested. For example, how would the awesome South African side of 1970 perform against some of the great West Indian sides of the 1980's?

title: Locus
description:
Locus was advertised in Scientific American as The Peer of Chess, but it actually turned out to be more closely related to polyominoes.

The pieces are polyomino blocks which cover 2-4 spaces.  The goal of the game is to create as large as possible connected set of pieces.  The rules provide for adding new pieces either on the board or covering your opponents pieces.

title: Rodeo
description:
The Original Rodeo Hexagame, a dice and bet game for the whole family

In turn, each player competes in of 6 Rodeo disciplines, whilst the others place bets on the outcome. An active player can earn good money by successfully completing the task at hand, but the real money will be made by the onlookers who wager wisely.

Cowboys who enter the hexagonal rodeo arena will be randomly assigned one of 6 events: Bull-Riding, Bronc-Riding, Barrel-Racing, Calf-Roping, Team-Roping or Steer-Wrestling. These typically are resolved by rolling a die and moving along a predetermined track until the active player completes the task, fails by landing on the wrong space in the races, or can't land on the required spot(s) before the cattle escapes out of the arena in the roping events.
 The overall winner of the game will be the one with the most money at the end of it. Exactly when that is has to be decided by the players themselves, as events can be repeated as long as players are willing to enter them, and bet on them.

Since all the tasks get resolved by die rolling alone, winning cowboys will have been riding little more than their luck, making the Rodeo setting nothing more than a novel theme for a dice betting game, rather than simulating the adrenaline-rush of a genuine wild west gathering,  where skillful cowboys strut their stuff.

On the upside, with detailed playing pieces and 6 different (and all short) events, your average dice betting game suddenly has become very atmospheric, reasonably varied, and does move on at a brisk pace. And even better, as players can keep betting during the races as long as they can find another player who takes them up on the counter-bet, bet money can move even faster than the bulls, triggering personal rivalry around the table that will make even the wildest rodeo-ride look tame in comparison.

This light-hearted simulation is aimed less at gamers and more at the family market, and the detail and simplicity of the rules will mean that it is probably most enjoyed by those with younger children to entertain. The suggested lowest age is 6, which might be a bit young to fully understand the complexities of even simple betting odds. There is no real upper limit to the amount of players that can join in, and the more the merrier the betting. But if all cowboys want their own piece, then 6 is the maximum number of entrants.

title: Animal Tracks
description:
Animal Tracks, Make Tracks to Collect the Animals

A 4x4 grid is surrounded on all sides by 16 tiles with animals on them. Each tile shows a picture with a type of animal, either pigs, hens, sheep, or cows. Players get 2 track tiles each, which are placed (one each turn) on the grid to create connections (roads) between the animals. When a player places a track tile so that it connects 2 animal tiles of the same type, then those animal tiles are removed from the board and placed on that player's scoring stack. Empty spaces are filled with animal tiles from the draw stack, each player also draws a new track tile at the end of the turn and play continues until all animal tiles are collected or all track tiles are played. Track tiles may be placed on top of each other, and matching sets of animals may only be collected if the connection is made by establishing a new(!) route between them.

Each animal tile has one to three animals on it, and each player's end score is equivalent to the total amount of animals on the gained tiles. The one who collected most animals is the winner.

What appears to be a very simple tile-laying games with an appealing farmyard animal theme is quietly hiding a rather clever maze game that challenges children on multiple fronts. There are only four different track tiles in the game, yet there are so many ways to place these that a bewildering amount of new routes have to be considered. Visualizing the one that would connect two identical animal types, let alone spotting the most profitable one can be a challenge even for adults.

But kids love tiles, and kids love puzzles, and the rules are so intuitive that they easily get engrossed in an entertaining game. The best children games do far more than simple entertaining, and by having to match identical animals, create new routes between them, and consider the relative value of two matched tiles (2 hens and 3 hens is better than 1 sheep and 2 sheep) half an hour of fun is well spent indeed. There are 68 animals on offer, so even determining the final scores can be a quick math lesson.

The suggested age range is from 7 upwards, but it is such a good bridging game that it would suit even slightly younger children. For kids at the younger end of the spectrum, it might be simpler to settle for whoever has the highest animal stack wins, but even then there is enough left to make this a game worth considering.

Also known as Dierensporen in Dutch and Pistes d'Animaux in French.

title: Finger-Flick Sports: Basketball
description:
The offensive team tries to pass the ball to their players and then shoot it into their basket. The defensive players attempt to stop their opponent from completing passes and taking shots. Includes 3 games or versions: Fast Break, 3 on 3, and 3 point Barrage

Includes game board, disks, baskets, shooters, 1 minute timer, die, score pad, and instructions

title: Radio Collector: Six-Shooter Series Log
types: Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
This eBook contains information on the popular adult western, The Six Shooter, starring James Stewart. The log contains air dates and episode titles, along with brief plot descriptions. Also included is a list of cast members and writers, where known.

Besides the log, you also receive a CD label in .jpg format that you can import into your favorite label printing program. And a set of 6 collector cards that can be used to play with the Radio Collector Card Game, or just printed out and collect them for the fun filled facts listed on each card.

title: Harry Potter: The Triwizard Maze Game
types: Children's Game Exploration Fantasy Maze Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
From the box:

Face the Challenge of the Triwizard Tournament!  Enter a maze filled with creatures and magic as you race for the Triwizard Cup!  Be the first to get through the maze, claim the cup and win the Triwizard Tournament

title: Voyage au cœur de Lyon
description:
In this game, players will each have a personal profile indicating which parts of the city of Lyon they must explore in order to win (ie: the sportsman will have to visit stadiums...).

The game is then a classical roll-and-move where depending on the place your pawn is, you will have to answer special questions about the history and the city of Lyon.
When a player has visited all of his 5 destinations, he needs to rush back to place Bellecour (biggest square in Europe), first one there wins.

The game is entirely bilingual, questions are both in French and English.

title: Pelle Haleløs baggårdsjagt
description:
The players each control one of four cats, Pelle, Maja, Mons or Bill  Bull (the last two are twins and only got one piece to represent them, therefore they count as one.)

The cats try to run from one side of a backyard to the other without being captured by the nasty dog Berntsson. Fortunately there are a few 'safe' zones along the way, where they will be out of reach of the dog.

The game is available in Danish and Swedish.

title: Sudoku for Dummies: The Game
description: Yet another Sudoku game. This one provides more than 50 puzzles, 3 training puzzles and 81 number tiles to be played onto the boards. In addition, the company runs the AreYouGame.com site where you can download more puzzles.

title: Das Bodensee Spiel
Domino Road
description:
From the box front:

These wooden pieces are an early introduction to Dominoes. As players match roadways and vehicles their Thinking and Problem solving skills are stimulated with yet another dimension in discovery! The player who is able to properly place all of his or her pieces first wins!

From the box back:

Domino Road is a wonderful addition to the discovery Toys Thinking and Problem solving Preschool line. Your child will first want to assemble his or her roadway like a puzzle. But DOMINO ROAD has a puzzling twist; preschoolers must match roadways and vehicles! This wonderful stimulating puzzle will capture their attention for hours!

Summary:

Wooden tiles showing roads and 3-dimensional vehicles. most tile edges show 1/2 of a vehicle which matches up to other tiles' 1/2 vehicles when placed adjacent. Vehicles are in several colors and styles.

title: Jump-A-Sheep
description: A HABA game in a tin, containing 4 wooden sheep, 2 hurdle-sticks, a die and a small booklet of rules in German, English and French.   To play, mark starting and finishing lines with the hurdle sticks.  Line up the two sheep of each color, one behind the other at the starting line.  Each player takes turns rolling the die and placing their rear sheep in front of their lead sheep the repeating the number of times shown by the die.  The first player to reach the finishing line wins.

title: Speckles
description:
An entry in the 2001 About.com 8x8 Game Design Competition.

Each player selects a color. Each player in turn (clockwise if more than 2) places one piece of any color, on any vacant square, alongside a differently colored piece or pieces, if any, already in play. The first straight line of four adjacent pieces with a player's color at each end wins for that player.

title: Buzztime Trivia
description: Buzztime Trivia (4 different genres) is the card game equivalent of the NTN trivia that is prevalent in Sports Bars.

title: Shing Shang
description:
Tagline: Mythical Creatures Locked in Mortal Combat.

Shing-Shang is a chess-like game played on a 10x8 grid.  The object of the game is to advance dragon pieces onto the opponent's protected area of the board. You control 2 dragons (which move by jumping over and capturing other pieces - as in draughts), 4 lions (can move one space each, or by jumping over other lions or dogs) and 6 dogs (moves 1 or 2 spaces or by jumping other dogs).

title: Fractals!
description: Fractals!(tm) provides an exceptional challenge as all players simultaneously work to find a home for their tiles on the game board.  The first person to place all their tiles wins.  The name of the game is derived from the property that the game board itself is an enlarged image of the tiles being placed.  Each placed tile will be a member of four interlocking numerical series that appear on the tile diagonals.  There is a built-in tutorial game for learning how to play Fractals!.  But really it's not hard: Anyone who can count to nine can play.  Even though there are 320 game pieces!

title: Global Conflict: Vietnam 1970
description:
From the website: Vietnam - 1970
After the defeat of the Japanese in the Pacific, America had to formulate a policy for Asia and the rest of the world. As allies of Ho Chi Minh's fighters against the Japanese, it is clear that the U.S. had several choices in Indochina. The decision to back the French, attempting to regain control of the region, led to America's eventual involvement, and all the consequences thereof. The war that ended in 1973 had led to all of the following: 57,661 U.S. servicemen dead, 2 million Vietnamese dead, the first military defeat for the U.S., internal turmoil in the U.S., distrust of the government and military, the devastation of much of Vietnam, and many other things. Is it possible the war could have turned out differently? It is up to you to decide...

Now YOU can take over where Nixon failed! Send them 'Tin Soldiers' far away FROM the grounds of Kent State et al, and unto the killing fields where they belong. Using your 'AA' pieces along with some others, then you too can attempt to rectify the situation in Southeast ASIA, where the domino effect concerning 'Communism' was at its height! SEE if the Bombing Cambodia Campaign would have truly been 'effective', OR perhaps an EXTRA couple 100-thousand 'Troops' might have done the deal instead. Here's your chance to re-write some gaming 'History', and either rise UP to the 'occasion', or 'go down' through Defeat in detail with THIS!

title: Disney Princess Gowns & Crowns Game
types: Children's Game Dice Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
From the manufacturer:

Like all Princesses, these four want to go to the ball. But only one will get to. Which will it be? Cinderella, Belle, Aurora or Snow White? Help these Princesses find their gowns, crowns, purses and bouquets then hurry back to their castles to get dressed up before the Prince arrives. The first Princess dressed and back to their castle will be the queen of the ball and live happily ever after! No reading required to play.

title: Mississauga on Board
description:
With a population of over 600,000, Mississauga is Canada's 7th  largest city, the safest city in Canada to live, work and play.  Mississauga is where you will find Canada's busiest airport - Lester B. Pearson, some of Ontario's best shopping centers - Square One, Canada's first interactive entertainment center - Playdium, and some of the best salmon fishing in the world.

With the greatest concentration of major highways in the country, Mississauga is easy to get to - in fact, 29 of Canada's Top 500 corporations are headquartered here.

Now, how would you like to own it?  Mississauga On Board is a unique real estate trading game that celebrates our city, as well as the businesses, attractions and people that make it exceptional.  Roll the dice, move your game piece around the board, and buy any property that catches your eye.

The city is yours for the taking...one property at a time!

title: Rich Little's VCR Charades
description: Rich Little acts out Charades on a video tape and two teams have to guess the charade before the team on the video tape guesses correctly. Teams also act out charades for scoring on their own.

title: S'witches
description:
From the box:

Hilarious switching game for the whole family.  Each player selects a witch, all identical except for the color under the base.  Roll the die and move any playing piece.  Fun starts when you land on a switch space.  Other players must cover their eyes while you make your move by switching pieces.  Land on look space and you can check the color under one piece.  Winner is the first player to take their witch across the finish line.  Take the wrong witch and you end up in the white cauldron and must wait until your next turn to win.  Includes gameboard, die, and 4 identical witches.

title: Hand in Hand
description:
The game of many new friendships! Cheerful children from all over the world hold hands in this game when the picture boards are placed together correctly. Contents: With 36 little wooden tiles.

The game plays by laying out the tiles face up. Then on turn, players roll two dice. One displays either hat or no hat, and the other displays either girl or boy. The player rolls the dice, then selects a tile that matches the roll, for example a girl with a hat. They then add this tile to the string of tiles by having the kids all hold hands. Since the hands come off different sides of the tiles depending on the child, the string that is created often winds and turns.

Le classique Selecta avec de nouvelles illustrations. Des enfants joyeux de tous les pays se donnent la main quand les images sont places correctement. Avec les 36 cartes , il y a beaucoup de variations possibles.

Frhliche Kinder aus aller Welt reichen sich in diesem Spiel die Hand, wenn die Bildplttchen richtig aneinandergelegt werden. Inhalt: 36 Holztfelchen

Ages 3 and up.

title: Färg & Form
description:
This game is for children Ages 4 and up and is used to learn different types of shapes, and also to recognize color and to be able to see a relation between shape and color.

You divide all the tiles by color and shape.

Then you take turns drawing bits from the pouch, trying to find a specific shape and color. You can see from your tiles which bits you are missing and so you try to find those in the pouch.

You can also see the other players tiles and so you know if there is only one of a specific bit left in the pouch, and try to get that one and in doing so you stop an opponent from completing his tiles. This gets you a point at the end of the game.

The winner is the one who first get all bits on the tiles or who has the highest point total.

title: Bokstavsspel ABC sa lilla t
description:
The purpose of this game is to learn the alphabet.

A pair is a match if you turn over both the small letter and the capitol letter.

Players take turns drawing two cards. If the cards are a match they can continue to find more pairs.

If they are not a pair then the cards are returned to the same place on the table.

The winner is the one with most pairs when all tiles have been taken.

title: Andedammen
description: In Andedammen each child controls a colored duck filled with 'eggs' (round wooden balls). The ducks must then move along a narrow path around their pond to get to a large nest in the middle. But next to each section of the path is a small nest, and if another duck ends up on a space where there is already standing a duck, he pushes that one onto the nest next to the path. The duck having been pushed onto the small nest will then loose an egg (it will fall into the nest). The winner is the duck ending up with most eggs when getting to the large nest in the middle of the pond. It is possible to have more than one winner in this game.

title: Tonobeb
description:
A dice game described in the premier issue of Gameplay Magazine (February 1983) played on a 7 square by 14 square board. The dice are not rolled, but instead moved around the board as pieces. Each player starts with six dice. one of each pip-strength from 1 to 6 in opposite corners of the board.
Pieces move horizontally or vertically the number of spaces shown on the top face of each die, or one space more or one less. If moved more or less the value, of the die is changed to show the actual number of spaces moved.
Units can be eliminated from play in one of three ways called eliminating, capturing, and fourwalling.
Eliminating is landing on an opposing piece by exact count, removing it from play.
Pieces are captured by placing opposing pieces on either side, adjacent, and replacing it with a die of the opposing player's color.
Fourwalling is blocking a piece from moving its required number of spaces in every direction. Fourwalled pieces are removed from play.
The object of the game is to eliminate all opposing pieces.

title: TaleSpin: The Card Game
types: Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Print & Play
description:
(Ripped from the Web Site)

Can you be the first to deliver your cargo and claim the title of Cape Suzette's fastest shipping company? Or are you planning on stealing it all to increase the wealth and legend of the Sky Pirates?

Whatever your goal, you can take it to the clouds in TaleSpin: The Card Game. A fan-created game based on the Disney animated cartoon, TaleSpin: The Card Game is only available here as an online download. It's completely free... you just have to make it yourself!

TaleSpin: The Card Game consists of over 120 cards, divided into Player cards, Location cards and deck cards. A six sided die is required to play. Up to 4 people can travel the world of Disney's TaleSpin, playing cargo, picking up passengers and starting aerial dogfights. You'll have to manage your cards carefully... or risk being shot out of the sky by your opponents!

http://www.fourhman.com/talespin/

Major game features:
- four player characters with different attributes
- secondary characters come with randomized game effects
- all cards double as dogfight maneuvers
- bluffing mechanic keeps opponents guessing
- website rules include solitaire version
- website offers base card set, and optional expansion set (more powerful and complicated cards)
- design and theme stays true to the source material

title: The Mind Game
description:
Create the longest possible line in a growing grid of lines on Hex tiles, each with 3 lines in two colors.  This was an antecedant of Tantrix, and was called Tantrix at one time.

Similar to:

    Tantrix
    Kaliko

title: Star Force One
description:
An Action Game . . . Encounter Alien Starfighters and Mysteries of Deep Space Flight.

This simple colorful children's game is built into a small hardcover book that opens to display a pop-up backdrop and everything you will need to play the game. The rules are printed on the back cover, but the game can be opened and closed without disturbing play.

This is because the playing pieces are bound into the book and rotate around the gameboard, a handy feature that also keeps them from getting lost. The game also uses a spinner to regulates movement and a Scanner Wheel to resolve Red Alerts (events) and attacks on Alien Starfighters.

A Wanderer Book Take Along Game from Simon and Schuster.

title: Desert Rats
description:
Desert Rats is a simulation of the campaign fought in the Western desert between December 1940 and December 1942.
Two maps showing that portion of Libya and Egypt where the campaign was fought.
182 counters

title: Heroscape Expansion Set: Zanafor's Discovery
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Fighting Miniatures Science Fiction
description:
Zanafor's Discovery is the fourth small Expansion Set (wave 4) in the HeroScape series.

There are 4 booster packs:


     Greeks  Vipers
     Soulborgs  Elves
     Lawmen  Samurai 
     Heroes of Trollsford


Each pack contains 5-7 new figures, army unit cards and some terrain pieces, but no glyphs.

title: Un-Uh! No, He Di'int!
description:
The game of secrets and laughter. This party game for girls includes spaces such as Bad Boyfriend Bash, Do Something Silly, and more.

The game includes a 12  in. x 7  in. game board, a die, a Talk-About-It spinner, and 6 game markers.

title: Totalisator Greyhound Racing Game
description:
From the rules:
This is a most exciting game, full of thrills from start to finish. A wonderfully entertaining game for family and friends.
It differs from other race games in that the players do not assume ownership of the greyhounds, but participate only in betting on the results of the races.

Four players operate the win, place,tote-double and forecast pools and issue tickets to the bettors.
A dice is rolled to decide which of six greyhounds move.
The player with most money after a series of races is the winner.

The box of components is separate from the board. Components consist of betting tickets, money, six cardboard greyhounds on metal bases, and a die.
The board consists of a greyhound race track in the middle of the board and various betting areas around the track.

title: Trollerispelet
description:
