        E

        T

    
    
        O

        P

        E

        R

        A

    
    
        R

        O

        T

        A

        S

title: Battle for Stalingrad Micro Game
description:
The Battle for Stalingrad WWII Micro Strategy Board Game is a fast paced mini game for two players. It covers Stalingrad and the surrounding area, and begins with the German 1942 offensive on the Russian Front.

It was published in Empires of History Magazine issue #1, and includes:
-11 x 14.75 full color game board
-2 zone maps for Upper and Lower Stalingrad
-108 plastic playing tokens

title: Bedlam
description:
Contents:

One spinner, one queen sized sheet.

From the back of the box:

For best results more than one player is needed.

The object of Bedlam is to maneuver you and your partner into the most compromising positions possible.

To start, each player sits on the Bedlam sheet. Sensuous bedroom attire and a bottle of wine can add pleasure to the game.

Each player takes turns spinning the Bedlam spinner. When the spinner points to one of the four colors the player who spun may move a hand or foot to that color. Knees and elbows may touch the sheet.

If the spinner points to Anything Goes, that player is given complete freedom of movement over the entire Bedlam sheet. This player may position their body any place on the game sheet as long as the other player(s) do not move from their positions. When the player is satisfied with their position, play resumes.

If a player spins Your Request, the player who spun may position the other players on the Bedlam sheet in any position desired as long as they do not move from their position.

When the players have reached compromising positions, Bedlam is declared and you take it from there. Have fun and remember, 'It's not whether you win or lose but Where you play the game'.

Re-implements:

    Twister

title: Pingu på skattjakt
description: Easy bluffing game for children. You choose small ice blocks and then one opponent tries to deceive you whether there is gold underneath the block or not. The first player to collect five gold is the winner.

title: Bible Charades
description:
The historical game of hysterical fun!

You've played charades before, but never like this! A new twist on Bible knowledge games that is guaranteed to animate every party, youth group, classroom, or family gathering. Teams of players race around the game board by correctly guessing charades of clues in one of six categories.

Bible Charades provides an excellent way for families and friends to strengthen their knowledge of God's Word.

Simple versatile rules allow for limitless variations

1,200 charade titles in 6 categories

Color coded categories with convenient on the board reference

Optional timer - select your own pace

2-4 teams, Ages 10 and up

Games includes: 200 boxed topic cards, game board, four playing pieces, die, 30 plastic chips and instruction sheet.

title: Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot Deluxe
description:
A venerable cabal bent on world-domination has sent one of their greatest champions to steal the reactor core... but so have their enemies. Bathed in atomic radiation, these champions fight to the death, in order to claim the sweet, sweet uranium for their people... and victory!

This is a game of marker-management where each combatant can manipulate their various character ratings (Attack, Defense, Mojo, etc.) each turn while trying to eliminate their opponent's tokens. Tokens can be replenished or stolen from the central pot. The player to eliminate all of his enemies first wins but variable character special abilities, usable on their turns, as well as random mutations can complicate the effort.

Re-implements:

    Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot

title: Bible Characters
description:
From the Publisher: A popular form of Bible Study for the home, and profitable entertainment for social gatherings for young and old.

Consists of 33 cards, each featuring a character from the Bible.  4 clues on each card lead players to the correct character.  The instructions include 9 play variants, including a version of charades.

title: Riistavisa
description: A Finnish trivia game about hunting, from hunters for hunters.

title: Le Secret de Grimbergen
description:
Le Secret de Grimbergen (The Secret of Grimbergen) is a deduction game produced for the Grimbergen Abbey Brewery in Belgium.  The game is described as being a Medieval Adventure and is published in French and Dutch.

From the box:

Walk through the corridors and rooms of Grimbergen Abbey to find the monks that will permit you to discover the secret of the beer that you wish to make.  You will need to unite the three monks that each know a part of the secret, in one of the rooms in the Abbey.  In order to do this you will need to enter the secret maze, pass through obscure tunnels and battle with your adversaries.  Who will be the first to discover the Secret of Grimbergen?

Components:

1 board
2 d6
5 playing pieces
1 pad of sheets showing plans of the Abbey
12 monk markers
12 'secret' cards (showing which three monks you need to find) 
44 Abbey cards
5 pencils
1 set of rules

title: The Black Heritage Trivia Game
description: The Black Heritage Trivia Game is a fun and challenging way to show what you know about black history and culture.  The game contains over 1200 questions and answers.  Get the answers right and make your way to the inner circle.  But be careful, your opponent is trying to send you back to the start!  Be ready for hours of enlightening entertainment.

title: Friendzee: Close Connections Edition
description:
Players move game pieces around the Friendzee game board by rolling cubes that direct them to draw from three sets of cards:
1) LIVE OUT LOUD--surprising and meaningful experiences challenge participants to tell stories, sculpt clay, write, sketch, perform charades...and more.
2) DIVE IN DEEP--gets them digging into Bible passages and studying God's Word together on a more personal level.
3) RISKZEE--a roll of the dice directs players to do both wacky and Bible-themed activities as they explore Scripture.
All three cards guide teens around the game board and to the ENDZEE. There are no winners and no losers--the game ends when everyone reaches the ENDZEE and commits to a challenge for the week.

The Close Connections Edition helps teens build close friendships by having them discuss Acceptance, Forgiveness, Trust, Accountability, Transparency, and Genuine Love.

title: XIG 4E: Fire Pathway
types: Card Game Collectible Components Expansion for Base-game Puzzle
description:
XIG is a tile-laying game where players try to be the first to complete their own pathway - based on one of four elements: Earth, Water, Fire, and Air - as quickly as possible by laying down puzzle-piece style tiles. There are also cards that can help you advance or hinder your opponent. The pathways are sold in complete sets, and booster packs of cards are currently planned.

The base game includes the Water and Earth pathways.  This is one of the first two expansions for the game (the other being the Air pathway).  It includes the entire Fire pathway, a set of XAG cards, a small collector's box, and 2 special bonus new edition XAG cards plus 1 special limited edition foil puzzle piece.  Other future expansions are hinted at in the rules.

Expands:

    XIG: The Four Elements

title: Yak
description:
From the rule sheet:
Yak is a board game for 2 players, which involves a combination of luck and skill.  Typical duration of the game is about 15 minutes.

Objectives:
The object of the game is to move your counters across the board whilst your opponent moves their counters across the board in the opposite direction.  The winner is the first player to remove off all of their counters.

Equipment:
A long narrow board marked with 16 squares in a single line.  There are 16 counters and 4 dice, 8 white counters plus 2 white dice and 8 black counters plus 2 black dice.

title: Battle of the Bulge
description:
This is a Japanese wargame about the Battle of the Bulge 1944.
It was mostly called SS Bulge because there are many games of the same name.

This game was firstly published as one of the SS(Small size war Simulation) series in 1990.
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #46 in 2002, along with D-Day.

Designed by Yasushi Nakaguro.

title: Mastergoal
description:
MASTERGOAL is a Football / Soccer Board Game translated onto a board, with all the ingredients that make this sport the most exciting and universal.

There are two teams with their corresponding Goal-keepers, and a Ball. The game consists of putting the Ball onto the squares of the opposite Goal post.

Multi-lingual rules included.

Claims to be a PRODUCTO OFICIAL de LIGA NACIONAL DE FUTBOL PROFESIONAL

title: Dicecar
description:
From the publisher's web site:

This is Dicecar's Tri-Oval Speedway. Now available with either Dicecar Jr. rules and Extreme Dicecar rules packages.
Heres the skinny of what Dicecar is. Dicecar is a Table Top Racing game that is played using dice and cards. The drivers must have their own 1/64th scale race cars. These are available at most department stores in the toy section or at your local racing collectible stores. Some spaces on the race track allow you lane changes or prompt you to draw cards which could be good or bad. Pit road is outlined in yellow, so you know where the speed limit begins. Strategies include pit stops in which you choose gas only, one side or both sides tire changes. Avoiding trouble and making moves which can put you in front of the competition are important strategies as well. To win you must be the first driver to cross the start/finish line after completing all of the laps and pit stops. Table Top Racing is no fantasy as you race face to face with your family and friends. Everyone can race at Dicecar. You dont need to be a race fan to enjoy the game. Racing knowledge can help but it is not necessary. Experience counts, so race a few times as you develop your strategy. Dicecar includes qualifying, drafting, unscheduled pit stops for tire or engine trouble. Crashes can happen and the yellow flag will bring out the pace car for a caution. Have fun racing and building your 1/64th scale racing world. Different tracks are available as well as accessories like the high banks and soft walls. Other items such as the pace car, jet dryer trucks, tow trucks and ambulances are also available and make your world of Dicecar a lot of fun.

title: Family Guy Trivia Game
description:
From the back of the box.

Peter, the big, lovable loaf who always says what's on his mind. Lois the adoring mother who can't figure out why her baby son keeps trying to kill her. Their daughter Meg the teen drama queen who's constantly embarrassed by her family. Chris, the beefy 13-year-old who wouldn't hurt a fly, unless it landed on his hot dog. Stewie, the maniacal one-year-old bent on world domination. And Brian, the sarcastic dog with a wit as dry as the martinis he drinks.

Now at long last, a Trivia Game based on television's most dysfunctional cartoon family!

1000 Trivia Questions will keep you guessing-- and laughing!

title: Don't Touch That Dial
types: Economic Movies / TV / Radio theme Print & Play
description: Return with us now to those thrilling days of yesteryear, as players compete from coast-to-coast to build the most successful radio network. Players control NBC-Red, NBC-Blue, CBS or Mutual. They bid to purchase popular programs and hire stars to host them. They sell the shows to sponsors who will pay well to brand their products with the right show. They advertise in local markets to add listeners and increase ratings. The player with the most popular network at the end of the game is the winner.

title: ConverStation
types: Deduction Dice Educational Memory Trains Word Game
description:
This game was created by a speech pathologist to ensure that conversation doesn't become a lost art.  The designer found that children that are not used to adult conversation will often reply to questions with one-word answers or an answer not related to what the question that they were asked.  The game is also helpful for adults that have had strokes, brain injuries, or are attempting to relearn or expand their language skills.

As a player lands on certain colored game board squares in a train track format, a player chooses one of 240 question cards, divided into the four corresponding color categories of Wh- Questions, If I..., Tell about..., and How do you....  The game cards have three levels: kids, adults, and both.

The companion workbook called ConverStation Graphic Expression teaches people when to express themselves in writing versus conversation.

The board game hit the market in June 2005, winning the 2005 Preferred Choice Award from Creative Child magazine as a Toy of the Year Finalist.

The game is published by Say It Right, a small press educational publisher based in Tybee Island, Georgia.  Their website is www.sayitright.org.

title: Kid's Bible Challenge
description:
OBJECT: To be the first Player or team to move from Genesis (start) to Revelation (finish),

CONTENTS: 100 trivia cards that are divided into 6 categories.

Each Category is represented by a color/symbol:

Orange / Tablets = 0ld Testament

Green / Cross = New Testament

Red / City = Places

Yellow / Rainbow = Objects and Events

Brown / 123 = Numbers

Blue / ? = General

- 4 colored player markers, a 6-sided die, playing board and travel box,

title: Deep Space Division Fission
description: Put a mathematical twist on the classic card game War! In place of ordinary flashcard drills, players solve basic addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division facts as they try to win all the cards in the deck. (108) 3 inch x 4-1/2 inch cards. 2 or more players.

title: Extreme Action Subtraction
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Math
description: Put a mathematical twist on the classic card game War! In place of ordinary flashcard drills, players solve basic addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division facts as they try to win all the cards in the deck. (108) 3 inch x 4-1/2 inch cards. 2 or more players.

title: World Vacation Multiplication
description: Put a mathematical twist on the classic card game War! In place of ordinary flashcard drills, players solve basic addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division facts as they try to win all the cards in the deck. (108) 3 inch x 4-1/2 inch cards. 2 or more players.

title: Vanished Planet: Racial Advantage Expansion
types: Economic Expansion for Base-game Exploration Print & Play Science Fiction Space Exploration
description:
Free to print  play (see link in Weblinks section below).

From the publisher's website (vanishedplanet.com):

The official Vanished Planet expansion is here! The expansion adds a new race, new racial powers for all races, new movement rules, and a twist to the Creature. Vanished Planet is more fun than ever!

Expands:

    Vanished Planet

title: Family Derby
description: Family Derby is a horse racing simulation game. Players bet on horses each race to Win Place and/or Show. The game ends after a series of races with the winner determined by which player has totaled the most winnings.

title: Masterquiz
description:
MASTERQUIZ comes with 600 question cards each of which has 9 questions on the following subjects - Geography, Natural History, Oddball, Arts, Life, Science, Entertainment, Sport, History - the answers are printed on the reverse of the question card.  Also included are a gameboard, pack of 55 subject category cards, playing chips, score pad and rules book.

The questions and various combinations of the other components are used to make 4 different quiz games described on the box as follows:

Game 1
Choose your specialist subject.  Answer the crucial questions.  Move on to the inner General Knowledge track.  Use guile and genius, leapfrog past opponents to win at the center.

Game 2
Here's a game for the family, a party or your club's quiz night.  It's easy to play - decide the subject rounds.  There's a simple, effective, scoring system with a score pad to keep the tally.

Game 3
It's not only your knowledge but your card playing skills combined with a slice of luck that makes a winner in this engrossing game.  Each card dealt entitles you to answer a question on the displayed subject.

Game 4
The chips are down in THE game for quiz aficionados!  Successfully gain and defend subject chips to win.  The initiative is with the question master until, by your brilliance, you claim the MASTERQUIZ chip!

title: Short Vowel Lotto
description: Players learn to identify short vowels through rhyming and/or matching activities.

title: Math Magic 2
description:
Math Magic 2

The challenge continues - The same rules and strategies apply as in the original Math Magic but the challenge continues with Square Values, Cubes, Square Roots, Cube Roots and Joker Tiles.

title: Double Tangoes
description:
Double Tangoes is the extension of Tangoes, using two sets of tans in each puzzle, instead of one.  The package consists of four sets of seven tans, in two colors, and about a hundred puzzle cards.

The two player game has two players racing to construct the same picture; but it's just as likely that you'll play solitaire,  or play cooperatively.

Doubling the pieces more than doubles the difficulty of regular Tangoes.

title: Magna Force
description: A balance game in which players must roll a die and remove a pillar from the tower that matches the dies' color. The pillars are removed by using a magnetic rod. Play continues until the tower collapses. The player who made it collapse gets no points, and the others add up the pillars they successfully removed, tallying up their scores.

title: Kampen om Rai
description:
This game is included in a series of books called Drageherren (The Dragon master, an easy-to-read fantasy series by Josefine Ottesen). The basic game comes with the first book in the series and the rest of the books will have small expansions to the game.

The basic game plays a little like the old Titan boardgame, with each player having secret armies on the map. Each player got one treasure hidden in one of his armies, and the goal is to get both of them to Rai (the capital in the middle of the board) and keep them there for 3 turns.

The two players will try to get his armies into the most favorable terrain which is different for each unit. Each army got one leader and two units (hidden at the start of the game) and the combat is simple dice rolling. The board is made in the same way as in Settlers of Catan, and  uses hexes with various terrain.

Kampen om Rai was published as a base set in book 1. Followed by 10 sequels with 10 expansions total.
Some expansions inlcude more players, more cards and the veteran unit extra cards.

Book 8 opens for sea battles and sea monsters
Book 9 and 10 contributes with a boardgame map (poster-like)

title: Pitwits
description:
The quick-witted game for for quick-witted people!

Pitwits challenges you to think fast, but think straight.  You all take a turn to read a set of five clues to the others, the clues get easier as more are read.  You simply shout out the answer when you think you know it; if correct all the others move down the board towards the pit and out of the game, if wrong then you move towards the pit.

Movement is related to the number of clues which have been read before the answer is given - the more clues, the less movement - e.g. 1 clue = 5 spaces, 5 clues = 1 space.

The last player left in the game wins.

title: Colour Magic
description:
Colour Magic

From the makers of Math Magic and Math Magic 2 comes a new challenge as a puzzle for a single player or a game for two players. Colour Magic relies on your power of deduction to place your tiles on the board so they do not cover any of a designated color. The player who places the most tiles wins. Sounds simple? This game will challenge all who love games of logic and strategy. Great for travel! Contains small parts, not suitable for children under the age of four.

title: Buster Brown and the Goat
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Memory
description: A card game featuring Buster Brown, Tige, and friends similar to Old Maid. The Goat is the odd card or the Old Maid that you don't want to be caught with or you lose the game!

title: Friendzee: Christian Character Edition
description:
Players move game pieces around the Friendzee game board by rolling cubes that direct them to draw from three sets of cards:
1) LIVE OUT LOUD--surprising and meaningful experiences challenge participants to tell stories, sculpt clay, write, sketch, perform charades...and more.
2) DIVE IN DEEP--gets them digging into Bible passages and studying God's Word together on a more personal level.
3) RISKZEE--a roll of the dice directs players to do both wacky and Bible-themed activities as they explore Scripture.
All three cards guide teens around the game board and to the ENDZEE. There are no winners and no losers--the game ends when everyone reaches the ENDZEE and commits to a challenge for the week.

The Christian Character Edition encourages teen to deepen their faith by discussing Courage, Integrity, Humility, Grace, Compassion, and Perseverance.

title: XIG 4E: Air Pathway
types: Card Game Collectible Components Expansion for Base-game Puzzle
description:
XIG is a tile-laying game where players try to be the first to complete their own pathway - based on one of four elements: Earth, Water, Fire, and Air - as quickly as possible by laying down puzzle-piece style tiles. There are also cards that can help you advance or hinder your opponent. The pathways are sold in complete sets, and booster packs of cards are currently planned.

The base game includes the Water and Earth pathways.  This is one of the first two expansions for the game (the other being the Fire pathway).  It includes the entire Air pathway, a set of XAG cards, a small collector's box, and 2 special bonus new edition XAG cards plus 1 special limited edition foil puzzle piece.  Other future expansions are hinted at in the rules.

Expands:

    XIG: The Four Elements

title: Barnum's Animals Crackers Game
types: Animals Card Game Children's Game Memory
description:
An over-sized animal crackers box (complete with string handle) containing 16 animal cards, 9 plastic animal crackers/cookies and a cloth bag to put them in.

The rules describe three games to be played with these components, all of which are memory/matching games:

1) One card is placed face down for each animal in the bag.  Players draw an animal from the bag and then attempt to flip over the corresponding card.  Success allows the player to retain the card and animal cracker, while failure requires the player to return the cracker to the bag and flip the card back over.

2) As above, but two cards are placed for each animal and players must attempt to match the drawn cracker with both matching cards.

3) All cards are placed face-down in a stack.  Players draw a card from the stack and then attempt to retrieve the matching animal cracker from the bag by feel (without looking).  Success allows the player to keep the matching set, while failure requires that the animal be returned to the bag.

In all cases, the winner is the player with the most card/cracker sets.

Best played while nibbling on Barnum's Animals Crackers.

title: The New and Fashionable Game of the Jew
description:
Cloth-backed, hand-colored folding engraving with slip cover.  Shows a publication date of May 27th, 1807.  Board is 18.5 x 16, cover is 7 x 5.

Game is played with two six-sided dice, but while I have pictures of the case and board, I can find no explantion of game play other than this quote from Deconstructing Sondheim, a March 8, 1993 New Yorker article by Stephen Schiff:

When you enter his five-story town house in midtown Manhattan, the first thing you notice, besides an enormous black poodle named Max, is his antique-game collection: on the walls, in glass museum cases, on various low tables. Most of the items look faintly sinister: here is something called Schimmel, or Ball and Hammer and here an inscrutable British concoction, Squails, and, behind the sofa, his earliest acquisitionthe ghastly New and Fashionable Game of the Jew, a dice game devised in 1811 that, according to Sondheim, taught kids to be anti-Semitic. But all the games you see here are very nice to look at and real boring, he adds. This thing about gamesI'm not really fascinated with games.

--
Looks to be a variation of Gluckshaus.  Roll both dice and pay the amount rolled onto the space of the same value.  If there is something already on the space, collect it instead.  Rolling a 7 always pays to the Jew space.  Rolling a 12 collects all the counters on the board.
From: http://www.gamesetal.net/Stock_Pages/GLB/glb3930.htm

title: Watson's Education
description:
This is based on my older game Watson's Bible Inquest (Biblical characters have been replaced with historical figures).  It is a game of deduction where players draw cards and must deduce which historical figures are in the opponents hands based on a set of questions.  Points are awarded for correct guesses and points given to the opponents for incorrect guesses.  The game is scalable for different age groups or experience.  It is also educational, although this aspect is not necessary (players may use the charts provided with the game instead).

It is available for free download (Print and Play) at my web site:

http://www.tzon.org/watson.htm

title: Watson's Bible Inquest
description:
This is my new game of deduction.  Players draw cards and must deduce which Biblical characters are in the opponents hands based on a set of questions.  Points are awarded for correct guesses and points given to the opponents for incorrect guesses.  The game is scalable for different age groups or experience.  It is also educational, although this aspect is not necessary (players may use the charts provided with the game instead).

It is available for free download (Print and Play) at my web site:

http://www.tzon.org/watson.htm

title: Vulgarville
description:
Filled with naughty cartoons and dirty jokes, this wild party game will leave you in hysterics!

In Vulgarville, worst is first. Your goal is to become the town's Mayor. This means bribing, stealing and back stabbing as you race to accumulate votes. Meet the hilarious town patrons, such as Chuck Chunks and Skidmark Rose. These patrons will vote for you throughout the game... if you can hold on to them!
Collect as many 0, 8 and 15 triples as possible. Players act simultaneously.

title: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Wissen, Lachen, Sachen machen
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
From Adam Spielt:

A set-collection and action game. This fun-filled roll-and-move game with mouse and bear doesn't just demand knowledge, but also activity! Mouse asks all sorts of interesting questions, and Bear asks the players to carry out all sorts of actions. Lots of new things to learn and lots to laugh about! Guaranteed fun for young and old!

Contents: 1 game board, 6 playing figures, 80 cards, 1 die, 2 watch hands.

title: Checkered Flag
description:
Checkered Flag is similar in nature to Formula-1 and Speed Circuit.  Players choose their cars speed on a dashboard and move one space for every 20 miles per hour.  The same dashboard is used to track fuel usage, tire wear and brake wear.  Players also have a small hand of five cards that provide certain benefits when played.  Unlike the other two games, Checkered Flag simulates stock car racing.

Given that speeds are more constant in stock car racing, there are only three speed choices; 60, 120 and 180 miles per hour.  At the beginning of the race and after a pit stop, cars start off at 60.  In the two turns, the maximum speed is 120.  The turns drive the primary choices available, as some lanes provide a shorter path than others.  The choice lanes have a cost in fuel usage or tire wear.  The first car to complete three laps wins the race.

title: Schleckermaul
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Players each represent one of the 'little gourmands', a snail, frog, ladybug or mouse.  Players move by throwing a three sided die unique to that creature.  The object is to collect four food tokens of your color or black.  If you pick the color of another player, they have the chance of 'winning' the food if they can guess which hand you are hiding it in.

Ages 3-5.

title: Chu Shogi
description:
Chu Shogi is a Japanese cousin of FIDE Chess and ancestor of Modern Shogi.  Each player controls 46 pieces, and play is on a 1212 board.  The object is to capture your opponent's King (and Crown Prince, if they have promoted their Drunk Elephant).  Unlike Modern Shogi, this game is played without drops.

The game is much larger than Chess and Shogi.  The pieces consist of such interesting pieces as the Drunk Elephant, Phoenix, Kylin, Free Boar, Flying Ox, and many other colorfully-named pieces including the incredibly powerful Lion.

title: Gulpin' Guppies
description:
From the publisher:

Something's fishy around here....it must be Gulpin' Guppies! Gobble up the competition as you swim toward the beach, but don't let them gobble you first! Goofy Gulpin' Guppies fit inside one another, making quick fish food out of unsuspecting swimmers! Make your way as you watch out for the wave or you may get all washed up! Be the first to get all 4 of your guppies to the beach, and you're the Guppy that gets the glory! Ages 4 and up.

Players are trying to get their four fish through a set of rapids. The first player to do this is the winner. Obstacles like hungry bigger fish and furious waves try to spot you from getting through the rapids.

title: Gabula u Gabeli
description:
A game based on a theory that the legendary city of Troy was located somewhere near Gabela (small town in Bosnia and Herzegovina). That's why it is called Gabula u Gabeli which can be translated as Trouble in Gabela.
Players take roles of heroes from Greek mythology. The goal of the game is to discover Troy and win Helen's heart.

title: Foto Yu
description: A game in which you travel across the republics of former Yugoslavia and take photographs of beautiful landscapes and historical monuments. Player who takes the most photos is the winner.

title: Sure Shot Baseball
description:
Various versions of this game have existed for many years. I am not sure if this game has been renamed?

Sure Shot Baseball is a two person game played much the same way as outdoor baseball.  The game consists of nine innings of 3 outs each.  The pitcher rolls a plastic marble down a slide and it heads toward a batter controlled by their opponent.  The batter tries to hit the ball out of the stadium by turning a batting knob.  If it goes out of the unique up-curved field the fielder then tries to catch it.  Singles, doubles, triples, foul balls, and home runs are determined where the ball goes over the wall.  The runners stay in their team dugouts until it is time to position them on the field.

Each batter gets only one pitch. A missed pitch counts as one out.  Each team gets three outs and then players change positions.  Players play nine innings and whomever has the most runs wins.

There are a few other simple rules.  The game is quite tricky to learn and play competitively.  But it is definitely a fun experience if you enjoy baseball!!

title: Camp
description: Each player has seven pieces representing tents on a 6x5 board representing a field. Beside the board, a marker indicates how many spaces pieces can move (1, 2, or 3). The players take turn moves a tent vertically, horizontally, or diagonally into a free space (without jumping or capturing). After moving, the player moves the movement marker one space clockwise, which chenges the rate of movement for the opposing player. The player who moves his pieces such that none of his tents are adjacent to each other is the winner. A nice little game from Abacus (weisse Serie).

title: Das Arche-Noah Spiel
types: Animals Children's Game Educational Electronic Memory
description: The Great Flood is coming and players are helping Noah to get the animals into the Ark. Each player has six different animals that are moved towards the Ark. To move an animal, a player must recognize an animal sound coming from the Ark and will have to find a corresponding card on the table.

title: High 5
description:
High 5 is a party game that, like the more popular Cranium which it pre-dates, combines five party-style games into one.

Players (or teams) roll four 10-sided dice to generate a four-digit number that corresponds to a question in The Book of 10,000 Questions. The number also indicates which of the five categories of game type the player will have. The categories are: Pic-Wit (Pictionary) Bull-Wit (Balderdash) Ham-Wit (Charades) Sher-Wit (20 Questions) and Wiz-Wit (Trivia).

The question book indicates how many spaces the players advance. In some situations, both the players asking the questions and the players responding will be able to advance. In other situations, an incorrect answer will send a player backwards along the track.

Questions for younger players are included in the question book, allowing players to create an easier game for children.

title: Saint Seiya Cardgame Collection
types: Card Game Collectible Components Movies / TV / Radio theme Mythology
description:
It's a Collectible Card Game based on the popular anime series Saint Seiya,  all in Japanese.

It seems you battle your characters using Cosmo points in various power fields : speed, Temperature and Psychokinesis. The playing mat looks fairly similar to the knights of the zodiac one, but the game seems completely different (different stats, different card design)

title: Trip Trap
description:
Players attempt to negotiate a plastic obstacle course using ball bearings fired from whale shooters.  The five obstacles may be arranged in the specific order and layout as suggested in the instructions, or the course can be made harder by increasing the distance between obstacles.  Each obstacle has a unique gimmick and name, such as 'Big Dumper' and 'Man With Falling Pants'.

The first player to successfully negotiate all five obstacles is the winner.

title: Brainsweat
description:
From the back of the box:

Destined to become a classic.

The bottom line of Brainsweat is to earn the most points. Points are based on correct answers but more so on fooling other players.

Brainsweat variations: Scramble. Find as many words as possible in the mixed up letters.

Example: Seafscier--Fricassee (unscrambled word)-sea-ice-far-rice, etc.

Reverse: Co-players attempt to guess the word which has been defined or to create a convincing phony.

Hilarious Oh no what now cards that add another dimension that can be friend or foe.

Example: I've never been to France, but I love French Fries. Add 5 points to my score.

Warning: The Sturgeon General has determined this game could be habit forming.

Includes gameboard, 500 Brainsweat cards, 2 dice, 40 Oh no what now cards, 1 minute timer, 6 playing pieces, 6 pencils, score pad, answer pad, history of the game, scoring rule summary, and instructions

title: X-Ceter-O
description: X fr O? is a new twist on the classic Tic-Tac-Toe game. It includes six game pieces: three Os marked 1, 3 and 5 and three Xs marked 2, 4 and 6. You play on 3 x 3 game board grid. The pieces are played in numerical order. Once the six pieces are on the board, play continues in sequential fashion, with each move exposing the now-vacated square to the opponent. The action ends only when the first player achieves a three-in-a-row combination. With this game there is never a tie.

title: Gnaqush
description:
Its not just the nickname of the games designer  its what youll do with your teeth as your carefully-laid plans get thwarted and blocked over and over again in this strategic Icehouse game for 4 players.

Original game design and concept by Nash, with additional modifications and variants by The Monday Night Games Group.

Object: Promote your one-pip pieces up to two-pip pieces, then three-pip pieces  eventually promoting the three-pip pieces to Nirvana. The first player with all pieces in Nirvana wins.

You Need

* One Icehouse stash for each player. Each player must have a different color.
    * A chessboard.
    * (optional)  16 blocker tokens to fill spaces to modify the board for two or three players.

Normal Play: On your turn you can Jump over an adjacent piece or Slide (Move) one of your valid pieces Move to an adjacent square. When you move a piece or stack into a space occupied by another piece or a stack of pieces, you must cap that stack with the piece(s) you moved.

Ascension: If one or more of your pieces is in your goal square at the end of any turn and your home square is vacant, you must remove one of your pieces from your home square. Set it on its side in front of you, off the board. Put a piece thats one pip larger point up in your home square. If the piece you removed was a three-pip piece, it has ascended to Nirvana  do not put a piece in your home square.

Winning: If youre the first player to send your last three-pip piece to Nirvana, the game ends and you win.

Download the full rules plus variants to the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/271/gnaqush

title: Play the Beats
description:
From the Rules:

THIS IS A MUSIC FUN GAME.

The object of the game is to take your marker along the music staff starting with the introduction going all the way to FINE.

A game apparently designed to teach musical terminology and note counting.

title: Bitter Victory
types: Print & Play Wargame World War II
description:
A game of the Allied invasion of Sicily, 1943.


(from the publisher:)

Most of the rules and mechanics will be familiar to anyone who has ever played a wargame. BSO, however, has added to this simplicity a combat system that rates units for how many dice they get to roll on their behalf, as well as what kind of dice (small arms or heavy weapons). No CRTs, no siree!

The game also uses cards, one deck (of 10) for each player (whose cards are somewhat different from those of the other player) to enhance the game. (They dont 'drive' the game and they can be left out, if youre so inclined.)  The cards are turned into a Resource system that gives the players a number of points which they can use to buy cards or rally units. The choice is theirs, but there are far more choices than points.

The cards, themselves, give the players 'Opportunities', from using their Tank capabilities, to getting more supplies, to special Reaction movement, to appearances by Patton and Monty.

Playing time for BITTER VICTORY has averaged 3 hours, sometimes less, and the rules are only 8 pages, including a section on Solitaire play!

Available in English or French

Components:

    1 rules and scenario booklet with historical introduction (8 pages)
    1 A1 map of Sicily 
    20 colored Opportunity Cards 
    224 counters (NATO Symbols) 
    1 Aid Cards




The Sicily map and the Opportunity Cards have been designed by Pascal Da Silva.

title: Anastasia
description:
This game was premium giveaway item to customers of Shell service stations to promote Twentieth Century Fox Film's theatrical release of their animated film, Anastasia. The game comes with the board folded into a triangular suitcase that holds plastic playing pieces of the movie's five main characters and a sheet that folds into a 6-sided die.

The object of the game is for players to safely arrive in Paris and defeat the evil Rasputan. They accomplish this by rolling the die to move ahead the indicated number of spaces. Once there, they must follow the directions on that space. To win, players must reach the last space and then be the first to make the correct die roll.

title: Jogo de Guerra
description: Jogo de Guerra (literally, War Game) is a Risk-like game of war and conquest. Players throw dice to liberate countries and accomplish missions.

title: Combiletra
description: Combiletra (Combi-letter) is a word game from Sonata. Players shuffle hexagonal letter-tiles, draw them one by one and try to form words.

title: Krebiz-4
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is the description on the cover:

Includes all the rules needed to for play:
- Capitalist Movement--A campaign game
- 7 scenarios for Capitalist Movement

Technical information including:
- More X-1 ships (Cruisers, Capsules  Combination Units)
- An advanced Starbase and Battlestation
- Krebiz Carrier and Control Ships
- Krebiz tactical concepts
- Krebiz units operated by other races
- Battleship variants

Also included: 42 pages of Companion SSDs displaying 42 Krebiz units

Expands

    Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

title: Argonians-2
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is an expansion for the game Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is the description on the cover:

Includes all the rules needed to for play:
- The Argonians: a new star faring race
- Argonian fighter rules
- More Argonian starship descriptions

Historical background for the Argonians:
- Argonian history
- History for the Argonian First Republic (A Far Side race)
- 3 more historical scenarios

Technical information including:
- Ship descriptions for 70 Argonian units
- Argonian fighter rules
- Argonian ship names

Also included: 32 Companion SSDs

Expands:

    Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

title: Mechad-1
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is an expansion for the game Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is from the description on the back cover and contents:

Includes all the rules needed to play:
- The Mechad: a new star faring race of machines
- Bolaar phaser capacitors
- Electromagnetic Field
- Power Distribution Nodes
- Trans-Warp Missiles
- The Distortion Cannon
- Subspace Whips

Historical background for the Mechad:
- Mechad history
- 3 historical scenarios

Technical information including:
- Ship descriptions for 25 Mechad units
- The Mechad tournament command cruiser

Also included: 24 Companion SSDs

title: Far Side-1
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is an unofficial expansion for the game Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is from the description on the back cover and contents:

Includes all the rules needed to for play:
- Two new star-faring races
- Bolaar Phaser Capacitors
- Deflection/Transfer Device
- Option Mounts
- Krebiz Capitalist Alliance
- Variable Plasmas

Historical backgrounds of two new races:
- Bolaar Pirates
- Corporate Aggressors
- Tuforeous Dead Zone

Technical information including:
- A fleet data table listing all the new races ships
- all necessary annexes

Also included: 22 Companion SSDs

Expands:

    Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

title: Official Rules of Card Games
description:
This is a book of rules for common card games published by The United States Playing Card Company.  It also includes suggestions for how to choose which games to play, etiquette, and how to teach children to play card games. (This description refers to the 84th edition.)

This long running book is published by the same manufacturer of the popular Bicycle card brand of standard cards.

The new version of this book is now called: Bicycle Official Rules of Card Games

title: Monopoly: Toys 'R' Us Times Square
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingDice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionTrading
description:
Now the world most popular board game lets you relive the thrill of the 60ft. ferris wheel, and miles of fun-filled aisles at the Toys R Us: Times Square Store.
-Game board features departments from the Toys R Us store such as Game World and Wheel World.
-6 collectible pewter movers: Nerf football, Tonka truck, Hotwheels car, Mr. Potato Head, Mr. Monopoly, and Geoffrey
-Plus a Ferris Wheel and painted wooden hotels and houses.
All packed in a collectible tin, found only at the NY Time Square Toys R Us.

title: Waterloo
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on the Battle of Waterloo.
Published as one of the SS(Small size war Simulation) series in 1989.

title: Sengoku Fight
description: This is an area movement Japanese wargame on the samurai era of Japan. Also has a second edition.

title: Meeple Fling!
description:
It's that time again!  Unity Games is here and all the meeples are ready to party!  They're gathering for a day of wining, dining, and dicing.  You're the host and you have to decide how many and which ones to invite.  Do you want an exclusive party where only select meeples are welcome?  Or do you want a wild riot of a party where everybody is welcome?  Each has its merits and both are subject to unwelcome party crashers.  The player who has the most valuable party at the end of the game wins.

The game was designed for and given to attendees of Unity Games X on January 21, 2006.

title: Krebiz-2
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is the description on the cover:

Includes advanced Krebiz rules:
- Fighter Sabots
- The Krill series fighter
- Capsule Auxiliary Packs

Historical background for the Krebiz:
- Krebiz campaign notes
- Krebiz timeline and planetary system
- More historical scenarios

Technical information including:
- Ship descriptions for an additional 85 units
- The all-new Kraken old style dreadnought
- Three additional refits
- Defense satellites
- Bases

Also included: 30 pages of Companion SSDs displaying 35 Krebiz units

Expands

    Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

title: Krebiz-3
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This is the description on the cover:

Includes all the rules needed to for play:
- Krebiz X-1 improved technology
- Krebiz X-1 ship descriptions

Historical background for the Krebiz:
- Two Krebiz campaign games:
- The War of Annihilation, and
- The Krebiz Scavenger Hunt

Technical information including:
- ship descriptions for the Krebiz X-1 units
- Krebiz FE build costs
- Krebiz campaign notes

Also included: 32 pages of Companion SSDs displaying 35 Krebiz units

Expands

    Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

title: ChessWar
mechanisms: Dice RollingGrid MovementSecret Unit DeploymentVariable Player Powers
description:
(from web site)

ChessWar is a strategic game for two players. It is meant to be played on a standard chessboard with standard chess pieces although it can also be used on any kind of battlefield made of squares. It is NOT chess with dice and some extra rules! Instead, it is strategic game played with chess pieces. So, pieces are not automatically captured, some pieces (units) have ranged attacks and all your pieces (units) may move during your turn.

title: Pyramid (Battlestar Galactica)
types: Bluffing Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description:
Pyramid (Battlestar Galactica) is a card game based on the 1970s television series Battlestar Galactica. It was depicted as leisure activity for the characters in the television show. Later on, rules and decks of pyramid playing cards were made available commercially to fans of the show. Both are currently out of print.
The game uses a 55 count deck of hexagonal cards separated into three kinds of suits and three ranks as well as a 'capstone' card which is used as a wild card. The game is played very similarly to poker. Players are dealt hands and place bets based on how strong their hand is. There is a discard between bets and players reveal their hands to determine the winner of that round.

Winning hands are determined by a number of factors including suit, rank and matching sets. There are approximately fourteen different hand combinations possible in the game. There is no 'end' to the game, players merely quit at their leisure.

The deck consists of 55 hexagonal cards, which is divided into 3 suits: purple, green and orange. Purple ranks highest and orange ranks lowers. The deck also contains a Capstone (*).

Each suit contains:
- 3 First level cards
- 6 Second level cards
- 9 Third level cards

How To Play
Each player is dealt 6 cards. If a player feels a better hand is possible, he may discard up to 4 cards and receive replacements from the dealer. This may only be done once per hand, much the same as Draw Poker. Players then construct their best possible pyramid and compare to the other player hands to determine the winner.
Ranks of Hands
A pyramid is made up of at least three cards.

1. First level pyramid consist of 2 third level, and 1 second level card.

2. Second level pyramid consist of 3 third level, and 2 second level card.

3. Third level pyramid consist of 3 third level, 2 second level cards, and 1 first level card.

4. Any of the above may be considered perfect when all of the cards used are of the same color. (Perfect pyramids rank higher than non-perfect pyramids.)

5. If two or more perfect pyramids are the same level, then the highest suit would win. (NOTE: Only perfect pyramids can be ranked by suit; non-perfect pyramids are considered to have no suit.)

6. If two or more pyramids are still equal, then the persons play another hand to decide the winner.


    ) The Capstone can be used in place of the first level card in a Perfect third level pyramid. This is the highest of ALL PYRAMIDS!



        ) The Capstone may also be used as a wild card to replace any card in any pyramid.

title: Prompt
description:
Taken from the back of the box:

Played with gloriously illustrated Character and Prompt cards and a variety of quotations from Shakespeare.

This is a light game of memory and card collection requiring a familiarity with Shakespeare's plays.  It is best suited to play after a dinner party.  Match Prompt and Character cards to your Quotation cards to create sets.  The first to match all their cards into sets wins.  There are 30 sets.

There are two levels of difficulty, which give different methods of play.

The easy method requires players to complete a Shakespeare quote by filling in the missing word(s) on a Quote card, from a Prompt card and matching them to a Character card.  The mechanics of acquiring cards is similar to the children's card game Go Fish.

In the advanced game the mechanics are similar to Happy Families but a good knowledge of Shakespeare is required to get you the cards you desire.  If attempting to obtain a Quote card from another player one has to recite the quote in full and be Dead Letter Perfect.

In both types of game the mechanics may well be based on children's games, but it is unlikely to appeal to children due to the subject matter.

title: A Christmas Story Board Game
description: [from the ad] We triple dog dare you to answer the questions in this trivia board game based on director Bob Clarks hilarious 1983 tribute to the original, traditional, one-hundred-percent, red-blooded, two-fisted, All-American Christmas, A Christmas Story

title: Set Point Singles and Doubles
description:
The only tennis strategy game that plays like the real thing!

A tennis simulation game, with different boards, but similar mechanics, for playing singles and doubles. The game is played on a board with 81 boxes on each side of the net, grouped in 9 sections. When you play a shot, you call the section (1-9) that you are aiming at, and then roll 2 D6 to see which box in that area it lands in (1, 12 = fault, 2-11 - numbered sectors). If the box is next to a line, 2D6 are rolled to see if the ball is called out. Players can only play a shot if they can move to the ball to play it. The number of boxes that you can move depends on the type of shot played by your opponent (volley, power shot, lob), and where on the court you are. You also can move some boxes after your shot to set for the next one.

The rules do not specify what length of game, etc., to play. Presumably you would decide to play a set, or a tiebreak, or whatever, and use tennis scoring to decide who won.

title: To Grandma's House We Go!
description:
From the box:
A Game designed especially for children to play with their grandparents!

From the instruction sheet:
Make your way over the river and through the woods. If you are the first player to reach Grandma's House, you win!

In this game for children age 3 and up, players take turns drawing cards then following the instructions on the cards to move their cars forward along the board to Grandma's House. Cards consist of two types:

Color/shape cards - Move the car forward to the first space matching the color and shape on the card.

Word cards - Kids draw the card, an adult reads it aloud, then the kid follows the instruction or answers the question on the card (things like smile or give another player a hug or answer What's your middle name?, Who's your best friend?, etc.) The card then instructs the player to move the car or draw another card.

The first player to reach the end of the board (Grandma's House) wins.

Components:
1 Instruction Sheet
1 Gameboard
4 Plastic Cars
6 Cardboard Kid Figures for the Cars
1 Grandma's House
66 Cards

title: Ramba Samba
description:
Here is a description of the game from the publisher:

Children Ages 4 and up can feel and form while playing Ramba Samba. Here, players develop their tactile abilities while playing the game. The friendly caterpillar has lots of colorful dresses in her sack, just right for the big carnival. Sadly, Ramba can't remember any more which clothing articles fit which parts of her long body. The player who can feel which ones fit the fastest is the winner.

In Ramba Samba, the name of the game is shapes, feel and a happy little caterpillar with clothes made of lots of colorful wooden pieces.

The game board shows the entire length of the caterpillar Ramba. Her carnival costume (wooden pieces) are hidden in a large cloth bag. They fit on the game board in pre-determined ways. Each turn, the players simultaneously reach into the bag to find the next matching puzzle piece. The winner is the player who places the most pieces.

Ramba Samba demands tactile awareness in a fun-filled way. Because only the player who can feel the matching pieces fastest will win.

title: Flivver Game
description:
The game box is 6 1/4 by 4 1/4 and 1 deep.

The box contains:

Four die cast touring cars
A spinning wheel board (to generate random movement number)
A one page rulebook.

The game is about racing in Ford Flivver (Model T?) cars.

The game is played by spinning the rear wheel of the Ford indicator and moving the indicated number of spaces.  Text on various spaces affect the players moves.  First player to reach home by exact count wins.

NOTE: No car may pass another on the Narrow Road sections of the board, and only one car may occupy a space in these sections. Two players may occupy a space on the rest of the board, but if a third player's spin takes him to the same space he loses his turn. If a spin takes a player to the space marked spin front wheel he is entitled to spin the front wheel of the Ford indicator. If this spin lands on the 5, he can move 5 spaces. If it lands on any of the blank spaces, his turn ends.

title: Cup Skipper
description: The match race sailing game consists of 2 to 4 yachts sailing around a course set out at the beginning of the game.  The game was developed to to help improve interest and understanding of match racing and consists of throwing a dice and moving pegs (yachts) up and down a board following yachting rules without incurring penalties.

title: Ava
description:
Ava comes with a wooden gameboard displaying a hexagon divided into small triangles and 59 colored stones in black, white and red.

The players try to achieve one of the three winning conditions using 6 stones: 6 stones in a row, 6 stones creating a triangle or 6 stones creating a hexagon.

Game has placement and movement phases.

title: Die! Die! Bang!
description:
Each player is one of five Alliances (a criminal organization) and undertakes various crimes in order to receive a reward.

Each player has a scoreboard (which records their 'crime', 'information', 'battle' and 'reward'), Alliance card and Karma table.  A Boss is selected (the player with the most criminal convictions!).  The Boss selects three Karma cards, takes one and passes two to the player on the left.  The process is repeated until all players have two cards.  All players roll the dice and place a mission card in the corresponding numbered area.

Players place Alliance cards next to the missions they select.  Where more than one player attempts a mission they simultaneously show a thumbs up/thumbs down sign to declare whether they will co-operate or fight.  If players co-operate they divide the reward.  If players fight they divide into the groups, all who voted to co-operate (if any) are one group, fighters become separate groups of one.  Battles are determines by dice roll plus Battle influence.  The winner takes the reward.  The first player to collect ten rewards wins the game.

title: A Bloody Business: The Battle of Hue, 1968
description:
(From the game rules:)

A Bloody Business: the Battle for Hue, Tet 1968 covers the attack on the old Imperial capital of Hue by forces of the North Vietnamese Army and South Vietnamese insurgents of the National Liberation Front during the Tet Offensive. The Communist forces hoped a popular uprising by the oppressed people in South Vietnam would lead to a general uprising and overthrow of the puppet regime supported by the United States. 
The city of Hue was the only city to be completely occupied by the communist forces during the massive offensive, and was the scene of violent and close-quarter fighting that waged for nearly a month, from January 31st to February 25th, 1968. The general uprising never occurred, and in fact the communist's disappointment led to atrocities when they massacred hundreds of collaborators after they took control. The fighting to retake control of the city and oust the NVA and VC devastated the city and Imperial Palace, symbolizing the tragic and confused nature of the war.

Players are cast in the roles of the commanders of each side's forces. Both players will have capabilities to inflict harm upon their opponent, while also having liabilities to protect. Contestants will be challenged to do as well, or better than, their historical counterparts.

Game Scale: The map scale is about 350-400 yards per inch. 
Each combat unit represents a platoon (25 to 30 men, 2 tanks or 6 APCs (Armored Personnel Carriers) and artillery batteries (M-109, Katyusha rockets, and mortars). 
A game turn represents 2-3 days of time.

title: Cooperation
description:
The goal of this little roll-and-move game is for players to work together to make it to the finish line.  Along the way, they have some choices to make as to whether to which path to take and whether to remain together or to go their separate ways.  Depending upon where they land, they can draw Gold, Disaster, or Frustration cards that affect them depending on whether they are still with their partner.  The goal of the game is to be the player holding the least chips when the finish line is reached.

Per manufacturer advertisement:

Cooperation? is a hilarious experience. It lets you scheme, practice being crafty, have fun with disaster. Once you've betrayed your partner - and you probably will - watch out! If you choose to cooperate . . . beware!

Cooperation? stands unique among games. It's aim is to beat you, and, since all players are facing this same obstacle, someone has to be the winner.

Score Cooperation? high in entertainment. It's the kind of a game you will want to bring out at a party . . . and all ages can play. Four to six players, in teams of two. You will experience hours of fun and relaxation.

title: Triumph of the Will
description:
In this alternate history, Nazi Germany and Japan who won WW II have started WWW III in 1948.

This games deals with the German Invasion of Japan. The German have super elite troops such as some of the best and most well known panzerdivisions, heavy Maus tank units, US Marines, ME-262 fighters, the Kriegsmarine, Rommel, Guderian and Von Manstein and others, the Japanese have the numbers, but also Samurai divisions, Kamikaze, the Emperor.

The game uses the rules, map and many units of Samurai Sunset as well as new units and additional rules. It is Operation Olympic launched by Germany instead of by the USA.

title: Problems and Programmers
description:
Problems and Programmers is an educational software engineering card game. Featuring over 120 unique cards, it is intended to simulate the software development process from conception to completion. The game's players compete to finish their projects while avoiding the potential pitfalls of software engineering. These players will quickly learn that the strategies that will let them win the game are the same that will help them in the real world.

Complete rules, as well as files for creating all of the game components, can be found at http://www.problemsandprogrammers.com/

title: Beat The Bookie Race Odds Game
description:
A contemporary betting game consisting of 52 standard size playing cards:
8 horse cards and 44 odds cards


The rules description reads
Given various odds the bookie chooses which horse will win
and the other players bet on what they think has been chosen.

The bookie then reveals the horse chosen and settles the bets accordingly. The objective of the game is to place bets on the horse the bookmaker picks.

title: Bookie: The Card Game
description:
A betting game published by Central News Ltd.,London.

The game consisted of:
52 standard size playing cards,
6 horse Runner cards with seven numbers for
each named horse, 
4 special set-up cards.

The description from the rules reads:
The first horse to reach a position in line with the first card marking the course is the winner. The next horse to arrive achieves a place and wins one-third the odds offered by the Bookie...

Practice will quickly determine the possible odds to be laid.

These will range between 6 to 1 and 50 to 1, or possibly more.

title: CHECKCHESS RoundBoard
description:
CHECKCHESS RoundBoard contains standard sets of chessmen and checkers, but as the name implies the real star is the game board.  The circular board consists of eight rings of eight spaces each.  Each ring corresponds to one of the eight ranks on a standard chessboard, and each radially-aligned group of spaces corresponds to a file.  (They're even labeled 1-8 from outside to inside and a-h counterclockwise, and the rulebook calls them squares despite their curved shape.)

The pieces are set up with one player on the outside of the circle facing in and the other in the center facing out (but otherwise exactly as in ordinary chess or checkers) and the rules of those games are unchanged except that file a and file h are considered adjacent for the purposes of movement.  This is equivalent to the variant in which pieces are allowed to move off the right side of a square chess board onto the left and vice versa, but on the round board all legally-adjacent spaces are also physically adjacent.

From the designer's notes included with the game:

An engineer by profession, I have always had a fascination with the game of chess.  As a member of my high school chess team, I played hooky from school to strengthen my game.

In the 1960's the concept of a round board interested me as a novelty.  However, some 25 years later I made a serious study of that novelty and concluded that the round board is a major evolutionary advancement in the games of chess and checkers.  I hope you share my belief and enjoy your games on CHECKCHESS RoundBoard(TM).

title: Cityism  -- The Austin Trivia Board Game
description:
What is cityism?

Webster's says nationalism is loyalty to a nation, especially its culture.  So cityism is loyalty to a city, especially its culture.
     All cities have cool things.  But you have to live there to appreciate some of them. Who but Austinites would delight in Spamorama or Eyeore's Birthday Party?

All questions are about Austin.

title: Cluster
description:
Cluster's playing board consists of forty six holes, of which twenty four are shallow and twenty two are deep.  There are sixteen playing pieces, eight white and eight black. Within the set of eight there are four short pieces and four long ones. If a long piece is placed in a deep hole and short piece in a shallow hole, the the tops of the two pieces will be level.

The object of the game is to form a cluster before your opponent does. A cluster is when all of your pieces (one player has white and the other black) are in a group all next to each other and all of the tops of the pieces are at the same level.

title: Pentagon: The Marble Game of the 70's
description:
Players set their marbles up on the interior or exterior pentagon.  From there, you attempt to move one at a time taking turns to get to the person's other pentagon (e.g. interior tries to get to the exterior).  You can jump when you are next to another's marble and capture it.  First one to get all their remaining marbles to the inside wins as long as he has as many marbles the other person.

Nice wooden board and marbles for bits...

title: Toggle Logic
description:
Toggle Logic is the umbrella game for two variants, Batel and BaoWei. Played on a standard chessboard, each piece has two distinct sides. Batel is a race to be the first to occupy your opponent's home row. BaoWei has a capture mechanic, with randomness increased through the use of dice.

The Toggle Logic set comes in a 6 closed tube with enough two-colored pieces for either variant. The tube includes a cloth screen-print playing board, two-colored pieces, dice, and instructions. It is self-published by the designer in Lawrence, Kansas.

title: Kriegspiel
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementSecret Unit Deployment
description:
Invented in 1899 by Henry Michael Temple, this chess variant is played by 2 players but requires a third person to act as an umpire. Essentially, players only know the positions of their own pieces and have to make inferences based on what the umpire tells them (for example, that a move is impossible, or a capture has been made on a specific square).

According to The Encyclopedia of Chess Variants (D.B. Pritchard, 1994) alternative names are Screen Chess, War-Chess and Commando Chess.

David Li's book Kriegspiel: Chess Under Uncertainty (1994) provides a set of rules and some sample games.

Rules and more details are available at The Chess Variant Pages' entry for the game:
http://www.chessvariants.org/incinf.dir/kriegspiel.html

title: The Money Game
types: Bluffing Card Game Economic Educational Math Negotiation
description:
A boxed set of cards used in three games intended to explain, and educate about, monetary and banking systems.

The box contains two sets of cards - one set represents machine parts, the other bank notes - and score sheets.

Both games are based around the premise of an engineer shipwrecked on an island - he has a limited source of gold.  The islanders have machine parts from an earlier shipwreck.

In the first game one player represents the engineer and the others the islanders.  The engineer wants to buy machine parts (collect complete sets), but the cost of buying parts goes up the more he buys in one go from any one islander.  The islanders want to get as much of his money as they can, and one of them can win by 'breaking' the engineers bank by holding more notes than he can cover with his supply of gold.

In the second game the islanders are purchasing goods produced by the engineer by bidding. In this game the engineer does not score, but merely acts as banker.  The winner is the islander who has managed to accumulate the most merchandise

The third game represents an experiment by our one-time shipwrecked engineer, now financier.  He has a contract with the islanders by which he pays 200.00 for a complete eneterprise (set of machine cards). To ensure that they can find and supply the complete enterprises to him he lends them money which they can use to bargain with amongst themselves.
This game is meant to illustrate the mutual indebtedness which is the characteristic of banking, and involves considerable amounts of maths.

In 1928 there was a real bookcase edition submitted. Half of the book is the story of the game, the stories of the 3 game variants and long rules explanations with examples. Also there are many quotes from people recommanding this game.
The other half is a neatly made storage for the game components, everything made of good quality.
The first copyright mentionend in this bookcase edition is 1912, so the games origin must be in this year.
